review_text: Amazing food. Great vibe. Good drinks. Perfect night out
We went with our 21 month old. The staff was beyond kind and accommodating. My child loved the pasta and ate the most pasta I have ever seen her eat in one meal. We loved the lobster fra diavolo!
After not having been there in over 20 years we were pretty disappointed. The food was fair, nothing I would go back for.
excellent choice of fresh seafood … go for the grilled octopus ! ambience suffered due to overly energetic small people … very good pinot grigio …
Amazing food and atmosphere, will definitely come again
Incredible food! Highly highly recommend!  Tables quite small for a tall man like me.
I’ve been here multiples times and it is always an incredible experience. The service is spectacular, the food is delicious, and the ambience is perfect. I will continue to come back.
Solid meal.  Every dish was well prepared.  Nothing particularly exceptional or imaginative and the service was good but impersonal.  No complaints but looking for better in this town.

We absolutely loved our experience here. The food was outstanding- we had a tuna tartare appetizer special, the blackened swordfish, and the sole francese. For dessert, we split the bourbon pecan pie. Everything was top tier and I highly recommend it!
Great food and atmosphere. Our waitress was amazing and attentive! We got the mussels and clam linguine. Both were delicious! I think the mussels here was my favorite in Maine. Highly recommend it.

We asked our server about the thickness of the swordfish and she indicated it would be about an inch. Three of us ordered it.  Only one was this thick. It was delicious. The other 2 were about 1/2 inch and dry. We ordered the potatoes and green beans. While they were tasty they were both barely warm. Not what we’ve experienced before.
Branzino and Sole were delicious! Crab and puff pastry as well. The homemade limoncello was outstanding. Nico our server was exceptional and very attentive. We loved our evening.
always get the sole and as always it was fabulous. And of course the bread is too
Excellent food and staff. Always a great treat.￼.
Food was amazing.  Great service.  Was a quieter night than normal, so noise level was good.

We gave gone every year for decades. Same great atmosphere. Prices have continued to increase and the portions are smaller (we’ve never been able to finish the lobster diavolo for two for $95 and this year we easily finished it). Our waitress was short with me and unfriendly. Probably our worst experience there so far.

We were made to feel very special as we celebrated our anniversary. Staff was knowledgeable and accommodating as well as friendly. Food was delicious with wonderful presentation. The table was cleaned between courses with fresh napkins and silverware each time. Warm, moist towels were a nice touch after lobster!
Beautiful flavors. Everyone clearly is proud and cares that you have a wonderful experience.
Unbelievable food and good service. We’ll be back.
We have a great time each and every time we eat at Street & Co! It’s a tradition every time we come to Maine to visit family.

Firstly, the food is absolutely delicious! BUT I will not be going to this place again. We had a reservation and hoped we could get booth seating but were told booths were reserved for larger parties. 

The dining room is loud and crowded. We were seated in a corner and I was comfortable but my husband who is 6'3" and large framed was quite uncomfortable. The noise level is chaotic.  You can literally brush elbows with the person next to you. 

Next time I will definitely research ambience before blowing $200+ dollars on a restaurant with the same atmosphere as a fast food joint.
Delicious food and beautiful atmosphere. The wait staff is super knowledgeable!

Had a reservation but kitchen was backed up and waited over 1 hour for our dinner. Was rewarded with free appetizer but expected better service from an upscale formal establishment.  Food was very good though. Hopefully just a bad service night.
Excellent food in a charming setting. Everything was exceptional.

Street &company is always perfection !  The ambiance, service & especially the food is superb - in all the years I’ve been dining at Street I’ve always marveled at the consistent quality of every item served.

Amazing service. Dishwashers work hard!!
Food was amazing if only if it was hotter.
I know it was busy. Great work!  Worth it

We were seated near a noisy family table with my kids running around in circles. The wait staff should pay attention to these disruptions with the comfort of other guests in mind. The other comfortable thing about our table was that the waiter station was right at our backs and it wasn’t too close to the bathroom.. Also, we asked not to put a lot of garlic in a pasta dish and they were unaccommodating.
The food was great, as always. I had the scallops in pernod. I enjoyed it, but would have preferred the cream based version.
Food and service were excellent! The blackened tuna was perfect.

We went there for our 1st anniversary dinner and there was a card waiting for us at our table (nice touch). The food was incredible, the service was impeccable (they were short staffed that night and our waiter handled it flawlessly), and the ambience was perfect. Overall an excellent experience and highly recommended.

Excellent menu and service from Charlie. The tune tartar was especially good.
I wonderful, relaxed evening dining at Street and Co.

We had not been back to Street and Company for a few years, and this visit did not disappoint.  We made the reservations a month ago even though we were not in peak season.  I’ll note that Google maps says you can drive on Dana Street and the down Wharf Street.  Not correct.  It is blocked off for pedestrians only, but the parking garage on Fore Street is nearby.    It is five star for food and service.   The mussels are the best we ever have, and we’ve had them all over the world.  You do have to like garlic, and we do.  The noise level and crowded tables brings things down a notch.  We decided not to wait so long to go back as we’re still raving about Street and Co 24 hours later.
We sat at the Bar.  Fun time watching the shucker work.  Q
Probably one of the top 5 meals we have ever experienced! Incredible!!

The food was excellent,  sitting in bar a little tight esp at end seats. Our server was  very sweet but  she could have used more help.   Next time I would request not sitting at end of Bar if we are in bar.
One of Portland's best seafood restaurants that adds linguica to a couple dishes. Great bread from Standard Bakery to sop up the garlicky sauces.
The special was excellent and I was lucky enough to get the last one #timingFTW
As always a wonderful experience every year ….food,people,service amazing
We were there for an anniversary dinner. The food was very good, portions were smallish on 2 of the dinners. We would definitely eat there again.
One of the best stops in Portland. We had oysters and grilled octopus for apps and both were great. We then had scallops and bluefin tuna for dinner both were outstanding.
Everything was absolutely amazing! The blacked swordfish melted in my mouth. The fish pate and pecan pie were also great.
Fantastic experience, year in and year out and wonderful restaurant!
Dined outside—lobster Diavolo for two was outstanding!!

Great table…. Benches would work better if we had a cushion all orders were yummy, but salad ordered as An entree, came without the shaved Parmesan and croutons… that kept the rating low…
That was a disappointment…

We continue to return to Street and Company.  We were seated near the kitchen on this visit.  The noise level was more than usual as expected on Father's Day (busy).  The service we received was excellent this go around.  The food was very good per usual.  We continue to go to Street and Company whenever we visit Portland, Maine.  The ambience is always great!  Our server was very energetic and professional.  

Thank you for a great Father's Day experience.  
Mike C
Great service from a wonderful team. Can’t wait to go back
Everything was perfect. Only regret is we didn’t save room for dessert.
Excellent food and service…. consistently great over many visits. Ambience is very good, but fairly noisy due to low ceilings and brick walls. Our favorite restaurant in Portland.
Great food. Oysters, very fresh and local. Sole francaise and Branzinno were cooked to perfection. Service was excellent.
Not bad. Wasn’t as amazing as the previous experience.
Nice out of the way spot. Excellent seafood spot. Very good service.
Haven’t been to Street & Co. for awhile and it did not disappoint. We had an excellent dinner from a tried and true restaurant. They know how to prepare seafood!!

Our dining experience was beyond amazing! We kicked off our meal with the delectable mussels, and if you love dunking bread, you're in for a treat! The scallops, sole, and tuna were exquisite and flavorful. The linguine with shrimp was an absolute delight. I've been a loyal patron of Street and Company for years, and I can say it's consistently exceptional and unbelievably delicious!
Perfectly cooked seafood. Swordfish was stellar. Grilled octopus is a must try.

Exceptional service:  We indicated it was someone's 21's birthday and there was a handwritten card waiting at the table.  The staff was attentive, fun and made great recommendations when we waffled over the many choices.  This dinner was an incredible experience.
The food and the service was was wonderful! It is always a pleasure to go to this Restaurant.
Most consistent food and service of anywhere I’ve been in Portland (and I’ve been to most places) knowledgable staff and food always delicious.
Love this place, Portland go-to. Love all the different pasta dishes.
Sardine can pack em in people brush you as they go by in isle
Everything was wonderful from the staff to the drinks and the food!  Highly recommend Street and Co!

If you are looking for a superior Maine seafood experience, you found your new favorite restaurant. If you want to taste exquisite multiple kinds of seafood, order the Lobster Diavolo and be prepared to be amazed!

We had great service for our server Liz. She pointed me to the perfect cocktail and explained the menu. I had a wonderful lobster with pasta. You have to like garlic to love this dish; and I do. We were there 25 years ago and I couldn’t wait to go back. It’s been great to be back in Portland.
Delicious food, excellent service and wonderful atmosphere !
Best Seafood restaurant in Portland and consistently great meals
Loved everything we have....we will definitely return.  Fabulous food and environment.   Highly recommend this spot.

A stellar experience from start to finish. We arrived approximately 15 minutes early for our reservation and were seated immediately. Our server, Kylie, was attentive, accommodating, and pleasant throughout. Cocktails were excellent. My husband’s appetizer of smoked mackerel over pea risotto was wonderful. I was surprised when my appetizer of prosciutto di Parma arrived, that it was merely sliced prosciutto on a plate without any accompaniment. I guess I was expecting some melon to go with it. Nonetheless, it was delicious. Both of our entrées, the branzino for my husband, and the sole francaise for me, were perfection. We finished the meal with two excellent desserts. I had the Basque cheesecake, served with rhubarb compote on the side as requested, and it was as good as I remembered it. My husband had the pecan pie and enjoyed it thoroughly. It’s always a treat to visit Street and Company.
Very busy. Excellent experience all the way around.
Wonderful accommodations for GF and DF! Service was excellent!

A steady and reliable choice in Portland! We loved the oyster selection: Glidden Point & Norumbega! Those are our favorites! They were expertly shucked, which we really appreciate! Our server was funny,  attentive,  and easy to interact with.  I ordered the halibut special and was so happy! Just delicious in every way! The only constructive feedback we have would be the swordfish my husband ordered was 1/2 inch thick so clearly had been portioned making the piece of fish so thin.  Perhaps a coat savings measure? He did not love that but did enjoy the flavors of his dish.  We will always keep returning, perhaps just not ordering swordfish.
Excellent as always, I never visit Portland without making a stop here. Until next time.

We had absolutely amazing service at Street and Co. I was nervous bringing a one year old somewhere so nice but my wife and I needed a nice dinner (and a nice bottle of wine) after a week of vacation with our toddler. Our waitress went above and beyond to make sure my daughter was having a good time and the whole staff was so friendly.
Dinner for four with old friends. Absolutely absolutely delightful as always.
Great meal, nice staff.  Came based on a recommendation.  So glad we did.  Cool vibe & comfortable with great food!   Scallops are a must & mussels in marinara - chefs kiss!
Another delicious dinner at one of my favorite Portland restaurants!
Really like the place. Food was good and service was excellent. The fresh bread was super!!!

Food was delicious and thoughtfully prepared. However, being crammed in elbow to elbow with other diners and the impossible noise level made it difficult to truly enjoy our meal as much as we would have liked to.
Came for my husbands birthday, everything was spectacular from the cocktail service, the meal, and dessert. Thank you for a wonderful dining experience!
Great food and beverages. Awesome ambience. Service excellent.
Très bon restaurant. Poissons et fruits de mer frais et délicieux!

My husband and I dine often at Street. Food is exceptional. Highly recommend the grilled octopus app and scallops entree. The service lacked this past visit. Waitress spoke too fast and missed an entree order. We had to ask for a wine chiller and bread, and a rush job on the second entree. Usually the service is top notch.
Beautifully quaint atmosphere with spectacular seafood and exemplary service. Loved it!
Always a wonderful experience! The food is delicious !!
Street and Co. is a favorite of mine, and this dinner did not disappoint. Great service, amazing food, and the ambiance is always wonderful.

Dinner was fabulous as always. This
Is by far the best restaurant in Portland.  Have been there many times and never a bad meal!
It has been a lot better over the years. We have gone here for 30 years and it used to be one of our favorites.
Bar tender seemed to be focused excessively to a very selective clientele.
OMG Street&Co is my favorite restaurant in US I live at BOS but I usually drive 2hr to Portland just wanna go Street&Co!
Our favorite seafood restaurant , still has the warm ambience , excellent service, and the best seafood we can always count on 🎏
Highly recommend this restaurant. Google it for prices but I think the quality matched the price. Service good and the kitchen was clearly run by a professional. No complaints.
Food excellent as always. Prices have gotten a bit high but ….,
All food was unbelievably fresh! Oysters, mussels, blue fin tuna. Had it all. If you want a zippy drink, try the spicy tequila.
Great experience and amazing food.  Plan on going back.
Amazing service and delicious salads, entrees and desserts.
As usual, they don’t disappoint, good surface, great food!

Street & Co has been my favorite Portland restaurant for over 30 years.  Seafood and fish are always cooked perfectly, pasta is al dente which is how I like it, and service is almost always top notch.  I like the atmosphere but it is pretty noisy, even after we moved to the quilter side.
Amazing restaurant - not to be missed if you’re in Portland.

We had a wonderful meal at Street and Co.  We were very impressed with the service and the attention to detail with everything.  The food was amazing.  I highly recommend the mussels appetizer.  Excellent experience all around.  Will definitely return!
Very enjoyable evening at Street and Co. well worth the visit.

All.of our dishes were disappointing except for our tuna tartar appetizer special. The arugula salad with toasted farro was small, refrigerator cold and the farro rock hard. The grilled monkfish was dry amd very small portion of fish. The Pernod scallops were bland. I like bustling restaurants,  but the table next to us was boisterously loud. The wine list is hood and well priced.  Our previous meal was much better. We liked the sole and mussels.

Best place for elegantly prepared fresh seafood and seasonal vegetables. Street and Company has been around for over 30 years because they have a clear focus yet keep it fresh by being creative in preparing dishes that highlight the best of each season.
Street & Co is always delicious with great service and atmosphere. Don’t remember it being as pricey. May have increased recently like everyone else.

We had requested a corner table in advance which we were very pleased with when we were seated. Menu choices were very good.  Our server was excellent.  I really enjoyed my hake. My husband was not thrilled with his yellow fin tuna.  But overall it was a great dining experience and I would recommend this restaurant.
Delicious food with great, courteous service. We will definitely be back.
Street & Company never disappoints. I’ve been going there since the 90s - super consistent - excellent seafood - good service and a really great/historic place.
Food was outstanding. Service very attentive. Ambiance was rustic and modern at the same time. Definitely recommend and will be back.
An exceptional dining experience that left us feeling totally overwhelmed.
Dinners were brought to table ten minutes or more apart

Always always order the Sole Français!!!  It is a specialty and has been consistently delicious since my first order in 1990!

The rice pudding is fantastic even if you are not normally a rice pudding fan.

Don’t forget to try the house made Lemoncello.
Street and Co is a regular stop for all our celebrations.
The food is always consistently good. The service is also excellent.

Food was exquisite, wait personnel were attentive and well-informed about menu questions.  Had not been to Street & Co for years, mainly because I remembered how crowded it was and no privacy between tables.  Seating changes have been made that provide for a much more pleasurable experience.   The restaurant was not completely full and we appreciate the extra time we were allowed to spend at the table for that reason.  My only suggestion would be to make the espresso martini the same size as your other martinis, not in the mini martini glass, although it was delicious.
Waiter was very stiff. Food was fine. Ambience was really nice.
Get the lobster with butter and garlic linguine. Trust me.
The best meal I have ever had.  I have told everyone I know.

The food was phenomenal, the staff was incredible and the ambiance was perfect for my fiancés birthday dinner. They even gave him a signed card for his birthday! Thank you so much for making it so special.

We had an amazing dinner with such great service! One of our favorite Portland places
To dine

My wife and I  were excited to go reading the reviews and after waiting over a month to reserve a table. I got the Branzino with Mushroom Risoto and my wife got the Linguine with clams. Both dishes disappointed. The Branzino was undercooked and spent my dinner removing bone after bone in my mouth. The risotto was flavorless and not done to perfection with hard pieces of the Arborio needing to set longer in broth. A lack of the mushroom flavor was even more disappointing.  My wife’s clams were the best part but the sauce was mediocre and the pasta was not fresh.  When you’re paying for forty dollar meals one would expect a well orchestrated dish.  We were hoping beforehand to try the other Street Restaurants but now we’re not sure we can spend that kind of money knowing it might be hit or miss for the price.
This was an excellent dining experience from start to finish.

Everything about this place is great! We enjoyed the raw and baked oysters, bitter greens salad, clams over linguini, sole francaise, and bourbon peacan pie. Everything was so delicious! We dine out frequently so we’re not often blown away… but we were! We’ll definitely be back sooner than later!

Thank you, Street & Co., for a wonderful meal. The food was spectacular, the wait staff responsive and not overly hovering--just right. In an often shout-y world, I love the quiet ambience of this restaurant
Alwss as us an incredible meal!!! So gathering with friends at this restaurant is s as n easy decision

Consistent, quality food and service. A favorite of ours throughout the years. Best mussels and perfectly done scallops.
Would like to see a change in the menu or a few additions to keep us coming back.
The service was fantastic. The server was friendly and knowledgeable. And the food was so delicious. So many people worked together make it a great experience.
Less renown than others but fantastic dinner in Portland.

It's a nice and charming restaurant located in downtown Portland. I ordered a fantastic grilled octopus appetizer and a lobster entree for two. The only issue I had was that the lobster dish used a bit too much butter and garlic. However, the dessert was excellent, and the service was impeccable. I would highly recommend this place, and I will go back again.
We have dined there several times over the years and  have never been disappointed in all aspects of the dining experience.
Great food. Always enjoy eating here. Will be back.
Amazing food, cocktails, and atmosphere. Would highly recommend if you are a seafood lover.
Just not up to Scales and Fore St. Disappointed. Server very nice.

This is one of the our favorite restaurants we have dined here several times and it is consistently very good. The meals are always well seasoned and paired nicely with the sides. This is one of the best seafood restaurant overall, highly recommended.
Really nice restaurant.  Great food, great service.  Highly recommend.
We had a lovely dinner at Street and Co. My wife had the sole and I had the half lobster pasta with butter and garlic.  Both were tremendous.

The menu choices were limited. The wine by the glass choices very limited. Table was not flat, had to be careful where to set my drink. Service excellent. Meal
Was good. Had shrimp and linguine in tomato sauce. Wishing there were protein options to add to salad.
Great food, drinks and service. We’ll be back.  Parking is a challenge .  Walk or Uber if you can
This is still my favorite upscale restaurant in Portland.  Great menu, outstanding service and very comfortable/cosy —especially great in winter when it’s cold outside.  Don’t miss the octopus!
Great service, even better food- there was a handwritten card waiting for us wishing us a happy anniversary.  Some of the best cocktails we’ve ever had. We will be coming back.
Food is always fantastic  Atmosphere is lively. Sometimes tough to get reservation.
We had a perfect meal, delicious food, fantastic service. It could not have been better. I can’t wait to go again.
I had an absolutely lovely meal at street & co.  The mussels and octopus were some of the best I’ve had.  Beautiful space, wonderful service.  The rice pudding was a surprise hit for dessert.

Our first time at Street and Co. will not be our last.  The space is amazing, the staff is friendly and well-trained, and the menu is terrific.  We opted for one special and a menu standard.  I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu! We're looking forward to a return visit!
Great food and excellent service. Our second trip there in six weeks.
We had a great time at Street and Company. My husband and I used to go regularly before we had kids, and I was very glad that the quality of the food has not changed one bit.
This is such a beautiful restaurant in everything they do! Great service, ambiance, and food! It's a lovely place to be with food that excites and hits nostalgia.

The positive- cozy and a nice decor in a beautiful part of town. Very seldom do I criticize a restaurant- I simply don't return. But in this case the 'hype' was not worth it. The risotto with my fish was not properly cooked, the oysters did not taste fresh (a first for me while in Maine) and, the worst part for us, the ventilation left a great deal to be desired. All of our clothes had to be washed and/or dry cleaned because of the deep smell of food. Just not normal. My apologies for the first negative comments about a restaurant in Portland for the last 2 decades.
Always a favorite   Enjoy the atmosphere and food.  Never disappoints
The Oysters, salad,Tuna and Scallops were excellent

Superb meal & service !
Hubby had the whole branzino w risotto grancile & oyster mushrooms. I enjoyed the cod w cannellini beans & kale as my main.
We had the octopus appetizer (we always get octopus when we see it on a menu) which was also amazing. Loved the homemade sourdough bread too.
Excellent as always!  Our favorite place to eat when in Portland.

I was disappointed with the service and the food for the first time at what has long been my favorite restaurant in Portland for a romantic dinner.  We were left unattended for a long time before service began, about 15 minutes. The presentation of both our octopus appetizer and my dish, monkfish, was poor and unappetizing.  My dish was also dry and had hardly any kale in it, which had been a featured ingredient.  My husband's scallops were delishes.  Hope this was just a blip and not a trend.
If you’re looking for a wonderful seafood dining experience then Street and Co is the place you’re looking for! Never disappoints!

We were disappointed in our experience this time at Street & Co. The food was not up to the usual - the whole branzino was bland and the kale was burned not charred. The service, which we feel was not our server's fault, was bad. We waited for at least 25 minutes after we finished out appetizers for our entrees to come.  It will be some time before we eat at your restaurant again.
Excellent.  I said it was average value because you need to pay for five stars in all the other categories which is why we went here.  There always fast food down the street if you want value.

Every bite delicious, every dish handsomely plated (except seafood in long-handled frying pans: practical maybe, but not gorgeous). Charming ambience. Attentive, friendly service. Relatively quiet on a February Sunday, but I can imagine the place getting noisy with a full house.
Absolutely love this place! My bf and I always dine here 1-2 times a year when we visit!!!
Shrimp in butter sauce. Over cooked and dry had better at Olive Garden  halibut was great. Waiter was smug was our anniversary been here before good times  questionable if we come back
Great place in all aspects except for the noise level.

This is a very special place with excellent service and superb food. A wonderfully warm rustic atmosphere that was perfect for a cold winter night. Some of the best seafood we’ve ever eaten. And great cocktails too.
Great food, fantastic service, comfortable lively location
Location superb. Food beautifully cooked. Atmosphere impeccable. Staff friendly and helpful. Wonderful experience.
Loved the food and the Portuguese Wine! Definitely a place to dine in Portland
Come to Street and Co every couple of months.  Always excellent food and service.  Never disappoints.

The staff is lovely and we didn’t have to worry about running out of water. The dishes were coursed out with good timing. The cocktails were very good and the pasta dishes we got were great as well! Out server did a great job of helping me chose a wine to go with my entree. We Weil definitely be back and with friends!
Time and time again, the best seafood restaurant in Maine.
Great service.  Great food. Go for the farm/table vibe and the seafood.

I sat at the bar. Ordered an overpriced entrée. The bartender never spoke to me even though I was the only other person other than a couple who he fawned over. I ordered fish stew, which was good, but about a half portion. ￼

If I could give the service 10 stars, I would.
Understated, attentive and elegant service, fit for a Relais and Chateau designation.
The food and drink were equally on par.
Always a great time and awesome food and drinks!!
as always a wonderful experience.  Particularly in winter it is such a nice cozy restaurant.  Service is spectacular. Food is wonderful.  One of our favorite Portland restaurants.
We have been going to Street &Co for years and have always had a wonderful dining experience
Good and service were great as always.  It is noisy so don’t expect to engage in extensive conversation or woo a new date.
It was fantastic!  Just love this place from food- service-ambience.
The tuna was amazing,  and loved the razor clan appetizer. Our server was lovely.  Great atmosphere.  Wonderful evening!
A very nice dining experience. The food was great but found the menu a little limited. Best dessert I've ever had, though. I'd recommend the rice pudding.
Great meal as usual.
Really great dinner. The inside of the restaurant was warm/cozy and the food and service was excellent.

Waiter was attentive and funny!
Food was hot and delicious 
Drinks were flowing and friends were laughing
Fantastic spot to celebrate a birthday.

One of our favorite places to eat in Portland.  Probably our favorite.  Food is always outstanding as is the staff and service.  Only wish we lived closer!  Looking forward to our next trip to Maine and to eat at Street and Company

Excellent food in a pleasant atmosphere.  The king salmon special was expertly prepared and presented.  The cod was fresh and served with cannelloni beans that were cooked perfectly.   All wait staff were friendly and knowledgable and provided the dishes in a timely manner.  Would definitely recommend.
I lived in Portland since the 1960's.  This is my number 1 restaurant
It’s our favorite restaurant in Portland, have been going there since they opened!
Great food and service. A wonderful dining experience.

Anytime I can prepare something significantly better in my own kitchen, I feel compelled to say something.

I’m sorry to say the food and presentation at Street & Co were lazy and not special and not particularly good, bordering on poor.  It was a disappointment but perhaps I should have known better.  Seems to be resting on its laurels.
Great food. Caring staff. Tables are close so noise if a factor but food makes the meal.  Very happy.

This long-standing Portland restaurant was a go-to for years but a recent visit was disappointing. Grilled lobster on linguine was baseline average following a hard-won extraction of meat from a few small claws. It should have been tastier and more robust on all counts. I was bummed leaving….
Everything was amazing. Charred octopus,Moroccan chick pea soup, and saffron tomato seafood stew..yum!
Garlic! Overpowering a dish with garlic is the sign of an unimaginative chef.
Good food, great service, and fun atmosphere.  The whole menu is seafood (or at least was last night), no beef/chicken/vegetarian options available. But if you like fish, it's a great spot!
One of our favorites , always book ahead . It’s a classic in Portland.
Best linguini with white clam sauce I have had outside of Italy! My husband had the hake special. He loved it. Will be back.

We had the grilled octopus and a salad to start which were both great. The tuna Bolognese and mussels over linguine were favorites at the table! We sat in the dining room looking into the kitchen which was cool to see.
Atmosphere was amazing! Food was even better . Service was top notch … my only complaint is they stuff patrons in. Our table was smack in middle of restaurant
The cocktails, food, ambience, and service were all exceptional
Awesome dinner! The oysters and yellowfin tartare were amazing!! I really enjoyed the scallops. The sole was okay but too greasy. Desserts were unreal. Can’t wait to go back.

Good food and service was as good as usual but we won't return because the restaurant was unwilling to accommodate my wife's medical condition which doesn't allow her having alcohol. Their solution was to say that they gave non-alcoholic drinks. NOT THE SAME AS WINE. I brought a non-alcoholic wine which they refused to allow us to use even after  I said U would pay a corkage fee.
A consistently excellent restaurant, exactly representative of what Portland has to offer for fine dining opportunities.
One of the best restaurants any where in the world. We are always there for our anniversary and other times.  Out of 10 stars , I give it an 11 star rating.  Go and experience great food!
Excellent seafood.  Fabulous, friendly, attentitive service.  Very noisy in the dining room.  Much better ambiance and quieter in the bar area.  Highly recommend for great seafood.

DO NOT RECOMMEND IT 
Very Disappointed 
Food served COLD… And we had dinner reservations for 5:15pm!  
Had the monk fish and scallops.  Were not impressed at all.  
Nothing special: something anybody can cook at home and save $100. 
Monk fish came with side of steamed potatoes and green beans. 
Scallops with side if green beans and faro beans.
Great place. Amazed at how long they have been around and maintained the high level of food and service. Has been one of my favorite places since they opened.
Tough to get a decent time for dinner but worth the effort. Best seats for a couple are at the bar however limited.

I chose this for my birthday dinner.  It is consistently fantastic.  I was tempted by several entrées but fell back on my reliable favorite, the Sole Francaise.  It was even better than usual when paired with a half bottle of Grgich Hills Chardonnay.  Another amazing dinner!
Cozy restaurant atmosphere with excellent food and service

Dined on a busy Saturday evening with a party of four. Service was attentive, appetizers and entrees arrived in a timely manner. Everyone throughly enjoyed their dinners. Servers were very professional and knowledgeable. Excellently prepared seafood. So good!
My mussels (white) on linguine was fabulous. It was noisy. The tables were very close together. It was hard to hear my two dinner partners. I have dined there before and don't remember this as much.
Exceptional food and service. Tight seating arrangements
Another great dinner!  Highly recommend!  Everything was wonderful as usual.
Outstanding food, servers, and ambience. Loudness echoed off bricks. Overall, we were very happy. Thank you, Dana!
Overall we had a very nice dinner. We would have appreciated just a little more menu depth, but having said that, our meals were well prepared and very satisfying.

The noise level on a Tuesday night at 7 pm was awful, but we were able to move to a table in another room. There we were able to focus on conversation and the delicious food. Our server was pleasant, but did not bring a plate for fish bones until the entree was finished. This is a favorite restaurant of ours, so we will return.
Imaginative seafood menu. Everything we ordered was beautifully prepared.
Our first time there. The food was outstanding and the service was excellent!!   Will return.
Food was awesome clams in white sauce and the scallops were delicious.   Ambiance was rustic and warming.   Noise level very loud due to the low ceilings but we adjusted.

Wren was perhaps the best server I have ever had in a restaurant. We brought some foodie friends from NH. They were extremely impressed. My wife and I have a tradition where we purchase 10 $100 restaurant gift certificates to various Portland restaurants to remind ourselves to go out on dates throughout the year. We have included the S&C, Fore St. and Scales trifecta on our list this year.

It was magical and delicious as usual.  We had the mussels for the first time and one of the salads with the blue cheese and nuts.  Also amazing!  My go to meal is the pasta with oil and garlic with the lobster.  The kisses and poppies is a fantastic drink as well.  We will be back. The staff is so friendly and it just makes the whole experience better.  I am always signed into my husbands OpenTable but just the same it was amazing!!

Dinner was absolutely delicious.  I had spinach salad and sole. My husband had oysters and scallops. Everything was delicious. The only problem was we waited almost 1/2hr for our entree to be served.  We noticed other dinners, who came in after us, receiving their food before us.
Food and service are always an A+!  We’ll be back!
We have been many times over the years the food is consistently delicious and the service excellent. We will be back!

As always an incredible meal but with a relatively tough start with our arancini mushroom appetizer….two had no mushrooms, but the Street team made it right.  My wife and I enjoyed a bright Teresamanera Chardonnay paired with her sautéed scallops and my simply incredible big eye tuna bolognese.  One of the best meals we’ve had in a long while.  Friendly service and elegant atmosphere.  A top five dining experience in the very foodie Portland waterfront.
Beautiful restaurant with great, great food! The sole française was wonderful.
Very nice for a special occasion.  Service was spot on. The mussels were the best we have ever had.

We were very pleased with our experience. we originally had a 9 PM reservation but decided to try a walk-in around 6 PM on a Saturday. We were lucky enough to be seated immediately at one of the last tables which made our day. We had a very enjoyable experience with our server, who explained the specials and gave us time to make decisions.  We had the octopus appetizer and the spinach salad, both excellent.  W then each had a delicious pasta dish.  All in all great food.

The food was good but the service was terrible. They just wanted to rush us out of the restaurant from the moment we walked in. They even changed my reservation time 30 mins earlier and did not bother informing me.
Street and Company never disappoints. Best service ever and the freshest seafood cooked to perfection.

This was our first visit and we will certainly return.  The restaurant has the typical rustic atmosphere we have to come to expect in the older buildings in Portland, we just love that aspect.  Very pleasant and welcoming staff, it was fun to watch them work as a team.  They had some great specials as well.  We tried the grilled octopus and it was amazing.  My wife had the broiled scallops which she loved and I had a special broiled seafood stew that had great depth of flavors.  

The only complaint was they are doing everything they can to flip tables in under an hour.  The one line I never want to hear in a restaurant is the chef wants all orders for dinner placed with the apps.  This automatically means they are going bring your dinner within a couple of minutes of eating  your apps.  We like to spend closer to 90 minutes when we are having a higher end dining experience, several tables around us came in after us and left before us.  We were there for about 80 minutes because we held off ordering our meals.  It was sad to see so many people spend so much and get rushed out the door.  I honestly think they should say on their website if they do not want anyone spending more than 60 minutes.
Amazing experience and should be on everyone’s list
Food is always excellent. One of my favorites. Started coming over 30 years ago and make a point to come back

Great food! Great service!

Been going here since the day they opened  if you like Mediterranean seafood and flavor with no shortage of garlic this is the place

Absolutely incredible. Some of the best mussels I’ve had with the white wine and garlic sauce. Our waitress was kind enough to bring us more bread because we couldn’t get enough of the sauce. Cannot wait to come back here.

Fabulous food and service
Our table for two was much too small
But loved it!

My wife and I have dined at Street and Co. several times and always had an excellent experience.  This time was an early celebration of her birthday.  We were greeted with a nice handwritten card congratulating her and a few staff members congratulated her.  Out server, Tatyana, was professional and personable.  My wife had the sole Francais and I had the swordfish.  Both dishes were excellent.  (I'll have the sole next time...)  We had a really fun time and will definitely be back.
Food was fabulous as always! The staff were courteous and welcoming. Such a pleasure dining here.
best vibe & snax in Portland. holding strong for decades
Romantic night out, can’t go wrong at Street & Co. Food was excellent as usual, waited a bit longer than expected for our meal, (40 minutes), but our server kept stopping by with updates.

Excellent! Loved the kale salad. I chose monkfish. Menu states it had greens, but only had cannellini beans. Delicious! My wife had shrimp and pasta. Delicious! Panna Cotta was very creamy and good. Always amazing food and service a5 Street and Co!

Place seems past its prime.  Tight / small tables with quick turnover apparently the model.  Simple menu, but the scallops were over cooked.  Service was terrible and very slow.  For what you pay and experience, much better options these days in Portland.
Always, every time a perfect experience. Thank you Street & Co.

We arrived early for a 5:30 reservation and were seated at table 1 where I had a clear view of the kitchen.  Things were fairly quiet for the first 15 minutes or so until we had placed our order.  As we waited for our entrée's, I enjoyed watching the banter between the kitchen and wait staff.  Good vibes.  Before long, our entrees arrived and we were busy enjoying our meal, but I was also drawn to watching the increasing action in the kitchen.  I have a hightened respect now for the hard work that kitchen & wait staff are doing to deliver the wonderful food and great experience at Street and Co.  Delightful evening for us both.

Got mussels for appetizer, and was given plenty of bread for the broth!  Both of us got the dole francious, which was excellent, albeit a bit oversalted. Service was excellent. Due to traffic, we we realized we were going to be late for our reservation. I called and they were very accommodating about pushing the reservation back a bit. Awesome!
Excellent food, excellent service both in a very cool location surrounded by bars and restaurants on a cobble stone street.
Our server was wonderful. The food was absolutely deliscious. Perfect portion sizes. Definitely will be back.
Our server was wonderful. The food was absolutely deliscious. Perfect portion sizes. Definitely will be back.

Amazing service, great food, quiet enough to chat, but not so quiet I felt like everyone could hear us.
Just love this place.
Excellent service and delicious food. The atmosphere including energy and noise level was great so we were able to enjoy conversation at our table throughout our dining experience.
Our favorite Portland restaurant. Street & Co has it all.
Excellent experience overall. The mussel appetizer was flavorful and abundant. Big eye tuna and halibut dishes were both cooked just right and tasty. We wouldn’t hesitate to come here again for sure!

It is fantastic. The only blemish was that the marinara sauce was quite salty. It was part of two different entrees in our party which is how we figured out which component was salty. Given how great everything else was, we think it was just a mistake with that batch. Our server was perfect.
Absolutely fantastic experience all around, would highly recommend.

We have not been back to Street & Co since 1992, for no particular reason other than we moved out of Portland and started a family. So I cannot tell you how excited we were to get a seating primetime on a Friday night. And oh boy did we have a wonderful meal and experience. Shrimp & Garlic over Linguine, Seafood Stew and Sole Almondine were outstanding. The wait staff was exceptional as was the ambiance. And just the odor of roasting garlic in the alley of Wharf Street is enough to drive you made with culinary delight. What a great restaurant!!

I haven’t been here for years. I really enjoyed the food and we had a nice table. Our waiter seemed grumpy. My sister and I both noticed it. We both thought it was odd. He had food runners helping him. They were pleasant. We ordered lots of food and wine, so it was a great tip. Neither of us had questions about the menu or complaints. So, we weren’t occupying his time. Other than that, things were very good.

They wouldn’t seat us until all parties arrived which I understand so they had us seat in the bar area and wait. Promptly a bartender came over to take our drink order and while waiting for our drinks our friends arrived. They would not seat us until our bar tab was paid and drinks served. My husband went to pay the tab and they still wouldn’t seat us while he paid the tab.

They would not take our appetizer order without our full meal order.

I asked for a different dressing on my salad instead of the recommended dressing and was told “not sure they will do that for you”, he returned they can but dressing in the side which was perfectly fine.

Salads were great, mussels and octopus were also delicious.

My husband ordered the tuna rare which was cooked perfect but very small portions and even smaller side vegetable. My dinner (scallops and farro for $38) was ice cold but flavor was delicious.

We hadn’t been there in years. Charming restaurant but won’t rush back.

Street and Company has been one of my very favorite restaurants in Portland. The seafood is always fresh and deliciously prepared. Wait staff is wonderful, always. The restaurant does get to be a bit noisy, but that just means everyone is having fun!
Limited but wonderful menu.  Everything was awesome.  Ambience -- kind of rustic -- was just perfect.

Great vibe. Great service. Great dinner.  Fresh as ever seafood. Wonderful preparations of the dinners. Great wine list to compliment seafood dishes. Extremely well done by all.  A place to go and enjoy.
Great choice with innovative and tasty dishes.  Well done.
Great food, awesome location and atmosphere. Service was decent, but it could have been better. Will come back.
Never have had a bad experience at Street & Co.  the food is fantastic, we had Malcom as our server again, he is amazing.  The atmosphere is amazing!

We haven’t been here in awhile so we decided to have our 33 year wedding anniversary  dinner  here!
Excellent service and excellent food.
We enjoyed the most tender and flavorful grilled octopus!
Big Eye Tuna was amazing as well!
not a place for conversing with friends, but the sole and desert were excellent
Been there many times once again great service, great food great atmosphere ￼
Absolutely wonderful meal and ambiance.  We truly enjoyed this place.  It’s hard to top this.
Absolutely wonderful meal and ambiance.  We truly enjoyed this place.  It’s hard to top this.

Wonderful seafood restaurant.  Casual atmosphere in old building.  Wonderful server, great service.  I have the grilled lobster over linguini, my wife had the sole francaise.  We both found our dinners outstanding.  

Will definately return.

My favorite restaurant in Portland...that's saying a lot because there are so many fabulous restaurants in town.  First, the food is spectacular, the venue is in an interesting old building with a cool layout.  The staff is incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, and responsive. The noise level can be a bit energetic, but all venues of this type are. Because of how fabulous the restaurant is, plan ahead when making reservations! Good luck trying to walk in without a reservation even though they keep a percentage of tables for walk-ins, it is so popular that it is difficult. to land a table without a res.

I was traveling for work. The trip happened to fall on my birthday. I was able to have a perfect solo birthday dinner! The Lobster with linguini was amazing! My favorite was the hot pecan pie with the vanilla ice cream! Absolutely delicious!
Not my 1st time at SC. Service seems to be so much better on the weekends.

May not be the newest, hippest place to eat in our foodie city, but Street and Co never disappoints. Try the tuna bolognese which is often featured on special and don't forget to enjoy their amazing desserts!
Incredible meal as always.  After decades this is consistently some of the best food EVER.  Service top notch and the 4 of us had a great time.

I ordered the monkfish which was cooked to perfection! The ratatouille style, eggplant was melt in your mouth delicious. Service was quick, professional and very friendly. Always a wonderful experience at Street and Company! ￼
As always, the service at every level and the food and the other diners were all wonderful!!!
Amazing food and service.  The mussels and linguine with clams is the best ever!

We have an absolutely delicious dinner at Street & Co, one of my faves in Portland, Maine.  We made a reservation, since it was a special occasion with out-of-town guests.  My only complaint was that the salads came before the oysters and as a result, the dinner felt quite rushed.  I think better pacing for an establishment like this one is almost as important as the meal itself.

The meal was very good- some of the best scallops I've ever had and the rice pudding was an incredible treat.  However, felt like once our dinner had started the objective was to feed us as fast as possible so the next diners could sit at our spot.  It was a shame not to savor every bite.
Food is outstanding, service is also amazing, the vibes here and cozy yet fun. We will definitely be back!

We have loved dining at Street and Co., and were happy to return.  The special- tuna carbonara was delicious.   But we were disappointed that the sole franchise- a dish we came back to enjoy-  was not sizzling and crisp in the pan when it was served, but soggy from sitting in oil, like it was prepared in advance and then reheated. The beans a potatoes were also oil soggy.   Maybe it was just an off night.  Hope so as we really like this restaurant.

This is our favorite restaurant to visit when in town and it never disappoints. Food is always excellent, wait staff are attentive and we never have complaints. We always get the lobster fra Diavlo red and it’s amazing
Food was impeccable, thought we were going to be rushed but server was excellent. Halibut special was amazing.
The perfect restaurant to celebrate my birthday. The host even presented a happy birthday message on a note card!
Buzzy, hugely busy. Great service and food. Would definitely go again
Grilled halibut was great. Wish it could be a regular menu item.

Consistent straightforward delicious food.
They could use some vegetable sides in the menu, otherwise great.

Used to be an amazing place. It’s now too tight, menu more limited, staff less knowledgeable.  Menu has not adapted to increasing dietary restrictions. Overall a big D. We won’t be back for quite some time.

This was our first meal out in Portland for our little honeymoon and I could not have asked for a more perfect start to our trip! The food was outstanding the entire night. We ended up getting specials for the appetizers and dessert and split the lobster dish for our main. Such a fun, lively space, but not too bustling that we couldn’t enjoy each others company. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Our second visit here while visiting Portland Maine from Denver.  Again the service was great and the food was delicious.  If visiting Portland Maine, make sure to visit this restaurant and make reservations ahead of time.
Tuna bolognese! Who knew it existed or could taste SO good?! Had a wonderful meal here.
Our first time to Portland Maine, the food and staff were fabulous. If we ever go back we will definitely revisit.
This is our #1 GoTo restaurant in Maine. Never disappointed. Everything about this restaurant is absolutely fabulous

Servers not sure who’s table is whose. Not willing to allow you to pay more to add scallops to your shrimp pasta entree. Wanted our whole order at once, but then couldn’t time it properly.

Overall,  just lost a step. Not what it used to be.
The amazing cuisine NEVER disappoints. Cocktail choices are amazing. Our server was incredible very attentive and helpful making selections. It was a wonderful experience.

Wonderfully delicious food and great service. The bluefish was moist and the halibut was flavorful. All our food arrived hot! We enjoyed the mussels as an appetizer and sopped up the garlicky broth with the amazing bread.

This time only 4/5 as the receptionist was not exactly very friendly. We sat very cramped next to the wall and were constantly disturbed by bypassing service personnel trying to squeeze their way between us and the neighboring table. Food was excellent.
Fabulous as always.
Hadn’t been in a couple of years but just as good as the many times before!
Quite literally the best lobster I have ever had. I often dream about this place when I’m back home in Chicago. This should be your first stop.
Amazing as always - great food, service, and drinks!
It was exceptional!!  Every component was memorable.

Our reservation was for 8 p.m. But we didn’t get seated until 8.30 so this frustrating.  We had a drink in the bar while we waiting which we were overcharged for. We had 4 different drinks and were charged for 5. When we pointed this out they immediately changed it but all our party were left with the impression it had been a deliberate ‘mistake’. Our wine didn’t arrive until after our appetisers and only because we chased it. My husband was then served the wrong entree so he had to wait while the correct dish came out. The food was very nice but the service let down the experience

Fantastic! We had fresh fish that’s served in a hot skillet so that your food stays warm. Love the ambiance it’s like an old house, and an open kitchen with wafting incredible smells! The service is also top notch. Highly recommend it!
So predictably delicious! No one cooks fish better than Street & Co
Definitely a cut above. Flavors were excellent. They have a chef in charge, not a cook. :)

We enjoyed our pear and gorgonzola salad, the sole francoise, and the shrimp with butter and garlic pasta. The space is rustic and charming but very noisy. It is located on the Wharf street with cobblestone charm in the Old Port area. Our waiter was pleasant and attentive even though it was crowded. We had reservations.
The amazing smells & the vibrant energy of the restaurant is what keeps this local coming back & calling this my favorite restaurant!
Food was outstanding as was the service. Highly recommend
I recommend the grilled octopus appetizer!! Fantastic!!  Scallops were also divine!! Fun place though a little hard to find.
Cozy and authentic vibe. The food was amazing - we had the sole and the tuna. Both were the best we’ve had. Service was great.

First time at Street and we would definitely return.  My wife and I shared the Broiled Scallops  and the Monkfish Over Eggplant Caponata.  Both were delicious! We shared an order of the cheesecake with fruit (a few blueberries) which was also just right. We had the Smoke Cod Pate appetizer which we would not reorder. 
Our server (sorry, I don't remember her name) gave us great recommendations and was always there when we needed her.  Plenty of others kept our water glasses full. 
We were lucky to get a cozy corner in the back.  The noise level in the restaurant IS "energetic".
great atmosphere without a crush of tourists — a long time favorite of ours.
Very good food.. our salad came within 3 minutes, our meals took almost 50 minutes ti be served. Had to rush out to a show.
Excellent meal. Great ambience. Only qualm is we were seated directly in front of the kitchen. Felt I was in an episode of Bear! Overall truly outstanding.

We were very excited to eat at this restaurant. It was a cool atmosphere and interesting menu. The service was just to be desired. Our primary server was very inattentive to our table but overly attentive and distracted by an adjacent table. We ordered a second round of drinks during appetizers and received from another server (because our server wasn’t paying attention) once we were finished with our entrees. We sent the drinks back. No apologies or acknowledgement.
The food is fresh and unpretentious, expertly prepared, and generous portions.  Servers are friendly and knowledgeable, although they cover many tables.

Ambiance was definitely Old Port - cozy brick, exposed beams, open kitchen.  Food was outstanding.  We started with cold, fresh oysters that rivaled the best we've had, and followed with the cod special with stewed tomatoes and shrimp, and the Sole Francais.  Both were fabulous - sizzling hot (literally).  The lack of the 5th star on the atmosphere is only because it was a bit noisy as tables are close together and brick isn't a great sound attenuator.   Definitely eat the bread - perfectly rustic with soft butter.  We'll go again.

I liked the appetizers, and the protein in my meal was good, and dessert was also good. The drinks were pretty flavorful, too. I wasn’t really impressed with the sides, though. Very basic. Two whole red bliss potatoes, lightly seasoned, same with the green beans, although I did like both. Just felt like something I could do at home. I definitely prefer the sister restaurants.
Phenomenal as always, best food in Portland. The Swordfish is a must. Staff is awesome and friendly.
Wonderful meal.  We loved the food and the service was great.
We had mussels and scallops and they were outstanding! Panna cotta for dessert was fabulous!
This place always delivers...of course the bread is amazing, but care and attention is put into every dish and if you can get a table, grab it.
Mussels were huge and plentiful, very fresh. Scallops excellent. Monk fish rivals lobster in flavor. Servers attentive and upbeat.

We had a very nice evening. Love the old brick walls and wooden beams- felt like an old London pub. Our service was excellent- very professional and friendly. 
The crostini with smoked fish spread appetizer was underwhelming- only 2 pieces of bread. Would order a nice salad instead next time. 4 in our party- we all had different entrees and all delicious. I had the very rich, Bluefin tuna. Nice and tender! Our booth was right next to the servers support station- a bit splashy and noisy. Next time would love a table by the window! 
Overall- a nice experience.
Great dishes. Every one. Save room for the bourbon pecan pie

Food and service were outstanding, the only drawback is the noise level.  We were originally seated in the “middle” room, and every table was occupied (@6pm).  The group next to us was especially loud and my wife and I had to yell across the table to try to talk.  We asked to be moved, and the staff was very understanding and accommodated us after ~30 minutes.  We waited in the bar area, which was very quiet.  Next time we will ask to sit there.  We wound up in the third room, which was much better but still loud.  If you’re looking for a quiet, romantic dinner, this isn’t the place for you.  The sole was amazing, as were the tuna bolognese and smoked bluefish dip (both specials), and the pannacotta.

Food and service were outstanding, the only drawback is the noise level.  We were originally seated in the “middle” room, and every table was occupied (@6pm).  The group next to us was especially loud and my wife and I had to yell across the table to try to talk.  We asked to be moved, and the staff was very understanding and accommodated us after ~30 minutes.  We waited in the bar area, which was very quiet.  Next time we will ask to sit there.  We wound up in the third room, which was much better but still loud.  If you’re looking for a quiet, romantic dinner, this isn’t the place for you.  The sole was amazing, as were the tuna bolognese and smoked bluefish dip (both specials), and the pannacotta.

The grilled pear salad was so fresh and delicious.  We ordered the fresh halibut which was a special that night. It was the best halibut I’ve ever had. So white and flaky and sweet. I highly recommend this restaurant. The food is so fresh and our service was awesome.
Love the food and staff. Place is the best in Portland

Street and Co. used to be a go-to for me, a place I looked forward to eating and experiencing, but something has changed. First of all, they are way over filling the restaurant, such that you have to yell to be heard. Second, service is suffering. We waited and waited 20 minutes or more each time we ordered a drink.  There was almost an hour between our appetizer course and our entrees, and our server all but disappeared during that time.  And lastly, the food is fine, but with all the excellent restaurants in town, it by no means stands up to it's peers for the price.  The oysters were gritty and not fully shucked and the fish dishes are uninspired. Would be a long time before I looked to return.
Great place to eat. Worth the wait! I shared the lobster diavolo with white sauce. Absolutely fantastic.

I love this restaurant and have eaten here many times. Great atmosphere, good service, and the food was just okay this time. I believe the fish was fresh but it lacked flavor. Pear salad was good. My overall impression was good but I can’t say it was great.

Wonderful atmosphere, delicious food, great service. Drinks were expensive considering how much ice was in the glass, and the noise level made it difficult to hear the server. Definitely the place to go, though, for an exceptional seafood experience. Would highly recommend.
After appetizers waited for over 1 hour for dinner. Kitchen seemed to have missed our order.

We were blown away with this restaurant. One of the best we've ever enjoyed. We arrived early for our reservation, but were easily seated at the bar, where we enjoying dining. Declyn (sorry if misspelled) and Jenny were exceptional bartenders and servers. The meals were equally outstanding. This restaurant deserves all the accolades it receives.
Top notch service, food and ambience.  First time there and we’ll DEFINITELY be back.  Would highly recommend to anyone.
Street & Co is an iconic restaurant in Portland’s Old Port. It remains a must visit experience when visiting Portland
Food quality excellent except sword fish portion very thin and small for the price
Delicious food!  Excellent service.  Highly recommend.
Great food as usual. First time guests were very impressed.

A must dining experience for any occasion. 
Very special!
Friends recommended Street and Co. and we were not disappointed.  Reservations were on time; service was great, and food receives our highest recommendation.
Always a great meal, & professional service. Our favorite restaurant in Portland!

Thought it was great. Server was knowledgeable about where the fish came from so I could get one that was local. Appreciated there were a couple of ways to have the fish prepared. Enjoyed watching the open kitchen. Nice spot.

Food is very good approaching excellent. Service is good, location and ambience are very good and the value is fair. Pricey at the end of the night but I would gladly pay more for a quality experience all together. Highly recommended for those who enjoy seafood.
Absolutely fantastic all around. Both food and service were great.

excellent service excellent food , truly a pleasure to dine there , highly recommended but they really don't need it because the place is always full. 
As Yogi Berra said " No one goes their anymore its too crowded "

I used to love Street & Co as a place to celebrate a special moment. It has been really loud the last two times I’ve been. The food is fabulous. But, unless you’re up for being in a place where people are pretty loud and it feels more like a bar vibe, you probably want to celebrate special occasion elsewhere.
Sister get together!
It was good. Will go back. A little noisy. Good service. Good place for seafood.
Great food and atmosphere. Average to poor service.
Once again an amazing experience at Street!  It never fails to impress my friends and family!!!
Great as always...Food is always fresh. Love the Mussels!
For an awesome seafood dining experience, you must go here at least once while in Portland!
The food was great, but the service was very slow.

We had the pleasure of dining at Street and Company for celebrating our first wedding anniversary. We spent some time searching around for the right restaurant in Portland as we had never been there before. We settled on street and co. My wife had the swordfish and I had the blue fin tuna. They were extraordinarily delicious. The rice pudding dessert was something beyond our expectation. I think it may have been the best dessert that I’ve ever had. The service was superb. We can’t wait to go back there again sometime in the future. Thank you street co chefs and servers for the privilege of dining in your establishment!!
Awesome overall experience. Only downside is getting seated next to the kitchen. While fun to watch the team cook, my clothes smelled like kitchen grease when I got home.
Great food and excellent service. I really enjoyed the mussels appetizer.

Everything we had was delicious. We are discerning foodies from San Francisco. Just for credibility.
Would definitely go again
Our meal was very very rushed. The main course came immediately after the starter with no chance whatsoever to breathe. Just too fast.
Best restaurant we have dined at in a while.   Had mussels (best ever), and scallops / swordfish.   Highest recommendation I could give.  Worth a trip to Portland

Everything went perfectly.  We arrived about 5 minutes before our reservation time and we were welcomed warmly and directed into the bar area to wait for our table.  At exactly our reservation time, they directed our waiter to us who then escorted us to our table, which was a nice 2-place along one wall by the window, which was perfect.  Everything from drinks, to apps, to main courses to dessert was perfect.  Great menu, great direction from our waiter, Charlie and a meal to remember for a long time and considering it was for our 40th anniversary, we were glad we chose Street and Co. to help us celebrate it!

I always make a reservation here whenever visiting Portland. I’ve always had great service and INCREDIBLE food! I’ve never had a bad meal. I always get

- Lobster Diavolo over Linguine (split with my fiancé)
- Clams over Linguine in white sauce.

Amazing! I wanted to post a picture but this app doesn’t allow! 


Make sure to schedule a reservation, you might get lucky and walk in, but probably not likely.
Great food.  Our server forgot about us a couple of times.
The food (scallops, swordfish,.clams with white sauce) was excellent, and the service was gracious and upbeat. A total joy of an evening.

We like this restaurant very much.  All of the food (2 appetizers and 2 entrees) was excellent, however I found the daily special Fishermans Stew a bit disappointing, a lot of sauce and not much seafood (a single bite of lobster, a couple of small pcs of fish, 3 littleneck clams, 3 mussels, 5 med shrimp).  The tomato soup, tomatoes with pesto, and dover sole were all wonderful.

We had tremendous service and our food was excellent. Our son and his wife ate the same evening but had later reservations and had a completely different experience. Their food took forever ( from things the waitress said, they surmised she forgot to put in their food order). They said the meal was wonderful but their waitress was not attentive and they rarely got water refilled. We had the opposite experience and would highly recommend.

Street & Co. is a wonderful spot for a high quality, foodie-level dinner.  An exceptional experience, even for Portland Maine which has a very high level of dining in general.

Two notes:  For me the noise level was way too high - not really the fault of the restaurant - and when two loud tables of 4 finally departed, it was much nicer. 

There was a 40 minute lag between starters and entrees.  This was odd and unexplained.

We had a wonderful dinner at Street and Company. Our waitress was excellent; attentive time but not overly, perfect and she was willing g to share her favorites when asked. Sour meals were delicious. The desserts too were fantastic. We’ll be back.
Wonderful seafood - everyone had a great time and friendly waiters
Second time I eat there...has never disappointed. Recommend 100%
Our meals were wonderful and we cannot wait to return!!
Great food and great space. Highly recommend ordering the mussels. Will definitely be coming back.
Cute place. We ordered the linguini and it was good, but not mind blowing like we were expecting. It was a lovely dinner overall. The tuna tartar was delicious.
very good service , creative menu with beautiful execution
Great food, a little too noisy but worth it for the overall experience!

This restaurant is amazing.  Had the special heirloom tomato salad with pesto and feta cheese.  Incredible!!   Arugula salad with fennel also delicious.  My husband and I shared the lobster fra Diavlo
Which came with mussels, clams and squid served over linguine.  Arrived in a steaming huge pan filled with fresh and delicious seafood.  To die for!!   Highly recommend. Staff extremely welcoming, friendly and attentive
Amazing food, especially the scallops, just really loud and cramped.
Great place for a small special event or celebration. It is loud during dining. Very good overall
Great dining experience.  Love the ambience and the wait staff was top knotch. Food was amazing and so glad they took reservations for our trip to Portland.
Very crowded, tables too tight together. Very loud, difficult to have private conversation.

Great food, and the staffing and service is extraordinary. The place was packed right from opening at around 5:30pm, but these folks at dialed in. We ate earlier than usual and I was worried that we might be rushed through to make the table available for a later reservation, but not the case. We had a very leisurely pace of cocktails and appetizers, and the entrees were impeccably timed. Everything was delicious and hot and the deserts were terrific. Excellent portion sizes, too, also just right.  Great experience celebrating my son’s 30th birthday!

The hostess was much more pleasant than in all of our past visits.  Management / owners should train her on the essentials of greeting customers and visitors from out of state (tourists).  *The first interaction will make or break your business.  Be more friendly / affable to the customers.

The server (male) was not attentive.  He was nice and polite the couple of times that he came back to our table, but left us underwhelmed.  The young man (male) that brought the bread and water was very polite and attentive.  

The sauce in the lobster diavolo has changed the past two times.  We enjoy it, but the original recipe was much better.
Absolutely Delicious mussels.  Bluefish was moist and nicely seasoned.  Scallops were done perfectly.  Our server was attentive and friendly.
Been coming here for 20+ years.  Still great.  Bangs island mussels are fantastic and HUGE

The experience my husband and I had here was top notch.  We were celebrating our anniversary, and they left a card on the table for us. Our server was very kind and informative, and recommended wines as well. The mussels were a perfect portion, and prepared in an amazing butter sauce that paired perfectly with their fresh house bread. The lobster was fantastic, and we ended the night with their limoncello. We will be recommending Street and Co to all our friends who visit!

The seafood is impeccable and perfectly cooked. The dishes will blow you away. The lobster fra diavolo for two is spicy and deep with flavor while finessed and made with care. The wine list is well curated and reasonable in price. I will be back!
We ate here for our 50th anniversary.  The service was great and so was the food.
Great food and service. A top restaurant in the area.
The food here is so delicious!  1f you like fish, this is the restaurant to come to in Portland.  The service was also excellent.  We had a wonderful meal and a great experience.

The food and ambiance here was incredible! We shared the lobster diovolo in the red sauce and it’s was outstanding!! We were going to get the white sauce, but our server suggested the red because of all the flavors. 100% would come back here when in Portland. Worth the hype.
We had heard good things, and they were all true. We loved the atmosphere, our server and our meal. The branzino and the bluefin were so fresh and flavorful. And that Basque cheesecake - perfect.
Food is always fabulous and ambiance amazing!  Have been dining here for 30+ years and it never disappoints..

Any time we can book a table at Street and Co we feel like we’ve won the lottery. It’s always perfection wrapped in delicious. Even if the only thing on the menu was the filet of sole we would go there at every opportunity. This is not a paid endorsement we love love love
We had Kylie as our waitress who was outstanding
This place was great and walking location to many places. We loved the octopus appetizer and the ambiance
Fabulous restaurant, ambience was super, food was delicious, and service was impeccable
Amazing food and service! Everything we got was delicious - highly recommend the cornbread, steamers, scallops, and steak. 10/10
Waiter was out sanding . Noise level is the only issue
Absolutely the best meal I have ever had… recommend the Halibut dish and the blueberry mousse for desert! Will not disappoint!

Our first visit to Scales after coming back to Maine to visit family. Had my favorites but wanted to try Scales as heard so much about it. Great food and staff was so friendly! Looking forward to next visit.
Outstanding atmosphere and food/service top notch.

The hostess was rather hostile, but every other element of the evening was fabulous. We dine here at least 4 times a year, and the food and ambience is consistently a treat for us and our guests. One of our favorite restaurants in the US.
Great experience all the way around. Amazing, fresh ingredients presented beautifully and prepared well.
We had an absolutely fabulous dinner. Service was excellent . It was a little loud but a great time.

Scales was a delightful experience. I got out on a waitlist for dinner and we were given the bar. The bar had a granite counter designed for having your oysters shucked right in front of you. They were amazing. I got the whole deep fried fluke and my partner got the pan roasted halibut. Both were excellent. Great service, nice peeps, we will be back and we will bring friends!
Excellent food, incredible service. One of the best meals we’ve had! Sat at the bar and would highly recommend.

First of all, I want to say that Scales is extremely well run.  Our reservation was for 6:45,  we were welcomed and guided to our table promptly.  Our waiter was knowledgeable, efficient, very helpful and professional.  Everyone enjoyed their meal which was served piping hot and plated in a most attractive manner.  I would recommend Scales to a friend but with a few caveats.  First they do not allow substitutions so make sure you like the sides served with your entree.   Most importantly it is not a place for intimate dining or to go when you want to catch up with friends you rarely see because the noise level is very high.  It's not unpleasant, just  a very busy buzz which makes conversing with anyone other than the person sitting next to you difficult.
Had a delicious dinner here with family last night. The prices are reasonable if this is considered fine dining. Highly recommend
We sat in the patio. It was a very nice evening so it made the experience excellent

I was surprised! I was expecting a restaurant in a very busy tourist area to be mediocre. Not only was it not mediocre, it was great! All four of us ordered a different meal and we all were very very happy! Seafood or meat=lovely.
Food was amazing but we felt like we were really rushed and that really affected our experience. Staff was just on us from the get-go. Food was amazing though.
Always a great place with fabulous service, wine list and food!
The scallop ceviche special was so good that it’s ok for me to die now.

Very upscale restaurant on the water in Portland. Reservation was right on time. We were early but there was a nice waiting area off the bar where we got drinks and appetizers. Oyster all from Maine were excellent. Highly recommended. Next trip to Portland we will do this again.
Special occasions require special dinners. This was special
Food excellent.  Need to do something about the sun in peoples eyes - simple shades would help.  Noise buffers would also improve ambience.  Sometimes too loud to have a conversation.
We had great service, great food, great environment. They provided a little birthday card for my fiance. It was wonderful. This is one of our new favorite spots for special occasions!
Food is always excellent! Wait with reservations was a bit disappointing.
We enjoyed a business dinner at Scales last night.  Great atmosphere, terrific menu, and service was stellar.

Truly an outstanding experience from start to finish. We sat at the bar, grateful to get a 4:45 seating. The atmosphere is terrific. Our bartender was friendly, efficient and professional. We had all the raw appetizers offered that night. We also had a whole fried fluke as well as a lobster roll. Some of the best food we've ever had. The ingredients, combinations and expertise was magical! Only sorry we live so far away! Thank you for a truly memorable experience.
Cheers!
The food and drinks were amazing and our waiter, Ben, and the team at Scales executed everything flawlessly. Love this place!
Don’t miss the seafood stew or the butterscotch sundae! Sit at the bar and order oysters, Tableside shucking!
Been to Scales twice so far on our travels to Portland.  It’s a fantastic place to spend an evening and the food is beyond wonderful.  This is our go to place in Portland.

We had an outside reservation, but it rained. We were given an inside table after a short wait. Every service person we dealt with was super professional and friendly. Everyone I looked at flashed a warm smile. Clearly the staff training here is excellent. And all the food was perfectly prepared and delicious. A nearly perfect dinner. The only slight negative was the noise level, but we were happy to tolerate it.
Scales thank you so much for a great anniversary celebration.  Lex , Guy and the entire staff were incredible!
Scales was by far one of the best meals we have ever had. The oysters were amazing, and the homemade cocktail sauce was a nice accompaniment. The entire dinner was exceptional.
My only complaint is that the ambient noise level is way too loud for my comfort and the food is expensive. Otherwise excellent food, service and a cool ambiance.

For a fine food restaurant, they were looking to flip the tables like a fast food restaurant. Felt very rushed. I wasn’t even able to get a second round of drinks. And when we finished our entre they cleared the table and took my napkin so I had nothing to use for dessert.

We always enjoy sitting at the bar.  The staff is always engaging, and the food is consistently outstanding.  As a Portland resident, Scales is one of our go-to restaurants.  We highly recommend it.  It can be busy which is why we prefer sitting at the bar.
