Good location, good ambience  (a bit noisy, though), good food and excellent service.  Menu has something for everybody.

Don’t miss this fine eatery in Portland, ME for the freshest  halibut, oysters, little neck clams, and clam chowder … Our server, Sandra, was  exceptional from her suggestions to her coordination with the kitchen, timing our appetizers and entrees flawlessly.  The wine selections were solid and the sides were simply divine tasty… 

If you don’t order the ramp rolls you will be missing out!  We will be back for sure on our next visit to Portland 🤗😋🤩🍽️

Amazing food, as always.  One of our favorites, and never ceases to impress us!!! The only downside is the noise. It’s very popular so it’s understandable, high ceiling open space, but still  can be tough to have a conversation.  The quality and creativity makes up for any noise though.  So great.

Sitting at the bar for two is usually an enjoyable experience and this was a flawless performance.
The food is imaginative, the service attentive and the atmosphere is welcoming and lively. Highly recommended

Loved the pre dinner bar area. Had ramp rolls to start which were a MUST order 10/10. We also ordered the halibut and the lobster roll. Both were outstanding.  This was probably the best meal we had while visiting Maine. Scales is a must visit!
We thoroughly enjoyed the shaved squash salad, what a great change up to the menu.  We had a dozen oysters, the scallops and the baked haddock.  Great meal, drinks and service.

Once again our dining experience at Scales was outstanding. Evolving flavorful tweaks to their menu, great service and exciting atmosphere draw us back on a regular basis particularly for special occasions!
Good was excellent, as was the service. A bit loud and fairly pricey but otherwise highly recommend
Food was great but it seemed the kitchen was backed up as we waited a very long time to get our halibut.
Delicious seafood, highly recommend - gorgeous atmosphere as well.
My only disappointment was in the size of the side of whole belly clamps five small clams seemed awful small. They were delicious. My only criticism.

It's a nice restaurant, being on the wharf, it's fun. The food was pretty good, I would not say excellent. A bit on the salty side for me. Portions were fine. I got the feeling that they try to get as many people through, I felt a little rushed. It is expensive for what you get.

Wonderful evening meal with family for a birthday. Dined outside on the patio and the temperature was perfect, the only small flaw was the neighoring restaurant’s music was a bit loud. The waiter and host were phenomenal. The food was everything we desired and no one should skip the brown bread. Must order two serving of the bread because they are small and you will want more.

The food was delicious. We were seated outside in the far back corner after dark and there was no light above our table.  It was so dark we couldn't see the menu or our food. We had to use the light on our phones to see.  Also, the bar across the water had music so loud we felt like we were at a club.

We made a reservation for 7:45, and were immediately seated upon arrival. Chris, our server, was absolutely amazing. He was so attentive, amiable, and was thrilled to chat about the specials and the menu’s top picks. It made my date night so much more special. The food was incredible, so tasty, great portion sizes, and the ambiance was just what we were looking for. I can’t wait to recommend this place to my family and friends!
The vibe and location are really nice! The food is ok.

Three of us (all seafood lovers) ate here for the first time. The best parts of the meal were the anadama bread and the server. The coleslaw was quite awful (one bite proved this), the seafood stew and fish and chips were adequate/mediocre, the lobster was fine (but hard to ruin a steamed lobster). The outside seating was great until the sun broke through the clouds and blinded us. At least outside we were protected from the inside cacophony. So noisy!

Sorry about this; I never give bad reviews. But for the money and hype this was really not even adequate.

Love Scales…this day not so much. Mussels were shriveled, dry and sauce watery. Not their usual plump and delicious mussels at all. French fries extremely greasy. What happened…
Chris, our server, was most delightful, polite and professional…he along with delicious clams and dessert saved the evening!
By the by…restaurant deleted charge for the mussels.

Window seats are for parties of four only when busy, to our disappointment, -- we had widow seating a month earlier. Many, as we were, also were disappointed with their appetizers. The sheer size of the restaurant and the air conditioning made the entrees arrive colder, and less appetizing than ideal. The sides were also not appetizing. Scales was once on our A-list; but after this year's experiences.
The food was delicious! We also enjoyed the water view on the patio.
The place was great! Only criticism was that the bacon/pork belly in my rather expensive scallop dish was too fatty. It was a little disappointing
Wonderful good, great ambiance, and friendly, prompt service.

Fried oysters very good.  Clams loaded with sand and that made it unpleasant eating.  Got excellent.  Tuna quality mediocre not sushi grade tuna and though cooked was  tough.  Not the usual excellent meal I’ve come to count on at Scales.
Our bartender Guy was very attentive, informative and easy going.  Loved sitting at the bar and would request the bar for our next visit.  Food from apps to dessert was delicious. Highly recommend.
We really enjoyed everything we ordered. The specials were terrific, the oysters were so fresh and shucked perfectly. Our server was helpful and efficient. The restaurant was beautiful.
The food is outstanding as well is the service. If you sit at the bar for dinner, they shuck the oysters in front of you. Highly recommend!!

Lovely restaurant with an abundance of seafood options. I had corn and crab chowder that was delicious and the sea bass in brown butter sauce. Really enjoyed both! Hubby had clam chowder and 1 1/2 lb lobster. We were both very happy with our choices! Service was excellent too. Definitely highly recommend-only caveat is make sure to have a reservation and plan early!!
VERY impressed with every item we tried - I would love to eat at Scales again.  Can’t recommend it highly enough.
Food was excellent as usual. Brian was a great waiter/Bartender!
Easily one of the best restaurants in Portland. I’ve been twice now and can’t wait to go back. Get the scallops!!!

Wow - we visited Scales 3 years ago and couldn't wait to get back. We sat at the amazing bar and ordered oysters. They put crushed ice right on the gorgeous concrete counter and open the oysters right in front of you! Fabulous!  The appetizers were inspired...king fish with a strawberry gazpacho. Every trip to Portland should include scales - right on the waterfront in a fabulous wharf building. The seafood could not be fresher.
This was the best overall dining experience we had in Portland. The service, design, food, and even the wine list… perfection.

Fresh seafood creatively prepared. Had the halibut with brown butter and hazelnuts and my wife had the scallops which were served with an outstanding sauce. Sat at the bar and the service was outstanding. Will certainly go back.
Loved everything about the restaurant! Food and service were e excellent . We were seated outside and I would highly recommend that because inside it is very noisy and chaotic.
Terrific dinner with some great specials and tasty desserts. A bit loud overall but lots of energy. Would eat there again!
The food and service was great.  Too noisy and the ambience is not that great.
Enjoyed sitting at the bar. Food was incredible-flavorful and lovely presentation.  Highly recommend!

Scales is a wonderful restaurant. The food is so well prepared and presented. Every staff member is nice beyond expectations.
Do not skip dessert! The carmel popcorn ice cream dish is out of this world!
We loved it! Beautiful setting, dinner and drinks were delicious and Sandra was a wonderful server. We look forward to coming back!
As a local, we feel privileged to bring all of our guests here.  Scales is a fantastic restaurant!

We learned about this restaurant from a docent at the Lighthouse Museum closest to the Bug lighthouse. Although reservations through OpenTable weren’t directly available to be made  for Scales, Scales way of making a reservation was simple to navigate. Our waiter was excellent, and the menu choices were plentiful. If I’m recalling it correctly most of the wines offered were French. We ordered a glass of the Pinot Blanc & the Chardonnay Chablis. Both were great. We ordered the Garlic Knots to share with our cocktails. Super garlicky and buttery and light as air!!! You must give those a try. I ordered the scallops, which were fabulous. My husband ordered the tuna which unfortunately was terribly stringy and practically inedible. When the waiter checked back to ask how our meals were, i mentioned my scallops were fab but that the jury was out on my husbands tuna and that the piece of tuna that he was served seemed not the best. Our waiter immediately offered to replace his dinner entirely, but he decided to finish it and so the waiter offered to comp his dessert￼We each had a frappe which was SO GOOD!!! Great service! Thank you.

The service and food was great; however, we felt like our entrees were priced $8-$10 more than they should have been. The house-made bread was not included with the meal. Our server was wonderful and gracious and our only critique is that the entrees were pricey for what they consisted of.

Food delicious as always, and our server was charming. Loved sitting by the windows, love that there’s valet parking. Only difficulty last night was the noise level; we had to more or less shout across the table.

Stellar food as always - loved the oysters rolls and steamers especially
One minor point of improvement could be the maitre d’ who was rather accommodating
Fabulous experience. Glad we sat outside as inside seemed very noisy. Staff was considerate and knowledgeable. Food was excellent! Great view.
Superb! In every way. It should be on everyone’s must dine at list. Merci.

Thank you for seating us early!  We were trying to avoid a major rain storm and ran in an hour before our seating.  We were kindly greeted and with only a few minutes wait were seated at the bar (exactly where we wanted to be!).  Our server was very attentive and the food was next level (I hate that overused expression but it was!!).  Thank you for making our anniversary so special.  We will absolutely be back!
Staff was very accomidating. Food was excellent! The whole fish dishes were best i have ever tasted.
Always an excellent food experience.  I do feel like their bar service could use some support - the prices are reasonable, but the drinks and wine are pretty average in comparison to the food.
We had fish & seafood that was second to none - off the boat fresh and expertly prepared! Great service & atmosphere -restaurant located on top the peer!
Amazing food, wine, view, and service, we had booked an outdoor reservation but it rained and they were still able to accommodate us inside, great location too.

🌟 Scales Restaurant: A Culinary Gem on the Maine Wharf

Atmosphere and Ambiance: Scales Restaurant, nestled on the historic Maine Wharf, exudes coastal charm. The moment you step inside, you’re greeted by the salty breeze and the rhythmic lapping of waves against the pier. The nautical decor, with its weathered wood and maritime artifacts, sets the perfect tone for a seafood feast.
Culinary Delights:
Freshness Reigns: Scales takes pride in sourcing the freshest seafood. From briny oysters to succulent lobster, each dish celebrates the ocean’s bounty. Don’t miss the Maine Lobster Roll—a buttery, perfectly toasted bun cradling chunks of sweet lobster meat.
Inventive Starters: The Tuna Tartare dances on your palate with zesty citrus notes, while the Grilled Octopus surprises with its tender texture and smoky flavor. Pair these with a crisp glass of white wine.
Main Courses: The Pan-Seared Scallops are a revelation—seared to golden perfection and served with a delicate saffron risotto. For landlubbers, the Braised Short Rib melts in your mouth, accompanied by truffle mashed potatoes.
Dessert Dreams: Save room for dessert! The Blueberry Cobbler captures the essence of Maine summers, and the Chocolate Torte satisfies any cocoa craving.
Service and Staff: The attentive waitstaff strikes the right balance—knowledgeable without being overbearing. They guide you through the menu, ensuring a memorable dining experience.
Sunset Views: Arrive early to snag a window seat. As the sun dips below the horizon, the harbor lights twinkle, casting a magical glow on the water. It’s a moment you’ll want to savor.
Final Verdict: Scales Restaurant is more than a meal; it’s a sensory journey. Whether you’re celebrating a special occasion or simply indulging in life’s pleasures, Scales delivers. Book your table, raise your glass, and let the sea enchant you. 🦞🌊

1st time casual service was excellent! Food nicely presented fresh fulfilled expectations ~
Energetic loud, we didn’t mind just was hard to have a conversation without raising your voice.

A delicious meal start to finish along with great service at the bar. Oysters were so tasty and we started with that.  One had halibut(perfect) and one had tuna (so good). No room for dessert!  I would highly recommend this restaurant if you visit Portland
Appetizers and service were amazing!! Main dishes weren’t the best but we do still love it there.
Amazing fresh food, perfectly cooked with amazing service.
Not a fan of many differenr servers bringing the food to the table  for this style of restaurant. The food is excellent, though.

Brea was our server. She was excellent. We ordered muscles, raw scallops, Endive salad, halibut ceviche, Maine chowder, fish stew, and Bavette steak!!
￼
Only give it a five star because there wasn’t six stars to pick from !!!

food and service were outstanding, I was dining alone so had a seat at the bar to eat and had a most enjoyable evening.  server was attentive and food did not take long to get at all given how full the restaurant was and quality was top notch--one of my favorite restaurants in Portland

Food was very fresh, beautifully presented and delicious! Nice setting, right on the water. The dining room is large and open, which creates a lively atmosphere but it is a bit loud. Service was great. Definitely going back!

Our meal at Scales was one of the best dining experiences in recent memory. Each plate was prepared with such care, Duncan coursed out our meal perfectly, and we found the value to be excellent for such a nice meal. The patio seemed to be a little quieter than the main dining room which was nice. 10/10 would recommend to anyone!

Fresh, nicely prepared seafood and good service. Loses a few points from me due to the cavernous warehouse-like space, which is nevertheless tightly packed with diners. (Squeeze 6 people into a booth that might normally seat 4 then pull up a chair at the end and voila! A table for 7!)

The vibe is loud--not at all cozy, intimate, or romantic. That's not necessarily a bad thing, and it's understandable given the location. It's just not my preference for fine dining.

Scales doesn’t need a review from me!! It’s well known for providing excellent service, fabulous food and really good drinks! It did not disappoint!! Our meals were excellent. They have a large and accommodating staff. It’s such a treat to celebrate any event at Scales!!
Great meal sitting outside on the dock made better by our great server Emily!
A great dining experience. Food, service, ambience and everything in between is top notch.

Maritime vibe, delicious seafood, good wine, super desserts, outstanding service (lots of servers and staff keep things rolling even in busy tourist season)—however, quite noisy. Our senior companion from out of town found it challenging to hear and, despite all the positives, was kinda peeved about that (complained). But, we (locals) were contented. Not a good place , thus, for a business meeting dinner or intimate conversation.
The food was excellent! The service was very attentive and enjoyed sitting in the outside less noice.

Not
Great for
An intimate dinner. Very loud!  Awesome food..never have had a bad meal at any of Dana’s restaurants.  The halibut
Was a bit dry but the prep
Excellent.  Apps amazing ..both octopus and ceviche great. wonderful bread.
Always impeccable service. Food is consistent & very high quality. Very lively atmosphere. The oysters here are always top level & very fresh.
Perfect experience and the food was the best I’d had in a very long time. We sat at the bar and the service was premium. Best fish n chips and the steamed cod was excellent. Wonderful ambiance
Very consistent, Excellent food and service at one of the highest price points in town.
Food is outstanding. Service is fabulous. Can’t wait to come back!
Food was excellent. It was a bit noisy. Fair amount of wait time to order and in between courses.

Our server Ben was outstanding! Very attentive and never let a drink go dry, gave amazing recommendations and was very friendly. Oysters were some of the best we had during our stay in Portland. Scallops and lobster main dish were amazing. Gave 4 stars because first cocktail we were not impressed with, wish we would have requested a table by the windows, we felt “in the way” with our small two top and lots of servers/customers walking back and forth. This place is BUSY- it will be loud but we didn’t mind. We will definitely be coming back!
Delicious halibut and oysters!!  Service was impeccable as well!
One of the best meals we have ever had! We sat on the outdoor patio and it was the perfect setting for our dinner - the service was superb and the food even better!
Favorite Portland restaurant, oysters at the bar are 10/10!

Had a birthday dinner here for my SO, the staff was excellent. We had the muscles and rolls to start. The muscles had this delicious creamy sauce they sat in, tastes amazing. The rolls were delicious, very buttery topped with scallions. For our entree we both had the lobster roll. Warm buttered and topped with the perfect amount of mayo. We had a fantastic meal that closed out an amazing day in Portland. Will definitely return in the future to try more menu items!
Excellent! We enjoyed everything about our dinner at Scales.  Highly recommend!

The food was great, but pricey.
The noise level was so bad I could hardly hear my husband🙁
I also had to avoid the sun glare.  Shades would have been nice!
Server was very good!
OK food and friendly service. The chowder was good. The lobster was typical. Not sure why people rave about this place. It’s a decent choice but not an upscale experience.

Rather loud, but Natalie our server, was terrific. Every dish was crazy delicious.  My dinner at Scale was one of my All Time Top Five Dinners, ever!! (and I’ve dined at some Michelin restaurants in Europe, Australia and NZ. It’s a large s-Ace, lots of buzz from patrons, background noise is loud. Try the lobster bisque - AMAZING!

We had a delicious meal as usual!!!   Our server Sandra was terrific!! And we love Brandon who is always friendly and helpful.
Everyone was really great.
We’ll be back in two weeks!!

Excellent food.  Wasn’t very hungry.  Ordered salad and soup. Got a feeling the waitress was annoyed we ordered so little. Yet dinner guest had a full meal.
Noise level intense.

Pros: Good service, the appetizer clams were delicious, left us a card wishing us a happy anniversary.

Cons: Scallop entree was way too complicated, too saucy, scallops were small and hard to taste with all the other ingredients overwhelming them. Branzini entree was decent, but could have used more seasoning. Basically a plain whole grilled fish.
Clam Chowda (chowder) lacked flavor and lacked clams. Mostly just as unseasoned potato soup.

Tables are tiny — not big enough to hold apps like clams and bread at same time.
Fantastic meal. Noise from live band nearby was the only negative.
food so good I could cry, 10/10 recommend. halibut was the best i've ever had
Great food pleasant waiters - atmosphere out on patio enjoyable.

Scrumptious food. Great service. 
Amazing with the numbers they serve night after night that they still deliver fabulous food. 
Best in Portland
Our first time in Maine and this was an amazing experience!! Duncan was an outstanding server and made the best recommendations! The absolute best Mussels I’ve ever had!
Scales is quite honestly the best restaurant I’ve been to. I’ve visited three times now and it is consistently outstanding. The fresh seafood is best of the best, the ambiance and service matches.
Always first class from start to finish. Best restaurant and bar in Portland, maybe the East Coast!
We had a great time at Scales celebrating a birthday. We sat at the bar for dinner and the service was so warm and welcoming! And the food is excellent. You HAVE to order the ramp rolls!!

As one of the more upscale ("up-scales"?) restaurant along the Portland waterfront, Scales does not disappoint, with absolutely fresh seafood fare served with flair. We had the mussels, oysters and the seafood stew, all excellent oferings. The asparagus salad, topped with grated manchego, was amazing. We topped it all off wuth the Indian bread pudding. Our server, Paige, provided cheerful and attentive service. Compared to other tourist traps with zero atmosphere such as Luke's, Scales is a great value.
the muscles, the ceviche, the oysters and the asparagus salad. All washed down with a dirty martini = heavenly
Loved it. Can’t be missed when visiting Portland.
Good food. Little pricey. Service ok………………………………..

Everything was great except the noise and your policy not to seat a party until everyone was there. We dropped off our wives 5 minutes before our reservation while we parked and were disappointed to find them still standing when we returned 5 minutes after our reservation time.
Food was exceptional and our waiter was outstanding.
Exceptional visit with wonderful menu of freshly caught fish. Dining experience not to be missed. Very highly recommend.
We loved everything about this place: the ambience, the service, and especially the food. We will return next time we are in Portland.

This restaurant was everything we hoped for, and more. We started with a cup of their clam chowder, which was absolutely excellent.  Then we had the octopus appetizer, which was unbelievable! Loved the spicy oil sauce!Then I had the halibut, and my husband had the scallops. The halibut was a little on the small side, but it tasted delicious. Scallops were great too! ￼ This is just a wonderful restaurant that does not disappoint. ￼
Food was excellent as usual.  Best seafood restaurant in Portland.

Patrick’s knowledge of the food built on actually having tasted the dish reflects the quality focus from Scales owners & chef. The halibut chop & morels, fresh scallops and oysters were the best Maine has to offer from their own waters. We will always go to Scales when in Portland, again and again.
Food and service were outstanding. Great place to go anytime or for special occasions. Emily was a great server!
Lovely restaurant with great food and  service with a surprisingly diverse menu. It’s loud, however, and that makes conversation a challenge. Try the smoked fish pate and the ramp rolls are a must!!
Incredible food served by a knowledgeable and delightful team of people that made it easy to enjoy every minute from the ambience to the view.
Food was amazing. Waitress was very nice and attentive. Thoroughly enjoyed our meal and will go back again!

Scales is a top notch restaurant and my late reservation during Memorial weekend only had outdoor patio seating available. Sitting outdoors ended up being a bonus with free live music from across the water but without the deafening noise and there were heat lamps to keep us warm.  The staff worked in unison so we experienced impeccable service. The food was outstanding, everything fresh seafood is supposed to be and their dessert menu was original - the coconut and passion fruit mousse cake had my name written all over it.  The lobster was on price point and the biggest we were served dining out that long weekend.
Food, service, and location were all fantastic.  Drinks and starters came out quickly, entree’s were plated perfectly.  Corned bread and baked haddock were excellent
Always outstanding at Scales. Food was 10/10, great service. Awesome ambience. Always a must stop in Portland
Scales offers perfect dining experience Attentive, waiters a freat amboance and delicious good! Highly recommend!
It was really loud in the restaurant but the food was incredible!!
Host was rude, but servers and bartenders made up for it. Fantastic food!

Food and service at Scales is exemplary!  The fried oysters, grilled octopus,and tuna tartare are all a must try. The halibut and scallops are both at the top of the list and the the haddock appeared poached in a fish chowder…very delicious. You cannot go to Portland and not dine at Scales.
Good portions of delicious food and quality service. The food comes out very quickly so be ready to eat!
Our server (Chris) was amazing. Very attentive, active and great host for our family vacation dinner.
Portland staple - a must ! Great atmosphere and food !
My husband and I got the halibut and the scallops and both dishes were knee bucklingly delicious. Highly recommend.

Hands down the best seafood I've ever had. Always so consistently delicious and everyone who works here is always so wonderful. Great drink selection as well. I've always gotten seafood, but their non-seafood items always tempt me with how fantastic they sound.

Thank you, Scales.
Sat at the Bar and enjoyed chatting with all the staff best oysters and baked fish ever !

Amazing food every time I have been there!  Service was excellent!  The kitchen by accident dropped one of our meals so the timing was 11 minutes off.  But they offered a free salad while we waited which was delicious!  Highly recommend Scales to anyone that loves finer dining!

The food was fantastic. I had the steam cod that was absolutely delicious and my wife had the baked haddock that was spectacular. Everything here is top-notch and the food quality is second to none. Caleb was our waiter and he was excellent. Love this place and will come back again.
Service and food perfect as usual and we will return
Make sure you get the clove bread and spicy calamari!
Food was fabulous our server Milan was exceptional overall an excellent experience highly recommended
Great server, excellent food and very accommodating with a last minute change to our reservation

What amazes me is the consistency of good service and great food quality, year after year.  Well done, and don't change.   The menu has enough for everyone, and the mains are delicious.   The desserts are equally so.  Wine list is good.  Service is also friendly and good.   The atmosphere is nice, and unique on the pier/wharf, with high ceilings and big windows.   The noise does build, but the high ceiling helps.  Prices are high-ish.   Best main:   Scallops in the pan, with bacon, mushroom, garlic, and cream sauce.   You will need some bread to soak it all up.

Seating at the bar is an experience you don't want to miss. Performance artistry in front of you as Chad opensand plates the shellfish. On a busy night they serve between 850-1000 oysters, so you know they are fresh. I had cherrystone clams, served right in front of me in the ice groove carved into the marble counter. My gracious server Anna was attentive, friendly, and took great care of a solo diner. The lobster and scallop mousseline was delicious and worth the premium pricing ( lobsters are very pricey these days). The Indian pudding dessert was delicious, a downhome taste from Maine holidays past. I would highly recommend Scales to locals and visitors alike.
First time in Portland and Scales and we will be back.  I had the halibut and my husband had a whole lobster. Everything was delicious!
It is a noisy atmosphere, very nice restaurant. The food was ok. I’m my opinion it’s pricy for what we got. Our waitress was amazing and had no problems answering our question.
Amazing dinner.  Oysters were the best I’ve ever had.  Every aspect of the meal was top notch - will definitely go back.
Great meal. Great service, thanks Ben!
We were celebrating a week of birthdays and everything was lovely! Our table even had a birthday card awaiting us.

We had to wait 15-20 minutes for our reservation.  Scales is so popular on a Friday night!  And it was very noisy!   It's the first time I got the Fish Stew.   While it was very tasty, I was disappointed that it did not have a single shrimp.  And if there were scallops, they were so tiny I didn't notice them.  No pasta or rice in this dish.   My husband got the fish & chips which are always good.   But the fries had a lot of slivers that weren't much to eat after frying.  The best thing was the butterscotch caramel popcorn sundae and the cocktails.  Fresh oysters ate always the best here!
Food was excellent, service was great, and the complimentary valet parking came in handy, when the parking garage next door was full!

We can always count on the team at Scales to make a special occasion extra special. Professional and personable service, creative and delicious menu. Our favorite Portland waterfront destination for a memorable evening.

We had a great meal and Bartender at Scales!
Overall a little loud inside however eating at the bar helped with the noise level!
Would recommend this restaurant!!
We came to Maine on holiday and dined at Scales on a busy night. We were not disappointed! Complex flavors and perfectly cooked meals. We loved it.
Excellent food, sitting at the bar was a great experience, we learned so much about all of the items on the menu and how they were prepared. Highly recommend

We were visiting Portland for three nights in mid May and I knew we wanted to eat at Scales. I made reservations at the bar as soon as our dates became available (2 months ahead). We were seated right away and our bartender, Guy, took excellent care of us. The place was buzzing with great energy.  We had a lovely bottle of Sao Joao sparkling Rose to start, plus a half dozen oysters. It is really cool when you sit at the bar that they just put ice in the trough in front of you so when it's time to clean up, they just whoosh the ice and shells down a hole in the counter. Also, they have a guy who is a "master shucker" who opens up oysters in no time. 
 We decided to order smaller plates and not a large meal, so we started off with the Ramp rolls. Oh my god they were good! Instead of getting dessert, we ordered another serving of the rolls. The Asparagus salad was dressed perfectly in a lovely lemon vinaigrette. The Tuna Tartare was so fresh, but preparation was just a little too much for us. It was hard to discern the tuna because the other ingredients were very flavor forward. Our seatmates offered a taste of their Brown Bread and it was fantastic. We've never had anything like that before. 
I highly recommend eating here and sitting at the bar. Fun times!
Our fish dishes were delicious, the oysters and the seared tuna were fresh and the convenience of valet parking is a plus.
Excellent service. All the food was delicious. Would definitely return.

We enjoy sitting at the bar for food and cocktails. Both are always delicious. Hard to find good clams right now. Scales had delicious clams on the half shell and steamed clams. Also can’t go wrong with the chowder. Bartenders are always friendly and helpful. We love everything about this place
Great restaurant for a special occasion. The food is amazing with great service.
Amazing, best restaurant in Portland by far! Everything was outstanding.

Amazing food, and some of the best seafood we’ve had in a while. Great and attentive service. It was very loud and had we not had a table in the back, it might have been a dealbreaker. Would recommend to anyone visiting Portland!
Saturday night. Packed. Noise level so high that you couldn’t enjoy the food or your companions. Smallish portions with high prices. Servers frazzled but nice. Took a while for food to come.
Scales is always so good. I had the black cod which was fantastic.

A must try in Portland! Great location by the water. Ambiance is beautiful with large windows looking at the water, fresh caught fish on display and open kitchen. Food is always so fresh and flavorful.
Had a great dinner on a Thursday night. Our server was friendly and knowledgeable. Food was delicious! Beautiful interior.
Food is good but not worth the price point, in my opinion. The service was fast and professional, and the atmosphere was lively. I would like to go again and try a different option on the menu.
Every little thing except the noise level was perfect.
Excellent seafood restaurant.  Great location, great service and delicious food.  Highly recommend.

The server was outstanding!  The hostesses were unwelcoming and snobby.   Attractive in appearance - they made us and others feel entitled to be there!!    And no Acknowledgemrny upon leaving.   Not  the representation you strive for ….Food was good but the portions have decreased.  Always noisy but it is part of the experience!

Wonderful meal and service . Loved sitting in the window and enjoying the beautiful waterfront outdoors .  Delicious halibut always my favorite . We also enjoyed the scallop entree and cauliflower appetizer and vegetable salad . Great cloverleaf rolls warm and buttery . We enjoyed a cappuccino and delightful chocolate tart for dessert. Our server was excellent and enjoyed a beautiful night out .

Had a wonderful dinner at scales May 7th. We did make a reservation a week and a half ahead. We were seated at a window table for four (even though we were only two) giving us plenty of room and great water view. Food and service were both excellent. We had the crab cakes appetizer - delicious and the seafood stew - the broth was addictive! And the seared scallops - delicious.
A great dinner.
The food was amazing but it was quite noisy. Service was excellent

Very loud.
Too many children.
Excellent food.
Lobster roll the absolute best.
Oysters freshest.
Such a fantastic dining experience along the waterfront! Amazing food and the service was phenomenal!! We will absolutely be back.
We were worried about sitting at the bar to celebrate our anniversary but it was perfect! It felt intimate, relaxing and inviting.
Prefer bar seating to be away from crowd but still enjoy people. Favorite bartender/waitperson is Patrick - easy manner, professional execution, sense of humor! We’ll be back.

We had the freshest oysters, the octopus melted in my mouth and my branzino was excellent. My husband said his scallops were delightful. The staff is so friendly and we made some friends in the lounge. Such a great experience!
I loved the oysters and steamed lobster. The broccolini was great too. Loved my wine too. Scales is always great!

Outstanding in all aspects.  We made a reservation for bar seating (all they had), but they were able to seat us at a table.  It was my wife’s birthday and they had a hand written card waiting for her.  She ordered a frappe for desert and the waiter brought it out with a candle on the side dish.  Oh yea, the apps and meals were outstanding also.  HIGHLY recommend the seafood stew.  Great food, ambiance and service.  Not cheap, but you get what you pay for at Scales.  Go there!
beautiful building right on the water. food was amazing. we got a steak and lobster my husband and I split but i feel like everyone in portland was there. and for good reason!
Great food great experience! We had the mussels and Halibut! Must try!

Superb!!  We were lucky to get a seat at the bar with a reservation and the place was hopping on a Tuesday night.  The service was spot on and the food was simply amazing.  We inquired about the grilled brown bread and decided we needed to try it and very happy that we did.   We selected the salt cod croquettes, haddock with morels,  brown butter halibut and the spring peas.  Simply outstanding!!  I only wish Scales was close to frequent it regularly.  Scales has a hospitable, precision and efficient operation that is a real standout with what it delivers.
Love all the food here!  There is a salad that changes with the season and it is always exquisite.  The fresh seafood is beyond compare - just delightful!
This is an incredible restaurant i am in Portland about 5 times a year and alway try to eat at scales
A wonderful experience whether you're a local or from away!

We've dined at Scales several time when we've visited Portland. The food is usually good. If you want to try the brown bread, be aware that the order consists of 3 small circles about 2 1/2' in diameter for the order. They should charge another dollar and add another slice, especially if a couple is sharing. It doesn't come with butter or any spread. Page was our server/bartender and the service was excellent. Thank you Page!
Best of the best and a perennial fav-o-rite with amazing staff and fantastic food!! 10 out of 10; highly recommend!
Great food, excellent service. Will be back again for sure. Try everything if you can! Cocktails above average, for sure. Loved it.
Seafood stew, ceviche, and icecream sundae were world class
Outstanding food with a broad variety of choices. Professional and friendly service, beautiful and modern style ambience. Highly recommended. Best choice
Great wine list.  Excellent food and service.  Amazingly fast!
Get the scallops, you wont be disappointed. Place is a bit loud but still enjoyable.

Chopped salad with vegetables was disappointing. There were hardly any vegetables in the salad: two radishes,  a few slivers of carrots, and two slices of cucumber! Branzino was good though I ordered because it mentioned artichokes. One or two slivers is hardly worth mentioning in item’s description. Pistachio dessert was good.
Everything was phenomenal! The food, the service, the ambiance, all perfect! Will be back and highly recommend to anyone looking for a nice dinner in Portland, ME.

Second time visiting Scales. First, free valet parking is a great perk. We made reservations for and sat at the bar and had the same bartender as last visit. Very personable and great attention to detail. Food is easily 5 stars. Oysters from Raw Bar were delicious, Seafood Stew and Seared Scallops are among the best seafood dishes we've ever had. Overall a great experience.
Fantastic experience! The staff is amazing, the atmosphere is fabulous and the food, delicious. We cannot speak highly enough of Scales. We will absolutely be back!

Scales went above and beyond to make this night special as it was my partners birthday. They set up a hand written note and a beautiful birthday desert and candle. The food was unbelievable, in fact, made us want to move to Portland immediately.
Oysters 10/10. Corn Bread 12/10. Scallops 11/10.

I always enjoy Scales.  They had scallops on the half shell on Thursday and they were delicious.  It was the first time I have had them on the half shell.  I ordered the Seafood Stew for probably the twelfth straight time, and it was great as always.  My server Patrick recommended I try the Swordfish next time, which I think I will do.

What a treat this restaurant is. The atmosphere is wonderful, the decor is very on point for a seaside restaurant. The food... Dear Lord the food was amazing. We decided to have several different appetizers so we could have many different things. All outstanding. We had bar seating (by reservation which is highly recommended) and our waitress was so fun, attentive and a pleasure to chat with.

This place blew my mind. The service was impeccable, like a well oiled machine. Ambiance beautiful. But nothing compares to the food. It was hands down one of the best meals I’ve had anywhere in ages. Highly recommend.
Was able to snag a reservation for two at the bar. Crab fritters to start. Very tasty. Grilled scallops. Absolutely delicious. Well prepared. Great service. Cozy atmosphere despite the crowd.
Wonderful atmosphere with excellent food and service.
Pretty good experience. Seafood good as you would imagine. Service ok.

We came 3 years ago menu IS EXACTLY THE SAME!
you need more creativity.Fish and shellfish such as scallops /salmon /branzino and halibut is a very common dish anywhere .There is hundreds of fish species in the world and locals for you to provide for customers from Maine and out of state like us .Overall it was good but we won’t return if it’s the same menu .

Kindest Regards 
The Rebbouh family

Food was just ok. I had the cornbread (good), crab fritters (ok), octopus (ok), and halibut (cooked perfectly, but the sauce was oil, and the hazelnut didn’t quite pair well). Service was very friendly and the place looked nice.
The food, ambience and view were outstanding. The waiter was very knowledgeable and courteous.
First time at Scales.  Excellent food and atmosphere and the service was great as well
Fantastic service- meal and ambiance. Everyone was incredibly nice and attentive. A bit pricey but it was a special occasion so it was worth it.
Went there to celebrate my birthday. Great food and drinks. Service was on point. Definitely will dine there again.

Late review, we dined in mid April '24...  We found Scales to be a great restaurant.  We reserved bar seating, when we come back we'll just opt for a table...  I had a pan seared cod special which was excellent.  My wife had the Seafood Stew which was also excellent.  Both entrees had seafood that was clearly exceptionally fresh and well prepared.  Despite being quite full from dinner, our very attentive server/bartender made the case for a dessert which was a Passionfruit/Coconut mousse cake.  We were interested based on his description.  After sharing it we were fully impressed.  I looked recently and didn't see it on the menu, try it if it comes back.  Not really sweet and very flavorful.

I've eaten at Scales several times now, and the food quality is absolutely excellent!  If the food quality remains the same I will keep coming back here for a long, long time. The creativity of the kitchen staff and their ingenuity in pairing ingredients is a joy to experience.  The servers are friendly and knowledgeable, and appear to enjoy being a part of the restaurant.  Another huge plus is the valet parking, especially when parking in Portland for dinner is colossal pain in the neck (or a complete rip-off).  The only two things that could stand to be improved is 1) the noise level - this is definitely a noisy restaurant . And 2) the hostess is one of the most cold, pretentious people I have met in a very long time.  There is very little about her that is welcoming.  However, despite her off-putting behavior and attitude, as long as the food remains excellent I will keep coming back.
Scales never disappoints. Food was great.. The Scallops were amazing, the Baked Haddock was fantastic.

The clam chowder was overwhelmed by the corn flavor, more of a vegetable chowder than a seafood chowder. The haddock was quite tasty as were the scallops. The portions were so small that we left hungry.

This is our third time at Scales, so we’re very familiar with how the staff does their best to rush you through dinner to turn over the tables quickly. We’ve learned to order a drink. Almost finish it, then an appetizer…almost finish it, etc. If not, your appetizer will arrive after the first or second sip of your drink and you will end up with an unfinished cocktail, two bites of your salad/appetizer and the entree on the table getting cold. This actually happened the first two times we ate at Scales, but now we know better.
Last night, my wife, who has celiac and therefore must have gluten free meals, asked our waiter what was gluten free since unlike most menus these days, there is no GF, vegan, or vegetarian designation on the menu. His response was, “you can read the menu and pretty much see if anything is gluten free”! BTW there was one appetizer, two entrees and no desserts that were GF.
My son asked to have a baked potato instead of the fingerling potatoes that came with the halibut. Our waiter’s response…”no substitutions are allowed…I know, it’s crazy, but those are the kitchen’s rules”. Fortunately, my wife said how about you just bring him a baked potato and we’ll pay extra for it which he agreed should be acceptable. The charge was $12.50 on our $500 bill for four (4) people.
We won’t be back as there are just too many alternatives in the Portland area including Sam Hayward’s Fore Street where we have never encountered this pretentious attitude. Bye Scales.

Very nice experience eating at the bar on a Saturday night with a friend for our first visit there. The bartender was engaging & helpful with good suggestions.  We had the highly rated Cloverleaf garlic rolls & they did not disappoint-- sinfully yummy.  Cocktails were creative & tasty.  My friend & I shared the halibut ceviche appetizer which was a lovely blend of tastes.   We both were delighted to find that the bartender was very encouraging about their ability to accommodate dietary requirements-- I had the grilled scallops but without cream as I am dairy intolerant & it was still a wonderful dish. My friend had the halibut, but without the hazelnuts & enjoyed it immensely.  We did not have dessert-- we were too full!  And I brought some of my meal home to have for lunch the next day!
Delicious food, great atmosphere, and excellent service

Always an exceptional dining experience at scales… Whether you have to wait five 1015 or 20 minutes to get your table or the bar seating it’s well worth it as they have areas for you to sit while you can get a cocktail and also oysters if you desire… Once you seated from the usual menu to the additions for the evening beyond exceptional between service and atmosphere, always a great experience
Excellent dinner here.  Great, varied menu and great service.

I had a fantastic meal at Scales. Started with a Portland Tea Party cocktail in their lounge before being seated for dinner (heads up, you need to close out the drink ticket before leaving the lounge area!). I had the Baked Haddock with Morel mushrooms, salsify, and spring onions in a fumet cream - props to the waitress Charlotte who nudged me away from getting the steamed lobster in favor of one of their truly in-house recipes. Rather than get dessert, I had a half-dozen oysters with a Fire in the Sky cocktail. The overall vibe was bustling and cheerful, and I thoroughly enjoyed the entire evening. Depending on your personal budget, it might be a rather high final total, but I fully endorse it being worth every penny. Would love to go back!

Scales is my favorite for celebrations.  The food, including a scallop and poached lobster ceviche appetizer special, was uniformly delicious.  The staff is the perfect combination of professional, kind and relaxed.  Makes for a wonderful experience.
Great food, excellent service, reasonable prices, but it is loud during dinner.

We had a vegetarian join our group business dinner and were very disappointed that there were very few options of appetizers and no entrees that could be made without meat or fish.  I even reached out to the restaurant earlier in the day to see if they had anything they could prepare and was told that they only have what is on the menu.  My business guest was able to eat bread and a salad and the fried cauliflower appetizer and a side vegetable, which in the end was enough food, but very cobbled together.  Scales had a pasta on special that had pork belly, and we asked if it could be made without pork belly and were told no. (I understand that it may have been added to the whole batch ahead of time.)  It would be reasonable to expect a high-end restaurant, at the prices they charge, to have at least ONE entree that can be made to be vegetarian.
Other than this, had, as always, a lovely dinner, great food, beautiful space (but wish they could put some sun shades up to block that evening sun the face!!)
Food and service were excellent. My only complaint was the entree portions were small.
Such good food and service! The staff is well experienced and polite. Our server made helpful recommendations for both drinks and food. We will definitely be back!

Loved that they had a little lounge area while you wait! And the staff was excellent - on top of everything it seemed! Food was kind of disappointing- chowder, although “Maine” chowder so it was thinner than “New England” clam chowder tasted excellent but literally the only thing actually in it was onions - a lot of them. No clams at all. The rest of the food was pretty tasty but very small portions for the value and the quality didn’t really make up for it. The place was gorgeous and the staff were wonderful, but I wouldn’t go back.

We stopped by Scales before a show at the Merrill auditorium. Everything was so good! I definitely recommend the cloverleaf rolls and lobster roll. One of the best lobster rolls l've ever had! YUM. The bun was perfectly buttery and toasty. The restaurant itself is also really nice looking inside. Great vibes overall. Definitely make a reservation at least a month in advance to get a good time slot.

We had a delicious dinner and service was excellent. The green salad had a fabulous dressing. The anadama bread with  molasses was outstanding and the halibut with fingerling potatoes melted in my mouth.

Our only disappointment was that the sundae with caramel sauce won’t be available til the summer menu. We loved it the last time we were in and really were looking forward to enjoying it once again.
Such a great experience. Still thinking about the halibut and the dessert moscato!

On the pricey side, but not too bad! Amazing staff. Just went for our anniversary, and every staff from the hostess, seater, waiter and bar tender all were told it was our anniversary and remembered. You also know the food is great when you go on a Monday night and the place is packed! So happy we made reservations!

Consistent excellence every time, Scales is one of our top three most loved Portland restaurants. Top quality staff, service, ambiance, views, and of course food! Wish they offered smaller, less heavy desserts, and I did not enjoy my salad, but the Fisherman’s Stew was wonderful enough to make me forget both.
Beautiful views, great food with good-sized portions!
Maybe top ten seafood places in US. Would like to see the menu change up a bit since we go so often but damn they do a good job
Great fresh seafood with exceptional service.  Never disappoints!
Our server was incredibly gracious in making the birthday party for my husband a festive occasion. We loved the food and the atmosphere, and will return often.
Wonderful everything.  Meal was amazing from start to finish
Scales is our favorite Portland restaurant. Once again, they exceeded expectations.
Delicious - so enjoyed dinner! Lovely atmosphere and wait staff!

The dining experience was one of the best I have ever had in my short 26 years. All of the food was extraordinary, the mussels were cooked to perfection. The lobster was roasted in an amazing chili blend that they had covering the lobster
Scales never disappoints. Exceptionally fresh seafood, professional service and a great valet team. This is our favorite seafood spot in Portland.
Loved the special that night--Cod with Sicilian Couscous...keep it on the menu!
Freshest local oysters around and wonderfully creative special items along with exceptional friendly service reinforces why I consider Scales one of the best dining experiences in Portland.
The most amazing meal I have had. The service was fantastic and the food was beyond anything I have eaten before. So flavorful and delicious.
We sat at the bar and had a fabulous experience. The octopus appetizer was wonderful.
Everything about it was great - food was delicious, service friendly. Loved it!

Our anniversary was acknowledged both by the greeter and the bartender (we reserved for the bar). After the warm welcome, things only got better. Our server/bartender provided great recommendations and the chefs delivered. Outstanding flavors, fresh seafood, good portions. We didn’t regret our choice to try something different than our usual go-to, Fore Street. Still like Fore Street but will definitely return to Scales when we’re after a larger seafood menu.
Excellent food the quality was outstanding, and our waiter. Caleb was a delight.

Outstanding in every respect. We sat at the bar and the bartender was great.  We octopus for an appetizer, cooked to perfection and offered with a delicious chili sauce.  The main course I had the halibut, again cooked to perfection, hubby had the scallops.  The scallops were in a sweet potato cream, amAzIng!  Dessert we had Indian pudding, again did not disappoint.  Can’t wait to go again!
We loved everything. Sandra our server was excellent. Thank you.

Food was fresh and presented beautifully. The oysters were perfect and other apps were unique and delicious.
We reserved letting the restaurant know we were celebrating a kids birthday with family. We received a nice card at the table and in a beautiful part of the restaurant. We were surprised that no accommodations could be made to any of the meals for a kids palette- in addition to no kids options. My daughter loves steak (whose birthday it was) and it came out so spicy and sauced she didn’t eat it. Same w another teenager in our party. The wait staff seemed bothered we were there despite us spending over $600 in less than 2 hours. Very disappointed after a lot of anticipation.

Scallops, dessert, and sablefish pate were all delicious and well worth the price. Service was perfect - not hovering but there always when needed. Disappointed in swordfish - very salty, small portion for the money.
Amazing seafood and nice atmosphere. Highly recommend the Branzino as well as their oysters, very tasty and fresh.

We felt the waiter was trying to rush us and we just got there
Did not like his demeanor

Our dinner at Scales was outstanding.  The tuna tartare was served with a miyaki mushroom/miso coulis.  The tuna was so fresh, the coulis delicious and very unusual.  Halibut and scallop main courses were also delicious — expertly prepared with very distinctive sauces.  For dessert we had a delicious chocolate tart with a brown butter pecan frozen custard and creme anglaise. Delicious!  I rated the meal a 4 on value because it was quite expensive.  That said, it was worth the money for us for a special occasion dinner.
Bad vibes. The bartender not up to par and not friendly or knowledgeable.
Delicious food, great atmosphere, excellent selection

Great atmosphere, wonderful staff but food is overrated. Halibut ceviche was a big piece of fish instead of usually sliced pieces. It was tough and a bit fishy and didn’t seem marinated long enough. Tuna tartare tasted salty, like it was smoked. Halibuts main course was very greasy.
Always reliably good. We were in a hurry this time and our waiter was extremely accommodating getting us out in time for a show. Oysters, Bronzino, lobster - couldn’t go wrong!
Delicious fish and fresh seafood. We loved our dining experience as usual at Scales. We tried the clover rolls , salads , oysters , and haddock and chowder . Great wines and cocktails .
The food, as always, was superb. This was our first time eating at the actual bar itself - the service was excellent.

Absolutely one of the best meals we’ve had in decades.  The halibut was cooked perfectly and the seafood stew was had enough broth without overpowering the dish. Our server, Sandra, was attentive but also gave us plenty of space to have a romantic dinner.  We can't wait to come back.
Excellent food,service and ambience.   Will definitely eat here again

The pace of food delivery was uneven. The apps arrived unusually fast, then the wait between apps and the entrees seemed excessive. Some of the greens in the salad had brown spots and the very tough root of the greens was was not trimmed properly. Otherwise, the food was very good. Overall it was a good experience, but we weren't blown away.

Staff was friendly and efficient. Food was very good and desserts decadent.
Cocktails were well balanced.
Nice views of the wharf. A bit noisy as the evening went on.
We had an absolutely delicious meal while away for the weekend. The food and service were fantastic! We would definitely return and highly recommend to others .
Waitstaff is outstanding. Food is great, very good vibe in the restaurant. Would recommend
My friends and I had a great time at Scales! The food and drinks were amazing. Our waiter was knowledgeable and very friendly. I’m excited to go back!

Outstanding food and service. Beautiful dining area. We will be back again
Thank you
Tuna crudo appetizer was spectacular. Everything was top notch. Bartender was excellent as well.

Spectacular as always. The chu toro special was fantastic, I’m glad my husband and I got one each so we didn’t had to share :). Great cocktails amazing food and always fun. Love this place. Coming back today again with a friend.

We make it a point to always come to Scales when we visit Portland.  The bread is delicious, the entrees always perfectly prepared and the desserts interesting, fun and a wonderful way to end an enjoyable meal.  The service has been above and beyond on each visit.  Will definitely return.

Scales NEVER disappoints. Adam & his team always provide A+ service and the kitchen is a finely tuned machine of culinary excellence. Last night was no exception - perfectly prepared food served in a wonderful restaurant environment that was full - yet didn’t feel crowded. My only complaint - please, please, please bring back the Baked Alaska dessert from year’s past.
This was my second time at Scales.  I love this restaurant! My friend always tries the specials and I stick with the menu.  Both are deliscious!
Excellent food, friendly and professional staff, our waiter Duncan was awesome. Highly recommend.

Raw bar was exceptional! But I ordered the special for dinner and they were already out….it was only 6:30 pm. My second choice was salmon…I’ve had better. I think it was over cooked. The noise level was very high.
Amazing service , good , cocktails .. everything!!!  Bar seating is the best , loved the presentation for the oysters !
Five stars all around.  Was my first time there (visiting from out of town) but absolutely won’t be my last.
Outstanding experience all around!  The clam chowder was authentic, favorable and light.  Superb haddock entree, outstanding flavors!   Would recommend to anyone!
Main bartender was a little to chummy with my wife.

We had a fantastic evening sitting at the bar celebrating my husband’s birthday day. The bartender and servers were very knowledgeable and kind. The halibut and ribeye was delicious. We will be back real soon.

Second time there, great spot. Not the same old dishes everyone else serves.
Service was friendly and not intrusive. Meals came out quickly and hot. Plenty of parking in town.

A most pleasant evening all around. Everyone in the party was very pleased with their various menu selections, both appetizers and Maine courses. The server, Sandra, could not have been more personable, attentive and knowledgeable about the menu items. The valet service was appreciated and the valet was very courteous and friendly.
Delicious but noisy. Great cocktail. Wonderful server. Should give free dessert for special occasions. Most other restaurants do. It was my birthday and you should have given me a slice of cake.
Always a great experience. Ben is an excellent waiter.

Have dined here often and this will probably prove to be the last time.  Fried clams are under cooked, so not crispy, and dripping with oil as if they were cooked in a hurry.  French fries are fine.  Fish Stew cam with a spoon but the  soup was so reduced there was no need for a spoon.  There was almost no fish in the soup only clams, mussels, and a few bits of calamari.  Very tasty but not a meal.  Mixed salad was very good.  Noise level makes normal conversation impossible.  Streaks are good.  Overall the food is not made with love.  Service is very good.
One of the best meals of my life: great wine, great food, great dessert. Staff was also lovely. I can’t wait to return.
One of the best meals I have ever had the pleasure of eating!
We had an amazing experience - definitely check it out

Excellent food and excellent service!
We enjoyed our Anniversary dinner at Scales. Don’t miss the crab fritters and the sticky toffee pudding for dessert!
Soooo good!
Everything about this restaurant was great, and we will most definitely come again!

For such upscale prices, the question always comes down to would you return?  We would not.  We found the food variable:  Apps:  sablefish pate was delicious, the seared tuna was not special (over seared, sauce overpowering) , and portion size small for the price.  Entrees: halibut good, but quite small for $44, fish stew very tasty but again on the small side.  Wines were a generous pour.  Having reserved weeks ahead, we weren’t pleased with our two top either.  There were empty four tops, and no need to sit parties so close on a Wednesday evening at 5:45.  Valet parker was warm and cordial.  Receptionists were aloof and not particularly welcoming. (“How can we help you?” is an odd way to greet patrons.). Waitress was attentive and expert.  At the price point, the misses outweighed the hits.

We had a lovely evening at Scales! The food was excellent and the atmosphere was really nice - very open but not noisy, pretty, warm wood, and a great view out the window. And the nicest server, Chris.
We will definitely go back.

Scales never disappoints. The food and service are phenomenal, we try to visit every time we’re in Portland. Every bite was delicious! The bartenders were so friendly and welcoming. We had the salmon rilletes special, citrus salad, the swordfish and hasselback potato. All off the charts. It was packed on a cold winter evening. Can't wait to go back!
A wonderful restaurant with terrific food, great and friendly service and a superb wine list.   The only downside is that it can be very loud, when full.
Always a great meal at Scales. Staff is very professional and knowledgeable. Food is always on point .
Great place for fantastic food and friendly service. This is my third time visiting Portland and I always eat at Scales when I’m in town.

We travel to Portland every few months just to eat at Scales. We have other restaurants we love in Portland, but Scales is always the highlight of our trip. Excellent food and service! Couldn’t recommend a more consistently excellent experience.
This is my favorite place.  Whenever my partner and I have a special occasion to really celebrate we go here.
We came for our anniversary and enjoyed a wonderful dinner at the bar. Service was quick and friendly, drinks were made perfectly, and our food was fresh and flavorful. Can’t ask for more!
Nice looking place - solid food up to par with Portland’s food scene and attentive staff. Piercingly loud space - no attention to how the room fills with sound. It’s like eating in a beer hall.

Scales seafood is exceptional, very fresh and prepared deliciously. The sides are a nice accompaniment to your meals with enough to share! The attentiveness of all the staff and their teamwork makes for an enjoyable time! Thank you!😊

This was truly a beautiful experience to have with my husband. The appetizers were delightful, we got the crab fritters which were so crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside and we also got the chive butter clove rolls. For dinner my husband got the bacon and scallops and he himself said they were the best scallops he’s had. Cooked to perfection. I got the halibut and let me tell you all, absolutely amazing. The flavors of the browned butter, lemon and hazelnuts, perfect. 
Truly a beautiful experience.
Fantastic food. Oysters were some of the best I ever had. Highly recommend.

From the drinks, to the Cloverleaf rolls, Tuna Tartare, entrees, and dessert, everything is as good or better than anything in town. As with every restaurant in this group, the service is impeccable. Lastly, compared to other places, they have not jacked their prices through the roof.

This was my second dinner at Scales, and we are already looking at when we can go back.
Main course ( halibut) was too heavy with the salt

A bit noisy, but food was so delicious and its very popular so it’s understandable. We had a wonderful meal - the only suggestion would be to deliver appetizers all together… it’s a bit awkward when some people at the table don’t have their food while others are waiting and theirs is getting cold.
We go to Scales for Valentine's every year. Always perfect
great food, great servers, wonderful place to eat. Mr. Street and his group in all his restaurants do a suburb job. I have never had a bad experience or bad food
great food, slightly noisy but not horrible. a bit pricey but again great food and location.

We had a nice meal. 
Our server was efficient and attentive.
My meal was excellent 
My wife’s meal was unfortunately very salty.  This was unusual and surprising.
Top notch food & service. We have not had an experience this good in a while. Very impressive!
Best restaurant not only in Portland but anywhere!  Only minor issue is the prices, somewhat pricey but worth it.
Very loud for an upscale dining venue small portions

The food is outstanding! We ordered four different dishes and all were delicious and cooked to perfection. Incredible wine list and decor. The staff is thoughtful, friendly, knowledgeable and make the experience even better. We traveled from Boston for the second time in 6 months just to have dinner here! If you have never been you should run. Make reservations at least 2 months ahead. Yes, it is that good!
My Wife's fish was  significantly under cooked and the service was great
I always love my experience at Scales. Our food & drinks were incredible, and we had a lovely server!
The food did not disappoint. Will definitely be back.

Alexis was an absolute dream server. She was knowledgeable about the menu, guided us through pacing courses and ordering. She listened to our dining style and helped us navigate the menu for the perfect evening. What a lovely dining experience.
Amazing as always.  Staff is great and super accommodating.

We had a delightful evening celebrating my birthday! We started with amazing oysters. Then fried oysters & cod croquettes for appetizers. Entrees were halibut, swordfish & scallops all delicious. Our server was great & and recommended her two favorite desserts, which did not disappoint. We will definitely be back.

Took guests to Scales for dinner Thursday and we all had different entrees that were delicious. Sofia provided first class service. A very memorable evening. In fact it was so good we’re all going again tonight.
Paul Hood
Excellent food.  Great server.  Great wine list.  great ambiance. Bar closes too early.
Fantastic dinner at the bar.  Incredible food & service from Duncan.  All the staff seemed to enjoy their jobs which was nice to see.  Lived the vibe. Will definitely be back next time in Portland!

6 people for dinner. We had apps: cloverleaf rolls, oysters on half shell, octopus, clam chowder-all delish. Entrees: scallops,halibut, steak, lobster- all delish.

Still a noisy place, but we enjoyed the evening.

Scales has changed but not for the better. We used to say “we’ve never had a bad meal at Scales, but that changed last night. Of six meals, two were bad, two were less than ok and two were ok. For example, the pan fried lobster came lathered in a non de script brown sauce that   over whelmed the fine lobster flavor. It was a mess to eat. A few months ago this was an excellent entree. Something has changed.
Also, the noise level has always been high but it seemed well above the tolerable bevel last night. Unfortunately we have scratched Scales for our favorite places to dine.

Pretty, cozy space; delicious food well prepared; impeccable service (thank you, Chris!), all topped off with a nice view. Was hard to choose from among so many great dining options in Portland; very happy we selected Scales.
Wait service was excellent, food extremely rich / lots of cream & butter. Tasty, not necessarily healthy (for seafood).
Wonderful as usual . Server was personable and just attentive enough as to not be bothersome. Food was excellent. We probably should have skipped dessert- we were just too full to appreciate
Beautiful, cozy, delicious. A perfect spot for family or romantic date.
My wife and I fly to Portland every year from Atlanta and always dine at Scales. We've never had a complaint. Everything has always been excellent.

When I made the reservation, there was a prompt for special occasions. I mentioned that we were celebrating a birthday. When we arrived at our table there was a handwritten birthday note, such a special touch. I know that my husband was concerned that there might be some sort of loud presentation of a dessert at the end of the meal, which did not happen - he was thankful! Our server was lovely and efficient. We will return again.
Excellent experience. My first time at Scales and everything was delicious and service was great! Will be back soon! I tried oysters for the first time and I’m hooked 😊

A friend recommended that we try scales. We are so glad that we did. The food was phenomenal and service was great. Best mussels we have ever had, the champagne sauce for the oysters was delicious and our main dinners- scallops and salmon were delicious. It will be a part of our stay in Portland every time we come here.
Amazing meal. Spectacular seafood. Go here for sure.
the food is superb, the wait staff works as a seamless team. the ambient high noise level is one area that needs correction. it c an be hard to have a conversation
Fabulous food!! Excellent service!  Definitely would recommend it!!
We love Scales. Beautiful atmosphere, great waitstaff and excellent food!
We went to Scales for our anniversary and could not have had a more satisfying experience.

Overall good vibes!  We tried a lot because we all shared!  From clover garlic rolls to opera cake!  Our entrees were mostly good.  I think the steak was salty and luke warm, the haddock was the best followed by the halibut.  However the halibut ceviche was delish!  Cocktails were good and the ambiance and vibe was great!

Loved Scales
The Food and Ambiance were amazing!
We will definitely go again
Found the fish and chips disappointing.  The fish was almost mushy inside soggy batter.  My wife had the halibut dish which she loved.
Despite having to wait a bit (res for 645.. sat 7:05) everything was fantastic as always. They sent an app our way for our patience. Scales checks all the boxes, every single time.
We had a wonderful dinner! Food was delicious and waitstaff was great. We definitely recommend Scales!
One of the best dining experiences we have had in last few years.

Cloverleaf rolls were amazing and went so well with the clam chowder. Halibut and seafood stew were delicious, I would have liked a few more clams (than 3) in the seafood stew but that’s my only complaint. Don’t skip the octopus appetizer either! We sat at the bar and the bartender was so friendly. Great service and can’t wait to return!

Asked For special seating For a birthday celebration. We were put in the backcorner by the bathroom next to huge, noisy crowd in 3,4 combined tables.
After complain we were moved to a-much better place. Thank you for that.

Food rather uninteresting and mussels too small to bother to serve!!!

Have been there lately maybe too several times, and will now not go for awhile at least
Would recommend WITH caution!
We eat at Scales twice a month, so many wonderful choices. Last night, oysters, halibut ceviche and the grilled branzino - all perfect.
The food was absolutely delicious… a beautiful presentation! I would definitely come back again…
Great food, great service.  My go to place in Portland.
Excellent food!  Service was less than par this visit.
great location, great food and great service. Hostess was friendly and attentive

Went for anniversary dinner. All the staff that we interacted with acknowledged our anniversary. Very nice touch. Food was amazing and I will be telling everyone about it for weeks. Will be coming back on next Portland visit.
Scales is a very inviting place with excellent food and a nice variety of wines.  Our waitress was exceptional and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  looking forward to dining there again soon!
Celebrated our anniversary. The food and atmosphere did not disappoint.
Excellent seafood & service - not to be missed!
We had a wonderful dinner at Scales. Great food. Wonderful staff. Nice place.
As always this place does not disappoint.  The service is excellent and it is by far the best seafood in the country.

Food is always phenomenal here, so worth it! Living in Maine sometimes it’s hard to find truly phenomenal food but at scales?! Always a 10/10! Would recommend to anyone. My fiancé and I always celebrate milestones here
great yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
Wonderful experience! Well done. We’ll be back again!

We love Scales, and the winter salad we had was stupendous and they always do such a great job with oysters and fish.  Stick with that and you will get a 5 star meal!  I tried the duck this time and it was over-seasoned, greasy, and disappointing.  We will go back, it's such a great experience, but sometimes the line chefs are a bit heavy handed with the salt and cream.

Absolutely wonderful in every category!
Top of the list of restaurants in Portland.
Thank you!

Went here for a brithday and it was amazing. All of the staff were attentive and helpful, drinks were great, food was delicious! And the inside was very cozy. We were worried it would be a little cold on the pier but it was nice and toasty. Can't wait to go back to try the stew.

Outstanding in every possible way. Food was fresh and utterly delicious. The clover leaf rolls as a starter: positively mind blowing. Haddock and halibut main courses : memorably full of flavor. Old-fashioned and the banana “daiquiri”are wonderful cocktails. Don’t pass up dessert, if you have room. The kitchen should bring back their to the menu the butterscotch sundae. Meredith was our server. Give her an award.
Sat at the bar, service was fantastic! Food was really good, especially the octopus appetizer.
First time to Scales but definitely not our last! Maybe the best foodie experience we’ve ever had.
Food and service were great as always.  The only negative is the noise level.  But, all in all well worth it.

Scales never disappoints!  Whenever we are in Portland, Scales is a must.  The food and drinks are delicious, the staff is fun, polite, always smiling!  Energetic and welcoming atmosphere.  If you haven't been, give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

Oustanding!  Early reservation, seated immediately and was waited on immediately.  Friendly, helpful and what a well run restaurant.  Beautiful room and seating along the winds looking out on the water with a light snow falling. Magical!

Scales is a terrific dining experience every time! The service was exceptional.  Our meals were extremely well prepared, delicious with a wonderful presentation. We loved the cocktails! The broccolini side dish was simply divine!  I don’t think I’ve ever felt compelled to comment on a side dish—amazing! The noice level definitely poses a challenge for dinner conversation, but a sacrifice worth making for the meal.

Loved our appetizers - best mussels and those rolls are crazy good. Very salty scallop entree - took away from the overall high quality of the rest of the experience. Fun atmosphere but didn’t love our table sandwiched in the middle - too close to other two-tops

We had a great experience here. Excellent service and the food and drinks were fabulous! I loved that they had vegan and non-vegan options so everyone in our party could enjoy the food. I'll definitely go back.
Great food , lots of fun types of tacos, great service, amazing drinks !!
Bird and Co., never disappoints...We always have a great experience.

Went for brunch with our pups, enjoying the dog-friendly outdoor area. Our reservation was for later but they were happy to accommodate us earlier. Service was friendly and the food was really good. I had the Bird Benny and my husband had the California tacos. We shared some chips and queso. The chips and the tortillas appeared to be made in house... so good! The brunch cocktails were also very good.

This was my second visit to Bird & Co and I loved it just as much as the first time (earlier this week)!  Everything we ordered was delicious (drinks, appetizer, 4 different tacos) and they were served quickly.  Even better, we couldn't believe how reasonable the price was for the amount and quality of food we had.  It's my new favorite place without a doubt!

Wonderful experience with our server Ashley.
Fun and energetic neighborhood place that was packed with locals and tourists .
We had fish tacos, a cubano taco and the house taco. All were excellent and vibrant tasting. Best tacos I have had.
Drinks were great too including a margarita and something called a 539 which was a watermelon juice base with gin and Prosecco.
A great find and I encourage you to take a ride away from Old Port to try a place the locals go to.
Excellent food but very slow to arrive - took 1 hour from ordering. Service was slow and not very friendly or attentive.

Our table was ready and we were sat right away.  The restaurant was very busy and our party of 8 was all very happy with the service, patience with our ordering, and quality of food and drinks.  The prices were great and we did not feel rushed. It was a wonderful evening for all.
We had a great meal with great service. Superior Margaritas and the tacos were delicious and well designed. Super friendly and great chill vibe.

We really enjoyed our evening at Bird &Co. The food was very good, as were our jalapeño margaritas. The menu had a great variety of different tacos.  Great for meat eaters and vegetarians.  We thought it was a good value also.  Will definitely be back.
Great service and atmosphere. Pricing is a bit high though, albeit comparable to the area
Always a favorite! The outdoor seating is such a gem. Always solid food and service.
Best tacos ever! We didn't get our beers until well after our queso and chips app arrived which was my only complaint. Definitely going back!

Delicious and wonderful taco combinations . Always one of our favorite spots to go with our young adult children for dinner. Love the  apps elotes and the guac is yummy as well as the brussel sprouts and queso . Great margaritas and beer choices . Fun to sit on the patio on a nice evening . Always a great evening at Bird Taco !
Great atmosphere... great mexican style food.   Creative menu-  seafood and non-seafood options
Food excellent! Super service! We'll be returning soon!
Always great food and Margaritas! Service was great.

Host was great— super friendly, seated us and got us waters, utensils and napkins.
