Waitress was so flat— seemed to want to just get through her day… waited awhile to get water… had a different restaurants shirt on… slow to check on us after our food( we were done when she came back). Food was not hot, wasn’t cold either but definitely was sitting out a bit before coming to our table. I’ve had better overall experiences here for sure. For the price, and with similar places who nail it every time not sure we’ll be back soon.
3 of us had a reservation and we were seated immediately. Our server Victoria was amazing and she made our experience awesome. Food and drinks were delicious. Highly recommend!!!
Great food and drinks! Tacos are always consistently good and filling. Loved my margarita.

Delicious tacos so fun and fresh and inventive combinations . I don’t think you can go wrong with any of the tacos. Love doing the fish taco blackened  ,the Bahn mi always a favorite , street corn chicken yummy . We love the Brussel sprouts and  great guac and chips . Wonderful beers and margs and fun cocktail menu . One of our favorite taco spots also has a great weekend brunch .
Our first time here, but everything was great!! Food was delicious !!
I was a little underwhelmed with the food. I usually get the salad and love it. It was not so great and they forgot my tofu. The waiter was great and took it off my bill.
Delicious as always, took a little too long to pay the bill so we ended up leaving cash which wasn’t what we wanted, but we had to get going to pick up kids from practice
I absolutely love this place. Amazing brunch options. The staff are next level. Love, love, love.
Our waiter was top notch. Will be back bc of him! Thank you

The service is amazing and the food is very diverse in flavor profiles. Everything from the kitchen is an amazing experience in flavor and style. We’ve tried it all and have loved everything. Get reservations, it fills up fast, but any wait is totally worth it. The drinks are inventive and the traditional drinks are made with heart. Definitely a local favorite.

We ordered Brussels sprouts as an appetizer and waited and waited and they never came. Finally our tacos arrived and when we asked about the Brussels the server looked us blankly. I said never mind, we don’t want them anymore. One of us ordered the Elote (corn) and got an Elote taco instead. Again, when we told the server it wasn’t right, she just stared at us. No apology, no offer to bring the corn. Nothing. The bill came and she basically threw it at the table.
I understand that it’s a popular place and very busy but we certainly didn’t feel the love. Maybe they know since the food is good they don’t have to worry about the service? I don’t want to generalize since it was just one server. Maybe she was just having a bad day. It happens.
Absolutely love that I can get a vegan brunch & a mocktail, and it’s all delicious!! There’s actual choices and it’s hard to make a decision. In a good way!!
Amazing food and service, as always.   The best drinks too!

Yummy margs and tacos! Tiny place
Good service! A fun date night!
great happy hour, food very good and reasonable.Help friendly  and hard working.
Went for brunch as a party of 6. Drink service was fast, margaritas were excellent. Food was tasty, tacos were a good size and value.

First visit.  I ordered three different tacos:  chicken Diablo, Tijuana, and fish.  I've spent a lot of years in CA.  These aren't typical tacos, but the flavor is delicious!  A unique taco dining experience and I will be returning!
Queso 10/10. Had some great margaritas and tacos were on point. Can’t wait to go back.

The food is very creative and good. It has flavors for everyone in the group. Drinks are amazing as well. The staff is friendly and very attentive. Best to get reservations, this little gem is becoming very popular!
The tacos and margaritas were yummy and reasonably priced.  Kind of small but well worth it for such high quality food and service.  Will definitely go back.
Amazing food and drinks!

This is one of our fav restaurants in all of Portland but brunch fell short of our expectations. Food was just okay. The mimosa pints were great though! Def wouldn’t be back for brunch but the experience won
Again, we had tacos at Bird and Co and wow they are good. The pork with mustard and pickles is really good, really good. I wished I had ordered 3. The drinks are excellent. Thanks for being there.

The tacos are undefeated
Margaritas elite
Chips and queso top tier

What more can one want?
10/10
We had a rez for 6:45 and the food came out at 7:50 and it was cold (like it had been sitting for a while). Our first experience there was great but this one definitely wasn’t. Can’t win ‘em all
Always such great food and service at Bird & Co. My brunch go-to is always the huevos rancheros, but everything is excellent. Staff is always super friendly even when super busy. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Loved this spot! The food was delicious, they easily accommodated my food allergy and I loved that they had a variety of options for mocktails and vegan food. I'll definitely go back here again!
Had lunch for my son’s bday, always great tacos and margaritas!

Bird is one of our favorite spots in Portland.  Great value for the money.  Tacos are super tasty.  Bummed they did away with the fried avocado taco but 🤷🏽.  Didn’t love the cauliflower creation.  However, the vegetarian taquitos, Polo Diablo & Cubano were excellent!  Our server was top notch even though they were super busy.  Lively, great music, overall awesome!
Delicious food, generous portions, friendly service and great drinks. A wonderful after-work stop!
Wicked cute and great food. Really appreciated that they have a good amount of mocktails on the menu too.

Nick Deering was a great server- and everyone pitches in like a family!
Fantastic food! We will eat here again next time we are in Portland!
Thanks guys! Outstanding!
The Lamb Tinga Taco and the Ribs were absolutely phenomenal.  Bacon and Brie Taco was excellent.  Mexican Cold Brew Coffee is awesome.
Excellent service, food was outstanding, margaritas exceptional, very reasonable prices.
Happy to find vegan options which were very tasty. Great that they accept reservations too!  Excellent service, we will be back!

Bird & Co was an awesome little Mexi-taco restaurant/bar. The food was awesome, the waitresses friendly and helpful but the noise level was pretty high and the room was cold despite the curtain at the door which was rarely closed all the way. We will definitely come back again in warmer weather.
Delicious vegan French toast!! So appreciate several vegan options. The margaritas were wonderful and our girls (aged 14 and 8) really enjoyed their meals and fancy drinks l, too. Will be back soon!
Great food, packed, cozy atmosphere. Service checks after entree could be better.

Food was delicious, as always. Ordered the Fried Pollo Diablo taco and I’m pretty sure they forgot the Diablo part of that. It wasn’t just not hot enough, there was zero spice to it. 
The Korean Beef tacos were to die for though. So everything turned out all right in the end.

Delicious and creative tacos. Great margaritas! The servers were lovely and attentive. I also think the prices are fair! My only complaint is that it was too loud- so two of us at a small two top couldn't hear each other and engage in conversation without strain. I wonder if someone complained because it was noticeably quieter when we were leaving. Also, I'm not a big fan of the metal bistro stools. Overall, a great restaurant we will be back to!

What a gem this little spot is! Imaginative and delicious tacos. No crazy combos, just fresh, well-seasoned, and expertly paired ingredients. I had a fried chicken and a fish taco. Both were just right spicy, tangy, moist, tender and delicious. 
Our server was fun, knowledgeable, and helpful.  
We were there at lunch, and there was a good crowd, but not overly noisy--which was perfect. 
Prices are reasonable and the food is great. Highly recommend.
Food is always excellent, they have great margaritas (I recommend the Blood Orange). Staff is always super friendly and attentive. Highly recommend!!
It was a delicious spot. Great margaritas, Brussels sprouts, and tacos!!
Print and excellent service, good was hot and delicious, in and out quickly but not rushed at all. Love this place!
Family dinner before our daughter went back to college. Really fun vibe and delicious food and drink’s.

Excellent service. Ordered ~20 tacos - a bit confusing on the “whose who’s” identifying what tacos went to which person. Excellent cocktails, Margaritas!! Food is great. Parking is a challenge but you will find something!
Nice foooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooood.
It’s consistently good and therefore, my favorite place to go.

Exceptional food, great service, and very knowledgeable and adept at handling food allergies! One of the best spots in town. 

The guava ribs and bahn mi tacos are especially amazing.

We have lunch at Bird & Co. once or twice a month and consistently have very good experiences there. Close attention is given to the food and especially the service, yet the mood is always cordial and relaxing. And the prices can't be beat!
Awesome brunch. Portions were huge- we all took 1/2 out meal home.
Outstanding! Sat at the bar and were entertained watching the bartender making margaritas with great commentary. Food was fantastic!
The food was terrific and I am not kidding. We had chips and salsa, drinks, and chips and salsa. All delivered by a nice a helpful wait staff. Perfect. Thank you.

Food was delicious and creative.  The margaritas were very very weak.  This is a local bar kind of place so set your expectations accordingly. It's a great place for unusual and good tacos but the ambiance is lacking - small bar with uncomfortable seating.

We love the food, the people, the friendliness. Last night, even at 6 pm, the noise level was off the charts. It was one group in particular and they were SO LOUD. We left before eating more tacos or dessert. Too bad because everything is delicious.
Love Bird & Co., it’s one of our favorites.  Can’t  wait to go back.
Great place and good food - I met up with a friend to have lunch and catch up. Staff were great too!

Fish tacos excellent.
Brussels sprouts yummy and the dip was perfect.
A great local spot with good food and drinks.  The perfect place to meet with friends at.

Excellent! Expect noisy but we could still talk - loudly!
Food was fantastic!
Food and service were great! Loved the atmosphere.

Dedicated vegan brunch menu! Need I say more?! It was outstanding food, the staff was friendly and helpful, and there was zero judgment that we ordered their vegan cheesecake for (brunch) desert! My non-vegan family was thrilled (and indecisive) with their delicious non-vegan options too.

Good brunch. Table for 6 was a little cramped but I appreciate being able to make reservations. Speaker was playing music just behind us, making conversation a bit difficult. Food and drinks were great, as were prices. Service was good.
Excellent food and service! Great Tacos and Margaritas.

Hightop stools are somewhat limiting for some customers.  The only regular seating is for large groups.  There are few regular seating tables for smaller parties.   Otherwise,  the food is awesome and great service!  Definitely will return!

This restaurant has a cute ambience, but they were unable to serve us food without an allergen. We discussed with the waiter that my daughter could not have cilantro, which he discussed with her. I also saw him write it down on the ticket ￼Her entire order came covered with a green cilantro based sauce. He took it back and had the kitchen redo it. After a fairly long wait (the rest of us had finished eating), her food arrived again with the same cilantro sauce, this time buried underneath the food.! We had to leave and get food elsewhere. ￼ everything else we ordered tasted fine. But I would not trust this restaurant with any food allergy. ￼
Bird & Co. always hits! The food is consistently delicious and the service is always on point. Our go to spot in Portland for tacos.

This is, IMO, the best taco place in Portland. The food is fresh, cooked to perfection, and really good. We started with the brussels which are great and have a nice sauce served on the side. I had two house chicken tacos and fried pollo diablo. Really nice. My wife had two beef house tacos. She really enjoyed them along with her house margarita. I enjoyed a dark Modelo with a side of Mezcal. Great team serving really good food. Thanks

Incredible Taco Bar, great drinks and food. Drinks are consistent and properly made. We unfortunately were seated at a table with another party, no big deal - But also waited quite a bit. Server was great and apologetic.

Wonderful and  fresh interesting taste combination  of tacos, always hard to choose which to try all delicious .Always enjoy the brussel sprouts and wonderful guacamole and elote. Great drinks and casual atmosphere .
Other than our server forgetting to bring us our order of chips and and queso until the end of our meal, this place was great!
Bird and Co and one our favorite if not our most favorite spot to grab great food and have outstanding service!!!!

I must admit that, after all the negative comments about the service, I was hesitant to come to this restaurant. However, we had fantastic service, and our food came out quickly, and as we ordered it. The food was good, but the experience was even better.
Great birthday dinner spot!
Super yummy and good service, but really uncomfortable seating.  The food is so good, I will be back even if there were no seats at all.

Very tasty! Had the blueberry basil margarita, chips and salsa, fish taco, and plantain taco. All were delicious. Finished it off with the coconut cheesecake which was VEGAN and delicious! I really like Bird & Co. and have been multiple times. It is a little pricey, but overall, I think their pricing is far and on par with similar restaurants.
Took over an hour to put in our order, food was cold and bad when served. Getting checks took over 25 minutes.
Drink and ribs all were good. Tacos were lacking.  Tortillas were like thin rice paper.

I've been to Bird & Co a few times. The food is delicious and relatively healthy. There are vegetarian and pescatarian options as well as pork belly etc.  It's always a great time. Bring something warm to wear if it's cold out because a lot of seating is outside- with heat lamps, but still. It's fun!

The food was delightful, service was great, it was perfect for catching up with an old friend before we headed off to a show. The special cauliflower tacos were  super delicious, as well as the guava margarita!

Food was fantastic, margaritas were tasty and strong. 
Service A+
Amazing variety of tacos. Amazing flavors. We'll be back.
Had to stop to eat on our way north. So glad we came here. We tried 7 different tacos and they were all delicious. The place is small and seating is tight but it’s fun and worth it.
I love this place. The tacos are so good. They come out quickly, so you can order a couple to start and if you're still hungry, order more!
Great tacos! Chips were a bit hard. Margarita was great! Service ok.

Always great vibe, food and drinks!  

A little disappointed that we had a reservation and arrived on time to no available table so had to sit at the bar...no big deal just hard to talk sitting in a line vs across from each other.
Really good, unique food in a fun environment. Would definitely go again.
Beautiful day to dine outside.  Our table was ready, we got apps and drinks right away and the tacos were not far behind.  Lovely service and great food
First rate tacos of  many kinds and interesting house coktails too! Would go back on a less crowded day.

We loved Bird & Co. 
Service was very good and the food was excellent. We will be back time and time again

We were seated right away and got our delicious drinks quickly. We ordered the chips and guacamole and the little poke tacos. The poke tacos were wonderful! The guac was very boring. It was basically a mashed avacado with nothing in it. We were disappointed but we ate it. We then ordered 3 different tacos each and they were VERY good, but we waited a very long time for them. The vibe in this place is really great and the drinks and tacos will definitely be bringing us back for sure! I just won’t be ordering the guacamole and I hope our  meals don’t take so long next time. Very cool place!
Great tacos, great margaritas, fast efficient service. Poke tuna mini tacos are amazing. Cubano is a must try as well as blackened fish tacos.

Bird & Co is my new go-to in Portland for excellent tacos and other bites and lovely drinks. I haven't had anything bad there ever and their variety in the menu makes it easy for almost anyone to find something -- but the BEST THING about Bird & Co is they are excellent at serving folks with food allergies and dietary restrictions. Couldn't recommend more!

The service was excellent and the menu was exciting. The only problem was even with everything in the tacos and elotes, the meal was kind of bland. A little seasoning (s&p) would go a long way. I was very excited that they cook the tortillas instead of leaving them raw which happens too frequently at other places.
On my all time favorite restaurants in Portland. The food is so delicious!! Highly recommend

We had a terrific dinner. The food was exceptional. We sat outside which was nice however service was a bit slow and our server did not come around to see if we needed anything else but the various tacos were thoughtfully constructed and delicious.
Excellent food, drinks, and service! Highly recommend!
Good service with friendly and efficient staff, yummy drinks and large selection of tasty tacos.

Despite a reservation, we left without any dinner.  I had a reservation for 2 for early dinner.  The employee who seated us didn't seem pleased to see us.  Restaurant was half empty at 5:15p, but filled up soon after. The drink order took un usually long.  40 minutes into it a waitress came for the food order.  She said she was slammed and wasn't sure she could request for the order to be prepared quickly.  She said she could only get the food as soon as the kitchen could get to it.  since I had the commitments later, I opted to leave without getting dinner.
Great spot. Fresh food with vegan options. Will return!

Personally we love a restaurant that has a limited menu , we feel like when they do it’s usually good and this place was proof of our theory!  Our server gave us really good recommendations. This place is busy so make a reservation, it’s also very small inside, there were 3 of us and we had to share a big table with a family of 4 (worked out just fine but with the wrong people could be awkward). My margarita was a REALLY strong. We had 4 different tacos, black bean taquitos & the loaded fries and we couldn’t finish the fries (they’re huge). I would definitely go back!
Absolutely delicious. Everything from Margaritas to Apps (the new guava ribs!) to Tacos was better than we expected. Highly recommend.
The Pollo Diablo taco is amazing.  Can't wait to go back and try some additional items.
Bird & Co. never lets us down! One cannot go wrong with any taco or even the “not tacos” part of the menu. Keep up the delicious work :)

Very poor service. Our server took our order, delivered our drinks and we never saw him again as he was one of the bartenders. He forgot to put our dinner order in. After waiting 45 minutes for 8 tacos, we went to check on them and he said they would be right out. They were delivered by another server and they were all cold. Very disappointed. Shrimp tacos had a good flavor, but the tiniest bay shrimp you have ever seen. No need to go back unfortunately.

Food was an international take on Mexican street food and decent.  The service was terrible.  I went with a large party and they never checked on us, waited 30 minutes for our app order, which they had forgotten, and to ask them on repeat for water and utensils because they never brought them.  Also tacos were served as 1 large order not to the individuals that had ordered them so we had to figure out what everyone had ordered and serve ourselves.  When I asked for taco holders for each person I was told “they didn’t do that”
Great tacos, drinks and salsa. Service is always good.
great dinner!
Small dine in area, but absolutely delicious food and drink! Great mocktail menu!
A great date night place. Boisterous but orderly. Food was good and not expensive. Staff was friendly and worked hard.
Not only are the tacos so reasonably pric d but they are delicious. The churros were excellent too
Great tacos, chimichanga (huge) and hash, also the cocktails were really good too.
Food was incredible! Poke wontons are a must have!!
Great, fun little place that serves delicious tacos. Don’t be afraid to try the Banh mi…actually, we tried 5 different tacos and they were all great. Service was friendly and welcoming.

Food was great, unfortunately, our reservation wasn’t really held for us and we had to wait 35 minutes for our table. Thankfully we had no plans after and we were able to wait and the food and drinks were awesome!

I really liked the fun atmosphere, our server was somehow very professional and laid back at the same time. I took off a star for the food only because I ordered something without meat and it ended up having a little bit of meat in it anyway. Not a huge deal for me personally but if I didn’t eat pork for religious/moral/health reasons it would have irked me.

Great service, creative margaritas, DELICIOUS tacos, vegan options labeled on menu - love this place. We have a great time every time we go. Reservations recommended on busier nights - they fill up because the food and drinks and service are fantastic. Parking can be a little tricky, leave time to circle around and be flexible about parking in a nearby neighborhood.

Celiacs beware- third time they have served me gluten, first time I didn’t catch it.  Doesn’t matter how much you tell the kitchen.  So sad, bird and co was my absolute favorite but I will never ever go back
Always a great experience at Bird and Co. The staff there are extremely welcoming. Even when busy with to go ordering, all dining onsite still receive the best service. Love Bird and Co!
I had the Bird Benny and it was one of the best things I’ve ever had. The combination of all the flavors and ingredients were well balanced and outstanding.

My brunch tacos had very little seasoning and were not served hot.  My blackberry basil margarita had great blackberry flavor but no basil flavor and I think they forget the tequila!  Very watered down.  Two in the party had the brunch chimichanga and also said it had little flavor.  We were so looking forward to it and left disappointed

Always love my bird and co visits but it was a bit loud these past few times. Small space, tables full, not sure how you can avoid it. Also the bbq shrimp was not so exciting. The coconut margarita was amazing though!

Made a reservation for 4 people and table was ready and waiting. Margaritas were delicious with real fruit. Tacos were excellent. A bit on the pricey side though. Parking was limited.  I’m going back!

Bird & co. was a great restaurant away from the touristy part of Portland - we felt as if we were with the locals vs. the tourists. Great margs and such interesting and yummy combinations in the tacos. Small inside with outside seating with a great vibe.
Best strawberry rhubarb margarita so good! Their queso is amazing and they put a good spin on tacos!

Made reservations. We waited over an hour for our food and the staff was rude about our wait. Completely unapologetic. There were several drunk girls being purposely loud and annoying which didn’t help. We paid $90 for ok food.

Food was great, but the music too loud. We wanted to sit outside, but our waitress told us they were out of propane. We asked if they could turn the music down, but our waitress said she might be able to turn it down a little. That didn’t happen. We’ll return when we can sit outside. We noticed it was a very young crowd. We are all in our seventies.
Tijuana tacos are to die for, watermelon margaritas are phenomenal and the choco tacos make the whole experience 10/10 would recommend

Let me begin by saying I am from New Mexico.  This restaurant does NOT serve tacos that even remotely pair against the real deal that is available in most of the southwest. There is no spice nor heat.  The "tacos" are bland and were served lukewarm. Margaritas are watered down in huge 16 oz. glasses.  This was a total disappointment as we were so looking forward to hot and spicy tacos and great super chilled and flavorful margaritas.  Certainly not worth the $120+ cost.

I really love this place and am so happy it is walkable from my house.  Great creative and modern versions of tacos. New choices introduced occasionally keeps it interesting. The chips and guacamole are to die for.  Two people can have beer, chips/guac and 2 tacos each and leave with full bellies and all for $50.

Went for Mother's Day brunch.   Had brussels, chips and guac as an app and both were excellent.   2 of us had the Bennie and one had the French Toast.   Everyone left full and happy.   Would go back for sure.

My husband enjoy having breakfast/lunch here because of the plant based options with Just Egg.  The food is prepared well and offers a variety of options to please just about anyone.  I think the drinks could be improved if only the bartenders would use jiggers instead of just eyeballing the pour into a glass.  Very happy with out meal and will return again!
The cilantro was not washed. The server was pretty indifferent when it came to the issue.
It’s consistently great. The people who work there are super busy but fabulous. So nice to have options as a vegan.
Delicious food, attentive and friendly servers and they take reservations.  Thank you!
Really great brunch experience! Great mimosas and tacos, plus the choco tacos shouldn’t be missed. Friendly folks in a great neighborhood.
Went for a girls brunch and it was amazing! We all loved our drinks and food. It was an awesome experience.

Glad we made reservations as they did fill up fast! The food was delicious, the service was great and attentive even though they were busy. We sat outside and as the sun set, it got chilly, but the staff was very quick to fire up the outdoor heaters. Excellent job overall!

We go to The Bird almost every weekend during the summer.   The duck confit taco and the winter salad are perennial favorites.  Brunch on the weekend is fantastic.  The Eggs Benedict, Avocado Toast, and Churro french toast are to die for!
Food and service were great, we sat at the very back table which was a bit claustrophobic, wouldn’t sit there again.
Super friendly staff, great food, moderately priced, would recommend!!
Love Bird and Co! The staff is always so welcoming and on top of checking in with guests during their experience.
Small space, excellent food. Menu was simple and some cool taco choices and delicious appetizers. Even had dessert! Server was very busy but did a great job. Would return!
I wish I could remember our servers name because he was amazing. It was our first time there and I’d recommend 100x over. Loved the food loved everything about it! Will definitely be back!
Celebrated my daughter’s birthday at Bird & Co.  Tacos were delicious and service was terrific!
great food, great service, reasonable prices, the churros were awesome
Great atmosphere and food - an ideal spot for vegans and vegetarians, as well as omnivores.  And Mexican!

We had a great time. Yummy food and super nice employees. Was very happy I could make a reservation. I was able to go from 4 to 5 people w the open table website - and when we found we would have a 6th - I called the restaurant and they said no problem. Looking forward to going back again. Looks like could make a reservation for a party as large at 10. Yay!

Food was excellent as always. The drinks were mostly great/ my friend had a house Marg that was very heavy on the sour mix and not very drinkable, but everything else was good! The staff was very friendly as always 🖤

There are happy hour specials too which was nice (but I had to inquire with the waiter to find out)
Excellent food; excellent service! We love Bird & Co!! Couldn’t recommend it more highly!!

This little neighborhood gem lived up to the hype.  The margaritas were very good, my spicy one had the right bit of kick! The taquitos were delicious as were the tacos, we will be back to try the ones we didn't have this time..
First visit and I liked it very much.  Chips and guacamole was fantastic.
Great time as always! We love Bird and Co! So much as they are catering our wedding reception next year!
It's always perfect! People, setting, food, etc. I also love the weekend brunches!
Took my wife out on a date night. We loved the atmosphere, our waiter was super nice and the food was fantastic! We will definitely be back again!

We were in Portland Maine for the weekend and decided to stop here for brunch Sunday morning. It was amazing! Everyones food was delicious, the drinks were great and the service was also fantastic. We will be back in the future!

Absolutely perfect as usual. I love this little neighborhood place. Great but not overwhelming selection of tacos and a few other items, rotating craft beer selection, plus great margaritas and other drinks. Vibe is super cool, not quiet, but fun and lively. Love this place!

Very good
Delicious brunch.
Definitely recommend reservations
Great vegetarian options as well
Great good and a fun vibe.

Lunch with a group of buddies wasn't the greatest experience. The music was loud and we could hardly hear each other. The service was fair and the food was cold. I understand it was a busy holiday lunch, but we didn't appreciate the cold tacos and elote. Won't be going back anytime soon.
We love it here
Great food and drinks, very accommodating for dairy allergy!  Vegan cheesecake was to die for.
Great tacos. Great service. Great vibes. Definitely recommend!
Casual early dinner and drinks with a friend. The food is always fabulous but I love coming here because the service is equally amazing and the margaritas are so fresh and delish!
Food is always amazing. And service is always friendly.
Great tacos and drinks!

What a wonderful surprise this menu and experience was for us! Staff was amazing, helpful at a comfortable  and friendly level without being intrusive.  The food was "to die for".  We chose 4 different tacos between the two of us, and all four were an adventure in taste.  We have agreed to meet again there next month, to try another 4 (different from this time) tacos.  We might keep going until we've tried them all.  Then we'll just go back and start at the beginning again! Kudos, Bird & Co!
Always great! This was our 4th visit, and definitely not the last.
Food, drinks, and service were great!  Tough to find a complaint but I guess the table was near the door and kinda drafty.  Minor detail for a great meal!
Delicious and inventive Tacos!! definitely worth a visit
The stools are hard on the butt, otherwise we were very pleased with the experience. Thank you.

Went for hubby’s birthday, although we eat there at least 1-2x/month. Had the vegan caramel apple cheesecake for dessert for the occasion-it was really good. Tacos were excellent as usual, although one of them arrived at the table decidedly colder than the others. Need to warm those taco trays in the winter before you fill them, especially on a larger order (we had 9 or 10 - ?) where the first ones up are going to be waiting several minutes. Not a huge complaint, just a bit of feedback. We’ll definitely be back. :)
Disappointed that chips weren't warm as well as our taco shells. they were cold and didn't seem very fresh :(  Margaritas were fair, not the best I;ve ever had.
Very small, intimate restaurant. The wait staff was excellent.  The tacos were innovative and were very good.
Best salad I’ve had in a long time! We were seated near the door so it was pretty cold and drafty, but the food made up for it!
Great margarita, tasty tacos and a lively crowd!
Great food and drinks with excellent prices.  Great choice for an early new years eve dinner and cheers.  Recommended.  We'll be back for sure!
Great food! Glad we did a reservation it was packed when we arrived. Would definitely come again
Great food and service! Love Bird And Co!!!
great food and awesome vegan options, even a dessert!
My new favorite restaurant! Handed a "vegan brunch menu" in addition to the regular menu. Huevos Rancheros were great!
Excellent food and service.  Very cool place to check out!

The food at Bird & Co is always on point! The Tijuana, house, and California tacos are always our go-to’s. They have a bunch of flavor choices for margaritas too! They also have a good variety for vegan and vegetarian options. I would 100% recommend making a reservation, it’s a small space and they’re always busy. The food can take awhile and at times we’ve waited up to an hour for a few tacos, but on this occasion we had somewhere to be and let our server know from the start and he was able to get our food and drinks out ASAP, which we appreciated. There’s only 2 tables for larger parties and every other table is a 2-seater, making this a great spot for date nights.
Some of the best tacos around. Great drinks and service. The food is flavorful and unique. Never had a bad experience there.

We needed a last minute brunch reservation for 10 people on a Sunday morning during the holiday season and they squeezed us in and gave us incredible service and yummy food. 

Everyone (including a vegetarian in our group) found lots of things on the menu we loved and we will definitely be back.

The service could not have been better.  Everyone from the host to the waitstaff was very friendly and attentive.  We were here during brunch.  The food was quite good if not especially memorable.  To be fair, brunch isn’t my favorite meal.  My schnitzel was great, but the sandwich was a tad dry. I’m a local so I’ll definitely come back to try more things.  And a possibly lame request, please offer half and half or cream for coffee during brunch.
Food was delicious! Service was on point!

Very cool place, liked the seating. Order loaded carnitas fries, very tasty but the fries and topping were lukewarm. Tortilla soup very good, needed to be hotter and I’ve never had to without chunks of chicken and vege, flavor was great.  Tacos are the star, had chorizo mash and fried avocado, quite good! My wife had the portabella, very good. We also had elotes, flavorful and wife liked it. I’m not a huge corn fan so I wouldn’t bother again. Overall it’s a great place, just very close and loud! We will go back when we can sit outside for sure!
Food and service were great. It was a bit cold whenever the

Everyone we encountered, from the server to the person delivering our food to the hostess, everyone was super friendly and were a pleasure to be around. We loved our meal, the food was incredible and very reasonably priced! We will 100% be back
We love Bird and Co. Service is always great, food is always perfect!
Everything was delicious   It was our first visit…we will return!!
Always a great experience! One of our faves
Lovely staff and delicious food.. highly recommend!!
Excellent food, drink and service! We will definitely be back for the blackberry basil margarita made with jalapeño tequila!
Lunch with cousins

We dined from their plant-based brunch menu and the food was great! Their bloody Mary’s were also really good.
Wish I lived closer!
My family and I went for brunch. Food was okay kinda bland

Hard to (overall) beat a birthday lunch on the sidewalk, in November at 70 degrees, in Portland, ME, with tacos this good.  Parking was a hassle, and despite a reservation, we had to wait for a table to be cleared, but once we sat, the day was glorious and the food phenomenal.  Cubano taco was my favorite by far and away.  First visit, will definitely return.
Best tacos and service around! I always have a wonderful experience here. Well worth a visit
I wish when I made a reservation they gave you an option of outside or inside. We ended up outside which was fine but a little chilly.  They also need to let you know it is family style eating.
Ate out on the street which was fine but want to go back to get the ambiance of the inside as it looks cool. Food is great.
Loved this place. Tacos delicious, drinks wonderful and all with a great waiter
Great food, hospitable and helpful staff. A nice vibe!

Great food, had a completely plant based menu loaded with solid items. Both the Heuvos rancheros and the Breakfast sandwhich were very tasty. Would eat here again. Very small and quaint, have a reservation ready.
1st time here, loved the concept, staff, ambience and cocktails were excellent as were the tacos. The noise level was a little loud, but I’ll definitely come back!

Excellent service!!!!! Really excellent!!!!
Food is great; Ditto drinks & Prices!
Great menu variety!
Loved it!
Omg, every about our experience was so amazing. Tacos, cocktails, the vibe, our awesome server, the fact that we could eat outside in Maine in October. We loved and we will be back.🍹🌮⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Our family has many food allergies, each persons being different.  They are comfortable and confident and take great care to be sure we are all safe.  Always with a smile!   The food, atmosphere and wonderful staff leave us wanting to go back every week!

Loved it! I've been trying to get to Bird & Co for a while and finally made it in. The tacos are amazing. Try the Bahn Mi taco....WOW!

I can't wait to go back!!

“Poor” review is based on service only. Unable to
Ccomment on other categories.
Everything was spot on. They forgot one of my tacos but brought it out right away!
We had a great time! The food was delicious and the staff were incredibly nice. The cocktails were also amazing. I would highly recommend checking it out!
Fantastic choice for our first visit to Portland! Halibut was exquisite as was the corn and blueberry salad (along with everything else we ordered. Top notch service with extremely high quality food.
Can’t say enough about Fore Street. Everything was fantastic. We had the tomatoes, the bison sausage, scallops and hanger steak. Can’t go wrong with anything they serve
Always great. Great oysters, foie gras and chicken. Thanks!

Always my FAVORITE restaurant when coming home to Maine!!!! My number one pick on the menu is always a delicious local salad mix then the best ever Hanger Steak grilled on an open fire to perfection of bloody rare!!!! FORESTREET NEVER disappoints!!! Oh yes always ask for “the flavor of the day”  Crème Brûlée when you are first seated as not to miss out on selling out!!! Tonight’s was Apricot with almond macaroon! DELICIOUS!!!!
They're at the top of their game again. Perfect place to take business guests from "the big city" to impress them.
Exceptional in every way, the food, the service, the ambiance
Excellent experience food was good. Ambience was lovely. Service was great. Highly recommend.
Had a fantastic birthday dinner with some great friends!! The waiter was amazing and recognized my birthday on several occasions! No hoopla!! Had a lovely dinner!! Thank you so much!!
The noise deafening.   Couldn’t speak with my dinner companions.  The food and service were outstanding.

In a city with wonderful food at a remarkably significant number of restaurants, there's nothing that can compete with Fore Street. The service staff is brilliant and the kitchen seems to always succeed at "Can You Top This!" Every meal I have had there I rave about for days and days; what a treasure.
First time in Maine. First meal in Maine. First choice for dinner. Great dining experience in all respects.

Fore St. is an exceptional experience ! The space is unique. The service line is open for viewing of the flaming food preparations. The food selection and quality are top notch. The service is impeccable !! My server, Sydney (sp?) was attentive, professional and friendly. Very accommodating with a reservation change for me as well. I love Fore St..

The food is absolutely first rate, some of the best you’ll find. Service was also great. The only drawback was the noise level, not music, but just restaurant noise. It can be hard to hear your companions. If that doesn’t bother you, it’s 5 stars all around.
Everything was excellent except one meal. The duck was awful. Couldn't eat it. Wife says the scallops were great. Everything else was excellent. Awful duck. No taste. Tough. Yuck. Sorry.
Fore Street is always an incredible experience. The food, service, ambience...all of it is perfect, every time.
One of our favorite restaurants in Portland, always a delicious meal and a wonderful spot! Grilled squid was a favorite to start and all the entrees were excellent—can’t go wrong.

Absolutely one of my top meals in Portland. My husband had the halibut and he said it was the best he’s ever eaten. 
We shared the smoked mussel appetizer and it was so unique with almonds in the poaching liquid. 
I had the scallops and again they were outstanding.

Always such an amazing experience! The tuna tartar was incredible and we can’t leave without getting the squid!
Be back soon!

For nearly 30yrs this restaurant has served flawless food and drink, in a space that feels one of a kind. I’ve never had a bad dish, and constantly leave both full and inspired. Reservations fill up quick, but it’s worth the effort to make one.
Great food and service! The cornbread was the best we’ve had! We had a few shareable and an entree to split and the server paced the food out and paired them beautifully!
Excellent menu, very nice setting - highly recommended, but get a reservation!
Amazing meal.  Food was incredible, service was perfect.  Loved the ambience.
Every single person on staff is a ten out of ten if you know what I mean. Food’s good too.
Unfortunately, we were underwhelmed by the food. Everything was edible but nothing stood out, and the presentation left a bit to be desired. Wouldn’t return or recommend.
Excellent service and excellent dinner. We’ve been going to Fore Street for as long as it’s been open (1990’s) and it remains our favorite.

The food and server were great. What was not great was being rushed out after spending $300+. Delivering a check with dessert is poor hospitality. We had been at the table less than 1.5 hrs total and could tell they needed the table to complete a larger service coming at 9. When a table orders appetizer, salad, mains, desert, a bottle of wine and an after dinner drink, don't rush them give them at least 2 hrs to complete their dinning experience.
A great meal with exceptional service. We'll be back!

A must go to Restaurant in Portland Maine. I not a fan of Mussels, however Fore Street Restaurant Wood Oven Roasted Maine Rope-Cultured Mussels blew me away! 
The rest of dishes were also outstanding.

We had a great experience at Fore Street. This is our first time at this restaurant but we are repeat customers to their other restaurants. They did not disappoint. Our server had great recommendations. I had the special baked lobster with scallops which was amazing. My husband has the steak with flavorful and perfect medium rare.
Over 100 visits and each one is still great!  Can't wait to come back n the next time.
Our dinners were delicious!!!  Service attentive without being intrusive…. This place is a gem!
Still my favorite restaurant in Portland- best service and food every summer!!! Our server Michael was attentive and fun and our food was superb! So fun

We have dinner at Fore Street about twice a year and always enjoy the changing menu. This visit (July 2024) was a particularly great menu with the lobster pasta being exceptional. The only downside was we were seated in the annex section and it was very cold compared to the main section of the restaurant. We’ve never sat here before and will request not to in the future. Thankfully I had a jacket in the car and my husband went to get it for me, otherwise I would have been pretty miserable; the people beside me were.
Our favorite restaurant in the world. Always a special and delicious experience. Thank you!
Start to finish an amazing meal. So fun to take it slow and watch the service team do their thing!
Best restaurant in Portland.  They take good care of you plus serve fabulous food.  Always save room for dessert.
Incredible service and an amazing kitchen in a city with no shortage of great restaurants.
Food is outstanding here, if you are going to Portland, make it a point to treat yourself with dinner at Fore Street.

The service was great at Fore Street, however the food was good but not worth the costs. Portions were small, the squid was slightly overcooked giving it a rubbery texture, my husband ordered the pork chop and for sides broccolini (which was good but small portion - they are share sides , 2 stalks broccolini each) and corn bread which was more like a cornbread pancake and I did like the cornbread (the butter was good, the cook on it was good- my husband didn’t like it and stated there was a bitter after taste ) I ordered the crab stuffed halibut which the waiter suggested and it was good. Overall, would go again for maybe just a drink and atmosphere

Perfect service, impeccable food and ambience.
Definitely, we will come back

Adam was outstanding!  He was very knowledgeable about all the dishes and ingredients on the menu and patiently answered our questions without being condescending.   The food was delicious but the hangar steak could have been a little more tender.   Would highly recommend this spot!
Amazing in every way! Food quality, service and ambiance all included! Hannah was great! Thank you!
Exceptional food. Recommend scallops and roasted cauliflower

Fore St NEVER fails to impress! The ambiance, service, cocktails, and food are exceptional! Our server knew his stuff, made excellent recommendations based on our individual tastes, and was just the right mix of friendly without imposing. We shared oysters on the half shell and grilled squid - both so very good! Our dinners were halibut, pan seared oysters, lamb, halibut, and a spit-turned sirloin - every dish PERFECT! It is our favorite restaurant!!

Very good but the servers were a bit bossy .  Was not “allowed”
To sit at bar and get a drink while waiting for table
Actually could not EVEN order a drink from bar.  Had to sit in lounge and wait for a server.  Also there were no requests as far as sauce on the side etc when ordering dinner.  I don’t like m food over sauced!  I found it too rich.  Oh well, I’ve been many times before, and it was a much more enjoyable meal.  The food was good, but I will  not run back to dine there, as there are many other places in Portland that are very good and not as “ strict “
Food and service was outstanding.  Found the room somewhat noisy as it filled up.  Overall I would come again with no qualms.

What an amazing dining experience. I know the menu constatly rotates but the Venison Denver Steak was one of the finest steaks I’ve ever had. Chef prepared it rare - to absolute perfection. Front of house staff, server, everyone…fantastic all around. Cannot express how much I recommend this restaurant.

We learned about Fore Street from a Docent at the Lighthouse Museum near the Bug Lighthouse. I ordered the halibut which was perfectly prepared & my husband had the Pork Loin. Both of us enjoyed our meals very much. Service was good, the wine choices were good and overall the meal, ambiance & value for all was top drawer.
Great Restaurant,  along with delicious food well executed.
Amazing fast service.  Best food in a long time.

Amazing and delicious!
Beautiful decore…a wonderful dining experience!!
Can’t wait to come back and see what’s on the menu..as it is constantly evolving!!! 🤩😃
Our server was excellent.  Food and drinks were delivered promptly.  Even though the restaurant was full it was not too loud.  Excellent dining experience.
High quality, locally sourced food, imaginatively prepared and carefully served.

Reliably excellent restaurant, perfect for those of us who like meat grilled or spit-roasted over a wood fire. We eat here whenever we come to Portland and are never disappointed. The price is right for the quality of the meal.
What a fantastic restaurant, killer menu and drinks!
One of the best meals we can remember.  Truly outstanding on every metric we can think of.
Wow. Try as many of the salads and sides as you can. So many wonderful flavors prepared to perfection.
Just go. Do yourself and your loved ones that favor. Food is phenomenal.

The service was outstanding and the ambiance was great! Loved the energy! Our waiter was very kind and helpful. The best salad I’ve ever had! My hanger steak was somewhat tough and fatty but tasty. My real disappointment was that the restaurant doesn’t / won’t do any side dishes without garlic … I’m allergic to garlic and had to do without.

Always my first go to restaurant when trying to find a place to eat in Portland. Everything on the menu is delicious and fresh. The wait staff are very knowledgeable and friendly. If you can get in, go!

Fore St. has been our Portland favorite.  Menu is always creative and the food is top notch. This was our 4th visit but the first time that the service was not as expected.  After 3 of us were served, the remaining entree didn't appear until 5-10 minutes later.  No one stopped by to say it would be late or seemed to realize the error.  The server finally came by and noticed the issue. She eventually brought the meal over citing it was a "glitch" in the kitchen, with no apology.  Perhaps they were short-handed, but the situation could have been handled more professionally.

Our entrees were delicious and the service great.  The only thing I would have improved upon was the table we had because if we sat across from each other, one of us was looking at the wall. We solved it by both sitting on the same side of the table.

Fore Street has been a Portland staple in fine dining for decades - they are iconic.  However, it seems they've gone too far from their roots of solid protein and gorgeous vegetable options to now some really kookie dishes, with odd combinations of ingredients, small portions, and high prices.  You don't need to compete with the new guys - stick to your roots!!
We had a great time and thought the food was wonderful and the service was excellent. Would definitely go back there again and would recommend it to anybody
Excellent flavor.  Be prepared for a unique menu. Not a typical family style restaurant. Very attractive setting downtown. Parking is convenient.
Still the best in Portland.  Every dish is cooked to perfection!
A wonderful experience! Highly recommend. Cocktails, appetizers, entrees, and dessert were all spot on. Worth every penny.
Reservation honored on time, service prompt and attentive ( without being overly so.). Every bite of food simply great!
From hostess , to waitress the attention and food was off the charts as always

Fore Street is wonderful for a finer dining experience with outstanding service and a lively kitchen! The grilled squid and seasonal sugar snap, snow and English peas were amazing! The sourdough brought to your table is excellent and useful for wiping sauce, which is something one ought to do here. The scallop entree was also excellent. The sea salt brown butter ice cream and mango sorbet - a perfectly ripe mango flavor with no graininess whatsoever - were also absolutely delicious! Thank you Megan, my server, who was so kind and helpful in deciding what to eat.

Excellent service, ambiance and food.
Staff was educated on all aspects of the menu, food preparation and wine.
An absolute must go in Portland!
Excellent dinner. I’ve been wanting to come since Fore Street started the dining revolution in Portland but never managed to get a reservation. I’m glad I kept trying!
We loved everything about the entire experience, from cocktails, to Hannah's wonderful recommendations to the cozy feel.
Lived up to the hype and all expectations. Highly recommend!! (now off my bucket list)
Service was excellent! We really enjoyed our meal.

Very easy to change our res from Fri to Thurs at the last minute.
Our server, Kelly, was gracious, skilled, knowledgeable, with a friendly & welcoming personality.
All meals, apps & wine were delicious and perfectly prepared.

The only less than positive comment I would add is the hostess was a bit reserved and not as welcoming; almost a bit snooty.

Food was excellent. Server was very kind, knowledgeable about the food, and the right amount of attentiveness. Definitely would East there again. We went with our two children ages 5 and 8. It’s not a kids restaurant for sure, but they made smaller portions for them and they ate very well.
The best mussels ever. Had stuffed haddock and my wife had halibut. Both spectacular. Great service. A little loud but we got used to it. Good bar and drinks.
Went for our anniversary and the entire experience was incredible! Definitely recommended.
Honestly one of our best dining experiences - outstanding service, exceptional food, and warm, inviting ambiance! The wood fire concept - 5-stars!

What an amazing place!  Upon entering, we were greeted warmly. We were escorted to a lovely table with a large window. Our server was so kind and friendly - and knowledgeable about the food. We truly had maybe the best meal of our lives. Everything was perfection!
Food is outstanding and fresh couldn’t have chosen a better place to dine with the family.

Our visit to Fore Street was one of the best dining experiences I’ve had in quite some time. The restaurant has a great aroma as you arrive due to the open kitchen with a live fire grill. Our server, Adam, had full command of the menu and provided insightful suggestions and informative answers to our questions along attentive service throughout the meal. Our cocktails and wine were on point as were the local oysters and gem lettuce salad. For dinner, we had the Hangar Steak with an herb sauce and seared Scallops with a zucchini bacon relish and scallion sauce. Garlic mashed potatoes and roasted cauliflower were our delicious sides. All items were cooked to perfection and beyond our expectations. The dessert of Bourbon Pecan Cream Pie ended the meal perfectly.
If you visit Portland and don’t eat at Fore Street, you are making a huge mistake….
Food beautifully prepared.  Excellent service. Great wine list and cocktails.
The food was creative & delicious.  Service amazing.  This is one of my favorite restaurants in Portland Maine!
Absolutely amazing experience. Every bite was fantastic and the ambiance was phenomenal.

Interesting menu with. variety.
The only criticism--wine by the glass of modest quality.
Otherwise, a superb meal.
Greg was excelent as our server - good recommendations, paced us well. Thank-you!
Always amazing from the food to the service and atmosphere.

Love Fore St! The place has a great vibe (casual elegance, Maine style). The food was wonderful, as usual, and our server was fantastic. Personable, engaging , attentive without being too attentive. Definitely one of the best dining experiences in Portland!
The food, service and atmosphere were all incredible.  A great start to our Portland trip, definitely recommend! Michael was our server and he was excellent
Excellent as always!! Amazing …I had crab stuffed haddock and my husband had the pork chop. And mussels for an appetizer. Our favorite place

Fore Street Restaurant did not disappoint! It was very well worth the the trip tp Portland, ME. Reservations are still highly recommended due to its well merited popularity and exquisite food items.
We shall return and continue to consider this restaurant as one of our most favored.
One of the orders got messed up due to an allergy and it was difficult to accommodate the table but it got worked out in the end and the food was great!
Amazing amazing amazing experience! Loved every bite and the staff was wonderful.
Our server Kelly was fantastic! Very friendly and knowledgeable. The food was delicious and the portions were good. Make sure to save room for dessert.
Top-level experience from start to finish. Fore Street lived up to its rep as the top special-occasion eatery in Portland.
Last ate there was 25 years ago and still outstanding.  Great meal and service.

We don’t get to Fore Street often but every time we do the meal and experience are outstanding!!!    From beginning to end our server Greg was excellent, even with a great wine suggestion. The venison starter was incredible and the special flawless. Would highly recommend the experience to anyone. Such a treat!!
There is a reason Fore Street has been open for so long. Great food, fantastic service adn eating there feels like a special occasion.

The food was fresh and amazing!   The crab stuffed haddock was delicious and just enough.   The lemon and white chocolate mousse was light, citrusy and phenomenal.   The service was excellent!   Thanks to Jesse our waiter for his recommendations!   I would come back everyday if I lived in Portland.

Lighting is insufficient. It's ok in the booths but not along the wall (why such a difference?). It's almost impossible to read the menu or see what one eats! Far from being cozy or fancy, it's just very inconvenient. Real pity because otherwise it's a great place.
Visitor from Europe.

Delicious food, well crafted cocktails, excellent service, and an upscale but unstuffy atmosphere.  In my experience, Fore Street has never disappointed - from the excellent bread that starts off each meal to the toothsome desserts. Even the decaf coffee tasted great!  Between the three of us, we enjoyed expertly made whiskey sours, good sauvignon blanc, thick and smoky fish chowder, succulent mussels, and Boucheron salad to start and then moved on to rotisserie chicken, halibut and haddock.  Desserts -- muscat grape sorbet, a rhubarb crisp-like concoction, and a light lemony mousse -- were a perfect ending to a delicious meal. Whenever I am in Portland, I want to dine at Fore Street.
Our favorite Portland restaurant and with good reason. Outstanding asparagus salad and out of this world bourbon brined chicken.
Lovely food and service from Michael. Hoped for more non-shellfish options. Even halibut was made with scallop butter. Delicious cauliflower side and rhubarb dessert. Bread always wonderful too.
Always a pleasure and the rare pleasure of free parking.  Food was fabulous and service was perfect.  A favorite restaurant for us here in Portland 😊
Party of 6 for mother's day. We ate everything! food and service were fantastic as usual.
Main dining area is a bit chaotic and noisy but we like the smaller room for quieter dining. Food and service  are always excellent!

Wow.  Just wow.  This place is gorgeous, rustic, industrial loft type vibes, amazing farm to table high end amazing food, without being stuffy or pretentious.  Staff were fun and they were very accommodating to my dietary restrictions.  Can't wait to drive 2.5 hours just to go back there!

Love the Farm to Table and especially how fresh the meats are.  It's always a great atmosphere, although our table could have used and over head light to help read the menu.  Great fun watching the food being prepared.
I had to ask myself why it had been so long since I’d been to Fore Street. It’s always so good!
Great food and service! It was a total experience and the decor was also well done
Vegetarian options are very limited. Despite checking in with the restaurant prior to arriving there were no substantial vegetarian options.
Outstanding food. Fresh, flavorful & unique preparations.  Delicious!  Highly recommended not missing this place while in Portland.
First time at this restaurant, food was excellent! One of my new favorite places

Wow, what a great birthday dinner 
I had requested for the table by the kitchen and when we arrived it was all set 
Food was Delicious as always 
Our server Alora was very friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu 
She answered all my questions with detailed answers 
You can tell that she really gets it

I always love the food at Fore St. A solid 5++ Never fails to nourish and delight me. The mussels last night were huge and sooo tasty. Tried lamb and I’m still thinking about it! Wine selection is great too. We introduced a family member to Fore and he is smitten!
Service was a little odd last night- we had the distinct sense of being rushed along so they could have the table.
A bit weird and uncomfortable- especially as we were leaving at 90 minutes.
Really enjoyed the atmosphere along with the fabulous food.  Ask for Sarah, she'll take care of you!

All of the food was excellent, including imaginative yet not overpowering preparations of side vegetables (parsnips and cauliflower), excellent main dishes (scallops; steak), fine appetizers, excellent wines by the glass, and an interesting and flavorful dessert. Our server was personable, cheerful, and well-informed.  Other staff were also in good humor and helpful.  The open kitchen and rustic decor are essentially unchanged from our last visit long ago but still provide warm and comfortable surroundings for an extraordinary meal.
Husband and I both went for 'raw' starters (beef tartare and clams) and then fish main courses,  Wonderful flavours.  Great attentive service and loved the ambiance of the place.
Wonderful food and service. Very special! Hanger steak was superb as were the oysters!

Such a warm, inviting interior and great service that serves up some excellent, fresh food!  Drinks in the lounge were on point, and the menu had so many options, it was hard to not try everything.  The friendly and accommodating staff made the entire experience really lovely.

Once again, Fore Street's team made everything perfect for us and our guests. We treasure our returns as we pass through Portland on our way to or from Colorado for the summer in Maine. Our visit last week was made even better by being joined by friends who drove 2 hours from Boston to join us. They were blown away, as well they might be. Thank, Fore Street!

We were warmly greeted at the door and seated promptly.  Our server Monica approached the table with water and explained menu etc.  Came back to take cocktail order. Cocktails delivered.  Monica came back to take dinner order.  Food was amazing as always. Asparagus salad, 2 pork loins, bolognese and chicken all delicious.  So were the 3 sides we ordered, Aroostook county garlic mash potatoes (can’t go wrong with these) broccolini and cornbread. We all passed on desserts since we were completely satiated!!   Love this place for
The most outstanding food. Wonderfully prepared and presented!!

Absolutely fabulous meal last evening at Fore Street.  The oysters, brocolli caesar salad, salmon on toast, and day scallops  were all delicious.   The service and ambiance were also amazing.   Can't wait to return.
Always a great place. The stuffed haddock was delicious
10stars would be appropriate as always here since its beginning
Excellent food and service.  We really enjoyed the entire experience. One of the best restaurants in the Northeast.

This place is phenomenal and hits a grand slam with bases loaded with every single dish. This place is not be missed. The service is stellar and makes you feel welcome. The food is prepared with extreme detail and technique.

Food was excellent, Ryan was a great server, the place is very loud and there are no lights. Was ok when the sun was out but once it went down we couldn't see the food in front of us. A few lights on the outside walls and every table gets a small candle. For the amount you pay here you really need to get the whole package. I'm all for the dim ambiance but this was ridiculous.
Excellent and excellent service. Can’t wait to go back.

not up to usual excellence.  Food not its usual perfectly seasoned delicious delight.  Halibut crust very salty. Lamb  meatballs bland. Beef stroganoff bland.  Very noisy.   As I said, not the usual Fore St excellence.
We loved it so much we went for dinner two nights in a row. We’ll make a beeline back next time we’re in Portland. ❤️

Sometimes the old standards stale. The food was very good; our server was lovely and we appreciated her wine suggestions. The prices are pushing it unless ownership is still invested in sustaining local Maine food networks. Mostly I’d rather go to a fresher venue from here on out. And wish I’d read the one-star reviews before choosing to eat here again.  The “welcome” was anything but and that absolutely affected the experience. Mostly I think the pandemic broke the restaurant industry and it’s a shame.

Been my all-time favorite for 28 years - In 28 years, always a great meal and service was there the 2nd day they were open.
Their staff - only 2 originals left - is the best in the business along with their sister restaurants.
The bar seating is almost always a friendly community to meet both locals and people traveling either on business or pleasure.  Still my No. 1 favorite in the U.S.!
Can I say anymore?
Every dish is expertly executed! We’ve eaten here a handful or more of times over the years and the food and service is consistently on point. Thank you for a great experience!
Fore street was amazing! One of the best restaurants I’ve been to, tremendous service and magnificent food. Will definitely come back!
Food was incredible as always. Our favorite restaurant in Portland never disappoints! Thanks for a great birthday dinner.
Another perfect date night at Fore St. Had the beef tartar, halibut and scallops. Absolutely delicious. Great service too. Thank you!

Best restaurant in Portland! One of my favorite restaurants ever!! It is an experience not to be missed!! Must make reservations well in advance. Come hungry, you must have an appetizer, entree, dessert, and the bread!!!

Our 4th trip to Fore Street. Every single time is the same. Perfect. The service is impeccable every time but not stuffy. The staff takes care of you. And the food. Simple food inspired by Maine that is cooked with fire. And done perfectly. The easiest example - while probably outshined by the amazing raw bar, perfectly cooked sea food, and unique meats - is the roast chicken. It’s simple. But it’s something that you just cannot replicate at home. And it’s so hard to not order it.

Go and enjoy yourself
This was an absolutely Transcendent meal. Great food and service.

The food was so good and for an amazing price! The pork loin was to DIE for and my husband loved his trout. Everything was cooked perfectly and came out quickly. Will 100% be planning another trip back to Portland just to come back here!!

Great food as always during our visit
Fresh, well prepared. Knowledgable server.
Get the 1/2 chicken, scallops, the squid. All excellent.
Top notch food, drinks and service in a warm and unpretentious atmosphere.
Wonderful food and decor, however, it was very loud and difficult to have conversations.
Had Sarah as our server & she was great, will definitely go again.
Great food we will be back !
The food was excellent, and our server was very knowledgeable and helpful in terms of making decisions.
On my list of restaurants to experience. So grateful we had the opportunity. The food, service and ambiance were amazing. Such a wonderful place to celebrate anything.
Great staff & great food. They are still setting the standard for fine dining in Portland.

Amazing as always! We’ve never had a bad experience or meal at forestreet. The service is always attentive, every bite is savored, and perfectly portioned meals. Even the mocktails were phenomenal!
Being a vegetarian, you might think a meat and fish heavy menu would be a turn off, but as always their one vegetarian option ALWAYS hits the spot. 
This will continue to be one of our favorite celebratory stops.
There are no words to describe how incredible our meal was at Fore Street.  The service was excellent and the food was amazing.
Our meal was superb in every way. The food and service were excellent. The wine list was a little overpriced, but all in all, one of the best meals ever!

Outstanding experience. Superlative service, delectable food, excellent menu, timely and comfortable seating.  Tables were not densely populated, all the food tasted like it just came off the farm or out of the ocean. Fresh, fresh, fresh.  The oysters were best I've had in some time. Highly recommend this place!!
Simply the best restaurant in Portland, ME...and there are good restaurants there!

Everything from drinks to dessert was superb! Many dishes to choose from. Our choices of hanger steak and spit roasted pork loin were excellent, flavorful and perfectly done. Plenty of wine choices to complement. Roasted oysters were nice app adventure.

As always the service was impeccable, and the food of the best quality.  We really enjoyed the new entry on the menu - the spring asparagus salad.  It was fresh, delicious and a nice choice for a different start to a wonderful dining experience.  Although our server seemed to be very busy with so many tables to take care of she was fantastic.  We can't wait to make the trip (which is over 2 hours away) to dine here again.

Anytime we are in Portland, this is a must to stop in and have a meal.  Even if we are traveling further north and not to Portland, we will come by for a meal. The duck and in particular the scallops were superb this past Monday 4/8. 

We will continue to come back!

Outstanding food 
Lovely surroundings 
Friendly and knowledgeable staff 
A great meal

Fore Street is my absolute favorite restaurant anywhere.  Whenever I am in Portland, I eat there and it is always truly superb in every way. From the opening Fore Street Old Fashioned to the handmade chocolates, from the beautiful, woodsmoke-scented  dining room to the flawless, unobtrusive service, everything is delicious, satisfying, calming and superb.
Amazing environment and staff! Food was delicious and farm to table. Eating local was great and we will be back again soon!

outstanding dining experience. not your average, mediocre pub food, but a thoughtful, well-executed menu. small touches like fresh flowers on the tables give it a lovely atmosphere. love that they highlight local ingredients, including local charcuterie. the shrimp and grits were the best I have ever had. service was kind and attentive.
Dinner was excellent as always.
delicious as always! i’m a vegetarian and throughly enjoyed the kale and chard entree. the bread is to die for and my fisnce loved the pork.
Fore Street never fails to please.  A really flawless meal with perfect service. Similar vibe to Zuni Cafe’ in San Francisco.
Everything was outstanding. Food was amazing and waiter was very attentive. We’lll be back soon.
In all the years I’ve been going to Fore Street, I have never been disappointed. I had the hanger steak and it flavorful and cooked to perfection. If you’re in Portland this is a must try restaurant.
A very relaxing restaurant.  Great menu and service.  Couldn’t ask for more!
It was an all time outstanding dining experience. One my family will recount and cherish for years.
We are always amazed at the level of excellence! Besides our server, who was sleepwalking, we have always loved our experiences at Fore Street! This was another memorable occasion.
Outstanding experience. I would definitely return!
Phenomenal experience— inventive food, quality ingredients, great service, comprehensive bar. This is a restaurant you will remember.
Fore St. never disappoints!   Wait staff is excellent. The food is over the top.  Get the pork loin and cabbage!!

Fore Street never disappoints. They were able to accommodate gluten sensitivities. The cocktails were delicious and they clearly use fresh ingredients. As always the mussels were hearty and tasty. The chicken and steak were both cooked to perfection. My wife and I shared the mashed potatoes which were smooth and flavorful.
Smells. Sights.  Sounds.  Just amazing! Always a great dining experience!
Such an excellent classic! As good as ever! Tenth visit over 15 years is as good as the first.
Server was extremely knowledgeable and helpful.  Building itself was interesting

Our experience was perfection, in all regards, from ease of reservation to quick, welcoming, appropriate service.  We loved the room, the open kitchen, the atmosphere, the menu. The wait staff was attentive, helpful, charming, unobtrusive but observant.  We are foodies and were blown away by how extensive the menu was. We shared appetizers, fresh, briny perfect oysters, beef tartare, and had 3 different entrees.
We will be back every time we come to Portland.  I wanted many more items from the menu, so many appealing options! Thank you for a superlative experience. My host is a hospitality professional with top Boston property & he was impressed. We loved it (& Brendan, too!)

We ate here after nearly a decade since our last visit and it didn’t disappoint. The food was wonderful, Joe, our server was knowledgeable and attentive and the atmosphere was soothing and rich with flavorful smells and an open kitchen which is always nice to see. We will be back again.

We’ve had some pretty amazing food since moving to Maine, but so far this takes the cake. Every course we had was delicious. Never knew something as simple as Caesar salad could be so …special. Tip: ask the waitstaff what they like and you won’t be disappointed. Highly recommend.
Great atmosphere. Great service. Excellent food. Will definitely tell friends and eat at Fore Street often.
The restaurant is so dark it’s hard to see what you’re eating. Slightly more light would be great. Everything else was amazing.

The food and service were excellent.  But it was just too dark to be enjoyable.  Used cell phone to read menu but by the time entrees arrived I literally could not see what I was eating.  Or my husband across the table. It got tiresome to the point where we opted against dessert.  Waiter said the dimness was intentional design choice.  I don’t know that we will be back.  The darkness was very off putting.  So easily remedied,
Always good to dine at Fore Street. As the scene fluctuates in such a foodie town it’s a consistently comforting spot. We had the chicken, haddock and mussels. All perfect.
Fore Street never disappoints. Keep up the great work!
Amazing food and service! We will be back again soon.
110% delicious all these years later. Consistency in quality is hard to keep up with and they knock it out of the park! Not to be missed!

The space is fantastic for starters. I loved the vegetable storeroom in the center where cooks would get their produce.
Four shared dishes - yummy salad and their grilled squid for starters and the monkfish and half chicken for mains - was a lot for two so we were stuffed but squeezed in a gingerbread desert. Fabulous reasonably priced wine - Levantine de Musar to accompany our meal.
Waiter was fun to chat with. Attentive and helpful.
The staff and the food are outstanding and keep us coming back!

Fore Street knocks it out of the proverbial park once again. I’m astonished by the quality and flavor each and every time. Five out of five across the board.

Only minor critique is that the selection of gin could/should be better for us martini drinkers.
Delicious food, great atmosphere, love the open kitchen. Service was excellent!
The food and drinks were amazing & the staff is kind & attentive! The only complaint might be that there seemed to be no vegetarian option on the menu which was a slight disappointment.

We were sat in the back room which is very pretty, dim with candle chandeliers, white lights and quiet. The front is much more lively and louder with a very entertaining open kitchen. We were happy to have a quiet table since it was a romantic dinner for two. Our server was very nice and knowledgeable. Our courses were perfectly spaced and everything from the oysters and steak tartare to the creme brûlée and espresso martinis were delicious. We will be going back!
Good good. Could not read the menu due to low light. Great service. Very loud.
The food here is always impeccably delicious and the waitstaff is professional but fun. Great ambiance!
Great dinner and food was delicious. We had a terrific time
The food was amazing and the wait staff was great!
Some of the meals were just okay average tasting. The mushroom salad was very good as was the gingerbread dessert. The services was great.
Delicious and unique food,, Great service with attention to detail

We arrived 15 minutes early for our rez; joined the queue in the airlock. (We were the 9th & 10th folks)
Hostess unlocks the door but orders us to stay there until she’s ready. You open @ 5, you should be ready to roll at 5; one couple stepped in and we followed staying off to the side to allow the people before us to be taken care of; couple #1 is seated; next party is 4ppl and they’re seated; next 2 folks get seated;
(BYW these were all walk-ins); we step up and this oh-so-welcoming-NOT hostess reminds us that our Rez isn’t until 5:15 and send us to the bar wait section which is furnished with ripped, cracked, leather chairs. Do I want a drink? No! It’s my husband’s birthday and I am beyond angry. Why did I make a Rez while 20 more people who arrived after we did & had no reservations did? And, why on earth wouldn’t you want to seat 2 ppl who arrive early??? We get seated in the side room where a table for 12 was set up. The waiter was condescending and certainly did nothing to make me feel welcomed either. We asked to be reseated and quickly were.
Our new server Alora was genuine & kind. She provided great input and service throughout the evening. The wines she recommended were delicious and the food was great. We live locally and eat out 3-4 times a week. Wherever you’re from, you can always get good grilled meat. There are so many great restaurants in Portland. Go to one of them.
Food was so good. Salad was perfectly tossed with the dressing. Mussels were phenomenal. Scallops were perfect and the toffee desert was a perfect way to end a great meal.
One of the best meals I’ve ever had!  Adam our server was wonderful as were the host staff and the staff at the bar. All 3 courses were exceptional!
Since Fore St opened it has been our favorite restaurant - last night meal was a nice warm winter night out. Joe was and attentive pleasant server; food was (as always) excellent…
This is our second visit to Fore Street and we were once again pleased with the interesting menu, the service and quality of food that had a nice presentation.
This was my second visit. It was outstanding again.
Simply AMAZING!!! Never a bad experience at Fore Street!
My waitress was so great! I asked her name but of course I forgot it overnight... Food was astounding as always.
Always the go to dining experience.  Food and service is always perfect!

Friends of ours recommended Fore Street and it did not disappoint.  We loved the ambiance, the food was unbelievable and our waiter was excellent.  We would highly recommend this restaurant if you are in Portland and looking for a nice dinner!
We celebrated a birthday but were informed we would get dessert on the house but that wasn’t the case. Overall the food was 10/10!!
