Excellent all around! Great food - great service  - great ambience/ this is my favorite restaurant in Portland maybe whole Northeast hands down. Oysters perfection. Salmon beautiful. Halibut buttery. Ginger sticky toffee pudding with pear ice cream- ? What??? Unbelievable. You just have the go here!!! Wine spectacular. Especially pairing with food.
Innovative, interesting, relaxing, cozy, delicious.  We sat in a back area that was quiet and comfortable.  The food was outstanding.
Food was great, Adam,our server was very nice. The atmosphere was a little dark-several people including us had to use our cell phone flashlight just to read the menu
Never disappoints! Fabulous experience, highly recommend.
Such a wonderful way to celebrate an anniversary   The ambiance, service, food and cocktails were top notch.   Still glowing from the evening !
Amazing must stop in Portland if you can get in - food and service are incredible, highly recommend

Incredible food, service and beautiful, warm comfortable facility. An amazing dining experience. Twice we’ve been there and twice have been knocked out by a top notch operation. Can’t say enough good things. Simply awesome.
Dan Street continues to proved an amazing experience. The service, food and value at Fore Street are a solid 10 out of 5!!

Continues to be one of, if not hands-down, the absolute best restaurants in Portland. INCREDIBLE food, menu, cocktails, wine list, service. The only downsides ever are the price and the level of noise. But they are well worth it.
We had a wonderful meal. The food was prepared perfectly, delicious and well portioned. Our server, Joe was excellent. Loved the entire experience.
Fore St is always so good! Everything we had was between solid and exceptional. Such gracious host and service. Happy to get to wat here again!
Love the room love the service like the food a lot.
Always a great dinner. Ambiance and service excellent. Fluke entree was extremely salty - like crusted with salt. Other than that, didn’t disappoint.
Fore St is the best place in Portland! We always eat here.

Aside from having excellent ambience (Wood-burning oven? Check. Endless stream of meats roasting over open-flame? Check. Water views? Check.) the service here is among the best I've ever experienced - shout out to our waiter, Joe. Of course, the food is excellent too, but that shouldn't be a surprise.
This is a perfectly average restaurant with average service and food and a very casual rustic atmosphere. I do not understand how it came to be nearly impossible to get a reservation here.

The table was in a nice location but very dark--could have used a flashlight just to see my plate. The waiter was excellent and very helpful (believe his name was Joe). The apps and desserts were also excellent.  The only dish that was a disappointment was one of the hanger steaks was charred to the point of burnt which made the steak overcooked and chewy.  This is uncharacteristic for Fore Street.
We always appreciate the careful preparation of each item and the exceptional service.  The atmosphere is high caliber without being pretentious.
Always a great meal and super setting. It was surprisingly slow but was a Monday. Waitstaff is attentive and hostess welcoming.
Loved our dinner and the beautiful space however the 9:15 dinner service feels rushed due to closing time.
Made reservations over a month and half and two entrees were not available. Otherwise, cooking was good as usual.

One of the best meals we’ve ever had. The restaurant hits all five senses, starting with the warmth and smell of of the wood smoke from the kitchen. Service was friendly, food outstanding. Be sure to make Fore Street a part of your Portland experience.

Everything ordered was delicious. However, I should have asked for additional candles for the table (there was just one votive type), as we (group of three) could barely see the food when it was served.  That's life with 62 year old vision? Nope - my 26 year old guest remarked as we were finishing that it had almost been too dark to read the menu. Also quite noisy in a happy way, but I suspect anyone with a hearing issue could have difficulty.
The lighting/ noise issues fade in comparison to the wonderful food and exceptional service. I'd definitely return.

Fabulous experience. Excellent service, incredible food. Unique and creative menu. We did various small plates and all were a hit. Some very unique menu items
that are well thought out by someone with a very sophisticated palate. The staff was friendly and well informed on the menu.  Really enjoyed and will be back next time in Portland.
Amazing food and wonderful experience!  Note that you need to book 60 days out to get a decent reservation time.
A fantastic place for an outstanding meal, do not expect a low priced experience, it will be expensive but worth every penny
Delicious meal— service was wonderful, recommend the mussels!

Had a great time with our party of four. Service was impeccable; there was always someone nearby either filling waters, replacing silver ware, taking drink orders, etc. Food was an A+. We never felt rushed, never felt like we were waiting on any particular thing. One of the most enjoyable meals I've had since London in the summer of 2022!
Very good service. Food was excellent. Good options on menu. Wine list had very good selections. Somewhat noisy. Service was on point. Not rushed.
It’s been a few years since we have dined at FS. Food is always wonderful. Waiter was good. Welcome could have been warmer.
We absolutely love Fore Street.  We come 4-5 times a year.  It NEVER disappoints.

This is by far my favorite restaurant in Portland. The staff is amazing, the food is spectacular, the vibe and atmosphere is phenomenal. We love coming to Fore Street whenever we get the chance & will keep coming back!

One of the best meals I’ve ever had! Food is super fresh, service is 12/10 and ambience is perfect for a date night. Very cool space. Menu is a lot bigger than we thought it would be given that it changes daily. We will be back!
We always love dining here. Fore Street never disappoints!

Greg was our server & well versed on the menu; could answer our questions easily. Greg was a joy to talk to & quite charming. We try to eat here each Anniversary, but have missed a few years due to COVID. We are so happy to be back and enjoy this wonderful food!!

Highly elevated comfort food. I forgot how good this place was. It gets better as the meal moves on and you realize you aren't eating delicate tweezer dishes but rather good ole fashioned food that warms the sou.
Excellent food, top notch service & warm, relaxed vibe. Always a treat!
It is always a pleasure to come to Fore Street. The food service and ambience are always exceptional.

Gorgeous rustic decor, excellent A+ service from Adam. Great drinks and food lots of funky choices. I would have liked an additional  beef choice but was very happy with the butternut squash dish I selected. Only thing we didn’t like was the small table by the kitchen area where we were seated. We were roasting from the oven and prefer more privacy than the proximity of the other tables allowed. All in all loved it and will visit again when we return to Portland.
Food was great as always. Friends who had never been enjoyed
A wonderful experience as always.  Food and drink were delicious, service was attentive and friendly.  Thank you!

Lucked out and a 5:30 res came available a night my wife and I were staying in Portland kid free. Absolutely blown away by the experience. Everyone was extremely friendly and attentive. We got the half chicken dinner and seared scallops with garlic mashed and cornbread w butter and brown sugar crumble. Everything was amazing as advertised. I was expecting very good based on what I heard but the exceeded my expectations. Will be back.
This place doesn't need another positive review, so I'll just say that we loved it and can't wait to go again.
Expensive, but excellent quality and service, will definitely be back.
Scallops were lukewarm and quite small, they did not have a whole lot of flavor.  The rest of the parties dinners were more enjoyable.

Outstanding experience even with a few minor misses.  One of the most pleasing decors I’ve been in, the open kitchen was fabulous and really puts you into the restaurant and brings it alive.  The only downside…. It was hot.  The salad was outstanding, the entrees were done perfectly, one side of potatoes was underdone.  Drinks were on point. Dessert was perfect.    Service was prompt and attentive if not a touch cold.  Would 100% go back.
Outstanding service, quality and great interesting choices!  Never have been disappointed at Fore St. Best restaurant in Maine!
One of my favorite restaurants.  Fore Street never disappoints.

We have been going to Fore Street for over 15 yrs. We heard  about from my mom who used to go for yrs. It’s always something special. The ambience is warm, welcoming and takes you back with the brick and wood beams.  Mushroom salad with Radicchio and the blue cheese!!! Yum and the Duck Confit with tagliatelle again was delicious but sadly the salt content on everything we ate was just too much. I did ask my server after having the salad to ask the chef not to add extra salt but I think the confit had already been made and the salt content was just too heavy for me and I couldn’t enjoy my dinner. I know some enjoy salt and think it brings out the flavors but for me it was just too much and made my meal enjoyable. We will go back and before ordering I will definitely ask for no salt to be added to my food.
The food, ambience, and service were all fantastic. Complementary parking in a busy part of downtown Portland is a huge plus as well. Would recommend!

First time back to Fore Street in 8 or 9 years - it DEFINITELY did not disappoint.  Amazing food and atmosphere as always.  The highlight was the side dish of roasted sweet potato with tahini and pistachios (we asked them to leave off the molasses drizzle over the top).  My hanger steak was a perfect medium and melted in my mouth.

Long-time patron of Fore Street and last night's meal was excellent, except for one entree that was practically inedible. I have bought the pork loin dish many times in the past and it's always been excellent, but last night's was objectively a very bad dish. It was poorly seasoned, used a spice rub that got very bitter (perhaps Chinese 5-spice powder), and was served over a bland red cabbage with Pork Jus. 

That said the ambience, the service, and the remainder of the dishes were excellent and up to their usual high standard.

Delicious food! Peking duck and cassoulet mains were great. Pacing between courses was a little off. First course of squid came very quickly, then a 40 min wait for second course. We were seated next to the kitchen and the massive wood fired stove - beautiful, but incredibly hot! Would not recommend sitting here if you have a choice.
Excellent food, great service, excellent atmosphere, my favorite Portland restaurant.

If you’re looking for one of the finer dining experiences in your lifetime, this is in my top five. It’s worth every penny, the staff is friendly, the ambience is amazing. Most importantly, someone who attended the culinary Institute of America this is one of the finer eating establishments on the East Coast. Don’t forget to try standard bakery as well.

Our server, the food and the ambience is always great at forestreet. We’ve been multiple times and will go again. That being said the evening didn’t start off on the right foot. 

They do not open until five and we had a reservation right at that time. The front of the house lead asked us to wait in their entry way (which was inside but drafty and it was a super cold night). 

It filled up quickly with other patrons waiting to get into the actual restaurant and became crowded. On a cold night in Maine in January it felt like a tough start to what is expected to be a five star restaurant experience. They could have let us wait inside the warm, spacious restaurant for 5 minutes…

That being said, food was awesome, as was our server.
Chef Tony executes a thoughtful menu with an elevated take on all dishes. You cannot go wrong with any course you choose. Don’t skip dessert!
Food was amazing and the staff was friendly and accommodating. A great place to celebrate any special occasion.

great restaurant in a "foodie' paradise!!!    Always call ahead and get a reservation.
We go two or three times a year to Portland and always go to Fore street...
Food menu constantly changes but always is interesting but very well presented.
food is great there. no complaints.always look forehead to going there.
Always Delicious.  Terrific for a special occasion!
Fore Street continues to be a favorite.  The service is wonderful and the food is always perfect.

One of the best dining experiences I’ve had in a long time! Wonderful, creative menu and an outstanding server made our night. Perfect ambiance on a cold winter evening.Love all that grilling and oven roasting!
Best dining in Portland!!!!  Hands down!  First class service and of course the cuisine.
Food was outstanding. Waitress was really helpful, friendly and patient in describing the dishes and making recommendations. Great dining experience!

Fine meal, professional service, have dined here often throughout the years.
Was a bit taken back by all the cartilage in the skate, more cartilage than meat. Nice to be able to enjoy fresh skate out.
Incredible service, food was incredible, as always.
Service and food was excellent. Never disappoints.
Celebrated my Grandson's 15th birthday.  Thank you for making the evening so special.  Our server and quality of food made our evening memorable, one we wonf't forget.  Thank you!!

Gin cured salmon appetizer was delicious as was  (unexpectedly)the split pea soup. Even the bread (from their sister bakery is amazing.) We had the shepherds pie and the haddock for mains. The pie (while expensive for such a dish) was amazing. The sauce on the haddock made the dish. Don’t miss the shaved brussel sprouts - best we’ve ever had. Desserts were equally good. Even the drinks were solid - their take on the old fashioned with apple brandy - a good call as was their house cosmo (great citrus flavor.) Great experience all around - highly recommend!
Extensively delicious menu of wood fire roasted meats and vegetables that come together in perfect harmony. Beautiful ambiance and very kind attentive staff.
Another amazing evening at Fore Street. Thank you for delivering another fantastic dining experience.

Don’t wait. For a once-in-a-lifetime exquisite meal, make your reservations today. Fore Street has a well-deserved reputation for outstanding service, elegant and delicious fare, a solid and creative wine list, and an ambiance that reflects the flavor of an outstanding restaurant.

I love Fore St. and always go when I’m in Portland. The appetizer was excellent and the sides as well. The beer was nice and cold. My main entrée, one of their signature dishes: half chicken, however, was not hot and therefore not enjoyable. I’m not the type to complain to my server as he was so lovely, so I picked away at it. The others in my party were very happy with their orders.

This was our second time at Fore Street. The first was not good. This time was much better. The service was excellent, food was very good and a very different menu to choose from. The dining area was very loud in the beginning. I was happy with our second visit to Fore Street but would not put it as our first choice to dine in Portland. 
Portland has some amazing choices for dining and Fore Street and Scales are not the best. I would reccomend it but I would say it is overrated.

Amazing as always.  Staff was attentive and personal.  Menu was to die for.  Cocktails superb.  Wine by the glass is nothing you’ll find anywhere else.  Ambience is 100/10.  Was so lovely to show off to an international friend.  There’s a reason why Fore Street is bar none, the best in Portland.  We should not take her for granted!
Easily one of the best restaurants in this foodie town, however it is noisy.  Lamb leg steak dinner was outstanding, as was the service and pace.

My husband & I had an enjoyable dinner @ Fore Street as we celebrated our anniversary.  The waitress was exceptional as she answered all our questions & served all courses in a timely manner.  The appetizer, entrees and dessert all had a nice presentation and were impressive with flavor & taste.  It was a perfect evening for a special occasion.
It was a fantastic experience all around.  The server at the bar was outstanding and it was just another great night Fore Street.
Authentic and local sourced items makes this restaurant unique, along with bare brick interior . Love seeing the open kitchen and how servers and staff work together, very organized
All I expected. A truly excellent dinner. Wonderful service.
Always amazing food, customer service and ambiance.
Our waiter Adam was outstanding.  We hadn’t visited Portland in five years … so, could it live up to our memories?  Yes!  This is worth the hype,  Congrats Fore St. to your longevity.
We had a great time!  The service was impeccable and we appreciated the great food.
Amazing food and off the charts service. Parking was also a plus.
We celebrated our anniversary with a delicious meal. Food was superb, service was attentive and excellent. A top notch dining experience.
Food, service and ambience was spot on. Great date night. Our server Adam was fantastic and very knowledgeable.  Very relaxed atmosphere.  Can not wait to go back.

We had not been to Fore Street in a couple of years, and going back was certainly a treat.  The menu was amazing but that made it very difficult to decide what to have!! (We should all have such problems...lol)
Our waiter was awesome and I was treated to a Happy Birthday card on our table and our son had called and requested a bottle of Prosecco to be delivered, which it was with a grand flourish!
The meal was terrific-I had scallops, my husband had the duck ragu, and another member of our party had the pork chop.  It was all done to perfection.
Thank you Fore Street for making this birthday celebration an absolute delight.
The star was friendly and the food was excellent!!

Outstanding dining experience.  Great food choices, meals expertly prepared.  Local purveyors.  Helpful staff and excellent service.  Wood burning ovens and spits in the open kitchen add to the ambience.  We love trying different restaurants in Portland, but we always reserve one day of each visit to dine at Fore Street.
Fore St. Continues to be our favorite restaurant anywhere!

We are foodies and always eat in Portland when we visit (which is 5x yearly), regardless of where we land. Though there are many nice restaurants, Fore St. never wavers and is always top shelf. Service is professional, speedy and Sarah and David EXCELL!!!!
Great as always! Thanks very much for the wonderful hospitality.

after all these year’s this is still an absolute gem of a restaurant. great local food and seasoned perfectly. the staff are professional and a delight. i’d return anytime, even just to sit at the bar.

Fore street always delivers.  From the wonderful ambience, to the seasonal menu, accompanied by delicious spirits, Fore Street is a must for dining in Portland.  The chefs always are trying new things and the staff are friendly and helpful.
Fourth Street stand the test of time. Simply the best… Still!

We thoroughly enjoyed our Fore Street experience. The cocktails were perfectly prepared, the staff warm, informative and passionate about their work. Cozy atmosphere that the sight and smell of the open kitchen with the wood burning oven provided. Laid back vibe with brick and warm woods and copper topped tables. The food, yes the food. Super fresh locally sourced seafood and the lamb was exquisite. A smokiness imparted from the turnspit and a  couscous with a honey that provided a perfect counterpoint. Thank you for an amazing meal.
Great food great service an unexpected surprise - loved the mussels
Outstanding food, service, and ambience.  Casual, not pretentious. Table ready at time of reservation. Wonderful experience

We had an amazing time. Our server Sarah was wonderful. For our appetizers, we got the arugula squash salad and the dill and gin cured salmon. Incredible. For our entree we shared the haddock and the Brussel sprouts, both were delectable but the haddock is truly not to be missed. For our dessert we had the gingerbread pudding which was unreal and the English toffee ice cream. It was the perfect meal we hope to be back soon!

Maybe it was because we went in with high expectations because it's so hard to get a reservation here and because of the great reviews, but we were all underwhelmed by the food. My husband's pork was a little dry and lacked flavor, my skate wing was oily from the meuniere sauce. The mussels and the bread/butter were my favorite part of the meal. With so many other good options in Portland, we would not return.
Fore Street is a wonderful dining experience.  It's not a traditional Maine restaurant,  rather one that would be successful anywhere in the country that we're lucky to have in Portland.
Food, service and ambience were all fantastic. The sausage appetizer was was especially good, as was the squash salad.
Best meal ever! The very best roast chicken I have ever eaten! My only regret is that I don’t live in Portland, or else I would be a regular! Treat yourself - you will love this place!
Fore Street always hits it out of the park! I’ve been going there since they opened and enjoy it every time.

The Kettle One Martinin was good; however there was a $3 up charge for “shaking and pouring” the drink!!

My Cosmo was outstanding!

My skate entree was awful. Salty and very messy to eat and was a very unpleasant meal.
Foie gras starter was out of this world! Also the pork coppa main course. Highly recommend!
Excellent food and service. Seating felt a bit crowded.

We have enjoyed Fore Street over the years & we’re happy to return. For us, this is a special occasion restaurant. The restaurant looked beautiful with strings of white lights & glowing stars. We sat comfortably in the bar and my husband enjoyed his Negroni. I found my House Cosmo overly sweet. For dinner we shared mussels which were the star of the evening - large & plump & on top of a garlicky broth that was delicious to sop up with the best bread ever from Standard Baking . We also shared the pork tongue appetizer, chosen for its novelty. The tongue had a deep, rich flavor & the potato latke it was served on was a marvel of crispy shreds. After much discussion we split the entree of spit roasted chicken wanting to experience the cooking method Fore Street is known for. I have enjoyed other entrees ordered in the past more. The white meat was a bit overcooked & the dish wasn’t remarkable. Our side of Brussels sprouts surprised us ; we must of misread the menu. The vegetable came shredded- we had expected roasted . I would have selected a 4.5 if possible because the two appetizers were outstanding & we had an excellent bottle of wine.
Attentive and timely service, amazing food and atmosphere.

I am always so pleased with any interaction with Fore St. Almost ten years ago I first stepped in for a quick drink and now we go for our most cherished occasions. This last visit we were there to celebrate the solstice. Our server, Alec, was knowledgeable, kind, and clever. I was able to finagle paying for the check without my parents fighting for it, thanks to him and a helpful front of house staff.

The food is paced so that you can both enjoy it and feel like time is flying. It comes to the table hot and perfect, and while it’s rich you can tell the quality of ingredients because it feels nourishing.

I am so grateful that Fore Street is here in Portland.
All the food was fresh and delicious and we loved the wine we got!
Amazing as always! Everything was excellent and made the birthday so special!

Overall great atmosphere for a romantic anniversary dinner. Wasn’t blown away with the food preparation or cocktail list & was hoping it would be a little more special for an anniversary maybe a special dessert would have been nice.

If you appreciate fine dining and a complex flavor profile that sends you into a happy dance then THIS IS THE PLACE! I don’t think there is a better restaurant in Portland. From the moment you arrive to the moment you walk out the door you’re treated like a treasured guest! Almost like you’re the only one there and they’re thrilled to serve you the best of food and drink. I can’t say enough great things about it- you’ll just have to experience it yourself.
Fore Street is one of my top three restaurants in Portland.  Wonderful, attentive, knowledgeable severs with way creative, thoughtful twists on traditional favorites.  Warm and inviting ambiance
Food choices and wine both delicious. Server Greg did a great job and made rec’s when asked. Atmosphere was very nice. Will definitely go back if can get a reservation. Often hard to get into.
Everything we ordered was delicious. Service was exceptional.

I have been dying to go here for years and finally went this weekend. It did NOT disappoint. I love that the kitchen is open, there is a rotating menu so even if you go frequently, there is always something new. I will 100% be back!

Lovely from start to finish.  Can’t say enough about our experience.  We never felt rushed, our server was attentive without being overbearing and the good was sensational. I see why there’s a two month wait for a reservation.

Well done!
Nice ambiance and great food, service was excellent
Always a pleasant experience. Good food is a given.
Very tasty in smaller portion sizes.  Great location behind our hotel.

Fore Street is the best restaurant that I've visited in Maine. We are repeat customers at Fore Street. The menu is varied which is great and they use locally produced products. The ambiance, service and food presentation is top notch.

We had not been here for 10 years. We both had high expectations and everything was excellent. Great energy, wonderful drink and food selections and our waiter Joe was helpful and knowledgeably. We will come back again soon.
Always a great meal.  Locally sourced food prepared well.  Doesn't get any better than that.

This is the second time this month I visited Fore Street. Last time the dish I ordered was really bad so had to say something. Last night we ordered the lamb shank. It is NOT a lamb shank. It’s a few shreds of meat (had to search for the meat!) on top of a pasta dish. Definitely not worth it. Sorry to say that my favorite restaurant has not lived up to my expectations. I’m not typically someone who complains, but within this price range, this is not acceptable.
Everything was fabulous.  Our server shoe was terrific! The food was so amazing.  I highly recommend this restaurant!

We returned to Fore Street after 20 years and it was even better than our dreamy memories. Despite the fact that the restaurant was full, we had a cozy table for two in a second room. Our winter meal of cassoulet and fabulous wine was splendid. Our knowledgeable server made the meal seamless. It was an all-time wonderful experience.

Fore Street is known for consistency. They delivered in spades last night with a truly flavorful menu that had all our favorites as well as new stars. Service throughout the evening from every single staff member was really fantastic. Thank you to every person at Fore Street for delivering a truly exceptional experience.
I have been going to fore street for 23 years and as usual it was perfection !

The service was excellent without being overwhelming with interruptions.  The quality of the meals were all very good and the bar pours were generous. You need to be prepared for a$100/person w/tax & tip meal but it is not a place you would go on the spur or weekly.  Reservations are a must!
Wonderful place to celebrate a birthday - especially if you appreciate a brilliant culinary scene - the open kitchen and the recommendations of wine from the server made our dinner wonderful.
As always, fabulous.  The best restaurant in New England.

The restaurant is certainly one of the best in Portland. Doesn't have the most options for vegetarians but certainly has some great choices. Staff is extremely kind and helpful. Definitely will go back but maybe save it for a special occasion based on prices.
Loved the food, ambience with the open grill/wood fired oven, and service was exceptional.
We enjoyed a lovely Anniversary dinner. All was excellent but the gingerbread steamed pudding with pear was sublime.  Our server was helpful and very nice!
Perfection, same as the last time we were there about 20 years ago.  Outstanding staff and meals.

The service was excellent!!!  From the time we arrived, everything was wonderful.  We were quickly seated at our table greeted by our waiter, given time to make our beverage, starter and meal choices.  All was served promptly but not rushed.  Plates were cleared efficiently.  Overall, service was excellent.

The food was superb.  I had scallops and my partner had haddock.  EXCELLENT, both.

Very nice wine selection.

The experience was pricy, but wonderful nonetheless.
Fantastic, the absolute best restaurant in Portland!

If your trying to decide where to dine. Just think of one place Fore Street Restaurant. 

You will not be disappointed
Such a amazing find! The service and attention to detail makes it clear that their guests are their first priority. Excellent food and drink as well. Definitely will be back.
Just relocated to the Portland area. We’ve tried many places in the City, but this one is tops on our list so far!  Perfect in every way!
Food wasn’t good as usual unfortunately. But the server was very nice and try to make up for it. Disappointed.

While our out of town dinner guests had a wonderful meal, I was beyond disappointed that the kitchen was unable to effectively accommodate my lactose intolerant dietary requirements.  There were no seafood options presented - broiled fish with non dietary sides would have been simple, wonderful, and appreciated.

Lovely evening. Great service. Nice wines. The food came out too fast, though. Depending on where you’re sitting and who’s around you, it can be loud. Was loud initially, but got quiet once that party left. Was the first time we’ve eaten there is about 20 years. Glad we went back. We were not disappointed. :-)
Fore Street has been one of our very favorite restaurants for many many years! They never disappoint and to be able to sit and dine at the bar is the best!
Amazing meal.   Will not disappoint!  5 stars!!!!!

Taste of food overall, ok not great.
Portions, very small!!
Person taking our order, did not explain the menu; well at all.  Did not get what I had ordered!
Too many servers involved, causing lack of proper service at our table.  Satisfaction, of our dining experience; seemed unimportant.
Fore Street, is very expensive for what you are served & how it tastes.  Unable to measure value.
Excellent food and service.  Service was attentive and the timing of the courses was excellent and professional.
Great food and service.   Annoying that the website said parking in lot of Standard Bakery ok to park in.  But there were signs everywhere that said permit required.
Fantastic meals! Very cool restaurant, our waiter was lovely and very knowledgeable and recommended some great dishes. Can’t wait to come back!
The overall experience was great.  We love Fore Street.
Best overall restaurant experience and food I have had in a long time if not ever!! Wow!
LOVE LOVE LOVE Fore Street. It’s one of my favorite restaurants of all time.
A destination restaurant by most any definition.  We were also treated royally, celebrating our combined birthday and anniversary.

Fore Street never ceases to exceed expectations.  The setting is open,  inviting and warm.  The room hums with conversations and the aromas emanating from the open kitchen.
The service was prompt, professional and well informed about all of the food selections, attentive but never hovering.
The food is outstanding and beautifully presented with unique tastes and sauces to excite the palate.
The menu changes frequently and the vegetables are selected from numerous local farms daily, the seafood is fresh from the daily catch from the fishermen docks across the street, the beef, pork, foul and lamb are delightful and are excellent fare.
If you want great food in Portland, please treat yourself to a delicious meal at Fore Street.
Book the reservation, you won’t regret it! This was one of the best restaurant meals we have ever had and the service was excellent

Very enjoyable evening.  Great service, and everything we had was delicious.  We especially enjoyed the brussel sprout and apple salad and the beef tartar.  It had been many years since we ate there and hope to go again soon.
This is one of the best restaurants in New England

Street’s places have the most consistent service in Portland. Attentive, knowledgeable, friendly and just the right balance of pace. Food is as usual fabulous, had half chicken, oysters, squid, and dessert. Solid wine list, cocktail service in the bar was prompt even though it was busy. And oh yeah the bread from Standard, sublime…
Simply one of the top two meals I have had in my lifetime. I am 72 years old.
The staff was incredibly kind, knowledgeable and accommodating. The food was unbelievable; definitely a meal to remember.

If you’re going to Portland, eat here! The hostess was fabulous and had us wait an extra 5 minutes in the bar to ensure we had the best seat for our anniversary. The server we had could not have been better. The food and drinks were spectacular. The atmosphere of Fore Street is the best I’ve had in a long time. I don’t typically write reviews, but this place was honestly great.
Remarkably good chef and kitchen staff supported by terrific wait staff and ambience. A great place for a special occasion or when you just want to treat yourselves.
Amazing food, service and atmosphere. Each dish we selected was delicious. Wonderful dining experience.

Joe, our server made the evening!  Best service we have had in a long time. He was engaged and efficient in spite of being very busy.  We began with the gin and dill salmon and had the morel pasta and pollock with lobster sauce, both were well prepared and delicious. The sides of Brussels sprouts and sweet potatoes were good, but nothing to rave about. The homemade chocolates for dessert were a perfect finish to our meal. The building itself is worth a visit, but the food and service made itt top notch.
My guests from NYC were very impressed with the total package of FS.  They particulary the mussels
As always, an excellent meal and great service from everyone! The fish was delicious and the garlic mashed potatoes were amazing.

Fore St delivers on all fronts.  Terrific ambiance.  Elegant and casual at the same time.  Service is always perfect.  Standard Baking Co bread is a great start.  The food hits all the right notes. Loved the brussel sprouts and apple salad to start and the apple Brown Betty to finish.  Halibut and pork loin entrees were both winners.  Food is pricey, as are the drinks, but we left very happy with our evening.

Superb first experience at Fore St .
Definitely, we will return.
We had an amazing experience. The food was excellent and our server Joe was so welcoming and made the dinner exciting.

Our waitress Kelly was amazing. She made the dinning experience spectacular by more than just taking our order and spending some time to chat with us. I worked in F&B for a long time and the server can make or break the dining experience, and in this case, Kelly made it even more memorable. Huge Thank you
The open kitchen concept was great as well. Being able to watch the food being prepared with such passion and attention to detail made for a high level of anticipation for each plate to arrive at our table. 
The food was absolutely incredible. The presentation, the quality, and the overall taste was stellar. I will make Fore Street a regular stop every time I visit Portland.
Fore Street is a special treat. The menu is unique and changes daily.

I have not been to Fore Street for over 20 years and was really looking forward to experiencing again. I’ve only heard good things about it and supposed to be one of the best restaurants in Maine and it’s very hard to get into. But to be honest, the atmosphere was fantastic, but I was disappointed in the service, and didn’t find the food to be extraordinary. The staff walked by our empty plates repeatedly ￼ for nearly 20 minutes, before finally clearing, I just found that annoying.

My husband and I came to Fore Street Kitchen for an anniversary dinner and had the most wonderful experience.  The service was amazing and the food was exceptional. We would absolutely recommend this place to anyone and everyone!

Fantastic food, service, presentation on dishes, wine list, knowledge of staff. Innovative dishes that will not disappoint. Atmosphere is vibrant but will not disappoint for a special occasion , business dinner, or night out. Watch the chefs work in the open kitchen as you munch yummy bread. The menu changes daily or very often so that recommending a specific dinner is not possible.  Just go and enjoy.  Very busy so you might want an early reservation.
We were celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary and could not think of a better place to celebrate. Thank you for another great experience and fantastic meal….
In a city filled with award winning restaurants, this meal stood out. Unique preparation, beautifully plated and attentive, friendly service.

We booked outdoor for dinner as the weather was perfect (and it was). While the seating on the sidewalk (4 tops) is on a bit of a busy road, it was still pleasant and the chairs are actually comfortable.
The menu has three sections and guest are encouraged to order 2-3 plates.
We had the “famous” Bread order which was amazing (liked but didn’t love  the butter but not the egg yoke spread, but the homemade bread is to die for). Followed by the Asparagus dish with foamy hollandaise sauce, the lobster agnolotti and the large last plate was the pork chop - which, while a little heavy of the fat content, it melted in your mouth and was seasoned perfectly.
Our waitress was friendly and helpful with dish selection. The wines by the glass were very good and good value. Overall, great food and wine, little pricy for the size of portions (except the pork chop), and a slightly limited menu. Give it a very good and we will definitely come back again.

The food was over thought and lacking focus. The lobster agnolotti was dull and the over powering xo sauce didn't allow the delicate lobster flavor through but accentuated iodine of the lobster from over handling/age. The short rib would have been better if each bite were composed rather than a catch all of too many flavors competing. The hamachi collar was excellent with grilled pineapple, radish and jalapeno. The breads were excellent.

I dined here with my sister and two friends; none of us had ever been before. In my reservation I had noted it was my sister's birthday. When we sat down, the menus had "Happy Birthday" printed on them! What a nice touch. 
Everything we had was delicious- we split everything. We left satiated, not stuffed. The presentation and attention to detail was wonderful. 

The only thing we were surprised by was no cocktails- it was apertifs (that could be made into a spritz), beer, and wine. I probably missed this when researching the place. But the wine was delicious. I'll definitely go back!
Amazing meal. Everything was super fresh and delicious. Can’t wait to go back.
Really incredible food and service! Such interesting dishes

Excellent attention to providing a rewarding dining experience from the ambiance, service, and finely prepared menu offerings.  Highly recommend Bread and Friends for dinner (seasonally).  Our first time there but eager to get back to try their brunch.

You can come here for breakfast, pastries, coffee, brunch, bread, or dinner, and know it’s the best decision you’ve made. They always hit, so happy dinner service is back. Sometimes it’s a little too good and we have to come for breakfast and dinner in the same day.

We had a great experience at Bread & Friends and would definitely recommend it! Wait staff was friendly, attentive, and kind. Food was so enjoyable - unique and full of flavor. We also enjoyed our drinks (spritz, wine and beer). Lastly, such a nice touch - the restaurant had printed “happy birthday” menus for our occasion which was a lovely sentiment!

This is easily our favorite restaurant in Portland and we have been excitedly waiting for dinner service to begin again for the season. The meal was hands down the best I’ve had all year. The food is innovative and delicious while being visually appealing. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable about the cuisine and drink pairings. The alcoholic and nonalcoholic beverages are all thoughtfully selected. The setting is unpretentious, bright and comfortable. My husband and I are pescatarian and generally expect to only be able to have a handful of dishes on any menu. The dinner we had on 6/21 only had 3 meat dishes which was a dream for us! I can’t recommend this restaurant highly enough.

The food and service were excellent and the ambiance perfect for conversation. I will go here again in a heartbeat. The only downside was that there were only 2 dessert offerings one of which was not available even though we were and early seating
The staff was extremely friendly. The food was unbelievable. And the drinks and desserts were delicious! Will be dining here again!

The food was outstanding, every bite a delight! Very accommodating for a variety of dietary needs. Service was friendly and efficient. Sometimes the wait staff explained dishes too quickly and quietly for us to hear and understand. The cocktails were very sweet-forward, which is not to our taste, and the two tops are too close together for any privacy. It was also very warm in the restaurant.

One of the most well executed, delicious, and impressively unique meals I’ve experienced.  My only hope is they obtain a full liquor license someday.  An exceptional addition to Portland’s vibrant foodie scene.

The food here was PHENOMENAL! My partner and I shared 4 of the smaller plates and still had room for dessert. I’m more of a foodie than my partner, but she did say that the squid dish was so good it “bullied me into mindful eating” (seriously though, I’ve never seen her close her eyes for every bite of a dish before) 

The staff were attentive, engaged, and receptive to questions. It was a wonderful experience and I encourage anyone curious to try them out-it’s well worth it!
Very friendly service, great presentation and tasty food. You do need to share a lot of plates to be full full as the pasta dishes are quite small. Very good though.
First time! Great experience overall. Smore tartlette was divine!
Absolutely incredible. Flavor combinations were amazing. Great service. Intimate setting. Highly recommend.

We had a lovely dinner, we ordered 6 plates for 2 people, which was a little bit more food than we needed, but every dish was spectacular. our favorite dishes were the tuna tartar and the endive salad.
Bread and friends is delicious! Such care taken with every dish. They care about what they put in front of you and it shows! Highly recommend!

An amazing selection of about 15 items, and everything we ordered was creatively and artistically prepared. Small plates. Unique Decour, setting was wonderful. Service was absolutely impeccable.
An experience not to be missed if you’re going to Portland

I’ve been a morning bread and pastry patron (wonderful offerings in the AM) and went for dinner for the first time. We met the chef who has created creatively delicious dishes. Only a matter of time before it gets even more positive publicity. Vibe is very chill (even better after the table of way too loud people left).

We got lucky stumbling into Bread & Friends! Being that they just started doing dinner a couple months ago, there weren’t many reviews but I promise this place will be hard to get reservations for in the future! It is a MUST try. They crush it in all aspects, dinner was so good we were back 16 hours later for brunch. You will not be disappointed!

All of the shared plates were amazing! The bluefin tuna was so delicious. The charred carrots were so delicious and prepared so well. Duh- it’s called Bread and Friends- try the bread app and the seaweed butter is way better than it sounds.
Had the pasta special on Sunday- corn agnolliti which was delicious too. It is only beer and wine for drinks but lots to choose from. My only callout is to have a heavier red wine by the glass- it’s Fall.. go big! Staff is amazing as well!

The server (Jack) was fantastic! Guided on the menu items and was knowledgeable on the ingredients and amounts of food sufficient for two people. The food was delicious but almost too rich, could use some lighter options. Would 100% go back.
Everything was soooo tasty. Our server Jack was splendid. I can’t wait to go back!

Creative unique dishes and flavors, tapas style sharing, locally sourced ingredients, very vegetarian friendly, casual fine dining atmosphere, good service despite a very busy night—ticked all the boxes. Will try again, and hear the brunch is worthwhile too.
Love everything about this place. Dined for dinner and returned the next morning for brunch. My one wish is that they were closer to my hometown. Can’t wait to return.

This place is new with dinner service but so so so good. The Japanese eggplant was divine and the steak for 2 was perfection. The chicken livers were silky and the vegetables were fresh and crisp and a perfect accompaniment. I loved everything about this meal. We’re going back again tonight!
Fantastic meal. Still thinking about the bread!
Everything was great! They ran out of dessert and gave us a hot peach cobbler pop tart instead that was out of this world!
Wow! 10/10…really unique, flavorful dishes. The corn agnolotti was one of the best pastas I’ve ever had. Every dish was exceptional. Don’t miss the bread starter!
Inventive, creative, and flavorful.  The use of local ingredients combined with talented chef and gracious service lent to a memorable culinary experience.

The salad we had (lettuce and corn) was outstanding.  The other dishes were okay.  The fried eggplant seemed to have no eggplant, just fried breading.  The pasta dish was good but to salty.  We were encouraged to order 5 dishes for 2 of us; 4 would have been plenty.
Keeps getting better and better! We'll be back soon!

Bread and Friends is my new favorite restaurant. If there is any other restaurant within driving distance of Portland that has food fresher, more beautifully presented or with such appealing flavors, I need to know about it immediately.

I started with the melon and heirloom tomato salad which is enhanced by a delicious and pretty generous amount of duck prosciutto - amazing. Had a bite of my friend’s grilled corn and butter lettuce salad, and I can tell you I’ll be ordering it (please let it still be on the menu) next time I come in.

Entree tastes were also shared - we couldn’t agree which was more delightful - the crispy Japanese eggplant (with accompanying grilled shishito peppers and cherry husk chutney) or the pappardelle all’amatriciana (with incredibly fresh chanterelles and basil as well as pecorino romano cheese). Both were just beyond tasty and again, I have to emphasize the freshness of every ingredient. 

We also shared a bottle of their South African Chenin Blanc and found it a great accompaniment to our food.

Had to go for dessert - a blueberry mille fois and a chocolate tart. Had we been alone in the room, there might have been some plate licking. Not really (but maybe). 
 
Also need to mention the service - helpful, friendly, informed and obviously big fans of the restaurant themselves. Atmosphere is conducive to a great dining experience (we were able able to have most of our meal on the charming outdoor patio, but staff quickly found us a table inside for dessert when it began to rain - thanks!

Kudos to all. Time for me to make another reservation.

This was our first time here for Dinner service and we were blown away! Each dish was unique, delicious, and beautifully presented. The staff was knowledgeable and attentive. Looking forward to a return visit!

My husband and I chose Bread & Friends for our anniversary dinner. Being from Nashville, TN we have a ton of amazing options, and we’re also weary of over priced “small plate” and “shareable” spots as we unfortunately have those in Nashville as well - this was not the case in any regard! Every dish was well worth the price. The art, thoughtfulness, and overall energy put into the entire experience shows. We left full and feeling so cared for by Bread & Friends. Thank you for an incredible culinary experience!
A gem, with multiple facets: excellent food, service, and ambiance.

Fantastic meal! Have already been blown away by the breakfast and pastries. Their dinner program adds a new level of experience to this already special place. The sweet corn agnolotti was easily one of the best things I’ve ever eaten.
Wonderful staff and fresh oysters!

Fantastic restaurant - the oysters and sauces were amazing. Loved the way the different types of oysters all are on display. Had a great lobster roll too. The oyster-shaped cookies are a must for desert. Great service too!
Amazingly good!!!!  If you like Oysters- you will be smiling ear to ear.
My new favorite restaurant in Portland, Maine!  Staff and food are both amazing. Top notch on everything and great prices!
Awesome place very accommodating. Great people!
John and his crew kill it. Great experience!
Fabulous food, service, vibe, everything!
Very cozy, welcoming place with delicious food and specialty drinks. My out-of-town guests said they wished they had a place like this in their town!!

I went with some family members to celebrate my fathers 95th and my brothers 65th birthdays. They love oysters and wanted to try this place for our first time. The oysters were delicious as we shared three dozen between the 5 of us. The only down side was the music. My father is hard of hearing as it is and it's becoming very difficult for him to go out to eat pretty much anywhere these days due to noise levels. Wish restaurants would take the older customers into consideration with this problem. Other than that our time here was wonderful!

If you like fresh oysters, this is definitely your place (there are oysters from 10+ local growers).  You can seen your oysters still in the shell before they are shucked.  Great selection of local brews too.

 We were there on a Thursday, so we got to meet the growers as well.  Excellent selection of local beers too.  This is the kind of small, locally sourced restaurant that Portland should be known for.
Food was truly meh but the ambiance was nice and service was excellent.

Very pricey and the portions are tiny. It’s funny because they say the meals are shareable… but they are too small to share. $38 for a pasta dish and it was gone in 4 bites. Way over hyped!!!! Won’t be going back
Server was very knowledgeable and helpful, food portions were moderate which is fine by me, taste was excellent. I would recommend them.
Everything was Outstanding! Food, service, atmosphere - it was our 2nd visit in a week and we are trying to figure out how to fit in another night before guests head home.
Possible to love a restaurant more? Our server was so wonderful. The pesto pasta dish, and the one with mushrooms. Stunning. Some of the best pasta I’ve ever had!
Delicious meal and great ambience. We will certainly return.
One of the best restaurant experiences we’ve had in a long time. Highly recommend Solo Italiano
Excellent meal and enjoyed eating at the bar - mixologist was a pro, made amazing cocktails.
The best dinner we have had in in some time .Great service Salad was great entrees fabulous , dessert wonderful .

We were so looking forward to our meal at this restaurant. We had dined there two years ago and had an exceptional experience. We walked in and there was no air conditioning in the main dining room and even though we asked the hostess she basically said it wasn’t getting fixed. So we had to request to sit in a cooler spot.

The bar service was unacceptably slow but moreover the meals that we had lacked complete flavor and innovation from our prior experience. It was clear to us that there had been a change in chef. Many of the items were called the same thing for example, the smoked Butatta, but we definitely not what we had enjoyed two years ago.

We we expected the flavorful fluffy light and airy focaccia of two years ago and we were served a flatbread with gooey cheese in the middle.￼

The $65 New York strip was fair at best, tough and thin. The bok choy that accompanied it tasted like dishwater.

We also had a rack of lamb that came with four small lamb lollipops, and the halibut was the size of a half a graham cracker and dry. we ordered a second round of drinks just before our main course and they never showed up and we had to request to take them off our order. Overall, this was a $500 meal for four people and we left the restaurant sad, and hungry.￼
￼

The food was excellent. Best Italian I’ve had anywhere, even in Sicily and many towns in Italy, north and south. So fresh with amazing flavors. I recommend their signature pesto dish, Mandilli al Vero Pesto Genovese, the King Edward Island mussels (dip the homemade bread in the broth) and have the Torchietti con Sugo d’Ipppoglosso. The service was really, really good. Overall, a wonderful experience. Can’t wait to go back.
Good food but small portions of pasta and fish.  Friendly wait staff.
Food was amazing restaurant is beautiful would highly recommend this restaurant for some of the best Italian food you will eat
Delicious food but overpriced for the portion size and quality
Creative, delicious food and excellent service. Don’t miss the pesto pasta!

Solo Italiano is one of the best restaurants in Portland. The food, wine, and service are always top notch. We brought friends who were visiting from out of town, one of which is a Chef. They were so in awe of the food!
Always love Solo italiano,, will be back.  Thanks for a great meal
Food is good but way overpriced and super small portions.

4 adults and a 10 y.o., best meal we have had I n years, tuna appetizers were delicious, mandrill was spectacular, salad ingrediants were fresh, other pasta dishes were also fabulous. Deserts were great. Waitress was great in explaining the various dishes. All in all a great dining experience.
We were told about Solo from several sources, about how outstanding it is. For the most part, the food and service were very good. The gonfietti was outstanding.
Exceptionally prepared food, but you may wait a while to get it.

Really special food. Great waitstaff. Only negative was noise. Need to get table in quiet nook  otherwise the noise interfere with relaxation and enjoyment of meal. They should install sound absorbing modifications to the loud echo-y space
Bestbitalian food I've had in a long time.  Better than anything in the North End. The veal was out of this world.  Great experience and we will be back.
The food was delicious, the ambience lovely, and the service excellent.  We would definitely eat there again.
Solo is consistently high quality food with great service.  A favorite, go - to place.
Awesome food, great service and overall a definite must for date night!

Had to ask for bread and water.
Slow “European” service.
No assertion of recommendations.
Not proactive waitstaff.
Casual service. Upscale food.
Small portions.
Food was good but portions were extremely small for the price. Service was just ok.

Swordfish, pasta, and scallops were excellent!

Wine was fantastic!

Food was outstanding with various flavors in every bit that you can individually taste which elevates the experience. The portions however are quite small (compared to traditional American cuisine) however the food was amazing!
We had a starter, salad, entrees and desserts. Each course was incredible! Made for a terrific place to celebrate my son’s graduation.
The waitress was friendly and a pleasure to deal with
Server was great. Food was DELICIOUS!! Definitely recommend Solo.
It was fantastic. Could not be beat well done. Will be back and will send others
We loved it! Beautiful meal, lovely service. Highly recommend!
Whatever else you order, the handkerchief pasta with pesto, and focaccia is a must; intuitive service, great food, beautiful decor, highly recommend
Excellent service and very knowledgeable waiter. Food was wonderful. Very fresh ingredients and beautifully seasoned and cooked.

Alcohol specifically rum was local did not care for the taste. Soda was local not Coke or Pepsi products. Food was excellent portions were fine price was extremely high. For $ 250.00 I expect a much finer dinning experience.

We visited on June 15 for an early light dinner. My wife had a gnocchi special which tasted reheated and was nothing memorable. I had a pesto pasta dish which was a very small portion, with a delicate, not very flavorful sauce. We were both disappointed in the meal. And we both felt the prices were quite high for what we were served. We were very disappointed and we would not recommend Solo Italiano.

We went early in the evening on a recent Saturday. The service was so, very attentive. The food was really fresh, prepared expertly and with respect for the attributes of the local ingredients. We will definitely return seasonally to experience the menu that will, I'm sure, will continue to adapt to what is available.
Excellent food; NY prices. Delicious options for vegetarians
The food is always delicious and the staff are excellent. This time we enjoyed the pasta and dessert. Both were exceptional!
We always enjoy eating at Solo Italiano.  The food is excellent.  The space is nice.  Our server Zoe was kind and attentive.
Better than the best in New York and Paris.  It is a very special restaurant.  Although the plates are small, the dishes are so satisfying.
The halibut was delicious.   Service was impeccable.   Lovely restaurant.

Service was the sore spot for us. For an upscale restaurant, we had to constantly chase someone down to order, get drinks,etc. Food was average to slightly above average. Menu was somewhat limited, but it should have enough items for everyone. Probably not a place we would return to.
Fabulous food from appetizers to mains and desserts. And great service and ambiance
Another amazing meal at one of our favorite restaurants in Portland.
This is a favorite for me!  Service is excellent, sharing is encouraged and its beautiful space with a great vibe.  Solo Italiano never disappoints!
Always a great experience! The authentic food and the amazing ambiance.
I had the rack of lamb. It was outstanding, as was all the food.
Wonderful setting, great attentive but not intrusive service, and outstanding northern Italian food.

Knowing how well this restaurant prepares fish, I ordered their thinly sliced sword fish in a steak sauce (meaning steak drippings, not BBQ sauce or the like!) and it was FABULOUS!  Tender, flavorful fish with mushrooms and other veg's.  Simply superb.  The bread to start was also fabulous, and the service quietly and well done. The tables are far enough apart that the sound level is fine.

Great professional service 👏.
Very good authentic Italian food.
Outstanding waitress. Maybe Megan???
Just great.
Superb food.  Service was excellent, and our food came at an appropriate, unhurried pace.  Great place for special occasions, as it is a bit pricey but the food and service was well worth the cost.
One of the best meals of our Portland trip. Service and food were both impeccable. Would definitely recommend .

Everything was incredibly delicious, and our wait person really took care of us. I took a friend there for dinner, and it was a perfect way to celebrate. Will definitely go back next time I'm in Portland.

It was our anniversary and I included this information when I made the reservation.  It would have been nice to get a complimentary dessert rather than just 'happy anniversary' written in Italian in chocolate on the plate of cookies we purchased.  We had a bill of nearly $200 for 2 people, $240 including tip and a dessert would have been very nice.  So many other restaurants do this and it builds customer good will.

The food was very good, and the price certainly reflected the quality of the ingredients and preparation. Our server was great and provided very helpful recommendations. However, our visit started off on a sour note as it took a while for the host to acknowledge our group when we arrived. There were two hosts at the host table, one of them was having a conversation with another guest which is understandable, but the 2nd host didn't even attempt to make eye contact with us or  welcome us so we just stood there for 2-3 minutes waiting.
Amazing service and pacing! Everything was delicious. We loved the sage focaccia with burrata and my favorite was the panna cotta. A perfect birthday dinner, would definitely come back again!
The best of the best. Solo Italiano is the next best dining experience outside of Rome.
Amazing experience as always. Don't skip the gonfietti with prosciutto and burrata. Best item on the menu in my mind. But let's be honest, there isn't a bad choice to be had at Solo.

Wonderful every time we visit..  phenomenal menu , service & food.

Cappuccinos were also fantastic!

Our favorite Portland eatery.

Solo Italiano never fails to deliver. Our favorite spot to dine as a date night, family dinner, or to celebrate special occasions. The food is always incredible and the service is second to none. Thank you!

We went to celebrate our anniversary and unfortunately we were underwhelmed. 

When I arrived I stood in front of the host stand with 2 hosts and I think a manager having a conversation and it took quite awhile until someone even acknowledged me.

The waiter we had was fine but flat. Heard a waitress next to us explaining the menu, meal details and drink specials to another table; we got none of that from our waiter.

The food was good but the prices are high for what you get. Restaurant aesthetics are lovely. 

Last year we went to Scales for our anniversary and they had a note card with a lovely message, service was excellent and food was excellent. They made our night special.  That is what I hoped our experience would have been at Solo Italiano.

I would come back for a drink and appetizer possibly but unlikely I would spend that kind of money for another meal.

Excellent food done well. I have seen reviews that people leave hungry because the portions are small. If they order correctly, they will have no problem. This is not the kind of place where you order JUST the pasta and think that is going to cut it. This is not Olive garden. You have to order the full deal like 2-3 courses. We had the pasta with mushroom sauce, muscles, beat salad, the strip steak and the cod. Dessert was the choc tort and the panna cotta. Outstanding.  Thank you for a nice evening out.
Amazing!!!! The service and food was excellant!! !!

We ate at Solo Italiano recently and had a nice dining experience. Overall, our food was outstanding, though our coffees and desserts were not up to the same standard as our other courses. The ambiance was very nice. In particular, the restaurant was very quiet, though we were there on the early side. The biggest negative was our waitperson who I felt could have been much more welcoming. Also, he/she forgot one of the courses that we had ordered. Nevertheless, we will return to Solo Italiano for the food which was really excellent.
Food was spectacular, even better than the first time we dined there.

Just wonderful in every way! Bravo!!
We live the staff, food and service. Great location!
Expensive. Food and service was exceptional. You get what you pay for
absolutely delicious meal.  Everything we ordered was first class - you won't get better in NYC (or Italy).  Also outstanding service.

Beautiful restaurant with the most pleasant staff. Sharing is encouraged so it would let you order course after course to experience different flavor profiles. You could come and have a more formal experience or “business casual” was more the norm. We felt comfortable asking questions and our server was lovely. It was a wonderful and relaxed experience. Parking is the usual problem for downtown Portland. If you can’t get a space on the Main Street, there is “pay parking” along the side street beside the restaurant $20 for two hours.

Top my mother, wife and daughter her last evening. Our waitress was very good however the food was just OK and the portions were very small. Definitely not worth the high price we paid. So many better places to each in the Old Port that cost less.

Bill was $300 and we didn’t even have dessert and left hungry. We will not be going back.

I was introduced to solo through their famous pesto, which used to be sold at their sister market. I'm so glad I could make it out to the restaurant because the night was incredible. Our knowledgeable server helped us craft the perfect meal with an amazing wine pairing. Can't wait to go back.

We have eaten here at least five times over 3 years and recommend it highly. The cocktails are wondrous and so is the bar staff. The pasta, salads and focaccia are outstanding. I was however disappointed in the bluefish entree cooked in parchment with pesto, garlic and artichokes - did not let the blue fish's unique flavor shine, paper did not let the fish oil drain, too much garlic flavor. Kind of chewy grey fish and boring. The rest of our party were much happier. It also got noisy and hard to converse with our 2 guests. Next time we'll sit at the bar. Not a great choice for young kids (staff are friendly, it's just a high end restaurant and not particularly kid oriented.)
Portions were too small for what you pay. The taste was good but you pay 35-40 for what should have been an appetizer
GREAT service! Food was average for Italian cuisine.
Always a wonderful experience at Solo!! It’s like being in Italy!
We love Solo Italiano. Food is delicious. Allergies are accommodated. The end.

Excellent all the way around! Food was amazing, beautiful setting, and great service. The only thing I would have them change is the choice of music. The ambiance was detracted from by the show tunes they were playing. Didn’t fit the experience at all.
We ate well, but went home hungry. $30+ for a pasta dish that was gone embarrassingly quick.
You can't miss this restaurant. The food is outstanding. It will be a meal you remember for the ages. Go for it!

I am Italian American. There are “Italian” restaurants in Portland but they are not authentic Italian restaurants. They are Italian American restaurants which are good, don’t get me wrong. Solo Italiano is authentic Italian! We go to Italy once a year on average and have experienced true Italian cuisine. Let me tell you THIS IS IT!!!! The handmade pasta daily cooked to al dente perfection is unbelievable! I cannot recommend this place enough. If you want to take a trip to Italy, just stop by here! What a blessing we have in Portland!

I’d probably rate this 4 stars overall, but the portions were ridiculously small. This was not advertised as a tapas/small plate restaurant. The food was good, but it was hard to get a feel for it when my pasta dish had maybe 1/2-2/3 of a cup of cooked pasta. Same with my wife’s pasta dish. I realize this is a pet peeve of mine, but homemade or not, pasta is easily the cheapest food item to provide. I get cutting back on the lobster or lamb. But pasta? If you want to charge $25 for a plate of pasta, put a half pound in there. I’m sure they can afford the extra .75 cents to do so.

First time in for my Girlfrienda birthday weekend and everything was 10/10. the focaccia with burrata was unbelievable. Both of our meals were off the charts. And I’m so sorry i forget the waitress name but she was great as well! Overall can’t wait to come back and visit Portland because we will certainly be back.

Imagine a cold, damp April night in Portland Me. Not to difficult right?
Solo is a warm, cozy spot that always makes you feel like you are a welcomed friend.
The Pizza bruschetta is amazing and the lamb chops are amazing. We go to Solo a lot. All they need is a fireplace.
Fantastic in so many ways!
Sudrit is so wonderful! We ask for him every time! This is my favorite restaurant in Portland!!
The food was incredible. Every bite devoured. We will be going back!

Solo is a divine restaurant that delivers authentic, northern Italian coastal cuisine that is simply so good you will feel transported to Italy with every bite. Some folks get upset that portions are too small, this is not the type of restaurant you go to for heaped over plates of pasta and chicken Parmesan. This is the type of place where the menu changes daily, where every piece of gnocchi and ravioli is made by hand, in-house. Why are the flavors and textures so good? Because everything is made from scratch with the finest in season ingredients money can buy. The waitstaff is AMAZING, they have a deep knowledge of the menu and the beverages. Trust the waitstaff to craft a meal for you and Solo will not disappoint.
Always an amazing dining experience!  The service and creative choices keep us coming back time after time.

Best place to spend Easter dinner! Traditional foods and a warm atmosphere. We had such a lovely time. The food was amazing, the service was just right-friendly but efficient, and just a lot of care taken with every detail. My husband especially enjoyed the specialty cocktail and the wine recommendation was spot on with our dinner. Thankful to have such an authentic Italian restaurant in Portland. Always worth our drive down.
First time dining at Solo Italiano and everything was fantastic!
Terrific service, including knowledgeable wine pairing suggestions.  Food was outstanding.
I’m sorry, but charging $36 for a modest portion of gnocchi is absurd, and $50 for a fish entree is just a blatant rip off. The food was good, but the prices are unlike anything I’ve seen.
We had a pretty good meal with nice glass of wine served by a great waiter who helped us order slightly off the menu for our 6yo.
Dinner was fabulous!   Tuna tartar was amazing as was the linguine.   Great wine recommendations too!

It was our first time here and our server was excellent.  Answered all of our questions and gave wonderful suggestions.

Thank you so helping us celebrate our anniversary!
Always a wonderful experience! The food is so thoughtfully executed.
The food was exquisite, our server was a knowledgeable, patient and helpful and the front of the house staff quite accommodating. Excellent all around.
Pesto pasta bland - not at all as described. Chef’s accommodation of vegan meal was excellent.
As usual xtraordinary dinner augmented by stellar service!!

When I enter a restaurant I judge it immediately how I'm greeted. The hostess was attentive immediately.  The ambience was very welcoming with beautiful lighting. I found the staff to be extremely helpful explaining and recommending the perfect wine that would compliment my entree .

There's no question my husband and I will be back.

Simply magnificent meal at Solo Italiano last night. We celebrated all the March ocasions — two birthdays and two anniversaries. ❤️ We had the same wonderful server that we had last year, who guided us on menu and wine selections. Truly an authentic Italian experience, many times during the meal I thought of my grandfather, who came here from Italy. We also met Chef Paolo, the creator of all this deliciousness.

The food was delicious. The bucatini with uni was  divine, but the portion was a bit small. My husband had the rib eye which was pretty pricey for a small portion as well. I would recommend and return.
Great service and atmosphere but food was over priced, portions smaller than in the past.

The hostess, our server, and the food were all fantastic. The young woman at the check-in desk could have been friendlier. They open at 4:30 (we had a 4:30 reservation) and I entered the restaurant at 4:27 (the doors were open). When I went to check in, she informed me I was "early" and that they didn't open until 4:30, and asked me to take a seat. I had no problem with having to wait a few minutes, it was more her attitude that bothered me.

Server was knowledgeable, helpful and good-natured, as was the woman who seated us.

The food was absolutely the best we've had in Portland.
Expertly crafted dishes of quality ingredients. Thoughtful service and beautiful spaces to dine in. Thoroughly excellent.
Had a great time! Great food, wonderful place. We will be back ! Esp.. for the cannolis !
The ribeye is absolutely amazing, cooked to a nicely seared medium rare with fat parts that melt right in your mouth

This is one of my top favorite restaurants in Portland!  The staff is incredibly helpful and knowledgeable and the pasta is heavenly!  The Gonfietti is a must try!  We ordered it as an app and dessert!  The tiramisu was the best I have tasted. Wish I had taken pictures.
Wonderful dinner last night. The Uni on toast was remarkable as was the bucatini!

This is one of my favorite restaurants - the rack of lamb and pasta/truffles are fabulous. But the Restaurant Week meal was nothing to write home about it. Most of the courses (except salad and dessert) were blah.
We’ll be back, but never again for Restaurant Week.
The Gnocchi in Bolognese sauce and the Cod with trumpet mushrooms are two standout menu items

We have traveled all over the world and this was one of our top 10 restaurant experiences. Our waiter was so professional and attentive. The food was superb. We had the tuna appetizers, pasta and dessert and a bottle of wine very reasonably priced. It was an energetic lively feeling but that is to be expected at a great restaurant on a Saturday night!!
The food was incredible! We have loved Paolo for years and it makes us so happy to see him succeeding in Portland!

We choose Solo Italiano for our special dinners every time. Authentic Italian food (not American Italian), an inviting space to dine in, highly competent staff (who stay over time-so it’s not just a great restaurant but must be a great place to work), and all of the small touches to make it an amazing dining experience. We left happy, full, and counting down until our next visit. Bravo, Solo Italiano!
It was an amazing meal as always and excellent service.
creative cuisine, beautifully executed. Shoutout to our server Peter for his gracious, professional and friendly service.
First time here and it was amazing!! The food was to die for and the whole atmosphere was extremely welcoming. I will definitely be going back.
Excellent food!  Great service.  Highly recommend.  The pasta was the best I’ve had in Portland.  The burrata is a must to order!
Very pleasant first time in. Our server was extremely knowledgeable about the food and wine list. The food was very good and service was outstanding. We will be back! Thanks!
Incredible meal and terrific service. Everything was outstanding.
Fantastic service! The food was very underwhelming.
Interesting and thoughtful wine selections. Sommelier was very helpful. Waiting to go back again.
Wonderful experience with food , service and warm greeting!
We had a very good meal. The pasta was delicious.
One of the very best Italian restaurants in Maine .
Solo Italiano remains one of our favorite restaurants and one where we take friends who have never eaten there.

Me and my fiance had the most amazing meal. The service was fantastic especially with the small details that make a meal even more special. The food and drinks were perfect , can’t wait to get back there .

Food proved tasty but did not hold its temperature. Portions were very small & I left hungry. Excellent service, waitstaff was top notch. Overall, not great value & I left disappointed as I had high expectations. I M not sure I will try them again as there are so many great restaurants in Portland that check all the boxes. Solo Italiano fell short for me.

A wonderful food experience!! We were a party of seven that was treated by an incredibly attentive server that was pleasant, knowledgeable and helpful. The food was outstanding w flavors that stood out and complemented each other. All we talked about that evening was how delightful our time was at Solo Italiano w a “ we shall return” mantra echoing the night!! This is a must food adventure not to be missed!!
This was one of the most amazing Italian restaurants that I have ever eaten at. The mussels were particularly stunning, and each of the homemade pasta dishes were divine. Beautiful atmosphere too.

Ambiance was very nice. Tables aren't squeezed together - everything is spaced out nicely. The menu is fluid, but the Donna Scala Focaccia is amazing, as well as an oxtail bolognese dish. Would highly recommend.

The pasta was excellent. The modern-era portioning was diet-appropriate, but for many would come across as quite small. Service was super-friendly, though we did waive off bread that hadn’t arrived by the time we were finishing our main course. Very nice ambiance that comes with a price tag equal to the best restaurants in the city.
Good service, good wine, delicious authentic food, nice atmosphere.

This was a really nice experience!! The ambiance is so comfortable and not crammed into a booth like most high end downtown Portland restaurants. The focaccia was to die for and the paste was delicate and melted in your mouth. Our waiter was exceptional and you must get the cannolis truly an experience!!! We will be revisiting this restaurant.
Food was amazing! We keep going back because it’s so authentic and delicious. Waitress a little too zealous but overall a great experience!

I came for my birthday and Solo did not disappoint!! Every dish was amazing, but their homemade pasta is where they really shine - the pork and beef raviolini is the best pasta dish I've ever had. I can't wait to come back to try more!

Fantastic spot, right on the waterfront, offers fresh authentic Italian cuisine, in a beautiful atmosphere!
All of the dishes were superb!!…
There were creative variations that Paola presented, but nothing was over done, just well refined.  Don’t let the $$ stop you from getting several courses, trust me, it’s worth it!

Some of the very best food in Maine...a must on any dining itinerary.  Excellent food, creative cocktails, stellar service...great for special occasions as well as for just a night out with someone special.

We eat at Solo on a regular basis and are never disappointed. Last nights meal was exceptional. Focaccia Normale was thin, crispy and melt in your mouth. Service is always exceptional. One of our favorite restaurants in Portland.

Everything - food, service, ambience - were all just wonderful, as they always are at Solo Italiano.  Peter was our server, and we appreciated his vast knowledge of wine, his attentiveness, and his warm and friendly personality. A very enjoyable evening!
