The new Insalada Radichi is excellent, as is the Cod.
Excellent food and service. The focaccia and pasta were wonderful.

It had been a few years since we dined here so we were excited to try it agin. The restaurant has a great vibe. Love the decor. Our waitress, Megan, was very knowledgeable about the menu items and gave us helpful suggestions. To start I ordered the tuna carpaccio. Although delicious, I expected paper thin slices of tuna, and received small thick rectangles…which was odd. I followed that with the pesto handkerchief pasta which was tasty, but not the standout that I recall from previous visits.
We ordered two focaccia for the table and both (the pizzata and the pizza) were delicious. The winner of the night was my husband’s tortellini. Exceptional!
Our guests got the sundae and raved about it and we shared a cannelloni. Very orange forward.
I love this restaurant even though our visit was a hit or miss. Will definitely return to try their other offerings!

As always, Solo Italiano was a treat.  After a flight from Houston to Logan International and a drive up 95 to Portland, sitting down to a plate of the signature Mandilli di Seta al Pesto was just what I needed.  Followed by the Atlantic Cod for a “Portland” flavor it sent me to bed happy and healthy.
Loved the experience.  Octopus was a little chewy but the the pasta choices were excellent
Superb menu and food preparation, charming and responsive server, lovely ambiance, expensive but worth it.

I dined at Solo Italiano with 6 other friends for the first time on my birthday. Everything was outstanding. Our server Debbie was fun, friendly and extremely knowledgeable regarding both the food and wine menus. She suggested a bottle of red that was the perfect pairing with our meal. We sampled some charcuterie to start and the meat was clearly very high quality. Second was the handkerchief pasta with pesto. The pasta was melt-in-your-mouth perfection and the pesto was beautifully bright. For my main course I had the day boat scallops with polenta. The scallops were incredibly fresh and the polenta was very flavorful. I had an espresso martini for dessert and it was one of the best I've had. It was a birthday dinner I won't soon forget.

They were having heating issues when we arrived for our reservation. Only 62° but they had a crew there working on it. We were informed of the circumstances when we checked in. We opted to stay and it was another great tasting meal with terrific and professional service from Debbie. She had served us on our last visit as well. She epitomized the professional aspect of the job, being well versed in the wines and the menu. 

We’ll be back, regardless of the ambient temperatures, because the food is so good and the service is exceptional.

Everything was top notch. The only reason I did not give 5 stars for ambiance is because the heat was off when we arrived. The staff were very upfront and apologetic so we were fine to eat with our coats on.
Have been here several times. Always a great dining experience. Food is terrific - sharing of meals is encouraged. Service is incredibly attentive. Highly recommended.
Great place to dine! One of  best restaurants in Portland!
Fabulous northern Italian food, superior unpretentious service, and great ambience. Scallop crudo surpassed all expectations! Solo rocks!!  Pat S
Amazing. The freshest handmade pasta. From the food to the service . Very professional.
Best Italian restaurant in Portland! Very upscale. Delicious!
The food was delicious, the atmosphere, location and service were all excellent.

Went for a long overdue visit for our anniversary. Food was wonderful. Service was beyond wonderful. Our server plotted out the order of our dishes, helped with wine selections, and was in general just wonderful.
Solo is one of the best restaurants in Portland!  From start to finish everything was exceptional!  I will definately be back!

Drinks were very small. handkerchief pasta did not have enough sauce. The anchovy caper pizza was so minimal ift had little taste, not enough red sauce. The meat was great but needed salt. would like salt and pepper on the table. Very expensive.

Food is outstanding, just be aware of very small portions. Vast wine selection and the menu is constantly changing. Server was very knowledgeable but busy with a large section of tables. Overall recommended for dinner dates or celebrations.

Everything from the tiny $12 salad to the $18 focaccia to the $35 pastas is significantly overpriced relative to other fine dining options in Portland. That is why we have only been twice in 5ish years while we’ve probably been to Scales, Fore Street, Leeward, Corner Room, Wayside and Bar Futo as many as 50 times during that period.
Great service, food was incredible, all in a lovely space.

The food was amazing, the burata and prosciutto with foccocia bread was so delicious!
The waiter was great with then service.
The bar tender Randi does a fantastic job too! Paulo the owner goes around to the tables and is always great to have a conversation about Italy , or the food . I would highly reccomend Solo Italiano! Great place for awesome service , great food.

The food was ok. Monkfish was rubbery making me think it had been frozen before. Small portions for expensive prices! Service was better than food and ambience wonderful. Wine pour was good and wine excellent.

I thought the portions were smaller than i remember
The food was very good and out wait staff was excellent .
This was the best dinner and dining experience I have had in years.  Thank you so much.
Nice ambiance but food was bland.  Good wine selection.  Always wanted to try it but that will be it.
We come up from Boston to Solo every couple of months. Always an amazing experience with the  Food,Service,and cocktails! We will be back soon!

Excellent atmosphere, friendly waitress, bread was delicious, food flavorful. 

For the price, wish there was a little bit more for portions on the main course. Suggest possibly small oil bottles at the tables for larger groups. 

Overall a great time with family thanks to the friendly staff. :)
Great food and great service as always! One of our favorite places!
Scallops and fish entrees did not appear to be extremely fresh.

Wonderful dishes, loved the duck liver on toast in the meat board, the special chef pesto dish, fabulous bang island mussels, warm octopus salad was to die for. Veal belly with pistachios and cranberry very unique

We have been patrons for a long time.  Peter, our server was very attentive, especially with a number of large parties in our seating area.  We appreciate his assessments of timing, we had a wonderful dinner experience.  Thank you.

Food and service were great!
Perfect for celebrating your birthday!

We always love Solo.  Food is always outstanding.  Paolo grated our white truffle himself.   We started with raviolini of duck with white truffle and petto d'anatra as a main.  The duck was perfectly cooked, tender and delicious - with a cranberry coulis.  We started with Franciacorta and then a nebbiolo with the duck.  We finished with biscotti and a local amaro.  Really great evening.

GO HERE! Twice if you have time! There is so much great food in Portland but this topped our list on a long weekend visit (also went to Scales, Eventide, Duckfat, and Luke’s Lobster). Don’t miss the handkerchief pasta or the focaccia app (thin and cheesy and not what we expected but WAY better). Thank you to the fantastic staff!

Our waitress was excellent. I can't remember her name but she looks just like Emma Stone. I had the rack of lamb which was cooked to perfection. My companions each had a pasta dish that they liked very much. Great cocktails, excellent wine choices. Love it!

Loved everything form the handmade holiday garlands to the food- which was really outstanding!
The scallops, panna cotta and tiramisu were the favorites of the evening!￼
The best food I’ve had in Portland! The sauce was simple and so spot on. Pasta cooked to perfection!
Unbelievably small portions of average food for a lot of money.
Amazing food, service, and a lovely atmosphere. We can’t thank you enough for making our evening wonderful one. We will definitely be back!
Ask us to put our order in at once and we’re in and out in 45 minutes… not how I want to spend my evening when I spend that much money

Absolutely spectacular restaurant!  We had reservations for Sat 8:30pm on holiday weekend (after Thanksgiving).

Service was outstanding! We had a guest w celiac so we needed gluten free options. The waitress went above & beyond to ensure we were accommodated.  

Our guests were world travelers & big foodies. They were equally impressed. Portions were generous. Food arrived quickly and with mindful timing. Good space between tables. Excellent wine menu. 

Overall an excellent choice for upscale dining in Portland. We will definitely be back.

Lovely ambience and wonderful hostess and servers. They gave helpful suggestions for a group of six with regard to cocktails and many dishes we all shared. Hard to pick a favorite dish as so many were delicious!

If you rely on an appetizer and plate of pasta to fill you - be prepared to leave hungry.  Both my husband and I wound up eating dinner at home after eating here. The pasta portions are so small you need to order 3 courses - a protein course - to walk away full.  Very over priced for the portions provided.
Great atmosphere and service. Quality food. Quantity small for cost.
Our waitress Sarah was outstanding . So pleasant, knowledgeable . Great suggestions .

The menu is definitely different but wait staff is happy to explain every item so that you will want to try it.  The fish was so fresh and expertly prepared. We struggled trying to find a wine we would like and our server picked a winner for us.
All the staff is so friendly and helpful.  This is a well run place and we can't wait to go back!
This was a lovely date night restaurant with a really beautiful ambience and great food
The most amazing service and food. Can’t wait to come back. Thanks for making it special for us.
Had a wonderful meal. The lamb chops and scallops were both excellent. The service was great. Desert and latte topped off the evening. Really enjoyed it. Thanks.
Excellent traditional northern Italian food. Handmade pasta was melt in your mouth good. Service was impeccable.
the food was delicious and we had excellent service and I cannot wait til we get to go again!!! It was like being in Italy for a few hours:)
Incredible!! Had an absolute blast and the atmosphere was great

Beautiful restaurant and attentive service. I wasn’t a fan of the beet salad the cheese and dressing just seemed off and overwhelming. My husband and I both had the handkerchief pesto pasta special and although it was good I don’t feel the price was great. Cheese board was good. Could’ve had a few more dates. All the cheeses were good with the exception of a soft cheese that was just too overpowering for me.
We went Sunday night at 19:30 hrs our serveur was amazing she took all the time to explain the menu and answer our questions.  Very nice lady
Our server was knowledgeable about the menu, wine and cocktails, explained things very well and was very attentive!  Thank you.

We always have a fabulous dining experience at Solo, and this was no exception. We brought friends with us who have never been, and they too were very impressed with the entire evening. Great good, attentive service, and warm atmosphere. The price point is on the higher end but we do find it worth the experience.
Peter is a gem. Knows the wines very well and is a true professional. Thank you!
Our server Megan was fantastic and helped us through a daunting time looking over a menu like that for the first time. Everything we ate was divine.
Great service; well informed server on menu and wine
There were 6 of us at dinner - just a night out with friends. The food was excellent, as was the service and the decor. But the prices are quite steep. It's a very nice special occasion restaurant.

Make a yearly (at least once) trek from North Carolina for the pesto alone.  But, everything is fantastic.   Also, visit during truffle season if possible!   Never disappoints!
Peter, our waiter, was fabulous.
Solo is my favorite Italian restaurant on the east coast!
Had the truffle pasta- very expensive but flavorful.
Fantastic food— especially the pasta. Highly recommend!

While we had only been to Solo once, we really enjoyed it. This visit was for a special birthday, they were out of tomato capressi which several of us wanted, the tiramisu was fabulous as was the cannoli!
Solo Italiano is always great and tonight with our helper Sarah even more so. Delicious and beautiful
Awesome experience ! Food was terrific and service was great

Solo delivered a great experience for us. The staff was very knowledgeable and gave us just the right amount of attention. All the food was very well prepared. The cannoli for dessert were the best I’ve ever had; and I’ve had many. The prices were a little high, but in keeping with other Portland dining rooms. The only negative was the cocktail list. Their house specialties were not inviting, so we went with traditional cocktails.
Great meal and fabulous service - LOVE the octopus appetizer
Amazing experience. Thoughtful waitress. Every time I come it’s 10/10
Food was delicious, service was amazing. Second 5 star meal at Solo for us!
Seated right away. Very friendly staff. Great food. Would highly recommend

Very expensive and the quantity and quality of the food was very disappointing. I had the
Bucatini Al Carbonara di Mare … one Shrimp was placed on top of the pasta. One Shrimp !
Our appetizer was tasteless.
Won’t be going back.
The food was innovative and spectacular.  The young woman who was our server was extremely knowledgeable and pleasant.  A great meal.  Would go back again when we are in the area.  Great find!

It is rare to find a true Northern Italian restaurant - most are focused on traditional Southern Italian cuisine.  But Solo Italiano is such a unique opportunity to experience delicious homemade pasta, fresh prosciutto and a great selection of wine, among so many other things.  We sat at the bar and enjoyed every moment, including learning about the history of Solo Italiano from the staff.  If you're in Portland, put Solo Italiano at the top of your culinary list.

Everything about this restaurant was good., from the bread to the dessert. The pasta servings were smaller but sufficient. Like many Italian restaurants they have a Primi and Secundi. It would be great to share a Primi and each have a Secundi. Would be doable with their portion size. We would definitely eat here again and highly recommend!!

Went to celebrate my sons 24th birthday.
It was the first time for all of us.
Our server was excellent, and suggested we eat tapas style and split things.
Ended up getting 2 aps, a beet salad, 2 pastas and 2 main meals - we were stuffed by the end.
They brought a nicely decorated tiramisu with a candle- awesome-

Everything was incredible, but the prosciutto ap, pesto pasta and the halibut were outstanding!!!
Had a wonderful dinner and the service was great! The pesto pasta dish was amazing!
Consistently excellent, fresh ingredients.  House-made pasta is a must but plenty of non-pasta choices.
Food was outstanding. We had every pasta . It was delicious !

Severely overpriced. $75 for a ribeye steak? No thanks. 
Pan seared duck was served cold, raw and in a gravy reminiscent of canned Campbells Cream of Mushroom soup. 
My wife’s piece of halibut was about the size of a silver dollar and she described it as “bland”. 
Never going back.

Food was good for the most part but the service was terrible. Waiter let our food go to another table and then we waited another 30 minutes for our dish. Another 30 minutes later our final course came out.
Food was delicious, great ambience, we had a great time.

The food was incredible—absolute flavor explosion! We highly recommend the octopus salad and the scallop main course. 

Service was attentive, knowledgeable about the menu, and went out of their way to give us a wonderful anniversary dinner. 

The kitchen/dessert decorators even adorned our tiramisu plate to wish us a happy anniversary (unexpected, and hugely appreciated ❤️).
I want to thank you the staff that help me propose to my fiancé Jessica.  The food was amazing the atmosphere, everything was top of the line.  Thank you so much.

Wonderful in every way!
But please baffle the noise level.

I had heard so much about this restaurant however it turned out to be $577.00 worth of disappointment. We were a party of 6 however seated at a table that clearly could only seat 4 people. Two of us were seated on the ends of the table and there was a horizontal piece of wood preventing us from putting out feed under the table. My back was killing me. My husband equally unimpressed and he never complains about anything. The food was just okay. Nothing over the top and my shrimp was over cooked and for $38.00 one would hope for more than 1  1/2 shrimp. The portion size was not much so we filled up on bread mostly which by the way was excellent. We were celebrating an engagement and a birthday so I could not bring myself to fuss about the table or anything. I just kept thinking what's all the hype about this place? Scales Restaurant, David's, Street n Co and so many other places are a much better spend so I would suggest spending your money at somewhere else. I think the drinks were good but the alcohol pour were pretty light. As a pro they did send over a round of shots as an acknowledgement for the special occasions were were celebrating. That was very sweet and much appreciated. 

I did come home and read the reviews (after the fact) and anyone that gave this restaurant a low star was responded to by the owner who shot back with excuse after excuse and did not take responsibility for anything. I would imagine this will be the case with my review. This is an honest review so take it for what it is worth. I will never be back to this restaurant and we eat out often. With so many choices in Portland, don't waste your money. I did try calling the restaurant and thought I should bring to their attention our experience but it is really hard to get someone to pick up.

This restaurant was five stars all around. From the ambiance to the wine,to the delicious dinner, it couldn’t be more perfect. Our server was amazing, great suggestions and very personable. Highly recommend this restaurant!
Amazing food, great service and great vibe overall. We love it here and will be back!
Everything we ordered was delicious.  The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable.  We would definitely recommend this restaurant highly.
We come to Solo everytime we visit Portland.  Just a fantastic restaurant!!
loved it!!  atmosphere and food were great!! would highly recommend

Miniature portions.   Others also complaining.    Very disappointed as one of first restaurants that is really cutting corners and holding itself out as superior. Very overpriced for what it is.   Didn't even have what was advertised on menu.      Seriously overated units advertising.    People next time said would never go again and we agree
We loved Solo Italiano. Everything was fantastic, our server gave great recommendations and didn’t steer us wrong. The food was delicious!
Angle hair w/ funghi was amazing. Panda cotta w/ raspberry glaze was to die for. Great service. Highly recommend!
Waiter was excellent. He even got an Oder that was not on the menu for me.
A bit pricey, but truly the most authentic Italian food and wine I’ve ever had in the US.

This one didn‘t impress me- I had high expectations as this restaurant had been recommended to me. The food was good, but not excellent as the price would demand. Salmon crudo was very nice but lacked some salt and I was confused by the fact that it wasn‘t raw as crudo would suggest. Ravioli were very nice but the sauce that came with them was much too heavy covering the wonderful filling. Mocktail was delicious.
I went by myself and was put far in the back, where it was freezing cold and there was no ambiance.
The food was exquisite, our wait staff was wonderful and we could even hear ourselves talk
The service is excellent.  The waiter recognized my wife and remembered me by name from a previous visit 10 months earlier!

What an adorable place!  Tasty food and drinks.   Service was great,  as well!  I do think that the dish i ordered was a bit overpriced for not having Any meat in it but everything else was as expected.
Food was amazing! Our server Sarah was very knowledgeable and helpful. Definitely recommend.

Food was ok at best. Seems the "Daily" menu change doesn't serve them well. I would think u have 5 or six things u get good at instead of a dozen things that you are ok at. The halibut was cut so thick it was over cooked. The pasta with Scallops and mussels was bland and only had 1 scallop. Had a great server but the food was mediocre at best. It's a shame with all the great restaurants in Portland we picked this one to celebrate our anniversary.

I wanted a special restaurant to celebrate my husband’s birthday and it didn’t disappoint. The food was spectacular, our server Heather was warm and attentive. At one point I told Heather that the combination of my cocktail and my husband’s wine may have been the best ever, with Heather actually recommending the wine to suit my husband’s palate. It turned out to be a great choice for a special occasion, but we would like to visit more often. Highly recommended
Solo ranks as one of the best that Portland abounds in.
The food and service in this establishment was excellent. Our server was extremely knowledgeable about the food and wine. Will definitely return.

overall the restaurant is great.  however, the pasta dish we ordered and asked the wait person if it was shareable, it was not.  very small portion, even for one person. had the mussels, and caprese salad, which was quite adequate to share.
Pricey but worth it for a special occasion. Server was delightful, and the food was truly exceptional.

It started with the hostess wishing us Happy Anniversary when we walked in the door.  I always put the occasion on the Open Table reservation, but this is the first time a restaurant looked at it.  Outstanding food, outstanding service and at the end they even wrote Happy Anniversary in chocolate on the desert plate.  What a wonder experience.

From drinks to appetizers, then pasta course, followed by excellent main dishes to an assortment of desserts.  
Our waitress did a great job thru the numerous courses - highly recommend..
Very nice atmosphere and service.  I don’t mind paying expensive prices for dinner out, especially if it’s a special occasion.  However $40.00 for a small serving of pasta seemed excessive to me.

The food was good, but not outstanding, especially for the high prices. Service, however, was truly excellent. The music was on too loud, making it difficult for us to hear each other. We did request that it be turned down, and that was done slightly. We came in early and thought we would get a drink, but we were directed to some uncomfortable stools as the bar was set up for diners, and we decided to come back closer to our reservation time.  Overall, Solo was a less satisfactory experience than we had hoped for.
The food and service and ambiance was great. Portions are small but my wife and I don’t like large meals. We generally share but we could have had another dish. Otherwise quite nice.
All courses were exceptional, we started with the scallop crudo, which was one the most delicious experiences of my life. Highly recommend!
Best pesto ever.  One of if not the best dinners I’ve had. Great service as well
Superb food and not the usual Italian menu.  This is different and very good. Staff is great and knowedgeble.

This place is a must if you're in Portland! Located in the Old Bay area, it is operated by the best chefs in the area in my wife and I's opinion. The service was marvelous, olive oil and bread whenever we were ready for more. Our experience here was fantastic.
Amazing authentic northern Italian cuisine, plus a great vibe and very cool space. Highly recommend!

A good restaurant experience overall, but clearly doesn't live up to what seems the reputation as a top-notch venue.  We waited 20 minutes after being seated for an initial interaction by our server, who then was pleasant and helpful.
Amazing food, as always. Ingredients are high quality, and preparation is just outstanding.

Really wanted to like this place, but couldn’t make it work. The ambiance and bar are fantastic. Service was ok but the food left a lot to be desired. The pasta tasted anything but fresh. We had two very boring Capers’s salads along with penne handkerchief pasta which was very simple and completely uninspiring. Kinda seems like they are over it. We mentioned at the beginning it was my girlfriends birthday. They did nothing for it but make us wait almost two hours for entrees. Much better Italian options in Portland. Chances are you’ll get better quality food at Amatoes!
Great food, perfect atmosphere for a celebratory dinner!
Quality food, flavors, and service.  Meghan was great and took great care of us.
Our 25th anniversary meal here was so special and perfect— thank you!

This is a GREAT restaurant!  Delicious appetizers & amazing entrees. The mushroom Angel Hair pasta was so flavorful that I will remember it forever.  And the duck confit w farro was outstanding.  Thoroughly wonderful dinner - thanks to all who made it happen
Outstanding food , service and ambiance
Absolutely wonderful evening and a delicious meal.  Peter waited on us amd had great suggestions and we had some personal service from Jesse as well. Overall A+ evening
Food and service were spectacular! Our server was on point with everything. There when you needed her and always ready when things were good too.
I have been to Italy multiple times, and this food tasted like I was there!  Amazing flavors!  I’m already dreaming of coming back to Portland for the sole purpose of eating here!

It was 7 years since I was last at this restaurant.. so glad it survived the pandemic. The server was very knowledgeable and personable. She heard it was my birthday and brought my desert with a candle.. My partner was never there and was very pleasantly surprised about how good the meal was. He described  the night as a great peaceful dining experience
It’s always a wonderful evening when we dine here. We’ve been coming here a long time and never tired of the food and the people that make the experience so great!
Our server was very informative about the menu the food was absolutely fantastic.   Would highly recommend this restaurant!
Excellent as always we keep coming back. The service really sets them apart.
Will be going back many more times to come. Our waitress made our first time there perfect in every way. Excellent at her job.
The food was creative and ￼ delicious. Would go again in a heartbeat. ￼

Your restaurant is the very best Italian restaurant. We have it now in a very long time the food was outstanding. The service was terrific. Our serving was terrific best lamb chops. I’ve had in a long, long time, and everything was just great. Thank you.

One of the best meals we've had in the Old Port. Highly recommend the tuna tartare and the prosciutto with burrata. The cacio pepe pasta was very good and the duck and sage ravioli was fabulous. A wonderful Italian eatery with a great vibe!

10 out of 10 stars. We were fortunate enough to have Peter throughout the course of our meal and he was AMAZING. His recommendations were spot on, everything was so delicious and he was so great. It also helps that the food was fantastic (props to the kitchen staff) and drinks were delicious (props to the bar staff). All in all, we would eat here again and again and again, if you are in Portland this is a must. 

Plus the ambiance, wow.

We have been in Maine for nearly a week and this was by far and away our best meal. Service was terrific. Each dish beautifully presented and the flavors were just a perfect blend. The panna cotta dessert was insanely delicious.
Was fantastic meal and service really brought us back to Italy!

This is an outstanding Italian restaurant. They have traditional Italian dishes (if you rely on the vocabulary) but with amazing creative and tasty spins.

And the wine list is spectacular. Maybe 15-20 fine wines by the glass and a great full bottle list with reasonable pricing.

Mixed experience with the meal. The starter (beet salad) was bland. Previous reviews raved about it but we were disappointed. 
However the entree's were very good. My wife had linguine with class, mussels, and one scallop! which was surprising?.
I had torilinni with Buffalo mozzarella, tomato sauce and Parmigiano Reggiono which was excellent. Bread was not served warm and average.
Overall just average. Over priced for the quality. Had better for less money.
Everything was superb. Selections are outstanding. Go early to find parking.

Solo is a contemporary Italian eatery on Commercial Street in Portland, ME.  We sampled three different appetizers, all very well presented and very tasteful.  The Tagliere di Contadino con Gnocco Fritto was enough for 3 people in it's self.   Two of us in the group wanted to try the Pesto based pasta and the Cacio e Pepe dish since we make these ourselves at home.   The Pesto pasta was very light and quite good, however different from traditional Pesto one may make with pine nuts, garlic, basil and olive oil.   The Cacio e Pepe was also quite good, however very mild compared to the traditional Roman dish we are used to.   All in all, a very nice night out in the very busy Old Port in the middle of the summer.
Outstanding service and food
Overall very good. Not spectacular. In general for the price, you can get better meals in Portland.

Food was delicious. Started with the warmed octopus salad amazing! Highly recommend it. Husband had scallops with polenta, also amazing!  The pasta dish I chose had a broccolini purée with sausage, this too was great, just wish it had a bit more sausage. Pieces were extremely small crumbles and very few. None the less I enjoyed all. Service was exceptional!

The hostess was not at all welcoming but our server, Sarah, more than made up for it. She was attentive, patient (we had our 3 kids with us) and made some excellent recommendations for starters, wine for my husband and dessert options. The meal was definitely pricey but we enjoyed it thoroughly thanks to our server!
Food outstanding. Our server, Sarah, extremely helpful in choosing our meal. Would recommend.
Great food great service. Pesto pasta was over the top amazing
Great experience, server was extremely knowledgable.  We will be back
Excellent food, a great menu and service. Ambience was fun and elegant.
Delightful, delicious, definitely a must in Portland
Very very good food and service - it’s on the high end for Portland restaurants, the dishes are very small for the money - but well presented and delicious
The food was absolutely amazing this is a must go in portland definitely not a budget dine but well worth the money

Some of the best food we ate during our month in Maine. Delicious fresh pasta dishes and seafood highlighting local, seasonal flavors. Unfussy yet very refined.  The space is beautiful. Service was lovely. Will be returning!
It was amazing but portion sizes were way too small!

Another wonderful evening with friends, introducing them to Solo Italiano.  They loved it, and we loved the service and pacing of our courses. Our waiter suggested  lovely wines, perfect with the clams, scallops, tuna, swordfish, baby octopus, all of it was delicious, as usual. Starting with the Gonfietti is always special….
The wait staff and hostess were very pleasant. Although the food was good, I found the portions small and therefore, lacking in bang for buck.
Ambiance and food were great. Service was a little slow. Never got bread at start of meal which would have been nice for a late evening reservation. Menu a little difficult to interpret.
Great evening on our 50th anniversary.  Thank you.
Wow, the BEST Italian outside of Italy.  Fantastic Mafaldine Bolognese and superior service (This visit by Pool H.)

Was excited to come back after a great dining experience last year.  Was greatly disappointed, there were no specials, they were out of veal by 7:00, the food lacked flavor and our server seemed to be going through the motions.  This will be our last time dining here.
Fantastic food and lovely service - the chef is amazing!  Good location in the heart of town
Food was amazing. Service was great as always. Megan is the best!!

The food and service was exceptional' the wine list was way out of line in pricing along with my SMALL glass of ice tea that was $4.00.....really??   The halibut was entirely too small a portion for the price as was the scallop dish at $8 for each of the small ones served, I was expecting much larger ones for $42.  Paying $48 for one small duck leg was a bit unbelievable......they are so small that two would have been more acceptable.  I have had equally as good food and service in Boston and New York and paid less.  I'm going to Ma Maison in Boston instead of Solo in Portland, ME from now on!!!!
The food was outstanding and the waiters really took time to explain the questions before we ordered. The staff was pleasant helpful and  professional.  Can’t wait till we return to Portland
Great homemade pasta and focaccia.  Service was great.  Consistently a great dining experience.

Very attractive and inviting restaurant. Pasta did not meet expectations. The Parmesan cheese had gone bad and ruined one of our dinners. Bread arrived about 45 minutes after we are seated and no refills on water. Fish was over cooked but still quite good.

Excellent and rare Northern Italian Menu and Experience (Ligurian Coast/Genovese) - perfect combination of New England seafood and an uncommon regional cuisine that I have only had in Liguria - great job and excellent staff

We don’t know what we said except where we were from and the bartender/waitress shunned us from that point forward. Very uncomfortable and awkward.

Everything else was very good, ambience, vibe, food and rest of staff was great.
The Gonfietti con Prosciutto is incredible. Outstanding pasta dishes. The lasagna was one of the best I’ve ever had. The tortellini with truffles and cream was to die for. Will be coming back!

Pretty disappointed in Solo… we are frequent customers and this time was disappointing at best… dined in the back room for the first time.. horrible acoustics, NO MUSIC … just dry, loud, talkative air… 

Carpaccio was off the mark, “normal focaccia bread” was not normal, pastas were good… 
I wrote we were celebrating and it wasn’t acknowledged by Solo.
All five diners enjoyed excellent meals & desserts and our waiter was outstanding!

I’m always looking for flavorful interesting food. I lean toward veggie oriented dishes with some meat, less starches. I loved the dish I had - a pasta with sausage and broccolini, and a salad, all of which were delicious. We all wanted to order side veggies and they didn’t have an option. Just a side of chard or spinach… broccolini, a daily vegetable of some kind. That’s the only thing that was missing. So many restaurants don’t get what my friends and I are always searching for - lighter food, salads with greens, with a side of veggies, not heavy, meat and potatoes. We got most of our wish. Our waitperson was fabulous and recommendations were spot-on for wine and dishes. Will return, keeping our fingers crossed for a side of a veggies.
Don't miss this - great Northern Italian cuisine, the best mixologist in Portland!
Food was very good but not exceptional.  Service was excellent as was the ambiance.
Loved our meal at Solo. Food was great and our server was outstanding. Definitely recommend this restaurant
Great Italian pasta. Great martinis. Great ambiance.
Outstanding pesto, homemade fresh PASTA & scallops EVER!! Waitstaff Ms Debbie is just brilliant ty 😊 🙏 ❤️
The chef makes the pastas fresh ( and different) every morning. All delicious...
you have misspelled ambiance in your survey!  pl fix it... as important that we spell it correctly
We celebrated our anniversary at Solo last night and once again, it did not disappoint!  The food, the service, the ambiance - all outstanding.
Food is always outstanding!  Always get personal attention from the staff!  A gem in Portland!

The service was very very good. The bread and olive oil was amazing. Although our food was delicious, the portions for the main courses were VERY small for the price. Our appetizer (beet salad and carpaccio) were  adequate or average for the price and were both delicious. 
My main course was linguine with 1 scallop, a couple of mussels, and a few manila clams. It took me 4 forks fulls to eat my pasta. The sauce was amazingly delicious but for $36 I think there should have been a lot more on that plate.
In a town of 5-star restaurants, Solo outshines the rest.

Incredible food, wonderful wait staff and a pleasant environment! A tad noisy, but nothing overwhelming or unpleasant.
Would highly recommend as an upscale dining experience for a date, anniversary, event, etc.
Amazing food and service! We will definitely be back soon..
First time and it was just right all the way around!!  Thank you 😊

Pasta dishes were excellent, great flavor, but pricy for dishes with no meat. Scallops were cooked to perfection, very flavorful.  Deserts were good but not outstanding. The garden salad was poor and yet expensive, not as good as a generic salad at House of Pizza. How can a restaurant reputedly of high quality offer a salad of such poor quality and small size? Noise level was moderate and allowed comfortable conversation.
We had a wonderful experience! The food was super delicious! Great service!! Highly recommended!
A lovely meal.  Each dish was delicious, and we appreciated the helpful, attentive service.
Closest thing to eating in Italy. Authentic Italian food using fresh local Maine ingredients. Our server, Sarah, was knowledgeable and so helpful. We feel like we’re dining with family.
Perfect night out.  Server was amazing and food was phenomenal
This place always feels like a warm hug. Staff make you feel at home, all while serving food that soothes your soul. My all time favorite place.
Service was great, food was amazing, price was a little high but overall such a GREAT experience!
One of our favorite places in Portland.  Always great food, wonderful location and great wait staff.
Great service. Our waitperson really knew the menu and by taking their advice we loved our meals. Dessert included! Watching the dessert maker was very cool too!

Sarah our server was fantastic, we went last year to celebrate our anniversary and Sarah was our server and she was great, much to our surprise Sarah was our server again this year and once again she was fantastic! The food is great we will eat here at least twice on our next visit.
The food is delicious, the servers  are incredibly professional and lovely, the portions are just the right size, and the food is very filling. Be prepared to spend some money to do it right though!

Had heard good things about Solo, so we wanted to try it. Great atmosphere but was expecting better.... Love the bar area and will return for drinks and apps, but will explore a new restaurant that we have not tried yet for a meal..
This is one of our absolute favorite restaurants in Portland! The food is outstanding, the service is always great, and this time was no exception. It is a bit on the pricey side, but well worth it!

Food excellent.
Room where we were seated 15-degrees colder than the other room. And an a/c vent blew directly on our table. Very uncomfortable.
Service superb!

This was our first visit to Solo Italiano, and it was the best overall dining experience during our New England excursion (Boston, Portland, and Boston again). It's a charming restaurant in the heart of downtown Portland. Busy place, and we learned why: the service, food, and ambiance are all first-rate. This was on the eve of our wedding anniversary, which they acknowledged on a beautiful dessert plate. Megan was our server. She did the best possible job. She was knowledgeable, personable, attentive, and energetic. We started with a mackerel crudo, which was very good, and the tuna tartare (delicious and with a very creative presentation), which we enjoyed with a glass of Prosecco. For entrees, we each loved the seared duck breast dinner. It was outstanding! The wine list is very good; we shared a bottle of Amarone with the entrees. For dessert, tiramisu (awesome) and a strawberry/rhubarb tart topped with vanilla ice cream (also a winner). This was a big-time wow experience! We'd definitely return on a future visit to Portland. Go.

Service was great timed every plate coming out so took time but was relaxing 
Food was the best we had for up scale dinner
This is our favorite restaurant in Portland, Maine.  Very friendly, and they encourage sharing food.  A must is the homemade bread, pasta and dessert.

Absolutely a disappointment and horrible service!!!!!  
This is a place that needs leadership and better training!  I would not recommend this place to anyone!
Excellent food and friendly and helpful staff.  We had the charcuterie board, and for dinner I had the rack of lamb.  Would definitely order both again.

Great environment, tried to get a table for 7 instead of 5 and they said no.  Based on room I felt it could have been done.  Food was good but perhaps it was what I ordered that was not as good as I remembered.
Excellent food, service, and ambience, but the prices are simply too high.

Excellent service while there.  Number of unique Italian inspired dinners not found in Portland.  Is on the expensive side for pasta type dishes.  Good desserts.  My wife did not like her first entree, and they graciously substituted it with another dish to her liking. Thank you.

Lovely setting. Warm and welcoming. I like it when the waitperson checks in right after the first bites are taken. She came to ask how we were doing when we were nearly finished our food. Although my halibut was delicious, the tiny piece was not worth the $42 I paid. It also came with a minimal amount of side.

We have been looking for a good Indian restaurant around the neighborhood for a while and I think we have found our go to spot! The food was delicious and the service was great as well. We were recommended to come by for the lunch buffet and we plan on it.
One of the best Italian restaurants I have eaten in in the US. Simply superb
great consistent food full of flavor. fresh fish, amazing salads, desert always great. eaten here many times it is always amazing.

Very good experience ! 

The food was exceptional and the service too!

Highly recommended

My wife and I had the most incredible 5 course dinner yesterday. Our server, Debbie, was beyond amazing. Her recommendations, pacing of our courses, and friendly conversation enhanced the 5-star food to create not only a tasty meal, but a complete experience.

First time trying this restaurant and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a real authentic Italian dinner. The food was outstanding and the pasta just melted in your mouth. Will definitely be back very soon!
Great special occasion spot.  Great blend of tradition with flavor.
wonderful waiter - amazing food will go back.  highly recommend

My wife and I went for our anniversary.  We were seated promptly and staff were very friendly.
Our server, Sara(h), was knowledgeable, friendly and stated clearly that she would take our full order, but pace things so we would not feel rushed.   She kept her word and our service was great.
Our meal was delicious and we will definitely return soon.
Excellent service and food. A little pricey but worth it.
Food was great!  Very overpriced.  Will go back, but probably order differently next time.

The octopus was quite good as was the linguine with clams.  The fish "meatballs" were disappointing as was the beet salad.  Desserts were mixed.  Overall the portions were somewhat undersized considering the price of the entrees.

AMAZING food & service.  This was a second visit for us, our first during a local food tour back in November 2019.  Solo Italiano made a big impression on us then, so I knew when we were making a return visit to the area for my husband's birthday, THIS was were we needed to go to make it a memorable celebration.  They did NOT disappoint.

The food was amazing and the service and assistance with wine pairing was spot on.  I HIGHLY recommend Solo Italiano and hope to return much sooner again.

The food is uneven. If they offer duck confit, get it—the best I have ever had including what I make at home. 

But, we have now tried four pastas on our three visits this year. While the quality of the house-made pasta is good, the sauces were just bland. For the price, and after that duck confit, we certainly were disappointed.
We love Solo Italiano, the only issue is we always order & eat too much because it is so good ;)

Our server was excellent. The appetizers were better than the main course.  Not a particularly good value.  With so many choices in town, this one may be a little over-hyped.  I would go back but in no rush to do so.

We made a reservation but was given a table in a section away from the main area.

The food was average at the best for being so pricy I expected the food to be fine dining quality.

For me it was not fine quality food and would  not recommend spending $$$ on this type of food.   AVERAGE at the best!

Our waitress was terrific, informative and fun. Food was delicious. The restaurant was also very accommodating when we needed to add another person only 2 days before our reservation.  The place was very busy yet service was relaxed and well paced.

My wife and daughter enjoyed the lasagna but my lamb was terrible. Described as a rack of lamb it consisted of 3 very thin chops that were actually raw in the middle. Yes, I know that lamb can be rare but this was cold in the middle. They were served over a messy pile of greasy, oily fries. Why any chef would think this would be appealing is lost on me. It was Mothers Day and I didn't want to raise a fuss since it was a great day up to this point so I didn't say anything to our server. We have had good meals at Solo in the past but it will be a a long while before we return.

I can’t say enough about how consistent this restaurant is! The staff is always on target and the food is just superb. Good northern Italian food. The lasagna is something out of this world, light, very smooth and it’s hard to keep a dry eye after each bite!
The meal was delicious! Ingredients tasted so fresh and were well prepared. Server was knowledgeable and attentive.  Wine menu leans toward the higher priced but our selection was really good.
Absolutely love this restaurant. The food and service are impeccable. It is hands down my favorite place in Portland.
I had the lasagna with with duck confit! It was beyond amazing!
Our server was very accommodating and friendly. Made the whole experience feel like we were eating a home cooked meal.
Amazing fresh authentic Italian food. Great wine list. The staff is always friendly.
We had a delicious dinner and wonderful service. We would definitely return.
Wonderful place! Highly recommend it to anyone who wants a lovely dinner, relaxing atmosphere and perfect service!
Great food and service!  Highlights were tuna carpaccio and pasta with pesto.  Pistachio soufflé for dessert was also excellent.
Amazing meal, amazing service. Can't wait to go back.

Debbie and the all the staff at Solo Italiano made our anniversary dinner completely memorable and special. The food, every course of it, was delivered perfectly cooked and incredibly flavorful. We were impressed by the Pulpo (exacting preparation and texture) and the duck (beautifully light sauce that stood out against the standard fruity wine reductions).

The pastas rivaled the best we’ve had in Italy. The depth of flavor, precise seasoning, and attention to texture were all top notch! I’ve never had as good a pesto as this.

At each point in our dinner, we felt well attended to and extremely happy that Solo Italiano went above our expectations.
Food was delicious but overpriced.

We had a 5:15 reservation and were running late.   But the hostess assured us they would hold our table.  And it was so worth it.  We've dined here before and enjoyed the Handkerchief pesto pasta, which is wonderful.  But we decided to try something new.  I had the ravioli and my partner had the Gnocchi.  Both were delicious.  The roasted beet salad did not disappoint and the Napoletana bread with fresh buffalo mozzarella & prosciutto should not be missed!   The canned music in the background made us feel like we were in a White Lotus episode.  And we were in and out in about 70 minutes; way too fast.  So we tried to stretch it by having some Cream Gelato, which was also delish!  A nice finish.   We appreciated the waitress' help with the wine list as it is all Italian and not so familiar to us.  There was a large party in the room next to us indicating that it is a good place for celebrations.
Always amazing. Recommend the sage fried focaccia with Burrata and Prosciutto! Must try!

Awesome as always & Sarah is an amazing server! Can’t wait to come back.
Ron

Very pleasant dinner.  Highly recommend the basil pasta and gnocchi.  Nothing special in the focaccia was more like a flat bread pizza.  We had family style which allowed us all to try all the dishes.

Excellent food. 
Great service.
Sat outside, and it was very comfortable.
Nice music.
Great dinner! Truly wonderful food! Each course was a delight! We will be back!!!
The best most creative salad selections in Portland. Creative tasty cocktails, too.

have dined at ISA for many yrs,twice this week. It's the best food, dining experience in Portland in myself and my wifes view. We just returned from a 2 week vacation in Italy and Isa's food is just as good.

The food and service at Isa were outstanding.  I had the bistro steak and it was exactly right.  the biggest problem is the noise level.  I'm glad that those who needed it at our table had hearing aids
The food and service were outstanding. I would highly recommend Isa Bistro to friends. Would love to go again.
Loved it, great food, great service. We sat outside which was lovely, reserve early if you want a spot at the bar or in the dining room.

Overall, it was a meh experience.  The parking on site was appreciated.  The amount of people who looked under the influence that were walking around in front of the restaurant was not great.  The location is a detractor for the restaurant.  Our waiter was ok, didn’t seem overly concerned about our experience, didn’t notice when waters were empty or that I didn’t drink any of my second drink ordered, the summer spritzer. (It was not good, tasted like orange rind)  I just paid and left, feeling underwhelmed.   When I next want to spend $120 per person for dinner there are a lot of options in Portland with better trained staff and less people in bathrobes at the front window.

Fish added on ceasar salad tasted very fresh and perfectly cooked. Focaccia on Blt was tasty. 
The surrounding area didn't feel super safe with people loitering seeming down on their luck

Excellent food and great service. We sat at the bar and the bartender was very nice, but busy. Hey, we expected that when  we went in. Well worth the experience. We had and shared the seared scallops, farm salad, lobster linguine and beets and pistachios.

The linguine was better than expected. We were expecting heavier sauce, but it was delicate.

Great food and service. Good wine recommendation.

Would love to see one more veggie entree on the menu. I enjoy the eggplant, but I order it every time.

As usual we love Isa for the space, service, food, and atmosphere.
Last night there was a loud group of 6 at the center table and that was hard ie hard to talk to our table of 4 over them. That is not Isa's fault.
We recommend Isa all the time and it is our #1 go to restaurant.
Thank you Isa staff for what your do so well!
Great wine selection and food!!! One of best meals in Portland!
Wonderful food, great service- best experience in Portland!

An absolutely amazing dinner as we were celebrating our anniversary in Portland. Brian did a great job helping us out from behind the bar (ask him to make you his Mexican old fashioned!). All of the food was PHENOMENAL. Truly a five star experience. Felt like we were being treated to Michelin star or James Beard awarded food.

Would definitely return if we were in town again. I'm sure the menu changes, but you can't go wrong with anything. We had the esquites, the lobster tostada, and scallops to start. For our mains, I had the lobster linguine and my wife had the eggplant lasagna. Truly a great experience all around. We hardly took pictures because it was so tasty. We got the mango cheesecake at the end (AMAZING), and they put a candle in it for our anniversary. We lucked out finding a reservation open. Be sure to plan ahead.
Wonderful experience. Each meal, cocktail, and dessert was outstanding!
Everything was great.  Halibut and Sole were delicious, service was good, enjoyable all around.

Really loved the food.
The lobster tostada was divine
The salad with Mango and avocado was fabulous
The Halibut was terrific
Female server was knowledgeable and gracious
Great food and great service. Very quaint bistro setting.
This place was excellent.    Service, drinks, all the food was top notch
Service was awesome. Food was incredible. Everyone was so friendly and welcoming

Excellent chef inspired dishes, family owned with great service.  Modest building that a tourist would not notice, get recommendations from locals for this and many other great restaurants in Portland.

Isa is one of our favorite restaurants.  We have gone there for 15 years, and often choose to take friends there.  Last night we were celebrating an anniversary, and it couldn't have been a more perfect spot for us.  We ate outdoors, had a very experienced waiter, loved everything we ordered.  The food is beautifully presented, artistically presented.  My husband is physically comprised so needed help to get out of his chair.  There were two people who came to help.
I really enjoyed the patio, nice quiet vibe. Steak was AMAZING! Taquitos are small (only 2) but delicious. I will definitely be back.
Perfection all the way around - cocktails, food, waitress- very special

Wonderful combinations of flovor and texture, many choices, all brilliant preparation and presentation. Outstanding selection of non-alcoholic refreshing drinks. Tres leches cake not to be missed.

On a sunny breezy Friday lunch on the patio is recommended, complete with awning to shield from the weather. Unbeatable service and ambiance.

And parking!
The food was very good! Definitely worth a visit!

Catching up with long time friends, in Isa’s relaxed simple space is always a pleasure. Food was delicious (we all ordered seafood and nothing was left). Service casually impeccable - not stuffy.  Appreciated diplomacy of our waitress Anika when it was time to turn over the table. Isa is a consistent fave with our  crowd.
Great food, lovely atmosphere, easy to park.  Cozy and delicious.
Wonderful dining experience, it’s like the dream version of a little bistro in your neighborhood with amazing food and friendly attentive staff.  I highly recommend.
Amazing food and service looking forward to going there again

We really had a lovely meal at Isa. We shared the shaved fennel salad (very good), the fish taco special (so good, a second was ordered), and focaccia. For entrees: the grilled halibut (that was my choice and it was really, really great), the eggplant lasagna (got great reviews), and the sole (our companion said it was excellent). We shared the tres leches cake, and to be honest, that was good, but not great.

I would definitely recommend Isa. One avoids having to go into the heart of Portland which is super busy this time of year and their were no issues with parking. Most importantly, the food and service were excellent.
Delightful restaurant. Seating was a bit awkward in a corner under a dripping air conditioner. Service, food and cocktails were lovely.
Everything superb. Wait staff and kitchen very accommodating serving the taco special ‘deconstructed’ to meet the wishes of our granddaughter.
Amazing food and drinks and the service is always fantastic!
As always everything was wonderful for our Anniversary Dinner celebration.

Cool little restaurant with a hip vibe. The food is top notch, very creative, interesting , and delicious to the last bite. Everything was extraordinary, and I would say worth the high prices, though the portions are small and not really shareable.
The noise level can be pretty high, depending on how many rowdy diners there are. But we will return!

Fabulous food  from a wonderful neighborhood restaurant.  We were in town for a quick overnight and had planned to go to one of the downtown restaurants but decided instead to try Isa Bistro, a bistro with lots of great reviews.  So happy that we did.  We ate at the bar and it was terrific. Highly recommend this place.

The lobster corn chowder was the best I have ever tasted.  Incredible food.  Every.  Single. Time.

Great service, incredible food and cocktails.

Never disappoints.

Great experience and good food.  Some inventive flavors coming out of the kitchen!  I would definitely would return and would recommend the same to anyone else.  It's not pretentious, very down-to-earth and local.
Our favorite restaurant in Portland! We sat at the bar with Bryan, and he guided us through their eclectic and seasonal menu. Every dish was a winner and cocktails were perfection! Highly recommend.

Delightful dinner experience! Service was friendly and professional. Delicious Sole dinner with spinach.  Pork chop was the best my husband ever had!  Desserts were so good, we each had one instead of sharing!

After reading reviews, I chose Isa which was not far from our hotel. It's a cozy room with a tin ceiling and brick walls and a small bar area. The hostess was very friendly and gave us our choice of tables so we took a back corner with a bench seat. We each had a salad. Mine was a tasty watermelon and mango with a mango vinaigrette. The watermelon was very sweet. Yum! I chose a soul with garlicky spinach and small boiled potatoes. My husband got a farm salad and seared scallops which he much enjoyed. The meals were great choices. We declined dessert but they knew it was our anniversary so the hostess brought us a berry sorbet that was just delicious!. Our waiter was terrific, attentive but not overly obtrusive. I'm sorry I didn't get his name. The whole experience was excellent.
Brilliant food with excellent service and perfect surroundings. We’ll be back!
Great food, service, and cocktails, definitely recommend visiting
Have eaten here many times and the food and service is always excellent and consistent
Food was excellent.  Place is noisy and busy and in a bad neighborhood with dozens of homeless people walking by.
Isa is a small bistro near the Portland main Post Office. The food is outstanding and the service is excellent. We have eaten there many times and enjoyed it at each occassion.
Nice food and service. Sketchy neighborhood. Prices too high.
I love this place. One of Portland's best. Great value.

Quaint restaurant with amazing food and beverage . The octopus starter was so delightful . The sole was perfectly cooked and seasoned so nicely , just melted in your mouth. The bolognese was very tasty. Such a great experience .
Great place with superb food.   Unfortunately, the noise level was far too much for me.

Great food, great service, wonderful menu and people!!!!!!! What more can one say? It is our favorite restaurant in Maine and top five, for sure, among the many great restaurants we’ve enjoyed in New York City, Washington, Chicago, London,
and other venues in Europe. Seriously wonderful and relaxed.
Everything we ordered was delicious!  Flavors were

Isa never disappoints! We’ve had many friends and family members meet us there for dinner over the years and everyone always leaves happy! Most recently we celebrated a friend’s birthday. The food, service and drinks were fabulous as always. In 7 years of dining here we’ve never had a poor experience. It also helps that they have parking behind the building!
Excellent as always !  I always appreciate how welcoming the staff are and how good the food is. Love the use of rhubarb this time of year !

Excellent food, excellent service, and lovely ambience. Server was super helpful making drink and food suggestions, and everything was spectacular. A little noisy, but didn’t really detract from the experience. Would definitely eat here again.
This was our third visit and it was excellent, as always. Consistently great food, drink, atmosphere and service.
Excellent service and the food was unbelievable!  If you have the opportunity to eat here, do it!!

Isa never disappoints! The squid appetizer is one of my favorites- a perfect melange of warm and cool, sweet and savory. I tried a new offering on the menu: sole on a bed of spinach with potatoes. It’s a cardinal sin to overcook fish. Isa knows how to cook fish! Dessert - Black Forest Cake with bourbon cherries. Yum!

The place was cute but not in a great area - Curtains should be closed. I had a guy pointing at me from the sidewalk. The food was fine but not great - the service was really good and the wine and dessert were good. Price was fine - but I would not go back.

shaved fennel salad
seared halibut and pan seared sole
mango cheesecake

How fortunate we were to discover Isa Bistro, knowing virtually nothing about Portland.  We needed a light meal so two of us, both women, shared the beet and avocado salad, and two tostadas: one special with battered halibut, and the other lobster with avocado mousse.  So so so good.  We weren’t going to have dessert, but we finished every bit of them too.  The coconut cream pie is hands down the BEST I’ve ever eaten.  And your can’t beat their house made sorbets.  
The wine list is short and complementary to the menu.  Cocktails are also seasonal and well done.  
The caters to all sorts of people…old and younger.  We both feel like we’d hit the jackpot and are still talking about it the day after!  And will on the way home!!!!

Have eaten here many times and the food is always delicious. We always sit at the bar and the bartenders are very friendly, knowledgeable and very efficient. They also make excellent recommendations for pairing wine or cocktails with the food. Highly recommend this establishment.

2nd time my wife and I have eaten at Isa in the past month. Both times we went with another couple.
We thoroughly enjoyed our meal both times. Each of the 4 of us had different dishes on both visits. They were uniformly good. We each had an appetizer, main and we split 2 desserts.
The bar makes some outstanding cocktails.
If there is a weakness it is in the selection of wines by the glass - somewhat limited - although what the offer is very good.
Awesome in every way, as always! The sole and the ramp pasta were especially🔥🔥
What an enjoyable meal out! We did sort of tapas style and shared a few small plates and a salad. Everything was excellent and the service was on point.

All of the dishes were beautifully presented and delicious. The fiddleheads were the best I ever had, and I’ve been eating them for over 50 years. My sister declared the halibut the best she ever tasted. I was on crutches and the staff was super accommodating and attentive to my situation. I will definitely dine there again the next time I’m in town!
Wonderful experience all around. Everyone at our table LOVED what they ordered from drinks to apps to entrees. Server was funny and attentive - a truly lovely addition to the whole evening.
Have been here twice and the food and wine are always great.

Food was perfectly prepared and delicious. Drinks were excellent as well and the “hometown “ atmosphere was palpable. We try to do one unique and special restaurant each time we return to Portland and Iso Bistro did not disappoint. We plan to return!

It’s rated number one in Portland for a reason. The chef has a gentle touch and brings about a subtle blending of all the flavors. The waiter, Justine, answered all our questions and never made you feel rushed.
We must have liked it because today is Monday and we made reservations for Thursday already.
The menu is very creative and the staff goes out of its way to make customers feel wanted and comfortable.

We loved the food here and the service was excellent. However, the location is not in a great part of town, which was the one and only negative. So park somewhere close by if you can’t get a space in their small parking area behind the restaurant and once you are inside you’ll be in for a treat!
Wonder dinner celebrating Mother's Day and my Birthday ..... Great company and great well prepared dinner,,, specialty drinks were great too !!
Another great meal at Isa Bistro. Consistently the staff is attentive and knowledgeable about their food and wine.

The food is superb. Every dish (3 apps & 2 entrees) we tried had a nuance and flavor that made it a winner. We sat at the bar, and the bartender was super helpful in guiding our choices and ensuring that we were happy throughout. Even the mocktail we tried was great (and at $7, a bargain). If I’m back in Portland, I’m eating here.
Perfect.  Great food, reasonable prices. Nice pace to meal.
A small cozy bistro with many tasty food options! We really enjoyed the octopus, steak, and branzino.
Extraordinary!  We were delighted with the food, the ambiance, and our server Justin!  We will definitely recommend Isa Bistro and will be back soon.
Great bistro ambience, pleasant bartender, exceptional pasta dishes.
Always great food and great service at Isa Bistro!
My husband sent me for a birthday dinner with four friends -- food was delicious, cocktails were excellent, service was attentive and considerate. Isa is a gem!
Two of us had the special which was a fancy beef stew dish. It was extra delicious. From our salads to the desert the plates were bare when we were finished. That says it all.

We had a memorable dinner at Esa a year ago, and when we returned this past Saturday, the food was just as good.   The eggplant lasagna and tagliatelle bolognese were excellent.   The place feels off the beaten path but it is only a short drive from old port, where we were staying, and definitely worth the trip.

Great food. Small little bistro. Cute. Only negative was that our server didn’t tell us the specials and they sounded amazing and I would have ordered one but didn’t know about it. (To be fair, the food we did order was delicious and well crafted)
Justin is a perfect server. Very friendly but not too much and always checking in at the right pace. The food was great. Best restaurant in Portland.

What a find Isa Bistro is.  Tastefully decorated with well thought out offerings make thos restaurant one of my top favorites in Portland. Great for date night or to catch up with friends. Has something on the menu for everyone.

Bistro Steak was flavorful and cooked perfectly- medium rare.
Lobster Tostada app
“We’ll be back”
Fantastic, absolutely deserves the title of #1 restaurant in Portland!

There were 4 of us in our group. We each ordered a different appetizer, main course and even different drinks, We got small tastes of the other's dishes. Each was really good. Service was also excellent. Waiter told our table there was only 1 left of the special appetizer of the day (duck liver pate) and we immediately placed an order for it.
The bill was about $130 per couple. Two drinks (wine or cocktail), appetizers and main course, plus a side order of focaccia for the table.
We will definitely go back in the near future.

Have wanted to try this restaurant for 3 years! Off the beaten path but well worth the trip. The food was outstanding - lived up to all the reviews. Service was great, food was served nice & hot, and drinks were all very good. I would definitely recommend Isa  and cannot wait to go back!
A tremendously lovely meal from beginning to end. Service was solicitous without being overbearing. The food and drinks were exquisite. And we were all able to hear each other!
Always a treat to eat here. Love the food and the setting.

Dinner for two. We both ordered steak—one medium, the other medium rare. How wonderful to actually get the steaks perfectly cooked. A steak knife was provided but the meat was so tender that an ordinary knife would have sufficed. This is a boutique bistro, and easy to drive past, so watch for it carefully. I have already recommended it to friends who might find themselves in Portland. It's not inexpensive, but, you get what you pay for, and, in this case, it was worth every dollar. The husband/wife team who own the restaurant have created something special, which provides a master-class in how high-quality bistro service should be done.
Great experience! Was our first time looking for something new.  Was very impressed with menu.  The food was very good.  We would definitely go back!
Always the best dining experience in Portland! From apps to desert, Isa and his team create consistently delicious food and my cocktail with beet shrub was over the moon!

Wonderful place. Great service. Friendly atmosphere. Delicious food.

Thank you!

Isa Bistro was everything I hoped it would be and more! We had the field greens -delicious onion vinaigrette -and we had the beet salad. Also amazing. My husband had the trout and I had the tagliatelle. Both were completely delicious. I wish I lived closer. I’d be here all the time.

We love Isa and are regular diners.  We love how they vary the menu just enough, the service is so lovely and welcoming and the atmosphere wonderful.  It is one of our favorite places in a city full of good places to eat!  Top of the tops.

Good and service were great as usual. But, we had booked the window table (and confirmed that less than a week before) as we were celebrating our son’s engagement and found it had been given to another party. The hostess didn’t provide a reason for the mistake other than the other party arrived first. Very disappointing.
Incredible service and superb food! The price is on par with other Portland restaurants. Only the second time I've been for dinner (but have been for brunch countless times). 10/10 would recommend.
Great server/bartender.  Delicious food.  Will definitely return!
We ate at the bar and bartender was great. We had octopus shaved fennel salad grilled brazino and eggplant lasagna. All excellent.

Isa continues to impress both of us with the creativity and quality of meals. It’s our favorite restaurant in Portland and we try to get there frequently- although last minute reservations are impossible.

What a gem! Isa Bistro provided a limited but choice menu. the seared scallop appetizer, the succulent pork chop on a bed of lentils and carrots, and the Black Forest Cake infused with espresso were each exquisite with lovely presentation and perfectly balanced layers of flavor. The staff were professional and attentive without being stuffy. We had a wonderful experience and look forward to a repeat visit.
Always wonderful. If you’ve never been you’re missing out on one of Portland’s finest dining experiences

The food was delicious, the service was excellent and the ambience
was fantastic

Delicious food, attentive service, and homey, charming atmosphere. Make sure you order the scallops with pineapple gastrique. Best scallop dish ever. Pork chop and halibut were also very good. We want to go back and try more small plates. Can’t wait for a return visit.

You can’t miss with whatever you order. Superb and artfully presented. The homemade coconut ice cream for dessert was an unexpected delight.
The bartender concocted a lemon snap, perfectly posh for lunch!
Be sure to give a nod to the chefs, who magically make all this happen.
Great experience. Waiter was attentive but not too much. He was extremely patient with us. The food was wonderful. Fantastic evening!
Super good and wine choices... reasonable prices... excellent wait staff... highly recommended

Dinner at ISA was a great experience in. The service was great and the menu was filled with creative dishes. And everything our party ordered was prepared perfectly and delicious. We really loved the lobster tostado appetizer and the beet  and avocado salad and the eggplant, lasagna, and shrimp entrées.(all of which we shared) the real was complemented by great wine pairings. Dessert was coconut custard pie, Also delicious. We can’t wait to return and try the rest of the menu.

First time going to Isa for dinner.  We had the octopus as an appetizer.  I had the branzino (the regular prep, although the Mexican special sounded great too) and it was outstanding.  My wife had the grilled pork chop which was outstanding.  Great flavor, preparation and presentation.  We definitely will add this to our regular rotation... and it's open on Monday when choices are more limited.
Excellent experience, food was fantastic, wait staff very attentive without being overbearing.

Fantastic menu that delivers! Every course, every bite was a food memory.
Our party is still talking about. With such a  bewildering array of great place to eat in Portland, make it easy and set the bar with Isa! (And no, I have no relation or connection with Isa, just a new ardent admirer).
      Jim
Amazing food and amazing staff! We loved our anniversary dinner here.

This was the first time we have been to Isa Bistro. The entire evening was superb. The food, the service, the vibe, the decor all were creative and superior. We’ve lived in and around Portland for about 20 years and eaten at many excellent restaurants in Portland. We REALLY enjoyed our time at I/B and will enthusiastically recommend it to our many friends in the area. Thank you!!

The service was excellent and the ambiance inviting.  The food was absolutely amazing.  We had the beet and avocado salad, the branzino fish and pork chop.  Best meal I have had in Portland in quite a while!
Three of us all had different entrees and loved them. Very comfortable and welcoming space. Also has parking.
The food was excellent. The server was knowledgeable and kind. It was a wonderful experience.
Warm welcome, friendly service.  Food always excellent, recommend the Branzino and the eggplant lasagna also the beet and avocado salad.
Best restaurant experience in Portland thus far. Will definitely return.
Never lets us down. Pork chop is almost always on the menu, but preparation varies and is always a winner. Had burrata and citrus salad, and scallops for starters. Both delicious.

The food was delicious. I had the lobster tacos that were out of this world! I always get the apple fennel salad which is wonderfully dressed and so full of flavor. My husband had the meatball sandwich which he really liked.

We ordered every starter, a main, and two desserts.  Every item was beautifully executed and polished; the team was friendly with exactly the right level of attentiveness.   Succulent octopus, stand-out lobster ravioli , savory gambas al ajillo on a bed of perfectly prepared linguine, and cod fritters that felt like they were in an impossibly thin, crispy battered shell.  We will definitely be back!
Excellent t experience!! Bar seating, service was friendly and fast. Fresh food and wonderful atmosphere. Small space but ample background noise. Well done ISA!!

Great food in a cozy atmosphere. Cocktails were delicious and our server was attentive without being overbearing. Steak was cooked perfectly and tiramisu for dessert was a delight. Would highly recommended!
Great menu, food well prepared, staff professional, enjoyable dining experience.
Outstanding service and fantastic bistro fare with a lovely twist. Cocktails (especially the Night Owl) are absolutely top-notch.
Intimate, nice place with professional staff that know what they are doing.  Great food and creative menu.

We went for the Valentine’s Day menu and I got literal goosebumps with the first bite of each dish! The food here is incredible and the service was friendly and fast. $110 per person for 3 courses was a bit much, but $75 per person would be reasonable given the elevated menu.
Very great service! Delicious food and drinks! Just wish there were more vegetarian options!
Our first time at Isa was amazing! The cocktails were unique and delicious, the food was some of the best I’ve ever had. The staff was friendly and attentive. We will definitely be back!
Great meal.  We do date lunches there.  Highly recommend.

We had a fantastic dinner at Isa the other night! The food was amazing, but what stood out the most was the service. Our server was lovely and coursed/timed the food perfectly. We'll definitely be back!

What a fabulous dining experience!  Food was delicious and priced reasonably, even the specials. Highly recommend the octopus appetizer, the eggplant lasagna, and if they offer the specials of quinoa salad and lamb tagliatelle, by all means get them. The service was superb, parking easy. We can’t wait to go back and wish we had found this gem sooner.
Outstanding food quality, service and overall dining experience in a quaint charming atmosphere.  A must go again.

One of our favorite restaurants in Portland. Small and comfortable, with great food. The brick interior provides an intimate space. Salads were crisp and delicious. Entrees were well-prepared, well-presented and flavorful. We all enjoyed our meals and it was easy to carry on conversations!
Terrific variety. high quality, one of our favorites.

This review from 2/4/23 having dinner at the bar with my wife. We had enjoyable conversation with the bartender who gave us great advice on house cocktails and the menu. The bar is small and nice. We had a terrific meal, great drinks and look forward to going back again soon. The restaurant also has good nearby parking.
The food (cod fritters, beet salad, bolognese and shrimp pasta) and cocktails (specifically Shrubbery No One) were outstanding, and the service was great. Highly highly recommend!
Every bite was amazing. Isa Bistro exceeded our expectations.

The food was worth the price and the service was excellent.  I got the Bolognese pasta and ate every last bite, and I’m still thinking about the focaccia bread we ordered as a starter - so warm and delicious.  Highly recommend.  If you get a window seat in a weekend night you have a great view of Bubbas

Exceptional food, lovely ambiance, outstanding service - we've already decided that we will definitely be returning to Isa! It's a gem worth revisiting for anyone seeking a memorable culinary journey. Highly recommended!

Food was amazing. Tried Grilled octopus for the first time and it was really tasty. Eggplant Lasagna was delicious. Service was spot on and would highly recommend. Definitely need a reservation as is a very small place.
Food, atmosphere, and service the best in Portland
Excellent food, great atmosphere and exceptional service!
