Awesome as always. This is our favorite place to go. Always looking for that special just to try something new. I’ve never been disappointed. Chris and Isabella are awesome.
Absolutely fabulous! First meal on my first trip to Portland and Isa Bistro did not disappoint! Sat at the bar and had the pork chop, beet salad & lobster tostada- must try’s!
A truly hidden gem in Portland! Will definitely be back

Dinner was delicious! Nice corner table but we would sit at the bar next time to try that. 
Serving size was perfect, great flavor. 
The waiter let us try a couple different wines before we chose a bottle. 
Look forward to a return trip!
Isa- always the best, most consistently delicious food in Portland.
Excellent food!  Also impressed with the quality of cocktails, wine, and beer list.

I was with a friend who is not afraid to voice her opinion and she said in the few months she’s been in Portland, it’s by far her favorite restaurant, and she’s been to the big names. She sampled all three entrees and raved. For me, it was nothing different because I expect excellence and got it

My wife and I ate here on a quiet Monday night and it was fantastic. Service was just right, attentative but not overbearing. The food was uniformly excellent. Well prepared, well plated, well proportioned, and just delicious. Would recommend to anyone looking for a fresh, creative, excellent meal. 5/5 stars!

The food was 5 star. The service was spot-on with a relaxed vibe that my wife and I appreciate. We love high-end food without the stiff atmosphere that so often accompanies it. This place fit the bill!

We had a great experience at Isa Bistro. The seasonal menu had a lot of great options to choose from. The quality was unreal. The location was easy to get to from Old Port. We loved the ambiance and cozy feel. The staff and owners do a great job to care for regulars and new visitors from out of town.
The kitchen seldom disappoints with its seasonal, south-of-the-border influenced menu.
Isa never disappoints. It’s our favorite restaurant in Portland. The homemade tortillas are to die for 🤤.

Great neighborhood vibe. Sat at the bar and enjoyed the bartender,who also waited on us for food. He makes a great Manahatten! His own concoction. The arugula,burrata citrus salad was really tasty. The special  lamb and pasta dish was very well prepared. Coconut cream pie was a great ending. Would not hesitate to go back. Wish I lived closer!
Never disappoints! Amazing quality and creatively of dishes cooked to perfection
Delightful dinner for two. Service was attentive and friendly. Food and wine was excellent

It was a lovely evening. We waited a long time to dine here and wondered why we waited so long.
Everything was wonderful. Our server, Isabella, was gracious & knowledgeable about the menu and offerings. The food was outstanding.
We cannot say enough about the experience.
Thank you for everything.
Time and again we return to Isa because it is consistently warm and welcoming with terrific staff, fabulous food, and a wonderful feel. It is our "go to" restaurant in Portland.
Food was exceptional. Portions were good size - not too big or small. Little pricey but where is it not anymore. Still felt like the food lived up to it.
Had a delicious dinner at the bar everything was perfect  Service was super friendly also.
Not sure why I waited so long to try Isa… made up for it by visiting 2X this week - most excellent
Excellent and interesting food. Great choice for Prix Fixe New Year's Eve. Good value and the restaurant has now shot to the top of our list.
Small, yet cozy dining atmosphere. Hidden gem in the neighborhood. Great quality of food. Highly recommended.
Isa is a gem.  The food is excellent even if understated, the staff is friendly and knowledgeable and the amibiance is cozy and inviting.
Remarkable. Lovely. Sublime. And neither of the owners was working which is a true testament to their team. Will be RUNNING back soon!
Great food.  Great service.  Easy parking!
Food always excellent and menu is always changing to keep restaurant fresh. Top notch, ranks with best restaurants all over the world.
So yummy, stellar service and cosy atmosphere. Definitely returning.
Excellent service and food! I would highly recommend
Exceptional food and service. The jalapeño margaritas were fantastic. The atmosphere was cozy.

Went to Isa for the first time last night to celebrate our anniversary. We had an excellent experience. The service from our primary server, Annika, was outstanding. All of the staff was extremely helpful and attentive. We both loved our dinners, and we also shared a salad and appetizer. Everything was delicious as well as the bottle of wine Annika helped us choose. They even topped off our evening with a scoop of their homemade sea salt ice cream with a candle lit to celebrate our anniversary.  We would definitely go back and would highly  recommend Isa to others.

It is amazing- the food is so delicious and perfectly prepared ad served. You literally want to lick the plate clean and get every drop it’s that good.
10 out of 10 stars on my rating scale and we both grew up in the restaurant industry.

Isa is the perfect place for an intimate date night. The restaurant’s ambiance is warm, cozy and charming. Our waiter was exceptional, very kind and welcoming. The appetizers were exceptional, each very tasteful and different than the other. Our main course was just as wonderful. The dessert was 10/10. Would recommend to anyone and for sure would return if we’re in Maine again!

Service was fabulous!
Friendly and lighthearted 😊

Eggplant lasagna very yummy!
Everyone in our party loved their dishes.
My party of 4 enjoyed the entire experience for lunch. It was great. The menu was uniquely creative. It will end be on our list of "regulars".
Delicious lobster tacos, excellent service at the bar and a personal welcome from the owner. Perfection!
The food was incredible. Lovely presentation, creative additions, tasty and delicious. Also, the chefs were having a great time doing their work, and it showed in the dishes. Yum!
Absolutely one of the best meals ever. We loved every bite. Great food and fabulous service. We are huge fans and will be back next visit.  Highly recommend.
As always, Isa is perfect!  Food, service and ambiance make it the perfect spot for any occasion. In fact, I will be celebrating NYE and my birthday there this year!!
Excellent all-around restaurant that I gave my highest possible recommendation

Delicious food. Nice restaurant. 
Attentive staff.
Eggplant Lasagna was everything a lasagna should be. Branzino was tender and delicious. The birthday boy loved his baked apples with salted caramel and a candle.  A memorable and special meal!
The octopus, the duck, the fries, oh my! Great meal!
Delicious from beginning til end, server was very knowledgeable of menu.
Excellent spot, great food and wonderful service.
Great experience! Everything on their menu looked delicious, and we were very happy with the food and drinks we ordered. Service was also very friendly and attentive. Will be back!
If you are just visiting Portland- don’t eat here!  When you get back home you will only compare your local fave with this experience- and be disappointed!  Great quality food and value!
Still our favorite restaurant in Portland. The food has never disappointed us.
Always a great experience at Isa.  It’s in our list of top 10 restaurants in Portland.
Really great food and service. Would definitely go again.
Always fabulous—delicious, friendly, charming, a go-to favorite, for sure!

ISA has become my favorite restaurant in Portland, better than Fore Street (which I love) or any of the other fine dining establishments. The food is always wonderful and the drinks are excellent. The menu is always interesting and varied. I highly recommend ISA.
Outstanding!  Every person in our party of 9 thoroughly enjoyed their meal.  A truly superlative experience.
We have dined a Isa Bistro many times.  Always great.  The noise level, music was a bit loud.

Our experience last night was incredible appetizers main desserts drinks everything was five stars. By far is the best dinner we’ve had in Portland in years service was impeccable. Food was so tasteful and presented beautifully.

Isa is the perfect restaurant: cozy, comfortable, inspired menu, excellent and personal waitstaff. We love that we can dine there frequently, and still discover new dishes created by the wonderful chef every time we go.
Easy parking on site; never having to wait for a reserved table. A warm and friendly hostess who remembers your name and welcomes you back.
Amazing food, great service and incredible ambiance. I will definitely be back!

We began with two excellent cocktails, the Mezcal Negroni and Hibiscus Margarita. The Grilled Octopus appetizer was one of the best we've ever had, and we've had many fine versions. The duck breast chef's special was terrific; perhaps the only very slight disappointment was the Short Rib pasta dish which was just a little less dark and rich than we were expecting, but still delicious. Service was excellent and the evening delightful, thank you!

Brilliant food and service as usual.  Bolognese is to die for.  Love the short ribs never fail to please.  Our go to night out.  Love sitting at the bar and chatting with the bartenders.  They are always a lot of fun.
Would highly recommend Isa. Service and food were both great.  Give the beet and avocado salad a try.
Just great all around. Split two apps and a main (the pork chop is highly recommended) with a friend from out of town. The drinks, the vibe, the food are a perfect combo.
Great spot! Would come back again. Good food, good service, quaint atmosphere.
Isa is my go-to. Absolutely. Thank you again for a wonderful evening with friends!

When I looked at the menus of several upscale restaurants in Portland, I honestly couldn’t think what I’d order. Everything was so odd it didn’t even look good. Isa’s menu offered food I don’t often get, but actually sounded appetizing. So we booked in there, and are so glad we did. We had duck, halibut and pork chop for our mains. Nothing unusual, but seasoned, sauced and presented in creative, delicious ways. Appetizers and desserts were also very good. The coconut pie was especially outstanding. Service was quick, knowledgeable and attentive. And there was parking!
Isa is one of the best restaurants in Portland.  Great experience from beginning to end!

Lovely little restaurant - unexpected little gem with a contained menu. What is on offer is all done very well and carefully considered. Surprising flavor combinations that work well and quality ingredients. Staff are very friendly and even added a candle to our dessert for our anniversary (I didn’t ask for this so it was a nice added gesture on their part).
Love Isa Bistro!   Eggplant lasagna and tres leches cake are unreal.  So good

The food was absolutely fantastic. We got the octopus appetizer, the short rib pasta, and the pork chop—seriously one of the best meals we’ve had (and we go out to eat a lot and try new places). The service was awesome and the cocktails were delicious too. Highly recommend!
Food was delicious and the service excellent. Great experience.
Great food, drink, service and atmosphere. Also easy to park.

The Isa Bistro was lovely and the food and service from Logan and team excellent. My new bride and I enjoyed a lobster tostada as a starter, then the Gulf of Maine Sole and Crab Linguine. We finished with a perfectly baked coconut cream pie. Highly recommended!

I always love going here. It is one of the places I always take guest to if I have out-of-town visitors. Absolutely one of my favorite places to dine in the Portland area. The food is always fantastic. One thing I will say about last night is the service was better than ever and I didn’t think it was possible.

The restaurant is small, intimate and cozy.  We sat at the bar and had great service from the bartender! We shared caeser salad which was excellent.  I had the crab linguine and it was delicious. My husband raved about the eggplant lasagne. It was light and flavorful, and melted in your mouth.  We shared the chocolate ganache cake with caramel and sea salt.  Yummm!! We loved our experience at Isa.

Spent a few days in Maine and were fortunate to discover a great family run neighborhood bistro called Isa. The food and service were truly amazing, so we ate there two nights in a row on our trip.

The Lobster Tostada and Crispy Potato Taquitos were fun appetizers, for our meal we enjoyed the Seared Duck, Short-rib Pasta and the amazing Eggplant Lasagna.

A true find, hope that you wil enjoy it as much as our family did.

We think it’s the best in Portland.
A hidden gem.
We had a fabulous birthday celebration at Isa.  Can’t wait to return!

The restaurants is really special and intimate. The food was delicious and everything we ordered was tasty. The beet salad was wonderful and the lobster tostado was great. The duck, halibut, sole and lasagne were perfect and we loved our meal.

Excellent menu in a friendly un-fussy bistro.
The Chef clearly knows what he is doing, the waitstaff are very knowledgeable and friendly and the bar staff is as well.

Our meal at Isa was delicious. I had the seared Halibut and it was next level. My mom had the beet and goat cheese salad, (amazing) and lobster taco which she was very happy with. The wine was perfect and our waiter was great. It is a  relaxed atmosphere- unpretentious and comfortable. I would recommend an Uber as it is a bit off the beaten path and if you’re walking from the wharf you do have to walk the gauntlet of homeless which while not terribly unsafe, is unappetizing. But Isa is worth the hype.
Isa is always fabulous. There's never an item I have ordered that is a bit "off" or just "okay" for a nice bistro. If I am entertaining friends coming from out of town, Isa is the answer.

Sunset makes a few of the tables challenging as the blinds are not sun blocking.  
The bar patrons can be loud.
Food is outstanding and service is just right.
Excellent food, excellent service. Friendly/non-pretentious upscale ambience.

First, the food was absolutely excellent. My partner started with  the Lobster Tostada  and had the Seared Halibut for his entree. I had the Cod Fritters to start and the Eggplant Lasagna for my entree.  It totally lived up to its reputation - just exceptional!  We were seated promptly (reservations recommended) and our waiter, Justin, was pleasantly attentive.  He suggested a very nice wine, A Telleira Godello,  a Spanish white, that was a perfect paring. The ambiance is friendly, - soft buzz of conversation, small, but not jammed together - a true gem!  Highly recommended!!

We made reservations way ahead of time because we heard this place was so good. My husband & I had 1 glass of wine & the waiter refused to serve us anymore because he felt we were slurring our words. This was absolutely ridiculous as we had nothing until we got there. I can’t even say how the food was because we were so humiliated. First time in 72 years I was refused a drink!
Delicious food, always beautifully prepared and presented. Staff is terrific, friendly but always professional. Lovely room. Go now!
Great food and service. Chairs could be a little more comfortable but it is a bistro after all
Always a wonderful experience.
One of our favorite dinner spots in Portland. The food is awlays consistent and delicious!
Once again, a fabulous meal! And the best coconut cream pie I ever tasted!!
Fabulous!  Excellent attention to detail-each meal was done perfectly. Our best meal in Portland by far.
The food & service was AMAZING!!!!! The lobster tacos are the best we’ve had EVER.
Good restaurant in small space.  A lot of homeless in the neighborhood

Truly one of my favorite restaurants in Portland for so many reasons. Cozy, friendly, and a menu that starts with excellent ingredients and is both creative comfort food and elegant world cuisine at the same time. Lovely people and immense talent.

Fantastic environment coupled with phenomenal food made our experience unforgettable. Adding the fantastic service truly made our visit memorable and enjoyable. 

Highly recommend this restaurant
Could not get a taxi to come back, lots of homeless on Portland

We had a wonderful trip to Portland ME and this was our first dinner. We ended up sitting up at the bar and had a GREAT view of the chef owner and kitchen. The bartender / waiter was engaging and knowledgeable. The food was amazing and I loved the eclectic nature of its origins. The grilled Octopus w/ chimichurri sauce was incredible and the eggplant lasagna was both delicious and lighter than expected. The cocktail combinations were creative and tasty. Not being a dessert person the biggest surprise came from dessert. I never order dessert because I am a savory over sweet person but the bartender highly recommended the Dulche de Leche cake and it did not disappoint!! The only draw back is that it is a bit off the main part of town and resides near a homeless shelter so many homeless were around the streets around the restaurant.
We had an outstanding meal at Isa. The main courses were both great (Pork Chop and Sole). The Heirloom tomato salad is memorable!

We visited based on Trip Adviser reviews where Isa is the top rated restaurant in Portland - and found it deserves to be there.  The service is excellent, the food is tasty and well presented, and the entire experience was most enjoyable.

We've been to Isa many times and have always had excellent food and service. It has become our favorite Portland restaurant -- small, intimate, away from the crowds of the Old Port and downtown, easy parking, and friendly staff. We'll be back!

We went on a Sunday evening. Had the lobster tostada, pasta Bolognese and dessert.  Everything was delicious and we enjoyed our dinner near the window.  The restaurant was a little bit of a walk from the touristy water front area, but worth it in our opinion.  The neighborhood; walking there was a bit uncomfortable but there were plenty of people out and about and no one paid us any mind.  And I felt more comfortable walking back after a good experience walking there.  I would recommend driving if you don't want to cross some busy roads and don't like walking up hill.  The restaurant itself was lovely and we were treated very kindly.  Thanks for a nice evening😊

The appetizers were incredible.  The mains were very good too, but the burst of flavors and fun at the appetizer level is notable.  The noise level was a little loud for us - we sat in doors in the middle of the restaurant so maybe a different location would have provided a different acoustical experience.  We'd love it a little quieter to make for a more intimate setting to match the delicious food and incredible service, but all in all, the sound level was tolerable.  This is an underappreciated gem!
High marks for the mushroom/quail egg appetizer, Caesar salad, halibut, special side of shishito peppers, and chocolate pie.
Absolutely fantastic! The service was great and so was the food! We got the bolognese, pork chop and lobster tostada. It did not disappoint!! Would definitely recommend!

Flavours were sound but fell short of our expectations. We both had halibut and the overall rush was just about ok. It was served a little tepid. We did not complain for fear of a ‘ping pong’ microwave top up if heat. Or a 15 minute delay for as mother. It was ok.

It’s not the best value you will find but service was very good and pleasant, they obviously know how to cook , ISA came recommended by a couple that do know foods
Not a huge menu but everything was quite wonderful, from specialty cocktails to dessert!
Always our favorite place to eat! We always confident in knowing we will have a wonderful experience and meal when dining at Isa.
A mushroom on toast with quail eggs was reminiscent if Spain and delicious. The Elote was excellent and a big hit at our table. The Halibut was perfectly cooked and scented with fennel.

We have now been to ISA a half dozen times and have found it to be remarkably consistent regarding the quality and presentation and portioning of starters, main courses and desserts. This place is a bit off the beaten path, but it is worth the visit and it just doesn't disappoint. Service is top notch.
The cod cakes and the two special appetizers were amazing as were our three entrees. And we always love the service and servers, such a warm group. Can’t wait to go again.

Food, service, experience and setting were perfect. And thank you for a respectable pour of wine. Great attention and detail to my needs as a guest with celiac disease. Can’t wait to return and try some of the other delectable offerings!

This is our fourth trip to Portland in the last five months but our first visit to Isa. I don't know why it took so long for us to get here. It was wonderful from beginning to end. The atmosphere is quaint, the service is excellent and accommodating and the food is scrumptious. Don't miss the octopus, which was so tender, the halibut, eggplant lasagna!  The desserts are a must too. We love to eat and experience many options in Portland. So far, this is our favorite!!
Great little find for an intimate lunch with a friend. Small but varied, creative menu.  Wonderful friendly service.
This little place is a culinary gem! Every plate from the appetizers to the desserts was excellent! There is a reason why Trip Advisor has them ranked No. 1!
Wonderful meal, interesting wine list, good ambiance
Everything was excellent, especially the food and the server.  The only small change I would like is more eggplant in the lasagne.
EXCELLENT dinner – 6 out of 6 food items were all VERY good.  The Esquites (Mexican street corn) and Eggplant Lasagna were standouts.
The only place to go in Portland for pasta bolognese! Great service, genteel patrons, tables comfortably placed in charming indoor & outdoor spaces.
Isa is consistently great: elevated comfort food served in a beautiful room by people who care about what they are doing.
Overall an excellent experience very much in line with most reviews.
An amazing dining experience.  Creative food served with great presentation y friendly staff. Top notch all the way.

My wife and I shared our 113th anniversary dinner with the friendly Isa family once again and we look forward to many more. The food was excellent ad the service was very good as well, we love Isa, the people are very friendly, well attentive to all and just a remarkable evening, you cannot go wrong.

Thank you all !..... again
We had the perfect dinner tonight! Appetizers, salads, and entrees that we chose were all different and all delicious. Staff was knowledgeable and helpful. Definitely recommend.
Lovely ambiance, friendly owners and waitstaff, and wonderful, inventive food offerings. And what's more, the desserts were worth the extra calories. We'll be back!

Impeccable service, delicious food. Some portions are somewhat small for the price in my opinion but I think it’s probably good value for Portland. Have been a couple times, always sat outside on the patio. Will surely return.

Great early dinner.  My wife and I had not been there in a while, but it was as fantastic as we recalled.  Great service, great menu, great venue.  Highly recommended just for whenever, a date night, a more special occasion, really whatever.  Thanks.
Food was unique and delicious. Service was friendly and professional

My meal was excellent. The only reservation was the octopus, which was deliciously grilled, but I do not think the chickpeas were a good accompaniment. I would’ve preferred two pieces of octopus, rather than one, and both pieces served with butter sautéed in garlic and herbs and lemon juice.
Best restaurant in Portland, hands down. Food, service everything was great!
I met friends for lunch recently. The  vibes of the restaurant are great, the food was excellent & the staff was attentive & friendly. The whole experience was was perfect.
Great place for foodies for sure!!  Missed out on so many trips in retrospect - we’ll be back for sure!!
Excellent service and fabulous food, fairly priced.   Noisy when full but everyone was clearly having a good time.

This is one of our favorite restaurants.  Consistently good.  Always great service.  There were four of us last night, all over 80.  Two with hearing aids who were struggling to hear over the noise.  Next time I think we'll reserve for 5:00 or 5:30 instead of 6:00.
Every course was spectacular - complex flavors in every bite.
Wonderful surprise in Portland dining scene can’t wait to go back
Delicious food. All of it! Bolognese and eggplant lasagna and salads were perfect. Great tiny spot with nice ambiance. Def recommend

Another wonderful dining experience in Portland Maine.
The food was outstanding as was the service.
A great find and a restaurant we will come back to - often!

We liked the atmosphere and had excellent service. We started with the lobster tostadas and it was wonderful. For our entrees we split the pork chop and monkfish. Both were flavorful but both were dry and overcooked for our taste.
Wonderful food and service.  Another great option in Portland.
The food was great. Amazing presentation. The service was wonderful.

Delicious food, excellent service, parking available. Sitting at the bar was perfect for us celebrating our 27th wedding anniversary! We enjoyed talking and celebrating with the diners around us. So fun!

Tremendous food, presentation, and service. It was a lovely experience. Staff were highly attentive without being at all overbearing. Entrees included the halibut, linguini, and the bolognese pasta dish. All were delicious. Similarly, the fennel salad, octopus, cheesecake, chocolate pie (I don’t even like chocolate that much and seriously kept going back for more tastes, elegant. The Refresh cocktail-yes.

One of my favorite places ! Great Lobster tacos and the French fries are simply the best!
All their dishes are delicious!

Sat at the bar.  Enjoyed talking with the bartender.  Everything we ordered he recommended and we loved it all: the IPA beers, the shishito peppers, the pork chop with grilled peaches, the fennel salad, the focaccia and the killer coconut cream pie.  Isa is a family run business and they have everything nailed down beautifully.
Food was near perfect, perfectly paced. The waitstaff was lovely! Would go back.

We had a very enjoyable experience. Our bartender and waiter Bryan was superlative, great cocktails, conversations, and service. We have had a long history of eating at many superlative restaurants here. Isa fed into that discussion, because of it’s deep kitchen staff that created professional and competent  octopus and cod fritter appetizers and a truly sensational pork chop with peach compote and a seared halibut  filet with an exquisite tomato chutney. We came to Portland to experience several of their best restaurants, and Isa may have stolen our hearts.
Isa was amazing!  Staff was right on from the moment we walked in.  Nice atmosphere - has parking for several cars.  Food was great and drinks were great!
Excellent food, clearly prepared with love, care and expertise
Outstanding and friendly, competent service; delicious food.
Excellent in every column!  I would not hesitate to highly recommend.
Every dish was a hit and there were no missed. Food and cocktails were seasonal and superb!

We went to Isa for our 18th anniversary and it was great, as always.  Their food is always delicious (especially loved the peach crostini and the halibut) and the restaurant has a wonderful atmosphere.  I love that the owners are right there - one working in the front of the restaurant (very personable) and one is the chef (very talented).  It really has become our go-to place for a fantastic meal!
Excellent food service and value. A gem I'd happily return to.

We were thrilled with the discovery of Isa Bistro. We are visiting the Portland area for the month of August and selected Isa Bistro from the reviews on Open Table. Although the menu is eclectic and even surprising - crostini with blueberries and peaches? - take the plunge. It’s worth it. Everything was fabulous.

Food was great. The octopus chimmichuri was phenomenal, and the tomato burrito salad was super fresh and tasty. Service was fantastic, the server was always looking out for anything we needed. Overall ambience was perfect for a special date night.
We love this restaurant for all it has to offer!  It is our "go to" place.
Been to Isa many times loved absolutely everything there!  Food always tastes amazing and service also fantastic!
We dined early at noon on a rainy day. Food and service were perfect. The Tagliatele and bolongnaise and the coconut pie were delicious.
The eggplant lasagna was a work of art. Many layers of tender fresh pasta with equally tender thinly sliced sautéed eggplant with a delicious tomato sauce and fresh ricotta.
I can't wait to go back!  There were so many things I wanted to try!  The Lobster Tostino, the Peach Crostini, the fries,  the heirloom tomato salad, and the coconut cream pie were all delicious!

We had a great first dining experience at Isa Bistro in Portland.  Food fantastic!  We had the lobster app which was phenomenal!   Main entrees were the pork chop which was so thick, juicy and tender and so delicious with a peach/rhubarb topping.  Other equally amazing entree was the haddock, perfectly cooked and presented.  Friendly waitstaff and ambiance lovely.   We will return!
Everything was great- especially the food.  Please don’t eat here- it makes it more difficult for us to get a table!🤗
This is our favorite place in Portland. We eat in and take out all the time. Great drinks and great food. My favorite are the meatballs and the eggplant lasagna.
every time we eat here it just gets better. great food with matching attentive service.

Fantastic food, incredibly well executed. Hit all the notes of classic french/italian bistro cuisine you would want but with some spanish flair and truly inventive twists. The bistro steak was wonderful and perfectly cooked to temperature.  Highly recommend all the apps and desserts!
Excellent lobster tostada.  Very good eggplant lasagna and blackened bluefin.  Service was excellent.  We would definitely come back.

It is a delight to eat at Isa - it is my favorite little neighborhood place in Portland. I always feel like I am in a sweet bistro in Europe as it is intimate, delicious and consistently wonderful..... The staff is also welcoming, helpful and make you feel right at home.

11/10 highly recommend! The food was EXCEPTIONAL!

For starters:
-Peach crostini with blueberries and goat cheese. So good it could’ve been a dessert.
-Meatballs: tender, delicious red sauce. Very fresh.

Main course:
Bolognese: rich, hearty, perfect! Fresh Al dente tagliatelle pasta
Vodka Linguine: holy smokes, this was SO good! Beautiful linguine with a vodka sauce topped with the most scrumptious burrata. Basil olive oil drizzled around the bowl. I could only eat half. Cannot wait to have it for dinner tonight 😝

Dessert: 🥰🥰🥰🥰 We had the triple chocolate pie. Gluten free cookie crumb crust, mousse, ganache, caramel drizzle and topped with flakey sea salt. Might be the best dessert I’ve had in YEARS!

If you’re looking for a low-key vibe with high-quality food, THIS is the spot!
What a wonderful dining experience from start to finish! Food was a 10 as was the wait staff. Love the whole vibe of this restaurant. Would highly recommend it.
Nice place. Food and service are great! Highly recommend.

Fantàstic small restaurant. Full bar, small but nice wine list. Meatball app great. Homemade pasta bolognese excellent.  Esquite excellent. Coconut cream pie great. Great service! Highly recommended!!
Excellent simple food, very informal & cosy. Our server was attentive but did not hover. Acoustics could be better, but overall a v nice evening.
My wife and I sat at the bar and shared a Caesar salad and tagliatelle bolognese. We are light eaters so this was perfect. The food was delicious and the service was outstanding.

Great place for a romantic dinner! Our waitress Isabelle was friendly and offered great advice not only for dinner, but for suggestions for music and places to see.
We will always remember with fondness our dinner at Isa.
A little pricy for portion sisez, but everything else was great.

My husband and I dined at Isa Bistro last night and had a wonderful experience. His hangar steak and my eggplant lasagna were excellent. I am going to try and replicate the eggplant lasagna when we get home from our vacation.  Service was attentive and we had a most enjoyable evening.   I would recommend dining here unconditionally.

Isa was recommended by good friends. It was exactly the kind of restaurant we enjoy. Small with a pleasant setting. Service was very nice and the food was wonderful. Next time we are in Portland, we will definitely return.
Delightful!  Great food & lovely service.  Always wonderful.
Great food with some unique options! Homemade pasta is excellent.
USA is always a treat with interesting, innovative food and great service. Always perfect.

This was our first time at Isa Bistro and we are definitely going back!  We went on an evening where outdoor seating was available and took advantage of that.  Although not as scenic as some outdoor options, especially in Maine, they are to be commended with making the most of the limited outdoor space they have available.  Noise level was as to be expected in an urban area, complete with seagulls singing to us.  THE FOOD!!!  Everything from the focaccia bread to my halibut & my husband's steak were cooked EXACTLY the way we like it.  The included sides to the entrees were the perfect accompaniment.  We also finished it off with their triple chocolate pie which was a great way to top off our dinner.  Service, especially with an apparent team approach, was spot on.  Perfect dinner to  start off our fun evening in Portland!
Excellent food, innovative and fresh ingredients. Very friendly and attentive staff. Have been here many times and have never been disappointed. Highly recommend this restaurant.
Bistro was nice. Didn’t expect to see that many homeless outside. Was confused on where to park. Besides that I would recommend

My wife and I enjoyed a great Friday lunch. Excellent quality of seafood, freshest ingredients one can find, and great attention to detail regarding every single dish. Kudos to the chef and the creative team in the kitchen. Our experience was rounded out with excellent service by our lovely waitress. Not an inexpensive lunch @ about $150 including drinks, but definitely worth it. We will be back.

Our table of 4 had watermelon salad, blackened halibut Caesar, bolognase and grilled cheese. Highly recommend all. Service by Isabella was excellent. Owner Susie was attentive and welcoming, as always. Great neighborhood bistro that we visit frequently.
The small bistro was lovely for our party of five.

Not doing review often but this place deserves it ! Everything we ate was delicious, the place was clean and staff was friendly/professional. A gem that you need to visit in Portland. There's less and less good restaurant that still care and prepare all the items from scratch. We highly suggest you visit this place if you enjoy great food. Keep up the good work, your kitchen staff are amazing !!!
4 people in our group and four clean plates. Wait staff very attentive, food was delicious!
Absolutely delicious! Appetizers were great and the main dishes were outstanding.  If in the area this is a must.
Delicious,fresh and creative food and drinks.Plates are quite small and expensive but it was a good meal
Excellent food I will remember the meal for years. Will return again next time in Portland

When you walk in and the first thing you see is GORGEOUS plates made with care being served in the open window, you know you’ve made a great choice for dinner. One of the best meals we’ve had in one of the best eating cities we know, with some of the best service we’ve had to boot! 100% will be back.

We had a lovely summer evening sitting on the patio of this neighborhood gem.  We had a slight glitch with the serving of our meal, but it was rectified immediately and graciously.  Our server was lovely, kind and attentive.  Our food, when it arrived, was beyond delicious and we fully enjoyed every bite.  Isa Bistro is a treasure. Go!

My wife, daughter and I enjoyed a great meal
together after meeting our daughter’s flight from Portland, OR at the Portland, ME Jetport.
We each had simple and perfect starters — burrata with arugula, shaved fennel and grapefruit salad, and truly memorable meatballs in tomato sauce. The main courses were at least as satisfying: halibut, a pork chop with whiskey peaches, and steak frites. We shared a triple chocolate flourless torte and coconut cream pie, coffees and flew happily all the way home to the Midcoast.
What a great homecoming and evening! Nigh perfect!

The food at this restaurant is very creative. They use seasonal and local foods. I had a garden salad with beets and blueberries and the peach crostini for my entree. Both were delicious. My husband started with the peach crostini and had the tagliatelle bolognese. Both were excellent, also. He had a special for dessert, marscopone cheesecake with blueberries. I had mango sorbet with toasted coconut. Both desserts were superb. They make their own pasta. I highly recommend this innovative restaurant. Reservations are a good idea because the space is limited.
we love this spot- the food is fantastic, the service delightful and the ambiance just right!

Fantastic meal in a very sweet,cozy setting, with knowledgeable and attentive service. The kitchen really knows what they are doing. The Chef is creative and innovative with a solid sense of combining flavors, textures and colors, making the best use of super fresh ingredients. Our only regret is that we will miss Mexican Monday…we were traveling through Portland and had only one night in town, lucky for us that Open Table helped us to find Isa Bistro for a memorable meal, thank you!
Isa Bistro is rated #1 on Trip Advisor for a reason.  The apps, entrees and desserts were all fresh, vibrant and delicious.   This is a spot that will not disappoint you.

Great little place away from the bustle of the Fore Street area.  We had a lovely lunch that made us want to come back for dinner.  Server was very friendly (not a given in Portland) and everyone's food was terrific: crab cake salad (we have a very high bar for crab cakes and it was exceeded), very tasty bolognese, crispy fries, blackened fish caesar and delicious chocolate cake. Highly recommend!
Everything was outstanding as always!
Best eggplant lasagna ever had. Little seedy around restaurant but food takes care of that. Don’t think book now
A delicious meal start to finish. Beautiful seasonal drinks and menu items. Our service was warm and professional. Also a great value for the quality and portions served.
great food and service , will return again on  next visit. a do not miss spot for dinner

Wonderful staff, amazing food and good bar menu. The ambiance is on point for the small space it is (we sat on the patio), I just wish it had been a smidgen warmer - bring a sweater next time!

Small plates left us feeling a bit less than full but we didn't mind because of how delicious everything was.
High quality fresh local food-well prepared and served! Parking available.
Everything we ordered was outstanding. We look forward to another meal at ISA
Lovely dinner. Bartender was friendly and knowledgeable.
We sat outside.  The food was delicious, wait staff attentive.  Great menu.  Appetizer portion (lobster tostadas) was small, though.

Terrific! The ￼ingredients in the food were exquisitely balanced and everything was delicious. We had the lobster tostada, the grilled octopus, the halibut and the home made pasta. ￼ Chef Isa ‘s dedication to crafting a memorable dining experience￼ is worth a return visit for sure. ￼Salud!
We ordered the bistro steak medium rare it was definitely more rare than medium and it was quite tough. Everything else was absolutely delicious though!
Wonderful experience-- great food, relaxed vibe on the outdoor patio, and good service.  I would highly recommend this restaurant!

10/10! Creative, fresh, not over the top. Best meal I have had in a very long time. Portions are perfectly sized so that you can try multiple items on the menu. Impeccable service. I would travel from Texas just to eat here.

We spent a week in Maine and this was the best restaurant. We started with a freshly made blueberry mojito, had grilled octopus & Caesar salad to start. I had an amazing eggplant lasagna with focaccia bread. For dessert we shared coconut cream pie and a triple chocolate cake. Everything was outstanding.

Isa Bistro has become our new go-to place for celebrations, in this case the sale of our house of 27 years. With nicer weather, we were able to eat on the patio for the first time and enjoyed this experience.  As always, the food, presentation, and service were outstanding. It's not in the greatest of neighborhoods, but it is close to the downtown and has an intimate atmosphere. Staff are friendly.

Favorite restaurant in Portland. Food locally sourced and consistently excellent, staff well trained in menu offerings, bartender been in business for years and knows his wines. Chef and wife owners. Best to make reservations, a very popular red with locals.
What a great dining experience!  My wife and I highly recommend Isa Bistro.
Really good good. Italian flavors and fish dishes.  Caesar salad and Halibut were really good.  Perfect portions, not too much. Priced fairly.  Service was great.
This Restaurant is a hidden gem.  Everything we ordered was prepared beautifully.
Everything was spot on. Wish wine list had more American options . But such a treat

My friend and I had a great time at Isa Bistro. We had eaten there before and were delighted to return. I suggest that the restaurant advertise its convenient parking area on its website. I did not know about it, and Portland parking is problematic.
Food is consistently great. Portion sizes are shrinking. Overall great experience.
This the best meals we’ve had in years! Everything was excellent: lobster tostada, halibut, lasagna!  We sat at the bar and had a fantastic experience.
Super convenient location. Everything was great. Limited menu but that’s a positive.  Less is more when the quality is this good.

The hibiscus margarita & old fashioned were both expertly prepared & delicious.  We ordered eggplant parm & pork chop - both were outstanding.  The outside seating was charming, but a warm, humid evening wasn’t the best way to experience it.  Our server was attentive & knowledgeable.  We were very glad we followed the recommendation of others & had dinner here.  A gem!!
Fabulous! Great spot and worth discovering. Highly recommended it.
Excellent choice for dinner. Good food and a nice ambience.
Amazing food. The vodka linguine was delicious. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We had a great experience
Funky neighborhood, nice atmosphere - Halibut & pasta
Excellent meal with lovely presentation. Staff very friendly and knowledgeable.
Outstanding all the way around great experience , thanks
Always great food and service we keep on coming back
Inventive, seasonal menu, well prepared--as usual   here.  Arugula salad is the gold standard. One of Portland's best kitchens.

Easter was recommended independently by two of my friends. We were not disappointed.  From the moment we were greeted to to paying our check the experience was wonderful.  I felt like we were among friends.  And the food was perfect.  Do not leave without having  the Tres Leeches cake!
This is one of our favorite restaurants in Portland. Service is always prompt, friendly and attentive. Food is excellent with enough variety to satisfy most cravings.
Wonderful food, drinks, and location. The atmosphere was awesome.
Great food and service. It was very loud but we had a great time anyway.
Isa is one of the best restaurants in town and is away from the old Port making it a hidden gem. Those who know, know Isa is the pound for pound best restaurant in town
Incredibly attentive service, delicious and inventive cocktails. A must-visit restaurant!!

Everything was fantastic! The bolognese was perfect, the halibut was divine, shaved fennel salad was refreshing and flavorful, and our server was cute as a button! She gave great recs! The patio is super charming and private. Wouldn’t change a thing!
We were with friends from out of state and chose this restaurant because of the amazing reviews.  It was exceptional! Did not disappoint!
delicious from app to salad to dinner. love this place.

Amazing experience!!!  From beginning to end everything was on point. Started with drinks, a cosmo and a cucumber tequila with elderflower and lime (refresh) - perfect summertime libation. Next came our appetizers. A crab cake with arugula and the lobster tostada. The lobster tostada was an unexpected flavor explosion, nothing like it!  For dinner we had the seared halibut and blackened bluefish. Both were delicious. The halibut was soft with a pearly translucence served on a bed of mashed rhubarb and asparagus Bluefish was succulent and zesty (not spicy) with a tomato bisque base on top of corn and zucchini bits. We paired both of the dishes with a  white Bordeaux. We finished the evening with the gluten free caramel drizzled triple chocolate decadence. It was heaven. Staff was engaging, service was outstanding. We will return again!
My steak was perfect. My wife had the seared halibut and it was outstanding. Highly recommend.

Overall meh. The service was way too slow. Server was attentive at first and very kind, but seemed “in the weeds” when it was seemingly slow. Had to remind her a few times of things we ordered and hadn’t yet received. Empty cocktails, wine, Empty water glasses too often. Apps were great, KFC Bao, Spicy fried chicken, dumplings, edamame, seaweed salad. Bbq items were just okay. Veggies had 0 seasoning, just raw veggies. 👎 We waited on the rice and Ssam for way way too long. Had the meat and veggies long before. So it wasn’t a cohesive meal. Accompaniments were much too small to actually be shared between the 2-3 people it recommended. We’d try upstairs if we ever decide to go back. But not downstairs again, now do we feel the need to go again.

We went during the week and it was very quiet but according to the staff, its quite busy on weekends.   I can tell this will be a great Saturday night out experience; authentic Korean BBQ with a nice presentation.   Food quality appeared very high and the staff was friendly.   Only complaints is are the price and speed of service.   The bill for 2 people was about 140 (for one of the BBQ platters).   Also the service was very slow.
Poor service, food was underspiced and really quite bland. Music was very loud, making conversation difficult.
Great food great service!

This new Korean BBQ (served downstairs on your own grill) restaurant serves delicious food! Service was great, drinks very yummy. Pork belly and fried eggplant appetizer are musts!! We have already made another reservation!

Raw tuna was outstanding and the spicy chicken Bao buns were to die for! The bibim bam bowl was boring in comparison to the rest of our meal. Initial table service was quite slow but I think the server didn't have any bar support. The draft from the door in our section was chilly every time it opened. Overall very impressed with the food and will definitely come back!
Service was very slow. The food was high quality and very good.

Took an hour to get drinks, yes a solid hour. Issue was the drinks for sent to the wrong table, those people ended up with free drinks which was annoying. Open kitchen concept is cool but not when you see the Chef handling three different kinds of meat then tossing salads by hand.

The food was phenomenal but the service was extremely slow. We waited 25 minutes to get our drink orders in and another hour to get our food order in. We waited almost 2 hours all in all to receive our apps and main dishes.

The friend chicken mashed potato balls were amazing! Great, authentic Korean cuisine. Would recommend the upstairs restaurant as well as downstairs which has bbq style where you cook your food in front of you.

Amazing food and service!! Thanks so much for getting us in earlier and feeding a hungry family..love everything I have ever eaten there!!!
Every time we have been here, we are further impressed by the service and food. Now it has become one of our favorite spots.
Always love going to Jing Yan - great atmosphere, yummy food & super friendly, attentive staff!
Easily the best meal in Portland. Great atmosphere and incredible drinks.
Always a favorite - creative cuisine and an awesome staff.
Every bite of our meal was delicious. The atmosphere is cozy and our server was wonderful.
Had an excellent dinner celebrating my adult son’s birthday.  We’d walked by before not realizing what a wonderful place is inside!

I decided to book a table for 3 to celebrate one of my best friend 40th in Jing Yan. I wrote down that the reason for the booking is birthday, and did not expect anything much from them. When we arrived we were served with a complementary blueberry martini to toast for my friends birthday, that was very thoughtful and impressive. We ordered 3 appetizers the marinated tufo, sweet and sour chicken and seaweed burrata, and all are outstanding, the tufo was so flavorful and crispy at the same time, while the burrata was so refreshing with the seaweed pesto in it, the chicken was thinly battered and crispy and light and flavorful. We all decided to have the beef kimchi ramen for entree, and that was very good as well, the beef was very tender and melts in your mouth, the broth was not over bearing, and the noodles and vegetables are cook perfectly, the kimchi was light and not to strong, although I prefer my kimchi strong but my friend who was picky like it that way, so it was perfect. The cocktails complements our meal well, I had a drink with ginger and sumac, I forgot the name but I love the bitterness and tast of it, my friends had a Singaporean cocktail, which they enjoy well. After dinner the staff once again gave us a  complementary dessert for my friend birthday, a sorbet made with mascapone, and ube and coconut bits, which is to die for. It reminds me of my childhood ice cream in the Philippines, although I'm sure the staff did not know we were Filipinos , but the gesture felt almost personal and very thoughtful. Overall the place leave a lasting good impression for me, definitely gonna comeback.
Loved the food; unusual combinations of flavors; delicious; would definitely return!

Creative Asian food and cocktails with some unexpected menu items. Everything was delicious and our server was super friendly and personable! Small and intimate with a very hip vibe! If you sit at the bar, the bartender, who coowns with his wife, is super friendly and interesting. I highly recommend ordering several dishes to share!
Amazing food and service!! Thanks so much for getting us in earlier and feeding a hungry family..love everything I have ever eaten there!!!
Every time we have been here, we are further impressed by the service and food. Now it has become one of our favorite spots.

We ordered 3 appetizers the marinated tufo, sweet and sour chicken and seaweed burrata, and all are outstanding, the tufo was so flavorful and crispy at the same time, while the burrata was so refreshing with the seaweed pesto in it, the chicken was thinly battered and crispy and light and flavorful. We all decided to have the beef kimchi ramen for entree, and that was very good as well, the beef was very tender and melts in your mouth, the broth was not over bearing, and the noodles and vegetables are cook perfectly, the kimchi was light and not to strong, although I prefer my kimchi strong but my friend who was picky like it that way, so it was perfect. The cocktails complements our meal well, I had a drink with ginger and sumac, I forgot the name but I love the bitterness and tast of it, my friends had a Singaporean cocktail, which they enjoy well. After dinner the staff once again gave us a  complementary dessert for my friend birthday, a sorbet made with mascapone, and ube and coconut bits, which is to die for. It reminds me of my childhood ice cream in the Philippines, although I'm sure the staff did not know we were Filipinos , but the gesture felt almost personal and very thoughtful. Overall the place leave a lasting good impression for me, definitely gonna comeback.
Loved the food; unusual combinations of flavors; delicious; would definitely return!

Creative Asian food and cocktails with some unexpected menu items. Everything was delicious and our server was super friendly and personable! Small and intimate with a very hip vibe! If you sit at the bar, the bartender, who coowns with his wife, is super friendly and interesting. I highly recommend ordering several dishes to share!
Amazing food and service!! Thanks so much for getting us in earlier and feeding a hungry family..love everything I have ever eaten there!!!
Every time we have been here, we are further impressed by the service and food. Now it has become one of our favorite spots.
Always love going to Jing Yan - great atmosphere, yummy food & super friendly, attentive staff!
Easily the best meal in Portland. Great atmosphere and incredible drinks.
Always a favorite - creative cuisine and an awesome staff.
Every bite of our meal was delicious. The atmosphere is cozy and our server was wonderful.
Had an excellent dinner celebrating my adult son’s birthday.  We’d walked by before not realizing what a wonderful place is inside!

Creative Asian food and cocktails with some unexpected menu items. Everything was delicious and our server was super friendly and personable! Small and intimate with a very hip vibe! If you sit at the bar, the bartender, who coowns with his wife, is super friendly and interesting. I highly recommend ordering several dishes to share!
The Buffalo cauliflower was top notch 🔥 it honestly could’ve passed as some chicken how tender it was. My compliments to the chef!
We had a fantastic time at Rigby’s. The service was attentive and the food and drinks were delicious. We’ll be back!
This is the best new-to-me place I have been in a while. Food is yum and not toooo expensive. Looking forward to going back, and they said dogs are allowed on the patio.

my party of 6 made a reservation at a high top table- When we arrived on time they sat us at the bar. We asked for our high top table which we could see was vacant and we were told that the open table reservation system caused them to be overbooked and they did not have a table for us. We sat at the bar for another half an hour meanwhile the high top table was still vacant so the owner came over and was very apologetic & He gave us the vacant table. The waitress was the most inattentive server we have ever experienced. We were ordering apps and adult beverages & dinner eventually and she never checked up on us at all we had to ask for utensils napkins etc. from another server. I would never ever recommend this place to anybody when there are so many more places in Portland to go to and get better service.
I just wish we had more choices on the menu.Too limited.

What a treat! We Loved everything about it. It’s “rare” I like a sirloin better than the one my personal Home-based grill master but I felt guilty eating it all alone the next day and shared just so he knew there was competition!
Food was not good. Very unappetizing. Don’t know how they expect to stay in business at that locale with substandard food.
Beautiful place and great atmosphere! Waitress Kelly is friendly, and stuff seems all pretty friendly and flexible (with reservations and changing plans)

First-time patrons. Our food (spinach dip; garlic fries; Brussels sprouts) was bland and nowhere near hot enough. $8 for a 10oz beer is crazy; even in Portland. And if the drinks are that small, the server, while pleasant, needs to stop by the table more often. Didn’t order entrees based upon the mediocre appetizers. Needs more domestic canned and bottled-beer choices.
Really enjoyed our experience! The food was delicious and the staff was very attentive
The Buffalo cauliflower was top notch 🔥 it honestly could’ve passed as some chicken how tender it was. My compliments to the chef!
We had a fantastic time at Rigby’s. The service was attentive and the food and drinks were delicious. We’ll be back!

Our anniversary dinner was cancelled last minute by another Portland restaurant and we were fortunately recommended to try East Ender. We got a fantastic table, great personalized service, and some of the best food we have ever had. The ricotta gnocchi were magical, the creamed kale was velvet, and the crab casino was amazing. It was a phenomenal experience top to bottom. Absolutely worthy of sitting at the top of the many dining experiences we've had all across the country.

Friendly and fantastic experience. Underrated for Portland. While everyone gushes about the same restaurant in Portland over and over, these guys should be getting the same attention. Better and more genuine by far. Lot of heart and soul at this establishment.
Wonderful dinner, absolutely cannot wait to come back!
We both got the burger and it was delicious!
Second time there.  Both times were great.  Highly recommend.
Everything we ordered was excellent, including dessert.  And our server was great, highly recommend.

Ambiance and drinks were great, along with the service. The food was good but not great. The scallop risotto lacked flavor. All together the experience was great, but the food was a tad underwhelming.
The food was tasty but a $20 burger it was not. Also had the pork shoulder which was super delicious. Drinks were perfect and our server was attentive.
Excellent small space that knows how to do food well!  We frequent this place in all seasons and it never disappoints.

We went for Sunday brunch with high hopes which were sadly not met.  One hamburger with fries and one grilled cheese with fries.  These are standard easy to make meals!  The grilled cheese was really small and flabby, the hamburger lacked flavor.  Was it the chefs day off - maybe.  Portland has an excellent choice of places to eat including "Duckfat", right next door to East Ender which is better in every way, and I would head there instead.

Friendly and fantastic experience. Underrated for Portland. While everyone gushes about the same restaurant in Portland over and over, these guys should be getting the same attention. Better and more genuine by far. Lot of heart and soul at this establishment.
Wonderful dinner, absolutely cannot wait to come back!
We both got the burger and it was delicious!
Second time there.  Both times were great.  Highly recommend.
Everything we ordered was excellent, including dessert.  And our server was great, highly recommend.

Ambiance and drinks were great, along with the service. The food was good but not great. The scallop risotto lacked flavor. All together the experience was great, but the food was a tad underwhelming.
The food was tasty but a $20 burger it was not. Also had the pork shoulder which was super delicious. Drinks were perfect and our server was attentive.
Excellent small space that knows how to do food well!  We frequent this place in all seasons and it never disappoints.

We went for Sunday brunch with high hopes which were sadly not met.  One hamburger with fries and one grilled cheese with fries.  These are standard easy to make meals!  The grilled cheese was really small and flabby, the hamburger lacked flavor.  Was it the chefs day off - maybe.  Portland has an excellent choice of places to eat including "Duckfat", right next door to East Ender which is better in every way, and I would head there instead.

The food was tasty but a $20 burger it was not. Also had the pork shoulder which was super delicious. Drinks were perfect and our server was attentive.
Excellent small space that knows how to do food well!  We frequent this place in all seasons and it never disappoints.

We went for Sunday brunch with high hopes which were sadly not met.  One hamburger with fries and one grilled cheese with fries.  These are standard easy to make meals!  The grilled cheese was really small and flabby, the hamburger lacked flavor.  Was it the chefs day off - maybe.  Portland has an excellent choice of places to eat including "Duckfat", right next door to East Ender which is better in every way, and I would head there instead.

Our anniversary dinner was cancelled last minute by another Portland restaurant and we were fortunately recommended to try East Ender. We got a fantastic table, great personalized service, and some of the best food we have ever had. The ricotta gnocchi were magical, the creamed kale was velvet, and the crab casino was amazing. It was a phenomenal experience top to bottom. Absolutely worthy of sitting at the top of the many dining experiences we've had all across the country.

Friendly and fantastic experience. Underrated for Portland. While everyone gushes about the same restaurant in Portland over and over, these guys should be getting the same attention. Better and more genuine by far. Lot of heart and soul at this establishment.
Wonderful dinner, absolutely cannot wait to come back!
We both got the burger and it was delicious!
Second time there.  Both times were great.  Highly recommend.

Portland has an excellent choice of places to eat including "Duckfat", right next door to East Ender which is better in every way, and I would head there instead.
Super place - highly recommend! Thank you for helping us surprise our son and his wife for their anniversary.

Great small plates with lovely presentation.  The bread/fresco salad queso was a nice start. The octopus/beet dish and the hamachi collar were our favorites. Tacos can’t get a fair shake from me because I’m not a corn tortilla fan but the tuna/chorizo filling was a unique combination. Creative cocktails and very responsive to allergies.
Great local place. Great food great service. Good value

Just wonderful! A really unique sharing menu and it was all tasty and well prepared and presented. Service was excellent as well. The night's favorite dishes were the tamale, oysters, yakitori tacos and the sweet potato for dessert. The signature mocktail was delicious and refreshing. We will definitely dine here again!

Overpriced food for incredibly poor service. Was very disappointed. Food took forever to come out. I think they forgot about two of our dishes and the waitress asked us what we had ordered. Was very strange. Do not recommend.

All our dishes were creative, inventive, and tasty. Our server did a great job of guiding us through our choices, indicating which dishes were smaller or larger and giving suggestions of which combinations would go well together.

The waitstaff steadily brought out our food, at a good pace. We never felt rushed but we also did not have to wait long for anything. They also did a great job of clearing our empty plates and taking drink orders.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant! It can be on the pricey side, if you end up choosing several plates and ordering several drinks - but it is worth the splurge!
This is such a unique dining experience with flavors you just don't find at other restaurants.
Food was 10/10 and wine selection was amazing! Only wish it wasn't so pricey.
Exceptional in every way. Food is first class, creative, and delicious.
Innovative menu/ingredients make it a great dining experience.
Amazing dining experience!  Chef Neil Z. is a master who ensures that every bite is delicious.

The food at Regards is always interesting with unique flavors and combinations of ingredients. Even the desserts are very creative! The atmosphere is comfortable and welcoming and the staff work together to bring you seamless service. I love Regards!

Amazing evening and meal! Thank you, Regards! This was one of the best nights of my life and Regards is my new favorite restaurant. It was an honor and pleasure to experience the food, wine and hospitality of this very special place in Portland. I will come back as soon as I can!

What amazes me is how Regards sets itself above and beyond an already creative and vibrant dining scene in Portland! This is now my favorite restaurant in the world (that I know) and I will be a lifelong admirer. The food is bold and perfectly calibrated to wow you in ways both big and small. Every detail from the lighting to the silverware and presentation of food has been very well thought out. Thank you, Regards, for one of the best meals of my life.

We really enjoyed our dining experience at Regards; we’d heard great things and it was next door to where we are staying. The service was excellent: attentive without being annoying, made recommendations, and the small plates came out at a perfect pace that allowed us to enjoy 5 plates leisurely. We loved our diver scallops, cabbage, and shrimp tacos. The hamachi collar that people rave about was good but we didn’t see the hype. We ordered a squid dish that we ate almost none of because it was so chewy, and we are avid seafood folks. Overall a lovely dinner, and a very good experience.
One of our party is sensitive to garlic. The waitress actually blacked out the items on the menu that she should avoid. That was such a responsible act.
Shrimp tacos were like nothing you can get around here, scallops were outstanding, queso dip -- wow. Very creative menu and presentation. Wine and cocktail list was a little slim.
Maddd delicious and creative. Very good cocktails 🙏🏼❤️
No decor.  Limited beer and alcohol choices.  2 of the small plates were great, one was ok and the Maine Mackerel was bland and needed bread or crackers.
Food was too salty (especially the main dishes), small dishes were creative

The service was great and the restaurant is adorable. We were very disappointed in the food. Nearly everything was unpalatable. We ordered a tostada and were worried about chipping our teeth. Ceviche was basically sashimi with 4 fava leaves with mild vinegar. There was no lime or lemon juice. The fish was charred to a crisp. My husband took one bite and has to run to the bathroom to spit it out. It was very disappointing, especially for the price. Would not recommend it or return.

Fabulous.  Online menu does not cover their creativity and I’m sure the daily menu changes are significant.  FOOD was outstanding — we had the scallop ceviche, an excellent grilled shrimp tacos, Quesailla, Tamale and a fascinating Cabbage dish that we all shared.

Service was attentive and informative as a number of ingredients are unique and may need explanation.

Definitely a place to return and recommend!  Well done!

Regards is stellar. Adventurous diners will be rewarded with dishes that make you stop and wonder how long the chef tinkered with them. These are labors of love and works of art. This is probably the most experimental and interesting cooking happening in Portland. Do not miss the scallops! Also, the staff are really nice and knowledgeable. They are completely unpretentious despite serving up such incredible food and bev.
We ate outdoors for the first time this spring.  The team treated us wonderfully; the food was fantastic!  We can't wait to go back!

This was by far one of the worst experiences I've had at a restaurant. The table to our left had great service and an attentive server. It took almost 45 minutes after being seated to get any food; the reasoning was because the order was placed after a large party. Go elsewhere. You can find better food at a more affordable price in other places.

This was my first time at Regards. We took my mom with us and she is not super accustomed to eating like this and she ABSOLUTELY LOVED it. We all loved it. The hamachi collar was so good we couldn’t get enough of it. We ordered one of each section on the menu and for three people we were totally satiated. The Birria was out of this world good. Service was outstanding and kind. We were close to the bar and it was early enough that we were able to chat about the cocktails and ingredients with the bar tender and our waitress and they were both so kind and patient.

Woud recommend 10/10

First of all our server was great very attentive and helpful. Where we were sitting, we could see the kitchen and we greatly enjoyed watching the goings on. Everything looked very organized like an assembly line. All of our food was great very unique. Even my nonalcoholic cocktail was great, we will be back!
I have celiac and I had a delicious and safe meal! Would recommend, cocktails were incredible and the seasonal menu was divine. Good value for what you get!
Excellent food, perfect portion size, and original cocktails.

Ambiance, decor, cocktails and noise level were excellent, but staff were very low energy which was a bummer. Food itself was very hit or miss. Diver scallops were completely tasteless, shrimp tacos and hamachi cheek were better but middling. Our server asked about any food allergies when ordering (hazelnuts), then the kitchen brought out the tamales and said they contained hazelnuts (awkward, sent it back). We stopped after these three small plates, left still hungry, and went in search of something else on Congress St. This place feels like it has great potential; there are much better choices nearby.

The combination of ambience and good food makes the evening for me.  Respectful and patient servers even during a storm.  The food is eclectic and the plates are small enough that you can sample multiple dishes.  Wonderful date night and will return!

We were disappointed- the food sounded great but we found it under-seasoned and not very flavorful, especially the ceviche and scallops - so much potential! The cocktails were good though small.  The service was a bit erratic.  Great concept but follow-through needs work.
Very eclectic and imaginative cuisine. Cabbage dish was really yummy!

Cocktails were fun and creative. Food was fabulous especially the flint corn tamale and lamb barbacoa. Unfortunately the service was at best mediocre. We arrived early and were seated in an almost empty restaurant. We were served water then ignored for 5-7 minutes. When we ordered cocktails we asked for the bread and scallops first. Before the cocktails arrived we placed the rest of our order. First, the avocado tostada and shrimp tacos arrived, then the bread and scallops then the corn tamale. So we had five dishes on the table while we waited for wine to arrive. We gradually went through those dishes and, almost done, asked about the lamb which we assumed had been forgotten. The server assured us it was coming and it did several minutes later. So, the food is creative and delicious. We loved the scallops, shrimp, avocado and bread. The wine from Baha CA was intriguing. It will be a long time before we return just because of the service.
Such a fun and funky restaurant. Amazing unique and fresh homemade food.

Check out this great restaurant. 
Four of us ate dinner at Regards Saturday night & totally enjoyed our meals. We are adventurous eaters who love to try new foods. We cook gourmet meals for ourselves & friends & we want quality options. 

Our motto is that we don't mind spending a little more money, if the food is better than we would make for ourselves and or something we wouldn't generally take the time to prepare at home. 

Because, the food is influenced by Japanese & Mexican roots, we had to "ask Siri" to define many of the menu items, but that was fun too. 

I am gluten/dairy intolerant & often restaurants will only have a few options that I can choose from, but at Regards, I had endless options & didn't feel like I was missing out on the "good choices". 

Regards offers great ambiance, a nice assortment of menu choices, helpful friendly staff & wonderful food. Check it out-

Great vibe, good service, drinks were great, not very impressed by the food, the oysters were great, chicken tacos were comparable to dry meatballs, ceviche at this time was tasty but only covered in shaved ice not compared to previous ceviches we’ve seen posted, had been wanting to try this restaurant for a long time and have heard great things, but our food experience along with how much money we spent we were overall not impressed and probably won’t go back.
the food was the centerpiece here. Eclectic Mexican based food
This was our first meal there and it was outstanding. I would highly recommend it.
What a fantastic spot! Food was excellent and the chef’s twist on the dishes were so interesting and delicious.
Creative, surprising, and delish.  Will be back !!
Amazing Valentine's Day 10 course tasting menu dinner. The variety and creativity was awesome and everything was so fresh and well prepared. It was a true experience  and would highly recommend.

Went for Valentine’s Day. Menu was fixed and the selections were just plain bad. I am not a picky eater by any means but this food was just very unpalatable and an overall unpleasant experience. Coupled with the $280 bill, I will surely never be returning here.

Wife and I did valentine's dinner here. The staff was awesome, the food was solid (though I did have an item that didn't look appealing but taste was good) we did the (experience dinner) which was $200 to start and another roughly $75 in drinks (I felt size and price didn't match very well). My wife loved it, I very much enjoyed it. Overall I would absolutely go back for a date night or a fancy dinner so don't sleep on REGARDS, it is an experience of its own.

The wait staff could not be more attentive and the ambiance is very nice but noisy. The food, on the other hand, was not memorable. The shrimp tacos were not cooked through. The avocado dish was completely overpowered by the lavash bread they served it with. The ceviche was a bowl of ice. The collar fishtail dish was oily. And the white wine choices were awful and they did not have sparkling water. All in all our dining iexperience was pretty disappointing.
Amazing amazing amazing food to rival anywhere in any city! So lucky to have this talented chef and team in Portland!

Ignore the menu online. It’s so much more. We went on a Thursday night which is taco night. Not what you’re thinking they make their own tortillas. We had lobster and scallop. The scallops are out of this world.

Most extraordinary restaurant in portland. Sensational melding of textures and flavors. The unexpected with each course. On line menu does not come close to accurately describing how amazingly delicious each dish is. Superb!

Menu needed a bit of interpretation by server.  Most items are small plates with a couple of bites per person when sharing.  Interesting flavors and combos, heavy on fish and seafood.  Being two women with smaller appetites we were comfortably full after $160 check but a person with a larger appetite  might leave hungry unless they order a few more dishes.
Really fantastic experience. Everything was very thoughtful, and we enjoyed the experience.
The food was great. The server knew all of the details of the menu and was helpful in putting together a perfect combination of foods.  Cabbage and fried chicken were two of my favorites!
Taco night. Order every taco/tacos on the menu. Be happy. Perfect dinner for two
Delicious variety of southwestern and Mexican oriented dishes for sharing, imaginative and flavorful cocktails featuring tequila and mezcal.  Highly recommend.

Food was uber creative. Each bite was carefully crafted by scratch and had flavor combinations that took us on a gustatory roller coaster.  The service was friendly and knowledgeable.  Adding this to my top 5 places to eat in Portland proper.

Adequate small plate arrangements.  The fish was not high quality and the execution was below average. Dry, rubbery or actual chunks of ice in the ceviche which was like soup.  Service was good, not great and the ambiance was just OK, had music that was to loud, I mean I like Bobby Darin but it was too loud and didn't match the food or ambiance.

Probably will never go again.  But in full disclosure not a fan of small plates..
Service was not as attentive as previously. We kept having to track the waitress down.
Unique seafood dishes and solid wine list. Definitely haven’t had any food like this in Portsmouth or Portland before.

Regards was exceptionally wonderful.  The best martini I’ve ever had.  The staff were fab and knowledgeable and lovely. The food was perfect.  Comfortable seats and chic cozy spot.  i cannot wait to come back.
Amazing food. Small plates, but fairly easy to share.
If you like to experiment with food, GO HERE!! Every dish is a perfect sized bite of flavor explosion.
Nice atmosphere, friendly staff, but the food is pretentious—creative and interesting but under-flavored.  The portions are too small also.
Forget taco Tuesday. Taco Thursday at REGARDS is my new fave.  Flavorful tacos and great atmosphere. We’ll be back!

We have eaten at Regards before and were very excited to come back.  The first dish we chose, ceviche, was too acidic to appreciate the fish and tampered the ability to really taste the nuances of some of the other dishes.  We did love the tamale and hangar steak, they were the highlights! The smoked panna cotta was also wonderfully rich and creamy.  The apple ice cream could have used just a tad less caramel (cajeta?) which overpowered the ice cream flavor.  Perhaps if we chose a different less acidic dish to start we would have appreciated everything much more!  I would still recommend and try some different dishes!
Some of the best food I’ve ever had. Great ambiance and staff.
So delicious!  Those carnitas tacos and the lobster taco, had dreams about them!
Excellent food and drink, attentive wait staff and lovely environment
The burrata and hamachi were amazing. The other dishes we had were interesting, but not at the same level. The ambiance and service were excellent.
Delicious, as always! That carnitas! Still thinking about it. Yum!
Beautiful atmosphere, great service, small plates, and creative cocktails.

The dishes were creative and delicious, from the surprising delicious cabbage to the amazing shrimp tacos, which had just the perfect amount of heat balanced by crème fraiche. A perfect meal. I would highly recommend.
Trop recherché - and slow but thé food is overall good
Excellent from start to finish. Can find no faults and only positives.
Energetic little restaurant with some interesting small plates that I haven't tried elsewhere. The wine by the glass was really enjoyable.  Service was helpful and attentive.

Enjoyed the evening. Delicious, unique, inventive combinations; a beautiful  change from what you’ll find at most high end “foodie” establishments. Service was more European than American fast pace. If you look at  their menu - we had scallops, shrimp tacos, tamale, crab and crunchy rice, and sweet potato desert…very interesting food. If you are looking for a good evening with food combinations that you wouldn’t make at home, this is the place. Try a shot of mescal too.
Delicious food, terrific service, great location.
One of the most interesting, unusual and eye opening meals in a while! Delicious.
