Two of our plates were inedible due to taste and saltiness.  Oysters had broken shells in them and almost cracked my tooth. Service was decent but I would not return due to food quality.   Waitress forgot to put in our order so food was delayed quite a bit. She acknowledged but didn’t even offer a bite of bread while we waited.  I would not return or recommend.
We had such an amazing restaurant. Lovely staff and lovely food. Great lavs too

Excellent food and service! The octopus and beets was very complex with great flavors—one of the best dishes I’ve had all year. The burrata was also delicious and a unique take on the classic dish by adding tomatillo salsa. Would definitely recommend.
Delicious and unique food. Huge selections of Mezcals and tequilas.  Friendly, informed, and efficient staff.  Def recommend.
The food was superb. Our server was caring and knowledgeable
What an exceptional meal. Though things are meant for sharing, the plating is a bit awkward.

Oh boy, the food here is lick your plate good! The scallops dish, with the thinly sliced scallops, daikon radish and marinated tapioca balls that burst in your mouth ohhhh I didn’t want this dish to end. The cabbage….might seem a trivial item but you have never tasted cabbage this good! Seriously, I’m dreaming about it. The cheese on top, the Caesar dressing, the tenderness of the cabbage and the aioli sorta dressing on the side with a hint of garlic and some heat; made this dish absolutely delectable. The hamachi collar with the charred outside and tender velvety meat wrapped in Bibb lettuce with the spicy sauce to scoop up - yum. Just yum, it was fantastic to perfection. I did not care for the pesky toe crab dish with the chewy rice; felt it lacked flavor although the husk cherry added to the needed boost and made my mouth appreciate it a tiny bit more. The corn dessert we got on a whim due to recommendation from our neighboring table, with the honeyed figs and corn ice cream was somewhat weird?? Not boring but different. It did grow on me but my partner did not care for it. Overall, do not hesitate to imbibe in the creative, delicious food being served at this excellent restaurant, you will not be disappointed!
This is a fantastic restaurant. Worth a trip. Build your trip around it. The service. The food. The atmosphere. Portland is an incredible city and this is one of the gems of its food scene

This is not the same restaurant that Bon Appetite put on their list of best new restaurants last year. That place had an innovative menu with delicious food and fabulous service. Tonight we had bad food and service to match. Our server was aloof at best, rude if we are being honest. Some of the food was inedible it was so awful. The rest was either bland, poorly executed or just a bad idea.
Such an amazing meal - can’t wait to return!  Thank you for everything
Amazing gluten free experience!! 80% of the menu is naturally gluten free.

We had an amazing meal. Honestly they have taken the Portland food scene up a notch. We had the most inventive raw scallop that melted in your mouth. The bluefin Tuna was exceptional with raspberry and beet infusion - 2 of the best dishes i have ever eaten. The avocado tostado was beautifully seasoned and conceived. The crispy brown rice was delicious with peekytoe crab though i would have like a touch more crab in the dish. The tamale was great and the only dish i thought was just good - was the shrimp taco which could have been more amply dressed. The drinks were great and we had a terrific and knowledgeable server. Regards - desererves your attention.
Amazing food and great service. Eat inside or patio ... this is not to be missed if you're visiting Portland

I live in Cape Elizabeth and have friends that raved about Regards and last
night was my turn to enjoy this fabulous restaurant! There is nothing like it
in Portland, Maine. Every dish was five star quality and the ambiance is
wonderfully soothing. I was going to go into NYC in December and after last
night decided to stay in Maine and come back to Regards. I'll be back and it
won't just be for special occasions!

Server was knowledgeable about menu but I feel he encouraged us to over-order. The biggest disappointment was the shrimp tacos - single, tasteless shrimp with lettuce and bland sauce. Other items were tasty.
Truly unbelievable food. The servings were are small plates meant to share. The dishes were all sublime. Someone really understands the art of food.
Food was great, service good, noise maybe too high
Went here for my birthday and it was perfect, special, delicious--and a wonderful celebration for me!

This was truly one of the best meals my husband and I have ever had. Each of the six small plates we ordered was incredible. The dishes were unique without being fussy or overdone; the flavors just all worked really well together. My taste buds were very very happy! The service was also outstanding, and as someone with some dietary restrictions, I really appreciated our server’s detailed knowledge of the menu items’ ingredients. Can’t say enough good things about Regards!

We had high expectations because of some write ups we saw about the restaurant.  The food was very good- interesting flavors and well presented, but it was too expensive for the amount of food we got.  We spent $100 on 3 small plates and 2 drinks, and we really needed 6-8 to be a sufficient amount for dinner.  In addition, our cocktails that we ordered when we arrived came after we had finished our meal.  While we had some interesting food, overall we were not satisfied with the value or service.
Lovely and unexpected. Our service was amazing! Thoroughly enjoyed our meal, timed super well... congrats on such a well executed space.
The menu is really creative and the staff is excellent. Love the atmosphere, and appreciate the good cocktail and mocktail menu. I’ve been several times it’s doesn’t disappoint.

Regards specializes in small plates that are very creative. Among other things we had that were terrific were a Hamachi dish,  an octopus dish and a fluke dish.  There were others as well.  There were four of us and we had eight small plates and then some desserts-also small plates and everything is meant to be shared.  There wasn't a bad dish or even an ordinary one./  The one problem is a very limited wine list-all young wines (red) and not great for wine lovers.
Wonderful meal and service. The octopus was fantastic! They were very busy but all the dishes came out at the perfect time and temperature. Can't wait to go back.
Too pretentious for this Manhattanite. When the waiter explains every nuance of how each ingredient is prepared in the masterpiece, why isn't the waiter cooking?
Great food and atmosphere. Enjoyed the small sharing plates

Favorite restaurant in Portland. Servers are super friendly and knowledgeable. Menu is always amazing. Chef and kitchen staff are always innovating and creating exciting new dishes. Wine list and drinks are fun too. They care about what they do. Always a great experience.
This is one of the best meals I've ever had. I laughed out loud at a first bite, and almost cried while eating another dish. I cannot wait to come back.

We had a great dinner at Regards. The food was amazing. The service was excellent as well, though the restaurant was rather loud; we thought that was the only drawback. We will certainly return there for another meal.
It was a disappointing experience. Some courses were great but most sort of fell flat. The service was really poor. It was impersonal and the waiters just seemed really blasé.
Excellent and creative food! Lovely service! Highly recommend!
Wonderful dinner! Perhaps the best mezcal cocktail I’ve ever had and an impressive mezcal and tequila selection. Great for gluten free and fantastic menu of creative delicious small plates.
Fabulous meal with unique presentation and wonderful warm service.
Fabulous and very creative.  A must in Portland.  The Buratta is also a must.

We loved the restaurant, food and staff. 
Wonderful service, warmth and attention. 
Motivator cocktail was excellent.
Every plate was tasty, delicious and a new experience. 
Only issue was the noise level. 
Difficult to hear our conversation. 
I would absolutely recommend. 
We had a terrific evening and left completely satisfied.
Great drinks and great food! We come here every year from NYC!

Very interesting tasty food.
Very avantgarde
Not for everyone
Super loud, but excellent. Good cocktails. Server was new but did great.
Very underwhelmed with the food.  Took forever to get food out to us. Very loud as well.

We loved the service and the pure fun of the inventive dishes here. The oysters with granita, scallops with radish, and caraflex cabbage Caesar were our favorites. And the strawberry sorbet! Gorgeous presentation and utterly delicious. Great value and lovely setting as well.

It was an explosion of flavor!
I didn’t know what to expect since I didn’t know much on the menu. 
I will go back!
An unexpected gem in Portland.  Everything about the restaurant was unique.  Very interesting menu too.
A truly unique dining destination. The flavors and presentations are wonderful.
Excellent as always! The miso ice cream was one of the most interesting desserts we’ve ever tried.
Barely edible food. Decent cocktails. Chef is trying to be creative. The lack of talent is difficult to hide
We weren’t sure what to expect. Checked out the menu in advance, which was helpful. This restaurant has great food with unique flavors. My faves were chicken wings and oysters.

Our party of five got nine different dishes, ten total, all for sharing.  (It's a great restaurant for larger parties because if you're sharing, and you should, that gives you the chance to try more dishes.)  Every dish was a revelation.  Our favorites were the ceviche (melon!), and the fish collars.  (Desperate to know the ingredients in the secret sauce!)  Least enthusiastic reception was probably for the scallop crudo.  No particular reason; it just didn't pop the way everything else did.  We all agreed that we were on the edge of our comfort zones the whole time, and we liked it; it was a wonderful ride.  Given that we got nine different dishes, our waiter had to make a lot of trips from the kitchen to our table and do a lot of explaining.  He was wonderful; the pacing was perfect.  The chef also, obviously.  Our only regret was that we had a ferry to catch; we were sorry to miss the ice cream!
Fantastic! Regards is not to be missed. We ate everything and the staff was great.
Servers were very friendly and helpful, answered all our questions!
Everything was excellent. But portions are tiny for the cost.

The best thing was the food…VERY interesting and delicious and special. But the noise was SO loud that we couldn’t hear each other unless we yelled and it wasn’t relaxing. Maybe it would have been quieter further back in the back of the restaurant. Granted, we didn’t ask if they would lower it, but we didn’t want to be those people. ￼
What a nice treat to eat here. Everything was amazing. My favorite were the shrimp tacos (the whole shrimp) unbelievable. So flavorful!
The food was good, the service was excellent. The avocado dish was our favorite. Definitely a restaurant to try when in Portland.
Enjoyed the creativity of every dish we ordered (around 6-7) but everything was a too salty. If they can lower the saltiness, it’d really be one amazing restaurant.
Food was really salty overall. Servers were very nice tho.
Don't be fooled, this is the best restaurant in Portland hands down!
Wonderful night with friends. Each dish was delicious and unique. Server was thoughtful.  Music was upbeat, and fun. Would highly recommend.
Every dish was an adventure - imaginative and finely tuned combinations of flavors came together each time. A new favorite !
Excellent service & great food. Love the space - must order the tamale.

I love this spot! I wish I could eat here every night. Very inventive with their flavors without the desperation for uniqueness that leads to so many misguided dishes these days. Will be back as soon as possible!
Drinks were outstanding, food was incredible, service was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. Great experience.
Wonderful meal snd excellent service! It’s a can’t miss.

Ordered almost everything on the menu and tipped 35%. Wait staff was friendly, not pushy + very attentive. Drinks were good. Food was god awful. By far, worst meal in a long time.
Was very let down, but ambienace was great. Thank you.

Regards was fantastic. If you are looking for interesting flavors and a European ambiance, this is your place. Scallops, tortilla, fish collar, and white mole (vegetarian) were all knock out. Rice with crab was good but too salty. Rose from Slovenia was so good we wished we’d ordered a bottle. Service (Rachel and others from team) was excellent. Lighting, especially towards back, was romantic. Even the bathrooms were lovely. Highly recommended.

The food missed the mark. Flavors in all the dishes did not seem balanced at all. The Hiramasa Ceviche was very fishy and had no delicate citrus elements  - basically chunks of unattractive fish that did not go down well.  The tortillas and miso butter - tortillas seemed liked they had been warmed and left sitting out resulting in chewy dried tortillas with flavorless butter served on the side.  The crab and rice dish looked hopeful, but started with some crab flavor and pieces, and ended with leftover rice and mayonnaise.  The shrimp tacos were underwhelming.  One piece of shrimp atop butter lettuce in a tortilla and drowned in a citrus vinaigrette and some sort of crema.  Overprices, for what you get, quality and flavor painfully lacking.  Our server was very nice, but checked on us way too often to be comfortable and by the end of the meal was MIA, we had to ask the bartender for our check and then after waiting another 15 minutes had to bring the check up to the manager to pay. I would not reccommend.

It was pretty good. Excellent service except they kind of bombarded us with plates throughout the night. One dish was a bit experimental which I enjoyed the flavors but it was ugly to eat. (The lamb tartare). Overall pretty good tho!
Amazing as always!!! My favorite restaurant in portland!!

Simply excellent all around. The food was creative and delicious. Server was highly professional and did a great job guiding us on recommendations and portion sizing for our group. I liked the chef a lot when he was at Little Giant. I like him even more here.
Good, service, room- everything was just great. Highly recommend!
We had a wonderful dining experience and our server was very knowledgeable of every dish and made great recommendations.  We’ll be back and highly recommend REGARDS.
Very creative menu.  Enjoyed everything we tried.  The desserts are also incredible!
Great small plates for tasting and sharing! Get the avocado!

We reserved an early dinner with high expectations, having been to a couple other  very similar "local," "small plate" restaurants recently (Twelve and Sur Lie) that are only slightly higher priced. My greeting upon arrival was meh; the host showed little enthusiasm. And I was the first guest of the evening. Our server was very nice and attentive throughout.

The dim lighting was somehow sad. The outside tables don't reflect the inside prices. No one chose to sit outside, thought the weather was perfect.

Steak was very good but overwhelmed by mole sauce; the hamachi fish collar was delectable but it was too much effort to get to the meat. The radish-heavy scallops and martini didn't come close to those aforementioned establishments and were disappointing. We did mention to our server that one dish (sea bass) was way over-salted and we barely touched it but there it was on the bill. Oh well.  

Timing of everything seemed off, even with the trendy warning about dishes not coming out in sequence. I wish them sincere good luck.

Exceptional food & service. Enjoyed the experience 
Thank you!
As always the food was outstanding, everyone there is lovely and we had the best time. Thank you so much!!!
Fantastic food and drink far exceeding our expectations.
We had amazing experience! One of the best restaurants in Portland. The waiter was so knowledgable about the food and drinks, we were impressed. Highly recommend this restaurant.
exquisite! service, creativity, menu, vibe, everything was great.

The flavor combinations were enticing and many of the combinations were tasty.  But to say that most plates should be shared is a stretch...a dish of one shrimp in a shrimp taco is a bit on the skimpy side.  The crispy rice and peekytoe crab dish, however, was one that certainly was sharable.  We also felt pricing was on the high side.
Excellent meal in a very cool space.  Probably some of the best ceviche I've ever had.  Will definitely recommend to friends.
Regards is my new “can’t miss” in Portland after my past few visits! Fantastic service, food and beverages!
Food was absolutely delicious. Unusual flavor combinations. Waitstaff attentive. Good explanation of the progressive nature of the menu.

Three of us dined here for my birthday because it’s one of my favorite restaurants in Portland and never disappoints.  This night was no exception.  All the dishes were amazing!  We shared 2 servings of the Avocado with salsa macha because it’s that good, the Burata (yum!), Diver Scallops, Tamale, and 3 Red Shrimp Tacos.  It was more than enough and so we had to cancel the Cabbage dish for another time.  Until next time, thank you for a lovely and memorable birthday dinner!

Kind and gracious service that went the extra mile for my party (won’t go into details about my mistake). Wonderful selection, tasty seafood, good presentation. Lots of young and some older folks. Like most nice places these days, no need to dress up.
Great service. Interesting menu and a great vibe! I think that the dishes needed salt. But otherwise fabulous .

The absolute best restaurant experience we have had in Portland. My girlfriend and I ate here on Saturday and had one of the best meals of our life. Our server, Ramsey, was an 11/10! She was like a Sherpa guiding us through the menu and making incredible suggestions based on our taste preferences and hunger levels. The drinks and selection of tequilas were absolutely amazing. We already can’t wait to go back!
Small plates came out a random times but each thing was spectacular. Very interesting combinations of flavors made for a delicious dinner. Cocktails were well done.

Awesome food! Always an inventive and enjoyable menu. Watch out for their desserts, though, they are definitely an acquired taste, and the only continuously disappointing part of an otherwise stellar dining experience

Food was great. Our server Andrew was extremely helpful in making recommendations.  The avocado appetizer and tri-tips were fantastic.  The bartender, didn’t get her name is wonderful and her hibiscus martini is the best!
Food has been better at Regards in the past.   Hopefully just an off night.

Delicious and inventive food, friendly, professional service, delightful, knowledgable (drinks and food),  bartender. Regards,  Leeward, and Helm are my favorite restaurants in a foodie-heaven restaurant town.

Decent food very good service.  Food not good enough for price, and could have been a bit more generous in quantity for an average size man. Ambient noise OK from about 5pm to about 6pm, thereafter increasing to the point where good conversation became difficult.

We had one of the worst experiences in a Portland restaurant in a long time.  There were 4 tables in the restaurant and it took extremely long to get our drinks and food.  Poor attitude and condescending service.  Very overpriced.  We will never go back and will not recommend.

The food was very good, and the waitperson was excellent.  Attentive but not intrusive.  She offered great advice when I wondered if we ordered enough...it was just the right amount.  One dish was lukewarm, but I'm not sure it was supposed to be.  Some a bit pricey like the charred cabbage for $16.  Very good, but I think the price could have been reduced a bit since it was just cabbage (with a great dressing).  The rice/crab dish was fabulous.  Although the dessert looked small, we were glad we shared it - rich and delicious frozen coconut cream with other flavors.  We are returning.
Over priced for what you get. The food was good but for $230 I would expect more.
Loved every part of our meal at Regards. There was not a speck of food left on our plates! Will be back again soon.

Creativity and FLAVOR! The dipping jus for the birria taco was delicious (not just a salt bomb). Porky deliciousness! The mole Blanco was unique and a best bite of the evening. Thanks for giving us new ways to use our garden's husk cherries, as their appearance in the kampachi tostada really elevated it. The pollack tacos were great (but could've used a 3rd taco wrap actually). The little bit of heat in the churros' chocolate was perfection. Will recommend to everyone!

The good: food was delicious and well presented. The tamale, pollock tacos, and rice cangrejo were the stars. The bad: service was a bit slow and not as knowledgeable about the plates as we would've hoped. Seems like they forgot to fire our last dish and we ended up waiting quite a while for a Birria Taco after the manager checked if we had any more savory dishes coming. Plenty of people asked if we needed more drinks, but no real explanation for the slow pacing of the dishes on a not very crowded Thursday night.
Great food, drinks, and service! High regards for this restaurant!
We felt rushed through our prefix menu and it was hard to get anyone to let us order the bottle of wine we wanted with our food.
Exceeded all expectations!
Service was excellent and food was fabulous!
This is arguably the best restaurant in Portland.

Service was on point by only being around when  they needed to be. Props to the servers and food runners for moving in a nearly perpetual side-shuffle  with all those narrow pathways. Easily worth the price tag. The Chef knows how to cook!

Food was ok. 2 of 4 dishes of mine were too hard/tough to cut into and also to chew. Everything tasted amazing, aside that issue. We had to pay a $50 deposit and that was taken, but it was not accounted for on our bill so I’m not sure why there is a deposit required. I wouldn’t return unless there were availability to just walk in so that I wouldn’t be out money.

Loved our first visit to Regards. We tried a couple of the apps (including the tortillas with miso lardo and the peanuts) and had two types of tacos since it was Taco Thursday. All of the food was delicious (loved the beef tongue tacos - YUM) and the margaritas were amazing! Service was spot on and so was the cozy space.

The food quality was wonderful, minus one dish they clearly forgot about (it was cheese-based and was only warm and not melted/stringy anymore). Unfortunately our drinks were forgotten about twice - first when we placed our initial orders and 20 minutes later realized the two tables who sat after us were already enjoying cocktails and snacks and the second when I realized the bartender was talking with guests and not working when I had waited on a drink yet to arrive. Otherwise the peanuts were great, fish collar was outstanding and the ceviche was perfect. The staff apologized for slow service once, but never about the slip ups they clearly had. In all, we love our neighborhood spots and were excited to venture downtown for a date night but will probably try other places before returning.
Fantastic food. Waitstaff was excellent and very helpful with the menu. Great food and experience!
This was one of the best meals I have ever had. Every single dish was outstanding.
Incredible menu, drinks and our server was outstanding!

Shared 4 dishes and 4 cocktails with my brother for about $120. 2 dishes were among the best I've had in Portland, 1 was solid but not worth the price and a 4th, 'Spanish octopus' was not good at all. The sauce was gritty, octopus was salty. I'd go back for a cocktails

What a bold menu! The charcoal roasted beetroot salad was one of the most unusual and appealing dishes I have ever had!  The desserts (particularly the coconut crema) actually overshadowed the rest of the meal, but we didn’t mind!! Happy New Year. We will return.
Food is always excellent. Service is attentive but not overwhelming. Drink menu offers many interesting options.

We loved the fried chicken and the charred Cesar cabbage!  Actually, everything was great :). Such unique flavors with fun surprises everywhere.  Definitely hit up Regards for your next dining adventure!

The food was boring. The large plates were served before the small plates. 
The ambience is very ordinary. They don’t seem to know what they’re trying to be.
Really innovative menu and wonderful service.  Highly recommend.

Regards is a most unusual conglomeration of several different styles of preparation ranging from hispanic to southeast asian.  The plates are small and come out as the chef prepares them and so it is good to go with a group and share the plates as they emerge from the kitchen.  Everything is extremely well made and unusual.  The wine list is very limited but includes some things one usually doesn't find.  A highlight experience.
Great flavor profile or all the dishes. A gem in portland.
Creative presentations of excellent food. One of our best meals in Portland without a doubt.
Surprising, fresh, and delicious with plenty of unique flavor combinations. It’s a fun experience, and portions leave you satisfied but not stuffed.
We had a very good experience. Get the Wagyu Tartare. Wow.
The combination of flavors made my tastebuds dance!
Great food attentive service
Get the tamale. Please. You will not be disappointed, unless you're a jerk.

The best food. Great steaks prepared perfectly and great sides, unfortunately left no room for desert but it was worth it. Our waiter was great, so knowledgeable and friendly and personable. A great dining experience in every way. We’re going back every time we come to Portland.
Always love our visit to the Grill Room.  Everything was amazing.

The restaurant was quite busy even with a reservation. Took a while to be seated and then to be asked for drinks. Waiter was excellent and very knowledgeable about food and drink pairings. Restaurant was loud, but not too bad. Restaurant overall temperature was hot and humid, but also during the summer so that makes sense. They gave us a free dessert because of a birthday so that was awesome. I am looking forward to eating there again.
Our meals were delicious and the prices were reasonable.
My partner ordered the strip steak with the broccolini and it was very spicy.  Other than that everything was good

We ordered the NETrout.  Both encountered at least 8 bones. Server said “people eat the bones”.  She was abrupt and unappreciative of our efforts to ask her to communicate our displeasure with the kitchen.  She told us the kitchen said they
only do a partial deboning.  Also, her tone reflected significant annoyance with our comments/concerns.  This is not the first time we’ve ordered trout in a restaurant…and I have sautéed many a trout and know how easy it is to prepare them properly.  Server needs to be taught how to handle problems from the kitchen.  She was very rude.

We have been here several times in the past and did and service was excellent.   However,  our recent trip was less horrible.  I ordered scallops entre and my husband had salmon
  Or make cane our and we're not even lukewarm.  My risotto was cold and my husband's salmon cold and baked potato was not even cooked.  No way could he melt butter.  In the past, we did order steak, but thought we'd have something else
  The complimentary desserts were mediocre.  
Server was not attentive.  We initially had to flag down another server.  I'm not sure we will return and would not recommend.
Quality of the food was excellent, bone marrow appetizer, Caesar salad and steaks were incredible.

We love everything about The Grill Room EXCEPT the volume of the music.  Can barely hear partner across the table because music is so loud.  Shouldn’t have to yell to have a conversation.  Other than this, all is perfect.

Have been here before and it is always fine. This was my first time having dinner with a dietary restriction (dairy free because my breastfed baby is allergic). I was incredibly disappointed to find that they basically charge for dietary restrictions. I wanted the NY Sirloin entree, but can't have the potato aligot. They won't do any sort of substitutions, even for dietary restrictions/allergies, so you have to order a la carte. The exact same meal with fries substituted for the cheesy potato dish costs $18 more than the entree option. So they basically charge $18 for an allergy. 

Fries were junk, Sirloin was medium when I asked for rare, service was slow despite the restaurant being only half full. 

Will not be returning.
Best steak around great experience and knowledgeable staff
Great time excellent food energetic attentive staff.  Prices def on the high side so be prepared. Would still recommend for special occasions.

Dinner in Hades.  Too hot for any guest to be comfortable. Lady next to me had her makeup melt off her face. They acted annoyed to turn fans on, wouldn’t turn them to higher setting until someone else begged. Spent $260 for meal we couldn’t wait to leave. Hotter inside than outside. Embarrassed bc I took my disabled parents here and they were miserable.
Always great food & service. The best steakhouse in Maine.
Amazing food, top notch service and great drinks!!  Perfect date night place!!!!  Will definitely go back!
Delicious food and many options. One of our favorite places to go in Portland!
Great dinner excellent service………………………………………………..

Visiting Portland from NYC/NJ area:
We had an excellent dinner at The Grill room!!
Our server, Lucia (sp?) was attentive and all-around wonderful.
Started with the calamari and tuna tartare which were both amazing!
Calamari was fried in rice flour and cornmeal which gave it a unique flavor. The jalapeno sauce/mayo (?) was perfect (had a zing but not too spicy) and the coconut curry sauce was BOMB!! Spicy but so much flavor!
Tuna had lots of avocado, cilantro and served with blue corn chips.
For entrees we had filet mignon and tuna steak (sushi grade) dinner. Both cooked to perfection!!
Would HIGHLY recommend (we’re thinking about going back again!!)￼
Had a great time for my wife’s birthday. Food and service were exceptional. Was just a little dark for my liking.
We were early and it quickly filled up with a warm atmosphere.  Food was fabulous from roasted oysters to perfect scallops.  Steak done just right.  Special New Zealand wine
Excellent food, service and atmosphere! We will definitely go back to visit again!
Always a great dinner and great service at the Grill Room!

We hadn’t been to the Grill room since before the fire. I booked on open table for 6:30.  They confirmed 5:30 via email after getting my cc info. After two calls from them with mixed info and not knowing they called twice.  We went for 5:30 and it was so so.  The wedge is good if you want a half of head of lettuce with a 1/2 pound of blue cheese in it.  Escargot had no flavor.  Asparagus thick and tough.  Salmon had good flavor.  Pork was okay.  Wagyu burger tough with no flavor so they cover it with 2 lbs of fries.  They brought my friend the wrong steak. He picked it up with his fork and put it back on the plate. When they brought the right one they put that back in the serving board and served it again.  It ended with horrible coffee.  But we had a great waiter.  Very very loud atmosphere.
Pork chop dinner was amazing. Preparers were very friendly, we sat at the counter overlooking the food preparation.

Wonderful dinner to celebrate our sons 25 th birthday!  We had a table for 4 close to the grill. We enjoyed watching and chatting with the chef.  Our server Arianna was knowledgeable and attentive. We have been to the Grill once before and   look forward to our next special occasion at the Gril Room,
Great experience at The Grill Room. We sat at the counter and watched meals being prepared. Food was great and staff was very friendly.

The meals were delicious! The server was very knowledgeable and kind. She asked us at the beginning of our meal if we were going to a show (we were!) and we had plenty of time to eat. Highly recommend.
We have eaten here several times in the past and enjoyed our experience, but we were terribly Disappointed on this occasion and will not be returning anytime soon.
The food was amazing. Perfectly cooked and flavored perfectly. The one complaint I had was our mushroom side came and was pretty cold. It was correct quickly and came back hot. Great experience!

This was our 3rd time at The Grill Room, and everything was awesome as always. Whenever we are in the Portland area, we try to make reservations for a nice night out. Can't wait to go back in the summer!
Food was good, very tight seating, it was fairly loud while we were there.

My very expensive New York strip was brought to the table cold. We had waited for 45-50 minutes from time we placed the order then for it to have sat out long enough to get cold I don’t understand. Chewy also. We ordered 3 sides and the fiddleheads were also stone cold. My son’s New York strip was room temp but he poured his blue cheese fondue over it and that warmed it a bit.
Poorly done and I was very disappointed. This is usually a nice experience. Chicken next time.
Wonderful anniversary dinner last night. Great service

What a great experience! We got to sit at the chef’s table. The cooks and chef all spoke to us at different times. The chef offered us a free Caesar salad because they made a little extra for a large party. The food was amazing! Great service and attention to detail.

We love the grill room.  The food is exceptional. The service is excellent. You're kind of stuffed in to a noisy environment, but the people seated eight inches away were very nice. :).  We really love the Grill Room.
Sat at Chef’s table, fantastic experience, fabulous food, knowledgeable staff.
Food was delicious and our server Chris was outstanding
Had a good meal. Although the mussels were a bit too spicy. It was very noisy and difficult to converse.
Always a top notch experience! The staff and Chef are great!
Food was good but would like to have more flexibility with entrees shouldn’t have to be a la carte
Our waiter, Chris was great.  We were there celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary and our meal was delicious.

One of our favorite places to eat in Portland. Always excellent service (Dustin or Sean) and meal.  We did have a little off putting experience though on this visit.  We often sit at the Chef's counter as we love watching the staff busily prepare the meals and I love watching how others prepare foods.  We couldn't sit there this time but we were close.  Usually the lead chef is an older (but not "old") individual than was there last night.  He usually keeps the staff smiling and happy, in spite of the very hectic pace.  Last night the younger person in that position got frustrated at one point.  He loudly slammed his fist on the counter and dropped the "F" bomb twice.  You could tell the rest of the kitchen staff was more on edge as well.  Will not keep us from going back.
Amazing food and great atmosphere.  Most of the staff were very friendly, accommodating, and attentive.
The food and service were outstanding. The noise level is a tad loud.
The food was phenomenal.   The horseradish mashed potatoes are something I will dream about regularly now.
The service was fantastic and the food was even better!!
Excellent service and food!  The wait person was excellent!  Very knowledgable and great with recommendations.  The food arrived so fast.  Everything was perfect!

This is our second time to The Grill Room. Our meals were fabulous; including dessert. Our waitress was amazing! Be sure to make reservations  at least one week in advance to secure a table. Nothing but a great experience awaits you!
Wood oven oyster appetizer was delicious, and service was top notch. Proteins (duck breast and pork chop) were nicely seasoned and perfectly cooked.

The service at the Grill Room is always top notch but Lucia took it to another level. The drinks, appetizers, and entrees were delicious. Dessert was a little disappointing though. The brownie served with vanilla bean gelato was very dry and difficult to bite through. The crème brûlée was pretty good, though not amazing. We will definitely be back!

Food and service were second to none for higher end Portland restaurants.  Sean, our waiter, was friendly and attentive but not annoyingly so and very knowledgeable.   Good comments and recommendations from Sean, not the typical “they are all good” non-committal response from some waitstaff.   My only negative comment was on the cost; the food and service were not worth an add-on to the cost one might pay at other excellent restaurants in Portland.  Trust me - I’ve been to all of them, and as good as the Grill Room is, there’s definitely a surcharge in pricing which I could not justify.

Not to say I would not go back.
Phenomenal food and service - we lived the atmosphere & will be back!

Another night of first class  food, service and wine!
Staff were knowledgeable, personable and professional.
Food was prepared as ordered , attractively plated  and served at proper temperatures.
Portions were more than ample and staff courteously boxed  what we wanted to take home.
The Grill Room has become our go to choice for special occasions but also for when we just want a great meal.
Fantastic experience.  Our family was there for the first time to celebrate my daughter’s 17th birthday. We had six people, it was amazing food and amazing service.
Always good service food. Looking forward to have the outside dinning.

I was looking for an excellent beef/steak meal.  The bone marrow dish was the best.  The NY sirloin was excellent and cooked to perfection.  We sat at the chef counter - very much enjoyed Chef Declan (sp?) and well orchestrated no drama precision.  Chef introduced himself when we arrived and visited a few more time.  Our server Eliana (sp?) was perfect in all respects - knowledgeable, helpful, interpersonal… I’m sure she could use a raise!  My overall and food ratings would have been higher but for the EXCESSIVE amount of salt which we observed being added and was toooooo much in all aspects of the meal.  I began noticing Chef announcing orders with “no salt”.  When I return - I will request this and recommend to others.  Overall an excellent experience for a couple who are exploring Maine for relocation.  Thanks for asking and great job Chef!   Lee Kirk

Fliet was amazing, so soft and flavorful..
Will definitely go back

Wonderful impromptu dinner, which was spectacular!
Iva our hostess and server and Ryan our bartender provided impeccable service this evening. The shrimp cocktail was spectacular, the tuna  tartare full of flavor and scallops appetizer sensational. We topped it off with a delicious mocha. Cheesecake!
Can’t wait to return when we return to Portland.

We decided not to get beef (we usually do which is super) I had the duck and it was fabulous; best duck I ever had.  My husband had the trout (which is hard to find on any other menu in Portland Maine) He said it was cooked perfect.  Sides... beets were soooo hummy!!!

This was a total disappointment with the lighting darker than a sleazy bar, the pungent Ceaser salad and the absurd price of the "special" revealed on the bill. The meat quality and cooking temperature was o.k., but not the sauces and garnished presentations where the pork chop was pre-sliced and the special fillet was floating on a heap of sauced mushrooms and mashed potatoes. I doubt that any locals dine in this restaurant.

The Grill Room was the perfect place for my boyfriend's 40th birthday dinner. Food, service, ambiance... everything was amazing. The host was kind and our server was spectacular. We will definitely be back for another great meal!

Highly recommended by good friends. Wanted to love it. Steak frites came with a small and tough piece of meat. Meat had been sliced and lost its flavor. A mountain of French fries quickly got cold.
Trout came whole and was probably delicious but it sat in a soupy pool of “lobster” mashed potatoes and then was covered in spinach. Very disappointed. Waitress was excellent and the manager gracious as I sent it back. If you want an EXCELLENT Caesar salad The Grill Room is the place.
One of the best meals I’ve had in a long time. Made the  5 hour trip from Presque Isle, ME to enjoy this for date night.
We had an excellent dinner. The staff really care about your experience and offer high end service as a result. Attentative, polite, efficient, and accomodating! Thank you for a super meal!
Too loud in there and quite expensive. But staff is always good as is the food
Filets were amazing! Cooked perfectly and so good!

Wow......what an inconsistant meal.........loved the ambience and GREAT service!

A wonderful wedge salad, house salad, and mussels...........but the steak/frites was a collasal disappointment.........a pile of soggy 'frites' and an inedible and incredibly TOUGH 'sirloin' that was both impossibile to cut and chew.....half was left on the plate!

Waiter did give us a discount..........thank you, but this Sirloin was very subpar!

oh.........and $3.00 for an ice ball in my scotch?

Guys, time to up your game.
Great food, fast and full of flavor!  Service was excellent. Drinks were also great
Great food and welcoming staff… but having a conversation in there is close to impossible.

Loved everything except the fact that they asked when I made the reservation if we were celebrating anything told them a birthday, asked again when we arrived and when we got to the table so I assumed something would be done for a birthday but there was nothing. So that was a little disappointing, not sure why they asked so many times to do nothing.
Always a great experience.  Best steaks without a doubt.  Dustin always provides excellent service.
The environment was lively and the food was delicious. I look forward to my next visit!
Wonderful generous portions. Tuna to die for.  Caesar salad and beet salads were also fresh and delicious.  The new wine list hit the spot
By far the best meal we have ever had! Lucia was our waitress and she was amazing!! We traveled 1.5 hours but it was worth the drive. We will definitely be back!

A longstanding favorite of many, we visited on a Saturday night around 6:15. The place was packed and the noise level was significant. Our server was delightful and clearly knew the menu. Drink service was slow but the blue cheese stuffed olives are worth the wait. Apps were good, our party liked the mussels and the calamari, despite a very fiery hot chili sauce. Dinner presented well, the trout dish was well plated. My wife enjoyed her salmon as well. My steak, although requested medium was cold to the touch rare and needed to be returned. It was scraped off the plate and brought back to the grill. For a $50 plate, that felt sloppy. Overall it was good but not the level of finesse one would expect. The least appealing part of the night was the chef yelling at staff. He was clearly upset and it was quite evident in tone. Our server gracefully attempted to normalize his actions but again not what one would expect in a high end place. We will likely return but not for awhile.
Great food and vibe! Salmon was exceptional! Seated and served quickly. Will definitely be back! Can’t wait to try the tuna.
Amazing dining experience! Every course was delicious and our server was knowledgeable and attentive!
Beautiful place and delicious food!! Definitely will be visiting again and with more time to enjoy the ambiance!
Portions are a bit much, but food was good. Fun place to go.

It is a loud busy spot.  Very good food.  The environment was a bit overwhelming for my daughter as she is autistic but that is in me, I should have asked.  She managed.

I do think the wedge salad should be an actual wedge.  It was yummy and I took most of it home as it was far more than a wedge.

Very tasty.

Every bite and sip was delicious!  Flavors were complex and melted in your mouth. 

Limited to 1-1/2 hours due to the number of reservations.

Service was a bit rushed for all the starters, but dinner was delivered with more appropriate timing.  We wouldn’t have minded,  but the tables are very small and don’t allow room for multiple starters at the same time.  

We were 10 minutes from our allotted time, and couldn’t linger over our after dinner drink.  Even if we wanted to shift over to the bar, there were no seats.  

Overall, this pricey restaurant is worth the splurge.  Might want to consider a 2 hour limit so people can relax and enjoy their experience.

Tried the Grill Room after seeing positive comments online.  It was an awesome treat!  The service was prompt and knowledgeable; the food was divine (the oxtail marmalade gets an 11); and the atmosphere was off the hook!  Highly recommended!!!!

The food is the highlight here - it's very good and the wood fire adds nice complexity and some uniqueness to the offerings.  The duck was very good, the scallops outstanding.  The sides - mashed potatoes, mushrooms and lobster risotto were also very good.  My one complaint was the tuna tartare - the whole dish was ice cold, like it just came out of the fridge.  This impacted the taste and the tuna was more like ceviche than raw.

The atmosphere is more dark pub than upscale, which was a little odd.  But the food more than made up for that.
The best steak I've ever had! The sides were fantastic and big enough for sharing. Service was great and the servers were very friendly.

7:15 reservation but table not ready.  My wife requested no pepper and her salad was loaded with peppercorns.  Waiter delivered my beer by placing an open can in front of me with no glass.  Felt ignored by wait staff throughout like nobody wanted to service our table.  Had to ask hostess for bread service which was supposed to come after our order was taken.  Had to ask hostess for water.  Waited nearly an hour for entrees which were only OK and mine was missing the puree base.  We've always loved the Grill Room although it's very loud.  Might just have been a bad night but this experience will have us questioning future invites.  Failed on every front last night.
Excellent service, great meal!! A little noisy in there but a great experience!!
We had such a great time! The food was outstanding, the portions are huge, and the service is exceptional. Highly recommended.
Amazing food and drinks! We go everytime we are in the old port
Unbelievable food and service ! Definitely one of the best meals I have had. Will definitely go back. We sat at the counter, highly recommend!!

Great food and great service. We had reservations and we were seated close to the kitchen. It was nice to see the energy of the kitchen and wait-staffs working together but at times it was a bit noisey for what I hoped to be a more intimate dinner with my wife. 
No worries all in all a great time and a great experience.

Our server Nessa was wonderful, timed out our food perfectly and never left our glass empty. I’ve tried lobster bisque all over but this is my new favorite, I love the slight heat. My filet was perfection with the most embarrassing amount of fries. My husband got the porkchop on a whim, it was tender and nothing like mom used to make. Keep doing what you’re doing grill room, we love it!
Great experience as always, great food great service. My wife and I love this place and this is our number 1 choice for a good date night.
The chefs there make culinary creations that bordering on absolute artistry. Highly recommended.
Food, atmosphere, and service are all completely top notch. Also might be the most expensive meal in Portland.
The food was fantastic and our waiter was very attentive.
Food and service were awesome. Tends to be loud when busy- but understandable- because it is busy!!
The food and service were awesome.  Our server was very knowledgeable about the food and drink offerings.  He seemed to truly care about our experience and made sure we were happy with everything.
Even with reservations, very poor seating location.  High traffic seats next to open kitchen, very HOT.  Unfortunate even with reservations.
The most tender chicken I’ve ever had. Great food!

The food was phenomenal. Our waitress was great. We sat at the chefs table I believe it was called and the chef and sous chef were very nice and checked in on how our meal was. Next time we’re in Portland we will definitely be going back.
Great food and amazing, attentive service. Would definitely go back again.
One of our favs!  Always great and consistent on everything!  Highly recommend!
Tasty food.  Beware the upcharges - $20 to add bacon wrap to a filet.  Very loud.

We had not been to the Grill Room in almost 8 years and we decided to make it our date night on 2/2/24.  The waitress was great and very attentive.  The bread that came out before the meal is always a plus.  The food was hot when it was delivered to our table.  Talk about some delicious fries!  The steak was a little well done for my wife’s liking but tasted pretty fresh. 
The scallops with lobster risotto were tasty but a little high priced for only 4.  The biggest downside was sitting at a tiny table in the middle of the restaurant.  It really took away from the ambiance and “date” night.    Overall  would have rated it higher but seating took away from experience.
Good food for Maine, but doesn’t do for a well traveled person. Not much better in Maine though.
Fabulous food and service. The staff was so friendly and accommodating!

My wife and I recently had the most delightful evening at The Grill Room in Portland, Maine, and I simply cannot stop raving about our experience. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warm smiles and a cozy ambiance that instantly set the tone for a perfect night out.

The Grill Room offers a menu that exudes creativity and passion. Every dish we tried was a true work of art, beautifully presented and bursting with flavors that left our taste buds dancing with joy. From the perfectly seared scallops to the mouthwatering ribeye steak, each bite was a culinary masterpiece that showcased the chef's expertise and dedication to excellence.

Not only was the food impeccable, but the service was equally remarkable. The waitstaff was attentive, knowledgeable, and genuinely passionate about the dishes they were serving. They seamlessly guided us through the menu, offering recommendations and ensuring that we had everything we needed to enhance our dining experience.

What truly stood out to us was the attention to detail and the use of fresh, locally sourced ingredients. The Grill Room takes great pride in supporting local farmers and fishermen, and it reflects in the quality of their dishes. Every ingredient was meticulously chosen, resulting in flavors that were vibrant, honest, and absolutely delicious.

The atmosphere at The Grill Room was also worth mentioning. The restaurant has a sophisticated yet relaxed vibe that made us feel right at home. The dim lighting, rustic decor, and soft music created a romantic and intimate setting, perfect for a special evening with loved ones.

As the night drew to a close, we couldn't help but feel grateful for the experience we had at The Grill Room. It was a wonderful reminder of how food can be an art form, and how a great dining experience can truly create lasting memories.

If you find yourself in Portland, Maine, I highly recommend visiting The Grill Room. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or simply look
It's a pub like atmosphere but with fine dining service and food--both of which were very good.  Ok wine list but wine storage is dubious—too warm.  I would not splash out here on an expensive red.
We had a wonderful date night last night and a huge part of the enjoyment was eating at The Grill Room. Thank you for making it a great night!!!
Great experience overall! Very Friendly staff and delicious food!

Excellent meal but wow are the prices up there. 2 apps, a few drinks and two entrees with tip was almost $300. This will certainly will be a place we will go as a treat but cannot afford to dine here regularly.
Julio was one of the best waiters I’ve ever had. He single handedly made our experience a 5-star. Food was perfect. Highly recommend.

Food was excellent. We had wood fired mussels (maybe the best way to prepare!), scallops entree, and pork chop entree.
Our server, Chris was awesome. Very professional and very knowledgeable.
Will definitely be back.

The food was good, but not wonderful. I ordered an entree (steak frites) and got maybe 4 oz. of steak and 6 potatoes worth of fries (a ridiculous over-abundance). Really overpriced for what I received for food. Everything was also REALLY salty.

The Grill Room is was a superior experience of food and flavor as always! Started with the bone marrow butter with lobster And oxtail relish ended with huge delicious ribeye cooked to perfection and a few lone pine beers… no room for dessert and no regrets!!!5stars!
Overall, the experience was amazing. Been here before. Food was incredible. Drinks good. Just very expensive. Our waiter Julio/Javier was awesome and contributed to a great night.
My husband loved his ribeye but my scallop entree was sitting in a half-inch of butter and it really brought the meal down a notch for me.
I've been going to The Grill Room for years.  I have never been anything but completely satisfied with everything about the dining experience they provide.

We were all happy with our meals. Portions were generous with nice accompaniments. This is a fun restaurant to go to with friends but a little noisy for a romantic dinner unless you sit at the chef’s table or side by side at the bar.

Our server was excellent. Very professional, experienced, personable, and knowledgeable about the menu. The sides were priced very fairly, although with the exception of the fries, a bit small for a table of 4. The ribeye was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing. Best we have ever had. The overall experience made our daughters 18th birthday so memorable and special. As a business owner myself, and strictly from a consumers perspective, I can say that this business appears to be run very well with careful attention to quality or food and staff.
We had a very memorable meal for our anniversary! We were pretty blown away by the whole experience and will definitely be back. The food is outstanding!
Our waitress (Lucia) was excellent, very attentive and accommodating, we could not have been wished for a better one.

So not my first time here, the food is excellent the wine and drink selection is on par with the finer restaurants. The waitstaff was very attentive the restaurant is clean as well as the restrooms. The only downside to the restaurant is the proximity of adjacent tables, I understand that more seating equals more patrons and more profit for the restaurant. This also allows for faster seating however I personally would prefer if they had set tables further apart and charged more for the food or try to use dividers to cut down on the noise as I don’t really want people hearing discussions that I’m having with my company.
Food and service excellent, I order dod not get put in on time, had excessive wait, people around us ordered after and ate way before us, but server did recognize and gave us free dessert.
Always fun to sit at the chef's bar and watch the food getting prepared, especially when it is yours!

Only one recommendation. Cut the amount of fries served in half or less than that.

We talked with other diners and a couple who were staying in the same hotel as us. Everyone said the same thing, what a waste of food. It really made us feel guilty of wasting so much food. Having six out of six diners feel guilty is probably not what the restaurant is striving for. 

If we come again we will know to order less fries.
Fantastic food and impeccable service. The music was so loud we couldn’t hear our server or each other, but we would definitely go back
Lovely waitress, drinks and food were prompt. Will definitely be back!
The atmosphere was cozy and beautiful. The staff was friendly and very attentive. The food was phenomenal.

Extremely tough steak for a $60 ribeye. Sides were cold and overseasoned (very salty). Lobster risotto was cold. The salad and bone marrow were pretty decent,  however. 
Service was spectacular which is the only reason I left 3 stars.  Extremely disappointed for the price we paid.

Bartender was busy making friends - good she's friendly... bad she has other customers and forgot the recipe for a drink special.   Sides were ridiculously small and never ever get a rib eye there again.  Charred.   Couldnt even taste the flavor of the meat.  bitter & burnt with a cool middle.  Grill room 'signature' salad?  overdressed and oily with spinach!  supposed to me a mix of romaine and chopped. If I wanted a warm spinach salad... That would have been ordered. Will not recommend.
Asked for NO salt.  All food was heavily salted and inedible.
My wife and I enjoyed our new years dinner. Steak was amazing.

Everything was awesome! The staff worked like a well oiled machine and we waited for nothing and everything was cooked to perfection! As first time customers we were extremally impressed and will definitely be back! Thank you!
Great service and food. Definitely will be dining there again.

We were told to order everything at once and they will time the delivery.  We were not half done the salad and were brought out the appetizer. We didn’t accept. Two more times different servers asked if we would like the appetizer still not done with the salad. No room on the table for another plate. No communication I guess or to interested in turning tables.
The bread was good, but the rest of the food  was just ok and overpriced.
So yummy!!  Great service!  Did I say so yummy!! The sauces!

We had a very enjoyable and delicious meal! The service was top notch, and our steaks were cooked to perfection. The only downside was that it felt like we were at a sports bar with the tv over the bar and the noise level. I wished the experience were a bit more special for the price of the meal. Overall, very enjoyable though.
Sitting at the Chefs Table is an experience, watching the good preparation while you dine. The food was great as always - the Bone Marrow app is a decadent treat!

Waitress (Shelby) very nice. Drinks and food came very promptly.
Food (a NY sirloin, salmon, duck breast) was all mediocre at best and way overpriced. Fish was grossly undercooked and covered with a pile of really gross french fries. dinner for three cost what I would normally expect for four, though there were only 5 alc. beverages, two apps and no dessert.
Amazing and our waitress Lucia was amazing! She went above and beyond, highly suggest! My family had a great time and experience
Very good atmosphere great service and the food was very good

Excellent meal! Drinks were fantastic too. Started with calamari and the carpaccio. Delicious, especially the calamari that was spicy and sweet. Then I had the pork chop and it was perfectly juicy and flavorful. Companions had steak- amazing - and tuna. Large portions. Very expensive though, especially the drinks. Service was good and described food well. Very loud though. Great experience though. Glad it’s back open.

Great food
Fabulous staff
Unique cocktails
Stellar wine
Amazing time with great friends
Will be back soon!

The food was great.  Portions were generous. Two of us had the lobster bisque and the scallop dinner,  Both were excellent.  The cheese board was enormous.  Two of us had the house burger.  The bun was odd and crumbly.  It fell apart so that you couldn’t pick up the burger.  The service was excellent.  It was kind of dark.  Overall, a good experience, and I would recommend.

We sat at the Chef’s bar right beside the kitchen.  We had a couple of starter salads; wedge salad with blue cheese dressing, blue cheese crumble and tons of thick bacon.   My wife had the Grill Room house salad which was loaded with spinach, feta, carrots, crispy fried onion Ind a delicious house vinaigrette.  I had the dry aged, brined oversized pork chop, with mashed potatoes and crispy brussel sprouts.  My wife had the fresh trout dish, lobster mashed potatoes (with chunks of fresh lobster), and pan seared spinach.  The Chef’s conversed with the us and answered all of the questions we had about the preparation of several dishes.  I will be back and highly recommend to any foodies out there!
Great place to celebrate special occasions! Staff is super friendly and accommodating, food is always delicious!

The service was outstanding and the food was terrific. However, they sat us in the middle of the room at the smallest table ever. Servers kept bumping into me and it was difficult to share the delicious meal with my girlfriend on such a small space.

This was our 3rd visit to the Grill Room.  We went back this year because we enjoyed it so much last year when we were in town.  The salads are all wonderful, you can't go wrong.  We tried the steak tartar this year, the most expensive appetizer on the menu.  It by far was the worst Steak Tar Tar we had ever had.  There was not much steak in it, and it was smothered with so many spices that you could not taste it at all.    

The filets we had were very good, but my wife thought her's tasted gamey.

Restaurant was crowded and loud. Service was excellent. Food was good but Not was expecting better. It wasn’t a poor experience but it wasn’t nearly worth the pricetag. I don’t see myself going there again

Ambience was awesome! 

The service was OK, but it took a while to get our food ordered. After we had ordered, we inquired about a plate that someone had next to us. The waiter informed us it was one of the specials (short rib). He never mentioned the specials to us. When my wife received her food, the salmon was raw in the middle. It was burnt on the outside but cold middle. I could tell we frustrated the waiter when we mentioned this to him. We just asked that they throw it back in to finish cooking. When they brought it back, it was still undercooked. They didn’t offer us a credit for the dinner nor did I ask. We just paid the bill and went to the concert next-door. it was our first time trying this place, but it will also be our last.
It’s the best meal we’ve had in a long time! So happy they are open again!

We enjoyed our recent visit. Our waiter was excellent and the food prepared just as we requested.  It was a bit loud for an easy conversation, but all patrons seemed to be having fun and generally had an inviting atmosphere.
Service and food were top notch! Definitely one of new favorite places to eat!
The staff had excellent knowledge on the menu and the food was amazing!!!

Everything was pretty good.  The horseradish potatoes were very overwhelming and the local mushrooms did not have the garlic and onions cooked down so they were raw and bitter.  Sitting at the chefs counter was very nice.   Service was very slow in the beginning.
Good food & very generous servings. The Wait staff were extremely professional and attentive to our needs. We have dined here before as this is a favorite place of ours in the Portland area.
Amazing atmosphere with wonderful knowledgeable service. Quality of food was superb and the prices were well within reason for todays costs as well as the quality in which they were prepared.

Not bad . $25 for 2 scallops and the celery root and bacon garnish are cold. Order 2 NYs  size difference was at least 2-3 oz and med rare was smaller than med. Waiter was a bit odd.. nice enough but demanding we cut into the middle of our steaks to check for proper temp was not cool. Why would we cut into the middle of a steak and let it cool quickly?? Dessert was very good

Ordered sirloin asking for it to have pink however the steak was overcooked and chewy with no pink. The other meal was cooked correctly. When bringing up the concern to the waitress she said “oh sorry” but didn’t seem to care or make any offers to correct. I wouldn’t mind paying that much if the meat was actually cooked that way it was ordered. Very disappointed.
Always reliable for excellent food, service, & creating a special occasion atmosphere!

Our food was quite good. Actually the trout and the tuna were the best dishes - really delicious. The ribeye steak was a little thin for our liking, but it was properly cooked, and exactly as the waitress described.  I will say that the portions are absolutely massive, and I don't consider that a good thing. It is wasteful and not healthy. There were literally about two pounds of french fries on the massive burger. This is 2023 - dial back the portions. The environment is very loud.  The dessert offerings were pretty disappointing, so we went to Gross for dessert. The popover was also meh.

Both entrees were sub par and buried under a pound of fries.  Loved it pre-fire, not sure what the issue is now. My burger was too thick and dry.  The tonic was bad, the service was fine, but a little frantic.  I’d go back and sit at the bar for happy hour.

My salmon was undercooked…I had to use a steak knife to cut the broccolini…It was our Anniversary so we reserved the Chefs table….nothing special….they did give us a complimentary glass of port…..all in all not a good experience.

My fiancé and I went to The Grill Room for a birthday dinner. The service was excellent, we loved our waiter who was very knowledgeable about the food and had some great recommendations! We will definitely be back again
The meat was amazing. The sides and cocktails were perfunctory.
Always great food! Highly recommend, whether casual or fine dining!
From start to finish it’s our favorite steak house, cocktails, apps, main and sides are all delicious. The tomahawk steak is perfection!
Outstanding dinner. great local spot. Appreciate the thoughtful waiters.
Exceptional food, as always, and excellent service. Fairly loud and extremely dark - the tables next to us were using phone lights to read the menu.

This was our second time at the grill room and it has yet to disappoint. The grilled scallop starter was my favorite. It was nothing short of perfection. The ribeye, fries and asparagus were great as well. Can’t wait to go back!

We were very excited for the reopening of The Grill Room and to get a seating primetime on a Saturday night. We were not disappointed.  The food and service were excellent.  And the remodeling looks great.  We cannot wait to go back.
The food was amazing! Great atmosphere and attentive staff.
Glad to be back at the Grill Room. As always, cozy, warm atmosphere. Friendly service and excellent food.
Lucia was a wonderful waitress and food was excellent as always.
It lived up to our expectations.Service and food was outstanding.

We had the 48oz tomahawk ribeye steak, perfectly cooked rare. It had a beautiful sear, with a salty crust - it was to die for when paired with my peppercorn bacon cream sauce. Truly melt in your mouth The spicy broccoli had a a spot on chili crisp oil and the grilled asparagus was tender and thick. The buttery lobster mash potatoes were sublime and tied everything together perfectly. Our drinks were spot on classics and enjoyed their spiced pear cocktail. 10/10 will be returning.

Brought my dad for his birthday. He had the BEST time. He is a cook by trade and he was beaming the whole time he ate. He said he was inspired by the food. And days later, he’s still gushing over how good the salmon was.

The Grill Room is everything you want from a steakhouse! Perfectly cooked meat, drool-worthy sides (the creamed spinach is a sin) and the environment is robust and exciting (especially at the chef's counter). The Grill Room was also great with food allergies--our server Alanna very impressively had all of the ingredients in her head and was able to go through the whole menu on the spot and design a great meal!

We made reservations a month before we got to Portland because we were traveling from Florida and wanted to make sure we got in. We got confirmations right up to when we were supposed to be there. Unfortunately when we got there the restaurant was closed due to a small fire. We got no notice at all that this happened. I will make sure from now on that when I travel to a different state, I call the restaurant to make sure they are open. Finding another restaurant in Portland Maine in the middle of the summer wasn't easy. Very disappointed.

The pork chop was cooked to perfection and the salmon was outstanding!  Our server Claire was knowledgeable and friendly.  Sitting at the chef’s counter was an added plus.  The “grilled” really came through tonight and made it very special.

The hostess was very nice and made us feel welcome; the waiter (Andrew) was very professional, friendly and courteous - great job!  The food was delicious - shared a wedge salad and baked brie appetizers, then a steak and lobster mashed potatoes for me, scallops and lobster risotto for my wife.  Good wines to choose from too. The ambience was comfortable and relaxing.  Great place to have an excellent dinner.
One of my favorite places in Portland. Excellent service and the food is top notch.

Excellent place to enjoy a great steak or just sit at the bar and have a few drinks.
Our waiter, Will, was friendly, helpful and a pleasure to chat with during our visit. He made us feel like "family" from the moment we sat at the table. If you like oysters, their smoked oysters were the best!!  The restaurant is small so would highly recommend making reservations. We will definitely add The Grill Room and Bar to our "must visit" list while in Portland!!
I would definitely recommend the Grill Room I was very satisfied with everything from food to atmosphere. Also our waiter Ryan was exceptional!!!

For the price, the food was just “okay”. Certainly didn’t stand out and could have easily found something much cheaper that tasted better especially in Portland. Our waitress was rushed and flustered and we were overall disappointed.
Great atmosphere and great service! The food was amazing and our waiter was great at explaining all of the specials!

Fantastic variety of foods and beverages of every category! Great service! We were celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary but wanted casual with great atmosphere, food and music! We were treated with glasses of champagne!! As world travelers but Portland natives, we loved our first time! We will be trying out all of the Rooms.

The food was excellent-my steak was prepared exactly right.  Teh escargot were a little small and some of the flavor was cooked out.  We were seated next to a door to the patio which was opened a few times.  During the summer it is not a problem-however when it is less than 60 outside---

Service was great. Our reservation was for 6:30 at the bar area but customers who were finishing up were still lingering,  so rather than keep us waiting they gave us a table in the dining area. Food is always great and love the ambiance of that restaurant.
Outstanding service, food prepared masterfully. An all around A+ experience!

Outstanding service. Our waiter was excellent! Food was terrific and over all a good vibe to the place. Went there for a birthday celebration... and it was the best decision ever! Will be back. Highly recommend this establishment.

Our server, Katelyn, was amazing! We really loved how thorough she was and we also felt as though she made a great effort to connect with us beyond the food. I am a restaurant manager and I wanted to poach her, that’s how good she was. The food was 5 stars from the appetizers all the way to the dessert. It was really busy and the food and drinks still came out in really great time. Overall this was one of the best restaurants I have been to in Portland. Will absolutely return
Steak was tough and cold! Salmon was raw. Had to be sent back twice to be cooked.
We eat here every time we come to Portland. ALWAYS great food and awesome staff.

We sat at the chef’s counter and it was fabulous!  The service and the food was outstanding!
The beef carpaccio  creation was a very nice change from the “ordinary”!
My husband truly enjoyed his baked potato with the ribeye!

I have not eaten here in years, and was pleased to find the service, the food in the atmosphere just right. The rainbow trout was delicious as well as the salmon. My daughter and I shared the beet salad… It was large enough we could’ve shared with three people. I’d love to go to this restaurant again.
The food and service were excellent.  Dishes were creative and delicious.  Our server did a wonderful job explaining the menu and providing recommendations. She was attentive!

The food was unbelievably delicious. The atmosphere with the music and being able to see the chef’s at work was wonderful. Our server Claire was amazing!! I definitely recommend this restaurant. The quality of the cuisine was second to none.

It was not my first time here and is usually my go-to restaurant when I visit Portland.  The steaks were fantastic, the scallops were OK but overpriced.  I remember the Brussels sprouts and mashed potatoes being better in the past.  The waiter knew the menus very well and was very professional and helpful.
Food and service was excellent. The restaurant was very noisy

Salmon only ok-way too salty. Came with broccolini that was pretty much raw.   Supposed to come with carrot purée and a bit of caviar-could only find a teaspoon of carrot purée.  No bread or nibble offered.  Waiter took my husbands drink (20 percent left) without asking. Quite loud (open kitchen and small space, but loud music puts it at too loud.)

Not likely to return.
Our first time dining here.  It was outstanding from our greeting, table location, exquisite food and cocktails to five star service!  We highly recommend The Grill Room and Bar!

Chris was amazing! very pleasant and great eye for timing when to come to our table - it was our wedding dinner and he brought us proseco! your hostess was also so nice - both congratulated us and we had the best experience. the food was amazing!! steak perfectly cooked and delicious!!
Amazing food and atmosphere. We celebrated a birthday, and the waitress was fantastic about making it all about the birthday celebration. I highly recommend The Grill Room & Bar.

I had purchased 4 50.00$ gift cards from seize the deal.  When we went to pay I was told I could only use one at a time.  No place on their website or yours states this.  This was unexpected and not right. We won't be back out of principle. Not away to conduct business by sneaky business practices and trying to force repeat customers. I'd rather throw the money away then to give you more of mine.

Too tight inside, kitchen is open to dinning room, everything smells like smoke and its hard to breathe in there. Service was amazing, Chris was very professional. Steaks cooked differently (medium is medium rare, medium rare is rare) food was good but not great. Overall okay.
Awesome food and location for a Friday night bite!
Great food! The music was a little loud making it hard to hear each other. Service was also good

Disappointed in the overall experience.  Our waitress was nice but the food was pretty disappointing for the money.  Four of us went and had different dishes.  Sadly not one of us loved our food.  With so many other options in Portland this will be a one and done.  Not what we were hoping for:(
WOW! The same jazz song on a loop! The food is great the noise is loud! I'm a combat veteran so if noise s loud for me...then it must be loud for others.
Our server was excellent and the food delicious. We’ll be back!
Extremely good service here, the whipped ricotta appetizer was amazing, great vibes and atmosphere all around
Visiting family jn the area and we wanted a nice night out, this was perfect

Sat at chef counter - great service great meal except oysters were the tiniest we’ve ever had - and we eat them all the time - yours were NOT worth the price - mussels and duck entree and coffee were terrific
Amazing all around! Not cheap but not overly expensive and definitely worth it!

Fantastic meal with great service!
Seating is a little tight but we had a fun couple next to us which added to the experience.
Definitely recommend!
Wedding anniversary dinner. A little loud and the table was a little to small but the food and service was amazing!

The food was some of the best I’ve ever had. Portion size was huge, two meals worth easily. Our server was very personable and was there when we needed but not overbearing and very knowledgeable about the menu. Without a doubt 5 stars!

Food was excellent. Service was top notch. Tables are very small and too close together. It’s very crowded and loud. If you are ok basically dining with strangers sitting right next to you, it’s totally with it. The food is incredible.

Everything was impeccable! Scallops to start were cooked to perfection. Our main was the filet - tender, juicy and delicious! The asparagus side was bountiful and tasty. We finished with the carrot cake; like everything else it was amazing! Many thanks for a wonderful evening.
We had been looking to eat at the grill room after great dining at the other room locations. Superior!  Will come back for sure!

One steak over cooked, one undercooked, both ordered the exact same way.

One filet was twice the size of the other.

Broccolini was severely undercooked.
A great place to spend time and have a good dinner.
I ordered a medium steak with broccoli and it was very tough. The broccoli was spicy despite my request for no spice. It was a disappointment all around.
Celebrating a 16 year olds birthday!! Great place for any occasion

We were very disappointed. After making a reservation we were offered an extremely small table in crowded conditions. Tables were about 12 inches apart.

For an upscale restaurant with good food the conditions were unacceptable. They would be better off removing a few tables so guests could enjoy their meals.

We walked out.
Always a pleasant experience at The Grill Room.  The food is perfect (and if it's not, they will make it perfect), and the service is excellent. I'm very happy every time I go therre.
Excellent food, presentation and service.  Always a great experience.
Our waiter Bill was phenomenal!! Steaks were cooked perfectly. One of the best Wedge salad I have ever had!
Waiter was attentive knowledgeable fast and accurate.
Awesome night out, delicious food and apps with excellent service. Steak and cheese beef carpaccio was excellent, as were oysters, salmon, and rib eyes.
Was a great date night. Sat at the chef table. Was so great speaking to the chef.
Great place to bar and dine. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Cozy and comfortable atmosphere. Drinks and foods were fantastic. Would recommend highly.
Excellent service, food came out quickly and cooked to perfection.

Fantastic experience. Oysters, shrimp cocktail, ribeye and filet, as well as the drinks were all amazing. Steaks were cooked perfectly, the place was well staffed with minimal wait times. Highly recommended!
