The steaks were completely charred on the outside, burnt. The calamari was drowning in the sauce. I have had great meals here but last night was not great. It was my son’s 18th birthday and so my wife and I took him here. They have this weird rule that you can’t substitute something that is less expensive for what comes with the meal. My son wanted regular mashed potatoes instead of horseradish mashed potatoes. Not allowed….Nice atmosphere. Nice dessert - crème brûlée. Just under impressed given that it was a $223 bill with no alcohol, one salad, one app and one dessert. Steep, for not perfect!!!

The Grill Room was my "go to" place for a long time but I hadn't been since Covid. Overall it was a good night but I thought the food was good but not great. Even after being given the info on temping of the steak, two of the three steaks were overdone. It was still tasty but more of a true medium than med rare. Other food just lacked seasoning, especially salt. We had to add salt to pretty much everything and I'm not a huge salter of food. The steak frites came with enough fries for 4 people and were under-seasoned and a bit soggy. For the price, the meal was a bit underwhelming. 

That being said, on a positive note, our server was great and spot on and starting the evening at the bar was fun.

Disappointed how we were crammed into a corner and so close to diners at the next table. Had a reservation too. Service was great, food decent, but where we were seated ruined the experience. Very uncomfortable
Went for my girlfriends birthday. I really enjoyed the food, staff, and crowd. The food was great as well. I really like the dim lighting and intimate feel.

Before the pandemic I would of considered The Grill Room pricey however times have changed. It would be a challenge to find a superior steak elsewhere. I appreciate the classic steak house of big portions but with out a big attitude.

6:30 reservation and didn’t sit until 7:00. Zero privacy with tables literally inches away from each other. Sat us directly next to the grill with so much smoke my wife’s eyes were burning out of her head. Great service by the servers and great portions but incredibly expensive. Probably our one and only visit.

Really liked the ambiance of the place.  It’s very convenient to the Merrill auditorium.  Service was very good. The tables are pretty crammed together so you can wind up eating very close with a bunch of strangers.  Wife’s steak was prepared correctly, Brussels weren’t anything to speak about. For me, the scallops were very underdone, never have had them like that at any restaurant.  They were also very late coming out after my wife’s steak which was odd, probably 8-10 minutes after the steak was served before the scallops were delivered. Baked potato was very good.  Overall very average for a place trying to be a foodie establishment, and expensive.
fantastic food! a bit pricey but honestly worth every penny!
Meal was great, steak cooked perfectly.
Loved our meal. Filet was delicious and perfectly done. Fries were outstanding and truffle oil drizzle topped them off nicely.

Absolutely love this place. I had never heard of it before but I was searching for an upscale classy place to dine for my birthday dinner. Hands down the best food I’ve ever had, Dustin our waiter was absolutely fantastic. He made sure we were pleased with our meal and made recommendations based off reviews. This is a place we plan to visit as often as we can. It is in the pricey end but quite honestly we would always be willing to pay a little more for someplace quite and delicious with amazing service.
Delicious food! First time visiting and will definitely be back. The portions were HUGE
Their service and food was exceptional, per usual.  Fresh oysters and great cocktails too.

In a town full of amazing food options, The Grill Room stands head and shoulders above them all!! We’ve been going there for years and it has never disappointed! Do yourself a favor- have the beets and the fries!!!
Excellent steak, staff was awesome, would recommend
Incredible food and a knowledgeable staff. Decor was charming and cozy. We were seated near the kitchen which was great but the noise level was a little high.

Very nice experience; service was amazing.. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu & wine selection, which helped our decision making. My steak was done perfectly, and it was entertaining sitting at the chefs counter.
I would have liked the calamari better without the added spices, same with the cooked beets. Beets with just butter.  Overall everything was great.
Great food, very noisy
Awesome filet minon
Birthday celebration. Appetizer, entree, dessert, bottle of wine and a drink for 2. Over $200 .  Whoa.

The cleaner used on tables was so strong - like it should’ve been diluted- that you could literally taste it. We mentioned something and the staff just shrugged their shoulders. One steak came out ice cold. One steak came out ultra spicy and it was supposed to be just a plain steak. The wine list … we ordered an expensive bottle but what was brought to the table was a different year. So we tried different wines. In each case the year on the menu was earlier than the actual year of the wine they brought to us. But they still charged the price for the older vintage. We have eaten at The Grill Room many times before - this is not the same experience we had come to expect. Very disappointed.
Service was prompt, friendly and attentive.  The food was, done to perfection and arrived very quickly.  We were  not rushed and felt very comfortable and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.
Not nearly as good as it usually is. Need to get their chefs back from the mountain room.

2 Birthdays…..Unless we misunderstood, we were told by the waitress that we would have dessert and candle at the end of the meal and that didn’t happen. Is that not suppose to happen or was that something that was just forgotten? We still had an outstanding time and were so full that we kind of forgot about it until we spoke a bit after the fact. Can’t wait to come back!!

Food and service were both excellent! What I didn't love was the table we sat at. It was the smallest 2 top ever, and we could barely fit out plates and drinks on it. It was also jammed in at the corner of 2 sections of booths, so as one side of it was sticking out into the aisle. It was uncomfortable sitting there. Maybe that wouldn't bother some, but I personally didn't love it. Not for what we were paying for our meals.

Solid steak house with both a la carte items and house specials. The food was very tasty and well prepared. The staff is friendly and attentive. Tables along the bench are a bit tight which means you can easily hear other tables’ conversations but, if you’re the sociable type, it isn’t necessarily a problem.

VERY loud ….  You sit VERY close to other people ….  VERY warm …..    we had the shrimp cocktail, escargot, and bone marrow.    The shrimp cocktail was very good except it was listed as 4 jumbo shrimp on the menu - we got 5 medium shrimp for the same price - NOT OKAY!   The escargot was lacking seasoning ….   Although the bread was delicious.   The bone marrow was delicious.     Disappointing ….   The one bright spot was our server, Shelby- she was great!!!

Overall experience was fantastic - loved the food and wine, our server was superb, and gave great recommendations for menu items. The only negative/unfortunate part to our experience was that the table we were sat at was no further than a foot next to the table beside us, and then they were a foot from the table next to them. It felt as though all of us were sitting on top of each other and we were able to hear everyone’s conversations loud and clear without even trying to over hear. Otherwise, great experience! Just would maybe ask to sit somewhere else next time.

It was a little too dark and we couldn't see what we were eating. 
Waitress was nice. 
A bit too crowded especially all the small tables for couples.
Delicious food and excellent service by our waiter Chris.
We were near the grill and my coat and clothes smelled from the smoke of the grill.

Great experience! My wife & I both got the bacon wrapped filet and both were excellent. Our server Alana (I think that was her name) was incredibly attentive and knowledgeable. This was a retirement celebration for my wife, so it was a special occasion and the Grill Room started us off with a complimentary glass of champagne to help us celebrate.
Our server Ryan was fantastic! We had a great NYE meal.

Filet was over cooked (They did ask us to check it and my wife said it was OK, she’s not one to send food back)

The service was excellent and the place was running like a well oiled machine, other than the fillet it was a pleasant experience, if a bit loud. We will probably return on not so busy a night.

New Year’s Eve. Food was excellent ( filet and ribeye; horseradish sauce was to die for , steaks were cooked as ordered, onion soup-perfect, portions more than ample).
Service personnel were friendly, professional and attentive without being overly so . Hostess was very skillful ( we were a little early and could observe her ) in dealing with guests ( two couples who arrived without reservations and seemed surprised that they were not going to be seated- graciously handled).
Wine pours were generous and reasonably priced ( would suggest a couple at a higher price point and corresponding quality).
The “Rooms “ have never disappointed!!!

Food was wonderful, service was excellent, drinks were perfect. Couldn’t have asked for a better evening. Steak was cooked as ordered, same as the tuna. Risotto was perfection. Muscles were very good as well. I would go back again but for a special occasion. Little pricey. Thank you for a great evening!

We had reservations and since we arrived early waited standing at the bar area.  We tried to get the bartender's attention, but it took a bit as they were working with those sitting.  We seemed to be an annoyance but were served delicious drinks and were seated shortly after.  Our table was in a great location to see the kitchen and yet intimate.  Our waiter was attentive, and the food was well paced.  The food was delicious.  We had to have the sirloin cooked a little longer, but he was so polite about it.   We will visit again the next time we are in Portland!
This was for Dec. 31st.  Why is it showing Dec 30th??!!!  Someone needs to fix this and call me!!!
Delicious meal and great service, as usual!
It was a perfect anniversary dinner! Glad we picked the Grill Room & Bar to celebrate.
Incredible food and service! 10/10!

First time at Chef counter at Grill Room - unique experience as we were right next to head chef masterminding meals - occasionally loud but to be expected with that seating arrangement.
Great service and food was phenomenal.
The service and food were wonderful. It is rather loud inside the restaurant. I suggest turning the music down.
Food and service was great. Would recommend going to eat if in the area.

So glad we found The Grill Room! We will dine here again when in Portland. The food was excellent (and the french fries were the best.) The customer service from the moment we walked in was outstanding and our server Claire really took great care of us.
It was so good we ate there two nights in a row. Rib eye was amazing along with the French onion soup

Our experience here was very good and all of our entrées were delicious! Our waitress was very attentive and pleasant. I really don’t have any complaints other than the booths we sat in tend to be somewhat uncomfortable. Maybe some seat and back pads would help.

We have been to the grill room before and was very disappointed.  The rib eye steak was all fat and charred with liquid smoke. The beets were supposed to be roasted but they were greasy and tasted awful. The dessert sounded great ...vanilla ice cream with maple syrup and pecans was butter pecan from the grocery store.  Cross The Grill Room off your list
Given the cost of the meat, portion size was astonishingly small. Just be prepared!
I went here for an anniversary and the staff at the restaurant made me and my fiancé feel very special. We felt well taken care of through the entire night and the food was delicious.

Don’t bother!  Booked our reservation almost a month advance and when we got there we were told that they were overbooked and didn’t have the chefs table we requested and held with a credit card!  They didn’t even have the decency to let us know in advance so we could book somewhere else.

Rude service at the hostess station so we left.  

I had to answer all of the questions to leave a review, obviously I didn’t have a chance to eat any food.
A cold draft was significant when the entry door was opened at our table. Scallops were not cooked to our liking and had to send them back. All other food was great.
Excellent server and ambiance.  Most dishes were quite good, except the tuna entree which was mushy and poorly served.  Our table was directly in front of the door, so we were cold the entire meal.
Great apps, sides, deserts and drinks.  Grilled items had char, if you enjoy it, you will enjoy the grilled items.

Steak was charred to a crisp on one side and barely touched the grill on the other. Ordered medium rare, served medium well. Overall really awkward encounter after I showed the server, kind of a “what do you want me to do about it?” response. Mostly just sad that I don’t feel they are serving to their old standards. I really hope most people have a better experience than we did. C’est la vie.
The food was excellent! Steaks and scallops cooked perfectly.

This place had amazing food! But it was very noisy and a little cramped. Very pricey but the food was so amazing it was worth that. Though it took about an hour and a half to get our main dishes. Though with all of that said, I would go again for a special occasion.

The steak was great and the staff made sure you were pleased with the temperature.  We sat at the counter (the only seating available) and it was fun to watch and interact with the staff.  Great meal, fun evening.

The Grill Room steaks are always superb, but both the mashed potatoes (which were thick, in some places very dry/stringy), and the broccolini was simply cold and way undercooked.   Our bang bang shrimp, although flavorful were somewhat grainy as well. 

Drinks and wine were quite good, as was the service.
Another outstanding dinner at The Grill Room! Great food, service, and atmosphere. Love it
We loved Eric!

Hadn’t been to Grill Room in 3 years!
The food was amazing!
Our waiter Matt was very good!!
Will be going back soon 😎

Hadn’t been to Grill Room in 3 years!
The food was amazing!
Our waiter Matt was very good!!
Will be going back soon 😎
Delicious ribeye - cooked just right with all the trimmings!  Wonderful old-school steak-house feel.  Really enjoyed the evening.  Thank you for the anniversary champagne!

We ordered an appetizer each. When was a green salad, that was fine. The other was escargot, they served it with grilled baked bread in the butter, they used to put on the bread was rancid. As a chef, I know rancid butter when I taste it. The escargot had no flavor to it whatsoever. Our steaks arrived. We ordered ribeyes, medium rare. We were asked to cut them to make sure that they were done to our liking. They were very very rare in the middle, and we sent the bat to be grilled again. When they came back with the ribeyes, they were black from being burned. It really ruined the flavor of the ribeye, but they were done medium rare. It’s been a year since we’ve been to this place and we went back to see how it is. It was the same last year, and it hasn’t changed this year. Displays could be a premium steakhouse if they just knew how to cook a steak
Didn't have table ready til 25 minutes after our reservation. Food came out at different times. Overall was very disappointed
Had to speak very loudly to hear because everyone else had to speak loudly to hear. Busy and loud, but excellent service and excellent food.
Great food and service.  Liked the ala cart options.  Atmosphere was cozy but it was very loud.
We sat at the chef's counter and had a wonderful time and excellent food.
Food and drinks are spot; a little pricey but delicious!

I mean I've had better rib eye but it was still good...maybe not for $55.  Would I go back?  Yes.  The beurre blanc sauce was my fave followed by the zippy and the truffle fries were to die for!  Brussels were good as well as the carrots.  Started with the wedge which was super cheesy and creamy.  I had a few sips of the sweater weather cocktail and that was delish!  Overall we were all satisfied and had a fun time!!

Food superb as usual, server seemed short and irritated.
First experience with less than stellar service at The Grill…..disappointing for a $500 meal
Always great food, service and atmosphere.

Me and my two guests were disappointed in the meal preparation. The mounds of fries that accompanied the featured meal piece were a distraction to the expected presentation and, actually, the taste of the meal. 
Consequently the value of the meal was questioned.

This was our second time here. The service is always exceptional. Sadly, the food is just okay. Salads are good, but our steaks were undercooked, the lobster risotto was crunchy and had very little, overcooked lobster. We were asked to cut our steaks down the middle, which is just wrong. A steakhouse should not need you to check the temp of your steak, not to mention cutting down the middle creates two medallions that will quickly dry out and overcook if they need to be refired. It was a busy Saturday night, so maybe just an off experience.
Excellent experience
Excellent service, atmosphere. Food was outstanding. A little pricey for our budget but it was a special occasion.
The food , service and ambulance were great!
This place was fantastic! The service was amazing. The food was outstanding I highly recommend to all my friends and family
Great menu with lots of choices. The duck was very chewy so disappointing. The bartender was fun. Was very, very loud. So not a good date night location

We really enjoyed our experience at the Grill Room. Our server, Matthew D. was excellent.  My husband's NY strip was perfect.  He would have liked more garlic in the escargot,  otherwise they were delicious.  Salads and carrots were great. The salmon was charred too much and too underdone for my taste and I hesitated to send it back to have it cooked more and as I expected,  it came backmore charred but cooked ok. I could not recommend the salmon.  Everything else was wonderful and we would definitely go back.
Great dinner! Everything taste incredible. Great service.
One of the best dining experiences I’ve ever had. Absolutely have to get the bone marrow! The food was a 10/10 and the staff was right up there with it!
This is our second time to the Grill Room, and the staff are incredibly kind and welcoming, the ambiance is nice, and the food is outstanding (both taste and presentation).
I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and the dinner was awesome! We shared the Tomahawk and it was incredible. We will be back!
Everything was fantastic! You can always count on exceptional food at the Grill Room.  The service is also impeccable.
We love this place! The Steak and Cheese salad is fabulous! We love to take our family here for special occasions!
Great food, fun music, sweet and attentive waitress, the food was perfectly cooked and drinks were fun and yummy!  We'll be back! Thank you!

I took my wife out fur our anniversary, and made mention when booking the reservation. We were greeted with a happy anniversary and provided with 2 glasses of complimentary champagne. 

The food was just amazing. I may have even enjoyed the amazing vegetables more than my perfectly cooked and seasoned filet. Definitely in my top 5 Portland restaurants.

Drink special was delicious, refreshing and well balanced. Food was cooked well but was not seasoned properly; we used a dash of the table salt served with the bread and it made all the difference. The meal was good but not memorable and sadly not worth the price. Service was great, very attentive and accommodating.

The Grille Room was fabulous! We had excellent bar service and the drinks were amazing. Our waitress was friendly and very helpful and she provided us with excellent service. The shrimp appetizer was just right and our main course ( tuna & steak) melted in your mouth!
We had a great night - we sat at the chef’s counter which is always fun!  My husband’s steak was a bit over cooked, but my salmon was delicious!  We had a wonderful date night and will be back!
Shawn was awesome! Had a great time
Excellent all around.  Great music also 🙂  sat at chefs counter. It was awesome
Our waiter was great, food and drinks were amazing

Great atmosphere.  Lively bar.  Great decor.  Rib Eye and Duck entrees could not have been better.  The rib eye was perfectly grilled and full of flavor.  Duck melted in your mouth.  I hate to downgrade the food or service but the errors were too big to overlook.  If you serve risotto, I expect it to be properly cooked.  The lobster risotto came out significantly undercooked (hard).  Worse, the waiter stated the chef wants the risotto to be crunchy.  What?  $25.00 for hard risotto?  Then the waiter suggested a sauce for the duck that made no sense.
Excellent place to have drinks and a meal. Food was perfectly done and very tasty. Great location and near parking. We will be back soon.
It was great!

Great menu, consistent food quality and nice presentation. Good customer service.
We HAD found that the food quality had gone downhill over the last 6 months but decided to give it another chance and we were pleasantly surprised. We will be back.
Quality of steak not good enough to justify the price
Great food and service. Steaks perfectly cooked. Fun dinner location.
It’s very loud

We were heading to an event, so had an early reservation. When we entered, the music was blasting. We were led to a table directly under a speaker so asked for another table and were accommodated. Server was excellent and attentive. Caesar salads were very good. The tuna was exceptionally good. The calamari was only fair and not finished. The risotto was bland. As we were waiting for our meals, the music got even louder - Gimme Shelter by The Rolling Stones!!  We asked our server if the volume could be turned down. He said he’d ask the chef. It was turned off, thankfully. Bottom line - some good and some not so good scores for our experience.

Everything was good, but it was just too loud. We were 4 in a booth and could barely hear one another. This was a business dinner. If I was there with friends (I have some very loud friends), then I might have appreciated the decibel level more.
Excellent meal, solid waiter, great time.

Had friends in town and wanted reservations somewhere in the Old Port. They had the time we wanted but didn't know what to expect. WE LOVED IT. The ambiance was great, the martinis rocked, and the steaks were cooked to perfection. We'll definitely be adding it to our rotation of great restaurants in Portland.

We were seated promptly, the server was trying very hard to upsell.  The Prosecco for my brothers birthday was nice.  The mussels were delicious.  From then on it goes downhill, both my brother and my husband’s steak was so charred  they were inedible.  My sister-in-law and my scallops were refreshed and tasted metal, again inedible.  It was an awesome restaurant before COVID.  Now I would not recommend it to anyone.
Amazing filet w/ a large amount of mashed potatoes & carrots! Highly highly recommend
Food and service were fantastic. We highly recommend and will return when in Portland.
As always exceptional meal great crowd and awesome service. Really appreciate how rocksolid this restaurant is.
Seating very tight. Loud. Menu good. Wood fired items. Drinks great. Loved appetizers . Very busy
Fun atmosphere. Large portions. Great location. Server was excellent. Overall and fun night out.
Enjoyed a great meal while touring through New England.  Great meal!
Excellent food and even better service. Definitely recommend to anyone visiting Portland!
Very good place to eat on our vacation

Before you step into the door of The Grill Room, you have no idea you will find a vibrant, hopping restaurant.  The hub-bub makes it noisy so don't expect an intimate setting, but the filet, rainbow trout and sides were all outstanding.  It's hard to find a perfectly cooked rare steak, but it was crusted on the outside and just right on the inside.  And the wait staff had me check it before they left the table after serving it.   Staff was attentive, portions were generous.  We've added this place to our rotation of regular date nights.

The reservation was easy
Staff was amazing!
The food and drinks were amazing!!
Amazing food with a great atmosphere. Service was great!
The restaurant was extremely loud - we couldn't hear eachother talk.  The food is mediocre for the price.
We enjoyed our experience.  Food, drinks and service were outstanding !!!

We were in Portland as newlyweds and decided to try someplace new to us. Stumbled upon this place and decided to give it a go. We sat at the chefs counter and got to see all the action. Our server Claire was attentive and personable. Answered all our questions about the menu and made some great recommendations. We started with the beef tartar and escargot both of which were delicious. For the mains we split the trout and sirloin and they knocked it out of the park. Everything was fresh, seasoned and cooked perfectly and we got a birds eye view. We will certainly be back. Thanks for a great meal.
Our waiter was fantastic and the food was great!  It was very noisy otherwise it would easily be 5 stars.

Excellent service and excellent food. Our server Tiffany was very informative and provided great service. I'd recommend anyone that is staying in Portland to check this place out. It was the best experience we had while visiting.

It was my wife's birthday and what a great choice for dinner.  The Ribeye was one of the best I've ever had and my wife's Filet Mignon was incredible. The complimentary  dessert with a candle on top was a welcoming touch.  We are both looking forward to our next visit.

Alanna our server was Amazing! She's the Epitome of what I'd expect from a 5-Star restaurant. 

Thank You, Alanna

Ed

Great ambiance and food. We got the oysters and the horshradish sauce was so fresh and delish. We also got the tuna tatare and the ribeye entree and the filet with fries. All was cooked to what we asked for. Do be prepared for a lot of food and to leave full. The spicy broccoli was very spicy so bw careful if dont love spice but it was tasty and flavorful if you can handle heat. Will definitely go back.
Steaks were perfect; sides were generous but the blue cheese fondue was a little too generous.

EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING.  We went there for our anniversary (our only night in Portland) and the food was extremely disappointing. The filet was very undercooked (ordered medium rare), to the point where is was simply not edible.  The mashed potatoes were dry and the flavor was bland. The Caesar salad starter was the only good thing about the meal, however, we were told there were not anchovies on it, but it had a couple large anchovies. The Management removed the entre from our bill, but at that point, it was too late and our anniversary dinner was ruined.  We had been the year prior and the meal was better but the French onion soup had a funky taste. Also, they typically have a gourmet burger, but it appears they have changed the bun (which previously was a nice dark house made bun), and the overall appearance did not look as good, so we did not order that which was also disappointing. Just extremely disappointed in the food which had a big negative impact on our anniversary celebration.
Food was great, charming atmosphere.

Extremely noisy, definitely an upscale bar ambience. Very crowded and tables were right on top of each other. The lighting was very poor and many tables were using their phone flashlight just to read the menu.  My steak was cooked perfectly but came to the table cold. My husband did not enjoy the short ribs special. We will not be returning as the enjoyment to expense ratio was outlandish! Very expensive. We were certainly glad to leave.

Sad for us. Made a reservation. Over a week before yet they gave us a small table crammed in way next to open grills and smoke etc. We asked to sit at one of the many open tables ..it was early so many empty tables. She said NO.  I asked why she wouldn’t tell us. NO we could not have another table except on patio.  
I asked if we had to designate a specific table when making a res. She said NO. 
SO WE DIDNOT UNDERSTAND why we could not sit anywhere but next to fire pit grill. 😱
It was sad for us and a VERY expensive sad time.  Sean was wonderful and helped a bit.
Excellent place to dine, great service and atmosphere.
We sat at the Chef's Counter and what a unique experience to see the kitchen work so seemlessly!! Highy recommended and incredible food!!  Cheers to the chefs!
Food and atmosphere were great.  Our server was attentive and friendly.  Will definitely eat here again.
This is what a steak house should be! Great atmosphere, delicious food perfectly prepared, and our server Ryan was fantastic. Highly recommend!

Birthday trip to Kennebunkport from Cape Cod spent a day trying to find an equal to Capital Grill and was presently surprised at 
The quality of service and good. I highly recommend nothing else like it in this part of the state.

If you’re on the fence, jump it! This was arguably the best dinner we’ve ever had. Couldn’t be happier with the experience from the service, to the meal, and everything in between. If we could give more than 5 stars we would!
Excellent food!
Food was very good. It is incredibly loud. Not only the din of talking but music over the top. Other than that a much higher rating.

Incredible meal! Wonderful service. Treated us wonderfully. We were celebrating both our birthdays so we wanted to go out for a special night. The grill room exceed our expectations beyond our wildest dreams. Thank you for an amazing night!
Great place for meat lovers! We went for a nice date night, and thought it was pretty good. Some of the sides were just ok, but ingredient quality and service was excellent!

We dined at The Grill Room for our 15th anniversary.  Tyler, our waiter, was exceptional--professional, knowledgeable, kind.  Brought us complimentary champagne.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars to the food was because my filet needed to be returned 3 times.  I asked for "medium-well"; third time was the charm!  The food and bearnaise sauce were delicious!  We had a wonderful time, and I would definitely recommend this restaurant in the heart of the Old Port.

Our waiter was absolutely brilliant.
We were not rushed.
He just knew when our glasses needed to be refilled.
When to put in our entrées.
We sat in our booth for 3 hours and enjoyed every moment.

The waitress was quite short tempered and was annoyed by everything - including us wanting to put in our food order at the same time as our drink order...after waiting 25min for her to even stop by. The mushroom risotto was dry and had no flavor. The tuna steak was cold. The restaurant is always very loud. Eaten there many times and usually always good. Was very disappointed this time.

aps. before drinks?, 20 min. after aps. drinks finally arrived, main courses a full hour after that....everything needed seasoning, quail was grey w/ no crisp, beans raw, forgotten sides all for 350 bucks!

over all it was a nice night out, the servis was out standing you can tell the whole crew work very well together at the grill room! Our main server was attentive kind and personable, he definitely made up for the" just good food" he was very knowledgeable about the food,wine and cocktails he mentioned he is also a bar tender there so that's always a plus when it came to drink recomdentaing, wine list was interesting, would have loved to see. Bordeaux by the glass but they had a good few glass that would have paired well. Food over all could have been alittle more elevated  in tast and in execution with the price point, alittle more attention to blance like we ordered the calamari and only got like 5 pice of squid the rest was fired veg. The grill room could totly be a stand out steak house if they just bumped up the level of creativity and execution as of right now for us it ranks as a traditional steak house(witch would be fine at a lower price point ) we will definitely go back to try other menu itims that look interesting , it's always possible we picked some of there "safer" choices ! Again it was a great night over all!
First time back since the pandemic hit. Our 49th wedding anniversary seemed like a good time to make a reservation at the chefs counter. The food was superb and the staff went above and beyond.
Food was good but duck was very rare when asked for medium well and salmon was medium rare when asked for “cooked through”. Very loud also. Very nice wait staff.
I ordered the ribeye as I have done many times. This time there was a lot of fat and gristle so it was difficult to cut. The taste was very good, however. Service was superior.
The food was great on the pricey side but is what i expected. Will be back
Great steak house and lively vibe.

Our first visit in Portland ! We were told by friends to try this place! We’re happy with our choice!! Service was excellent! Portions are soooo big, could not eat all! Will be back for sure!  Our waitress was so nice, can’t remember her name but she is from Fort Kent and she will surely remember the French Canadian couple! 😊
Loved the Salmon!  Food was fresh and delicious. Great beer and wine selection.  Great neighborhood spot!!

Neighborhood place, think it's under new management so we thought we'd give it a try again. We all enjoyed our meals (steak frites, smash burger and a lobster roll). All were tasty, all came with good french fries, service was good. Definitely in the rotation for a casual dinner and beer again.
Smells like a pub- (spilled beer), so expectations were a bit low, but service was amazing, food was excellent!  Wish it was cleaner, but we were pleasantly surprised.

The food was great, but it was an extremely hot night and the air conditioning was not working well.  However, I will say the manager brought a fan closer to our table which made the dining experience so much better.
Great casual dining place with good selection of beers !

Appreciated being able to make a reservation for dining outdoors on a busy Saturday evening. Sitting on the sidewalk, you'll enjoy people-watching. Outstanding meals--better food than we remembered from previous visits and better than anticipated: main courses of mushroom risotto and steak frites, perfectly cooked. The wine pours were generous, the service fine. Nice to get away from Commercial Street (we're local). Recommend.
Great evening to sit outside at Little Tap House. Excellent appetizers of roasted Brussels Sprouts and focaccia. Beet salad with chicken was perfect.
Love this gem of a restaurant!  Food always delicious, service from host , server and bartender outstanding!
Food was surprisingly very tasty, a tad expensive.

The food was served hot.  Sounds like a given,  but too often food in restaurants is served warm at best.

Waitress seemed a bit inexperienced but made up for it with a great service, great attitude and personality.

Mussels were good, noise level was very high at 6pm, making it hard to converse.
High top seating was a little uncomfortable with no where to put your knees due t the barrels.

The Little Tap House is occasionally excellent and always reliably good. We've never had a bad meal or any kind of bad experience there. Excellent service, nice space, good food, good drinks. A menu on which I'd imagine most people could find something appealing to eat. We will return.
Food was great, service was friendly, and ambience casual and cozy. Convenient location!
Great tavern-like restaurant with nice ambiance, great service, very good food and choices without steep prices. Lively enough to be fun but not too loud. Would go again.

Tasty Lobster rolls, nice local beer selection, friendly service.  Very near the art museum, and a few blocks away from rhe hubbub of Fore street or Commercial, which makes for a quite pleasant walk in good weather.  A bit pricey for a pub, but this is a touristy town.

Very good cocktails and food. Relaxed environment. Tables/chairs, hi-tops (barrel style), seats at the bar.. So close to Cross Arena, art gallery, etc. Would definitely return and hope for different server. We were trying to make an event nearby and server was not very attentive, long wait to place our order, get drinks, get check, etc. It all worked out. Parking available on street and/or parking garage a 2-5min walk.

On a damp, chilly night, after a day of gallery hopping and film viewing, dining at this cozy spot is perfect. There is nearby parking, it’s quiet when dining early, the service is very warm and friendly. My smashburgrr and my husband’s  salmon were well prepared and very well seasoned. It’s relaxing to dine here and we hope that you’ll love it too!
Great pub lunch; our group enjoyed the fish & chips, mushroom risotto, and steak frites.  Attentive and friendly service staff!
Food was delicious and service was attentive and friendly!!

This is based on my 1st and only experience at the restaurant so far, and I would definitely like to go back.  The food was absolutely delicious, and there are so many more things I want to try from the menu.  The only detractor as far as I can see at this point, is that the servers don't know the menu that well.   Our server advocated for ordering wings (with multiple sauces) with the sauces on the side.  Normally I don't think this would be an issue, but the salt N vinegar wings ended up being a tub of vinegar on the side....   that's pretty much useless!!  An educated server would advise against such an order.  Overall I would definitely go back, but I hope the kitchen staff has time to help the servers understand which dishes work certain ways, and how to guide customers accordingly.
Food and drinks were outstanding.  Our waitress helped orient us with respect to the layout of the city.  Very friendly and welcoming!

We really enjoyed our meal. Food was obviously cooked from scratch and properly done. Our waitress was pleasant and attentive. The restaurant is adorably small and charming with the old-fashioned walls and pleasant lighting. They do take reservations and I would suggest doing so given the small size of the restaurant. Also, it is important to note that the menu is more limited (but delicious) and while not mega expensive, it is on the pricier end of the spectrum.

So happy we found this gem.  This is our second time to Portland and we were excited to try some new places to eat.   Little Tap House was close to our hotel but also came highly recommended by friends who recently visited the area. The restaurant did not disappoint. The Food was outstanding and the vibe was just what we were looking for that night.  We had our 6 year old with us and it was family friendly as well.  Highly recommend and we hope to eat here again on our next time to town.
I don't get to Portland very often any more, but I would definitely eat here again, before trying somewhere new.
The food was really good. The atmosphere is pub like but not too casual. Overall, it was a great experience and I’d go back again. It didn’t seem too overpriced either. A good balance of all things.
Great service and great food, as always! Happy hour is a bonus!
I didn’t care for the food - I doubt I will be back

We arrived during Happy Hour, for dinner, before a show at the Cross Insurance Arena.  We made a reservation ahead of time, and our wait staff was great, both for seating options and for dinner.  The wait staff offered up the Happy Hour options, and even offered a taste of the non-alcoholic beverage before ordering.  They offer plenty of appetizer and meal options, and everything we ordered was great!  We would highly recommend the Little Tap House as another dining option in Portland.

Seated out back near kitchen so not much light, but at least we weren’t cold near the front door. Ordered a beet salad (it’s my go to dish when I go out to lunch) this beet salad had about four beets in it and couple walnuts. It was mostly lettuce. I would try something else if we go here again. Service was great! Very nice people.
Great food and cocktails  second time and will go back.
Cozy and inviting atmosphere. Enjoyed the yummy French onion soup on a cold December night. Great drinks, delicious beet salad and good service. A favorite spot of ours !! Never disappoints.
Excellent  - we can't wait to go back again.  Best Cesear Salad!

Our party of five was 15 minutes late and they saved our table. 
The soups were very hot as requested and my salad was lovely. Beers were as expected. 
This was the second week in a row we’ve stopped by before UMO games at the Civic Center and we’ll certainly come back!

There were 5 of us and we either had the fish and chips or the braised short ribs. We all really liked our meals though thought the breading on the fish while tasty was a little too thick. Overall quite delicious. We will definitely return
Service was great. Very disappointed that steak frites is off the menu.

Not a large food menu but certainly enough offerings.  Most importantly, our selections were excellent.  Highly recommend the Brussels sprouts small plate.  Plenty of Maine beers on tap.  Excellent drink preparation.  Attentive service, even from the maitre d'.

While the menu is limited as you will see on other reviews - this allows them to focus on what they do have on the menu. This is typically done in many High end European restaurants and in kitchens of Michelin star restaurants, so forgive the Americans complaining about the menu, as they do not know any better. They do something as simple as a Cesar salad with great care and effort that you can taste.
One of our friends we brought was laughing at how small the menu was on the way over and seemed very skeptical. By the end of their meal they said they would be back.
This doesn’t mean that the restaurant couldn’t do with a bit more variation, having weekly specials or more side options would have been nice.

Have been to Little Tap House under previous ownership.  Was consistently very good.  Under new ownership menu has shrunken somewhat and there were no nightly special.  Otherwise LTH continues to be very good
Delicious!  Highly recommend. Nice atmosphere. Friendly staff.
Everyone was so wonderful, the food was just what we wanted and it’s a very cute atmosphere. Peaches appetizer was delicious!

first time there!  went with my twin daughters to celebrate their birthday....awesome server, wish we knew his name - great service.  delicious food and 5 star all around - was just the evening we wanted!
Cute place. Great beer. Slow service and food.  Tasty food .  Close to State theatre.
Our group chose this place out of the blue (google maps) and were very satisfied.

Small corner gastropub in Portland. Buffalo wings are full size and excellent. Burger was decent but kind of bland if you ask me. Dessert menu is small but seems to be seasonally relevant and the pot de cremé and olive oil cake with lemon curd and blueberry was delicious. Would return if back in town
Food was excellent and the staff was very friendly and attentive. I would highly recommend this when you are visiting Portland

This place is a solid 4 for what it is and what it offers.  I might have scored it lower on ambiance if we had been seated in the main part of the dining area which is windowless, but we had a nice table next to a window.  The menu is quite limited, so check it out online ahead of time.  If you are staying at the Holiday Inn, it is about a three-minute walk, inclusive of waiting to cross the street twice.
Great beer selection. Smashburger was fantastic, staff is VERY friendly.

Very few menu choices - fried fish had tough batter and little flavor. Risotto was ok. Bill was 100, with two small glasses of wine and one cocktail on happy hour! Waitress was nice but new and not very knowledgeable. For the same price we had a 5 star dinner at Cliff House the night before.

It was our waitress’s first day, and she was phenomenal! She was very willing to help adapt my food and was super prompt in any request we had. The hostess was also phenomenal, which brings me to my point of this review. The hostess helped when we needed to adapt a drink from the bar. She suggested a drink that I’ve had many times before in other places, which was super helpful since the bartender was… less than. My husband got a drink without any adaptations, and we both agree that the drinks were completely unpalatable. We didn’t want to ask our waitress to address this, as it was quite clear that the bartender wasn’t willing to assist. We gladly paid for our drinks and dinner, but I wouldn’t go back if I had any desire for a drink with my dinner. If you want a beer, absolutely come here for food and a brew. Mixed drinks, not so much.
The food is over priced.  $27.00 for Fish and Chips. It was fried correctly but not a $27 value.

Great experience!  Menu was a bit on the small side, but everything on it sounded delicious. Our food was outstanding.  Service was friendly but spread a little too thin and was a little on the slow side - but overall, an excellent time.
Only downsides are that the "dog friendly" seat8ng is at sidewalk tables close to a busy road. Service and food were great!!

We had an amazing meal here. The mussels were so big and unbelievably tasty. Everything we ate (mussels, butter salad, steak frites and s'mores dessert) were so delicious.  Our server was incredible and so attentive.  Can't recommend this place enough.
Food was excellent. I realize it’s a pub but the noise level seemed high.
Awesome service and amaZing food!  We love it here!

Limited menu and most items are fried.
Polite, attentive wait person but getting two hamburgers took 45 minutes.
Noisy environment, made worse by being seated next to the kitchen entrance despite us having a reservation.

Staff were welcoming and service was attentive. They easily accommodated my wheelchair! Food was delicious. Server forgot one drink order, and the noise level could have benefited from some dampening, but I enjoyed the experience very much and will be returning.

Not an extensive menu, but something for everyone, leaning toward local suppliers. Delicious burgers, reasonably priced.  Solid craft beer list. Jolly server. Cozy tavern atmosphere, as name promises. Convenient to State Theater and museum of art.

I don’t know what has happened at Little Tap House.  We’ve been going there for years and it’s always been good, but last night was really disappointing.  Service was fine, but the food was not good (almost awful). ￼My wife and daughter didn’t like their dinners (shrimp tacos with very little flavor and roasted Brussels sprouts smothered in some kind of cheese, a very unusual preparation).  But, it was my mushroom risotto that was the worst.  Rather than having the Parmesan stirred into the rice, it was simply a few shavings on top of what tasted like boiled rice.  I don’t think it was even Arborio rice. It was super bland (complete opposite of what risotto should be) and had hardly any mushrooms in it.  Honestly, I feel I could have made something better from a box for $3 rather than spending $27 on this.  I really hate to be critical of a place we’ve supported and enjoyed for a long time, but last night’s meal was truly terrible. I hope the old Little Tap House comes back to life.
Great selection of Maine beers on tap.  Our group tried almost all the starters and they were great! I will definitely go back.  Great pub atmosphere and our waitress was friendly and attentive.
We had a lovely dinner before going to a show.  The food was excellent!  The service was wonderful as well!  We will definitely go again!
Food took an hour and a half. They seemed to be understaffed. Food was also cold, over cooked and just generally not good. Seems like they need some help.

We showed up for a 445 reservation. We made a reservation for a dining room table, and was put in the bar area at a high top next to a group of 8 people standing around the high top, extremely tight and uncomfortable. The host mentioned they had several people come in without reservations, so I’m assuming they gave our table up even though we showed up 3 minutes early.

We then waited 15 minutes for a server who never showed up. The hostess attempted to take our drink order, but those drinks never made it to our table. We left after almost 20 minutes and walked to down the street to another restaurant (which was great) Pretty awful experience, definitely won’t be back. I do recommend lazzari which is a 2 minutes from this place, thankfully they salvaged a bust of a date night.

Lovely Manhattan and fries were hot and crispy. The Brussels sprouts were tasty but over cooked. Double smashed burger is hearty and comforting.

Our waiter was attentive but invisible which was great so we focused on the companions.
Excellent food, drinks, and company! Loved the steak
We liked LTH so much we went back the next night. Wonderful menu, service, the whole package!

I couldn't read the menu because our table was so dark. It was hard to converse because it was so loud; not rowdy drunk loud but simply horrible acoustics. We ordered beers and apps to start and the waitress said the kitchen really prefers to have our entire order at once. We told her we weren't sure whether wanted more and she relented. The baked brie didn't taste anything like any brie we have ever had. The poutine had thin salty gravy and the fries were skinny shoestring with an off flavor. Kudos for using real cheese curd. We didn't finish either app. Saccarappa IPA & Allagash White were the stars of our visit. Easily the bottom of the list of the 6 locally owned restaurants we visited during our weekend trip.
The Little Tap house had a great atmosphere and delicious food . Great spot to stop before going to a show !
Very nice people. Food was great..waitstaff was attentive and explained everything..I’d highly recommend this place for a nice night out..

Typical pub hustle and bustle but the food was artful and so intentionally flavorful. Our waiter was excellent, as was my cherry-infused bourbon old fashioned.  Topper was the cheesecake- so creamy and full is subtle flavor.  Little Tap House is now part of our regular rotation.

My wife and I love this sleeper restaurant and bar. The cuisine is far more sophisticated than one might think when walking into what looks more like the corner pub. Many locals go there for the vibe and for the huge assortment of local craft beers, but we go there for the food along with that inviting atmosphere (and great beers!).

It was just okay. It as busy in there which was nice in off season. Food was good enough.
Got burger and fish and chips. Fries were good
Great food was terrific service was quick
We were a party of 7. Our waitress was amazing. Food was delicious but cold. Space was clean and they were able to sit us 15 minutes earlier than our reservation. Highly recommended.

Overall an enjoyable evening.  Lively crowd, great atmosphere.  Our dinners, duck special and the artic char, weren't as good as they have been in the past - but that's a first.  Our server was very nice, professional and on top of things.
Staff is friendly , food is great . Just went there twice last week and our favorites were the mushroom risotto and the leek papardelle . Also great burgers !
Great! Our only disappointment was they were out of the baked Brie.

We couldn't have received a warmer welcome! The brunch menu was on the short side but still with some terrific options.  The service was just the right amount of friendly and attentive. We'll definitely be back!
Great simple menu, cocktails we good and the service and decor were great.  We had a party of 8 and had a wonderful time and everyone loved their food.

The place is comfy and delicious. The scallops, butter salad and Brussels sprouts were to die for, and while the poutine was pretty good, it definitely could have used more cheese curds. Our food came out quickly, and the service was great. Will definitely go again next time we’re in Portland.

Experience was miserable.  45 min late seating, in the darkest dining room I have ever experienced, service was slow, mussles were dangerously undercooked and the accompanying spicy cream sauce sauce was cold, mushroom tagliatele bolognese was insultingly nasty, and the wine list was weak with nothing that complimented food at the price point this restaurant sells itself as deserving.
Food was delicious and fresh. The mussels had the best flavoring with the cilantro.I will be going back.
Love this place!  Absolutely the best burger anywhere!!!

Loved the ambience & service, a little low-light for older eyes to read the menu. The menu was disappointing in that it was so limited. We’d seen some menus online before arriving and none of the items we were looking forward to were on the menu. Great fries. Will check out the current menu better before we go again.
Wonderful food and excellent service.
The food was excellent, our waiter was efficient and friendly, and the atmosphere inside the restaurant was cozy!

Probably won’t go back, one of people in our party spent $34 for a piece of dried up halibut, thought the place was a little expensive for what you get.  If I went back it would be for a beer and a burger
Our server was exceptional! We could not have asked for a better night!
Risotto was excellent but the hamburger was tasteless. If you’re going to have such a pricey, limited menu everything should be exceptional. Disappointed.
Great little neighborhood place, with very good food and a great beer selection.
Dinner was fine.  Menu was very small.  Only about five items for main course.  Drinks were pricey $9 beer, $12 wine.  Ordered the burger which was fine but uninspiring for $21
Good, basic food - nice place
Nice neighborhood restaurant right across the street from Portland Museum of Art.

Little Tap House is the quintessential great local restaurant, reflecting the friendliness of service and the high quality of the food. The menu is short with focus rightfully placed on quality over quantity of choices. Start with a cocktail or select from a long list of beers (including lots of dark beers which I love!). Our table raved about the chowder, smash burger, hangar steak and fish tacos (special of the night). Try one of the fancy desserts to end a great meal!
Cocktails and food were delicious. We had great attentive service.

This was our second time visiting this restaurant.  I ordered the nachos and was so disappointed.  They arrived cold and I only ate a few bites. Our friends loved the burgers and the chowder was great.
We sat at a high top, giving it more of a bar feel. Limited menu but very tasty food. Staff was incredible.
Delicious food, and the service was very thoughtful. We went with a pregnant friend and they were incredibly careful about separating potential problem food. Overall a great meal, and kind people.

The Little Tap House is a great find in Portland, ME.  The ambiance is lovely and the food was delicious! We had the pretzels for an appetiser and then the lobster roll, one hot and one cold, for our dinners.  Excellent!  The staff were very attentive and friendly.

I ate here for the first time last night, and I can't say enough good things about my experience. The menu was not extensive, but everything we had (bibb salad with tomatoes/chevre and fish + chips) was outstanding. The ingredients were fresh, local, and full of flavor. We had roasted peaches with Chantilly cream for dessert - it was divine. On top of the perfectly prepared food, our server could not have been any friendlier. He was very conscientious about not rushing our courses and encouraged us to take our time throughout the meal. I will definitely be back!

Yummy spot that can cater to larger parties. We came in here 8 people deep and received awesome service and all the food was yummy!  

 The drinks were also delicious and same with the cider from Vermont! Would definitely go back here when we are in Portland again.
Very limited menu and they were out of the fish special at 7 pm on a Friday.  Good place to stop for a beer but not sure it's farm -to-table as advertised.
Place was clean, service good,food good,limited menu,little overpriced,nachos very disappointing-maybe 6 chips total, dry small portion,probably would take off menu or change recipe
Crab cakes were extremely fishy; nachos were soggy- bordering on wet..
Friendly service, delicious food, tasty cocktails!
Staff very nice, we sat outside and still the waitress visited us often to make sure we were all good.
They didn't have anything on menu that we wanted. Apparently run out of it.
Good food. Nice location. Very cold with the ac pumping.
Amazing food with a unique twist on Asian nachos. This local owned restaurant is a gem with awesome wait staff
Food fantastic, chef does a great job
Great service and food. Best fish and chips in town.

Only a half block from our Airbnb, this was a no-brainer to try. It had outside dining, but it was just off street, so we opted for inside.  After shuffling around for 10 mins, the hostess finally figured out that she actually do have a table for us.  We had a 7:15 teddy, but we were 15 mins early.  The waitress who served us was very good, juggling her outside and inside tables deftly and always with a smile.  There was no part of our dinner that was rushed or delayed.  The food was very good.  Ample serving of beef in the steak frites.  If we were to go out again for dinner, we would have gone back, but no time.  I would recommend this restaurant.
apps were average, steak came out raw in the center, I couldn't eat it.
Loved this place. Our experience was great. Service was phenomenal and food was delicious. The steak frites was amazing.

This was a great place for an early dinner before a show---right around the corner from State Theatre and an easy walk to the Merrill. Friendly and prompt service,  delicious food, and we love that you can make reservations.   We will be back!
Overall great food and experience. Highly recommended
Chris was fabulous as our server. We thoroughly Enjoyed him and had a fantastic meal outside with our dog.

Waiting 15 minutes after being seated for server to acknowledge us. Food was slow to come out and very bland. They were out of one of the entries we ordered. Drinks were not refilled. The restaurant seemed understaffed and had Avery uninspiring menu. It is a wonder they are still in business.
So comfortable!  Delicious food, lovely staff, perfect environment!

The mom and daughter team are awesome. The drinks were good and original. The food was good but not exceptional. It is a very nice atmosphere and welcoming.  Our service was a bit inattentive but i can't blame any service given short staff at every restaurant.

Reservations were for 5:15 pm outside. 
We arrived early, chose not to dine outside because of the noise and there was an odor of swill outside. 
Host accommodated us easily and we sat inside.  The room/location of our table was very nice but too warm. Could have had better a/c or air circulation. 
The wait staff was fantastic!  
House red wine during happy hour was nice. 
Drinks/beer was good. 
Food was good. A bit pricey for quality. The Scottish Egg and Cole Slaw was SUPERB!   The fish [& chips] coating was a bit too crunchy, the yogurt/cumin sauce on scallops was not particularly good and our other appetizers & entrees were just satisfactory.  Expected a bit more for the price. 
Overall a nice experience.
Good food, nice quiet atmosphere. More for locals than tourists
All was good.
The burger was incredible. Great food and atmosphere. I would highly recommend this place if you like fresh food
Fantastic and friendly service and the food was terrific. 😀

We dined at Little Tap House twice during our recent trip to Portland. Enjoyed the good food, impressive list of local craft beers and the attentive service. We highly recommend it for visitors and locals.

Brianna was a great server.  Very accommodating and attentive. The high top at which we were seated was under a pipe/vent that was leaking/sweating.which prompted me to change seats at our high top. 

Food was excellent and the meal paced nicely to allow for an enjoyable and relaxing dinner with my wife.

Lovely restaurant with friendly and attentive service. Mussels were exquisite, fresh and perfectly cooked. As expected, the lobster roll was delicious and the crispy but soft centered French fries were the perfect accompaniment. Will definitely return whenever in Portland.
Amazing food
Food was outstanding! We had Burata salad, risotto and clam chowder, and halibut. Best risotto every!

Great spot for dinner with friends! Food is exceptionally elevated, but also approachable for all guests. The 14 Maine brews on tap make tasting and trying local styles fun. They even offer beer flights. Friendly and personable staff along with a cozy interior makes this establishment a true neighborhood gem. A don't miss while in Portland!
Little Tap House is our go-to neighborhood restaurant. Get the halibut!

We live locally and had wanted to try Little Tap House for awhile. We had reservations for 7 and wanted to sit outside, 4 tables open. We were told our table was already set up inside for us. They don’t take reservations for outside after 5:30 so they weren’t reserved but okay. Server seemed stressed, probably understaffed, we ordered apps and drinks but was told we had to order our entrées at the same time. Seemed strange but okay. Limited entrée selections but we all choose fish and chips. Apps and drinks were very good but none of us cared for the entrée. We all took most of the breading off, very thick, to enjoy the fish. Maybe sitting at the bar and just getting apps and drinks if we return.
Food was excellent and so was the service. Enjoyed happy hour too great wine!
Excellent service, food and atmosphere. Haven’t been since before Covid and it is still amazing all around!
Excellent food, ambiance and service. Price and value great
The food was not as expected.  Portland usually very good restaurants.  Small menu so expected food to be the best it was ordinary.  The only taste was all the salt they use even in the coleslaw

There is just something so unbelievably charming about this cozy neighborhood restaurant. It really makes you feel like a local!

The service is warm and attentive, cocktails on point, and the food is 5 star dining without the ego. 

Tonight I had the Halibut special and learned that the Chef goes to the waterfront each morning to select and cut the fish he wants to use for the evening. There is such care and preparation in the execution of his dishes - they are truly masterpieces. (And so delicious!)

This was one of the best meals I’ve had in Portland in a long time. A do-not-miss!
Couldn't be a better place to have a meal in Portland. Great service! Great food! Great location.
Our kind of place  - small and casual. Very pleasant and accommodating staff. Great drink/beer menu. Small food menu but specials - all very very good!
Fine dining prices but not fine dining service.
We always enjoy eating here.  Our waitress was excellent.  I ordered the cold lobster roll and it was the best that I have eaten.  My wife enjoyed her burger.  We look forward to returning.

Pretty good meal. Chicken wings and lamb croquettes were the best. The server was a bit sassy and not as helpful as I think she could have been. I kindly asked her to please split my Burger in two and she said, “it’s soft enough to cut (for me to do it myself).” I really don’t know why that small courtesy is difficult to complete.  Overall, ok experience.
Chris is a wonderful server. The food is exceptional. Highly recommend the hangar steak and gnocchi.
Little tap house is our favorite spot for comfort yet fine food in Portland!!! Waitstaff, cook, and owner are awesome!
First time there and I wasn’t overly impressed with the service or the portion size of the food, especially for the cost of it. It was all pretty mediocre. Definitely a time thing for me.
Everything was amazing, our chef was Brandon.  Off the charts, awesome food and service!!!

Booked a reservation on a whim and it turned out being the best dining experience we’ve had in years! Our dinner was exceptional, the service from Nikko was *amazing*, and overall we had the best night. Would highly recommend to anyone and we will definitely be back!
This was our first time to Little Tap House and it did not disappoint.  We will certainly return in the future when we are in Portland.
A favorite when in Portland. Great spot with excellent service and food!
Service was was superfantastic. Food was delicious.
Great place to stop when going to the State Theater! Good food and great tap selection

My boyfriend and I loved the little tap house. The food was amazing and the servers were so sweet! It was our first time in Portland and they gave us so many great recommendations for bars, restaurants, and things to do!
Great little restaurant and bar.

Went for the roasted brussel sprouts - while tasty they were not what expected...... did not seem roasted at all, no crispiness, consistency was as if they had been steamed and expected blue cheese crumbles... but got a sauce instead.   Overall pretty good just fell short of expectations and the "eat drink lucky" photo that got us there.   Fantastic atmosphere

Great place for food and drink. We were immediately greeted and seated. Had a choice of bar seating, high tops or a regular table.
We ordered pasta with clams and thai chili wings. Wonderfully prepared. Had a few wines as well at happy hour prices 4PM to 6PM. Be sure to mention the happy hour request.
Outstanding service. Enthusiastic but not intrusive. Great food
Little Tap House never misses. Our server last night created a great genuine dining experience for us. I will be talking about the honeycomb in my dessert for weeks to come.

We aren't from Portland, so we found the place by happenstance because our first choice was booked. The atmosphere was cozy on a cold, rainy day. Both my meal and my wife's was very good.  The Brussel sprout appetizer was slightly underdone, but still tasty.  The service was very good. We agreed it would be nice to have a place like this near us, and we live near Portsmouth.
Food was excellent; plenty of options. The staff was extremely friendly and made the experience fun!
Fabulous food a great and friendly staff
Delicious food and excellent service! Would definitely go back.

The food and drinks were excellent, especially the risotto and the swordfish.  Our server was just the right amount of bubbly, very helpful and knowledgeable. Top notch! The vibe is fantastic and we did not feel crowded, for a very busy fairly small room.

My experience was okay. Food was average, nothing special. Kind of disappointed in the poutine. Not enough cheese curds and the gravy was very salty. They were out of the Sangria, so I ordered a specialty tequila drink and it was very strong. Service was good and the ambiance was great.
Excellent as always.
Great food! Great service! Close to State Theatre! The hangar steak is perfectly done! The smash burger is delicious. Small menu but I don’t think there is a bad choice on it!

Always a great experience at LTH - service & food always top notch.  

Would love a wider selection of beers under 5% abv
Very good experience.  We enjoyed our visit!
Food was good, but temp of the dining area was a bit overwarm, and half the table had a view of the back kitchen. Wait staff a little distracted.
Sorry for probably being the loudest table, but everything was amazing!
We had a great experience here for dinner. Very charming.

Great food, good atmosphere.
Our server was spot on!
Great happy hour specials. Service was excellent.
Great beer and food. We enjoyed the onion dip, tomato bisque, fish and chips, risotto, and cheesecake. Attentive server. Be prepared for a lively bar scene with lots of ambient noise.
I go out for creative food - I don't want what I could easily cook at home. The Little Tap room, though a bar, does incredibly well with their salads, entrees, appetizers and desserts. Very delish!

Super busy night with 3 concerts in town, but the crew handled well. Bar kept up, wait staff super friendly and accommodating. Food was quite tasty, but brie wasn't as warm and gooey as I would have liked (I think they were just hustling to get food out) but the compote with it was super tasty. Small and intimate but bigger than it looks- we will for sure be back.
Even though they were super busy, the staff was super great. The food was so SO good, and our waiter was amazing! The drinks were also top notch, we will definitely be back :)
We had a fabulous time at the Little Tap House.  The smash burger was absolutely delicious and we enjoyed a yummy cider.  Great service, too!

Little Tap House never disappoints. Consistent food, service, and vibe. Had a great time with happy hour cocktails (though the house wine was "meh"), yummy salads and a great burger. Was expecting something more for Restaurant Week -- they offered $20 bottles of wine (which I did not check out) but no food deals. Still enjoyed ourselves!
First visit to Little Tap House was marred only by the difficulty in finding parking on a winter Saturday night.  Service was sprightly; food was delicious
Excellent food and drink during a slammed Saturday night Restaurant Week.
Wonderful evening. Staff really polite and helpful. Lamb meatballs and the smash burger were great.
Date with two of my sons
Loved Little Tap House! Such a great spot for drinks and dinner. Will definitely be back. The service was awesome. Hanger steak was delisssh and the smash burger was fantastic too! Highly recommend.
One of our favorite local restaurants. The fish and chips is perfectly fried, light and crispy. Try the creamy cauliflower port salut sauce. Caesar salad was great, too! Friendly, attentive staff.
Our waitress was super friendly and attentive.  The bartender took her art seriously and was super patient with my wife's cosmo request.  The food arrived hot and delicious.
Great little place, excellent service, but they had run out of half the limited menu so a bit challenging for our group to all find something.

The food was great. The staff is very kind and attentive.  Our waiter was amazing, very knowledgeable and funny. 
We really enjoyed ourselves.
The entire evening was outstanding and our server was amazing even with her hiccup on the wine bottle opening.

My husband and I had our first date at Little Tap House and we make a point of returning frequently for special occasions and casual Wednesdays. The food is consistently excellent, the service always feels warm and personable. I look forward to our next meal there.
We both enjoyed delicious meals and excellent service. The drinks were also quite good.
Awesome experience as always. Definitely get the Buffalo chicken wings!

Entering The Little Tap Room cemented our decision that moving to Maine was a perfect decision. Love this Portland gem. The cocktails are excellent and the service is superb.  
OK let’s talk food. The share choices are terrific. Do not miss the calamari. My husband loved the fish and chips and my burger was terrific. 
Don’t miss this when you are in Portland.
Great service and food! Love this neighborhood gem

Went to LTH for dinner a few nights ago with a few friends and it was quite the dining experience. I wanted to find a place with good food, cocktails, and service and I left feeling like I nailed my selection.  Our waiter (forgot his name….sorry man) was outstanding.  Super professional while being extremely attentive, all while not making us feel rushed at all. This is the perfect spot if you want a top-tier dining experience with the comfort of a pub-style atmosphere and withOUT the stress of feeling like you’re in a fine dining environment.   CHECK IT OUT! They have a nice little patio in the summer too!
Love this place! Always amazing food and fantastic service. My new fav.

Great steak and frites! The chocolate mousse was so well made and accompanied by fresh ingredients to bring texture and flavor.
The owner and server serviced and made us feel so welcome.
1/27/22
Charming decor, fine food, great service, and all without pretense.  A warm, wonderful experience on a cold, cold winter night.
Delicious food and tasty beer selection. Will be coming back for more!

We loved Little Tap House! This is a gem in the edge of the Old Port and the West End. Just off the beaten track so as to be more of a local feel. Our food was superb quality, as in a very good chef, but at pub prices. Very highly recommended.
New Year’s Day brunch. Steak and eggs were fantastic!
Excellent food and service, will be back
Great food and awesome service!
Great food and atmosphere

Hostess and waitress were wonderful, friendly & attentive. 
I had the West End Mimosa which was absolutely delicious and yummy apps The roasted garlic Panisse were definitely a hit and a good shareable. Hubby got the Bitterballen. For our entrées I had the burger which was juicy and flavorful and more than I could finish. Husband got the Icelandic cod and he cleaned his plate.  We highly recommend LTH.
So lovely and cozy!

The staff was extremely friendly yet professional and prompt 
The food was yummy and the ambiance so warm and cozy. We loved it.

Great food with local craft beer and full bar  in a lively upscale pub setting right across from the museum. A must stop.  Our server Mel was very friendly and knowledgeable. The owner Lea (sp?) was engaging with the customers. A true hidden gem in Portland.
Great server and fantastic food.  Mussels and salads were delicious

Food was delicious, service was excellent. It would have been helpful coming from out of town to better understand if the restaurant expected or required masking in advance. It was a pleasant gem close to where we were staying and will definitely be back!
The food was just okay. The service was great.
Had the lobster Mac and cheese…delicious. Husband had the cod which he said was superb. First time here but not the last. Great local beer choices
Fabulous wings!
Service was awesome. Food was ok
The servers were very attentive and the food was extremely tasty and exceptionally well presented. We will definitely go again.
Of all the restaurants in the greater Portland area, this is by far one of our favorites!
Service was great, food was okay . Wish they had more choices on their menu . Cocktails were yummy! The Back nine beverage is delicious!
Way way over priced and insane small portions
We arrived in Portland for Thanksgiving weekend and enjoyed our meal! Service was excellent as was the food!

Every year we make an annual trip to Portland, ME the weekend before Thanksgiving and this year we did one of our dinners at The Little Tap House. Ambiance was fantastic, service was prompt and attentive, and the food did not disappoint. The menu is relatively small, but each item was great.
Potato soup was gummy.
First time there; it was a very pleasant experience. Friendly and prompt service; food was excellent.
Excellent service and good! This will be a regular haunt.

My husband and I went there after a long day of traveling. The restaurant was a close walk to our hotel and when we arrived we were seated immediately. That was the best part of our whole dining experience. We ordered Mussels ( fair)  very little broth but how in a town that prides itself on its seafood can you go wrong? We decided to get the Sloppy Joe sliders and Gnocchi. When the food arrived ( we waited way to long), My husband took one bite of the sloppy joes ( should name them sloppy nots) and made a face. My husband has the worst palate and eats pretty much everything, so seeing his face I was surprised. I asked what was wrong and he said it tasted like the chef dumped an entire container of salt in the food. I tasted it was gritty and full of salt.  He said he could not eat it. My Gnocchi was awful as well. It had a thick brown glaze that tasted like a very umami flavor gone wrong. The waitress tried to fix it by replacing it with a squash risotto. That was a mistake. The tiny squash boat thing was filled with an uncooked wet risotto that had the worst honey, syrupy drizzle that made it taste like a candy corn that had melted on top of it. The owner came over and acted like we were annoying her and would not even adjust our dining. We left hungry a hundred dollars poorer and annoyed. DO not go there go to the diner next door.

Super cozy space. Menu was limited and the portions were smaller than we'd expected. The meal was fine and we enjoyed our time there but wouldn't be compelled to return the next time we're in Portland. Nice selection of draft beers/ciders.

Great place! First time, went with three others and we all loved our food. The waitress was fabulous, as were all the staff. Great ambiance, interesting menu. Going back next weekend with friends coming from out of town. Definitely a bright spot in Portland's downtown.

We had dinner here on a Saturday evening. The place was busy but not packed. To my delight, there were no TV screens within sight of my chair.
The bar is fun-size when it comes to spirits, but this restaurant IS all about the beer...
Our server was very friendly and our dishes came out in good time. My companions enjoyed their dinners. I found my mussels lacked the rich flavor I'd hoped for in the broth (which was almost absent). 
All in all, this place is a beer-lovers haven with a casual vibe that lifts it above pub level.
Food was delicious although portions a bit on the small side.
Great cocktails and went with several appetizers to share, which turned out to be the way to go. Ended the night with a chocolate dessert that was perfect.
Food was great! The service wasn’t. Our sever was very anxious and awkward, struggled to explain the specials, and didn’t check back with us all at. The experience e made us feel uncomfortable.
Mel provided outstanding service and the food was served hot and fresh.
Waitress was phenomenal!

All food was under seasoned, Poutine fries undercooked, bland and minimal gravy, approx 8 cheese curds. Table next to use had the same experience and sent it back. Gnocchi was minimal sized and plated oddly to showcase the small amount for some reason.

We used to be residence of Portland and always LOVED little tap house. Their food is always incredible and the ambience is just the perfect level of quiet and bustling. We visited again after a few years away and we had such an incredible experience. It's a small spot and we made a reservation for 4 (this is the max reservation number on open table). Last minute two friends were in town and they asked to join. Little Tap House went above and beyond to accommodate on a very busy night for them. Service was great, food was excellent and we can't recommend them enough!
Amazing service, food, and beer
