Food and service was great!  Very noisy but that was to be expected.

We went based on the recommendation of some friends and we were not disappointed. We had made a reservation thru Open Table and got seated right away. Our server Mel (Melissa) was bubbly, informative, and efficient. All 3 of us got something different and everyone was happy with their meal. When we had finished, Mel made a point of telling us to stay as long as we wanted - there was no rush to flip our table and shove us out the door. All in all, this was a pleasant dining experience and I would definitely go back again!
Our waitress was amazing!

We really enjoyed our time at the Little Tap House. The cocktails were the highlight of the night with their house infused liquors. My friends really enjoyed their squash risottos. My gnocchi was very yummy but was was served lukewarm: maybe it sat a bit too long as our server told us the kitchen was backed up that night? However, I would definitely return to the Little Tap house next trip to Portland!
Fantastic food and service
Beautiful setting, outstanding service and delicious food!!

AMAZING!!   I wish I lived around the corner so I could dine here at least once a week.  Impeccable service (wait staff works as a team...super efficient and everyone pleasant).   Every bite of what we ordered was scrumptious!!  Best mussels I've ever had, by far!  Fish and chips were divine as were the brussel sprouts.  My cocktail (an old fashioned) was clearly made with love.     Thank you to everyone involved in making my dinner experience a true highlight of my visit to Portland!!

Hostess and waitstaff were lovely. Bang Island Mussels were incredible, plump and flavorful. Still dreaming about them. Chicken with bread pudding was amazing, very rich. The Prosecco and Gin drink specials were also wonderful.
We were thrilled to be able to eat again at a restaurant we have loved on other visits to Portland
Great cozy ambience.
great spot, we will certainly visit again! Good food and beer selection. Parking access was also easy! A surprise in Portland.
Love everything about this place! So happy it survived the last year and a half!

On my first visit here since its reopening, I was reminded why I always liked this place. Friendly staff, attentive service. Wide selection of local craft beers although my friend and I both chose wine that night. (Mistake: wines are mediocre.) I had mushroom gnocchi which was excellent. Prices have jumped since pre-pandemic times but that’s true everywhere. Enjoyed the dinner.
Wonderful food!

This restaurant was a terrific find. My husband's short rib, & my duck breast were wonderful. Perfectly cooked, beautifully sauced. My duck was accompanied by a braised(?) radicchio/hazelnut that was amazing. An assortment of craft beers on tap, along with a carefully curated wine list made for a really lovely evening.

The menu on the Open Table website is completely different from the menu at the restaurant.  So if you decided to dine there based on the menu, you are out of luck.  The food was delicious, but the gnocchi portion was tiny and a hefty $23.00.  Yes, for a small portion of pasta.

Had a lovely evening. Very attentive wait staff. Food was good - had the spare ribs a little too salty for me and fat not trimmed well - but overall everything was great. A pleasant evening shared with my daughter. Thank you.

Our first time at the Little Tap House, recommended by a new acquaintance.  What a wonderful experience!  Very accommodating staff, quick and very friendly service and the food was excellent! We definitely recommend this restaurant and will be sure to return.
A great spot for an early Saturday dinner. A nice menu with plenty of choice, very good food and superb service make this a winner.
Fantastic food, service & atmosphere! We would highly recommend.

The name is misleading.  This should be called “amazing food house”. Yes the beer was good but the food was exquisite!  We ate the mussels and then took turns drinking  the liquor that was left behind them. Everything was on point and we couldn’t have been happier sitting at a table on the sidewalk eating such delicious food.
Excellent dinner! Highly recommend!

Booked this spot because of the menu on Open Table. Got there and did not have the menu items  we wanted.  Service was iffy, but another young lady, who was not waiting on us, took great care of us.  Also ran out of the beer that we ordered, so just a few disconnects.  Smash burger was good.
Food is pretty overpriced in my opinion. Cool spot for a drink though.

Again perfection. Little Tap was perfect for my husband’s birthday celebration. The scallop share dish was excellent and the cocktails sublime. The special monkfish was terrific, and he loved the fish and chips. I must say your Apple Tarte should stay on the menu. Thanks for a terrific evening.
Great place, good food & beer! Wonderful service.

Love LTH! The risotto stuffed delicata squash was off the charts delish! Despite being what appeared to be the only one on table duty, our server Eric (?) was fantastic. We never felt neglected and our food arrived hot, timely, and tasty. A little odd that nobody was wearing masks (except us) given it’s required at so many places throughout Portland right now. But we did our thing and enjoyed the evening.  Note that noise level is very high. Overall a fabulous night out!

Absolutely amazing dinner. Visiting for the weekend to see my brother at college and happened to grab a reservation at this place after failing to get a table at another restaurant. Little did we know that we should have just gone to the Little Tap House right at the beginning. Everything we could have hoped for. It was special and delicious without being so uppity that we were out of our comfort zone. Excellent service from our waiter Aaron who was doing the work of ten thousand men and absolutely killing it. Drinks were generous and went down easy, and the dessert was almost illegal with how good it was. Plates were well crafted and everybody at the table cleared their plates. 10/10 would recommend, and we’ll keep this place in mind for future visits.

Seated right away and service was great. Food on the higher end of prices and serving sizes were on the small side. Even though a rather small selection of dishes, many unique offerings, everything was delicious.
Very nice atmosphere—very friendly and food was great!
Another exceptional experience with amazing food and outstanding service. Always a favorite!

Even though we confirmed our reservation via Open Table the day before, we arrived at the Little Tap House to find it “temporarily closed”. Apparently it didn’t occur to anyone at Little Tap House to inform Open Table.
This was a terrific find. The service was superb. The cocktails were perfectly mixed. Loved the warm goat cheese and the petit Cesar salad was excellent. Don’t miss the duck. Wow.
Great food and excellent service

A totally positive experience.  It was a very hip place with great energy, but chill enough for grandparents to thoroughly enjoy as well.  Wait staff were attentive and efficient, food was perfect and atmosphere was relaxed.  We will definitely return, but after the taps have been fixed so we can sample more delicious beers.
Cute place, great food!  Unfortunately the day I went they were having issues with their tap and only had cans.
Food was amazing and our server, Emma, was the best!
Nice little neighborhood restaurant. Simple menu but everything done well. Attentive service.
Amazing food and fabulous service!

Dinner was great excellent mussels.Wife said duck was best she has had.Blueberry desert was fantastic.Good beer on tap.Our waiter was fantastic had great conversation with aaron.Would highly reconmend.
Great salmon and fish snd chips. Attentive service - would return !
I liked the atmosphere, the menu is small but that may be due to COVID? Not sure, but not having very many choices is why I am giving it 4 stars.
Terrific night out
Great service as always! :)
Loved it here. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Food is delicious! Will definitely go back!
Lovely neighborhood restaurant with a quality menu excellently prepared and warm friendly service
Excellent service, great beer selections, and incredible seafood and appetizers!
Great Food, Great ambiance we had so much fun and enjoyed everything!

Always amazing! Lee and Bri are fabulous! We always enjoy a great meal, tasty drinks and a fun lively atmosphere. Whether entertaining friends or for a weeknight nosh, it’s our neighborhood go-to. Highly recommend!
Excellent service
This was the last place we dined before Covid shut everything down. Happy to say that things are great as ever. Food and service both great! Everyone was so friendly. Highly recommended!
What a great experience. Food was Amazing as was the service. I was so happy that they re-opened after C-19. We’ve never had a bad experience here

Friendly and informal setting. We opted to sit outside so traffic made it a bit noisy but that was our choice. Every single staff member was extremely pleasant. Food came out quickly and was delicious. Also easy to find parking on a Saturday for an early dinner. Happy hour wine and beer selections were good too.
Great food and friendly, excellent service. Love this place.

From the time we entered until the end of our leisurely meal, we were warmly greeted and treated to friendly service. If you are a fan of scallops, make sure you order the Scallops St. Jacques. The tarragon cream sauce perfectly complemented the perfectly-cooked scallops. We will certainly return to this excellent restaurant that successfully blends the feeling of a neighborhood pub with that of a fine restaurant.
Our waitress was so sweet! She knew we were hungry and brought fries over to the table for us while we wait. She was a sweetheart!!
Decent, albeit uninspired, food. Not worth the price, however. Ambiance was pretty nice and service OK, but took 50 minutes to get food on our table.
Great food and service.  Wonderful find.
Great service, awesome menu and great beer selection- everything was delicious!
Busy but good. Waiter was kept hopping because he had too many tables.

Great fun and food for first time. Sit down menu was slightly different from what was online, but still great choices. The duck was a little dry but the skin was fantastic! Great cocktails and wine. Will definitely be back for another dinner date or any day occasion!

Fabulous experience for Sunday brunch. We ordered mimosas,French toast special and frittata special. All was excellent and well prepared. The best item was the Caesar salad with Brussel sprouts and kale. Absolutely the best salad ever!  We’ll Be back.
Awesome will definitely be going back! Highly recommended
Cozy, good food & great service.

Love the atmosphere.
We all loved our food.  Great place.
Restaurant week.  Good selections.  Friendly staff

We have been to Little Tap house many times in the past - about 2-3 times a year.  The food is always good, but his time we rated the food as very very good. We tend to share appetizers for dinner. there were 4 of us.  We had Ruben spring rolls with a spiced thousand Island dipping sauce, deviled eggs with maple, bacon and coffee dusting, and Truffle french fries.  We also split the Scallop bowl, and a Scallop dinner. Everything was very well prepared, and excellent.
Great meal! If you have a larger group they push circular tables together which is a little awkward, but service is great, and they have a great beer selection.
I walked over from the Holiday for a lite evening meal.  Ordered their version of Chicken Liver Mouse spread and they served it with toasted pita bread.  Paired with a dark beer and I was very happy!

I had higher expectations for the food. The Kale Salad was excellent.  Deviled Eggs were rubbery with not much flavor.  Oysters appetizer special was extremely salty, first time in our lives we left oysters behind.  Truffle Fries were very good but were then drizzled with something sweet and red which was not necessary.

Great waitstaff. Bartender was pretty solemn - never saw a smile or even much eye contact as we ordered drinks while waiting for our table.  Everyone has an off day. We didn’t take offense. Just kind of a bummer starting the evening. 

We ordered off the main menu for Valentine’s Day. We started with the mussels (highly recommend). Hubby had the Haddock and fries and I had the petit filet. My filet came out in two portions and both were overcooked. I received a glass of wine on the house as a result. I would definitely go back as this could have been a fluke (everything else was tasty) and we did enjoy Scott, our waiter.  
Wish we had gotten photos, but we were just wanting to enjoy our weekend getaway together.
Wonderful menu for Valentines Day... a true treat.

Loved the lollipop chicken wings in a honey sriracha sauce.     Enjoyed our salmon and filet mignon entrees but the house made desserts were the best!!! Mud pie was not heavy and dense just packed with chocolate goodness!
LTH fish and chips with Bissell Bros Substance. Just had it for lunch! Perfectly fried and very tasty cole slaw and tartar sauce. As always, service was great.

We came here for a brunch on a Saturday with a reservation but didn’t need one- place just opened so was very quiet. Our server was super nice and attentive. The food was awesome and the mimosas weren’t bad either ;) definitely would recommend if your looking for a yummy brunch.
Hands down the best deviled eggs in town!  One of my favorite places.
Great atmosphere.  Friendly staff and owner.  Food overall was wonderful.  Had scallops and found them to be a little too salty.  Would like to see a little more variety in the cocktail menu.
Our service was excellent and the food was absolutely outstanding. This is my favorite place to eat in Portland and I wish I could eat here every day

Little Tap House is one of our local neighborhood go-to gems. It gets a little noisy when it’s crowded, but that’s okay. Great service, reliable food, good location. I don’t drink beer but it looks like a destination for beer connoisseurs.
Little Tap House never disappoints! Delicious menu, great drink options and wonderful staff!
First timer. We really enjoyed the attentive service. Also the menu spans from basic (outstanding burger) to eclectic small plates. We’ll be back!
I requested a quiet table in the corner and thats exactly what we got! Great service and delicious food!
Very loud environment
Our server, Scott was very attentive. The petite filet mignon was flavorful and tender, the haddock was light and well seasoned.
New Years Eve dinner was excellent!
This was an unexpected cozy and delicious place to celebrate my husbands birthday with our family of five.
Had a great night at Little Tap House. Beat Poutine we have ever had! Beef Stoganoff was delicious!

Very nice dishes, including Tuna Poke Bowl & Broccoli Bowl -plus Avocado toast!

Much more than a gastro pub!
Amazing service and wonderful food. I come here often and am never disappointed.
We love this place. Every special occasion we always choose LTH. Can’t go wrong 🥰
Great place
Great food and service. Our bartender Gretchen was top notch!
We had reservations and had to wait 45 minutes for a table so the reservations were pointless
out of town guests

Crowded but fun! Our waitress was terrific, too - very prompt and thorough as well as charming and efficient. Wonderful haddock - quickly fried in a tempura-style batter, great cole slaw, too. Overall, a great meal, perfectly timed and served.

Food was good. Was expecting more based on some of the reviews. The kale salad was noteworthy. We also had the Lobster grilled cheese with bacon. I felt the bacon overpowered the lobster and was not worth the price.  Good craft beer selection.

Hit this place up last minute for brunch on a Sunday while in town for business. Sat at the bar despite plenty of dining room spots when we got there. We had the shrimp and grits which was fabulous- small shrimp but big flavor and additionally the stuffed French toast which was very tasty as well.

This was my second time visiting Little Tap House. I chose to come here so that everyone in our party would be happy with something on the menu. Very well thought out flavors, wait staff understands the menu, service was was great! Keep up the good work, we will be back!
Great place. Busy on Saturday night but excellent farm to table fare.
Great service from entering the door to walking out.  Both owners (mom and daughter) greeted us and made us feel at home.  Food was very good and tasty.  Would highly recommend to anyone in the area.
Great lunch and craft beers.  Mexican Donut Stout was outstanding
Excellent menu and even more excellent beer list! Service was great, and we have a nice, quiet, and enjoyable brunch.

very timely service. Reserved online and when I showed up 10 min early was promptly shown to my seat. Had the poutine with braised beed and it was very tasty along with the main course of grilled cheese lobster sandwich. Drinks were good also. For an out of towner would recommend

Yummy! We sat outside on a lovely night. Loved the bacon deviled eggs and whipped truffle ricotta dip. So scrumptious. Service was quick, we made it to our movie in plenty of time. Definitely will return!
The service by Benji was excellent. The food was very good and an interesting menu.
Cute, quaint restaurant. Great service and amazing food!

Busy Friday night before a show could have easily been overwhelming - but our service was amazing and the food was lick-your-plate fantastic!  The crab cakes were perfectly lumpy and the salmon was so fresh!  Lemon parfait dessert was fresh and light - a perfect end to a lovely dinner!

We needed a brunch/lunch spot after touring the Victorian Mansion (Morse-Libby) House nearby.  We ere quite happy with this restaurant -- we both had the lobster rolls.  The bun was nicely toasted, and the lobster was held together with just the right amount of mayo.  Delicious! We also split a beer flight -- a couple of pale ales and IPAs.

Cozy yet funky little place, with wonderful options.  I live in the area and it has become one of mine and my husband’s few favorites.  Love the food, the Mac and cheese is a personal favorite, and I love the signature cocktails, and I usually stick to my standard Chardonnay because I’m always disappointed with cocktails.
Love this place!  Consistently great food and service. We’ve been here many times. Tonite we took our 3 year-old grandson and they were extraordinarily kind to him.
Loved the mussels!
Really good pub food...fish and chips were great!!!
Concert night so they were busy. Food was very good. Crab Cakes a bit salty. Bartenders need to smile and greet better! Overall very good food and drinks!

We had just wished the waitress had told us the wines that were valid for happy hour! We purchased the “house wines” that we had assumed would have been part of the happy hour list. 

Better awareness in the future would be our only request! Still an awesome meal and service. Thank you guys!

My husband ordered a $26 Lobster roll, which was of normal size, but the lobster had a mushy texture and was fairly bland.  After questioning the hostess and the waitress, both admitted that it was previously frozen lobster because fresh lobster meat is "too expensive".  Really?  In the summer in Portland, Maine?  I can get a previously frozen lobster roll of the same size and same side (French fries) at McDonalds for 1/4 the price.
My dish was the Linguini with Lobster/Shrimp/Mussels, again, previously frozen lobster.  The mussels were very good, as was the pasta and sauce.
With so many options in Portland, I'd probably go elsewhere next time.

We love this place. We always order the fish and chips and caesar salad. I ordered nuts to put on the salad and have ordered olives at other times. Service is always exceptional. Can't beat the great food.

My mom and I were looking for a cute restaurant in Portland to have a nice dinner outside on the patio since the weather was perfect. We couldn’t have asked for better! The service was wonderful and both of our meals were DELICIOUS!
Best fish and chips I’ve had in a long time. Nice selection of craft beers. Overall a great pub experience!
Excellent service.  Fantastic location.  Loved the outdoor space.
Great waiter and super-prepped meal. Cold, wet day...so warm reception and food just hit the spot. Would love to return!
Great neighborhood restaurant with a tasty menu.
Always a great spot and we had great service on a very busy night, food was very good

Me and my wife chose Little Tap House as our date night dinner location before hitting a comedy show. We ordered the hummus plate and burrata to start - both really good, along with a couple cocktails. We then split the burger, which came out a bit too bloody for our "medium" taste but they brought it back cooked nicely for us. 
The service was fine for us - as the restaurant got a bit more busy we saw a bit less of him, but we like each other and can fill conversation so it wasn't a big deal. Our water was full, and the offer for second rounds was timely so we were more than happy. Everyone looked happy and fulfilled and that they were having a good time. Would definitely go again -either as a couple or small group.
We enjoyed are meal and the service was excellent.  I would just suggest a few more options on the menu. Atmosphere was great for a gastro pub!

We arrived a bit early for our reservation. The hostess said it wasn’t a problem, she could seat us. Clearly that was the case as only one table was taken. We were then given the worst table in the restaurant. My view was into a service area or the hallway to the rest rooms. It was happy hour, so drinks were cheap. The wine was OK. My fish and chips were ok. Way too many fries and small amount of fish. My husband’s lobster roll was the same - small lobster & lots of fries. Service was OK. If I go back I’d go to bar for happy hour & try a shareable. So many great places in Portland I doubt I will return.

Wine week chef’s table 🤌🏻

Food was wonderful, wine pairings were great & David was friendly and charming.  Wonderful evening.
Absolutely amazing dinner, each course better than the last!
It doesn't get any better than David's Opus Ten. Food, ambiance, service always excellent. Wish it was open every night.
We had an amazing experience once again at Opus 10! All of the courses were fantastic and the wine pairings were spot on!!

David Turin is a culinary genius and as his guests, our meal was nothing short of a masterpiece!  Each course     was artfully presented and treasures for the palate.  The service was impeccable.  We couldn’t have asked for a better dining experience.
If you are looking for an amazing food experience, David's Opus is to of the list.

Generous hospitality best describes our experience from the moment we entered the restaurant.
The tasting menu reflects this same generosity, with each bite exploding with layers of flavor and a cohesive meal across seven courses.  I was surprised and delighted by the creativity and respect for ingredients, along with the attention to detail.  Oftentimes, this level of quality in a restaurant comes with pretense, but I'd describe David's as the opposite of arrogance.
Opus Ten is fine dining at the highest level, with sincerity and humility, and I'm grateful for the experience.

David Turin is our favorite Portland, Maine chef, and our 7-course French wine dinner at Opus Ten was an amazing experience, as always. Ashley, our server,  was knowledgeable and charming. Everyone had a wonderful time and the pacing of the courses was perfect. We have consistently delicious meals at all of David’s restaurants and they are a go-to when hosting guests from away.
I was looking for a special way to celebrate my husband’s birthday. This was beyond our expectations! So special!
Definitely recommend.  The food was delicious and the wine pairing was perfect.
Incredible food. Incredible drinks. Incredible service. What’s not to love?

We had the pleasure of sitting at the "chef’s table," a table for 2 tucked in facing the open Opus kitchen. We watched David the chef, along with his sous chef, prepare each dish of the multi-course meal. Deliciousness, and friendly conversation from our host. Will definitely be back for more enjoyable culinary experiences.

Food, service, and value for money was good.
I went there during mean restaurant week.
The noise level was surprisingly high. I think some sound deadening material in the ceiling other than a very thin curtain material might help. Thank you

We didn’t know what to expect as this was our first time dining at any of Chef David’s restaurants, but as soon as we were guided towards the special dining room tucked out back, and I saw that open kitchen, I knew we were in for a treat. We sat at the chefs table / kitchen counter and had one of the most memorable experiences in a Portland restaurant. Chef David and his son Kyle worked together beautifully without having to say a word! My husband and I were mesmerized by the way they moved around in such small quarters. I can appreciate this immensely, as I am a private/personal chef, who never knows what kind of kitchen I’m walking into until I arrive. 
Having Chef David serve each and every course to use was such a wonderfully detailed touch. He described each dish with passion, educating each guest he served. Although it was Restauarant week, and a lower price point than usual, Chef David still created a menu that absolutely wow’d us. It wasn’t just dinner, it was an entire culinary experience that all chefs can appreciate.
 Often times you see chefs stressed out in the kitchen, irritated with one thing or another, bothered by guests or servers - but not here. Not one bit. He goes above and beyond to make sure his guests are happy, took time to chat and get to know my husband and I... we seriously felt like we had a private chef of our own for the night!  
Service was great, cocktails were delicious and the wine pairing was on point. 
I hope chef David and I can collaborate on a special menu someday like we chatted about. Anybody would be lucky to work next to such a kind and generous chef as himself. 
So glad we got a reservation. Can’t wait to come back!
Some of the best food I have ever eaten. Each course was a delight.

Truly phenomenal experience that is certainly one of a kind in Portland. I went for the Maine Restaurant Week tasting menu and loved every plate. The wine pairings were excellent and pacing was on point. At the end of the tasting I was very full but the spacing over about three hours made the amount of food doable. Service was excellent and I felt spoiled. Worth the trip for sure!

Dining at Opus 10 is a magical experience ! Chef David always selects a wonderful menu. The presentation is Devine and the food delicious. It is a fantastic experience to look forward to for a very special evening.
An experience not to be missed - worth every penny. We recommend the wine pairing.
One of the best dining experiences i have ever had. We were fortunate to get the kitchen table and David himself was delightful. A superb experience.
A very special dining experience.  Food was wonderful and the conversation with the chef was delightful.
A special evening with wonderful assortment of flavors and foods. All good

Intimate,  inventive,  warm.  The service was excellent, the meal was a tasting but not too many courses so the portions were large enough to experience the dish. The courses came quickly though not rushed.  The wine paring was very good.  David was very available and we had opportunity to speak with him.  Overall great experience.
Highlight of our trip to Portland. David was so gracious and the meal was fantastic. We will be back!
Totally outstanding!  David & Libby were wonderful.  The Chef’s Table upgrade was terrific!
Wonderful meal. Excellent service. Great value. David himself speaks with each table. Only wish Opus Ten did dinners year round. Very happy foodie
What an anazing meal and  service.  Each dish was breathtaking and the interactions with Chef David was delightful.  First rate.
Outstanding meal. Everything was delicious and even foods I had not liked before were amazing the way they were prepared.
Incredible overall experience.  Food rivals the best restaurants in NYC.

We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of this experience. The servers and chef were personable and very good at their jobs. The food was outstanding and each course was timed perfectly. It was well worth every penny.

I wanted to give David’s Opus Ten 4-1/2 stars but Open Table doesn’t have 1/2 star. The food was very good and the presentation was lovely. The wine pairing was interesting and well chosen for each dish. The chef brought out the food to each table a few times and explained each dish. At the end, he came out and thanked  everyone for coming. We had a nice evening. We would come back to David’s Opus Ten again the next time we are in Portland.

I'm in my late 60's and have worked abroad and here in the states.  During the course of my travels I have eaten at some of the best restaurants in Europe and the states.  David's Opus 10, is just that, a 10!  Service was perfect and smartly timed, the food was sensational and kept getting better with each course, the wines were well chosen and dessert capped it off.  David was at our table a couple of times throughout the evening to serve, describe and answer questions about what was being served.  An extraordinary meal cooked and served by individuals who love what they do!  Definitely coming back.

This experience was amazing! The flavors of the foods are indescribable. David is very humble for such a highly talented chef. He enjoys visiting this intimate group of 18 people and answering any questions.
David is one damn talented chef. We talked with him throughout service.... excellent host. Loved it.
Easily in the top 5 five best fine dining meals ever enjoyed anywhere on the planet
This is the second year that we have come to Opus 10. We had an unbelievably great time. Food, cocktails,  and paired wine were perfect. This is such a special expression for us!
Opus Ten dining was an exceptional experience.  Chef David was so friendly and a pleasure to watch as he prepared a glorious meal.

All seven courses of our meal were absolutely outstanding. My favorite was the porcini mushroom with sage papardelle--SO delicious! We also loved the mini-breads served with each course. Because they were so small, we could try a little of each over the course of the evening without feeling stuffed by the end. The wine pairings were perfectly matched to each dish, and I was extremely pleased and grateful that the chef accommodated my dietary constraints (I'm pescatarian). David actually came out and chatted with us briefly, and his daughter was our server! The room was small and quiet (there were only 8 or 9 other couples there). We loved everything about our experience. Highly, highly recommended!!

Opus Ten has a short season and I can't recommend it enough... Chef David has created a seven-course culinary experience that's like no other I know of in Maine. The menu changes weekly and on the night we went it was impossible to pick a "winner" dish as they were all incredible. My daughter and I can't have gluten but that didn't stop Turin... we got a special menu as well as our own gluten-free bread service.
Incredible experience. Chef David was amazing and the service was perfect. I would encourage anyone coming to Portland to keep this restaurant on their list of top places to dine!

The 4 of us enjoyed every aspect of this 7 course prix-fixe meal of outstanding tastes, each better than the last!  Menu items readily (and deliciously) adjusted to account for 1 person's dairy sensitivity.  Our waitress was delightful, attentive, and knowledgeable.  David personally delivered a couple of the courses and explained their ingredients.  He also stopped to chat with us after the meal.  Two of us did the wine pairings which were also excellent.  Cannot recommend this unique and delicious experience enough!
Great food, David was terrific in greeting all tables.  About a 3 hour experience, never felt rushed or that we waited too long between courses.  Met a nice couple next to us.  Highly recommended.
This was an amazing dinner experience.  We really enjoyed the quality of the overall dinner.  The experience is definitely worth it!! We will try to get a reservation again next year if we can!

Wow! We had an incredible experience here. We highly appreciated the staff calling to ask about food allergies. Everything was delicious and inventive. We tried lots of new food and thoroughly enjoyed it. The wine pairings were amazing and spot on. It was great to actually meet and talk to the chef. We loved the personalized attention. The staff was friendly and very knowledgeable. If you are lucky enough to see an open spot, take it, you won't regret it.
We do not do prefix menus ! But you must do this one if you get the chance. The culinary experience is outstanding, the venue comforting and the hospitality warm and welcoming. Very impressive !

It's really nice when the owner/chef is present and can answer your questions.    One of our courses included a "frozen" vodka.  The bottle was encased in ice and the vodka was even colder than the blueberry taste-treat over which it was poured.  David poured the vodka and explained how he made this course.

Wow.  We celebrated my husband's birthday with the seven course tasting menu during Maine's restaurant week.  We both got a cocktail to enjoy with the phenomenal hors d'oeuvres they offered us and then had dinner with the wine pairing. Chef David came to introduce himself to everyone at the table at the end of the meal, which was a nice touch.  The ambience of the room, set in the back of the larger David's Restaurant was beautifully decorated with an open kitchen so that we got to catch glimpses of the chefs at work.  Thank you so much for the wonderful treat.

Dining at David’s Opus is a delight for the senses. From the presentation to the way the aromas greet you before the first bite of each new course to the unique flavor combinations that dance on the palate, it is not just a lovely meal, it is an experience. The wine pairings were perfectly complimentary. If you are looking for an extraordinary dining adventure, David’s Opus should be on your short list of choices.

This is a great experience for foodies.   Go with friends as the pace is leisurely so you can have a really nice evening.   All the courses were well prepared, the service was good, and the wine pairings were interesting.  I particularly recommend doing the wine pairing as the courses are so varied that selecting a bottle that went with everything would be difficult, and if you order by the glass for each course it would be too much wine.

Awesome experience, sat at the chef's table, interacted with chef David, the food was amazing, the conversation was amazing, the ambiance was amazing, overall the best meal/experience i've had out in Portland, ME. I would absolutely recommend 10/10!
Do this. I promise it’ll be the best food of Portland and beyond.

The food was, as always, incredible.  I don't like lamb, but it was one of the plates and it was outstanding.  If David serves it, it will be good.  Just try it.  After 4 years, we will be returning for a fifth.  When you find something this wonderful, just stick with it.
Deb Smith

David's Opus Ten never disappoints!  New Year's Eve's dinner was beyond amazing!!  The food was delicious, the service was impeccable and the atmosphere was perfect.  I am only sorry that I was so stuffed that I had to wait till the next morning to eat the dessert.  Chef Turin never fails to amaze me and each dish was even better than the last.  I can't wait until my next visit.

We had a wonderful New Year's eve at David's Opus 10.  It was our first time dining there and we were so delighted with the food.  My favorites were tuna carpaccio with quail egg and truffles (this was actually a substitution for beef carpaccio and it worked perfectly!) and a really thoughtful halibut dish served with truffle micro greens over shredded potatoes (the flavors worked well together).   I don't eat red meat or chicken, and the substitutions they gave me were fantastic.  I recommend the wine pairing- they were well suited to the dishes.   This is one of the best meals I've had in Portland.  It was pricey, but the service and food were great.
It was a wonderful evening with excellent food and service. The only issue was the seating was a bit crowded and noise level ( due to background music) was too high.
Great 7 course tasting menu! Food was fantastic and service was terrific.

Absolutely wonderful evening;
Food & service of highest standard
Personable, relaxed
So thankful no loud music to spoil ambiance
Best experience I have had anywhere in the Portland food scene since we last dined at Opus

David and staff were outstanding.  My son is gluten and dairy free and they went above and beyond to cater to our needs.  There was a flood in the kitchen the night of our initial reservation and the restaurant had to close.  They called and were able to reschedule us for the following night. Truly a fantastic experience.  

Thanks to everyone.  We hope to return soon.  Mark

The food was spectacular! David Turin is an amazing chef! He even called earlier in the day in order to accommodate some food allergy requests. The meal did take a little longer than expected, but it was worth the overall experience. We would definitely recommend to anyone interested in creative, delectable food!

My team of Maine Foodie Tour guides and I enjoyed an amazing evening at Opus Ten.  The moment you arrive to the private back dining area (seating just 18) you are greeted by Chef David Turin and his educated waitstaff, seated and treated to a highly creative cocktail, and then a beautiful tasting menu with paired wines begins. Every one of the seven courses is carefully detailed in the evening's menu, presented upon arrival and paired well with European and American wines.  (Note: They also email the menu in advance so any allergies may be addressed- 48 hours ahead.)  All substitutions were equally as thoughtful and delicious as the main selections.  David found Maine wild blueberries at the farmer's market in the morning, where he finds his inspiration for the menus and featured them in at least 5 of the courses. I'm sharing a photo of the soup that knocked our socks off with blueberries, parsnip puree, brown butter toasted macadamia nuts and a curry creme fraiche.  They are only open for 40 nights/year, Wed-Sat, so don't miss the chance to dine at Davids, Opus Ten!
This place needs to be on Food Network!
Incredible dinner! Chef David does an amazing job with this not to be missed experience.

We did some research about restaurants we might like to visit in preparation for our trip to Maine.  Since it was our 10th wedding anniversary, we wanted to do something special on the night we made the reservation for David’s Opus Ten.  This seemed like it would be an experience and not just a meal.  We couldn’t have chosen better.  We were seated next to the kitchen where we could watch the chef work (which we loved!).  He served us himself and explained every dish.  We cleaned our plates for every course.  The food was fantastic and the wine pairings were perfect.  We couldn’t have asked for a more enjoyable evening.  Our tip: take an Uber if you’re having the wine pairings.
Amazing food at gorgeous yet cozy and hidden from the public

My date was disappointing, but the amazing meal more than made up for that!  As always, everything was delicious.  I’m only sad that summer time is flying by and this place will be closed for the season.

We had an awesome opportunity to eat at the chef's counter and have Chef David Turin all to ourselves.   He was generous with food and sharing his immense knowledge.   It was a wonderful evening with several excellent dishes smartly paired with wine.   We've been to Opus 10 several times, it never disappoints.

Phenomenal!  The food was out of this world and the portions were quite large given that it is a 7 course tasting menu.  We had the bar seat which looked directly into the kitchen.  We had the opportunity of watching our food prepared and also chatting with Chef David throughout the night which was a really fun experience.  David's Opus Ten made our anniversary very special and I would highly recommend to anyone!
This was the most special experience I’ve ever had at a restaurant.  Beautiful, delicious, luxurious.  Thank you to Chef David, Kyle and Libby for being so caring.

I have never been disappointed with a meal at David’s Opus Ten!  The service is always friendly and so knowledgeable, the food is delicious and while it is a little pricey, it is fair for all you get.
Wonderful meal; high quality of ingredients which we saw first hand.  We sat at the table near the chef/owner David Turin’s kitchen area.  Charming person and very talented chef.
Everything was unbelievable! Food and wine were perfection. Atmosphere was quiet and beautiful.

Exquisite  7  course dinner.  One of us has multiple  food restrictrictions which we notified the chef of the day before.  No pro blem too great for this subtle, nuanced & imaginative Chef.  Easily on the level of Parisian Michelin star bistros.  Chef a lovely mensch & great service team & ambiance.

Everything was extraordinary from start to finish, the food and wine pairings were absolutely tremendous and the chef and staff's willingness to accommodate my son's food allergy was greatly appreciated.  I will absolutely come back.

The enviroment was very cozy, romantic, with great soft lighting. The staff was friendly, polite and very professional. I would recommend the Open Table experience to anyone who is a food fan looking to taste and expirience food to a whole new level. Excellent!

The staff at Opus Ten is amazing, there aren’t enough adjectives. The hostess, the servers, and both chefs go above and beyond to ensure that your experience is top notch. Chef Turin is so talented and makes the experience special every time. It’s a restaurant and an experience not to miss.
David's opus ten has a great prix fixe menu. Each dish is carefully thought out. Great service and If David is there, he will come by and talk to all the tables.
Our 32nd wedding anniversary.  We had a wonderful experience - Chef Matt's food was a delight to the senses ... delicious  ...  complex ... Excellent!

The food at Opus 10 was fairly disappointing. The first course, soup, was pretty good and the desert was excellent. Everything else in between was as mediocre as it can get; the fish was overcooked and tasteless, the meat was way too salty without anything there to balance it off. We all decided on wine pairing and the wine was just ok, middle of the road variety that did nothing to make me say wow even once. I must say that the amount of wine with each dish was very generous but i wish they had given less of something better. 
With all the great and interesting restaurants in Portland, you can get much better food and experience at $150/person. 

The service was great

I went here with my best friend to celebrate my birthday. I had always wanted to try David's Opus Ten after reading a few years ago that they offered a vegetarian tasting menu in addition to the standard one. I  called a few days before my reservation to confirm that was still available and was disappointed to learn that the vegetarian tasting menu had been discontinued. However, I was told they would be happy to accommodate me. The chef prepared a delicious meal for both me and my friend. Sometimes we had the same dish, other times mine was altered to include veggies while my friend enjoyed seafood and meat. We both loved everything we were served, and were delighted to be seated at the chef's table where we could watch everything being created. Amazing food, ambiance, and service. I will definitely go back the next time I am back home visiting Portland.

This is our favorite restaurant -- hands down an exceptional experience.  We most recently attended on 7/5/17 for a belated anniversary dinner and literally had the best dinner ever. The food is imaginative, beautiful, cooked to perfection, and each dish (of  a 7-course meal) is outstanding. Davids Opus 10 truly shines.

Innovative and delicious tasting menu and wine-pairing.  Exceptional value for the generous portions and pours.  Having eaten in all the top restaurants in Portland, I am confortable rating this restaurant number 1.  Why?  The chef, Matt Caddell is master at his craft, as we cruised through a smoked watercress-potato soup, steak tartar, Leon grass and lime sorbet with a generous splash of mint-infused rum, ricotta gnocchi with bacon lardons and porcini mushroom cream, fennel-crusted pork chop, and a deconstructed tiramisu.  The complementary wines were splendid choices: Bandol rose, Planeta cerasuolo, Alban viognier, Fatalone primatologist, and a NV Charleston madiera.  Love this restaurant!

My husband is vegan and I am vegetarian.  We were dining with a meat eating couple.  It is very rare that a restaurant can provide exceptional dining for such a varied crew of diners but they succeeded!

David's Opus Ten is for those people who truly want a different dining experience. You get 7 courses with two options per course. The food was consistently innovative and delicious. And the wine pairings were perfection. And the service was tremendous. If you are looking for large servings, this is not the place to go, but if you are in search of interesting selections that you have not had before, this is the place to be. It is a small intimate restaurant where you get treated extremely well and the food is scrumptious. We left quite satiated, by the way. I highly recommend this restaurant.

We used to be a fan of Opus Ten. But things have changed.

1.) if i pay $300 for dinner for 2 I am expecting white table cloth, not formica...the ambiance just isn't there
2.) the food just wasn't good. It appears  over engineered and complicated for no purpose. (Except the soup)
3.) some dishes where presented on a plate for two to be shared with your neighbor.  Why??  Its awkward to  lean to the side to eat your appetizer, aside from hygenic considerations.

Sorry opus but we wont be back. If you like fine dining  Tempo Dulu knows how its done right.
The service was excellent and we always love the room at Opus 10.
Service is one of the best in town. Food is above average and the service really make us want to come back.
I've been to Opus Ten a few times. This last visit was great, but things are definitely not as amazing as when Chef Bo was there. Next time I'm in town I'll try his new place.

We met up with some friends while visiting Portland and chose David's Opus 10 as the venue. It was a great success. We all left agreeing that it was a fun and memorable evening of great food and wonderful wine pairings. The staff were knowledgeable, friendly and enthusiastic about their craft which added greatly to our enjoyment of the evening. Its not at all the typical stuffy tasting dinner; wonderful vegetarian choices that our carnivore husbands hugely enjoyed, a very fun and retro amuse, beautifully prepared fish and steak. Visually and taste-wise the food was delicious and the wine pairings were spot on. It will certainly be on my list of places to return on our next trip to Portland.

First time back since their re-opening as a seasonal restaurant.  Although we have always felt the space to be lacking, the new young team in the kitchen is very talented and the meal was very, very good.  Make sure to book a table before they close for the winter. We'll be back.
Chef's table.  Got the treatment.  Chefs were very friendly and knowledgeable. Server was great.  Did the wine pairing and it was worth it.
Everything was spot on.  Great food, great wine, great service.
Great attention to detail in the cooking, and thoughtful pairings in the wine pairings chosen.

The food was awesome!! Very unique dishes that I probably wouldn't order otherwise that were outstanding! Very friendly wait staff and the kitchen staff would present the dishes and explain what was in then. This is a must visit when in Portland Maine.

Food and wine pairing was spectacular; innovative, superb presentation, vegetarian and meat option (both worth eating).  Extremely knowledgable servers, who understood the details of the food and wine; outstanding wine pairings!

We've eaten at Opus 10 a number of times over the years.  It is consistently fantastic, unlike some of the other high end restaurants in town.  The food is wonderful - 'experimental' without being weird, a complex mix of flavors in every bite.  The service as always been top notch - friendly and attentive.
Sitting at the chefs table is the best experience.  To watch the artists work and then enjoy it is a unique experience.
Wonderful seven course tasting menu with wine pairings.
Terrific, interesting and inventive food with a beautiful presentation.  The room is comfortable and the service is excellent but not fussy.  We're definitely going back soon.
We can not say enough about this wonderful restaurant.  The food was amazing, service outstanding and we felt like it we were in our own private room.

We ordered from the small plate menu and everything was excellent- beautifully prepared and plated and served. Had we known, we would have reserved the spot at the kitchen where you can watch the chefs prepare the food. Intimate room, expensive but delicious!
Every bite was delectable. The service was excellent. Our waiter was very helpful with dining and wine suggestions. Can't wait to eat here again!
This was our second time here and they didn't disappoint. Wonderful food, great service and very nice wine selection. I would recommend going if you're in Portland!

A year ago this was an experience to delight, amazing and interesting food, in a cool environment with great service. Today it is dialed way down, the food is good but no more than that. Servers were not well trained. Prices are about the same as a year ago, so the value is way down.
Wine list had 3 reds, one of which was a rose. 
Seems to be a conscious decesion to become a different restaurant,

I'm going to say right off that I'm partly to blame for the way the evening progressed. I had the week off so I chose Friday night for the 9 course option instead of the 7,only to learn there was no 9. The 2 previous times I went to Opus we were asked if we'd like a pre-dinner cocktail. With 2 less courses and minus a drink to linger over, dinner was much shorter than I had planned. I was planning to be at Opus for two and a half hours minimum. I also should say that there was an exceptionally large party which I'm sure skewed the pace of the evening. Overall it's hard to say anything bad about this place. The food was beyond exquisite and I'm always anxious to get back to one of David's restaurants.

Their menu is a tasting menu; bites for 1 meaning little to share and you will have to order multiple items.  That may sound negative, but those tastes are fantastic. Depending on how big your appetite,  2 to 4 items should be expected.  My wife loved the scallop so much, she ended up ordering it twice.
Only small negative is you pay for a serving of bread that is replenished but is for 1.  Two people? Two items. One for each. They don't necessarily strictly enforce it, but it is on the menu that way and if you both reply yes for the bread, you will be billed twice. 
Considering the price of the items, and that you will be ordering multiple items,  just seems to be a way to add to the profit. 
FYI this will not stop us from going back. But something you should know in advance.

We went to Portland for a couple of days and were looking for a good dinner after a long drive. We were surprised with what we found. Opus 10 was a little gem...which is hidden in the back of David's, so you can't even see it when you walk through the door. Order the lobster on the fried risotto cake...you won't be disappointed. Actually, we weren't disappointed by anything...it was faboulous!! 5 stars!

Careful attention was paid to every detail!   Exceptional gourmet dining, impressive wine list, impeccable service.  Quiet, relaxed ambience, ideal for a romantic, special occasion for couples.  Most elegant, fine dining in Portland!

We loved the quiet, yet relaxed and casual atmosphere of Opus Ten.  

It seemed like most of the dishes were better than the ones that preceded the current dish, which makes for a great experience.   

The most memorable dishes of the night were the butter poached lobster and the tuna tartare, with the tuna tartare being elevated to a height far above almost any other tartare dish we've ever had.  It was so complex with so many layers of flavors, we were all just blown away.

The service was great as well.  They provided any and all information requested, and did so with humor and patience.  

The intimate setting of having only eighteen seats made it that much more enjoyable, as we felt comfortable, and it's great not having to talk over dozens of other people.

I will recommend this place to everyone.
It was a unique fun experience! The staff was equally as lovely as the food.

The food was delicious, and the overall experience was excellent. I do have to say that it wasn't as innovative as some other restaurants of this standard, but that doesn't detract from the fact that everything was very tasty.
Amazing eclectic
Everything here is done well. Three hours straight of awesome.

This was our 7 th time to visit Opus 10.  We convinced some friends to join us as we live in Bangor and this dining experience requires overnight at hotel. I gave the meal and outstanding but our service was very disappointing.  We had raved to our friends about the prior experiences.  We even did the Baird dinner in K-port with David himself. That dinner and service was very good.  I hope that this was just a bad night for the staff.  They couldn't explain the wine pairings, how the meal was prepared, etc. Disappointed !!

When we were told that the bottle of wine we had ordered was not at optimal temperature and were given free glasses from an opened bottle while it was chilling, we knew the service was going to be exceptional and their standards were high.  This tiny back room restaurant is an intimate experience between you, a few other diners, the talented wait staff and one chef, cranking out delicious small plates from an open kitchen in the same room.  Not all the plates were perfect but many were and the worst were still great.  A few well executed standards but mostly unique dishes that I had never experienced before.  We felt pampered and fortunate to be there.  We will be back!

Incredibly wonderful service.  Excellent food. Very friendly staff.  The butter poached lobster may have been my favorite.  The pairings were excellent choices.  Looking forward to many return visits.

We chose this restaurant by the reviews, and they were so correct! What a beautiful, delicious meal! The woman who served us was as knowledgeable as could be hoped for about both the food and the wine. We were delighted to meet the chef. One of our favorites that night was the "Mushroom Shooter" - soup from heaven, we called it. Don't miss the prix fixe dinner with the wine pairings.

Each course was carefully prepared and beautifully laid out. The servers were extremely attentive and explained each dish in detail. A very relaxing setting and although the portions were tasting sized, it was the right amount to taste each serving and not get over-full. This was well worth the money for a special occasion. It is a whole dining experience.

Davids opus ten is perfect for a foodie or romantic dinner with quiet atmosphere. Servers are attentive and are well educated in the wine and food. Would highly recommend this restaurant for special occasions.

The 7-course pre fixe menu was a delightful assortment of wonderful flavors that were delivered in perfectly sized portions and at a comfortable speed.  Our server, Oana, was incredibly knowledgeable about the food and the wine pairings and was very attentive along with the four other individuals who split time waiting on us.  Quite simply, if the idea is to make you feel as though you are royalty, David's Opus Ten delivers on that.  

It is not a place to eat and run, rather, a slow, comfortable journey through culinary exposition.  

This was a wonderful experience.

I took my husband to Opus Ten for his birthday and it was fantastic. The ambiance is perfect for special occasions, the food was sensational and the wine pairings were very good. We like to think of ourselves as foodies and we enjoyed every one of the seven courses. Our server had an excellent knowledge of the wine pairings and presented each dish with professionalism, and was attentive to exactly the degree that we like--it was almost like she could read our minds. We even had the opportunity to meet Chef David Turin, which was a treat. Highly recommended!!

I was surprised to see that there were no reviews written after 11/29/14. We were also not solicited by OpenTable to write a review. The food was mediocre, one course the beef was tough and flavorless. I had to ask for a steak knife and even then not able to eat it.. We had the wine pairings which were skimpy. The waiter while attentive gave the same exact spiel to the people sitting next to us. The tables were close so that when he came to tell us about our course, we had already heard the exact same description just a few moments earlier. After seven courses, it gets less special and trite. At $69 for a an average meal and $38 for  the meager wine paring, not some place I would come back to. 

I have to ask why are there no recent OpenTable reviews?

Given all of the 5 star reviews I was really looking forward to this place and it did not disappoint. The food was truly excellent but as good as that was, it was the service that made the meal an unforgettable experience. It was without a doubt some of the best I have ever had, anywhere. Warm, friendly, professional, knowledgeable, courteous and generous. It is however a small plate meal so be sure you know what your letting yourself in for before you book. My wife and I opted for the carnivore menu and we plan to go back in the Spring to try the vegetarian version. To sum up, as good a meal experience as you will get anywhere in the US.

Visitjng Portland for the weekend I searched and searched for the right spot to have a special meal with my wife. We were pleasantly surprised and impressed with the quality of the food, attentiveness and knowledge shared by the staff. Worth making this a focal part of your trip. Amazing wine pairing with the tasting menu.

This was our 3rd time at Opus 10, and it was just as delightful as the first time. The food was delicious and interesting, and the atmosphere was friendly and unpretentious. We are huge fans, and will definitely be back.

This is a place for foodies that rivals if not exceeds the best restaurants in Boston where I'm from.  They are extremely accommodating for those with allergies or dietary needs.  They do need 48 hours warning on this when you book your reservation.  My meals are never quite what they should be because of my special diet.  Opus 10 and the chef/staff were able to accommodate my needs for an absolutely amazing meal. I had the whole experience despite my limitations.  I've never had this level of food preparation and attention to planning at any other restaurant.  If you like just a big steak and the basics, this restaurant is not for you. If you revel in flavors and fantastic food, then this is so worth the trip. They also provide an education about the meal and the wines are chosen very well.
A very special place. Seamless attention to detail . David ,our waiter , is a professional

What a special meal.  If you go prepared  to just put yourself in the hands of the chef, the food is outstanding.  The portions are very small, but each one is special and there are quite a few of them.  The wine pairings were special too.  This is a real treat for anyone who loves food and wine.
Great place for dinner.

We were quite disappointed in our experience at David's Opus Ten. Despite the knowledgeable server, his demeanor was belittling. The service was very slow (there were three of us and from start to finish it took 3 hours)  The dining room seats no more that 20 clients at a time with plenty of staff to accommodate all needs and wishes...this did not occur. The room was cold and drafty which forced two of us to dine in our winter jackets just to keep warm.  The duce next to us asked to be moved because they were so uncomfortable with the cold draft at their table. The courses were cold and very salty. Don’t get me wrong, we had a great time because of our own company.
Well-paced meal that had something for everyone.  Great food, great service, great ambiance and attention to detail.  We are moving to Portland and this will be a destination restaurant.
We dined at Opus ten during a long weekend in Portland. Five out of the six dishes on the carnivore menu were fantastic. The reserve wine pairings were also very good.

What a cool experience.  Tucked behind David's is a small room that seats maybe 10-15 people.  Really cool prix fixe concept where you can choose 2 different wine pairings...the standard wine list or the higher-end wine list.  With a couple, you can each choose something different so that you can try 8-10 different wines.  There were 2 separate dinner menus, and again, each person can choose one so that you can try all the different foods.  The plates seem very small, but you will be satisfied at the end of the meal.  Really, really excellent place for a special occasion.

This is the best meal from start to finish that we have ever had.  It was greatly enhanced by Dave, the attentive and informative waiter.
The setting was peaceful and a bit quaint in a private area behind David's in front.  There was a choice of a carnivore or vegetarian fixed menu with flexibility to switch.  We had the meats and everything was perfect.  It was basically the menu found on line which changes seasonally.  An added attraction before the meal began were bites of the best Manchego and Iberico ham that we have ever had.  They seemed to have a great wine selection with selected pairings.  We were happy with a bottle of rose that came from the suggested pairings.  We plan to make this a part of our annual outing to Portsmouth.
Fantastic tasting menu and paired wine tasting.  Overall wonderful experience and evening.

The memorable part of dining at Opus Ten was the sheer ridiculousness of the whole thing.  First, we arrived a little early for our reservation (found parking nearby) and we were asked to wait in the front room with no space at the bar and nowhere to sit.  Then we were led through the bustling, happy scene of the front to a windowless room in the back.  The room had been a largish coal bin with the coal delivery window merely  boarded over.  The conversion existed of adding a few tables, draping some cheap gauzy fabric in swags from the low ceiling, and adding a tiny kitchenette to a corner.  Though we'd had to wait 20 minutes, there were only 2 other couples in the dark, dingy space.  Not romantic, just dingy.  The rather mediocre food was served a by what must have been a first year acting student just learning her lines. Each tiny portion was described in detail, but  she could not remember to leave off the hated truffle oil. When the stinky dish arrived from the kitchen (elsewhere) and was sent back, we watched while the person in the kitchenette pushed off the truffle oiled salad on top of what-ever-it-was, replaced it with new greens and the server returned it.  Guess what still stank of truffle oil?  Moaning and grumbling the kitchenette guy went to get a new dish. We were amazed at the entire performance. Nothing was good, just verbosely described. The wine (more descriptions) pours were a couple of tablespoons at most and poured so slowly that they may have partially evaporated by the time she was done. We've dined at Michelin 3-stars and know what exceptional food and service are like.  This was a really bad joke!  An expensive bad joke.  And we wasted 1 out of 14 evenings in Portland on a bad joke. If this is David's ultimate, dream 'restaurant' we really don't want to know what his nightmares are like!  The whole experience was painful at the time, but in retrospect we see it as a Saturday Night Live performance and laugh.

Excellent food and wine parings. I had the carnivore menu and wife had the vegetarian. Food was exquisitely prepared and presented. The manner of service encouraged you to linger over each course and truly enjoy it. Service was excellent, even if bordering on the slightly intrusive - it was cheerfully indulgent. I'd rather have too much service than too little. Heartily recommended!

Great spot in Portland if you are looking to impress. Small intimate atmosphere. Service was great, staff was very knowledgeable of food and wine ingredients and origin. Plan on almost two hours and enjoy the experience. Pricey, but worth it!

The seven course tasting menu at Opus Ten with paired wines was a special treat  to celebrate a birthday.  The server was a delight, knowledgeable and enthusiastic without being overbearing.  We chose the vegetarian option, including some of the same dishes as for the "carnivore" menu. We were told that a vegan menu was available by request.   
All of the food was tasty and well presented.   The meal was well paced, allowing us to savor each dish.   My only quibble was a bit of sameness in the textures and flavors.  As a vegetarian I would have liked a bit more crunch and color.  The mushroom "shooter" that opened the meal was spectacular.  The second mushroom plate wasn't at the same level. Great ambiance & service, inventive food.
One-of-a-kind experience. Everything was perfect - including the music.

Truly the best dining experience I have had and I am a foodie and travel regularly. 
The waitstaff are some of the best.  The seven course fixed menu was so creative and flavorful.  This is not just eating out at a great restaurant, it is a dining experience like none other.  A must try.

I am a cook, and a carnivore, so I appreciated all the classics done right. My daughter is a vegan and never gets a truly special dining experience. The Chef thought about each of the 7 tasting menu courses and made a vegan gourmet fantasy out of each. We sat at the Chef's table and he explained each course with passion.

Most of the courses excellent. A couple just fair to good. The reserve wine pairing was a little bit underwhelming. Might recommend buying a bottle or two especially if four or more people are present.
My husband and I we're all oohs and ahs and wows over six of the seven courses, with the seventh (pork butt) being plain old very good. Service was excellent. No complaints!

This was my second visit to Opus 10, and left something to be desired this time. Table placement was a bit intimate with the couple next to us as opposed to my husband- unfortunately it took away from the romantic feel of the restaurant and made dinner conversation a bit awkward. Food was great, especially the corn risotto topped with lobster and the quail egg ravioli with mushroom nage. The chocolate bark during dessert was our least favorite- the macadamia nuts had almost a fishy taste. Wait staff was knowledgeable even though there seemed to be a big difference in knowledge/experience among the two main servers. Excellent cocktails!

I really enjoyed the tasting menu, but the service was terrible. We wanted to do the wine tasting with our food, but asked if we could have only red wines. Our server said no. Most high end restaurants have a sommelier who can work with the customers request. They usually say they cannot guarantee it will be a perfect, but they do accommodate. What topped the cake was near the end of the meal, the server brought our check with 40% of our wine left and with us still eating our dinner. She basically said we can cork it to take home and never bothered to come back to the table. We had to pour our own wine for a meal costing $150 per person. I will never return to this restaurant due to the service. Too bad because the food was quite good.

We have been coming to Portland for many years and have always had great food experiences. David's Opus Ten was by far one of the best. The food was delicious, the wine pairings extraordinary and the service was spectacular. If you are in Portland and want to go somewhere special this is the place for you.

Kudos to David Turin. The entire experience is exceptional.
Portland has so many fine restaurants that a "foodie" can enjoy. Opus 10 has created the need for a new 'outstanding' category.

After eating our way through Portland, Maine, we finished on a high note at David's Opus Ten.  The diamond in the tiara of the Portland dining.   First, your table is yours for the night - so no rush...paced how you need/want, and you can take the time to linger and talk. Second, the food was impeccable.  Flawless.  The kinds of dishes you wanted (and got - four varieties) bread to scrape up every last bit of every sauce, and you wanted to eat slowly to truly enjoy every bite!  Third, the service was a joy.  We learned about not only how they created the menus and the wine pairings, but the grape varietals and vineyards.  The chef came out himself and presented two of the courses and was happy to share his love of these creations.

We love the Portland food scene and have visited many local favorites.  But perhaps our most memorable meal ever was the other night at David's Opus 10.  We were lucky enough to sit at the chef's table.  Chef Bo was perfect: attentive, informative, relaxed, and fascinating to watch.  And the dishes he created were spectacular.  I wanted to lick my plate.  Even with the palate cleanser sorbet.  A spectacular evening.

Great great restaurant…
Loved everything incl food and service

Prix fix menu, either vegetarian or carnivore.  I do not eat red meat and the carnivore menu main dish was pork, a bit of a back and forth to exchange the pork dish with fish or chicken "I was told I need to call ahead for that"  I was offered the goat cheese main dish and I objected to having that for a main dish, finally I was served salmon which was delicious.  
What was a little annoying was the long description of every little " and I mean really little" ingredient in every dish and a lecture about the origin of every wine, no need for that......  All in all it was worth the $250. price tag for two.  I think.

David's Opus Ten is a true gem on the Portland, Maine dining scene.  It is intimate and innovative.  The experience is akin to being present at a private dinner party where a single server guides you through the entire gastronomical experience.  Each dish is thoroughly planned to pop - both in terms of the senses and the palate.  The experience of combining unique flavors with a beautiful presentation is the best I have experienced in this town.  It is, indeed, David's crowning achieving.  A big thank you to the associate chef for delivering accompaniments, personally, to each table.

This is a wonderful dining experience.  We did the basic wine pairing with carnivore menu.  It was an assault on our taste buds, in a good sense.   It is expensive.  Be prepared to drop $275 for two people.  If you accept that entry fee you will not be disappointed.  Our waiter played an integral role in our meal.  He explained in detail the food pairing strategies and wine pairings, while interjecting the origins and characteristics of both ingredients and wine.  We'll done!

Wonderful from beginning to end. The table is yours for the entire night - no rushing the experience. Service was impeccable - knowledgable on both wine and food, personable and friendly, not at all intrusive. The food was a dream! Such a wonderful combination of comfort foods with a twist that only adds to the flavor, never detracts. Leaving the choices to the chef was the best decision we made!

David's Opus 10 is a superior restaurant. Excellent service, superb chef.
Spoonbill caviar, Vichyssoise, brown butter poached lobster, quail egg pasta ravioli, ale braised pork butt to name  a few items on the menu. 
We chose the Opus Ten wine pairings, which were just perfect. 
Whether you're a foodie (me) or not (my spouse) you will thoroughly revel in this restaurant. The total bill with tip was $240. It's a special occasion place. (It was our anniversary, and the staff made note of that, which was a delightful touch.) I highly recommend.

Opus 10 is not in Kennebunkport anymore but I did not notice when I booked on Open Table.
When we got to the restaurant, we had no reservation. The lady confirmed that I had booked at Opus Ten in Portland!
They did not charge for the no-show in Portland and they found us a nice table at David's. We had a fantastic meal and a great night.
The food scene in Portland, ME continues to impress.  David's Opus Ten is one of the special restaurants in the area.  Both food and service were perfect.  This is a must try restaurant.

From start to finish, we had a truly lovely dining experience. The venue is a restaurant inside a restaurant, and so is intimate and you can watch the chefs in the open kitchen. Chef also came to the table to finish one or two courses and check how we were enjoying everything. The wait staff was attentive (but not obtrusive) and extremely knowledgeable about all courses regarding sources of ingredients and preparation. And to top it all off, our waiter was also a somelier and we had some great discussions about wine, port, medeira, and sherry. Since the table is yours for the whole evening, we were able to linger as long as we wanted. A wonderful experience and we will definitely be back!

I can only describe this as an exceptional dining experience. It's a fixed price menu. My husband will eat eggs and milk products, but no meat. I enjoy meat. In other fine dining establishments, the vegetarian menu compares poorly with the "regular" menu and the dishes are often timed completely differently as well, such that that one might as well be dining at two different restaurants. Not so here. The fixed price vegetarian menu aligned perfectly with the "carnivore" menu and was comparable in every way in quality and presentation. The seven courses were each more wonderful than the last.  Unique cocktails, wine pairings and even non-alcoholic beverage pairings and a substantial amuse bouche enhance the experience.
Would definitely go back and recommend to others.  Food was fantastic!

I'm lucky that my work requires travel and the chance to eat in great restaurants.  I've had amazing meals in New York, Paris, Singapore, San Francisco, etc.  That said, I've never had a better meal than my hometown birthday celebration at David's Opus 10 in Portland.  Everything about our dinner for 5 was marvelous: the room, the service, the wine and especially the food.  Every course was delectable and paired with wonderful wine.  The vegetarian and carnivore menus were equally good and everyone in our party was delighted with every dish.  The menu changes so what we had may not appear on another night - but we loved the poached lobster and oysters, the smoked Portabello steak, the duck breast, the lamb and the gnocchi.  Marvelous meal!

Each of the 5 courses on the "carnivore" menu was wonderful. (A vegetarian menu was also offered.) The palate cleanser of house made blueberry sorbet with frozen limoncello was excellent and refreshing.  The reserve wine pairings were perfectly matched to each course.  Although the reserve was a bit pricey, it was well worth it in our opinion for the quality and interesting variety of the selections.  This was our first experience at the restaurant and we will definitely be back.

From start to finish Opus Ten is a culinary and dining experience not to miss. The waitstaff is knowledgeable, friendly, and are able to not only explain the dishes and wines, but also answer questions thoughtfully and thoroughly. We were visiting Portland with friends and Opus Ten provided a wonderful experience and delicious food for a couples evening out.
From the moment we walked in to the time we left, we had a great time.  The waitstaff were terrific, the food fabulous and the wine delicious.

Wonderful food, beautifully presented. My only complaint is that if you want wine, you must go with their wine pairings (at an additional $35 or $65) or pay $15 for a glass of wine--which can be selected only from their limited list of pairings.

Clearly trying for Michelin star cuisine and service but falling ever so short.  Decent quality ingredients, reasonably well prepared but over stylized all served in a dining environment overly influenced by the home decorating departments of Lowe's and Home Depot.  A textbook case of form over substance.  Terribly overpriced for the product.  Intrusive and pretentious service. Definitely not worth a repeat visit.

We sat at the chef's table by the kitchen with a full view of the preparation of our (and other diners') dinner. We chatted with the chef throughout the dinner. This is a tasting menu, with paired wines for each course. It simply was one of the best meals we ever had, anywhere in the world. The dishes were inventive, without being exotic, and the food was exceptionally well prepared. In particular, the lobster and oyster first course was exceptional. Chef Bo was friendly, informative and very talented. Service by David was attentive, without being distracting, and he carefully informed us about the restaurant, the tasting menu and the wine pairings. In all, an exceptional experience.

Dinner at Opus 10 was spectacular
Really interesting food creations. Intense flavors
and intriguing combinations. A perfect evening.

Sat at the chef's "counter table for two" facing the kitchen. One delicious dish after another paired with one lovely wine after another. Wine pairings are spot on--"reserve" pairings are worth the splurge, but "Opus 10" pairings also great (we got one of each so we could try everything). While somewhat subjective, portions of food and wine are precisely enough for a tasting menu--less would be skimpy and more would be too much--when you get to the 7th wine you realize that while you may have wanted more of wine #3 or #4 because it was soooo great, it would have ruined you for the rest. Service is warm and welcoming and we can't wait to return.

Our server told us that she would pace the 7+ courses for us - and she did so perfectly. From sparkling to port, every pairing was superb - and we chose the lesser wines (we already knew most of the premium choices). Each course was a beautiful gem, and both of us ate the whole thing. Portions, of both wines and food, are reduced, but reduced to perfect. I was full after the brownie with flambé banana & ice cream, but not overstuffed. My favorite courses were the poached oyster & lobster served on the shell and the flawlessly flavored and cooked lamb medallion. We will be back every time the fixed menu changes...
