Noise level is a bit high because the servers explain every course, at every table. But we certainly learned a lot!

Did not know the restaurant's menu was a 7 course tasting menu that changes several times a year - absolutely great. They also offered paring a wine with each course. Some were better than others but overall very good. Presentation was superb. Did not feel rushed. There are only 6 tables so the ambience feels quite intimate. Would absolutely recommend to anyone. There was also a 7 course vegetarian version. Also, if you did not like a particular course, they would work with you to see what they had in lieu of. This was not an issue for us because all courses were very tempting and tasted great.

David's Opus Ten does everything right. Upon entering this intimate 18-seat venue, you are asked for your coat. So begins the night of being taken care of from the moment you step in. We chose the 6-course Restaurant Week special and were treated to an extra 7th course to begin - cured meat and cheese from Spain on handmade crackers accompanied by some very nice olives. Then came the plates, perfectly timed. Each one was explained in detail by our waiter. The personalized service is not to be beat anywhere in town.

We went to David's Opus 10 on the first day of Restaurant Week, and it was a memorable experience. The food was creative and delicious, and the staff was knowledgeable but unpretentious. This will definitely be our next destination for a splurge, special occasion dinner.

The food was superb, the wine pairings were mostly on point. The setting is small and intimate. My one gripe is with the service; the servers (there were only two the night we dined) have the same points to talk about prior to each course, and because it's a small area we heard the exact same thing each time a table's course was brought out. It creates a stilted feel to the service; like calling a customer service center and having the agent read a script robotically. Once my husband and I managed to find some common ground with our server and struck up an actual conversation, the meal improved dramatically. But again, the food was fantastic. The next time we go, I'll be requesting the "bar" seating with a view of the meal prep!
This was my second visit to Opus Ten and it did not disappoint. From beginning to end, it's a beautiful experience and the staff is THE most experienced wait staff in Portland.
Food excellent, service exceptionally attentive, just wish the space wasn't so unisnspired.
A lovely night - excellent, knowledgeable service, and every course on the 9-course tasting menu was something we would have ordered on a regular menu. Yummy!
David's Opus Ten is the finest food/dining experience Southern Maine has to offer bar none!
The 9 course meal will blow you away!

This was our second visit to David's Opus Ten. We were lucky enough to go for a pre-opening event several months ago. Both visits have been very memorable. The food is excellent, the win pairings spot on, and the service outstanding. Highly recommended for a dinner for two or a special occasion with friends.
Everything was perfect. The staff was attentive and informative. Chef Matt clearly loves being in the kitchen and creating. We certainly wish to return.
What a charming neighborhood treasure. Great food in a relaxed friendly atmosphere. A bit noisy for me, but everyone seemed to be enjoying their meal.

First, Sally was absolutely outstanding from the moment I called her to update our party size.  She was more than accommodating and I appreciated all of her efforts!  Second, Bridge was one of the best waitresses we’ve had!!! Fantastic personality and so helpful and attentive. Lastly, the food was to die for! The mushroom toast, Crab Rangoon pasta, Steaks, Duck all so so so yummy!  We truly loved our experience!!!
Food and service was incredible. I honestly can’t wait to go back.
Great food, creative dishes, neighborhood place vibe and great service.

Overall a miss for us.  We have not been in a few years. The noise level remains high (expected). The AC may have not been working (?) as we were sweating. The carbonara (previously a fan favorite in our family) definitely is different than we recall (more of a pasta with garlic aioli with overdone pancetta). The pork was good but tough. Food came out quickly and server (Nate) was very efficient and friendly. Will we go again, maybe! Prefer the other rooms based on our most recent visits.

Portland Maine is known for its excellent dining scene and The Corner Room definitely adds to the legacy with a superb culinary experience. We used to dine here frequently before Covid hit, and since then, we havent really had this fine establishment on our "return-to" list until last evening. Unpretentious and very welcoming by the staff, the service was absolutely spot on in all regards, from being greeted by the host to the last minutes of dessert (a killer creme brulee made by our server!). Our sever didnt miss a beat, even though the first turn was packed. Every meal and side was prepared perfectly, the portions substantial, the seasonings balanced and interesting (and NOT oversalted, like so many places). Even the plates had been heated up, which is always a nice touch. The food and wine prices were right in line, being quite affordable in comparison to so many places these days. And after dinner, we closed out the check and our server said we "had the table" -- no push out the door, even though they were near closing. I highly recommend The Corner Room for all the reasons we enjoy dining out. This will now be in our monthly rotation as we socialize with friends and want to be guaranteed a superlative meal. Thanks CR!

Overall we were very pleased and we will be back! It's a small and cozy spot nestled in a neighborhood with street parking - we were a little worried we'd struggle to find parking but it wasn't an issue at all. Prices were all very reasonable and food was great. We got cornbread and burrata to start (both were VERY good!), and salmon and sirloin for entrees - the salmon was cooked perfectly, didn't care for the cauliflower puree that came with it (that's just preference though, nothing wrong with the way it was cooked); the steak was good, but not fantastic - again, not poor quality at all, just not over the top flavorful. The ambience inside is great, it's a bit small so can feel perhaps a little cramped, but not enough to impact the experience. Our server was great - very attentive and personable, there when we needed her. Overall, we were very pleased - definitely recommend and we will be back!
One of my Portland favorites. Food was wonderful as always.

Hadn’t been in ages.  Not even a shadow of what it was 5 and more years ago.  The “schnitzel” is a thick piece of fried pork with a mustard sauce glopped on it - nothing like real schnitzel.  Cornbread very dry and overcooked. Puréed cauliflower, puréed sweet potatoes…too many puréed sides with no texture or flavor.  This place was so much better when Harding Smith was really involved - there is just no way he is now given what it used to be. Bring back the duck confit and meatloaf and the delicious dishes that made this place.

The Front Room is a great restaurant for date night, dinners with friends & family, special occasions or just for a bite to eat.  Our waitress was wonderful, but the kitchen must have been short staffed because it took a long time (45 mins) between the appetizers & the main meal. Our food was delicious, presentation was beautiful & kitchen staff were able to accommodate my gluten & dairy intolerance. It would be nice to have a gluten & dairy free desert option.

Have been enjoying The Front Room for years.  Harding has worked hard to maintain such high standards .. and it truly shows!  Jarry took great care of us ... as he always does!  Can't keep us away ... we'll be back!

The food was fresh, well prepared and delicious.  The Mussels surpassed any we have ever had.  The noise was very loud.  We had to almost yell to speak to each other.
However, the food was amazing and we soon didn’t care about the noise.  If ever back in Portland, we would go back.

Sorry to say the food was disappointing.  One guest had a salad with steak that was undercooked and tough.  Another had the pork schnitzel; the pork was good but the dish did not have an appealing look to it.  Third guest had a salad with seared tuna; the tuna was good but the salad was over-dressed.   I had recommended this restaurant and was very disappointed.  Won't be returning any time soon.
The atmosphere was great for an early evening meal. My wife and I raved about the food all night. It was delicious.
Neighborhood gem. Comfort food for any craving. Loved it and will go back again.
This was our first time here!  We are so happy we didn’t!  Everything was wonderful, our waiter, the ambiance, the location, the food, the drinks and we can say even the coffee!!!!

Disappointed that they were out of short ribs (a signature item) at 6:30 PM. Prices seemed high for the amount of food given (the carbonara was a small portion). Generous wine pour and excellent service including very nice hostess. Quite loud until it thinned out around 7:30. ￼
I wish I could eat mushroom toast everyday. It’s a “must have”! All the dishes are prepared exquisitely. Jerry is a fine server and very attentive.  I will definitely eat here again very soon

Our server "Jerry Gerald" was very professional and entertaining.  Enjoyed the evening......  "Farmers Salad" had WAY too much arugula - did not taste very good - ate about 25%  also Ruben was not attractively served.  Customer only ate half - table enjoyed the French fries.
Great food and attentive service.  Delightful location in East End.

This is one of three restaurants with the same owners.  The Front Room was the only one where we were successful getting a reservation for six people for a Thursday night with more than 24 hours notice.  Considering the cost of restaurant meals, this restaurant was reasonably priced--especially the price of a bottle of wine.
Staffing is also an issue everywhere, and there were clearly not enough servers here. 
But we were served fairly promptly.
The food was very good.  I had scallops, and asked the market price before confirming my order--$42.  It was listed as being on a bed of risotto, but it seemed that there were no more than two tablespoons of risotto with four scallops.  But it was sufficient for me, and very flavorful.  My dinner companions ordered the crab ragoon pasta special, salmon, and pork, all of which were large portions.  
Overall, it was a nice celebration for six old friends on an historic day:  May 30, 2024.
Food  was delicious , service was wonderful. What a great spot ! Really enjoyed our visit !
Great food and service. The restaurant is loud but worth it
Great food and attentive service.  Always great.,  just wish they could do something about the noise level.
everything was so amazing! great service and food!
Extraordinary service, delicious food and drinks! Fun, a bit noisy atmosphere.
Always love eating at the Front Room. Small but cozy.  All the staff is very accommodating, friendly and knowledgeable.
Great food and service and a friendly feel good atmosphere
Great food! Absolutely worth it, will be back for sure.
Great food and great staff - a little loud but we love the food.
our pre-race meal was great!  And the service fantastic. Will definitely go back if we are ever in Portland again.

We've become somewhat regular diners at the Front Room, enjoying a meal there every time we visit Portland. A great neighborhood spot with a laidback casual atmosphere. Excellent menu with a nice variety of fairly priced, quality dishes...none of which have left us disappointed. The lovely wait staff is always a pleasure...knowledgeable, informative, and unobtrusive but attentive. Enjoy the experience!

Terrific food and drinks. Farm salad with seared tuna was amazing as was the french onion soup. Nice selection of wines, beers and signature cocktails. We went for an early seating to catch a performance across the street at The Hill Arts Center. Perfect spot with great neighborhood Munjoy Hill ambience.
The salmon and pork loin entrees were both outstanding, as was the service!
Fabulous experience! We had a fantastic waiter, and an amazing meal; from drinks, to starters, to entrees & dessert. We had a fantastic night amongst friends and will be visiting again!
Our server was great and the food was, too. The atmosphere is very cozy and nice, although it’s really noisy.
Exceptional. Great fare and a very professional staff. Go - you won’t be disappointed!

Elise is a fantastic server! Our meal was so good. We all enjoyed it and I very much appreciate that you honored my reservation request. You can never go wrong with TFR French onion soup and I recommend the kale Caesar with seared tuna. It’s not too heavy, but fully satisfying. Leave room for dessert, the creme brulee is another constant delight.

Feel the Front Room is down from previous years. Recently tried lunch and dinner menu.
French onion soup was “off” from visits a year before. Dinner mussels and tomato soup were good but Caesar salad was hard to navigate in a too small bowl and a too large Parmesan cracker placed on top. A Front Room corn bread classic didn’t need the addition of chili butter.

Super care given to cocktails, entree and dessert. Any questions? Highly recommended restaurant in a residential neighborhood . Some towns don’t like restaurants in residential areas. They are wrong. This place is great.
10/10 the food, the service as well as the overall experience one of my favorites little places in Portland.
Great comfort food. Friendly and knowledgeable service.
We usually enjoy The Front Room, but were disappointed that several menu choices were not available, so we ended up with second choice dishes. Still, it's a good spot with good service!
Our meal was amazing and our server most especially was friendly and helpful. We had a great experience and will definitely be back next time we’re in Portland!

We were visiting Portland this weekend (party of 9) and on a sleepy Sunday night with a lot of places closed we randomly selected this restaurant because they had an opening available but we could not believe how we lucked out. The food was amazing! The service was great and the staff was very friendly and accommodating to our large group for small restaurant such as this. This is a great neighborhood gem!
Great customer service and the food was absolutely amazing
It was great! Food was good portions were large and everything was fabulous

The food was a 10 out of 10. Our waiter was so nice and the atmosphere was good. Wish there was a little more spacing between tables to have a more intimate and private conversation with my spouse. Otherwise all was great!
The dining room is comfortable and the service is helpful and amicable. The quality of the food is very high.
We started off well with efficient service of drinks and some bread and fries for the table. However, we had to wait a very long time for the main course. Food was fine, but very slow getting to us.
Everything was really nice. The only issue was that our dining table was wobbly and was not an uneven floor problem. It needs to be repaired or replaced. Other than that, a perfect meal!
The service is great. The duck dish was superb. We always have a good experience.
Wonderful server and food! I hadn’t been in a while! It is still amazing!
It was very good. We would recommend it to anyone visiting Portland. Food was so good we didn’t leave room for dessert!
Great service, food was ok but expected it to be better.
Excellent food , charming waitress and a great evening.
Consistently good quality food and excellent service!

Amazing service & amazing food. Great location right across the street from the Good Theater making it perfect for a dinner & a show. We cannot wait to return to try new items on the menu. Please note that many of the tables are close...no problem for us as we love to meet people.

Food very good, as was service, happy hour house wine, service. We go regularly to the Good Theater across the street so would like a bit more variety and appreciate  the chef's specials. Not fan of "kale" caesar salad but but the farm salad is great as is the happy hour pricing from 4-6pm
The front room is an excellent choice for dinner. Great food and service!
Somewhat  noisy, tables a little tight, otherwise I like the staff and physical space a lot.

Good food at reasonable prices.  Would love to see the meatloaf and shepherd's pie back on the menu. Nice neighborhood spot.  Service was good but it was surprising when the server dropped the F bomb a couple times.
Love the food the service and the venue.  Food always surprises us with how special it is
Chelsea our waitress was excellent. Hardworking, efficient and pleasant. The food was great as always. A noisy night but fun

New Year’s Eve, party of 2, 5:15 rez.  Had a lovely time, attentive server. Started with the deviled eggs and mussels for apps - delicious! Mussel broth was to die for - they need to give you more bread with the order!! (1 piece per person).
I ordered the schnitzel (which I love) however: it was smothered in a creamed cabbage sauce that made it all soggy - ruined it for me. The schnitzel I was able to find that wasn’t smothered was not well seasoned. This dish needs some work. (They call it braised cabbage on the menu, which would be nice on the side, but braised cabbage doesn’t usually have cream added?)
Hubby had the Waygu burger, which he liked, but it was very rich and he could only eat about half of it.
We both had crème brûlée for dessert which was absolutely fantastic perfect. Overall a good meal.
Small restaurant, quite noisy but delicious food. The pork schnitzel was huge.
You NEVER disappoint!  Everything was perfect!  Our waitress, Chelsea, was amazing.  Meal was fantastic, love my Sangria and the cherry on the top…your CRÈME BRÛLÉE was the best!!! Thank you!
What a great evening. The food was excellent and the service just as great. Thank you folks for a nice evening. The amount and quality of the food and dollars paid, well worth it. J

I’m a big fan of all the Rooms restaurants and the Front room is another great restaurant.

Smaller than the others but this adds to the atmosphere. 

Great food and an over very good experience.

I will be back for sure!

Server was pleasant and attentive. We had a Brussels sprouts and mustard starter that was huge, overcooked and at $19 overpriced. 

The schnitzel was perfectly cooked and crisp, but it had been covered with cooked red cabbage (kinda defeating the crispiness) and a scant amount of a mustard sauce.

There were supposed to be “crispy” potatoes but they had been buried under the schnitzel so they were mushy. 


We’ll try again sometime.
The food was excellent and the service was outstanding.
We had incredible service, and each of us ordered something different and they were all amazing! The restaurant was decorated nicely for the holidays too.
Excellent service and the food was amazing. It is a bit loud, but cozy and fun. My partner and I had no problem having a conversation with each other. Perfect place for a date night.
Great neighborhood restaurant. Local vibe. Really good food.

The best dinner experience we have had in quite a while! We were not told the dinner special and heard a different server tel a table that Halibut was a special- which my wife would have gotten. She loved her scallops anyway, overall the experience was outstanding….
Everyone had a great meal.  The special entree was superb!!
Great food, great service, great drinks, great time!!

We have been coming here for years and last nights meal was very disappointing. Steak was cooked well done (asked for mid-rare) was dry and just overall terrible. Our waiter was very accommodating, although the cook didn’t care.

The Corner Room has the potential to be an outstanding restaurant, the main courses just need a little help.  Service was exceptional.  The fresh oysters were delicious.  I ordered the short ribs and they were done to perfection. However, the dish was void of any vegetable with the exception of a drizzle of squash puree.  Vegetables are popular right now and something green or perhaps some mashed potatoes would improve the dish.  A big solitary hunk of rib meat does not stand well alone.  My partner had the Spaghetti Squash "pasta" with mushrooms.  The dish was soaked in an overabundance of rich cream which made it way too heavy, a little goes along ways. Much too rich and it completely masked the flavors of the squash and mushrooms. Go easy on the cream or just do without.  Quality ingredients don't need a cup of cream, they can stand alone without it.
Overall very good.  Felt like some of the dishes were very rich and creamy.  Almost a bit too much.

Food was excellent. We had the pan seared scallops and the roasted bird. Both were cooked to perfection and pleasantly seasoned. Service was slow despite it not being terribly busy. Music was jarring and way too loud for us to enjoy our conversation without raising our voices.
Food was amazing. Restaurant was too loud to have a conversation.

the food service was very slow-

we had to rush to get to the theater by 7:
What a little neighborhood gem!  Small space which was good for an intimate dinner. The service was excellent and the food was superb. Don’t miss out on going to this place.
Always a good choice. The menu options give a good variety and the food is always excellent.
DELICIOUS FUN!! Elise gave us top notch service to go along with our outstanding meal! The Front Room is great for groups, then you can try all of the starters 🫶🏼
Excellent service & yummy food.  Tables are tight together & it is noisy, only downside.
I got the beef with Chimichurri, was perfectly cooked and balanced flavors. Appetizers came out promptly, service was excellent and attentive with our two little ones (3 and 9months)
It was a bit loud but the food was excellent! Waitress was very responsive.
We had a wonderful time at the Front Room.  Our only regret was that it was a bit chilly in the dining room.
Not great ventilation so we smelled like grease/food after we left.  Food was delicious though!
Excellent meal, service and neighborhood atmosphere
Absolutely amazing from the staff to the food. Highly recommend.
We had a great meal - I had the halibut special - our waiter was attentive and apologized for the extended time it took to get our food

We had a fabulous meal. The service was friendly and helpful, the food was outstanding! I had scallops that were perfectly cooked and mushroom risotto that I will dream about. My husband had the halibut special which was equally good. The salad was also excellent (although slightly overdressed for my taste- I usually ask for dressing on the side, but forgot to do that.) The crème brûlée was great.
Need to get the cornbread skillet, it was to die for.
Great spot if your attending the theater across the street. Very convenient and the food is great!
Consistent limited menu, spotty service and loud surroundings.

I’m not sure if our waitress was new or what happened, but our food did not come out as ordered and my meal come out 15 minutes  before my partners meal … leaving me to eat in front of her (or let my meal get cold while waiting for hers). Disappointed in what we were expecting to be an excellent dining experience.

I suggest that the cost of specials be revealed when the dish is described.  I had sticker shock when receiving the bill for a $45 dish of pasta, truffled, but an informed decision to order would have been appreciated.
Very noisy.  Tables close together.  Wonderful food.
Just wanted to give a shout out to our server... Don't recall his name (bald, glasses)... He was excellent! We have had him in the past and he is always a pleasure!!
Was happy to be able to make a reservation and find easy parking but food was a little slow, it was very loud and would have been happier w slightly more quantity of food.
Pleasant evening! Food and service excellent! A little pricey but expected
Excellent Oysters followed by good dinners!  We loved the new simple menu!!
Unbelievably a delicious food.  Great location.  Jerry was attentive, engaging and made our night even better!  This is a special place for our anniversary and the past four years have delivered.
The food was delicious the restaurant was a bit crowded.  Service was excellent.

Good example of elder abuse. Assigned wait person very rude and ignored us after some unpleasantness about our table assignment. Second assignee waitperson was fine. Food good but atmosphere extremely loud and tables so close you actually rub elbows with your neighbor patron..
Great food and service. Good for theatre going, convenient and parking not a problem.
The hostess was adorable and so engaging. Our waitress made our evening very special - thank you!!!  Food was amazing, especially the scallops!
The Front Room is one of our all-time favorites in Portland!
The duck was amazing! The service was great and we love the neighborhood ambiance.

Cozy neighborhood restaurant with a friendly staff and fabulous food!  The scallops were absolutely perfect and the Halibut special was even better.  Can't wait to get back to Portland so that we can go there again.

Nice meal ... great waiter. Focaccia wasn't as tasty as expexted, however spinach sunflower seed pesto made it tastier. We requested that the focaccia be warmed up, which waiter happily obliged. Chef, consider sending warm bread to diners:) Chilled tuna & avocado appetizer was good. Kale Caesar good. My husband said best mussels he's enjoyed in a long time ... I can  add the broth was amazing (perfect for dunking the focaccia ... in addition to dunking the cheesy garlic toasts that came with the dish). Definitely worth a visit.
Food is unbelievable, wait staff are fabulous, ambiance is fantastic.  What a great place.
Gerry took care of us and the service was excellent. Great vibe in the restaurant. The food was excellent and the portions were just right. Highly recommend this restaurant!
Food and service was great (thanks Jake!!) but it was pretty noisy. We’d still go back….
Excellent food, excellent service…but a little noisy (to be expected).
Everything was terrific, as always!   Our server, Chelsea was outstanding!
Food was delicious and prepared perfectly.  Our waiter was the best. Friendly, fun and very accommodating.  Love this neighborhood eatery!!
Amazing food and staff! I'll surely be back! The noise level was a touch too high for me.
Sat outdoors on sloped sidewalk. Meals were ok. Server seemed distracted.
Super friendly and knowledgeable staff! Food was delicious!

Great place; has the vibe of a neighborhood stalwart but the food and drinks are definitely elevated! We had oysters to start with, followed by salmon and the fish sandwich entrees. Both were exceptional. Service was friendly and professional. Nice neighborhood; we enjoyed the half-hour walk back to our hotel on the waterfront.
A great meAl . Somewhat limited menu. Certain things weren’t available. The fish was good.  Pretty loud and close in there!
Visiting Portland we wanted a more local experience. This place was a home run. The smash burger was maybe the greatest invention in burger history. A perfect dinner thank you.
Excellent restaurant, service was awesome, we had a server in training shadowing another and he did awesome! A great night out.
Server was wonderful, food was very good!  Never rushed.  It is always a bit loud in the restaurant which is hard to control.

The server was fine.  The food just okay.  The guy that sat us on a Sunday night was a little rude.  I had ask for a 4 top even though we are only 2 and he told me it was reserved for 4 people.  There were 3 other 4 tops.  That 4 top was empty the whole time we were there as were 2 others.  I won't be going back and it makes me wonder about the other room resterants.
Loved every course! Great atmosphere

Asked for a quiet spot, not in the middle of the dining room. Seated in the middle and promptly told (I did question our seats). That is was too hard due to large parties and that was all that was said. (There were other tables open on the sides of the room). I had let them know that it was my guests birthday, no acknowledgement of that. Just not a great start to what was to be a celebration.

If you are deaf and your main means of communication is ASL then you shouldn’t have a problem here , otherwise don’t go. The noise level is beyond tolerable. Part of the noise can be attributed to the after work crowd sitting at the bar but would have been noisy even without them.
We shared an order of specially seasoned French fries that were featured as an appetizer. They were dry and tasted like they had been lightly dusted with Parmesan cheese. Not worth their $15.00 price. Our main dishes faired better. The salmon was moist and delicious and the scallops were juicy and large. The three scallops were on a bed of risotto that was swimming in oil instead of a creamy sauce, which was disappointing.
Dessert was a underwhelming crème brûlée. Crisp but not charred on top and the flan had no flavor.
Service was very good. Our waitress was very attentive and pleasant and handled the room well. The wait staff tag teamed and everything came out promptly.
Overall it was not pleasant. Our ears were ringing when we left.  We won’t go back.

My family and I stayed in Portland for most of the summer, and The Front Room quickly became our favorite spot. The food is delicious, and the service is delightful and well-paced. We enjoyed many items but really loved the Reuben sandwich, potatoes, and salads. Also, go for breakfast and order the Irish benedict. Also, Happy Hour, it's a great deal with $2 oysters (on Wednesdays) and wine/beer specials every night. If you sit outside, you can even glimpse the water.
The food was really good and it was a really good experience all around. String drinks also.
Great food  and atmosphere  highly recommend! We loved it
Food & drinks were all outstanding!  The pork dish and mushroom toast were the favorites for sure.
Dinner was very good.  We sat outside so the noise level wasn't an issue.
Wonderful meal, wonderful service! We can't wait to go back.
Excellent dinner choice!  Definitely has the neighborhood restaurant feel
Friendly, casual place with upscale food.  No pretense but their food is exceptional.
Little gem of a restaurant tucked a at in a residential neighborhood.

Food was absolutely delicious - I had the scallops, my daughter had the salmon. I love this place. Only reason I gave it 4 stars was that it was extremely hot inside because the air conditioning was broken

Smash burger was outstanding!!
Fun, comfortable local restaurant with great food.
Megan was a great server! The biggest issue was that one of my husband’s scallops had an ammonia taste.

Our waiter was lovely, the location and atmosphere hip and fun. The French onion soup was too sweet for our taste, tasted a bit like onion jam, and we did not care for the cocktails we ordered from the menu. The rest of the meal was superb and we had a lovely time.
The front room is a perfect neighborhood restaurant.  The food was delicious, fairly priced and interesting. It’s our “go to” restaurant where we know we will have a nice meal.
Excellent food and service. Seating is a little crowded, making for a slightly louder than desirable dining experience.
Bridg was very professional & friendly and our meals were delish - the pork loin & seared salmon!
Delicious food great wine and friendly service. Great dinner place for our family

First Date and we both had the Scallop Risotto and it was fabulous!
I had the Young Buck cocktail and it was also delicious!
This was my third visit and it is always a treat!

This neighborhood restaurant was very good and I would recommend it. The prime rib and the waygu beef smash burger were favorites. A little disappointed that they were out of both foccachia and cornbread. Nice cocktails. Our waitress, Bridge, was very good.
Chef went above and beyond to provide a delicious dining experience for us.
Food was delicious, atmosphere was cute, waitress was outstanding.
The pork and the salmon were amazing! And the truffle burrata was one of the best things we’ve had in a while. Our server Elise was also excellent! Definitely gonna go back 🙂
The 1/2 roasted chicken and Wagyu double smashed burgers were insane! Service was outstanding!
Best meal we have ever had! Burger was absolutely incredible and the scallops to die for. Definitely going back!!
Loved this place. Funky, great food and service. Reminded us of lovely , ethnic places in Cambridge MA in the 70s
This little neighborhood gem was awesome. Great atmosphere and servers.  Everything was outstanding. We will return for sure and will tell our friends. Thank you Front Door for an incredible evening.
Ordered the mushroom appetizer which was good. For main course ordered oyster burger double. Burger was so over cooked it was crispy. Only 3 oyster on top, also way over cooked.

Lovely and attentive service. The food was so delicious. I hadn’t been to The Front Room in a while- but we first came a dozen years ago. We knew it could accommodate people with different dietary needs, and it’s in town. The salmon was out of this world delicious- have not had salmon so tasty anywhere in town. Also had a spaghetti squash noodle mushroom “carbonara” that tasted like the real thing. They also give a generous pour of wine, which is unusual these days!  And an amazing pistachio cheesecake dessert. We were really pleased.  The only problem was it took a bit long for the main courses to come; appetizers came quickly.
Amazing food and the service was great! Solid playlist too which is always a nice bonus.
Always enjoy the Front Room.  The cornbread and halibut special were excellent!  Also enjoyed the Maine blueberry sangria.
The food was delicious! The dishes were plated beautifully, making my partner and I feel very fancy while eating them. The flavors of the dishes were incredible. The staff was very friendly too.
The food at the Front Room is always excellent. The meals that the four of us had were all excellent, including the special appetizer and dessert. The service was also outstanding. We will be back.
Had a fabulous time at the front room last night the meals were incredible my wife had the halibut and I had the sirloin “tgr “ our waiter jerry? Was the consumate professional
The food and drinks were fabulous; the place was rockin' as it usually is. Service was very good, but a titch slow. Thank you!
Food was outstanding and reasonable drink prices which you don’t see anywhere anymore

Wait staff was nice. Our food was cold. Sent it back twice. Then the meet was no longer medium rare. 
Disappointing for 180.00 with the tip!
Great scallops and risotto, awesome neighborhood spot

We loved our waitress, she was super friendly, knowledgeable and honest.  Food was incredible, I had the burger, my husband had the salmon and both were excellent.  Its a little out of the way, but we loved the small neighborhood vibe.
Wonderful meal - all 4 of us loved everything we ordered, salads, entrees, and dessert
Great food, awesome service. Will definitely be back!
My new favorite restaurant in Portland. Excellent food, amazing value. Charming atmosphere Attentive service. It was a lovely meal.
Very nice waiter and great food! The first time I’ve been here and had a great time
We enjoy TFR but food last night was just OK, except for the soup - Tomato Bisque which was good. The small grilled cheese that came with it was sugary with some bites.
Delicious, fun, local hangout with accurate reviews and delicious food.
Amazing food.  Just wonderful.  Very large servings
Delicious food, excellent server, cozy and friendly ambience. It was the perfect place for dinner prior to a show at The Good Theater.
Fantastic neighborhood bistro. Roast chicken was sublime.
Excellent duck dish with a delicious glass of Côtes du Rhône. Hadn’t been in a few years and I definitely won’t let that happen again!

Everything was excellent! Food and service!
Had an great evening! Server was awesome (Jerry?)
We’ll definitely be back ❤️
Our server was excellent! It’s the first time we’ve had dinner here (we’re huge fans of their finch). The noise level was almost unbearable. Food was good.
Great service and good food.  Fun atmosphere to get together with friends.

Service was fantastic, waitress was fun and energetic.
Food was nothing short of amazing
Mushroom toast
Tuna Crudo
Seared scallops all highly recomended
Get reservations, it is worth it.  Great choice of food and even better service.  Small intimate atmosphere.
Always a great meal!!  Fresh from the start!!  Mussels are outstanding!!
Wonderful food, each dish was better than the next! We will certainly be back!

We have enjoyed meeting our son and daughter-in-law at The Front Room over the years, since they live nearby. My meal was of Farm Salad and Bangs Island Mussels was delicious, but I was disappointed to find that our two favorite things were not on the menu: deviled eggs and lamb shepherd's pie. I would have been happier with a salad half the size, but I'm also sympathetic to the current economic situation for small restaurants and the resulting menu choices. The Jameson whiskey chocolate dessert was just amazing.
This is a fun “pub” with excellent food and friendly wait staff. Our only complaint (ever) is that it gets noisy. But we go Ty to return 😎
An incredible dinner! The food was amazing, the service was unbeatable, and the atmosphere was just perfect. If you’re looking for a great local gem, this is it.

The food was absolutely outstanding.  Try the cornbread, it was unbelievable.
Our server was really friendly, we had the traveller and he was very nice.

The only complaint we have is there was a big party beside us who seemed to be oblivious to the fact that there were other diners in the restaurant.  They were very loud making it difficult to carry on a conversation.  Even the waiter had to bend over so he could hear our order.  Other than that, the food was delicious, wait staff were very attentive and pleasant.
Friendly staff, on time seating. Menu selection was good.  Apps arrived fast but entrees took a while to come out. We were there for 2+ hours. Food was good. Waiter seemed new.

We will definitely be back again.  If we had any complaints, our table was in an extremely cold section with a draft and kept getting bumped when people walked by.  Other than that, everything was amazing
Fast & friendly
Great food and ambience. Wonderful server. Just a bit noisy. Music makes it harder to have conversations.

First time at the Front room and loved the experience! We had tickets to the Good Theater right across the street so the location of the restaurant was perfect! This restaurant should be in Portland Maine's top 10! The food was delicious, I had Bang Island mussels and the delicious half chicken. We arrived during Happy Hour which was an additional bonus. I'll definitely be back again soon!
Eaten here many times. The menu has changed but still great. Waitress very knowledgeable.

Normally I love this restaurant but the cocktails ordered off the menu weren’t very good and the food wasn’t up to their usual standards (pork was flavorful but fatty and hard to cut in the bowl, odd presentation). Ill be back but a little disappointed.
One of my favorite spots in Portland. Great, cozy atmosphere- generous pour on the wine, and the food is outstanding!
Excellent atmosphere.  Friendly and attentive staff.  The food was excellent!
Never disappoints! The mushroom toast is a triumph!
Our server was amazing and the food was really good! We will definitely be coming back again!
Food was great. Little pricey, but worth it. Bee Sting martini was on point.
Always a great combination of flavorful and adventurous with good comfort food at Front Room. Something for everyone. And now they take reservations!!!!!
Enjoyed our meal and excellent service! Easy access for parking.
Great food!  Local handout atmosphere.  Service was good. Tables a little close and it is noisy but we still liked it a lot. We will return.

The Front Room is a longtime favorite of mine. The menu is totally revamped - I was looking forward to trying some new things. My salad was not thrilling - thin sliced but extremely large pieces of red & white radish - bland salad dressing. Basically difficult to eat. Interesting combinations for the mains, but some of the flavor combinations really didn’t succeed in my opinion. Hope the next time will be improved.
Great food and awesome service!
The Front Room never disappoints. The service was outstanding as were our meals.
Food was really good and our server, Jerry, was delightful! _^..^_

We have never been disappointed at The Front Room.  The service was professionally friendly.  The new bartender was well informed and helped gave us the list of specials as we waited for our table.  We had arrived a littl early.  the waiter check on us without being a pest and was helpful with the timing of our meal.  We will be back!

Our server, Jerry, was lovely - super friendly & attentive. The food was so good - as it always is! We had the whipped smoked ricotta which was delicious - we then had the duck and scallop entrees. I couldn’t eat mine fast enough :) great time, great food, great service A+
It is a great neighborhood place for dinner and a drink
This place is packed and VERY NOISY on a Saturday night! Cocktails very reasonably priced. Food good but high-middle priced — even bread?! Loved our server Aiden.
Everything was fantastic! Service, food, beverages, atmosphere! Will definitely be back. Thanks for making our night wonderful.
We love this cozy neighborhood spot! Great food, friendly staff and in the prettiest part of Portland.

I am not a fan of the new menu. It’s very limited and lacks diversity like the last menu. I miss the meatloaf, egg sandwich, tacos, and the hangar steak.  I should not have ordered the TGR steak as it had too many distracting toppings and hot flavors. The French Onion Soup was burned.
Enjoyed dining here.  40 minutes between app and entree a bit too long.  Good comfort food.

The Front Room was a welcome surprise. We had not been there before. Parking was easy and close. The table was a ready. Our server, Dustin was Polite, professional, personable and attentive, but not too much. The food was excellent. The scallops were cooked perfectly and the Lamb meat balls were a feast for the palate. The squash spagetti carbonara was delicious and new for me. It was a to  pleasure to eat there and we both are looking forward to our next visit.

The Front Room was a welcome surprise. We had not been there before. Parking was easy and close. The table was a ready. Our server, Dustin was Polite, professional, personable and attentive, but not too much. The food was excellent. The scallops were cooked perfectly and the Lamb meat balls were a feast for the palate. The squash spagetti carbonara was delicious and new for me. It was a to  pleasure to eat there and we both are looking forward to our next visit.

Great neighborhood gathering place. We had been to their other location...the Corner Room which we loved so wanted to try the Front Room.
Worth the trip.

Surprised to find a completely  different menu.
An awful lot of kale used-both as a vegetable and garnish.
The Front Room has very good food, friendly service but is very noisy!!! Thank everyone
Great food, as always.  Our server, Aiden, was terrific!
Everything was delicious- there were 6 of us and everyone loved their meals.  The service was friendly and upbeat.

The food menu is now very limited.
Hope the muscles change soon from the current coconut/curry.
Always one of my favorite items there in the past.
Salads were FABULOUS!
Cocktails excellent!
Service SUPERB!

Great food.. great drinks

Wonderful experience

The new menu is over the top. Elegant but still comfort food. Perfect swordfish, salmon and pork. Also plenty for the vegetarian in our group The best value we have had in post Covid. We are glad the Front Room is back.
Jerry, our server was outstanding as was the food!   Love this place!
Food was amazing. Our server, Jerry, recommended us a few things on the menu. He was phenomenal! Would highly recommend to anyone.
Absolutely delicious! We enjoyed some apps and then the short ribs, salmon, and swordfish. Everything was delicious. The kale on the side was amazing!!

The menu was pretty limited and 2 of our 3 dishes had issues.  The bacon wrapped trout was very difficult to eat.  The sirloin steak was undercooked.  I did like the ambience and the vibe and the server.
Absolutely loved every part of dining at The Front Room! Friendly staff, incredible food & tasty drinks! A must try for sure!

The Front Room has a wonderful ambiance and the service was excellent.  Having never been there we relied upon the Open Table tab and menu review to select this spot for dinner.  The menu at the restaurant lacked a significant number of offerings listed online.    No salads to start.  The main dish of pork was excellent.  My wife literally had no choices that worked nor did her sister.  Not vegans, they chose vegetable lasagna.  In 37 years of marriage my wife has never chosen that.  She did given the limited choices.  Neither my wife nor her sister ate the dish.  I tried it.  It literally was tasteless.  I can't say it was bad, it just didn't taste at all.   Apple pie fantastic.  Moral of the story, if the love of your life isn't happy YOU aren't either.
Chef/Owner Harding Lee Smith is extremely creative and inventive. The two dinners we had there under his helm have been THE best dinners we have ever had. Already made another reservation to go back!

The food at this neighborhood gem was outstanding, start to finish. The server told us that the current chef had implemented a seasonal, farm-to-table menu, so I am not sure how quickly it will change. We started with a tuna tartare with black garlic aioli that had us practically licking the plate. Followed it with a delicious farm salad with arugula, apples, radishes and goat cheese. I had the cassoulet for my main course, while my companion had a cedar plank cooked salmon. Both were perfect. I would recommend this restaurant without hesitation. A great dining experience!

Service was friendly and attentive; atmosphere is bistro/pub/kitchen; only comlaint I have regarding my dinner, is that the small, whole, onions on my plate were very undercooked and inedible. The wine, however, was delish and a very good pour.
Miss the old neighborhood vibe!  Liked it better when you could grab a burger or sandwich for dinner.
THEY WERE CLOSED!!! NO NOTICE GIVEN!!!!

We each ordered the lamb burger and were surprised (but maybe should not have been) that there was nothing else on the plate - no fries, no nothing.  I guess this may be the new normal, but for the price of the burger, in the old days, that would include fries.  I understand they are between chefs now and the food was fine enough although my medium rare burger was a bit on the more medium side.  Gripey? Perhaps.  I know it's been very tough during and coming out of the pandemic.  Our server, on the other hand, was a complete delight!
Food outstanding.   Server Jerry outstanding as well
Excellent dinner and dessert and amazing waiter!!!

We really wanted to like our meal here but it seemed everything was against this. The front door was kept open all evening making it quite cold. Like many places these days they were seriously understaffed and the ones there were very stressed. The noise level was so loud we couldn’t hold a conversation. The worst part was the food- I ordered the pork and it was drowning in a cloying sweet sauce. I was struggling to cut it until someone came around to check and offered a steak knife. It was a large serving but there was so much sauce I was afraid it would get everywhere as I attempted to cut it up. My husband had the duck and it was under seasoned and nothing special. At the price of each entree one expects more care and effort.
The restaurant was very crowded and noisy. The food was not exceptional. I received my meal 10 minutes before my husband received his. The cornbread was really good!
Worst prime rib I've ever had; potatoes were tasteless. My husband enjoyed his lobster sandwich. Liked the vibe but no where near worth the price. Won't be returning.

Harding Smith was the chef the evening we visited The Front Room and it was a pleasure to be there. Unfortunately my husband’s steak was a little over-cooked, but the food overall was delicious. We will always consider TFR to be one of our favorite, go-to restaurants in Portland.
Such good foodie food. Chefs playground!
Fantastic as usual
Ran out of short rib by 7 pm. All good came out at once except for the lamb burger ( of all things would seem the easiest). Ten minutes later it came. The chicken I ordered extra crispy was not.
Very quaint Excellent menu good service Did not rush you even though busy
Food was cold and the waiter was a jerk.
Excellent meal! Great “comfort food” style menu. Definitely would return on a future visit to Portland

The food was hit or miss. Mostly miss. It seems like many things were mis-described on the menu. 
 I started with a blueberry seltzer- it turned out to be a blueberry cider - the can didn’t say “seltzer” anywhere but the menu did. The online menu, which we viewed to make our reservations still listed the duck meatballs with whipped ricotta but the menu didn’t have them because the chef moved on and took the recipe with him. 
Our group ordered the poutine, the mussels, and the peppers with aioli for an appetizer.  The peppers were good, the mussels were great and the poutine was…not poutine. It was polenta fries. Which was fine because the menu said polenta fries but they were more like bricks. We then tried to order crispy chicken sandwiches and front room salads. They were out of chicken so we settled for carnitas tacos and steak. The pork carnitas were made of pork belly which was extremely fatty and the fat was not rendered properly, plus the pork belly was slightly cold. The tortillas were so strongly flavorful that they overpowered the rest of the dish. We each took a bite of our taco and didn’t finish. The salads were interesting but the dressing was under seasoned. The steak was cooked properly as ordered but not seasoned at all. Wanted to like the place because the ambiance was interesting and the server was great but the food was so disappointing we won’t be back.
Both food and service was great. Although we both loved the recommendations we want to come back and try more! Very happy with all Rooms!

What an excellent dining experience! We loved the small, intimate neighborhood feel. The wait-staff is professional and welcoming. Food is incredible! The only concern a diner should consider is that the small intimate atmosphere does not lend itself well for people who have hearing issues. The proximity of tables, size of room and the open kitchen can make it hard for people to hear each other at the table.
Great food and service as always
Love The Front Room! Always great food and service. Happy that you can make a reservation.

Great neighborhood place! We had a new server, so service was solid but made a couple mistakes. The food was amazing, great selection of wines by the glass and half-carafe and local beers on tap. They have updated the furniture and the vibe is awesome.

Wouldn’t recommend. The staff is not friendly at all, when we asked the person that was seating us if we could sit by the window he copped an attitude and said they’re all reserved, and the place Wes almost empty, and empty when we left too. He threw our water on the table and told everyone on the staff we were rude. He was just a kid and not professional at all. Macaroni and cheese was good, and our server was the only pleasant person in the place. Still would not go back. Plenty of other places in Portland that I’m sure would appreciate our business.

Wouldn’t recommend. The staff is not friendly at all, when we asked the person that was seating us if we could sit by the window he copped an attitude and said they’re all reserved, and the place Wes almost empty, and empty when we left too. He threw our water on the table and told everyone on the staff we were rude. He was just a kid and not professional at all. Macaroni and cheese was good, and our server was the only pleasant person in the place. Still would not go back. Plenty of other places in Portland that I’m sure would appreciate our business.
We had the best experience at The Front Room! The waitstaff was personable, funny and engaging. The food, the food was delicious! We are already talking about what we will order the next time we go!
Food is always dependably good, and service as well. Easy to secure a reservation on a busy summer evening. Indoor noise level can be off-putting at times.

The Front Room had outstanding food for a very reasonable price! The wait staff was really hustling and the food is cooked to order so although it takes a little while to come it’s worth the wait! So sit back enjoy a cocktail and an app!
A little disappointed in my dinner, but it’s just one miss. Nothing that will stop a return. Great, friendly service and feels like such a neighborhood place…
Great atmosphere and prices were reasonable!

Maybe the A/C was broken, or because it’s in Maine, maybe nonexistent, but the indoor dining room was sweltering & noisy. Although our service was attentive, the food was mediocre, certainly compared to similarly priced places in town. Good thing there are many options, since we probably won’t return.
Great service. The sirloin steak and jambalaya were fantastic. We finished with a piece of blueberry pie a la mode. We will be back. Grab a gin and tonic!
Wonderful dinner yet they need to install AC for the summer months

Waitstaff was good. That's the end of the positives.
Noise level inside was turned up to 11. It's always loud but this was LOUD. We moved outside, which was good. The breeze was nice and even the noise of buses and Harleys was better than the inside. 
Food? well, it was fine except for the foreign object in the mashed potatoes...a hard, thick, mystery disk about the size of a quarter. I discovered it when I took a big mouthful. Disgusting. It was not organic, I know that.
I pointed it out to our waitress who said she would talk to the manager about it. 
Then...nothing...not a word. 
I am not the type to complain about service in a restaurant. I get it. A busy Saturday night. But am I wrong to expect someone to apologize? At least?
I've been to Front Room many times over the years. I will not be returning.
Our waiter was excellent.  He was attentive, friendly, and funny.  The food was excellent.

Our server was delightful and efficient. We started with the special (duck meatballs) and they were a perfect dish. We also had the mac & cheese and chix pot pie…both were tasty and unique. We plan to return and return and return. Great night! #kindreviews
A great vibe, was hoping to sit outside but nothing open. Since we were seated inside I’d rather that. Watch the chefs, cool vibe and very good food. We’ll be back.
No AC, staff was friendly but food wasn’t as good as it been in the past. It used to be a staple for us  but it was Meh
Visiting from New York. Booked on open table . Such a cute space. The drinks and food are very good. Quiet neighborhood
Great little neighborhood gem. Good food, fun atmosphere

Dinner seated outside. Great Caesar salad, half chicken with mashed potatoes, and salmon special. The duck meatballs were unexceptional other than being duck, Brussels sprout appetizer was very good although a bit al dente, chicken was excellent.

Good neighborhood location with fair prices. Service was friendly and good. Food was good and bad (order basics not complicated items). Overall a good quick evening for a local spot. Nothing to go our of your way for -
Nice spot for eating outside! Menu has many things to satisfy every one!
Always a very dependable place for good food, service and value.

The food was delicious in the service was great. There was no air-conditioning and that was really unfortunate because it was very hot in the restaurant, which made it hard to fully enjoy the evening. Other than that, I would highly recommend the front room.
Food was fantastic as always.
Amazing food and service.  Front Room never disappoints!
Open Table sent me an email that I was no show. Not true.
Loved getting back after two + years away. Missed some of the old employees no longer there. Still very nice experience with good food and happy hour drinks!
Good food, in-experienced server and bartender

We got a little bit of everything and it was all SO good! Our server was great and the atmosphere was chill. It’s a comfy, homey spot that is brought to the next level with a top notch menu. Would love to come back again!
Every one enjoyed their meal and we appreciated a table for 4 outdoors.
Everything was lovely
Excellent food! Serve was wonderful! I would go back!
Food, drinks and service are excellent.
Loved it. Great service. Excellent dinner. Salmon and scallops were terrific. Short rib poutine alone was worth going back for.

We have eaten at The Front Room for years and always thought it was great! Not so much yesterday. Scallops were good, the Short Ribs were dry and not very appetizing. 
We’ll try it again but must improve service and food.

Excellent meal in a casual, almost pub like atmosphere, feels like a friendly neighborhood favorite, but the food is FANTASTIC. Comfort food plus some more complex dishes make it a very fun menu. Fun cocktail list. It was quite loud when we started our meal, but as the crowd thinned out later in the evening it was much quieter. Portions are generous and prices very reasonable for Portland food scene. Loved it, will be back!
Didn’t have our Open Table reservation, but everything else was great
It was quaint and comfortable.. the food was delicious!
It’s a solid fine. Cozy neighborhood joint for a regular night out. Maybe not a great option for a special occasion. Friendly and good service.
Wonderful experience! Would go again tonight
Great cozy space!  Mussels,Scallop dish, Cubano sandwich, and Reuben delicious.
Mother’s Day
Mother’s Day

Food was amazing. The spot we were in was by the bathroom and looked like it was just added there last minute. The worst part was when I was sitting against the wall my back was half on the window molding and the other half on the wall. It was not comfortable. Other than that; the food and service was amazing

Came for a birthday dinner and had a 7pm reservation. Our table was not ready and we did have to wait a while, but the hostess kept us informed all along. We all had something different from the menu and each dish was excellent. Very enjoyable evening.
Good food, good service.  Neighborhood feel

Every time I come to this restaurant I want to like it. I really really do. But every time I leave and I ask myself, “why did I come here again?” The service is OK, the food is OK, and the prices are not exactly commensurate with quality. It does have a nice neighborhood feel to it, though, which keeps me and I’m sure others coming back.

And when I do, I’ll go through the exact same head scratching afterwards. “Why did I come here again…”
Scallop special with white wine asparagus risotto was the best I've had. Great atmosphere and service.

The food was very good (although the Brussel sprouts appetizer was slightly under-cooked). The service and selections ate excellent. Unfortunately the noise was overwhelming. The kitchen is open to the dining area and the tables are packed in tightly. This creates a busy, noisy ambiance and, if you are hearing-impaired or like me you are still Covid aware, produces a sense of anxiety. Because of these reservations, not sure if we’ll return.

I used to frequent The Front Room years ago. Loved the brown bread. The local Casco Bay fish entrees like cod and salmon. I decided to go back recently for dinner. Menu had changed. No brown bread. No local fish entrees other than mollusks - mussels in a soup or scallops only. I can't eat shellfish. So, I opted for a Reuben, the Front Room house salad and a side of roasted brussel sprouts. Sandwich was tasty. That was the one bright spot. The salad though was bland (dressing was more just oil than a vinaigrette) - no attempt at flavor, and I could barely stomach the brussel sprouts. So bitter. Hard. Undercooked. Too big. Couldn't finish. Too bad it changed.

We were in Portland  for two days. Had dinner at the Front Room the first night, amazing! When my husband asked where we were going the second night, I said The Front Room. Why tamper with perfection?!
Attentive and kind wait staff. Great menu choices. Accomdating to food concerns. Not the best French Onion soup I've had (not much taste to it) but other items I had were delicious.

Cozy neighborhood place with nice variety in the menu and good service. Although they out of the appetizers we wanted, the server offered a bread basket as we finished cocktails. The salads (Caesar and Front Room) were quite good. The meatloaf and chicken pot pie were wonderful. The wines by the glass were good and not overpriced. The creme brulee was terrific.
A cozy warm place with attentive wait staff and bartender. Prices are very reasonable.
The server was friendly and efficient, the food was hot and good and the service was excellent. Very fairly priced.
Great meal, service and value! Can’t wait to go again!
Food and drinks are great, portions equivalent to price and lots of different options to please everyone.

Very disappointing.  This is the 4th time I have been here but I doubt I will return.  Three of four entrees were lukewarm or cold when served and we were told they could not be warmed up due to Covid restrictions.   The fourth entrée, the fried chicken sandwich,  has less chicken than 2 McNuggetts.  

They comped a soup but I would have preferred a hot meal.

We had an outstanding meal in a great atmosphere. The service was quick and just right. Friendly but not obtrusive. The food was delicious, the best scallops I’ve ever had. The portions were generous but not overwhelming. The focaccia bread was fantastic as well as the Brussels sprouts. We will certainly return to the Front Room.
Small place. Tables very close to each other. Food was very good. Drinks very good. Service excellent.
The Front Room is one of the best restaurants in the East End. Food is always amazing, and the ambiance is very cozy!
The Front Room is our favorite place to go in Portland! Always great service and food!
Great place. Good for pre-theater. The Duck Confit was fantastic. Service excellent as  usual.
The food here is consistently delicious.
Fabulous food and service
Outstanding service, everything came to the table so timely and the food was excellent.
Amazing local scallops in a unique buttery mustard sauce!

Front room is always a favorite. Love that I can now reserve using OpenTable. Food always delicious; it is a loud atmosphere, but we don't mind that at all. Great cocktails and wine. Service is always great. Have been many times and always enjoy, especially paired with a show at Good Theatre across the street.
Great place to eat before the theatre. The food is always good and plentiful. The service excellent.
Very cute place and the food was amazing!! It was relatively busy even at 8pm but the service was quick and very attentive.
We both had great meals and brought half home!  The rositto was the best ever as well as the steak. Great service!
Drinks and food were delicious. Great neighborhood spot in a comfortable environment.
Had a very nice date night with my wife. The scallops were cooked perfectly. The bread was some of the best around. The value is very good. We will be back again for sure.
Food was amazing as always. Great portions, great prices. Our waiter was very attentive and very kind. One of our favorite spots!

We had a great meal and our server was pleasant and attentive without being obtrusive. The atmosphere is comfortable and inviting and the noise level for me is just the way I like it. Not so quiet that you feel the need to whisper so not to be overheard by the next table, but not so loud that you need to scream at people in order to be heard.  Keep up the good work. We will be back.

Tom

Our reservation was for 7 o’clock and we were seated after just a very brief wait by a lovely host. We had a very knowledgeable and friendly server. We started with mussels, the mussels were flavored well and had a delicious broth. The one piece of bread that accompanied the dish was limp and thin. The steak was ok, not well flavored but cooked as requested, the sides were delicious. Dinner #2 was a combo of 2 apps, the Parmesan risotto and the chicken lettuce wraps, what a let down. The risotto was a gluey salt clump, and I like my food salted, this was inedible, the lettuce wraps were greasy and the “pickled” carrots were limp matchsticks. Our third dinner companion had the French onion soup that was delivered to the table literally boiling and took close to 20 minutes before she could eat it, it was worth the wait, good flavor and savory. The goat cheese and beet salad was ok, not much flavor and the bland sherry vinaigrette did not dress it up. We have been to the Front Room on many occasions and this was by far the most disappointing food wise, the service was excellent and the highlight of my dining experience was the Blueberry Sangria.
The food was spectacular! Some of the best food I have had in Portland for sure. Service was great, it was our servers first night, I would never have known!
The menu listed on the website isn’t updated. Food was meh.
We went here for New Years dinner and it could not have been better. The food is eclectic and delicious!
This place is one of my faves.. Always consistent!! Love it
Food is always delicious! Wait staff hustle and are so attentive and fun! We keep going back!
Our dinners and server were excellent.  Soups are so good and we appreciate the fact that they are not overly salted.  Our server was very attentive, although very busy.
Our dinners and server were excellent.  Soups are so good and we appreciate the fact that they are not overly salted.  Our server was very attentive, although very busy.
The scallops were outstanding as was our waitress/server.  It was a total satisfying experience!  Looking forward to our next visit
Excellent meal and service - be prepared to sit shoulder to shoulder with the general public.
A neighborhood gem.
Fabulous comfort food in a casual but comfortable neighborhood setting.  The BEST shepherds pie, and very fresh salads.  Other items looked good as well.

The Front Room never disappoints. The food was amazing! I had the scallops. They were cooked perfectly, the sauce was amazing and the mashed potatoes and spinach were delicious. The drinks were top notch as well. I had a Lady Slipper and a Bee Sting. Perfection!
Good meal, but not their best effort

Great place for a family dinner after seeing the Nutcracker @ Merrill Auditorium.  Cocktails were good, appetizers, duck toast, mussels and deviled eggs were all very tasty. Meals for 8, adults and kids were all enjoyable!

Birthday dinner :)

My husband and I lived in Portland for many years and Front Room was always a go to restaurant! We made it back and it surely didn’t disappoint !!!
Great food, great server
Dinner was very good, and service was excellent.  Only knocked off a star for the roasted brussel sprouts appetizer... could've used more roasting!

Great small restaurant. Excellent food but could use more servers.
Great for before theatre.
We went after the theater to have dinner and were very pleased to be seated immediately and welcomed. The service was great and the food outstanding.  Sea food is cooked perfectly.
Food and service were great!
Great service and delicious food. They start with homemade foccacia bread and oil- it's so light and heavenly- we almost wanted to make it our meal.
Everyone did a great job from the minute we walked in.  Would absolutely go back.
Our first time here - absolutely loved all of it!  Food and service were superb.  Will be back.
Great service and the food was excellent.
Fantastic as always
Wonderful dining experience - food, service, drinks ambiance - all great
Fantastic as always

It was pretty loud when we got there.  Super close seating for pandemic, vaccine or not.  Roasted chicken had little seasoning,  grilled meatloaf was decent but had chili powder in in making it less like meatloaf.  The server forgot my diet coke as well as the parmesan risotto that we ordered.  Food was moderately priced.  It seems as if they changed chefs.  We returned for breakfast the next morning.  The “gnocchi” was not gnocchi it was more of a potato pancake bite.  The sausage gravy is also a shadow of its former self.  We now for the first time in 3 visits to Portland going to try another breakfast place.
Great food, excellent value.  They were incredibly busy so it took about 15 min after we arrived for our reservation, but ultimately not a big deal.  Great atmosphere!
Good food, great service. The menu could use to be freshened up.
Family dinner celebrating our sons first performance with Portland Ballet. Food was delicious, drinks were good. Service was good considering we were a large party.
Accommodated my party of 10 and made us feel welcome. Food was good and was prepared quickly. Great place.
Meal was fair
Definitely one of our favorite spots to go in Portland! Always great service and if you are looking for comfort food this is the place!

We hadn't been to the Front Room in 8 years and its far better then we could of imagined.  Our waiter was attentive, professional, fun and informative.  Best resaurant dinners and desserts that we have experienced in years.
Jerry is a great waiter & we both enjoyed the swordfish special.

We have enjoyed dining at the Front Room many times but our recent visit was exceptional. While we had a reservation our seating was delayed because another table had lingered beyond the norm. The waiter, realizing we had a time crunch, went way out of his way once we were seated to ensure our order was handled quickly and did so with extreme good humor. We had a great dinner and were able to get to our final destination on time and without feeling stressed. Overall it was a very enjoyable experience.
Excellent service and food to die for!   Everything was perfect

We both like that comfort food menu here. Starters were the tomato soup and the french onion. The tomato soup was very tomato forward and would have benefited from a touch of cream and spices. My french onion soup was spot on. Entrees were the grilled meatloaf (really good and ample portion) and the pasta carbonara (just right on the portion size, but could benefited from more cheese). My wife enjoyed her "Young Buck" cocktail and my PBR was chilled to perfection. Jerry C was our server and he provided outstanding friendly service. We will be back again and again.
Amazing experience!! I’ve only been for breakfast and always so happy but dinner was incredible! Fast service and amazing food and drinks. Can’t wait to go back
The Front room is a great place. The food, atmosphere and convince to the theatre is great. We have always had very good service and choices of specials.
Good food, great service, good value.    Very comfortable experience

We had a great night at The Front Room.  The Muscles were divine and the Blue Plate Special did not disappoint - the freshest roast haddock! Thanks to our server Jerry for taking such good care of us.  Will be back for the fish sticks -- they had sold out!

The food at The Front Room is amazing!!! This was my second visit and everything we had was super delicious! The servers are very nice and efficient. I would highly recommend this small but excellent restaurant. Be sure to make a reservation as the place is small but worth it!
Amazing chicken sandwich and deviled eggs
The food and the service was great. The noise level is a bit high, but in more of a good energy way. We will definitely return!
Thank goodness you still have all the favorites! The Shepherd's Pie and Short Ribs are to die for!
Great night out and wonderful food

My husband and I went for a special occasion. The deep fryer was out, so I couldn’t get the fish sticks and my eggplant Parma was so so. Breaded and drowning in sauce and cheese. My husbands sword fish was very good. Patio was great.
Great food! Staff is super friendly and accommodating.
Always a pleasure to dine at The Front Room - excellent food, service and atmosphere!

Our dining experience was pleasant and the food was delicious!  Booking a table online for 8 people was easy via Open Table, I got a phone call to confirm and reassure me.  The service was attentive and the food had a great variety of options and we enjoyed all our dishes.  The ambiance was a bit too noisy and hot but didn't stop us to have a wonderful time.  Loved the specials Lobster Rissoto, and mushroom soup!  Yum!

Everything was great until we tried to order dessert snd the waitress they only had 6 creme brûlée in the beginning of the night but then when we tried to order dessert they were none left and they had no other dessert to offer!
Bummer because in our house there’s nothing like a good dessert after a great meal. 
This is why I didn’t rate it a 5 stars
Swordfish was great & so was our waiter, Jerry.
Exciting special last night, Duck, to go along with their usual offerings and both entrees were delicious. Cocktails were also perfect. Another great evening at the Front Room!

Great to be back at the Front Room. Missed dining here over the last two years. Everything was as great as we remembered. Food well prepared. So wonderful to see the chefs enjoying their evening as much as we did. Alexandra provided excellent customer service. Give her a raise. The only area for improvement would be for the hostess to remind those who linger after dining that there are those waiting with reservations. You require us to be on time yet let others linger to make us wait for our reservation. We watched. Your guests were finished. It was not cleaning protocols that caused the late table seating. Thanks again for your quality restaurant.
Ate inside and had an excellent dinner and great service.
The food was amazing, as always, and the staff were very friendly and attentive. Definitely worth a visit!!

We haven't been here for many years.  As we remembered. it was very good.  The service was good,  we were very comfortable and our appetizers, entrees and desert were all very good.  The  one letdown was the caesar salad as the dressing was very bland, there wasn't enough of it and we missed the lack of cheese on the salad. The chicken liver mousse was delicious but the portion was small.
We thought the cost was on the higher end of what you might expect from a very nice restaurant but it was a very nice dining experience.
The service was great my salad was excellent and it was loud outside due to a fight in the square. Not a relaxing outdoor environment but I bet outside is much better.

In the past, it has always been great to go to David's Restaurant for special occasions. I am a local foodie & cook, so going out to eat is treat. (I booked a table for two before seeing the Candlight Music show just across the street.)

Sadly, I was very disappointed with this last visit. It was a hot night, no AC, and the door was open. We were told the AC couldn't keep up. There was little air until the rain came an hour later.

Our drinks were good, although they were way over-priced at $14-19 for a glass of wine. We ordered 2 shrimp appetizers that arrived uncooked, not once but twice. It was removed from our bill. Instead, we ordered a mushroom tarlete that was fine, nothing special. It accompanied a Bruchetta that was not Mediterranean as listed but more Asian Fusion. It was soggy and crunchy from Seasame Seeds.

The staff was nice. The waitress tried hard and was responsive and apologized for the raw seafood. We appreciate that it was not her fault.

We shared our meals of Fried Haddock and a Lobster Roll, about $36+ each. The fish was good but a bit thin. The lobster was delicious and a fair amount on a toasted roll. They provided more mayo when requested. The side salads were fine but uninspired.

The worst part of my evening besides the shrimp was the kitchen cook yelling out for oder pick-ups every five minutes or so - like a short order cook in a diner. It was jarring and interrupted my fine dining experience.  There must be a better way. Pagers? I can't imagine how it was for the people at the bar surrounding the hot kitchen.

In their favor, they gave each of us a free dessert. One was a chocolate cake, and the other was a cookie and cream ice cream dessert, with coffees. The bill was over $200 (minus the shrimp at $36). We tipped her on the total.

I think it's getting harder to find a good, nearby restaurant with consistently good food that isn't way over-priced.

David's has become our go to restaurant in Portland and yesterday didn't disappoint. The three of us had different meals and each was great. As ever the service was attentive without hovering. I highly recommend David's for any occasion.
Excellent meal and service, will definitely be back!

It was supposed to be a special evening with friends at David's.  Unfortunately, our experience at David's was terrible.  The most disturbing thing about the evening was our server.  He wanted to immediately take our dinner order before we even had our drinks or had ordered appetizers.  We felt like he was rushing to get us out of there.  Before we ordered anything we asked for separate checks (one for each couple).  He looked at us and said "what? you want 4 separate checks" (sarcastically).  We replied, "no, we would like two separate checks, one for each couple".  Then he asked again what we wanted for dinner - again, before we even received our appetizers.  Now for the food.  My husband had the haddock with green chile sauce - overcooked and dry.  My friend had a filet - cooked perfectly but almost inedible as it was so tough.  Another had the meatloaf which was fine.  Our friends ordered a ceaser salad - which they never got.  When they told the server that they did not get the salad - after their main course arrived, he argued with them saying "are you sure, I'm sure I brought it to the table".  Are you kidding me???  Did he think they hid the salad under the table? or ate it and disposed of the plate?  How absurd is that?  Then, the coup de grace - time for the check.  He brings it over and it is not in 2 separate checks.  He said "well, just split it down the middle".  Well we did not want to do that and told him when we first sat down.  He then basically said - too bad, we can't do that, you'll just have to split it in half.  Wow, wow, wow.  What a terrible, terrible evening.  We will never, ever go back to David's, even though they took the awful steak off the bill.  The restaurant was not overly busy, there were plenty of empty tables so there was no reason for the rushed treatment, and certainly no reason for the servers rude behavior, or the terrible food.
