My wife and I are in a tour of New England. Trip advisor recommended David’s and it was right. This is a phenomenal restaurant. The open face lobster ravioli was wonderful and David’s ice cream is a must order.
Excellent service and food. Very much enjoyed the Caesar Salad, calamari, Cauliflower steak and Garlicky Haddock and shrimp!  Watermelon Margaritas were a nice touch on a warm summer night.

Food was excellent. The staff was great and they also sat us in a preferred area upon arrival. Can't say enough good things about all the food and the quality of the menu. I would highly recommend to anyone.

A comfortable space with friendly and knowledgeable staff. The food was not anything special. My sirloin steak was actually rare which is how I ordered it. Most restaurants don’t cook it correctly. But it had little flavor and chewy
Had a fantastic experience with my wife. Outstanding food quality.

I had a great dinner with my two neices. We stayed a long time and our server was great at staying on top of our needs but letting us sit and chat.  Food was great, and the white burgundy we had was excellent!
Food was very standard. Our server was OK and very professional. Unfortunately not a place for me.

Great restaurant! We were visiting from out of state so we wanted one last seafood fix but with other options as well. They had the perfect mix of food and DELICIOUS, creative dishes. Staff was so kind and the drinks were also great. Located walking distance from the water so we got to stroll around after dinner. Highly recommend!!

Exceptionally tasty food
Attentive service
Will be back thank you!
Amazing! If you get the chance, go. Absolutely delicious. I dropped $250 on a dinner for 2 (bottle of wine, apps, entrees, dessert and tip) and I'd do it again. Worth every penny!
Another great meal at David’s! Really nice atmosphere and those garlic knots are to die for.
Business dinner with clients. Great service. Great food.

Each of the three of us all had something different meals and each meal was excellent. We ate outside so it was a little nosiy but it was a beautiful evening and the noise didn't effect our conversation.

Added to all that our waiter was fantastic! He was funny and charming. David's will be our go to place for a night out in Portland.

I ordered the salmon & my husband ordered the steak. As we were visiting the area, the hotel we were staying in offered drivers to take us into town because parking can be a challenge. Our driver said David’s was the best restaurant around and encouraged us to order the garlic knots to enjoy with our cocktails. The garlic knots were good but sort of stiff. They weren’t as yummy as the garlic knots we had at Scales which were incredible! My salmon was SO good! My husband ordered his steak medium rare but unfortunately parts of it were quite rare. My husband ordered a Lemon Drop which he said was one of the best he’d tasted. I ordered a Hendrick’s Gun & Tonic which was served in a tall water glass. Really not the way for that to be served in my opinion.
Food was so good. Watermelon salad as an app and the tuna entree were both amazing and delicious.
Food and service was outstanding! So nice to enjoy a restaurant that values the customer

Really good experience! I’ve walked by David’s before, but didn’t have a meal there. Wish I had years ago. It was REALLY good. Four people, three of whom were out-of-towners. We all enjoyed our meals. I had the meatloaf, which was incredibly good. The others had salmon, mushroom ravioli and tuna. Each of us loved our food. Mmmm!! Will be returning.
Great menu, great food. The service is always good as well.
Place was amazing!!  By far one of the best places we have ate.  Well done

My party had arrived in town early and they were able to change my reservation to that earlier time. The staff was great and the food was excellent would recommend to anybody will definitely go back when I’m in town.
If you’re a foodie this is the place. Always good, consistently.
Great food, fantastic service! We truly enjoyed and will come back

David’s dropped the ball. We used to love this place but indifferent service and lobster ravioli was cold by the time it was served. Server was too busy and overall the quality of food and service did not merit the price or the reputation
Give it a miss
David's never lets us down.  The food is always amazing and the wait staff is very attentive.  I wish I could make salmon like they do.  And mushroom toast?!  WOW!
Great food, small place with an open kitchen. Recommend for a quiet, intimate dinner while in Portland. We would eat here again.
Wonderful meal. You get what you pay for- meaning, yes it was expensive, but it was delicious!

My veggie potstickers and steak strips were very good. The Caeser salad was nothing special. I think they could use a better dressing.  The mushroom ravioli was very good and the tuna entree also. It is rather noisy so depends on who you are eating with and how much conversation you want to have.  The service was excellent. I would eat here again but not for an event like an anniversary or anything like that.  It's casual.
Very pleasant night with delicious food. We come on occasion to David’s and have never experienced a bad meal

Consistently high quality food & service
Good menu variety
Not inexpensive but worth the price
Convenient parking nearby
Amazing place  Anthony was special provided us guidance on food that paid off

I read reviews of this restaurant and was very pleased with our experience. The restaurant had clearly made efforts to reduce the noise with sound deadening materials suspended from the ceiling. The food was delicious. I loved the meatloaf with maple candied carrots. My husband enjoyed a special haddock dish with a special sauce that made the haddock more flavorful. Then we tried a chocolate torte with chocolate mousse and caramel sauce and cashews. Our waiter, Anthony, was efficient and very friendly. Please try this restaurant. You'll be happy with your choice.
Took almost an hour to get entrees. Not our server’s fault as the kitchen was slammed, and they seemed to have only one server in our area. Food was good, but just too long to wait.
Wonderful experience ! The food is excellent and the staff is very friendly .
Unfriendly waitress and cold food... The waitress actually bordered on rude as we were doing toasts. She interrupted us and tried to clear the table...also  Subpar cocktails but a great wine list

I was Looking for some place new to eat in Portland, so I  Googled and came up with David's Restaurant...  We were delighted with all of it....  The food was excellent, the service was excellent.. Worth the trip...

My wife and I had a great evening food was delicious we will be back soon
Mushroom ravioli and lobster ravioli were excellent
Wonderful place for a date!  The food was excellent and it was a great atmosphere!
The “service charge” is BS. Adjust your pricing accordingly instead of the nickel & dime BS.

Excellent dinner! Food was delicious and very well prepared, desserts were out of this world, especially the “adult” ice cream. Our server was very well trained in the art of taking care of the customer but not being intrusive.
Our server Chris was absolutely terrific and made the evening a real treat!

Excellent service -- we sat outside as we had our doggie with us. We only had 50 minutes to eat and they served us quickly. I had an amazing chicken reggae pizza that was delicious; my husband had an excellent duck dish. The waiter was wonderful. Wish we could have enjoyed Portland more, but we were quickly passing through on our way from Boston to Boothbay harbor.

We chose this highly recommended restaurant during our visit to Portland. The food was superb and the service was wonderful. Jeff gave us lots of great recommendations of places to visit in the area. It did not disappoint.
Food was great, nd thr service was fabulous. We enjoyed are dinner very much.

We chose this restaurant because it was advertised as an upscale dining experience with positive reviews. Upon arriving for our 730pm reservation we were told by our server we needed to order everything at once. They would control the pace of our food delivery.
By 840pm we were walking back to our hotel. Appetizer, main course and dessert along with a bottle of wine. And the food was average.
The restaurant was only 30% full. Yet we felt extremely rushed. Not a good experience. We would not go back. Portland has other wonderful dining experiences to offer!
Everything was delicious and the service was impeccable. Only critique is the cheese board had minimal cheese on it for the price, but all other dishes seemed well priced and were very yummy!

The food was amazing. My husband had the open faced lobster ravioli and I had serious food envy. I had the haddock sandwich which was also great. The calamari app was one of the best I have ever had. Ted our server was attentive and very helpful. My biggest complaint about this restaurant was my husband I were seating in a room with two large parties. Both tables had over 8 people. It was noisy in this room I couldn’t hear my husband talking and he was seated next to me.
Always outstanding, food and service. Mocktails delicious.

We always have a wonderful time at David’s, from the food and the drinks to the wonderful service. We had Anthony taking care of us last night and he really took our experience to the next level. He was such a joy and paid attention to every detail. He remembered our names, gave us wonderful recommendations, and his overall positive attitude was contagious - making our dining experience even more enjoyable.
Can't really think of a single negative thing - terrific food, service was fantastic and amazing atmosphere.
E really enjoyed our lunch, great menu and delicious.
Excellent! The brussel sprouts were a hit along w/ the salads and mussels! Thank you for a great experience!

This was the 2nd time we celebrated our anniversary at David’s. Everyone and everything was outstanding. Our server Iryna was also celebrating her birthday and we were pleased by every aspect of her hospitality, amiability, professionalism and engagement. We most
Highly recommend David and the entire team
But Iryna was perfect for our celebration. Thank you to the culinary team for a special “Happy Anniversary “ greeting our our desert plates. Food quality was excellent.
My husband and I enjoyed an exceptional lunch at David's.  Everything we ordered was delicious, the service was great and the cozy ambience was welcoming.
Quick informed service excellent imaginative menu modest noise level
Amazing. Anthony was best server had in decades. All loved the food.

Overall, fantastic!  Service was beyond wonderful. Food was great, however, slightly disappointed in the EXTREMELY small portion of the lobster ravioli. One of the dishes only had a portion of a scallop, not even the full thing. That was the only disappointment with this visit. All other food was incredible and decent portion size.

There’s a reason this place has survived when most restaurants fail in this town.

Absolutely phenomenal in every aspect. This will easily be a new favorite spot for special occasions.

Took my mom out for a Mother’s Day brunch and had an excellent experience, as usual. Our server Anthony was great: attentive and a brought a positive vibe to our table! Definitely looking forward to going back again

I would recommend this restaurant.
My mushroom ravioli was delicious.
The server was attentive, professional and knowledgeable ￼
Dinner with a business colleague after a long day. Food and service was excellent. The ambience was perfect. First time at David’s but it won’t be my last.
Great experience, food was fabulous, service attentive while fast and friendly. Can’t wait to go again!

Food was creative and delicious.  Our server, Ted, was outstanding.   The restaurant was a little noisy but it was 7pm on a Saturday night so not unexpected.   Overall, a great place for a lovely dining experience.

Came in with a group of 7 for a bachelorette weekend dinner! We sat in the smaller room toward the back which was great for our larger group. Service was prompt, as well as the food, and the server was very sweet!
Ok food not good value for the prices. Dessert was the best.
Great Food. Great Service. Great Atmosphere. Would Love to go back again

We were able to get a last minute reservation for lunch after an event. The host accommodated our request for a quieter table, the server was friendly and responsive, the food was excellent (the Bruschetta and the Apple, Cheddar, and Green Apple Salad with salmon - yum!).
The food, service and atmosphere here were great!  Food was perfect and the waitstaff always accommodating. Will definitely go back here again!
As always, the food is fantastic. One of our favorite places in Portland.

Great food overall— the clam chowder had a sweet profile due to brown sugar in the recipe, which we missed in the menu description (would have avoided had we known). But we will absolutely go again when in town, the service, drinks and all other food items ordered were outstanding.

Portland sirloin with mashed, shrimp and scallops and garlic spinach was fantastic.
The wife said her pizza was also great. Super nice cooks (sat at the grill bar area) and staff.
Everything we ordered was amazing and we had great service.

David’s never disappoints, everything is always top shelf. Our food was amazing, our drinks were creative and delicious, the atmosphere was perfect and our waiter was exceptional. Fabulous dinner experience, looking forward to returning again very soon.  ✨✨✨✨✨

Great first time here and it was amazing. All the food melted in
My mouth. Thank you!

We normally love it here. This time was underwhelming. We didn’t have a drink menu in front of us. Ordered a mojito, which showed up as a coconut milk mojito. It would have been nice if the server mentioned that it was going to be made with coconut milk. The bolognese showed up with 90% tomatoes, and 10% pasta. Left still hungry.
The experience was good overall. Food was amazing. I would definitely go back.

A good meal at a reasonable price. My ahi Tuna was a bit fishy and tough. Not the best I’ve ever eaten. My wife’s burger was awesome. Cookie sandwich for dessert was memorable but the chocolate mousse tort looks oked to me to be 1/2 a serving.  All around good meal but I don’t know if I’d hurry back

We went before an event at the Cross Insurance Arena and it was very busy. We arrived early and were seated early which was very helpful. It was our first time eating at the counter. The seating was tight but it was fun watching the food being prepared. Our server was great. He asked if we were headed to the event and made sure things moved along quickly. The food was delicious. We have had several dishes here before and have never had a meal that was not wonderful.
Always an awesome meal and experience, look forward to going again

Our waiter gave us outstanding service. We were in a hurry and he was so cooperative and at our request even brought takeout container for leftovers before we finished dinner. My friend is still raving about her roast duck with veggies.

When in Portland, we always go to David's because of the superlative food and service. This trip, we got David's Meatloaf and the Salmon entree. For dessert, we split the special cheesecake. It was great to be back and we look forward to returning again and again.

Due to all the reviews, we were looking forward to a delicious dinner for our anniversary. The waitress was very nice but completely mixed up our orders from drinks to the meal. The tuna was a beautiful piece but was very salty and ruined it. A good chef knows not to salt seafood, especially tuna. The lobster and seafood ravioli with sweet sherry cream was anything but sweet. The seafood was great but the sauce was so salty.
Our go to restaurant whenever we are visiting Portland.

Truly great meal and experience.  Waiter was attentive and quick.  Garlic knots were excellent as was the Caesar and Portland sirloin.  My wife had the salmon which was also very good.  Thought we were finished but then decided to look at the desserts, and I chose the cheesecake.  Turned out to be the best I had ever had.  Great creaminess and texture and crust.  Would go again.
We had not been to David's for quite awhile.  The last time we went it was okay.  But this time it was fabulous!  We will go back again soon!
Food was immaculate. Drinks were delicious. Our waitress was amazing. Everything was a bit high for what it was and the tables were way too close for intimate dining but that’s showbiz.

David's is one of our stand-by restaurants that we go to on a regular basis. The food might not be super innovative and unique, but it is always really good. And the service is also consistently attentive and friendly. That's why we keep going back there!
Our waitress was absolutely amazing! She made our day! The food was extremely delish! We will 100% be back when in Portland next!
Great food, lots of variety, friendly service. And in a beautiful part of town.
We were seated in a small room opposite a large party and it was very loud!
Overall, this was an incredible dining experience. The food was absolutely fantastic, the service was just perfect and the atmosphere gorgeous. We will be back soon!
An all time favorite!  The rare tuna was fantastic!
Food was delicious, our server was fantastic but the noise level in the back room where we were seated made it very difficult to hear one another.
Wonderful server.  Enjoyable meal.  Great carrot cheesecake!
Amazing food and stellar service. 10/10 would recommend and visit again!
The food was delicious. I waitress was fantastic. We really enjoyed the restaurant. Even the coffee and desserts at the end were great.

There were 8 of us.  6 of the 8 were extremely satisfied. My husband felt the beet salad could have had more beets. The roll for my lobster roll was partly burnt. The potato chips were peppered. Had the menu mentioned that I would have skipped them. I will go again but order a pizza next time, because my friends raved about them. The waitress was terrific and the food was served promptly. The location was perfect for a show at Merrill Auditorium.
Food is outstanding and service is excellent. Will definitely be going back!
Wonderful meal and great service by Daniel. The atmosphere is appealing. I would definitely go back again.

We (3couples) had a wonderful time! As we all are in our 60s some of us had a little bit of a hard time hearing the waitress as the noise level in the restaurant is quite high or "energetic" but other than that it was great.

This was our first visit (recommended by Facebook friends) and we were so glad we found David’s! We were meeting new friends before going to a concert. From the moment we arrived, everything was perfect—friendly staff, cool vibe, delicious smells, great wine and cocktail/mocktail menus… the food was incredible! We enjoyed the meatloaf, the crispy skin duck, Caesar salad with grilled shrimp and anchovies, and crème brûlée and chocolate torte for dessert… perfection! Will definitely be back soon!
Absolutely terrific thank you for helping us celebrate our anniversary!!! Hello

First time at David’s and all four of our entrees were great, especially a pasta special that one of our friends was pondering, trying to figure out how the cream sauce was so light, delicate and flavorful.  We had a wonderful meal.
Great experience with a great server. Can’t remember the persons name but overall kind staff. Drinks were great and the mussels were amazing in the broth.
Duck is too chewy, disappointing. The lobster ravioli was amazing
From start to finish - a great meal! Daniel the server was so nice!
We had the arancini and Brussels to start, both of which were flavorful and delicious. We each had the Moroccan salmon special which was divine - cooked perfectly and so flavorful.
We had an unbelievable dinner at David’s, highly recommend.
We sat at the counter overlooking the kitchen. The staff was wonderful and we had a fantastic dinner. Bravo!

Our experience was 100% right from we walked in the door. We had this great waitress her name was Rachel. I think it was like a second day man. Did she knock it out of the park spot on about everything made sure we liked everything was prompt service was great. The food was outstanding, me and my wife loved it from finish to end. The only recommendation is detail the shrimp and of course, that was my fault because I should’ve asked for it but other than that our night was outstanding.

This is our go-to restaurant. They never fail to impress.  This particular time I was a bit disappointed because I reserved for a party of 6 weeks in advance and asked for the front room but we were put in the far back.  It was less awesome than it could have been, but the food and service were still great.

DB
You'll find something for you on the menu, try a mocktail, dessert fantastic, very laid back

My husband, two friends and I dined at David's last night. I hadn't been there since my engagement night 9 long years ago. I don't know why I hadn't gone back sooner. The food was fantastic and the prices were on-par with most Portland restaurants. We started with the beef carpaccio and I'm kicking myself for not taking a picture because it was equally beautiful as it was delicious. The beef was shaved thinly, topped with arugula, capers, crostini and some lemony white truffle dressing that was out of this world. I had to stop myself from licking the plate. I ordered the spicy margarita which had just a hint of spice and didn't taste much like a margarita, more so like a lemon-thyme vodka cocktail. It was still good but not what I was expecting. I also had the cucumber basil smash which was light and refreshing. For my entree I had the duck breast over butternut squash risotto and sautéed spinach. The sauce of "sherried plums and dates" was the perfect accompaniment. All the elements worked beautifully together. The perfect balance of savory, sweet and tangy. I will definitely not wait another 9 years to visit David's again.

Overall great experience at Davids. Service was attentive and friendly. Had Oysters and Carpaccio for apps. The oysters appeared to have been shucked earlier so seemed a bit dry ( I like the little bit of sea water with them). The carpaccio was tasty just a little heavy handed on the caesar dressing. Entrees were excellent! Salmon was cooked perfect and had great flavor. Tournedos au Poivre was also cooked perfectly and flavorful. Creme brûlée was a good size and Vanilla ice cream with fudge brownie, Baileys and Kaluha was amazing! Will definitely return.

We returned last after 6 years, food was still outstanding !
Had the tuna in 2018 and last night . Still great !
As always, one of the BEST “before the Show” Dining options!
The food never disappoints.   The potato pizza is very good and my husband just loves the meatloaf.

We’ve dined at David’s multiple times typically after a matinee at the symphony since the monument square location is within walking distance of Merrill. As always, we had a wonderful meal with excellent service and the price could not have been better since we took advantage of Restaurant Week and enjoyed three courses for $45! The pork tenderloin wrapped in bacon was simply wonderful as was the creme brûlée for dessert. My wife’s scallop and shrimp appetizer was the best app she’s had in awhile, second only to the lemon drop she enjoyed before hand. We’ll be back and soon.
good quality; very attentive service; no issues, but nothing exceptional.  Somewhat disappointing for a David's restaurant
David’s always delivers—it’s our go-to spot before a show or when we want a nice but not overly expensive evening.
Excellent service. Tuna crudo appetizer was excellent.
Excellent and Consistent as always. Great staff, Great food.
Too expensive & Drinks overpriced  - Great tasting food. Great service but too expensive. I will not return.  This is not Boston. It’s Portland Maine.  Let’s get back to reality. Thank you.
Very good food and service. Few things were overpriced but overall very nice experience.

The food was good. The service was painfully slow. Our waiter was not attentive to us at all. We were very annoyed at the poor service he gave us. At one point, he was just chatting with the bartender while we were waiting for dessert. Our reservation was for 7:00pm and we sat down approximately at 7:15 and did not leave until 9:45.
The Mel was a celebrationrwhich the 3 of us enjoyed. Food, service, and drink were exceptional. No rushing.

We came for Restaurant week lunch and were seated immediately.  Drinks were received quickly. Appetizers were very good. We waited quite a while for entrees. Although we saw other tables served before us. The food was delicious, however.  Desserts were also good. The mussels were particularly good, although  a piece of bread would have been appreciated since the broth was excellent.  We will return.
Sat at the counter, watching the chefs.  Excellent food, ordered from the Restaurant Week menu.  Great meal!

This was my first time eating at David’s and I was so impressed. The food was exceptional and perfect. The service was stellar. The vibe was exactly what I look for when eating out. I will definitely be coming back every chance I get.

We are big fans of this restaurant. Unfortunately their restaurant week menu was not executed well.  The hake was a plain piece of unadorned poached fish with salty spinach. The risotto cake was very good.    The pork filet was not cooked properly.  Requested at medium, first try was still blue in the middle. Our server went to get a second filet, and took it off the bill.  The second filet was a little better but still not cooked to medium. We ate what we could and left the rest.  Both bacon wrapped filets came with unrendered uncooked bacon.

Crème brûlée was awesome,;  pistachio dacquse was not traditional (meringue instead of sponge), and the described raspberry crème was not present.
Restaurant week menu was absolutely incredible! Everything we had was delicious!!!

Food was terrific and the server was top notch.  As the space filled it got a bit noisy but we were generally able to hold conversations.  We were a party of ten and the had no trouble serving our meals at essentially the same time.  No doubt we will return.
Very food and service.  Daniel our server was excellent
Visited for restaurant week and it was a great reminder of why David's is a must dine location in Portland. Every bite was better than the last and the service was on point!
Fantastic food and cocktails!!!  Would go back time and time again.
A fun, delicious restaurant with great atmosphere in downtown Portland!  Would definitely dine here again.
Outstanding dinner and service. Highly recommend. Would absolutely return.
EDL special drink had no cherry flavor - disappointed.  Plating could be more enticing- for example add 2 pea pods to carrots with meatloaf would make it prettier

This visit David was just as good as the previous ones. Friendly staff. Superb service. Fantastic food. Everything was served with great timing. It’s always nice to see the chef owner in the kitchen when you walk to the front door for dinner. Thanks David.￼
Appetizer, dinner and drinks were all great. Food was hot and fresh. Drinks were cold and delicious.

Excellent, every time. I am always thrilled when the people I'm dining with is are happy as I am. Everyone loved everything, from the food to the service. Thank you for being so delicious, special, and reliable!
I booked incorrect table open on site but waitress assisted and we opted to eat at the bar instead. All were very helpful and supportive to allow us to have great dining experience.

I had dinner with my mother and ate at David’s at her request.  The meal was
Perfect, service beyond excellent, and the atmosphere was inviting and appropriate.

We will certainly return when back in
Portland.
We are never disappointed at David’s. The food is excellent-everyone at our table was delighted with their choice- and the service was perfect.
Superb food and service as usual! Thank you for another enjoyable experience.
Excellent dinner! Great food, great setting, great service! Loved the Cajun dusted salmon - delicious!

Always a great meal at David's!  We went before a concert at Merrill Auditorium.  The cocktails were delicious and didn't skimp.  The wine list was extensive and gave us a bottle that we really enjoyed.  The Thai Brussels sprouts were just right, with a bright hint of lime, and the mushroom ravioli was fabulous - creamy and flavorful.  I highly recommend David's for any special night out with significant other and friends!
Delicious food and superb service. Our first time there and defiantly will return!
We had a wonderful dinner experience! Thank you for the great menu, warm atmosphere, and kind service.
Our server was great; she was friendly and attentive.  The burger one of us got was cooked to perfection. The lobster roll was disappointing for the price point.  The ambience was enjoyable.

My wife and I had a reservation for lunch on Saturday, February 10th.  From start to finish --- the service, the seating, the food --- it was an extraordinary lunch.

We'll be back.... and we wish it was closer to our home so we could visit it more often!

Long time patron and so disappointed last night…….steak was so tough, didn’t finish it!  Peppered Ahi was so over peppered, it too wasn’t finished.  Server, very nice, asked if we were finished and ok and informed her, no.  This was apparently ok with her so she brought the check…….will be a while before we return or recommend.  David’s, you can do so much better!
Great food, great service. Really a treat, first time in Portland.
David's is always a very solid dinning experience . My go to restaurant prior to a show at the State Theater
The specials were very tasty, loved the variety on the menu

First time at David's but it most definitely will not be our last....Food and service were top notch. The ambiance was intimate and inviting. We had a marvelous evening.

Again, our server was a delight. Thank you

For many years, David's has been our "go to" place whenever we are in Portland; however, during our last two or three visits we've noticed a disappointing drop in the quality of the food. Last night, their signature bread knots were dry. The asparagus were way undercooked and woody. The Japanese noodles that accompanied the tuna sushi were flavorless. On the plus side, the roasted Brussels sprouts and Caesar salad were superb. And our server was delightful and attentive.

The portion size of the dinners my wife and I ordered were much better than most restaurants. These entres were able to be eaten completely, leaving dining capacity for dessert. The reservation process using open-table was a very pleasant experience. We would be happy to repeat our experience at a David's restaurant.
Best restaurant in Portland.  We go every time we are in the area.
Perfect, great service and food and drinks, will be back!
Excellent meal. Helpful service. Warm space and open kitchen.

First time there had a late reservation and the entire staff was welcoming and friendly and never made us feel rushed.  My kids had mocktails and really enjoyed them and the food was amazing.  Fun spot right in monument square can’t wait to go back!

Server was excellent, seated at reservation time. Menu selections were varied and interesting. Presentation was very nice. Arancini was delicious as was the clam chowder. 2 of the three entrees was very good to excellent. They were out of scallops.

Ambience was great as is the location.
Food and service are always outstanding. My favorite Portland restaurant!
David’s is consistently delicious and service is great.
Great restaurant. Nice atmosphere, very good service, good food. My go to dish is the  seared tuna with brussel sprouts to start.  You won’t be sorry you went tomDavis’s!

Dining at David’s is never a disappointment. We can always depend on a quality experience.  Other places come and go but David’s keeps us coming back. The staff is always so warm and friendly and the food is top notch. We always feel special at David’s and look forward to coming back.
We've been twice now and had incredible food and drinks both times!

Service was good.  My lobster roll was served on a hamburger bun that was burned.  I didn't have time to send it back but it was essentially spoiled--worst lobster roll I've had in Maine in a long time.  The reception and wait staff were friendly, helpful, and prompt.
Food was amazing, ambience very nice and the staff was great. What more could you ask for?  Highly recommend.
David’s is always a great place for delicious food, phenomenal service and fun yet easy to hear and be heard atmosphere. We went with friends this past Saturday night and was not disappointed!
The food is consistently excellent at David’s  The wait staff always helpful

We love David’s. Having dined there many times over the years, we know the food is consistently excellent. Last night was terrific…great food, very good service in spite of the fact that our server had many tables to look after. Nothing was rushed, it was a great experience.
It was a great experience, hadn't been there for a couple years, but it was overall fantastic, and the food was hot when it was placed in front of us!!
Great restaurant especially because they cater to allergies. Seating was a bit uncomfortable for our party of six but the rest was great.

We had a birthday celebration there, and it was excellent. Very attentive staff, and while they did not bring out a free birthday cake, they did write happy birthday on the plate which made my father. Very happy. The food was excellent.

Davids has an excellent selection on their menu. There are a wide range of entrees to appeal to any palate. We enjoyed the shrimp, lobster casserole and duck breast, so delicious!!

Cocktails are excellent.

Our server was friendly, attentive and professional!

David’s was were worth the wintry windy walk! The atmosphere was comforting! The service was impeccable! The food was impressively well done! They were willing to customize based on a food allergy. We will be back.
Always a comfortable environment to enyoy great food

We were very pleased with our experience at David's.   We sat at the bar.  The bartender was friendly and helpful.  The atmosphere was warm and cozy.  The food and drinks were excellent.   Will definitely go back.
Staff was great.  Meal options were appreciated. Thanks for a nice evening.
Family was going to a play at Merrll.

The food was delicious and perfectly cooked! We sat at the bar where we could watch the cooking staff and head chef prepare the food. Their attention to detail, team effort and obvious talent was evident in the food we ordered. Thank you for a
wonderful evening!
Great food and Great service.  The whole experience was very nice.
wonderful food choices, all prepared divinely and the presentation was superb. Our table for five was roomy and comfortable, Highly recommend David's,

Food was very good. One member of our party did not get what they ordered.
The server asked if it was ok and our friend accepted it though not exactly what they wanted. The other 3 meals were excellent. We had a speciality cocktail which was great as was one of the desserts.
As a frequent Portland dining customers, David’s is always one of our go-to’s. Excellent food and service in a quaint setting. Never disappoints.
I highly recommend the Portland steak and Chai- tini. So good!
Probably my 10th time at David’s. Always good and this time my guests commented about how great the service was. Delicious food, great menu and fantastic service. Excellent value.
Quiet atmosphere, great food. Cocktail was delicious. Service was a little slow and not personable. Was our 10 year anniversary and nothing was celebrated or mentioned to us.
David’s is always fantastic. The food is amazing and the people that work there are the best in the industry.

We come to David’s every time we are in Portland! Last night we sat at the counter and the staff were so friendly…..they work their butts off!!!
Happy New Year🎉

Everything was excellent, from the ambiance, to the food!
I ordered the mushroom ravioli and it was the best I've ever had°

Food had no flavor and not even close to description. Very loud restaurant so don’t plan for a quiet and relaxing dinner. All courses had to be ordered at one time so no opportunity for changing flavors. 4% surcharge to help pay the staff and prices are already not comparable to the level of dinner experience you will receive.

Hands down our favorite place to go in Portland!  And worth the hour drive. Food never disappoints. Had the filet special for New Years, cooked perfectly. My husband's duck with rissoto was excellent. From the first cocktail to desserta  5⭐️!
Excellent meal, soup to nuts. Fun to sit at the counter and watch the kitchen action. 10/10 recommend.

David’s is a great date spot and place to catch up with friends and family. It’s not too loud or crowded and feels intimate. Excellent drink and wine menu - really appreciated and enjoyed the mocktail choices. Staff is great as always and very kind and willing to make things right if you have any issues.
Good and Service were AMAZING throughout!  This is one of the many hidden gems in Portland but among my top 3 favorite restaurants.  NEVER disappoints!  Highly recommend
Loved it! Everything was great! Can’t wait to go back there again.,
Love this restaurant!! We had a fabulous experience for my mother in laws birthday!
Great ambiance. Delicious oysters and mussels appetizers. The rest of the meal was unremarkable.

Hostess was rude. No greeting or welcome.  Wanted to give us the worse table in the place, although restaurant was not busy and we had made a reservation. She acquiesced to giving us another table, marginally better, though much nicer ones went empty the entire time in the back restaurant area (which we were unfortunately unaware of when we arrived as it was our first time at David's). Service was marginal. Then the food arrived and it was the worst pizza we have ever eaten. NO flavor despite a lot of toppings. Greasy. Terrible. Didn't know a pizza could taste so bad. Won't be returning here. Way too many other wonderful restaurants in the Old Port area.

Steak special was pretty good. Seafood special was extremely sparse and practically no flavor -big disappointment. Crispy duck is a misnomer-  it was just duck breast. Without the espresso sauce at 7pm it had very little taste.  Squash risotto was pretty tasty tho.   Haddock was the best w nice sauce. We had been to David’s in South Portland for a very nice meal at thanksgiving so this did not meet expectations.

David had a wonderfully creative menu with dishes to cover a range of flavors and tastes. Our courses arrived with enough time between them for us to enjoy conversation with our food. Without being rushed. We all enjoyed everything that was presented to us, it was delicious! ￼

We had a wonderful family meal at David’s following The Nutcracker performance at Merrill Auditorium. The food was delicious and the drinks fun. We were most impressed by the wait staff which often sets the timbre of the dinner. They were pleasant, timely, not rushed and picked up on little details. The table was nicely cleared before dessert and the kids were thrilled with their ice cream sandwiches. A memorable family afternoon/evening.

Our server was very sweet! Fantastic service. Food was delivered at the right time. Drinks and food were top shelf (we are visiting foodies from SoCal)! We had a haddock dish, a meatloaf, a burger, and the beet salad. Chai-tini was awesome! All was good enough to keep talking about an hour and more later.  Would happily return with friends!
Phenomenal. The mussels are amazing. The open face lobster rav was great too. Excellent service
Food and service was outstanding.  It was a little noises when we first arrived, but to be expected for a small restaurant
David's is a longtime favorite; the food is always good, the menu is varied, and the location is great.
It’s rare to go out to dinner with a group and everyone rave about their meal. David’s never disappoints. Great all around experience- can’t wait for our next visit.
The pot sticker dumpling appetizer was outstanding!  Everyone in our party of five enjoyed their meals.  A Christmas season favorite for our family!  Always great.

We fully understand the reasoning behind your policy of not seating people until the dot of the time of the reservations.  However, there should be an exception to the rule.  It was difficult for a 91 year old, using a cane, to stand for 15 minutes.  Plus another member of the party also using a cane.  We could see the empty table awaiting for us.  It would have made a better impression of welcome if we had just been seated; told wait staff would be available at exact time of reservation.  Maybe menus could be distributed.  It wasn't so much having to wait as it was having  to stand and wait.  Otherwise our experience  garnered nothing but high marks.
Welcoming staff, attentive service. Great menu and food
BURGER IS AMAZING WITH A SIDE SALAD AND NO BUN FOR MY FELLOW KETO PEEPS

We arrived with a narrow window before we had to leave for a concert.  Our waitress was very attentive and made sure we had time to order, eat comfortably and be out the door in time to make the concert.  She handled our 'situation' with ease and grace!

Reservation for 5 not seated until 530, rude hostess - male, will never go back, will go to a competitor
Food was great, waiter was great
This is one of the best restaurants in the Portland area. Food is spectacular. Pricey but it’s worth it.

The cocktails were delicious and the garlic knots were wonderful. I ordered the margherita pizza, which was very salty and expensive ($17 for an individual pizza). We were happy with the wait staff. My biggest complaint is the 4% charge added to every bill to help cover the cost of David's utility bill. As disclosed on the menu, this 4% charge is to help defray the costs of David's electric bill so that they can pay their staff better. This is ridiculous. The restaurant is already expensive and the wait staff is tipped on the total cost of the bill. Is it appropriate to tip them 4% less, since they are allegedly getting the benefit of that 4% upcharge? While I understand that costs of ingredients have gone up in the recent past, these costs seemed to have stabilized and, presumably, David's has raised the cost of its menu items to account for inflation. Electricity is a part of doing business and is not the responsibility of David's customers.

Food was superb, however the waitress forgot to put the order in for our salads so our entrees arrived unexpectedly early and frankly she seemed to not care at all.  We should have sent the entrees back and had them redone but it didn't seem fair to the kitchen.  At the very least the offer of a complementary dessert to share would have been reasonable.  We'll still be back because other than this, David's has always been a great place!
Great meal and the folks with celiac had safe, yummy meals. Overall it was lovely, but the wine prices were ridiculous.
This is 3rd time eating at David’s. Always good food and friendly service
Great menu with lots of options for vegetarian/vegan patrons. All dishes were perfectly prepared   The service was very good.

David's at Monument Square is an excellent place for professional lunch gatherings.
T
Great location for our company holiday dinner! Everyone enjoyed their meals and the service was top notch.
remarkable service and food, nice atmosphere. great location
Quality food, good prices. Always enjoyable for a night out
We have a good meal every time we go to Davis’s. Good selection and options for all tastes.
Best dining experience in a long time. Food outstanding. Great service and ambience. Highly recommend.

Dishes were well-prepared, as described, of appropriate quantity, and served in a timely manner by an attentive wait-staff. The restaurant was not busy so the noise level was acceptable. It can be uncomfortably loud when all tables are filled.
Classic Portland Restaurant - Great for lunch before a show
Great food and atmosphere! Would definitely return.

I was able to make a reservation day of, at the time I needed. Pretty great for Portland. The food, as I remember from over a decade ago, was excellent. I would order the tuna crudo every day. Our dishes were prepared precisely and we couldn’t resist dessert. A wise choice. Fiancé claims they have one of the best martinis in town.

Outstanding food, service and atmosphere!
Thank you for being consistently excellent at David’s.
Excellent.  The food was delicious and well presented.  The service was awesome.  The drinks were good.  A Great meal.

The food was out of this world! We had the special salad--fried chickpeas with greens, olives and feta--and I had the fish special, a salmon filet with a ginger citrus sauce, mashed potatoes with goat cheese and scallions, and grilled asparagus. Aside from there being too many scallions in the potatoes, the entree was absolutely perfect.
Waiter seemed bored, exhibited no personality. Food ok, but not outstanding.

It’s been a while since I’ve been to David’s, and not much has changed from the decor. It could use some updating. The lunch entree was good, but not anything like the creative dishes I’ve had before. The price didn’t seem to live up to the mediocre entree. In fact, the brioche bun was dry and over toasted, and the $6 mocktail tasted like lime juice mixed with ice water. 

I was celebrating my friend’s birthday, and made a note in the Open Table reservation asking to bring out a dessert as a surprise, but the server did not acknowledged it even after dropping a couple hints. 

There are so many amazing restaurants in Portland, and David’s used to be on top of my list, but this time I was disappointed.

Outstanding food with a wide variety of choices closed out by fabulous service by Daniel!
Our new go to spot for special occasions!

Great service, and welcome team
Food and little bit in the to much seasoning but that could be based on our Taste and not the restaurant menu
Great food, as always. Not crowded this time. We'll staffed, meal was completed in 1 hour.

This was our first visit and what a gem! Small, intimate and cozy with a nice bar. We tried the old fashioned and the Chai-Tini, both were very good! We had the Crispy fried brussel sprouts and the Bruschetta for our appetizer. For our entrées we had the Potato & Bacon pizza and the salmon with spaghetti squash, which was their daily special.  We finished our dinner with the maple creme brulee - everything was absolutely delicious! 

The service was top notch. The hostess was very welcoming and friendly. Our server was Elizabeth - she was just lovely!  We asked for a couple of recommendations and she was spot on! She gave us time to enjoy each course and would check in with us without being intrusive. She was super sweet!

We will definitely go back again!

We visited the restaurant for a pre-theater dinner. One guest has a garlic allergy and inquired about options for entrees. She was told their ingredients are prepared so they are not able to accommodate special requests. This was surprising as many people have allergies. After awhile another server came over and said this is the only thing we can do for an entree. The selection was lovely but set a tone for the balance of dinner.
Our go to restaurant in Portland when we’re visiting MECA.

A good meal with a close business partner.   Started with the dumplings/beef dish, added the calamari, and then moved onto our two entrees - the Salmon and the opened-faced lobster ravioli.  Food was great, solid service, but the back room atmosphere lacked ambiance and was dark....felt like we were in the truancy room!   If you are looking for great food near city center, this is a great choice.

Did not appreciate having a 4% surcharge added to our bill!!!!
Service was good
Meal was ok. Not sure we would go back.
Liked his So Portland restaurant better
This place is something special - food delectable. Server got a little behind, but her colleagues stepped in. One of the best gluten free pizzas I've ever had.
This is our go to spot when we are in Portland. It never disappoints

David’s is always a strong choice, it’s very consistently excellent.  On this particular day, it was good, but not the same as I’m used to.  The cocktail menu still had a very summer vibe, with mostly fruity light drinks, only two offerings matched the chilly November season.  When out for lunch, is it too much to ask for a lunch portion of an entree?  Do I have to have a singular item- appetizer or a sandwich or salad?  I dunno, the choices just seemed limited, and nothing jumped out as a “must have”.   The server was fine but matched the energy of eeyore.  Everything was good, I’m just used to excellent there.

Overall as per usual a very good meal. I had a cocktail (specialty) with whiskey that was very enjoyable but can’t remember its name or ingredients.. would love to hear what it was.. we usually go to 388 so this was a great change of pace

We enjoyed the atmosphere and the area.  Located in Portland, this restaurant is nicely turned out  and the food was well presented.  Nice place for a tasty dinner or to meet up with a few friends over a glass or two.

My wife and I were recently in Portland for a long weekend for a conference. Of course, lobster is EVERYWHERE. And we had some good meals for sure. However, our dinner at Davids was on a different level entirely! Great wine selection, excellent food offerings. Do yourself a favor and give it a try....I'm still thinking about the Open faced lobster ravioli!!
Wonderful food, great service - Libby couldn’t have been more helpful- , lovely ambience.  Parking garage so close was a bonus!  We will definitely return!
The food was absolutely perfect! Dan was an incredible server who made us feel so relaxed and we loved everything he recommended!! This is our new favorite place!

Delicious food and drinks. The mussels were tender and tasty. The tournedos  au poivre -beef tenderloin was cooked just perfect and lobster ravioli was a treat! Never disappointed with a meal at David’s!
Cozy restaurant with friendly staff. Best brussel sprouts and truffle fries on the planet followed by piping hot, delicious pizzas. Outstanding experience all around.
Tables were tight, hard to sit in that space with long legs
Dinner for 5 on a Friday night. It was very busy but service was very good. Seats overlooking monument square was nice. Food was very good overall.
We just had hamburgers and fish sandwiches…. both were excellent. It wasn’t overly loud!
Service awesome.  Great table!  Prices a little high for Maine.  Haddock over-cooked. Weird risotto.  Mushy.  Duck was the best as well as the creative desserts.
Outstanding food/drinks. We sat at the counter and it was very entertaining watching the chefs prepare and cook the food
David's is  a small delicious restaurant.  Our hotel  suggested it and I'm so glad that they did.  The food was wonderful, our server was great.   It made for a really lovely  evening out!

It was quiet because we were seated in a back room.  Would've preferred being seated in the front where it was much more lively.  
Terrific food and diverse menu.
Our server had just the minimum interest in us.
Our waitress was very attentive and the ambiance was very good but the pizza was very overcooked.
The food and service were excellent, as always.  We will be back!

I was solo on a business trip, and had previously eaten at David's 388, so wanted to check this place out. The neighborhood is a bit dodgy, but not terrible. The staff greeted me promptly and were very attentive. I sat at the counter, which is somewhat awkwardly situated just by the hostess stand, but I like to watch what comes out of the kitchen, so it was a great seat for that. I ordered the ahi tartare which was great, but presentation could've maybe showcased the ahi a bit better - it was covered in many pickles, but the flavor was good. For the main I ordered the crispy duck which was amazing - presentation was excellent, and it tasted incredible. I was able to close out easily and be on my way. Would recommend for sure!
Absolutely wonderful experience! Highly recommend for tourists.

Great restaurant in the middle of Portland, Maine. Easy walk from most areas near the waterfront.
Great food and service. Was recommended by my friend who is a local. Will definitely return.

We made a short notice reservation for a counter seat and was pleasantly surprised with an option for a high top.  Service was attentive the food was inventive and well paced. Overall, just a lovely experience.
We came here for dinner during our New England vacation.  It was rainy and chilly out and as soon as we walked in it was warm and welcoming.  The food and drinks were excellent.  A terrific choice.

We were terribly disappointed; the haddock was blander than bland, with fair mashed potatoes and burnt Brussell sprouts. The pear salad was meager, overpriced, and with a watery dressing. Desserts and cocktails were fine. Been here many times, and this was truly a letdown.

Visiting Portland for the weekend and had a wonderful experience at David’s - great service, amazing food (seared tuna; mushroom ravioli; potstickers) and great atmosphere.  We’ll definitely be back on our next visit!

Four of us had a lovely dinner Saturday night at Davids.   Our waiter was fabulous. Three of us loved our meals...great tuna sushi appetizer & great beet salad -two of us loved our duck dish. One loved his sushi main course. My husband ordered the haddock and mussels and said that the broth was tasty, but both the haddock and mussels were over cooked. We order mussels all the time at other restaurants so we were very surprised that they were so over-cooked making them tough.
Our server  Daniel was excellent-well informed, friendly and attentive. The food was brought out piping hot and in a comfortable pace. We will definitely visit again!

The food was excellent; marvelous flavors and presentation.  Our reservations were for the counter overlooking the kitchen.  After seeing so many chef shows with lots of yelling, I was impressed that the chefs were relaxed, super efficient and attentive, and everything ran smoothly.   This speaks well of David's leadership in the kitchen.  Our server was attentive and pleasant even though it was a bit hard to reach us.  It did take a while to get our wine, but that was because it was a busy night so no complaints.  I also like the variety of the menu.
David's is always great, food is creative and consistent, great wine menu with some excellent values, and attentive staff make it all happen!

The dining, food and service was 5/5. I had the deconstructed lobster ravioli. It was one of the best dishes I have eaten.
My only criticism is the 4% utility charge. I feel it is not my responsibility to pay the cost of the building expense… adding four percent doesn’t distribute the cost evenly among patronage.
Small restaurant. Good food and service.  Clam chowder was not typical New England style but good. It was  busy on a Sunday night, so reservations would be  recommended.
Food and service was amazing per usual. We love David’s and visit every time we are in Portland
It was pretty decent! The steak was cooked to requested rareness I just wish it was slightly more tender. The portions where kind of small. The service was ok! I would go back!
Great spot for celebrating a birthday.  Service was wonderful

The food and service as always great. A place we keep coming back to time and again. Keep it we.
Thanks
Carol & Jim
The food was amazing! We will  definately be back!
Wonderful food in a charming environment - would heartily recommend
Celebrated my husband’s birthday here and it was excellent! Food and service was outstanding!
Everything was delicious. Loved the lobster ravioli and the clam chowder.

The Food was good but not exceptional.  The staff was nice and service good.  The ambiance was lacking.  While it was a good value, we did have exceptional food at other establishments in the area. So it would not be my first choice to go back.
Food was amazing!  We just had a very unfriendly server, which was unfortunate at such a nice restaurant.
We had a great time, seated in the middle of the hubbub of activity
Overall great experience, but the Brussels sprouts were phenomenal.
The Haddock was delicious but the bun was stale.  Seemed like the quality of the food had slipped.  Meatloaf was flavorful and juicy, but again, the bun was stale.

We had a wonderful dinner last night at David’s.  The menu is wide ranging, and I particularly appreciated their care in offering dishes responsive to different dietary needs.  We enjoyed the meatloaf and halibut, and our starter salad was amazing!
Not only was the food excellent, we sat at the counter so we could watch the kitchen at work.  The vibe was so friendly and energetic.  We went back two more times!
What a gem!  We enjoyed an intimate meal outdoors under the awning on a warm October evening. The service was excellent. I highly recommend Open faced lobster ravioli 👍

Great outdoor dining on the Square! I had lobster ravioli and loved it.  Myhusband enjoyed the meat loaf and sides very much. Service was excellent and well timed. If we lived there, David’s would be a regular !

We had a family dinner to celebrate my fiancés birthday!
Called with a special request and they were very accommodating!
Service and food were 5 stars!

Took us a while to find David's, but it was worth the walk. We came up from the cruise port area and the GPS didn't help much. Once there, however, great service and equally great food. It's right on a popular square, so people watching was great. Nice atmosphere both inside and outside.
I was visiting and picked David’s based on its menu (and location.). We ended up splitting four menu items, each of which was great.  Service was wonderful too.  Would definitely come back.
We had a great dining experience Food was terrific: both creative and delicious.
Great experience overall. One me and my parents favorite places to go while in Portland.

David’s rarely disappoints.  Our group of six dined outside under the restaurants huge awning.  Our waitress was very good, knowledgeable and timely. Our meals were well prepared, tasty and visually enticing.  David’s has become our go to eatery in Portland.
Always a good go to spot when heading to the symphony.

My husband and I were visiting the area and enjoy trying local restaurants.  This is a very lively restaurant, and the staff was very attentive even though they were extremely busy.  The food was tasty and served nice and hot.  I would definately recommend making reservations to this restaurant.

We had heard great reviews about David’s and were excited to dine before an event at Cross Arena - unfortunately after ordering a round of drinks and appetizers, we were nearly forgotten for 1 hr by the wait staff and had to ask the hostess if our meals were on their way. The food was ok (although some dishes were a little cold). It was certainly not the experience we were hoping for and will try nearby options for future dinners.
Great food. Upscale yet casual ambience in the trendy Monument Sqaure part of downtown Portland. Works for a romantic dinner of a lively group.
Food and service was great for our party of 6. Would definitely come again
Food was delicious. I tried the prefix menu. I had as a main course the aguacate and lobster. This was delicious.
Great atmosphere and service …. The food was very well prepared
What a great find for dinner!  We had an outside table, quiet and relaxed.  Noisy and energetIc inside. Plenty of creative food offerings to choose from.  Server was very attentive.
The food was some of the best we had in Portland!! And the service was top notch!
Fine choice for a nice meal. Friendly service, prices fairly high but still reasonable. Delicious cocktails and normal sized portions.
Food was great. Service was horrible. We were never given a bread basket. The server never came back to ask if we wanted another drink or how our meal was.
We were very happy with all aspects of our dinner at Davids and would definitely go back again.

We got the fabulous garlic knots with our apps .  I had the fried calamari which had a very light “breading” and was ample and delicious.  The raw tuna entree was to die for and again, an ample serving.  The maple creme  brûlée was also delicious and could have been eaten by two!  My friend had chowder, muscles and a chocolate cake (?) - and all was delicious.  I did try her desert  which was rather dense but very good.   She had some wine tooo - and was given 2 choices for the size, which is a nice option.  Our waiter was lovely, there when we needed him but not hovering and he had a nice sense of humor.

The downside for me was that we sat in front, which is by the windows and in front of the kitchen.  It tends to be noisier here but, also, you get the smells from the kitchen and leave with them on you!  I had made the reservation online and should have been more specific about where I wanted to sit since I couldn’t change it when I showed up.  I wish the tables were a bit further apart too, especially the ones for 2.

We each got a bill for about $70 without the tip - so pretty reasonable for the quality of food and portion size - and for a Portland, ME restaurant.

We often choose David's if we want to be sure of quality food for guests. And this time did not disappoint. One of our guests is now spoiled for any other meatloaf. Normally the atmosphere is not quite so boisterous. A party of 12 beside us was having a very good time. Not a complaint, that's the chance you take going out.

Delicious food, good enough service.  We were put in the BACK ROOM next to a group of 8 loud women -- and next to a large, temporary panel that shielded us from the noisy air duct system and extra kitchen area.  Plus a 4% "UTILITY CHARGE" was added to the bill to account for the "increased cost of utilities."  I don't think so -- the owner is just gouging his patrons.  If you do go, ask to sit in the FRONT ROOM - it has crowded tables but much better ambiance.

Rainy Monday night....reservations were early so place was quiet. Eaten her numerous times. From Atlanta. Service was exemplary! Food was 4 of 5.....garlic knots seemed day old....haddock/lobster was okay but dry....steak and seafood good, burger delicious......Service great! Wine just okay..  for 36 bucks, a screw cap was not great. Didn't expect fabulous....but a screw cap? SERIOUSLY?

Absolutely great food, great service and great value.  Chief special haddock with mussels and bacon outstanding.  Berry cheese cake unbelievably delicious.  Anna took such wonderful care.  We love David’s!  So friendly and zero pretense (I.e.12).

We were on the patio, which was really nice. The food was fantastic. Every ingredient of the caprese salad was delectable (so many time restaurants just slap it together). I had the haddock and mussels and it was great. the creme brulee was wonderful and all of it was gluten free. Also had a great mocktail.
Our food was excellent and the service was as well. The mushroom ravioli was flavorful and delicious. Definitely a return spot!

We ate at the bar stools over looking the kitchen. Great spot to watch the fantastic chefs at work. The appetizers were delicious recommend the pot stickers and steak appetizer. Main entrees did not disappoint. Service was prompt and  polite.
Wonderful, good drinks. The lobster ravioli was delicious. Make reservations
Great food, well-priced, good service. A little loud inside to have a conversation, wish the patio was an option but our entire party really enjoyed their dishes. Would definitely recommend.

Had I not been at a conference, I would have gotten something more than a sandwich.  The menu had a variety options.  The duck special would have been my first choice, but the haddock sandwich hit the spot!!

Lovely dinner. Prepared just the way it was requested. My husband has a gluten allergy and David’s gluten free choices were plentiful. Service was excellent and unobtrusive. Unfortunately party beside us was exceedingly loud but there’s no guaranteeing noise level. This was our first visit to David’s and we highly recommend it! Will return soon.
Food was excellent - we only had a main course so didn't get to try much. Ravioli dishes were RICH. Salmon was outstanding.
Outstanding food. Excellent service.  Can't wait to come back to Portland.  David's Restaurant is first on the list of places to go!
David’s never, ever disappoints.  Every single time we go, the food is absolutely fabulous.
We had a lovely dinner in the back room. Fish was perfectly cooked. Service was very good. Only negative was a very large party near us, so hard to have a conversation
Great location on monument square. The food was exceptional and the service was very attentive. It was Friday night so crowded but not so much that you didn

We stopped in (with a reservation) before attending a concert nearby. The meal was delicious from start to finish. We ordered three courses and cocktails. The waitress was attentive and professional. We are glad we found this spot; we will be back!
Lovely dinner in the heart of Portland. A great burger.
Well staffed traditional restaurant in downtown. Maple bacon salmon cake delicious; seafood main courses better than home cooked. Charming patio and bustling front room; back room over lit.

Food was fantastic, great portions and surprisingly good vslue for the times and the city.

We got a late table; and ate at the counter which was fine but very tight to seat 4! We soon met the other 2 next to us. Lol 

The staff was pleasant, quick and upbeat.

It was a great First Friday Art Walk and dinner event with my friend. I'll def go back, as I was looking forward to the Crab Cakes!

The food was excellent , with just enough of a unique touch.
Service was very pleasant, attentive without being invasive.
Will return.

Excellent entrees. The open face lobster ravioli and haddock and crab with blueberry lavender gastrique are highly recommended. The restaurant is very unassuming from the outside and I probably would not have really noticed it had I not seen the positive reviews online. The interior ambience was pleasant but the acoustics could be better. Despite the restaurant not being very full, there was a large table next to us that was fairly noisy. Will be back!
Wait staff is awesome. Food is very good. Host staff … on three separate occasions, rude. They don’t meet the standards set by the chef and the wait team.
Great staff! Everyone’s dinner was good. An overall pleasant dinner. Shout out to reception that got us in earlier than our reservation with a nice table. Thanks!
Food was exceptional across the board! Highly recommend.
Everything was delicious, including the cocktails.  Daniel our server was very helpful with any questions we had.  great job!  I would definitely eat here again when back in town.
Food and service was excellent. A great night all around.

This may the best meal I've ever had. I have a shellfish allergy and the staff was so helpful and accomodating. Our server was delightful. I truly enjoyed the salmon cakes and then the meatloaf -- I'll be thinking about both for a long time. Wow. My husband had open-faced lobster ravioli, and has never had a better meal. I cannot say enough about how much we loved David's.

I think the restaurant is probably very good. I think our menu choices may not have been the best for us. We were having a light lunch and ordered the mussels appetizer as our primary dish. The mussels were extremely spicy which surprised us because they were in a cream sauce. They might have appealed to others who prefer spicy food. They were definitely well-prepared and the clam chowder was great. If we go to David’s again, we will try something else.
Expensive and overrated.  Crispy Brussel sprouts were soggy and overloaded with balsamic.  Duck with inedible and overly sweet sauce.  Overall really disappointed.

Food quality, Service, presentation and menu choices are excellent. Everything in the menu is very reasonably priced. We started with Arincini, and Avocado/Heirloom tomato caprese, both of which were outstanding with good portion size. For mains we had the Meatloaf (best I’ve ever had) and a large salad with grilled shrimp. Both desserts featured fresh fruit and were also great. Our Server, Dan, was extremely friendly and attentive without being over-bearing. Highly recommend David’s for a casual evening dinner date.
A nice mix on the menu - everyone in our party of 8 was happy!!
Waiter forgot to place our main course order and blamed it on a kitchen mix-up. Finally served more than an hour after ordering. Both the meatloaf and the pizza were third-rate. Not going back.
Everything was amazing. The mussels, sirloin steak, the tuna were all fantastic.
Amazing food!  One of the best meals I have ever had.
Very nice place. Had lunch with friends. Everyone really enjoyed the food and the experience
Food and service were top shelf.  The noise level was such that you could actually carry on a conversation.
Ordered the steak and requested medium rare. It was served very rare, barely warm and tough. Potatoes and vegetables were good.

We absolutely loved David’s!  The food and service were excellent. The cocktails were lovely and the menu selection was broad enough for everyone e to find something they liked.

One note:  we tried many delicious desserts but would pass on the chocolate cashew caramel one unless you like salty flavors a lot.

We enjoy David's Restaurant and have dined there many times and highly recommend it to our friends and family. This was a bittersweet occasion combining a birthday and anniversary in the knowledge that we are moving and it may not be feasible to visit in the future. We savored the meatloaf and mushroom ravioli entrees. For dessert, the chocolate cashew torte. It was all delicious and our server was wonderful. Best wishes to everyone at David's with sincere thanks for years of dining bliss.

My wife and I had an outstanding meal. For an appetizer, we can highly recommend the arancini balls - they were incredible. For entrees I had David's meatloaf and my wife had the crispy skin duck breast - both were excellent. David's was a thoroughly enjoyable experience.

Food was excellent and value as well.  Just prepare to smell like oil and smoke.  The ventilation of cooking smells is very strong and you will end up smelling like it walking out. So prepare to dry clean the clothes it wear smoke clothes.

Other than that.  Lobster ravioli and everything. Is so good and good rating well merited.
The food was amazing! We sat in the back room. The wait staff was friendly and personable.

After going to all the newer trendy top 30 magazine restaurants we decided to try an established one and we were very impressed. The Vietnamese potstickers, tuna crudo, Salmon and Bacon/Potato Puzza were all outstanding and the bruschetta, Duck and Burger were very good. Nothing was average. Service was excellent.
Tasty local Portland choice with some international twists. Really nice lunch, meatloaf sandwich was juicy and saucy. Crispy beef and wontons was better than expected.
Second dinner here. Food and drinks were again delicious!
The best truffle fries in the state! Fantastic service and everything was delicious.

An off night. Food was slow coming out. Server was taking care of the whole room (loved being in the Opus 10 room though). Only one round of drinks offered. Caesar was mild tonight. Scallop and date app was delicious. For entrees, mushroom ravioli was amazing. Tuna was not as rare as I’d like (sitting too long?) and noodles were soggy. Haddock was delicious and fresh but blueberry compote was as sweet as blueberry pie, a strange paring. Duck was crispy but more well done than requested. Passed on dessert. This is unusual for David’s. Every place has an off night.

Went for dinner Tuesday night. The front section of the restaurant near the open kitchen and bar was incredibly noisy. Luckily, they seated us in the back room, which was pleasant and quiet. Wine list is surprisingly limited for an upscale restaurant. Food was exellent. The bruschette appetizer was very nice, a little more interesting than the usual. My duck was perfectly cooked with an unusual strawberry sauce I really liked. My husband had the tournedos au poivre which he loved. He doesn't usually order anything "au poivre" so I was surprised at how much he enjoyed this dish.  Dessert was a very tastey flourless chocolate cake. Our server (whose name I wish I remembered) was excellent--appearing just when we wanted her.  A charming little place and an altogether enjoyable experience.
The lunch from start to finish was delicious. The atmosphere at lunch was fantastic for good conversation and a relaxed pace. The food did not disappoint and the staff were attentive.
Very dependable and extensive menu that can satisfy most palates. Service was exemplary and timely.

Food, service, and ambiance were beyond excellent. We were in the back room, which was quiet. The front area might be more noisy. 
Two words of warning:
  The $$ pricing level listed on Open Table seems low to me. Check the menu for a more accurate idea of the prices.
  If you sit outside, you may have some of the local homeless folks in view.

We were visiting Portland on a quick get away ,booked David’s a week before the trip and we’re lucky to get in. Our server Nelson was super welcoming and knowledgeable. We were seated in the back room at a cozy table among mostly locals. I had the clam chowder and my wife and I shared the roasted brussel sprouts for our appetizers and both were delicious! For our entree’s my wife really enjoyed the open faced lobster ravioli and I had David’s meatloaf because I was happily at lobster overload!😊
We split the blueberry sorbet for our dessert treat. Perfect !
If you are in Portland I recommend going to David’s for dinner. Ask for Nelson!

This place was a very pleasant surprise. We popped in for dinner after getting stranded by a cancelled flight home.

We started with drinks. I had the Spiced Coconut Punch..... delicious!!! My husband tried David's Boulevardier. He thought it was fantastic.

We shared a Caesar Salad to start. It was really good, dressed to perfection and a great starter.

I had the Tournedos au Pouvre. The dish was amazing. The peppercorns in the sauce make it a little spicy but it's fantastic. The veggies and potatoes that come with it, compliment the meat well.

My husband chose David's Meatloaf. It was as delicious as it looks in the photos. We were both beyond pleased with our selections and would 100% try this restaurant again if we return to Portland, ME.

I would recommend making a reservation on Open Table.
Absolute best lobster ravioli I’ve ever experienced!  Great gem in a fun city.  Don’t miss this on your trip to Portland, Maine.
The lobster pasta and steak were so good! We sat at a table over looking the chicken. It was very cool to watch them working on the food. Everything was fantastic.

This restaurant on Monument square in Portland, Maine features friendly staff, and excellent food. The wait staff did not rush us to order, and delivered our appetizers and meals at appropriate time intervals. The food quality was quite good. I appreciated that they took reservations, as my friend and I had each travelled over an hour to get there, and didn't want to spend more time waiting for a table.
My only dislikes were that our table felt a bit crowded near others, and the noise volume, mostly from other patrons, was pretty loud. In retrospect I wished I had gotten a table outside.
We enjoyed excellent food choices, excellent service, and a very relaxed environment for conversation with old friends.

We had very good food. Loved the brussel sprouts - note they are fsirly sweet. And the lobster ravioli was delicious. Lots of lobster, shrimp, and scallops in a rich sauce. Also some spinach, peppers, and carrots. My husband enjoyed the duck. It is quite loud inside but we wre able to talk with a little effort. Oh, yummy strawberry mojito.

We celebrated a few birthdays and had so much fun!  The food was amazing!
Our only comment was that the chef's shouted super loud when announcing the orders were done. Other than that, we will definitely keep David's on our list of favorite restaurants!

We needed last minute reservations….most establishments were booked, David’s wasn’t. I was a little worried about that BUT there were 4 of us and each dinner was fabulous! The special: Haddock with crabmeat was cooked perfect and delicious, others had swordfish, meatloaf and salmon….ALL were perfect. The drinks were just as good! Will definitely return!!

So delicious….. the oysters were fresh and brimming with flavor.  My swordfish was Perfectly Cooked and the staff was most attentive to our tables food allergies. 5 stars well deserved! Look forward to going back next time in Portland!
Had family from out of town arrive for the weekend and booked a table. We loved the cozy atmosphere, food and service.
Lobster ravioli was excellent. Highly recommend.  I’ll be back.
Very good food and service. The cocktails were well balanced, including the mocktails. The starters were unique and yummy. Kasey, our server, was attentive without interrupting our dinner.
Great service and fantastic food. The drinks and food were both incredible. Specifically the salmon was some of the best I have ever had.
Food outstnading with excellent and surprising combinations of flavors that were unexpected. We can see where David's receives such excellent reviews. Lexi provided great service.

Liz was our server, and she was wonderful! The food was delicious, the cocktails tasty.
I do wish the outside seating had more ambiance. Maybe some plantings or attractive lighting. It seems the square has lost some of its atmosphere, which is no fault of the restaurant. Nonetheless, an excellent meal and service!
Great spot if you want casual but gourmet dinner.  Chowder and calamari were well seasoned and delicious. Haddock special could have been hotter and a little less cooked but flavor was good.
This was a great experience and the food was AMAZING!  They were even able to accommodate my food allergies.

Every time I have been to Tuscan Table, it has been nothing less than delicious.  I love that the menu changes often, so you never get tired of the same dishes, but there's always something new and amazing to try.  I have had pasta, chicken, and steak here, and they've all been cooked perfectly.  Their unique takes on some classics, like the caprese, are not to be missed.  The food is very fresh tasting and bright, the service is always top notch, and the ambience is wonderfully warm and inviting.  There's nothing like sitting in a big, cozy chair to eat your meal!   You wouldn't know it from the location or outside, but this is a gem!
All was great - but if there were more than 5 stars for service; Emma deserved them!
Love this place!! The food, décor and service are all wonderful!!
