We met friends for dinner and each of us ordered something different.  All of our meals were excellent.  I recommend the Spaghetti Carbonara and a side green salad! I made a request to sit upstairs when making my reservation through Open Table and my request was accommodated. Great setting for visiting with friends and having a great meal!

Menu items unavailable on a Saturday night is an inexcusable sign of poor planning; slow/emotionless service takes the fun out of the experience; and wonky pricing (seriously, a single scoop of gelato for $5 vs a slice of cake the size of your head only $2 more?) make the entire experience a bitter pull to swallow. Food was actually pretty good, but alone it’s enough to bring us back.

I was lucky to find this place when having lunch with friends. The dinner experience was even better. Our server was PHENOMENAL!! He seemed to like his job. Please keep this energy going as it is very rare. Our appetizers and meal were incredible. The Resolutions were a delicious and fun way to sip in the new year. Cannot wait to come back with friends or to sneak away with my husband for another anticipated meal.
Very nice selections on menu.  Wonderful service
Service was great and food was excellent

Our waiter was very attentive and answered our menu questions knowledgeably. Food was delicious. A couple of us had two appetizers as our main meal and and we came away satisfied as portion sizes were generous. 
Wonderful atmosphere...will definitely return!

The food was awesome and is always prepared perfectly.  The hit of the night was our waiter Wayne.  Wayne is all about customer service, he offered great suggestions, he has a wonderful personality and he really wants his customers to have a positive eating experience.

He was awesome !!  I will ask for Wayne each time I return to the restaurant...and I will return often.

Every time I have been to Tuscan Table, it has been nothing less than delicious.  I love that the menu changes often, so you never get tired of the same dishes, but there's always something new and amazing to try.  I have had pasta, chicken, and steak here, and they've all been cooked perfectly.  Their unique takes on some classics, like the caprese, are not to be missed.  The food is very fresh tasting and bright, the service is always top notch, and the ambience is wonderfully warm and inviting.  There's nothing like sitting in a big, cozy chair to eat your meal!   You wouldn't know it from the location or outside, but this is a gem!
All was great - but if there were more than 5 stars for service; Emma deserved them!

I was lucky to find this place when having lunch with friends. The dinner experience was even better. Our server was PHENOMENAL!! He seemed to like his job. Please keep this energy going as it is very rare. Our appetizers and meal were incredible. The Resolutions were a delicious and fun way to sip in the new year. Cannot wait to come back with friends or to sneak away with my husband for another anticipated meal.
Very nice selections on menu.  Wonderful service
Service was great and food was excellent

Our waiter was very attentive and answered our menu questions knowledgeably. Food was delicious. A couple of us had two appetizers as our main meal and and we came away satisfied as portion sizes were generous. 
Wonderful atmosphere...will definitely return!

The food was awesome and is always prepared perfectly.  The hit of the night was our waiter Wayne.  Wayne is all about customer service, he offered great suggestions, he has a wonderful personality and he really wants his customers to have a positive eating experience.

He was awesome !!  I will ask for Wayne each time I return to the restaurant...and I will return often.

Every time I have been to Tuscan Table, it has been nothing less than delicious.  I love that the menu changes often, so you never get tired of the same dishes, but there's always something new and amazing to try.  I have had pasta, chicken, and steak here, and they've all been cooked perfectly.  Their unique takes on some classics, like the caprese, are not to be missed.  The food is very fresh tasting and bright, the service is always top notch, and the ambience is wonderfully warm and inviting.  There's nothing like sitting in a big, cozy chair to eat your meal!   You wouldn't know it from the location or outside, but this is a gem!
All was great - but if there were more than 5 stars for service; Emma deserved them!
Love this place!! The food, décor and service are all wonderful!!

Our waiter was very attentive and answered our menu questions knowledgeably. Food was delicious. A couple of us had two appetizers as our main meal and and we came away satisfied as portion sizes were generous. 
Wonderful atmosphere...will definitely return!

The food was awesome and is always prepared perfectly.  The hit of the night was our waiter Wayne.  Wayne is all about customer service, he offered great suggestions, he has a wonderful personality and he really wants his customers to have a positive eating experience.

He was awesome !!  I will ask for Wayne each time I return to the restaurant...and I will return often.

Every time I have been to Tuscan Table, it has been nothing less than delicious.  I love that the menu changes often, so you never get tired of the same dishes, but there's always something new and amazing to try.  I have had pasta, chicken, and steak here, and they've all been cooked perfectly.  Their unique takes on some classics, like the caprese, are not to be missed.  The food is very fresh tasting and bright, the service is always top notch, and the ambience is wonderfully warm and inviting.  There's nothing like sitting in a big, cozy chair to eat your meal!   You wouldn't know it from the location or outside, but this is a gem!
All was great - but if there were more than 5 stars for service; Emma deserved them!
Love this place!! The food, décor and service are all wonderful!!

We met friends for dinner and each of us ordered something different.  All of our meals were excellent.  I recommend the Spaghetti Carbonara and a side green salad! I made a request to sit upstairs when making my reservation through Open Table and my request was accommodated. Great setting for visiting with friends and having a great meal!

Menu items unavailable on a Saturday night is an inexcusable sign of poor planning; slow/emotionless service takes the fun out of the experience; and wonky pricing (seriously, a single scoop of gelato for $5 vs a slice of cake the size of your head only $2 more?) make the entire experience a bitter pull to swallow. Food was actually pretty good, but alone it’s enough to bring us back.

I was lucky to find this place when having lunch with friends. The dinner experience was even better. Our server was PHENOMENAL!! He seemed to like his job. Please keep this energy going as it is very rare. Our appetizers and meal were incredible. The Resolutions were a delicious and fun way to sip in the new year. Cannot wait to come back with friends or to sneak away with my husband for another anticipated meal.

We have been to the corner room 3 times in the last 2 months.  We just can’t stop going.  It’s been outrageously good: great service, phenomenal food.  Even the little kids were thrilled.  It doesn’t get the notoriety of some of the other Portland restaurants, but for me, it’s unbelievable value.  Best of all, they have fantastic GF pasta.  What a treat.
Always great food! Great location and we had the miss amazing server!
Wonderful experience! The food was delicious and the service was amazing!!
first but not the last time. wonderful knowlegeable waitress. the 3 of us were discussing Last Summer at the PMA and the booth was perfect,  pillows were appreciated
Great service, very positive environment. Great food, very fresh
Really excellent pasta dishes.  Don't overlook the spaghetti and meatballs.  Very relaxed dinning experience even on the busy night that we went.
Delicious pasta, nice Chianti, lovely spirited waitress… what more could you ask.  Highly recommend this restaurant.
The best bruscetta, prosciutto and canolli ever! Excellent service and would return without any doubt. ❤️

The Corner Room was amazing! The drinks so good with blueberries on the bottom! The focaccia bread so fresh it melted in your mouth! These were the best mussels we have eaten in Maine! 
Definitely will be coming back!
really good food , really good service , nice ambience

We walked in at 7:00 on a Wednesday night and the place was bright, crowded and LOUD.  The service was good, the food was good, the value was good.  Overall, the restaurant was good.  Personally, it would not be my go-to place for Italian food, but I would go back and would recommend it to friends.
The place was very energetic for a Tuesday!  Food was great and the service was very friendly. Would definitely go again!

The food was delicious, with an upscale ambiance. The waitress was friendly and courteous, and the host was very helpful. We had the lasagna, spaghetti and meatballs, truffle Mac and cheese, and focaccia bread. A+ rating on all.

The waiter started off great friendly.  We made the reservation for dinner prior to a performance with plenty of time 1-1/2 hours.  We got a bottle of wine and an appetizer right away, ordered meal when wine came then shortly after appetizer came.  Then we sat for 40 min without our food being delivered, neighboring tables who were sat after us ordered after and received food.  waiter in 40 minutes did not come to check on us.  We were going to be late for our event so I got up to go tell our waiter that we still hadn’t received our food after 40+ minutes and we needed it packaged to go also need the check. Waiter did not say sorry, just he’ll have to looking into that.  Came over to our table 5 minutes later saying the kitchen did something with the ticket. I’ve waited tables quite a bit in my life and totally understand blaming the kitchen but this was so outrageous, the waiter had not been to our table to check on us in over 40 min, that’s on him. He by the way tell us he’ll get us to our show on time… yes only because I got up to say we’ve been sitting for 40 min, and we’ll go to the show without eating dinner. Yes we got food which was put in our car, and a cream sauce is terrible the next day.  There was no offer of a discount.  It’s a shame the rooms are normally spot on to service and food.

So happy to get a last minute reservation on a Saturday night.  We brought guests from out of state and they loved the atmosphere.  Our waitstaff were knowledgeable and attentive and the food was spectacular.  We had a food variety from pizza to spaghetti to salads. All amazing.  (Loved my beet salad)   A+ side of roasted carrots!!!

The food was excellent, as was the service. When we arrived the hostess was not at the podium but quickly returned and acknowledged us immediately. Our waiter was appropriately attentive. Our table was at a window, which we really enjoyed. The one drawback was the noise level but that would not stop us from going to The Corner Room again.

We’ve loved this place for a long time, but hadn’t been in a while. Our most recent experience was  disappointing and left us questioning if we’d go back.

First, the food was sadly just ok. Not the stellar experience we’ve always had here. For instance, the homemade Mozzarella on our Caprese salads was rubbery and dry - just truly awful. We mentioned it to the server but she said that’s “just how it is” and they “make it in house”. She just walked away and didn’t offer to get us something else, which was disappointing. Also, who  runs out of focaccia bread at an Italian restaurant by 7pm? We were looking forward to it to accompany our apps. The worst was the negligence on the food allergy. My husband ordered the halibut fish special and shared his garlic  food allergy with the server. We asked for no pesto sauce on the fish but it arrived smothered in pesto anyway. It was so dark where we were sitting, my husband didn’t notice it right away and thought it was parsley garnish. He ate a good amount before he realized, but it was too late. He was sick for rest of the night.  No compensation was provided for the dish.

Food aside, our biggest regret with our experience was how the restaurant handled a patron slipping and falling  down literally all over our table filled with food and drinks.  The woman fell so hard, she spilled the entire contents of our table all over our laps. Our clothes were drenched. We managed to clean up the mess (mostly ourselves) but our clothes were all wet for the rest of the night.  We would have expected some sort of compensation for having to sit through the rest of our meal soaking wet, but all we were offered is another beer for my husband who had the most left in his glass when it happened. The rest of us just sat there and offered nothing. We expected maybe a free dessert or the manager coming over to apologize, but no one seemed all that apologetic for having our night and clothes ruined.

Overall, we expected a better experience.
The food was great and the service was attentive, but relaxed. I did not feel rushed or forgotten.
Food and service was great.  Been there many times and never disappointed.

The server allowed us to take our time deciding and ordering multiple smaller plates which were outstanding. We sat at a counter and enjoyed watching  the team assemble and plate dishes. 
Great evening.
Excellent dinner with friends from away. Food was delicious and Sean, our waiter, was funny and very pleasant.
Service was outstanding! Food was delicious! I cannot wait to go back.
Delicious dinner, big portions, amazing service from Sean! Quite loud and tables are close together, but will absolutely be back again!!
Everything was very good, our waitress was amazing.
Excellent service, delicious food, and fun atmosphere!
Great food, great service but a bit noisy!  Be nice if there could be be some noise control!
Loved it! All of the food was delicious and the service was perfect. The restaurant is small, so can be a bit noisy but that’s understandable.
Food was exceptionally delicious! Can’t wait to go back!

We had an unpleasant dining experience at The Corner Room. We sat at our table for 15 minutes before anyone come over to take our drink order. Then the food came out cold. It was also not good quality food-there are several other Italian restaurants in Portland that are FAR better. Our waiter did take one of the entrees off the bill in an effort to try and salvage the dinner, which was kind. But definitely wouldn’t recommend this as a dining option when there are so many other amazing places to eat in Portland.
Always a great meal at The Corner Room, starting with the pillowy soft focaccia and all the way through dessert. Every dish a home run.

We dined at the corner room during our first visit to Portland after getting the recommendation from a Portland resident we were speaking with.  It was outside of the waterfront area so we wouldn’t have noticed it. It was excellent!!  It’s a small restaurant so we were glad we made a reservation. The food is Italian- homemade pastas and delicious. We started with the arancini and each choose the orchichette with sausage. We chose the smaller size dish on the advice of our waitress Leanna as we were staying in a hotel. The portions were so generous we ended up with leftovers anyway which we made fit in the mini fridge it was too good to leave behind! Leanna was great, her smile and enthusiasm added to our wonderful experience. If you are visiting Portland area for a few days give yourself a break from all the seafood and eat  here, you will be happy you did.

Enjoyed the window seat. Charcuterie board had many wonderful items. A favorite was the ricotta. Salami also excellent.  I enjoyed the fresh local
Fish on risotto with peas and fava beans.  Husband enjoyed mussels.
Never disappoints!  Excellent food, wine list and outstanding service!  Great place!
Amazing food and service!! We had the bruschetta and arancinis for appetizers.  Chicken parm and spaghetti for dinner.  The portions were very generous!

the food was delicious.  We all raved about the muscles and the dipping bread.  A real treat to have the tuna cooked perfectly.  The fresh bread is so wonderful.  Chicken parm is still a big hit and lasts for two days.  Topped it off with chocolate Torte.  Yummy.  the wait staff and bar tender were all very friendly and efficient.

We made reservations for our anniversary. We were offered champagne as a part of our celebration, which showed us they went above and beyond to make our night special. The food was outstanding and our waiter couldn’t have been more friendly and inviting. 10/10 recommend for anyone debating where to celebrate an occasion or grabbing a casual bite to eat in downtown Portland.

This was our first time at the Corner Room.  I’ve tried to dine in as a walk-in, but was promptly turned away without a reservation. This time with the reservation, we came in, noted a few open tables and checked in for our reservation about eight minutes early. When I gave the host the name on the reservation he looked it up and said I’ll seat you at 7:30 and walked away without another word.  Not a warm welcome and really changed the tone of the evening.  Thankfully once we sat (at one of the tables that had been open all along), our waitress was very welcoming and made us feel good about being there.  The food was good, the drinks were good.  Dessert menu maybe lacked some depth.  Overall it was a pleasant evening.  But I don’t know that I will return.  The customer service at the front of the house really kind of turned us off when we first walked in.￼

Reliable italian eatery. 
House made pasta. 
Recommend the bruschetta and all pasta dishes. 
If you can save room for dessert, tiramisu is delicious as is biscotti with vin santo.
We had great food and prompt, professional service.
One of my go to places, it’s great in the city of restaurants you have a phenomenal place you can count on.  Great staff, awesome chef!

Greeted and seated immediately. Ordered wine, spaghetti and meatballs, a Caesar salad and garlic bread. All were wonderfully prepared and actually, wonderful to eat. Nice ambiance. The bar was pretty full when we arrived at 5:30. Happy hour, I expect. We will certainly return and will request a front window table.
Great food and drinks.  Very friendly and professional staff. A must go when in Portland.
It was a special occasion to celebrate a work promotion.  The food was great and service exceptional !
Always a good meal and great service! So consistent.  We’ll be back…again

We went in the middle of a snow/ice/rain event and expected it to be slow but it was quite busy! Not surprising as the food was delicious. We had the focaccia special and caprese salad to start. In our party of 4 we had 2 bolognese (YUM!), the gemelli (also YUM!) and another with asparagus, peas and lemon (again - YUM!) 
Despite it being busy, it was not noisy. We were seated near the door and when opened we got a burst of cold air. Curtains helped but it did get chilly. Now, it was a stormy night so I would not expect this to be an issue on a normal weather night.
Our Portland go to.  We always appreciate the quality and the value proposition is there too.  Wine selection is limited, but pairs very well with the menu.  Would highly recommend.

Shawn//Sean was our waiter and was AMAZING!! I originally had reservations for 6:45 and made a note that if they had any 6:00 cancellations we had tickets to a show at 8:00 PM and would like to have gotten in sooner. Due to a large party cancelling, they were able to get us in and called to let us know. We were delighted! Shawn recommended the Pappardelle Mushroom truffle dish. My husband had Chicken Parmagiano with a side of spaghetti. The red sauce was very flavorful and tasty! We enjoyed mocktails - a cosmopolitan for me and a virgin Mambo for my hubby. We enjoyed connoli’s for dessert. Though we could only eat one , they were delicious!! We took the second one home (along with lots of leftovers) to snack on at a later time!  The Corner room gets a 5 star review from us, and Shawn gets a perfect 10 for his pleasant disposition, warm smile, and ability to utilize friendly communication skills to quickly engage in establishing a positive connection with patrons. Shawn is top notch! We could not have asked for a better experience all around! Thank you Shawn & The Corner Room!!
Excellent food, excellent service.  We had not dined at The Corner Room since before the pandemic and will definitely return soon.  Great restaurant!

Make a reservation!  It’s a small place and there’s no space to hang around and wait for a table, much less mill around with a pre-dinner beverage. Once you eat here and experience the amazing food, I guarantee you’ll do what’s needed to be a repeat customer. I did!

The food was well prepared with good flavor. The service was fully adequate, considering the multitude of diners. However, the noise level was that of a jet taking off. The tables are close together and it is difficult to hear the person sitting across from you. Basically you have to scream to be heard over the ambient noise level.  We had a large woman at the next table with a ebullient hyena laugh that dominated the room without remorse. It was difficult to enjoy the excellent meal.

This was our first time to this restaurant and the experience was wonderful .  The service was superb. Our waitress advised us to put our full order in so we could make our 630 show and we weren’t rushed. The food was awesome …we had the Gemelli and Cioppino, the bruschetta with tomatoes and mozzarella and the baked Crespelle.  Outstanding 5/5 will definitely return
It was the off season when we visited so atmosphere was very good and not too loud. Overall food was good not great. The one exception was the Mussels appetizers, they were great.

Our server was very attentive and gave a great description of the menu and suggestions. We love this restaurant because the Italian is authentic. My husband has the bolognese and it was the best! Always our got to  in Portland even with the many other restaurants
Immaculate! Consistently one of the very best Portland has to offer. A village vibe with food as fresh and flavorful as you can get. And the service is delivered with love.
Service was stellar and food was terrific. Would recommend going there for a casual atmosphere and upscale meal
Overall, a great experience. The wait staff were upbeat and eager to make sure it was a great experience. The food was very good but portions were a bit small for an Italian restaurant.
Bolognese was excellent. No pressure to eat and leave.
The space is very well thought out. We enjoyed the meal and our server was very attentive.
Excellent Caesar salad and spaghetti and meatballs.

Fantastic food -   great bartender !
Great night -- will be back soon!

The corner room was the perfect date night spot! Our server Shaun (not sure if the spelling is correct) was so kind & attentive! A little pricey but you definitely get what you pay for. Would 100% recommend.

Our server, I believe his name was Sean was fantastic.  Checked on us periodically, but not over done.  Made perfect suggestions for food and wine choices and made sure we were not rushed or made late for the show at Merrill.
The food was absolutely delicious and fresh.  Very delightful experience.  We will return when we are in the area again.

1st time was quite impressed.  Very tasty food, great ambiance, and excellent service. Will be going back next time in Portland.  Great pre-show dinner option, only a 2 minute walk from Merrill Auditorium.  Italian fare - be sure to check out the specials menu- lasagna was excellent

Our server, Shaun, was attentive, personable and helpful despite being very busy.  He checked to see if we were going to the symphony (we were) so that he could let the kitchen know.  They are always extremely accommodating.
   The food, as always, was excellent.   I have never had even a mediocre meal at the Corner Room - always excellent food and service.

It has been a couple of months but our dinner experience here was excellent.  The ambience is warm and inviting with lighting and room temperature set perfectly.
The host and our waiter greeted us warmly.  Our waiter was well versed with the menu items.
We started with mussels which exceeded the quality that we often get at other places.  These mussels were nice and plump and filled out the shells.  The broth was delicious!  We also tried the Bruschetta which we loved and it was very filling (took some home) and we had the truffles Mac and Chz which also had leftovers to bring home.
Entrees were spaghetti and meat balls, wonderful and the meatballs were great!
Two of us had the squid ink pasta was delicious with some spice but the menu said it has mussels and shrimp but we didn’t get shrimp in either plate.  I asked the waiter about this and he said that the menu only lists mussels.  When I got home I looked and saw that he was wrong.  That was a misstep on his part and disappointing for us as we would have enjoyed the shrimp especially considering we had already had mussels as an app.
Regardless of the one error by perhaps, a new cook in the kitchen, we had a wonderful dinner, loved our waiter and other staff that assisted him.  We tipped generously and will return when we are in Portland again.
We had a reservation, we were seated right on time. Server was pleasant and we didn't have to wait for our drinks/appet. dinner also came right out. The foot was hot and delicious.
Sean, our waiter was excellent - very attentive. And I loved the focaccia with EVOO & vin cotta for dipping as well as the arancini. It’s crowded & noisy, but you feel like it’s the “it” place to be.
Love the cozy atmosphere. Service was very good. Had excellent soup - salad was good but it had many more greens than I expected based on its menu description and was a bit disappointing.

Such a lovely place for food and drink! The Esppresso Martini was amazing along with the selection of wines! The Arancini app and the Roasted Beet Salad were so delicious! And the Baked Crespelle is ridiculously the best comfort Italian food you will ever eat! From the bread to the pasta to you name it... well worth a visit to The Corner Room!
Best one out of the 4 other rooms. Food was amazing and the service was outstanding.
We always love the corner room. Tonight was awesome we had a great waiter and the food was delicious
Amazing food and great service!  A favorite local spot.

We realize you gotta turn the tables to make a buck. However, I don’t like being rushed out the door. You guys need to back off a little bit on expediting customers out the door they may not come back.

We were seated promptly. Things are a bit cramped.  The bruschetta was an enormous piece of bread with giant tomatoes on it. My wife was disappointed. The squid with peppers was good. I enjoyed the mussels and incredibly buttery garlic bread. My girls had the pasta Bolognese but there was an imbalance between the amount of sauce and noodles. They wanted more pasta. The pasta was handmade and delicious. The pasta in mushroom cream sauce was tasty but I have had better of the same dish. I think this is a nice place to step in for a quick bite. I wouldn’t travel to town to dine here.  I enjoyed the mussels and incredibly buttery garlic bread.
Great service from Sean! Food was excellent as always my friends and I had a great Christmas dinner with each other :)
Great food, Great Service, great space.  We will be back soon.
Great waitress!  She was so helpful and had great glasses!  Food was great and very festive!

This visit was for our wedding anniversary and a wonderful experience! Our server was prepared, knowledgable, efficient and kind. The dinner was quite tasty although my wife had the scallop dish and there was not the expected amount of scallops in the dish. We thorougly enjoyed our visit, the atmosphere, food and staff.

Relaxing spot to have a dinner with friends. The food was great and reasonably priced. They didn't rush us to leave the table when we were done eating.  It would have been nice to have complimentary bread, however. It was a little cool too with all the windows. I will definitely go  back again!

Loved everything about the corner room. Door was excellent as well as the service yummy drinks. Pasta was so perfectly prepared. Antipasti was exceptional. A bit noisy but is is expected when there are that many enjoying the incredible culinary art at its finest form.
Had a business dinner and the food was terrific.  Great service and really enjoyed it!  Will definitely go back again when in Portland!
Great atmosphere. Could have been great.Came highly recommended yet fell short of expectation.Food just ok and staff less than welcoming. Our group was disappointed.

We came to The Corner Room on Friday 11-24, and had the most amazing experience. Our server was exceptional, the calamari and homemade focaccia bread was so delightful. We all got a different pasta dish and shared a bottle of Pinot Nior! Then ended with homemade limoncello and cannolis. The bill was so reasonable. We cannot wait to go back to this restaurant!
Food is consistently great. It is a small space and a tad crowded which also brings the noise level up. But the food makes it all worth it.
amazing! our server Sean made it more so.  great recommendations, delicious apps (we had most of them) , wonderful seasonal cocktails/mocktails,  entrees!
It’s just great! You can be a meat eater or not and have a super meal!

I have been coming here for years and love it, truly a Portland staple. We were here for a special occasion and the food and drinks were as amazing as they always are. Unfortunately our server only came over to take our order and deliver it, our drinks sat empty throughout our entire meal after finishing them with apps. This is SO out of the norm and hopefully doesn’t happen again!
Delicious food and great service. It took a little while to get our entrees but they arrived hot and delicious.
Incredible food at incredible prices!  We loved everything.
Excellent Italian fare, lots of vegetarian options, great service, impressive wine list.
We look forward to eating at The Corner Room again soon!  Everything was delicious.

We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner.  Despite being a very busy night in the city, the staff was great and food was delicious. We will definitely return when we are back in Portland!  (The braised short ribs were particularly good.)

Hanger steak and sides were overcooked.
Very loud.
Good service.
The restaurant was very smoky inside. It was hard to breathe and you leave smelling like the restaurant.  I think they may have good issues.
Great experience. Food was top notch and the prices were reasonable. Quiet, good service and nice atmosphere. Garlic bread was absolutely amazing.
great from cocktails to dessert. looking forward to returning soon.

Right from making reservations over the phone to being greeted by the hostess and then having the pleasure of being served by Susanne , everything was perfect.  We all truly enjoyed our delicious meals, from mussels to pappardelle w. mushroom sauce and the focaccia, etc...  Thank you Corner Room staff, job well done.
Food, service and atmosphere were outstanding.  Celebrated a birthday and it was a great treat. First visit but will definitely be back.

Great food and atmosphere. The pasta dishes come in two sizes and the smaller portion is more than enough for most people. Pizza was excellent. Drinks were a bit funky - when the waiter asked if there was an alcohol preference and we said no, he said that they normally use Absolute. This was fine except there was a $3 upcharge that wasn't mentioned. And it took 15 minutes to receive a second beer because "the bar was backed up".  No big deal. Good food and fun time.
Food and services were great! Overall was good. I would go back to try different foods on the menu!

Food and drinks were great.  Worst service we have had in years.  Server was surly, borderline rude, inattentive, and unsanitary.  We waited for a LONG time for attention after we were seated, at least 10-15 minutes.  Appetizer arrived before drinks.  We finished eating and could not catch the servers eye for at least 20 minutes.  We never had an opportunity to order more drinks.  Then we were told we missed dessert by 10 minutes, the last one was just sold.  Server touched bread with bare hands, held drinks by the rim of glassware.  Just gross.  We have had great service in the past at this restaurant, hopefully this server doesn’t last.  If it happens again, we won’t return, despite the good food.
Enjoyed sitting at the chef’s bar. Very entertaining to watch them prepare the tasty and great looking dishes.

As always a wonderful experience for our anniversary dinner! The staff was amazing and the food delicious! We met a wonderful couple from Arkansas at the bar and another couple who knew some old friends of ours! Small world, and as always a lovely experience. Will return next year!

Food was delicious, but best of all was the service. Our server (and I wish I had her name to share so that she could get the credit!) was TOP NOTCH. The perfect balance of knowledge, attentiveness, professionalism and warmth. Heightened the experience exponentially!

Awesome Restaurant!! We were seated promptly at a great table.  The ambiance is energetic with an open kitchen, full bar, music playing, and tables all in a relatively small space.  The service was prompt and attentive with a warm smile.  The food was absolutely delicious.  The wine list was great.  All this fun ambiance, great service and delicious food was delivered at a very reasonable price.   Thank you!

The Corner Room and the rest of the Rooms restaurants are always exceptional. The food and service make these establishments some of my most favorite restaurants in Portland. The cocktails are creative and the food is perfectly prepared and flavorful. We had the garlic bread, beef carpaccio, bolognese, and mushroom pappardelle. All were excellent and sadly we had no room for dessert.

Would have given 5 stars, but for the noise level. Need to put in rugs, acoustic panels or something to absorb some of the noise. We couldn’t hear what people at our own table were saying. Everything else was great!
Great food, took awhile to arrive, music was playing loud.
Great food with friendly and professional wait staff.
Excellent pan seared Hake.  Wonderful mussels.  Service was great and cheerful.

Susanne was an amazing serving,recommending the fish which was Hake and was excellent  Cannot say enough about all the food which was fresh,and fabulous .
Thanks, 
See you soon.

Wonderful alternative to the places you have to book 2 months out.  Hanger steak was prepared perfectly.  Wife's pasta was delicious.  Our table got a margherita pizza as an appetizer and it was out of this world.  Charming location and interior.  They should do more noise control though.
Quickly seated with a reservation. Our waiter was attentive and very personable. The food was great! We’ll be back.

Our server was phenomenal, but the restaurant was definitely under staffed. The kitchen forgot to put in both of our appetizers, & one of our full portions of pasta was the same size as a half portion. They were kind enough to bring out additional pasta free of charge when we called it out. There was also only one bar tender, so our drinks took a very long time to come out.
Very nice evening with a dear friend I hadn’t seen in nearly 40 years. All good.
The food was exceptional from the prosciutto-grape-gorgonzola bruschetta to the caesar salad to the bolognese. The service was lovely, too. Nice range of affordable wines. Highly recommend.
Great food! Great service!! Would highly recommend.

We love the Corner Room, it's always a favorite. On this visit we sat at the counter bar and watched the kitchen staff in action. Unfortunately our server was less than stellar but it didn't matter, we had a great meal and enjoyed watching the kitchen staff. The ginger cosmopolitan was a hit!!
Second time going for dinner.  Always make a trip to corner room when in Portland. The homemade ricotta is out of this world.

Excited for a great experience.  We met some friends for dinner and they had eaten here before and enjoyed the experience.  Our server was attentive and the food was pretty good.  

The rating is due to several things; first, this nonsense of charging for bread is criminal, especially in an Italian restaurant.  It costs $1 yet you charge $8 and this was not even on the menu; the sourdough was but this was not what we got served. 

Also, the authentic Italian trattoria, we paid for a side of pasta yet the size of what we received was not $8 worth; the pasta plate, although they weren't run of the mill pasta was twice as much and probably was.  

I don't mind paying for good food or items made onsite but isn't this why I am dining out? There are somethings that have gotten out of hand and raking your customers over the coals is not cool.  While Portland, ME has come of age of late, just remember when the freight train is done, they will wonder why things become a wasteland.  

I would caution diners here as the food is good, ambiance OK, but I am struggling with some of the practices.

I forgot how loud it can be in there. If you are with somebody who is wearing hearing aids, or is a bit hard of hearing, it may not be that enjoyable for them. Our service this time was just OK. A bit disappointing. We will be back for sure and hope for a better experience. The food is always great.

I had the mushroom pasta in truffle sauce and it was fantastic. A small portion even let me bring home enough for lunch today. I did eat a lot of focaccia in oil first! Cannolis recommended by our server were very good. My SIL had the Bolognese pasta and enjoyed it as well. Her crème Brûlée was very good. Our server was attentive and efficient. For a Wednesday evening the small restaurant was quite busy. We had reservations for 5 PM and were delayed in traffic. We received a confirmation phone call on our way. At 6:30 we felt like our table was needed although we would have enjoyed tea and coffee or another glass of wine. I will return!

The food was spectacular!
The wait staff were helpful and attentive.  If I lived here this would be a spot I would revisit often.
Apps were great, main meals were ok, waitstaff was horrible, took forever to get any service and she was very rude! She seemed to be very bothered that we were even there. Won’t go back
Food was very fresh, tasty and with generous portions.

The kitchen needs better ventilation. When we walked in the whole restaurant was filled with smoke. Not great when I’m allergic to smoke. 
I wasn’t thrilled with their use of canola oils either. Seems it’s everywhere now!

When we arrived at the restaurant it was a bit chaotic with several people checking in for their reservations. Another couple was checked in for our reservation because our names were similar resulting in roughly a 20 minute delay in being seated. We then received our entire meal before we received our first cocktail roughly 45 minutes after being seated. We were then told we couldn't order a second round of cocktails as they had run out of the ingredients to make the one that we had ordered. The food was excellent as usual but the experience was terrible.
Wonderful food wonderful service great place to dine.
the food, service, and onverall experience was FANTASTIC!!!
Service was great. Very friendly and attentive. I got the pizza, delicious!! Everything was awesome,! Great prices too.
Small portioned sizes of chopped chicken replaces a whole breast in this deceiving dish for $30
Can’t say enough about the food, service, ambiance and our wonderful wait staff, amazing experience, sat at chefs table and were treated top notch! Look forward to our next dining experience here!
Fun time. Server was very good and made us feel like loyal customers.  Great vibe. Great food!

We sat at the bar and the bartender was awesome!! A one person show serving the 10+seats at bar and the servers!
She was wonderful!
Went to dinner here with an Italian friend and we all loved it!!  Hand made pasta.
Excellent food and cocktails! Love this place, I wish they could more easily accommodate parties of more than 6 though.

First time in Portland and wanted Italian after several days of seafood. Corner Room came up on a search for available seatings and did not disappoint! We were greeted as soon as we walked in a couple mins before our reservation and were told our table was just being prepared. We had a great little table for 2 next to the expansive window. Our waiter was delightful, making sure we had everything we needed. Water was plentiful, and I found myself drinking a lot, I think because the food was a little salty…but it was good! I’d definitely go back…so many great things on the menu.

Not enough wait staff to handle the room and the kitchen was overwhelmed - our side dish came out well after our entrees were served and we had to remind our waiter. On the plus side, the food was good and the room was comfortable and well appointed.

We love everything about this place. Food is outstanding! We enjoy sitting at the bar. Our bartender Ariel is amazing. We went 2X during our stay and the second visit was because of her and the beef carpaccio. We will return again when we come back in September!
Good Italian selection in a very busy atmosphere.  We were advised  by our server that they were short on kitchen staff, so service was a bit slow. Otherwise a comfy  place.
Lovely Italian restaurant with incredibly gracious service.  Outperformed expectations foodwise.  Would not have been out of place in NYC's Little Italy. Solid wine list at very reasonable prices.

Amazing food and service! Nothing could be improved!
Never disappoints.
Nice restaurant and great food . Great service. We recommend.
Best Italian meal in a very long time! Friendly and entertaining staff too.

This was one of our favorite restaurants in Portland from start to finish. We sat at the bar for a few minutes - the bartender was lovely and mixed  marvelous cocktails. Once seated, the wait staff were attentive and gave great suggestions. ￼ As a whole, the ambiance was lovely and the food was phenomenal. It’s pricey, but every good restaurant seems to be.

We arrived at 5:15 for a 5:30 reservations.  The person at the front desk said we would have to wait since we were early for our reservation.  There was  one occupied table and all the rest were empty.  When i asked why we would have to wait since there were so many empty tables, he started mumbling to his partner and after about 30 seconds decided to seat us.  We had a nice waitress but  it took our food an hour to arrive.  Luckily we had left ourselves plenty of time for the opera at Merrill auditorium so we weren't late.  The food was ok but the problems at the front desk and in the kitchen were not.
The food was delicious and the service was friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. The bruschetta appetizer and garlic bread were first rate. All four of us enjoyed our pasta dishes. Great experience!
Must try great cocktails and filling dishes. Bar service was great. House chopped salad is a must 😋

Nice place with very good food and some excellent, reasonably priced wines.

There were a few negatives that lowered my rating: It was VERY loud which made it tiring to chat across the table. The lowest part of the meal was the time it took to get served. Between appetizers and main course, we waited over an hour. That meant that one of our party missed the ferry and had to take a later one. The other negative was the smoke from the kitchen which stung our eyes and left our clothes smelling strongly. 
The service was good in that our server was pleasant, and gave honest and helpful advice. The service was poor in that we had to wait so long -- sometimes that has nothing to do with the wait staff, though. I would like to go back but I think a few things could be improved to make this a really great experience. I recommend with the above reservations

I asked chef if he could prepare I dish that is no longer at the Front Room. He said he would check on ingredients needed. We were seated. When time to order I asked our waitresses (Gillian) to see if my request could be done. Immediately she informed me that could NOT be done. I let her know that chef was checking. So she reluctantly went to the chef. She came back with the news I was hoping for. My request was honored. My hats off to the chef.

I asked chef if he could prepare I dish that is no longer at the Front Room. He said he would check on ingredients needed. We were seated. When time to order I asked our waitresses (Gillian) to see if my request could be done. Immediately she informed me that could NOT be done. I let her know that chef was checking. So she reluctantly went to the chef. She came back with the news I was hoping for. My request was honored. My hats off to the chef.
Excellent food and service. Reasonably priced as well!

The hostess last evening was hostile and unpleasant.  She asked me to spell my multiple times and repeatedly told me that I did not have a reservation.  I showed her the reminder that open table had sent me about the reservation.  She still insisted, rudely, that I did not have a reservation.  About then my soon, who had already been seated, stood up.  We went past the ‘hostess’ and sat down at the table that we had reserved.  She followed us to the table and remained unpleasant !

She presents your restaurant very poorly.

Our server, a J1 from Croatia, was very pleasant and helpful.  The food was good.

THE EXPERIENCE WITH THE HOSTESS WAS VERY UNPLEASANT.
Food was great! Place has some smoke in the restaurant but still very good.
Fantastic food! We enjoyed the whole experience! Can’t wait to come back!
We celebrated our daughter's 18th birthday there and had a wonderful meal and a great time. Thank you for not rushing us and allowing us to celebrate. ￼!!!!
We loved our meal at the Corner Room, it was our anniversary and they greeted us with a complimentary glass of Prosecco. Food and service was great, highly recommend.
Enjoyed a lovely dinner with great service at a window table. The scallops and pea/fava bean risotto were perfect. Our best meal in Portland.  Would definitely return.
The Corner Room never disappoints! Delicious food, great service, amazing wine & drink list.
We visited for our 20th anniversary and had a great time. Food was very flavorful and delicious and great staff. Thank you for making it such a nice night for us! ❤️

Food and drink were excellent, and the service was excellent.  Our server Susanne was knowledgable, friendly, efficient, and professional.  We would definitely come back on a future visit to Portland.
The kitchen does a tremendous job of ensuring your food is freshly prepared & delivered quickly from the kitchen (hot). Nice & knowledgeable wait staff to help round out a great dining experience.

Having been to the Living Room and the Grill Room, we feel the Corner Room was not as inviting. The table was so close to the front door, I felt like we were eating outside. The food was okay. Every other restaurant that I have ordered chicken Parmigiana, it came with some kind of pasta. Having to order a side of pasta for an additional $9, is a little outrageous.

Everything was amazing! The AC was broken so it was VERY hot in there but not much anyone can do about that 
Food was delicious and service was outstanding 
One of my favorite spots in Portland

Excellent food, great staff, our server was very good and her recommendations were spot on.

Only issue was the high heat in  the dining room, all the doors were open, but it did not seem to help.
The food was amazing! Our server was great! She recommended an amazing bottle of wine. Wanted to keep eating but was so full so will be having my leftovers for a late night snack!
Food and service was good. Just be prepared to dine at 85 degrees - needs AC and quick.

The cuisine was fresh and hot. Overall it was excellent and Jillian was our server. She did an outstanding job taking care of our needs. The dessert, tiramisu was delicious. I recommend this establishment for casual dining.

The food was great. We had the ricotta bruschetta -delish although a bit heavy on the cheese. All three of us had pasta dishes and loved them all. As always, the food was great. But this is the second time I have been in a month or so and the place is so hot!!!  Neither time I was there was a hot day. Apparently there is no ac. Even the staff mentioned it and complained. Fans and open doors don’t cut it. I won’t go back again til they fix it.
The food was delicious!  The wine list offers great options .
Outstanding as always! Wonderful service and great food.
I try to eat at this restaurant every time I'm in Portland. Amazing food and atmosphere.

Robin had the chicken parmesan and I had the roasted duck. The meal was incredible but it didn't compare to the service. Suzanne took the entire experience from good to great. She alone was worth the trip.

Everything was great. Food was great, server did a great job. Overall loved dining here. Excellent food, service and ambiance. Ordered several different items. Especially loved the Hake special the night we dined.
The food was amazing, as always.   Our server, Gillian, actually remembered the the cocktail I has a couple of weeks ago!
Great night out! On a rainly night, comfort food is EVERYTHING.
The food was delicious. The atmosphere was festive. Our server, however, was not pleasant, borderline rude. I would certainly go back again and just hope we didn’t get the same server.

WE will Will be back. Shawn was AMAZING.
Food was on point.
Service was attentive and caring; food was delightful-I took the entree home because the salad was enough :)
The bruschetta was to die for!   Everything else was great, too.
Nice place to eat near the Merrell Auditorium. Pleasant staff, good food, although somewhat salty vegetables. Duck dish was superb. Asparagus very salty.
Established and quality food & service .. drinks well made, descent wine list .. doesn’t disappoint …

Always enjoy dining @ the Corner Room.  HOWEVER, to NO fault of the staff, etc. there was no air conditioning (which will be fixed).  The woman who 'greeted' us (not really) @ the door was far from welcoming.  Again, it was very HOT in the restaurant; but everyone else, especially our server, Jillian, was OUTSTANDING!!
Very hot in the restaurant! Noise level was very high. Other than that it was very good
Great food! The homemade focaccia bread was a great way to start! And many of their signature drinks are available non alcoholic which my pregnant wife really appreciated!

Staff shortage on a busy Friday night at 6:30 pm gave me a worse experience than I’ve had there in the past.   The food is excellent. Servers did their best. Kitchen staff helped them out.  The bartender is one of slowest I’ve ever seen in my life, she threw the timing off for everyone

Great Restaurant in Portland.
Staff, food and choice of drinks are continuously good.
Noise levels are a bit high.
Fifth time coming here and The Corner Room never fails! Everything was absolutely amazing from the staff working to the food.

Have been here a few times but have never got around to writing a review. The fact that I've been back on multiple occasions speaks for itself. The pasta is always very good. Service is prompt & prices are reasonable. It's worth checking out when in the Portland area.

I always I've the Corner Room, this trip no exception, despite a glitch or 2. Single diner this time, was seated at the kitchen bar. I was disappointed that at 6pm the duck special was already 86'ed. Then the server forgot to put in my app order, and I waited almost 45 mins after I ordered, at which point the entree came. The meal was great, I had the pork chop special, cooked perfectly, nice presentation, and the server made up for her mistake and comped my dessert.

Get the focaccia.

I always I've the Corner Room, this trip no exception, despite a glitch or 2. Single diner this time, was seated at the kitchen bar. I was disappointed that at 6pm the duck special was already 86'ed. Then the server forgot to put in my app order, and I waited almost 45 mins after I ordered, at which point the entree came. The meal was great, I had the pork chop special, cooked perfectly, nice presentation, and the server made up for her mistake and comped my dessert.

Get the focaccia.
Really solid Italian food. The bruschetta & arancini balls were standouts.
This was our 1st time at The Corner Room; great drinks, fantastic food, excellent food, fantastic energy! I can’t wait to return!

We made a last minute reservation for 8pm on a Wednesday night. Excellent food, good service, and overall great meal. 
The fettuccini bolognese came out piping hot and was very well prepared. The duck breast & confit duck leg special entrée was delicious. The sides with the duck entree were roasted carrots (very tender) and fava beans (not that special). Would have preferred a different starch instead of the beans (a full scoop of the sprinkling of squash risotto would have been nice, or some gnocchi, or potato, or root vegetable purée).
Very good experience until the table next to us was swiped clean with some spray detergent while we were still eating.....how about a little consideration would have been appreciated.
Great service and delicious dinner!  Well prepared and perfect all around
Amazing food, atmosphere and service!
It wowed me !! So delicious ! Can’t wait to go back again .
Got the chicken parmigiana and it was too thick of a chicken cutlet and flavor was lacking. My husband got the mushroom pasta dish which also lacked flavor.
we love this restaurant - we are from Connecticut and we come about twice a year to enjoy this amazing restaurant,

Great experience and great food. Our server was great.  Quick and concise and willing to provide suggestions. Great attention to detail. The hostess was a little grumpy but we did not have to interact for long so it did not bring down the experience much if at all.
The food was excellent, perhaps the best bolognese I’ve ever had. Our server was great!
Great place to dine before a show at the Merrill. Good food, great atmosphere and a friendly staff. We really enjoyed ourselves here.
We love this place. The food is the highlight. We'll seasoned and great flavors,  served hot. They seemed short-handed but service was still excellent.  The Bruschetta is a must have.
The menu is limited now.  The waitress made an error on order and one person in our party had to wait a long time for the correct meal.  The waitress was abrupt and curt.

Our servers attitude and direct rudeness was wild, it’s like we were bothering her by being there. I thought we were being punked, but now reading other reviews online that are exactly what we experienced last night it’s clear that this has been an issue for months and nothing has been done about it. How upsetting.
We had to get to a performance and our server was wonderful in making sure we were able to get served quickly but also to enjoy our meal.
Best meal I've had in a long time. Friendly staff, fun atmosphere.
Superb Italian food, fast service.  You won't be disappointed.
Great place to have an early dinner before a show at Merrill Auditorium.

We had a great dinner! The food was very good & big portions on the chicken parmigiana. I was just surprised that the penne pasta was not included in the price as it typically comes w a pasta & the waiter did not inform us nor did he see that on the menu, perhaps it was stated but I missed that, so that made it pricey in the end. The bruschetta appetizer was delicious!!  It really is a nice restaurant & I would go back!!

Our first time visit is definitely not going to be our last. Cozy place, good service by Shawn and delicious food. My steak was perfectly prepared , beef carpaccio very tasty, my husbands duck was outstanding. We will definitely be back to try other things. Desserts seemed appealing…😍
The food was delicious.  Noise level was fine but it wasn’t crowded.  Could be quite noisy if crowded.
Wonderful dinner at the Corner Room.   Food was delicious and had the best Cosmo I’ve ever had.  Will certainly be back again.
Best whipped ricotta bruschetta around! Overall awesome dinner—everything we ordered was great.

Fantastic restaurant with a lovely selection of food. Perfect for a Friday night with the girls. Our server was wonderful and recommended an amazing red wine. Portions are really sizeable - the bruschetta could feed a small family! Ingredients are really good quality. Nice lively atmosphere. It's a little smoky as the air filter is being replaced but this really is a great place for a relaxed meal - we had a 7pm booking and didn't feel rushed at all.

The Beef Carpaccio was amazing. Then short rib with risotto was bland. The crème brûlée was amazing as well. Tables were close together so it was noisy making hard to hear each other. Our waiter did a good job overall but I had to ask three times for salt and it took forever to come. I needed the salt since the short rib was so bland. I would be back but would stick with the pasta dishes as those have always been delicious.
Food, service, and wine selection was all excellent!

The menu had a good selection and everything was prepared well.   The short ribs were very good, did not like the fried squid as much as I had hoped.   Our group enjoyed the desserts as well, the tiramisu was decent, the torte was tasty and the cannoli was well made.

Truthfully I was very disappointed with my experience! I made a reservation with a specific notation on seating. The host said he had just”at the moment” saw my note and had no  tables available for my party of 3. I asked about a table of four that was completely vacant ! I was told it was reserved for a bigger party and my specific reservation request could not be met and either I take the booth available or there would be nothing for my party! Upon departing I noticed the table I specifically asked about was still empty after an hour and thirty minutes… if I had been sat there during that time frame i would have left a very large tip$$$, considering the business meeting that I was apart of was high ranking individual Let’s just say I will not be back!
Wonderful service with great food. Would highly recommend.
Food was unbelievable! Our waitress was knowledgeable, funny and made it even better!

Very noisy, with loud Rock music. Service was a little slow. I had Chicken Parm. the worst I have ever had. Thick piece of overdone chicken with some cheese on it and very thin sauce. Spaghetti had to be ordered separately ($9). Would not go back.
It was the best service! Food was amazing!

Excellent food, generous entree portions, attentive service, and an all-around lovely dining experience. My husband and I split the truffle mac and cheese as an appetizer, then he got a margarita pizza as an entree and I got the cioppino. It was all delicious and we’ll definitely be back!

It was our first time.  We had read the reviews and agree with the kudos, particularly for the braised short rib. I had the duck duo special which was also awesome.  Our server was attentive and upbeat and added to the enjoyment of the evening. I was disappointed by the after dinner drink selections, but otherwise love everything about CR.

Apps and drinks were amazing! I had the chicken Parm and it looked beautiful but it was very tough and hard to chew so a bit disappointing for the prices. The pasta and sauce were really good! I would definitely go back but either order something different!

Everything was wonderful! The staff was warm, welcoming, and accommodating. Our waitress, Meghan (sp?), was phenomenal. She matched the mood of our celebratory evening, and we all left in the best of spirits!!
Dinner was good. Garlic bread was not quite as good as I remembered. Our server was attentive but a little rough around the edges. Not super friendly, but that was just their personality.

I have never written a review before but felt compelled to do so because the short rib entree was unbelievable. When we go out for dinner I will usually order the short rib if it’s on the menu, so I think it’s fair to say that I can do a reliable comparison. The short rib was the best I’ve ever had. We had Verduras marinated beets with pistachio & white balsamic and the roast Italian olives with citrus as appetizers and they were out of this world. Make sure you ask for the bread. The service was fantastic. I’m looking forward to our next trip (146 miles away) so I can get the short ribs

Waited for our table and had a drink while waiting- bartender was phenomenal.

Seated and had a good waitress-food was spot on.

Definitely will go back!!

We like to sit in the front of the restaurant in the winter monthels so we don't feel the draft from the door opening.
They do a great job....

Hands down the best garlic bread ever.  Generous charcuterie board with some excellent choices included.  Everyone loved their entrees.  Excellent chocolate raspberry torte.  Great service.  Couldn’t give them five stars for atmosphere…got a little smoky (don’t think the vents over the stovetop were keeping up) and very hot, windows steaming up.  They had to open the door, and that helped.  Overall, a great place, and we will be back!
The food, atmosphere and customer service was very good. It was our first time and we will definitely be back. 👍👍
Always good! Best staff, great atmosphere. Soooo yummy!
The food was perfection. All three of us enjoyed our meals, as well as the appetizers and desserts!
Always delicious! Great Service! One of our favorite places to celebrate a special occasion.
We had a great dinner last night celebrating a birthday at The Corner Room. The food and service could not have been any better! We will definitely come back next time we're in Portland.

Corner Room is our go to place. Food is always excellent and the service is top notch. We have never been disappointed. My only complaint is that it is so popular , sometimes I can’t get a reservation.

La nourriture est excellente, dommage que le service ne soit pas à la hauteur. On nous a installés sur une table devant une porte ouverte avec un ventilateur quand il fait 2 degrés dehors ce n’est pas vraiment agréable. Notre serveuse peu avenante et nonchalante  devrais peut-être apprendre à sourire un peu ou changer de métier…
Si on ne voulais pas de nous comme clients on aurait préféré le savoir avant de s’asseoir.

Sadly, this place seems to be going downhill. Entrees took over an hour to arrive, were cold, and relatively bland. Of the two pasta dishes we ordered, one was over cooked (mushy) and the other was undercooked (crunchy and not al dente). Both were like warm. 
The service staff acted as if we were doing them a favor by being customers.  The atmosphere is beyond noisy, is smokey due to the open kitchen, and my jacket still smells from the ill-vented dining room.
Our first time here - we will definitely be back! Everything was delicious from the generous appetizer of bruschetta to our seafood meals and affogato dessert! Friendly staff!
Ok. a bit crowded
Dinner before a show. Delicious
It was unbearably warm.

The food and service was great, but it was so incredibly hot in the restaurant that it really put a tremendous damper on the entire experience. It was so hot that it made it difficult to eat and not feel sick. We had to step outside multiple times to get some air.

The food was terrific and my server was a gem.
She was very knowledgeable of the menu and helped me pick the daily specials which I thoroughly enjoyed, and made an excellent suggestion for a wine pairing.
Slightly too-big portions (which meant I had a great lunch the next day)
The host was a bit brusque which started the evening off on a bad note, and the restaurant is a bit noisy, but I was eating alone so probably more aware of noise than usual.
Overall quite nice. Would go back.
A favorite for Italian dining, but currently suffering from HVAC problems.....so hot !!!
Great food and very helpful Starr

Fantastic food and wonderful service!
For sure will be back!
Fabulous! Will definitely be back! Arancini were amazing, Bolognese sauce was perfect and the drinks were on fleek!

Good meal. Had a couple of appetizers and garlic bread (which was killer). Sister has the pizza special which she really liked. 
Wish the server didn't call us sweetie and dearie. We're not that old! Also they could really use better ventilation. I hate smelling like the kitchen when I leave. It's been that way forever so I'd say it's not going to change.

Walked in and greeted by a very nice employee. We were 30 minutes early and they were still able to accommodate us, which was great. Our server was super attentive and helpful. He let us know he does not typically work at that location, but you would have never known. Drinks and Food came out quick and we’re all great. We got the whipped ricotta bruschetta to start. Large portion for just two people but super tasty and would definitely recommend. My husband got the spaghetti and meatballs and I got the pappardelle and mushroom dish. Both chose the smaller portions and we were stuffed. 

The restaurant was extremely warm due to the open kitchen. They propped open the doors to help with the airflow which definitely helped, but I recommend not wearing a long sleeve shirt there. 

Definitely one of our overall go to spots in the city!
We had the best waitress ever!
The restaurant was wonderful! Great vibes but a little warm and stuffy at some points.
Great experience. Waitress was fantastic, we all enjoyed our meals, and even the 'small' portions were large. It was a little loud but to be expected for a 530pm reservation.

The food was delicious and the drinks were good. The reviews on the meal from all 5 of our party were great. Special highlights go out for the Chicken Parmigiana (best ever), the Truffle Mac & Cheese, and the Squid Ink pasta. Our waitress was fabulous and made some fabulous recommendations for our dining and drinks. I will definitely be visiting again when in Portland.

I picked the corner room for my friend bachelorette party in Portland after reading reviews on the Internet about the restaurant. Booking the reservation on OpenTable was super easy. When we entered the restaurant, we were greeted by a lovely host and we only had to wait like 10 minutes for our reservation. The place was super quaint and adorable with beautiful, ambience and decor not to mention the most beautiful fresh flowers I’ve ever seen in my whole life. Our waitress was amazing and very detailed and super bubbly and fun. We ordered espresso martinis, Caesar salad and for our entrées, I had the most amazing mac & cheese ever had in my whole life. My friend had the chicken Parmesan, which was equally incredible, and my other friend had a squid ink pasta dish. I tried every single item and the food was literally out of this world good. The last part was dessert and we got tiramisu, which was also equally incredible when it came time for the check, the waitress explained to us that they were comping our cocktails due to the wait for them being longer than they would’ve liked. We were having such a lovely time, We didn’t actually even notice the wait for the cocktails, but I told the waitress that I have never had that kind of service or incredibly kind gesture at a restaurant ever. I will most certainly be visiting Portland again we had such an amazing time. However, if you’re thinking about going to the corner room just do it you will not regret it. Thank you so much again, Grace Anderson from Massachusetts.
Best Italian food I’ve ever had. If you’re in Portland, don’t miss.

Megan C was our waitress and she took great care of us. The food was delicious - my husband had the eggplant parm and I had the squid ink cavatelli. Portions are large (even the “small” size). We had enough food for dinner the following night. It was crowded and loud, but still enjoyable.
Always a great meal at Corner Room.  Delicious food at great prices and wonderful service!
Meal portions very well sized out. Had the pumpkin dish, absolutely amazing not at all what you think. Service was impeccable and timely. Reserve well in advance has it’s a hot ticket location.
Our waitress was absolutely amazing! She made us feel like we where sitting a friends kitchen!

It has been 3 years since we've eaten at the Corner Room. Hubby and I would visit Portland occasionally and the Corner Room was almost always our restaurant of choice.  The food is perfect. Don't put off a visit to the Corner Room. You won't be disappointed.
We had a wonderful meal to celebrate our anniversary! Always a pleasure eating at the Corner Room. Food is fresh, colorful and so delicious.
If you have a craving for Italian you have to check out the The Corner Room. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The food is beyond delicious! My wife and I cannot wait to go back in October.
Love the pasta and the gluten free is the best I can get.

The CR over the years has been one of our favorites and Saturday night was no exception. The pasta dishes are second to none and we enjoy the option  to choose either a medium or large serving.  Great pasta, great bread, great service = pleasure!

The Corner Room has been affected by the same issues that literally every other business in the world has endured..Namely the lack of staff.

The food was plentiful and tasty. Our waitress was doing the best in a difficult situation where she was clearly overworked.

The real distraction was the ambient noise level. Since the restaurant is housed in a relatively narrow space but with very high ceilings to call the Corner Room loud was an understatement. You could not hear the other members of your party even though you were sitting in a booth together. 

And for some inexplicable reason pop music was being blasted at almost maximum volume. I requested that the music be lowered and it was. However it was turned back up to it's original volume about 5 minutes later.

I will not be dining there again.
Wonderful! The food was delicious and the staff was great. We will be back.

My favorite restaurant in Portland! The Corner Room is- in my opinion- the best of the rooms. The staff is so knowledgeable, the atmosphere is cozy, the food always fresh and tasty. Their charcuterie board is such a great value, I also love their mushroom and pappardelle dish as well as their aperol spritzes. Don’t miss happy hour here either- it’s the best in town!
Fantastic food!! Wonderful service!  Definitely a good place to dine!
Best Italian food I have had since I was last in Italy! Suzanne was an extraordinary guide through this delightful culinary experience.

We go here every year for our anniversary. They have delicious gluten free pasta, and the drinks are amazing!

The staff is friendly, going out of their way to accommodate dietary needs.

Will keep coming back!
The waitstaff at the Corner Room man our anniversary dinner the most enjoyable experience.
It’s was nice.

Seating is limited & close. Large windows give it a more open feel however. A definite Italian ambience! The food is definitely genuine! The pastas are fresh made in house as well as the Mozzarella & the ricotta cheese and were absolutely delicious! My wife and I ordered the Antipasti cheese & meat board for starters. It was so large that we had to share a main menu! The Focaccia bread was house made and delicious.
We were on vacation and ate there.  Food was excellent as was service.
One word fantastic !!!

Nice location, appealing space. Definitely overcrowded , tight seating and narrow pathways which is reflected by then noise level. Service from our service was pretty lousy, a bit of a wisecracker - sort of an East German approach to customer service., grumbly, cut us off when we asked questions, almost broke the wine glasses as she seemed to almost slam them on the table. We should have none that this would set the tone for the night. The food was overall disappointing. Mussels which we shared as an app were excellent so the meal felt promising but quickly went downhill from there. My chicken parm was oversized, and generally unremarkable. I kept thinking “is this better than something I might pick up pre made at Hannafords?” Probably not. It’s like they were trying compensate for it being mediocre by serving a double portion. My wife pizza was as she described it - basically inedible - chewy, and doughy and served almost like a salad with prosciutto and greens piled on so high you had to dig thorough it to cut it. Again it was like they were trying to hard to present something that looked appealing versus focusing on the food itself. Our third diner had a mushroom something or another. This was literally just a half bowl meal. There was zero depth to this, it was like being handed a bowl of porridge. I hadn’t been there for about 7 years so thought we’d give it a try again, I guess I had forgotten why we hadn’t been for so long. The only good news is that for three people, a shared app and a bottle of wine it was just over a hundred dollars. So for three in Portland it wasn’t expensive but then again we all thought the food was pretty basic so for basic food it was expensive I guess. Won’t be going back there.

We had a 630 reservation. Our app did not come until 730 where people beside us came in at 7 and had their meals and we were still waiting for our app. Waitress was very nice kept checking on our and then bought us each a drink as we were still waiting. The food was very good from the app to the meals. Not sure if kitchen problems or what. Overall it was good. She did try to make it right by giving us a free drink which we appreciated!

Outstanding food (the salmon was fantastic).  Wait staff was attentive,  knowledgeable and very friendly.  Although the restaurant was very busy, the noise level was  not overpowering.  Entrees were not inexpensive, but definitely worth the price.  Will definitely return.

Our waitperson was excellent: she had great knowledge of the menu, paced us well, answered all our questions.  Everything we ate was done very well: Nothing was overseasoned, overcooked, or loaded down with too much oil.  A great meal & evening!

We’ve been here before and it was awesome so we were let down by this visit. The waitress was rude and the cream based pasta had the consistency of milk. We sent it back and it was still soupy. Completely inedible. Calamari was small tiny rings that just tasted like fried batter and I added shrimp to the penne dish and they couldn’t have been bigger than a nickel. I expected better. The only good thing we had was the bruschetta.
The dinner was for my wives birthday.  And the dinner as we expect it to be.  Excellent.
Love the food

We had a bottle of Nebbiolo, the antipasti platter, and a Caesar salad.  Completely satisfying for a summer night!  The antipasti elements were very high quality and the portions generous for 2 people.  Very refreshing in the current restaurant pricing environment.
Noisy venue. Food came out at different times for people at the same table. Drinks were forgotten to be served. Sweet waitress. She was apologetic numerous times.
Our experience was excellent! We had a late dinner, and both the food and the service were A+. We cannot wait to return. A special thanks to Suzanne.
Amazing service and food. Great care to our personal experience

Truly the best Italian restaurant north of Boston. The staff is outstanding and always goes above and beyond to make my experience here the best it can be. Ariel at the bar is hands-down the best bartender in the old port. Also make sure to say hello to the fabulous Suzanne from Germany and chef Jason. they are  truly one of a kind! Tell them Chris sent you :)
The food and the service were great, but the room was very hot, which made things very uncomfortable.

I always enjoy going there, the cocktails are imaginative and delicious, the food is always great. I had pasta with mushroom truffle sauce and I ate every last bit. The pasta was silken, you could tell it was homemade. Our waitress was great, very personable and charming. I’m never disappointed when I go there.
Fantastic pasta, pizza, appetizers and ambience! The portions are very generous and the experience reminded us of great spots in Italy.

The cocktail I ordered lacked taste. The pizza we ordered did not have the correct toppings. Although the pizza was very good.  The caprese salad was very good. The server did credit the drink and toppings for the pizza which we appreciated.

Great table, great food.  Dinner out for 2.  We shared the squid to start, which was a large portion and delicious.  We split two entree's, which was the special and a pasta.  The special was outstanding - thanks Corner Room.
Our waitress was strapped, but she was still great. The food was delish, even though I would like the pasta dish w/ meat to be less greasy. We always love The Corner Room!
It’s the best place. We love everything about this quaint little place…

Totally enjoyed everything!  Prosciutto, salami, parmigiano board with strawberry confit was excellent.  Pastas were excellent as well.  Great wine!  Susanne our server for the evening was such a pleasure, and made our evening a very 
enjoyable  experience for our last night of our vacation in Portland.
Delightful. Will make this a regular visit on our trips to Maine.  Energy,  staff, and food were great.
Average food, service on the slow side.  Noise level is very loud.  It became so annoying by end of meal we could not wait to get out.
The food and espresso martinis were amazing. Our server, Doug, was wonderful and gave us great recommendations for the rest of the weekend.

The food is very good, the service is great, everyone is welcoming and friendly. But, the air conditioning doesn’t work very well - maybe due to the open kitchen. I will return when the weather is cooler for sure. It was so hot inside we had to take our dinner and finish it at home.

Originally, I had made a reservation for two weeks ago and the restaurant cancelled last minute, citing that open table had made a booking error. I decided to try again at my next availability. 
The bruschetta and mixed drinks were excellent. I highly recommend trying the lemon drop. Great service! Our server was very attentive and made fantastic wine recommendations. I was super disappointed to learn that steak wasn’t on the menu; even though I had scoped out the menu prior to making a reservation. The pork was mediocre at best. Zero ambience. Nobody wants to sit smack dab in the middle of a loud restaurant on their anniversary. Overall, this dining experience missed the mark.

Food and service were excellent as always. Unfortunately it seemed the air conditioning wasn’t working. It was 85 and humid outside and not far from that inside. Was hard to get comfortable with how warm it was. Won’t stop us from going back, but hope they are able to resolve the air conditioning situation.
Food was disappointing. We go here every year and each year it declines so we will go elsewhere when we are in Portland.
Everything we had was delicious and we will be going back again. Also the garlic bread is amazing!!
