Have been here many times in the past and this was disappointing.  Server was not welcoming at all and the entree's were bland.  Appetizers were great as were cocktails.
Went with friends, it’s always so good!
4 year anniversary
Was a tremendous place for a first date.

Food was good but you need to pay additional for a side of pasta with any entree.

Pasta should come with meal.

Loved the pace of the dinner, plenty of time for chatting between courses.  Food was outstanding.  Thank you for another delicious dinner!  We did not realize the chicken parm did not come with pasta, so it was a bit of a surprise to see a charge for it.  Very noisy to the point of not being able to hear others speak.  Maybe turning the music off would help so it would not compete with conversations.  Thank you!  Are the brunches returning?  My favorite in all the city!

I recently ate at the Corner Room during a trip to Portland. The bruschetta was amazing and the cheese pizza was decent, but we were very shocked and disappointed that when you order chicken parm you have to order a separate side of spaghetti to go with it - for $8! What? I live in Boston and even in the North End they would never serve you chicken parm without pasta. That was ridiculous! And it was only mediocre chicken parm. I would skip this place simply because of this pracitce.
Our service was very slow. When our food came out it was dry clearly from sitting under the warning lights too long.
One of the best resteraunts in Portland!  Food is excellent and the staff is friendly.  The tables are VERY close together, so if you are worried about social distancing then you might want to pass.
Delicious!! Large portions. Great service.
Most amazing gluten-free pasta I’ve ever eaten.
We went for a special occasion dinner. Our waitress gave fabulous recommendations, great portions for the price, good vibe and atmosphere.
Food was terrific. The server was helpful but slow because of understaffing.
Meal was delicious.  Our waiter, Doug, was vey friendly and attentive. Fresh pastas and salads were outstanding as was the tiramisu.
Excellent value….the food is amazing. Did not disappoint!

Food service was slow, but the server (who was delightful) told us upfront that they were short-staffed.  It was a good 40 minutes between apps and entrees.  The special fish was lovely, but the pasta was dry and tasteless. Very disappointing. The chicken was mediocre.  Drinks were generous but overpriced.  Overall, it was not worth it, and for an Italian restaurant to not have good pasta is the death knell for me.
Service was not the best. We felt very rushed and didn’t feel we could really relax and enjoy our time there.

The restaurant is very loud.  The food was great for half the group and fair for other half of the group. The bread base of the bruschetta did not need to be blackened.  The ravioli in the special did not need to be luke warm.  The pizza was excellent, my husband had something he described as a seafood stew which he liked. The waitress was anxious to take our order but did not deliver the food or check back in on the food to see if there were problems.
Too many tables and people for the restaurant size
Unfortunately the menu on Open Table was different than the menu at the restaurant. It was pretty disappointing. The food was ok. We used to go often, but likely will not return.
Very nice and large beet salad- small plate of Gemelli was tasty and a good amount-glass of Pinot Noir was ok.  A satisfying meal but rather simple and it cost nearly $50.
The food and service were good. The tables were a little scrunched together, which even if we weren’t in a pandemic would have made things uncomfortable.

Perfect in every way. Pastas are delicious and gluten free makes me feel special. The service was as good as it gets. 
The renovation gives the space a fresh new look. 
We had beef carpaccio that was perfect  and the pork chop was two meals
Friendly hostess and waiter, delicious beet and pistachio salad, delicate and flavorful swordfish entree.
One of our favorite places. Delicious food, lots of choices. Great service.
Awesome place. Our favorite
All the food was delicious. Mussels outstanding.  Our waiter, Doug, was a true professional.  Add in a martini, wine and dessert and you have one hell of a great evening 😎
The charcuteri was perfect, the pastas were delicious and the wine selection was fantastic!
Cozy space - great service and pizza was excellent!
The corner room never disappoints. Amazing food, appropriately priced, we have never had a bad experience here.
It is our favorite go-to place. Wait staff is marvelous, personable and human.

Our server- we felt like a bother. The bar was busy and they were short staffed, it took forever for our first cocktail and we never got our second. BUT we understand that and know that they were short staffed. Whenever our server came to the table, she just stared at us and looked annoyed. We are ok with slow service due to short staffing but not rude. Nice matters. Everything is ok and forgivable if you are nice.
Perfect meal bartender and atmosphere. Best in Portland
Great service, good cocktails and great service!
Consistent food at a reasonable price.
Good food & drinks!
I recommend this place for anyone looking for upper scale dining but still getting large portion sizes, good tasting food, and for a reasonable price
Everything from appetizers to dessert was absolutely delicious.
Awesome food. The bartender is outstanding. The hostess was fabulous.

The food and service was very good.  Our server, Doud, was helpful picking out wine and learning about the entrées.   Unfortunately we were the first table near the door and it was a bit chilly each time a patron walked in or out of the restaurant... to the point where one of our party had to, put her coat on while we ate.
Everything was great except the wine list by the bottle and the glass is just so so.

Corner Room has always been excellent with a great selection of different foods: Italian, fish, meat, appetizers. Staff are wonderful to work with. One of the many wonderful things about Portland is that there are so many food establishments that I could give the same praise to
We all enjoyed our dinners!  My husband and i got chicken parm and short rib dinners!  They were amazing!  Service was very good!  Wonderful atmosphere!
Our absolute favorite spot for excellent Italian food and lovely wine and beer options. Big windows make people watching an extra treat
My new favorite restaurant! Excellent service and food.
Our server Suzanne was very enjoyable to chat with and gave us good recommendations on wine and food choices. We had a great dinner experience there and will return

The food and service is excellent. It is a noisy and busy restaurant but service is very good. Tables are still close together as in pre pandemic. 
I was disappointed that the Gemelli meal had changed to a
Tomato based pesto because I have loved the previous basil based pesto. The bolognese was excellent.
This is my favorite spot in Portland! Never disappoints
As always, dinner was amazing!  One of  my favorite spots in Portland to dine.
The risotto that accompanied the duck was a little too salty for my taste, but overall, it was good. Also, it was pretty cramped in there.
Our table was right in the middle way too close to other tables… felt like a spot a table shouldn’t be in. Other than that food and service was great. They always have the best pasta… cooked perfect.
Amazing food, but the room seemed smokey and did not like the burnt smell!
Valentine’s
No issue with the food and the ambience. Even the host is nice and accommodating. Now the server that we have is just blah and kinda just there

Our Valentine’s Day celebration. Loved watching the pasta being made.  Waitress was very personable and spoke German to us as we are trying to learn it. Food was excellent. Relaxing to be there. Definitely on our return list.

We had a wonderful Valentine's Day special dinner here last night.  The selections on the menu for the night were perfect.  Our server was great and helped with recommendations.  We had a great time and plan to return next month for the anniversary of our first date 12 years ago at the same table.

Had to wait for our table even though we had a reservation. Didn’t get my glass of wine until after my food arrived and when ordering wasn’t asked what size dish I wanted to didn’t receive the one I was hoping for. Also ended up paying for bread unknowingly as we were hoping for just bread and oil but got garlic bread instead. They were busy so understandable but weren’t composed or thorough.
The hostess stole the show. She was friendly, polite and genuine. The food was OUTSTANDING. Our waiter was ok.
Absolutely delicious meals for me and my husband!

Amazing food & service with the atmospheres being cozy.
Our waitress Gillian was the absolute best.
Good waitress.. food & drinks excellent

Our waitress Suzanne was awful. Thankful for the sweet hostess who got us our bill. Was planning on having dinner but it took 45 minutes just to get our drinks. Our waitress came to take our drink & appetizer order, and then said we needed to order our meals at that time too. We politely declined and she rolled her eyes. Never came back to our table. We will not be going back.
The waitstaff were courteous, greeted us on time and were extremely conscientious. Our food was excellent as well as suggestions from the waitstaff. We look forward to returning

Having dined there many times I was thrilled to see they finally reopened.  I came expecting the same amazing meals I have had so many times but instead was served food I considered very disappointing.  The apps were edible but not great and we had the squid, garlic bread, appetizer board. We had two orders of the short rib with both being overcooked and an average margarita pizza. The host and the waitress were great the problem really is coming from the kitchen and I hope they can turn it around
Love this place. Love the staff. Love the food.

A team that was small but mighty.  The hostess let us know the very small staff that was working upon our check-in for our reservation.  The team worked amazingly together.  The food was fantastic.  Atmosphere cozy. Well done 👏✔👍

Despite been very understaffed . We were looked after fabulously .
All the team here worked together to get the orders out , with  a can do attitude and a smile for each customer. 
Food was delicious .

The food is incredibly! The arancini is so tasty. The pasta is so fresh. The hanger steak was cooked precisely as ordered. We have only rave reviews for the quality and flavor of the food! Most of the staff was wonderful and genuinely seemed like they want to be there (shout out to Bridgett and Jeff). Unfortunately our server took away from our experience by being incredibly rude,condescending and deliberately obtuse. Maybe she was just having an off night. 
It was the first time several members of our party had been there and they all agreed they would return.
Night out. Great place.
The food here is excellent! The portions are large, so come hungry or be prepared to bring some home - we had a great meal.

We are early eaters so if you’re looking for a low key ambience arrive early. It tends to get noisier as the night gets busier. Great service and food!! If you get there early enough have a drink at the bar and enjoy the happy hour specials.  We always get the Arancini appetizer and the garlic bread was a great addition to our pasta dishes. We love it here!
A reliable choice for good food and friendly service. Only problem is the noise level is a bit much.
Great atmosphere.  Friendly efficient staff.  Excellent food, wine and cocktails.

It took over 30 minutes to have waitstaff address our table after we were sat. Meals came out separately for diners, specials weren’t available. At one point the restaurant smelled strongly of burning plastic and was so smoky  that our eyes and throats were irritated.
Excellent food and good service. A bit loud, and we were chased out a bit earlier than planned due to a smoky fire from the kitchen that permeated the dining room.
Food was excellent, server was a bit and we felt rushed through our meal at bit.  The main meal followed the appetizers a bit too quickly.
The food and service were great, but it was very bright inside the restaurant. Dimming the lights would have improved the ambiance, other than that we would eat there again.
Birthday dinner
Server was great , food was great too. We sat near the window and even with the curtain it was very cold   Need to have maybe more insulated curtain  Very happy to see restaurant open again!
Love this place. Some servers are not so friendly. Ours were amazing. Samantha and our hostess whose name I didn’t get. Food always incredible. As are drinks. Thank you Harding!!
Birthday Dinner
Wonderful meal at Corner Table.  Service was friendly, warm and relaxed - despite a very busy night.  Can't wait to return - highly recommend!
Delicious food, great service!

The waiter was wonderful! Great suggestions and great personality! He made our evening!   Food was good.  The room was loud not due to customers but two tvs on.  But we had a real wonderful experience

We've been eating here for about six years and unfortunately the quality of the service (and sometimes the food) keeps decreasing. We showed up at 7pm on a Thursday night expecting live music, but no band showed up. Okay, no problem - bands cancel - and the restaurant was basically empty (maybe two tables plus a handful of people at the bar) so we knew we wouldn't wait too long for our food, which has been an issue in the past. 

Our charcuterie plate appetizer was fine (great pickled veggies) but the brie was clearly old (visibly dried out except in the very middle). For my entree, I specifically asked our server if the seafood chowder had pork in it and she said yes, it normally does, but they could make it without pork as they cook everything to order. Great! I ordered a bowl of seafood chowder specifically with NO PORK. Unfortunately, it arrived *absolutely loaded* with pork. At this point we did not want to wait for another bowl to be made from scratch, as my husband's pizza was already on the table, and the pork thing is not an allergy just a dietary preference - so I picked out all the pork and piled it on a plate next to the bowl. Server didn't notice (even when she cleared the table) and we didn't call attention to it, because by then we were more than ready to say goodbye. I haven't given up on this place but wow, what a difference six years can make, based on the last few times we've eaten there.
I had the most delicious pork tacos, my Buffalo-born husband gave the wings his approval, and his burger was excellent. Our waiter, Logan, was very attentive and friendly! We will be back!

We were acknowledged and seated immediately. We started with wine and ordered the wonderful F&T burger with a salad and fish and chips with coleslaw. The food is wonderfully prepared and wonderfully fresh. We dined early, so pretty quiet, but getting busy when we left. Great place, great staff, great food.
Definitely a great place to have a wonderful meal.  Atmosphere, ambience and friendliness of the staff started off our evening. Meal was served at great pace and food was great.  Highly recommend
Phenomenal service, incredibly well-made drinks, and the food was outstanding.  This place is consistently awesome and is one of my favorites.  Can’t wait to return
Nice brunch spot. Good mimosas but a bit of a limited menu.
Always a favorite spot in Westbrook. Everything was delicious and prepared very well
Everything was good but the kitchen was way too slow and it was too loud for our taste

menu is creative and inventive always

food is delicious consistently 

service is friendly and fun

live music is awesome 

highly recommend

We go The Frog and Turtle all of the time and have really enjoyed all of it. Took my 83yo mom on Mother’s Day and it was awful.  We had to wait over 2 hours for our meal which was not at all what we expected. It was like they just threw the scraps on our dish and it was overcooked. Will not be going back for awhile. Bad experience for sure on Mother’s Day. Really? Oh and by the way… it was only 12:30 and they ran out of Donut’s which our main reason for going.☹️
We waited 2 hours for our food.  The food was good but that was way too long to wait

Very disappointing.  Terrible service , we had to get up to get pepper after waiting 15 minutes, food was slapped together and omlettes were horrible, mimosa's served in juice glasses, we reserved a booth but hostess said they couldn't do it and that they had 250 customers coming in, which was rude.We go all the time but will question going now.   This all happened at 10:30.

The worst experience I’ve ever had at a restaurant.  It was not busy but we waiting over 30 min to order and waited over 2 hours for food that never came and had to leave.  A dump.  Cross this off your list.

I love the music at this place!!!! I love the committment to live music and musicians. The food is good. The drinks are good. The service is often lousy. I keep going back because musicians I know and like play there. And often friends decide to go. But the service is slow and staff is rude. I'll have one or two ok nights ( the food comes in less than an hour, staff isn't rude when you ask about the long wait for drinks, the kitchen isn't out of many menu items and the sound isn't up too high) and then a terrible one (all of the above at the same time and I forgot ear plugs.) If you can find the band playing someplace else, go there instead.

My wife and I each had the haddock dinner. The portion size was perfect for us, the haddock was nice and light and flaky. Server was attentive. I had a martini which was very good. For dessert we shared a cheesecake and each had an espresso martini, both were great. 

Very nice evening. Will definitely return.

I have never ever been disappointed at the Frog & Turtle. I love the atmosphere and the vibe, the waitstaff is always friendly and highly efficient and the menu offers something for everyone. The bar serves a mighty fine extra dirty martini, extra high marks for that. And Chef James is the best, amazing chef and all around good guy! It has been a favorite place to dine and enjoy a fun evening with friends since my first visit very many years ago and it will always remain a favorite. One of the very best restaurants around, highly recommend 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

Great place with excellent food! I used to live in Westbrook and was visiting for a weekend trip and it’s memorable enough to stop back by! The made to order donuts are delicious and food never disappoints. Our server was very attentive and pleasant!
We come to this restaurant about every other month.  Always great!
The acoustics were terrible.  It was hard to hear what the person across from me was saying.

Last night was not our first time but might very well be our last.  For starters the service was pushy and made us fell rushed even though we made a reservation. The food was very middle of the road the only thing we enjoyed was the crust of the pizza and the dessert.

We sat down at 5:40 and ordered our entire meal immediately which I then had to ask them to just box it to go because two hours later at 7:40 we were still sitting at the table and not a single dish had come out.

We dined early, a couple of drinks and pub fare. 
It was pretty cold inside and staff was a little loud getting prepped for a busy evening. 
We had calamari app which was good
Hot fried chicken sandwich was was excellent
And the FnT house burger was delivered with a spartan amt of shredded cheese and nothing else on it. 
According to the menu it came w LTO, but mine came "naked" and was dry. 
I spoke with the waiter and he seemed confused when I asked for the LTO. 
It was an odd situation.
My absolute favorite restaurant in Maine. The food, the music and the service is always amazing. Makes my time out always feel special.

We have heard great things about this restaurant for years.  We were really disappointed.  There was mediocre live music that was so loud we had to shout to hear each other.  The menu was fairly limited and value for the price was not good.  My son ordered haddock that was so salty he couldn’t eat it.  We will not be returning.  The worst is that it was my daughter’s 18th birthday and I feel like it was ruined by our experience.
Fabulous food, warm cozy atmosphere with first rate live music........a perfect gourmet pub. Don't tell anyone about it!
Dinner was delicious, and the waitstaff was super friendly.
Beware of live music Fridays. Maybe pick a different day to eat here.
I live in Westbrook and really like The Frog and Turtle. I don’t like the noise, but I don’t think you can do anything about that
The food was delicious and the service was excellent. It took a while to get our food but it was absolutely worth the wait.
Was a very enjoyable dining experience. Food and atmosphere was  wonderful.  Wait staff was extremely nice and friendly.

Attentive, courteous waitstaff. Generous, tasty portions. The GIP Benedict was fantastic. Another guest had a scramble and thoroughly enjoyed it. Donut holes were a yummy start for sharing.
The facility is very loud. If you’re a small group of 4 or fewer, be sure to ask for a table far from the main area.
This was our first time. Will definitely be back to try the dinner menu and add to our brunch rotation.
It was a busy night but service was slow. The seafood chowder was delicious.

Delicious food and excellent service! Highly recommend the shepherds pie crepes and chocolate mousse dessert. Lots of other things on the menu that we’d like to try.  Would also like to check out the upstairs and the deck when the weather is nice. It’s been many years since we’ve been here but it won’t be too long before we go back.

Totally empressed with the way the restaurant was decorated, especially the upstairs. Very warm and inviting ambiance. Our waitress, Abbey was extremely professional and very pleasant. The food was great with the exception of the coleslaw. All in all, great experience and will definitely will return.
As usual the food was outstanding. Our waitress was the best!!  Great personality and was very attentive.
Great service.  Good food . Great ambiance . Live music

Wonderful brunch! The food is fabulous (gotta try those donuts!).  Service was wonderful as usual and just an overall pleasant experience. Just remember that it is an energetic place - nice vibe but your party is not always able to hear each other during a conversation lol. Highly recommend!
The table was in a great location to hear the band and talk with friends. Food was great and the service was done with smiles. I will be going back again!
Nice atmosphere and delicious food. Service was excellent!

Our server was amazing!!  Fun, friendly, and very efficient!!!  The food was absolutely fabulous!!!!  Only complaint is the noise level - we did ask to be moved in the back where the tables are because it was just so loud in there we could not hear each other speak!

Setting was nice, we sat upstairs near the fireplace, very peaceful. Service by waitstaff was mediocre. Only two people sitting at the bar yet took forever to get drinks made and served at our table as we observed bartender folding silverware into napkins. charcuterie boards were good. Both the dessert and cheese platter. Rest of the food was just OK. Heard they had a great brunch. Maybe we’ll try that.

The Frog and Turtle is always my go to for amazing food in the Greater Portland area. The fish and chips is the absolute best! You get 2 gigantic pieces of fresh haddock with homemade chips and coleslaw, the homemade tartar sauce is also delicious. My mouth is watering just thinking about the delicious meal I ate last night. If you haven’t tried the Frog please visit for an amazing foodie experience. They are also a great place for free live music.

Um, I respect menu says expect 30 mins for food.  Fine.  By 15 mins for coffee? 47 minutes for donut holes??  One HOUR and TWENTY minutes for food?? Nope.  Nope.  Nope.  That is two hours of my life I won't get back. And could we get coffee refills? Not without pulling teeth. My time is just too valuable. Food was great. Service and amount of time, not so much.

Frog and Tittle have the best brunch going. The Benedict’s are awesome. The poached eggs always cooked just right with their in house sauces. The best breakfast potatoes in the state. Their in house Bloody Mary mix is tops! Can’t wait for our next brunch!
Eggs undercooked. Not waitress fault. Sent back one poached egg still uncooked. Yuck on runny eggs for me.
Great food, great music and amazing staff! Thanks Chef!!

Usually love this place, but not a great evening. After telling the hostess that it was a reservation for my elderly mother’s birthday, she initially sat us near the door and immediately adjacent to the bar. Very cold and noisy. She agreed to move ys one table over. Our server was distracted by the musical act and we has to seek his attention repeatedly or ask another server for additional drinks, service etc. Worst experience we had there. Food and drinks were great per usual.

We had a 6:45 reservation on Friday 12/29/2023.  We used to go frequently over the last 7-8 years but had a bad experience in early 2022 for my wife’s birthday, and haven’t been back until last night hoping things had improved.  Last night we ordered drinks and then an appetizer, Brussel sprouts, and then our server asked if we wanted to put our entrees in.  We said no not yet and his response was “well if I don’t put it in now, it will be a while but up to you”.  So I ordered the beef Wellington and my wife ordered salmon.  As the server walked away, I asked if I could choose how the steak was cooked and was told “it’s all medium”.  The appetizer was good but my wife had to flag down our server after a bit for another glass of wine. Our food came out and my wife immediately noticed the salmon was under cooked but said she’d just work around it.  My first couple bites of the Wellington were good, but then I cut a piece off for my wife and notice it was pretty rare.  When I looked at my piece, it was raw.  I would prefer to order steak rare and even this was well
Below that.  It again took a bit to get our servers attention and when I pointed I out the raw steak, he kind of stood and just stared waiting for us to say what we would like.  I asked if they could throw it back on for a few minutes and that I didn’t even want a new one.  He came back after a minute and put the same steak back in front of me and said “so he won’t do it” referring to the chef.  I promptly replied “then I am not paying for that.”  He nodded and said “I’ll see what I can do” and left us for another several minutes.  Another man appeared and started clearing our plates  My wife told him to leave it, as we were waiting for a manager.  He introduced himself as a manager, but did not say his name.  He removed our food and nervously apologized and were not 100% sure he was a manage, as our server looked more professional than he did.  The steak was removed and safe to say we will never be back.

What a beautiful restaurant. We sat upstairs where the fireplace was going. Had a view of the city Christmas lights. The burgers were on special during their happy hour and they were delicious!  Can’t wait to return to try the other foods.
The beef Wellington was good.But tasted better the next day.the meat did not have alot of flavor
The food was great. My only issue was half way through our meal the band started to play and it was very loud. It was very hard to carry on a conversation.

Another fun evening at the Frog & Turtle.  Fish and chips are still the best around and the chowder is overflowing with great seafood.  Had the pappardelle pasta for the first time and it too is now a favorite.

The ambiance at The Frog & Turtle is warm, cozy and especially festive during the Christmas season.
Our server was amazing, attentive, knowledgeable, and personable!
The food was fresh and delicious!
The Jimmy Macisso Trio was talented and energetic!
Great location for dinner out with friends, food and drinks were delicious and staff was great.
Food was dry and bland. Found a hair in the fries. Service was terrible.  Our server wouldn't even pay attention to us.
Love this place. Food is fantastic. I had the Tourtiere pie which is a holiday special. Yum!

This was my first visit to the Frig and Turtle. I was really interested in having dinner somewhere that I could also listen to a band, and The Frog and Turtle did not disappoint. The food was fabulous 👌

Waited over an hour for food which was good. Excellent chowder. Drinks not so great. Ordered chistmas martinis which should have tasted like a cosmo but way too much lemon. The server was doing his best and he did a great job. But come on.. hire more staff. Hike up your wages. Whatever you need to do to cut down the long waits which I hear is pretty common. No one is in a hurry to come back despite the good food. Prices were reasonable and in line with other restaurants. I will come again but hoping service improves.
First time and will definitely go back. Our meals were excellent, staff very accommodating and friendly. Unfortunately it got louder as tables filled up. Didn’t stay for music maybe next time.

The food and service overall were excellent.  There was a live band that started about midway through our dinner which initially we were excited about, however, the volume was way too loud to be enjoyable for a dinner.  It unfortunately ruined the end of our dining experience and forced us to leave early.
Food was excellent as usual, but the service was on the slow side unfortunately.

We recently went to Frog and Turtle on a Saturday night to dine.  The only disappointment was there were no chef specials that evening.  The waiter told us there was a party of over 100 people that afternoon!  We totally understood due to those circumstances.  We loved our  appetizer of muscles and we both ordered steak from the menu.  We also had our standby cocktails of Captain & Coke and Margaritas with salt on the rim.  Our waiter was Ned and he was awesome!  We are never disappointed at Frog and Turtle!
Service was slow though it wasn’t a busy night (empty tables during our whole meal). Slow getting drinks from the bar to our table. Food was good, as usual.
The food and service were excellent as was the old fashioned cocktail.   A very enjoyable evening visiting with friends and listening to good music.    A return visit will happen.
The food and service were amazing. The live music was great as well!
The food was good but it took about an hour or more to get our food!

Frog and Turtle is one of my go to restaurants for Sunday Brunch . The food  is by far outstanding, however our server was a disappointment. After we received our food, we never saw him again to ask if we needed anything or how the food was. Never have I ever experienced that. I get that it is hard to find help but really. The hostess was very accommodating also so thank you for her kindness. We will continue to frequent as I love the food and the establishment.
Food is always delicious at Frog &  Turtle, as well as the music.

We love Frog and Turtle! We stopped in this past Sunday for brunch with our friends, including a couple who’d gotten married nearby the day before.

The food is delicious (try the Horseradish sauce instead of Hollandaise)! With 20+ ingredients, their Bloody Mary is a must try. The restaurant is bright and pleasant. Not too noisy.

Our server was absolutely wonderful, but we think she may have been alone. We didn’t see any others, and it took an hour and a half for us to get our food.

They were also kind enough to cover the cost of the bride and groom’s meals. Huge thanks for that!!!

Hopefully they’ll have more staff soon. Until then, I recommend stopping in when you have time for a leisurely meal.

Server was friendly and prompt taking orders.  The Flatbreads we ordered were served piping hot and tasty.  Only complaint was the table of six adjacent to us were so loud that we had trouble carrying on a conversation at our booth.

Very disappointing experience, we had reservations and were seated promptly. We were given a nice large glass bottle with ice cold water and NO glasses, we finally got up and found a couple. Once server took our drink order, it was 30 minutes before we saw her again with our drinks. We ordered our dinner and received a plate with 2 small pieces of bread and butter. As I took my second bite of bread I found myself chewing on a 1 1/2 inch piece of plastic. I notified our server and told her to make sure the manager knew about this. (No one ever came to apologize or talk to us about it) Our dinners arrived, the Haddock was laid upon a bed of raw onions....... never heard of this, nor was it disclosed on menu, ruined the sandwich. Our other order was "The Westbrook" burger, advertised with caramelized onions, nope....... they were raw onions. By the time our meal arrived we had been sitting at the table for an hour and a half. I noticed other diners that were seated after us, were eating before us. The server was friendly and working hard but was overwhelmed with all the tables she had, Our experience left us with a feeling of never wanting to go back unfortunately. There drink and food prices have also risen to a point way to high for a "pub". Think twice before choosing this place for an enjoyable meal.

This was a Google search top 10 restaurant for the Portland area for American food, open late and taking Sat night reservations on a Sat afternoon. It was a quick drive and easy to find. We ate in the upstairs dinning area. It had an outdoor balcony with a view of the river and bridge. We ate indoors. We tried a few drinks off the specialties menu, the Andy’s Manhattan was delicious. Our waitress was young, friendly and very accommodating. Warm bread and butter were provided. The appetizers were delicious we especially enjoyed the Roasted Beet Neapolitan. For dinner I had the Fried Haddock with chips. It was one of the best fried fish I’ve had in a very long time. Light and crisp but not lacking in flavor. The chips were paper thin and cooked perfectly. To be honest, I did not like the coleslaw. We also had the Shepards Pie Crêpes which were flavorfully delicious and very filling. Passed on deserts I would highly recommend this restaurant.

This is one of our " go to" places.  Fresh, locally sourced food (whenever possible) that is made to order.  We dined upstairs and had a fabulous waitress, I do not recall her name, but she certainly added to our positive experience.  Our out of town guest had a great time.  We'll be back!

The waitress was pleasant but slow, sat for 10 mins before anyone came over. Food was good but not worth the cost, for $32.00 in got 1 tiny piece of chicken and a Hugh boat of potatoes.  I didn’t order potatoes , I ordered chicken. Very disappointed. The apps were very good I will say. If I return it will be for apps or maybe a burger they looked good

The service is sub-par. The food is good if you ever get it. We had a 7:00 reservation and at 9:00 we hadn't gotten our food yet. We had to flag down the server for bread which arrived without butter while other tables did have bread and butter. Good service may overcome bad food but bad service will ruin your experience.

had reservations but could not get seated.  finally got seated. waited too long for server. ordered drink and never came. finally came and wine was not cold had been sitting..  Ordered a salad with salmon and got the wrong salad. could not get the server's attention. he kept going by but would not look at us. So I ate it .Asked for bread 4 times and never got it until meal came.
Meal was finished and no server in sight. finally had to holler across the room for his attention.  Gave him our complaints and he said he would buy us a round of drinks next time we came him.  Ha like that;s going to happen?  When we come back next month I am sure he will remember us.    I love the frog and turtle for the music experience they provide and the food is good. But the service is slow and usually terrible.  Not the first time... Hope you find a way to improve. I know you are busy and short staffed but this was a case of a waiter not paying us any attention at all and walking by us.   Poor training maybe??

We waited for two hours for our meal. Couldn’t converse with our visiting out of state friends because of the noise level. We asked our make server repeatedly for cold water and ice. Had to wait for our bill as well and then for change. We’ve been enjoying the F&T for years but this experience was a major embarrassment to us.

This was recommended by a neighbor for its good food. Actually receiving food, even some bread and butter, or a soda refill took at least 20 minutes and multiple reminders to waitstaff. Flatbread over baked and pork cutlet not properly prepared. Other dishes were good. Would give it another try but have to say a bit disappointed.
Brunch at the frog and turtle is always fabulous. Fantastic food and wonderful service.

It was fairly loud downstairs but we ended up eating upstairs which was completely lovely and we wanted to talk (vs sometimes we would want the louder music) so that was no issue. My only area to improve on an otherwise excellent meal and experience was that I ordered my salmon well done and I don't think it was cooked as well as I had hoped/ expected. I ate the edges and more cooked areas and took it home and heater it long and ate it happily - just would have liked it to be cooked a little longer at the restaurant. Waitress was extroverted and checked in plenty. Food came in good speed. Loved the charcuterie board as usual and the autumn- flavors in my salad and salmon were tasty, particularly the pumpkin in the salad it was delightful and soft.  And I had a pineapple NA spritzer that was delicious and refreshing and almost made me feel like I was actually drinking alcohol which is a positive. Thank you for a great experience as always we love this place! ~Emily
bad overall experience. music was entirely too loud and food was terrible.

Our server was great! Engaging & attentive.
My meal -the shredded pork hash Bennie was pretty much inedible; so glommy with cheese (that was not indicated in the menu description) that I  left a pile of uneaten food, soggy English muffin, globs of cheese &lots of shredded pork on my bread plate (& I mean a big pile of uneaten food) which was obvious.
The person that cleared the table made  no acknowledgment that I’d left a pound of food piled up. (our actual  server was stretched thin with lots of other tables; I believe that he would have noticed and asked if there was a problem)
Won’t be back for a while.

Unfortunately, after waiting for nearly 2 hours after ordering we decided to leave after being there for a total of three hours. I ordered a drink at the time of ordering our meals and was never given a drink during that 2 hour wait. Additionally, we didn’t see our waitstaff during that entire time. When we asked for an update they said the food was being plated however we waited an additional 20 minutes and still no food. The consensus of our group was that this was overall the worst dining experience of our lives. Poor service, completely ignored by the staff, zero ownership taken by frog and turtle. Luckily we were able to get out of there without being charged for the food we never received but we were charged for a drink that was never delivered. 

It’s unfortunate that I feel compelled to write a review because I’ve been visiting the F&T for over 10 years. Sadly, I’ll never again return.
Great service, and the food was very good. Would recommend.
Awesome venue for live music, great food, and cocktails! Super friendly, staff, and owner on site! It is a regular go to spot for us!

We were greeted and seated immediately. We made an early reservation, so the restaurant was quiet. Ordered the great burger with a salad and a cod and shrimp dish with whipped potatoes and sautéed spinach. The food is wonderful, the service is wonderful and we love dining there. A good go to place with great food.

Music WAY TOO LOUD & selections are for staff not customers.
I want a nice dining experience, not a headache

We used to go to F&T quite regularly, but haven’t been as frequently since the pandemic. I’m so glad we went last night. My partner and I both went with the seafood stew on special and it was delicious! Coupled with the spicy muscles as an appetizer and delicious bread (we ate too much bread, but the sauces demanded it!), we left quite content. The hostess and server were so pleasant that my partner thought I knew them previously. Great experience. Oh, and love the blues music (it was prior to the live music started). A+

Not only was the entire meal, (salad greens, salmon and tear drop dessert)  outstanding the service was top notch! We had such a fun time, we didn't want to leave. Try the dry rub chicken wings - fabulous!
Great food and our server, Logan was amazing, thanks for a very enjoyable evening.
Good meal and attentive service plus a bonus in a music event just outside the restaurant.  Have always enjoyed this restaurant but sometimes the music is too loud in the restaurant.

Our comment regarding noise level was because we were on the deck enjoying the Beatles cover band. We expected it to be louder than usual.
It was a perfect evening. ❤️

We requested outside seating and we’re seated inside without notification. Very disappointing! We’ve been before and service and food was much better. Busy night / we understand . At the end of our night, we met James and enjoyed talking with him and we’ll be back!

Excellent service.  Sat us right on the patio so we could see and hear the band.  It was super busy so food took awhile but server made sure to check on us and bring us drinks regularly.  Burnt ends app was ok, needed a little something, since it was a rub.  Burgers and pizza were excellent.

For years I'd been hearing how great this place is, and finally tried it for brunch. It got a lot right, but but not enough, and the portions are just annoyingly large. 
First the good: The doughnuts. The simpler, the better and they are outstanding. Don't fancy it up with the Boston Cream Pie, or chocolate sauce.
The creton, on our sandwich was excellent. But the sandwich--really every dish in the place, was too big. And brunch isn't really a dish that you can take home if you can't eat it all. Eggs don't travel or hold well. Delicious food, but too much of it. It's wasteful, or it's a contributor to America's obesity problem.
We asked for bacon "really, really, crisp." We made a point of this. The bacon arrived translucent.  When we made the reservation, we requested a table on the roof deck. We couldn't sit there because a wedding the night before didn't clear out until 2am, and they didn't have the staff to clean it up for brunch service.  Sitting inside is not for hard of hearing. Or even the okay of hearing. It was sooooo loud. We were a table of four, and only those sitting next to each other could hear the conversation. Over all, the food was good, but not good enough to go back. (Maybe I would do some doughnuts to go.)

Excellent food
Excellent waiter
Very slow service
Very loud

Nice place with good service but… the potato’s were not quite cooked. The Statler Chicken was small. While the fish chowder was delicious, it was not practical to have mussels (you have to dig your hands in the chowder to get them!), also, the shrimp need to have tails removed for the same reason.
Fantastic food, music, and service despite the fact that there was a wedding reception upstairs!

We had never been here before and had dinner on a night we knew there would be a band playing outside the restaurant, so we expected louder than usual ambiance. However, there were 4 empty tables for 2 people in the main room/bar (the nicer part) but we were seated in a small side room with 2 large tables full of talkative adults having a great time all together. The sound from the band and the other diners  swirled around this small room making hearing my husband and the waiter impossible. It was actually quieter in the nice main room even tho it was closer to the band. The small side room was so poorly lit, we had to use cellphone flash lights to read the menu. (Cleaning the dead bugs out of the light fixtures and upping the bulb wattage would help a little). We looked at the menu online before arriving and were looking forward to their steak and seafood entrees. We discovered upon arrival they pared down the menu to just soup, salad, sandwiches and flatbreads—not what we had hoped for. The menu was pared down to make it easier to get food out to customers on such a busy night. I appreciate that but wish I knew that in advance to avoid disappointment or to chose to dine here a different night. The food and service were excellent. But if it’s your first time here, be aware of the differences between rooms downstairs and ask if the full menu will be available on your night.
Do not order the nachos.  hardly any cheese and no salsa.  Worst nachos I had.

Chef James is the type of business owner that truly puts his heart into his business and his craft. This restaurant is a true joy because you don't just go there for dinner...you go there to dine. The food is fantastic to be sure but the experience and how you are treated adds so much more. The wait staff is personable (thank you Krista, Goddess of the rain), they are professional, there is a genuine camaraderie amongst the staff that you can truly feel and they sincerely elevate the entire experience. When things calm down in the kitchen, Chef James will personally come to your table to ask how everything was and is truly interested in your feedback. I have never had a bad meal nor have I had a experience while dining at this authentic local gem. When you stop in, tell them Dan Foley sent you. 😉

We had a fun night at The Frog and Turtle! I really enjoyed the Westbrook burger, with my favorite caramelised onions, without the Presumpscot sauce, just my preference. My girlfriend ordered the cod special with a spicy creole sauce that included tasty shrimp, accompanied by rice and sautéed spinach. She loved that spicy dish! Service was friendly and excellent!
F&T works at its own pace, so relax. Food was tasty, staff welcoming.

We enjoyed a misty night on the deck watching/listening to the Seth Warner band! We love the concerts in Vallee Square and Seth’s band did an amazing tribute to Neil Young. The Frog is the best place to take in these concerts. Our server, Alex, was very attentive and knowledgeable about the food and specials. We started with the scallop cakes, omg, if these are on the menu you must have them! Delicate and light scallops seasoned perfectly and topped with a homemade mango salsa…yes please! My husband ate a late lunch so after one cake he opted not to have an entree instead he went for the pastrami burnt ends. They were absolutely delicious! I ordered the fried haddock plate. This was a work of art! Two huge haddock filets with homemade chips, coleslaw and tarter sauce! There was enough food for at least 2 full meals. The haddock was cooked to perfection, not at all greasy and the house made chips are always delicious! I can’t wait to have my leftovers tonight.
If you’ve never been to The Frog and Turtle before or it’s been awhile since your last visit please go. James and his team do a fantastic job I swear magic happens in that kitchen!

We’ve been fans for years and that hasn’t changed. James and team never disappoint! Our server Graham was attentive even though he was very busy. The wings and tacos were delicious, and so we’re the cocktails. So glad to have a local gem. We can’t wait to go back!
The brunch is great and they take reservations. Service was a little slow, but the food is so dang good that it's worth being patient for.
Food is excellent, space is outstanding. Service could be just a little more attentive. Overall this place is great. We will keep on coming back.

I made reservations for 730. Upon arrival it was obvious that it was a busy night. The hostess was nowhere to be found. We stood near the bar for a solid 10 minutes before seeing a break at the bar to ask about our reservation. We were greeted rudely by the bartender telling us that the two seats we were standing next to were reserved, before I even asked anything. I stated that's why I was speaking to her, we had a reservation and could find no one else to speak to. We were directed over to the corner of the room where there was a young woman with her back to the rest of the room, leaned over a stand. I spoke to this girl asked her about our reservation and was told that there was another party there that wasn't quite finished yet and could we wait a little while longer. Okay fine. 25 minutes later we were still not seated, meanwhile servers and other restaurant staff were buzzing around, completely ignoring us. The other person in my party was finally able to catch someone's attention to ask for one of the four already cleared tables that appeared ready to be seated. With a huff, she seated us. Another 20 minutes goes by and I had to reach out to touch the arm of a passing server to get his attention so we could at least put a drink order in. Another 20 mins later, my friends drink arrives and was not even close to drinkable. Pure alcohol. Great entertainment (why we went). Food was ok, nothing special. I feel like our experience might have been better had they not been so overbooked. It seemed as though staff were not prepared for a large private party AND the crowd that the entertainment drew. Probably won't go again unless the entertainment draws us, definitely won't order food unless it's a quiet night. Kinda bummed about the whole experience but at least the music was excellent.

Food service was extremely slow.
Live entertainment was good but too loud in that space.  Not a place to catch up with friends for sure.
Great staff. Great pizza. The bands were amazing. Love this place!

Nous sommes allé pour le brunch du dimanche, mais quelle belle surprise!! Plats copieux, ambiance d’un vendredi soir à 9hres le matin, musique rock nous avons adoré! Merci Thank you guy’s! You make my day good job!

We had been wanting to try this place for a while. Doubt we’ll come back again, maybe for a drink on the rooftop area, but dinner was lacking and pricey. The food was average at best; chowder had good flavor but watery, flatbread was very bland and the bread pudding was so dry it required a fork and knife. The real shocker was having this as our dinner, split for two with two drinks for $150 bill! Disappointing choice for our night out.
Excellence food and service .. will definitely go back
I thought my meal was very good. The room upstairs was very very noisy though with a large table of people.  I think maybe young people don't mind this as much as us who are getting older.

Bri was amazing!  The outdoor band was very loud and she made every effort to seat us outside in an area with a moderate noise level so we could enjoy dinner, talk and still hear the music.  
Doug was our server and he was so pleasant, attentive and professional.  
We loved our experience and will be back soon!!
Excellent Brunch location with awesome donuts served warm.

This was our 4th trip to F&T and it will most likely be our last. Pros: Nice rooftop seating. Cons: Overpriced cocktails and entrees (noticeably more expensive than Old Port restaurants we frequent) extremely slow service. My husband had to go forage for napkins and silverware in the restaurant after requesting them several times. They didn’t have two of the drinks we wanted; nor did they have two of the entrees my parents ordered. We were there for nearly 3 hours and watched people who got seated 30 minutes after us receive their meals well before we did. We had to flag our waitress down for the check then again to get her to take our payment. Also, the menu has several spelling errors. It’s too bad because F&T used to be a fantastic spot.
Wonderful brunch for my birthday. Loved the homemade donuts. We also really liked the eggs Benedict and the huge breakfast sandwich.

Frog and turtle was so so. Service took a very long time when the place was empty. Food was okay. Calamari was pretty chewy. Drinks were great, and strong worth the 15$. Outside patio was good and covered. Waitress very nice and helpful

We met friends and sat on the rooftop deck. What a great experience!  Beautiful view! Excellent food!  Our waitress, Meghan was terrific. We ordered dessert and enjoyed it by the tabletop fire. We can’t wait to come back!

This is an absolutely super spot. Great food, excellent staff, love the deck in the evening. 

We definitely will go back but probably not sit inside if there is a music guest unless acoustic. Likely the band /musicians didn't care, but not being able to hear my companion or the wait staff WAS something we cared about. Luckily we were able to be graciously re-seated upstairs on the deck. Much better, and made for a truly lovely experience. 

I definitely would not have used the word "energetic" to describe the band's noise level.
Very slow service for both drinks and food. Menu didn't list mushrooms as an ingredient in the steak entree, steak came covered in mushrooms. Steak was overcooked too. Not worth the price
Great place for an anniversary! Music is a little loud, but over all a great time!

The food is consistently great at brunch, with kind, easy-going service! We always make a reservation just to be sure we get a table because it fills up fast.  This last visit I enjoyed a meal with my parents who found the music to be a bit too loud for an enjoyable brunch conversation. The overall volume of people's voices had to rise above the music and this made the general space feel loud and tinny.  Otherwise, we had a great experience!

We have not been to the Frog and Turtle since the start of the COVID19 pandemic.  We decided to celebrate our 55th Wedding Anniversary by have dinner at this restaurant.  We were a party of 3 and and we all agreed that the soup and chowder appetizers were excellent.  The main courses took quite a while to arrive and were fine, but not outstanding.  We reminded ourselves that we were in a gastropub and not an elegant very high priced restaurant.  Overall I rated our experience as very good.

We love the Frog and Turtle brunch, have been coming here for hours. This past Sunday was not our favorite, still good though. Waited 22 minutes before anyone showed with water and we had to ask for someone. Homemade donuts were great but have gotten smaller, a sign of the times i guess. Meal was great as usual. Once we got bill server disappeared, had to take it to the bartender. Overall not a horrible experience and we will definitely be back.
As always, we had a perfect evening. Totally awesome service, food and beverages. 100% satisfied, we love the Frog and Turtle, and highly recommend it to anyone or everyone!
A fun comfortable reliable hospitable place.  One of my favorite casual spots!
There were 3 of us for brunch. Our waitress Jac was excellent. She made great suggestions and accommodated our needs. We will be back to try lunch or dinner.
Ty for a great dinner. All went well. Wait staff were excellent.

The food at the Frog And Turtle is consistently good, however the service was lacking. The waitress made us wait for a long time to take our order which I didn't mind because we were on the rooftop tarace. She then mistook the order of my friend and didn't even offer to get her the right dish. All in all it was a good night and I will go to the second floor to eat again. 

I will never go and sit in the downstairs again however because they have extremely loud bands playing 10 feet away from your table. You can't enjoy conversation with your friends in the downstairs, and seniors will have trouble walking upstairs. For young healthy people it's a great hang out. Anyone with mobility problems should stear clear.
Music way too loud.  Could not have conversation with friends.  Couldn’t hear them.

As always the food was great, our server was amazing and made us feel welcomed. Live music is wonderful but the Venue  was a bit small to have a band that loud. Their
Music was awesome but need to lower the volume. Overall it was a great night
I love the atmosphere at The Frog and Turtle. I  had the soup and fruit desert. Both were excellent.
Wonderful evening- great service, drinks, food and music! We will return.

I have been a big fan of The Frog and Turtle, but I don’t plan on going back anytime soon. I realize that all restaurants are struggling to find support, but waiting 75 minutes to get our breakfast is too much of a wait. It is even more challenging when you have a toddler. When our food finally arrived, it wasn’t hot, the order was wrong, and part of our order was missing. We ate the order as is because we were hungry. We asked our server for additional napkins 3 times and eventually I had to go get them myself. 

Also, the table we were sat at shouldn’t be a table. It is very cramped in that corner and you are sitting right on top of the other table. It made it worse that we had a high chair at our table, but I had called the night before to make sure it was okay to have two adults and a high chair at our table. I told the woman who answered the phone that it would be okay if she told me no - we could go somewhere else. She was adamant that a high chair could easily fit at the table. This wasn’t the case.

Service from the front of the house to the wait staff was excellent. My traditional  eggs benedict was spot on and the portion size was just right. Home-fries were done perfectly and even the small salad on the plate was good. Everyone in our family group on Mother's Day totally enjoyed their meals. We sat upstairs and will be sitting up there for all our future reservations here.
First time going here. Food was just ok.  Our calimari app was terribly rubbery so they did remove that from the bill but food overall was ok. It’s a 25 minute drive so we don’t think we’ll return.
Live music Thursday and Friday.  Outside dining was for happy hour 4pm- 5pm. Food was fresh.
Great place ,great music ,very good meal and very pleasant service

Taco appetizer (special) was very good. My wife had the tortellini dish which she thoroughly enjoyed while I had the fish and chips, light batter and flaky. Dessert special was cinnamon charros with a rumchata dip- so so good.
Food not as tasty, too loud… needs shades for sun set
Our server Bree was excellent, knew menu & specials.  Food served as we requested.
Don’t go. Save your money. Long wait times. Horrific tasting food. Sweet people, but they need help.
Food was excellent, they did very well to accommodate even though short staff.

While we had reservations, we waited 20” to be seated. We then waited at least 20” for our server to take our order, which arrived 20-25” later. Had to chase down a kitchen helper for cutlery. Restaurant is crowded and very noisy, making it a challenge to carry a conversation. Once we finished eating, I got up yet again to flag our server w/my credit card so we could pay our tab & make our exit. This was not a relaxing Sunday brunch. No plans to return.

The frog and turtle has fantastic food. However, we made a reservation for 9am and didn't get our food until almost 10:45. We sat first and had tables all around us get their food, eat, and leave before our food even came out. We were out of drinks and no one came until I went up to the bar. The service has gone down hill a lot here. It's too bad I family trying this place for the first time and they were not impressed by the service and time frame to get our food. Food was great however, donuts are awesome. Please step it up this is such a great place!

Not really what we expected....Had a gift card so we gave it a try....My wife had chicken and I had Haddock....both sandwiches....they we stacked so high it was impossible to eat them....so we took them apart and ate them that way....both very dry....the french fries were very good....my gin and tonic was weak....waitress was very good....but the noise was loud....and only 2 other couples....Not really sure we will be back....sorry

Noise level very high due to one table with 4 people who were extremely loud and somewhat obnoxious! 

Otherwise, outstanding food and service!
Long wait for service and food was mediocre but nice atmosphere.
Everything was awesome....our server was attentive and friendly, the drinks were scrumptious, and the food was exceptional.  James and his crew were outstanding!
Always a joy to have dinner here. Took our grandson who just loved his burger and fries. We shared a simple dessert of ice cream and maple syrup!  Life is good.
Our favorite spot for brunch!  They never disappoint.

Took 30 minutes to get water. Another 20 minutes to get a beverage. Server Logan was awful..kept putting us off saying just a minute and then we’d look over and he’d be wiping tables or doing non-urgent things when no one was waiting to be seated instead of getting us drinks or taking our order. Was completely bizarre. Luckily the food was hot and delicious. Ordered donuts to go which were pretty special. Made the whole over two hour experience much less frustrating!

Chef James and his amazing staff bring such a high quality experience every time I go. The service is amazing, the entertainment is outstanding, and the food is simply beyond compare. Huge props to Lucas, for being the bartender extraordinaire that he is, we had such a complete evening as I have come to expect every time I step through the door. The frog and turtle is a gem and his reason alone to plan a trip to the Portland Maine area. I can’t wait for the next trip up.

Great selection, something for just about everyone.

Quality was great, service was great.

Upon arrival we were promptly seated upstairs. While we were walking up the stairs to the dining room I used the hand rail briefly and noticed that it was very sticky and not in just one spot as I needed to use it again and the same slimy sticky mess was noticed.
We were seated next to the bar at a wobbly bar style tall table which was quite off putting. It was busy and no other tables were available otherwise I would have kindly asked to move. We ordered the donuts which were excellent and they came out relatively quick along with a cocktail. My guest ordered just some bacon and home fries and I ordered the Jimmy Benedict. We waited approximately an hour for our food to arrive but my Jimmy came as a Franco American? After trying to put it on other peoples tables first the waitress then came and asked me if it was mine and I clearly didn’t order that dish. She apologized and asked me if I wanted it. I was calm and just asked her for what I originally ordered. My guest ate while my order was being remade. Finally my food arrived and I was able to eat but my guest was waiting for me to receive my food and hers was ice cold by then. Her side of bacon was dangerously undercooked on one half and burnt on the other end. My Benedict was not what I aspected from this restaurant. The Jimmy comes with caramelized onions which is fine however that’s all that was under the egg with little to non existing bacon.
I still left a large tip for the girl that waited on us because I didn’t want her (even though she made errors) to go without.
Excellent food, excellent service, and wonderful ambience!

Great food and atmosphere. The bar service was a bit slow but good cocktails. Would definitely go there again. I had the strip steak and a friend had the lamb special. All great. The house-made chips served with the fried haddock were great! I could eat a basket of those by themselves.

All the food was excellent. The staff were attentive in spite of being very busy. The drinks and wine were very good. We came to hear the band playing that night and stayed until they finished because everything was so good. At the end (and in my 50 years of dining never saw this before), the owner addressed everyone by thanking the band and complimenting them highly, thanking the patrons for coming to his establishment and wishing everyone a happy Easter weekend. We will definitely return.
Service during Sunday brunch was stellar, good was very good. Booths are a little snug if you're tall/have a belly.

After 5 visits to F/T, no more. They clearly don’t have their act together. Seated at a table with no menus or water. Other tables arriving after us received menus and water. Waited 20 mins and no server arrived, despite servers visiting tables not 3 feet away. No acknowledgment, no “be right with you.” Prior visits also included incredibly long times for appetizers, cocktails and meals to arrive. The food is just ok (we didn’t try any food last night as no one came to take the order).  So many other choices around so don’t waste your time.
Great food and beer and service. We enjoyed our dinner with our family and left before the band started playing- wish we could have stayed longer!

The food was and always is delicious!! Unfortunately the service was unbelievably slow. There were 2 of us there for brunch and we were there for 2.5 hours. It took 10-15 min for us to be greeted and another 15-20 to be able to order food. Our server was young and sweet, maybe overwhelmed? But did not check on us, I had to flag him down any time we needed something. I know staffing is tough I was just surprised that tables around us were getting prompt attention and we weren’t. Food & atmosphere are great.
Great time to be had by all . Great music.  Great food
The best seafood chowder we’ve ever had! Amazing service, too.

I ordered a martini with only one drop of vermouth….there was certainly more than one drop…totally changes the flavor. The server was okay…we were there early so the noise level was fine. We both enjoyed our meal very much.

The food was quite heavy without any subtlety. I was disappointed with the flavors. I will  chose differently if I come back. The creme brûlée was great. The ambiance was nice and the live music was excellent. Even though it was a small room the noise wasn’t overbearing. The waiter seemed stressed but he was pleasant,

Birthday for 2 of our party, only one waiter, he was working hard, but despite having a reservation we waited 45 minutes to be seated, they had a special menu for st paddy’s day but not good selection, sorry, won’t be going back
cold near the door as it opened many times. to be expected. nice time.
The is always fantastic! Thank you to the kitchen for accommodating my food allergies.  The service was great, cocktails were tasty, an overall fun and delicious experience!

Had the special - lollipop lamb chops with lamb sausage. It knocked my socks off! Best restaurant meal I've had in years. Everyone in my group was thrilled with their dish and the wait staff was fantastic!

We had a reservation for 4:15pm.   We were seated promptly.   The waitress was very pleasant and attentive.  The appetizer, drinks and food were excellent and served timely.  We will definately go back.  Dale & Lisa
Nice spot, food just ok at best and pricey.

Good basic food. Service so so. Need more help. Problem with this place is they make everything from scratch so plan on waiting long time. More time for them to sell more drinks which are way over priced. Liked atmosphere.

We sat upstairs, food was good, waited a VERY long time for it to arrive. Charged for refills on seltzer water. Arrived at 6:30, waited at least 30 minutes before food arrived, dinner was about 2 hours... Don't think i will rush to go back.

The meal was wonderful as was the extremely attentive staff. It was noisy because we were there to hear the featured band. We had a great evening.
This was our first visit and we loved the experience!  The staff (all) were amazing!
Great evening with family and friends!!! Love this place!
Incredible so dang creaking food! Service including the food.
The haddock in the haddock sandwich was not good. Chewy and not fresh.
Very fun place.  Great food.  Casual.  Busier than expected last night so service was not great but staff was pleasant and accommodating.  I like the selection of drinks.  Will definitely go back.
James never disappoints with his food.  Always good service.

This was our second visit to the Frog and Turtle and it is quickly becoming a favorite.  Their Valentines menu was outstanding with special mention to the braised pork appetizers. I could have easily walked away having eaten that and been happy! The dessert board was incredible. The ambience was lovely and romantic. My only mention is staff seemed very busy and it took a bit to get more beverages. All things considered though there are not enough adjectives to describe the deliciousness!
It was our a anniversary. Our son joined. Food and the freshly made donuts were wonderful. Our favorite brunch spot. .

We went for a family dinner and the restaurant wasn’t super busy. Our server was very nice and the vibe of the restaurant cozy, but it was the first time in my entire life we’ve ever had to wait for over an hour to get our food. We were a group of 5 and once the food came, after about 1.5 hours, my food was not part of the plates brought to our table. I was assured that it would only take a couple minutes but after 10 minutes I was brought a salad as an apology for the wait. I was told that my food would only take about 4 more minutes to come but I waited at least 15 more minutes to finally get it. By the time I got my food almost everyone else was done eating on my table. Delicious food but not worth 2 hours of wait.

Nice place and staff. Had chicken. Steak salad and wings.
The wings were the best part.
Will come back and try something different
Always good food, with innovative twists. Fun environment, lovely wait staff. Gets noisy at times, but we enjoy the ambience anyway!

Logan was our server and was just fantastic! He checked in on us after we were seated and that’s all you need is to acknowledge you know we are there. Buys you an extra 5 minutes to catch up and keeps customers happy as they understand you are busy. Nice job dude!
Delicious food and great service. So worth the wait!

I ordered an egg white, avocado snd tomato sandwich. The egg whites were runny snd undercooks snd not edible. The bread slices were so small the egg whites were falling out everywhere. I did tell the waitress they were undercooked snd she said she would tell the kitchen. I felt like my meal should have been discounted at that point.
We loved the food and had great service. A treat was the live music. No complaints and can’t wait to go back.

We made a reservation for 6:15 and ended up being seated right next to a small stage.  At about 7 (when we still hadn’t gotten our food, this place is very slow) a band came in and started setting up about 3 feet from us.  I looked online and it said music started at 8.  We hoped we could finish and get out of there before they started.  We got our food at around 7:20 and tried to eat fast but they ended up starting at about 7:40 and we weren’t done.  It was very loud country music.   We couldn’t hear a word one another said and it really ruined the meal.  They really should ask before seating people next to a stage of there is going to be a loud band.

Food, ambiance very nice but extremely load even before the music(which was great) started. Also a back door opening brought steady streams of cold air. I would suggest an airlock or curtain for the back door.

Had a 7:30pm reservation, didn’t get sat until 8:10, then made us get up and switch seats 5 minutes later because a bigger party came in. Didn’t even get a drink until 8:15, then was told by the wait staff that the menu was limited to pretty much chicken items because they were all on vacation next week. Food was good but not what I wanted to order.  Probably will not be back….

Never got to eat. Was seated and then we waited. Waited. Waited. After 30 mins, we’re told a third the menu items  were not available because they were closing in two days. Probably a good idea. We left. Too loud and crowded anyway.
Excellent food, Rose is a wonderful server, we all enjoyed each bite! Decor warm and festive!

Food was fantastic, my dining companion and I both had the salmon. Very delicious- cooked medium with crispy skin. We also had their chocolate tear drop dessert which was to die for! The couple next to us liked the pork belly so much they struck up a conversation with us and encouraged us to order it next time. AND there will be a next time.

Celebrated husband's 72nd birthday.  He got a free crème brûlée to celebrate.  Food, as always, was delicious. Very laid back dining.  Live music was great but a bit loud to have dinner conversations--particular across a large booth.  All 5 of us loved the experience and food.
Food was great. Macisso trio was outstanding!!

Nicely greeted by the hostess and seated immediately. Quickly greeted by the waitperson. Now the food. The food is wonderful. Ordered beef Wellington, mashed potatoes, spinach and a great sauce. Haddock sandwich and a side salad. Perfectly prepared, perfectly plated, perfectly wonderful. I highly recommend F&G. The restaurant was very crowded so the noise level was high but we were able to talk easily during dinner. Wonderful!

The food was very tasty and good value. The service was mediocre, the waitress was good but I guess they have 2 doors and we entered at the least used door. It took quite awhile for the hostess to realize we were there. My second time there and my first time being inside. I was not aware the Noise level would be that loud.  Would warn any friends of the noise level and recommend outside tables
So easy to make a reservation on Open Table .  Full fills all expectations.  Great service and great food.

Cat dad understands good customer service and how to make money. We booked 6 because that’s all it would allow then wrote a note that we’d be larger than 6 in our party. Reserved over a week ago. Server who met us at door was either overwhelmed or just doesn’t like making money. Cat Dad to the rescue told her he could take the party of 8 and he did an awesome job! Wish we could have tipped him way more but the policy of automated gratuity messes that up. We will be back because food is good, prices reasonable, and Cat Dad server! Honeybadgers Sunday Flag Football team tips well.
The food was delicious and our waitress was friendly and fun. We loved the vibe of the place and the music was great. We’ll be back.

I had requested a specific booth, the hostess was bringing us to it and suddenly stopped and said "the band" was using it and brought us to a tiny table in the middle of the room.  We did not know, but there was a fundraiser there and we were completely out of place.  The establishment was filled with people who knew each other and were all very loud.  There were people standing behind our little table and kept bumping into my boyfriend's back the entire time we were there.   There was a woman behind us in a booth dressed as Mrs. Claus who came out of no where and literally put her donation box in my face during our meal.  It should have been advertised that this evening was for a specific audience and we would have chosen another night.  Or even the server could have explained what was going on and we could have left.  Instead, we had terrible atmosphere for our date night, and after several complaints to our server, who said she was the manager, still received our full bill and no apologies.  

F&T has been my go to for years for a great meal and atmosphere.  It will be a long while before we come back or I recommend it anyone after this fiasco!

We had a very fun night with live, festive holiday music! We loved it! Service was slower than normal.  Our server was clearly overwhelmed, unable to split our bill,  and unavailable for a few of our needs. However, the restaurant was very busy.  The food was good, the price point higher than it really should be.  All that being said,  we had a great time! The atmosphere was very fun!

The dining area was cold. Waitstaff and kitchen could not keep up with an upstairs function and partially full dining area. 2 hour wait for entrees.  Loud live band 15 ft from table- wait staff had to lean over and talk into your ear. Where is our food?- " it is made from scratch", " they are plating it now". We tried to request our bill for apps prior to arrival of entrees and escape...  but evasive waitstaff prevented that. My food, when it arrived was luke warm and subpar.
No delay in waitstaff presenting $100.00 meal check without offering dessert on what was reserved on OpenTable as a special occasion birthaday. A very poor value for you dollar anywhere. High end price without the experience.
Great time , music good people nice food and drinks are very good also

The food and cocktails? Exquisite without being fussy. We had the seasonal crepe dish with chicken and mushrooms, the Smokeshow burger with onion rings , a side salad, and dessert. Everything was fresh, cooked properly, well-seasoned, and beautifully presented. Cocktails were well-crafted and delicious. Dessert was BEAUTIFUL. 

The service? Fantastic. Our server was extremely attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable, and provided us with excellent service and menu recommendations.

The atmosphere? It was live music Friday and it was LOUD. Extremely loud. Loud to the point that we couldn’t hear our server, couldn't carry on a conversation, and for some portions of the evening I needed to pop in ear plugs because the volume was actually hurting my ears. The band’s musicianship was good but the acoustics of the dining room were far  too bright for a drum kit and electric guitars amplified to that volume.  It was such a relief when the band packed it in for the night and we could actually chat with each other during dessert. 

The Verdict: We will definitely return to enjoy more outstanding food, drinks, and service. We’ll just be sure to visit on a different, quieter night of the week.

We’ve been here many times over the years. Unfortunately, our waiter seemed new and only made us aware of one special when there were actually three. One of which - the bratwurst - my husband would have ordered had he known of it. I wondered about this when servers at tables surrounding us mentioned all three specials and later brought it to our servers attention. He apologized and said he missed a meeting so only knew of one special. Nice kid, but that’s not a good excuse. Then there was a cheesecake on the menu which we would have ordered for dessert around 5:30, but even though said cheesecake was served to a table beside us we were told it would be at least another hour before it was fully set. So that was a disappointment as well because we were told it was not available at that point. Seems like there could have been better planning since they open at 4:30 for dinner.  And all servers should know what all the specials are. No excuses.
