A favorite restaurant of ours in the area.  Food is always very good with the fish and chips being the best around.  Good drinks and desserts as well.  Can get a bit loud, especially with any live music - so not the spot for quiet conversations, but overall, highly recommended.
Not a place to hurry. At least two hours unless eating at bar.
The owner is so kind and truely cares about his patrons. The band was absolutly superb! Atmosphere, food, and service are always top notch.

The salad on the Fall Menu was one of the best I've ever had---perfect balance of savory and sweet with grilled salmon!  The food and drinks are always worth the extra wait, as the staff clearly takes the time to make sure things are delicious and satisfying.

Our server was very pleasant and the food was very good. We had a 630 reservation and was seated promptly.  They had a band which Started at 7:30 which  made conversation a little difficult but they were very good

Group of 10 before thanksgiving. Meals were great including my flatbread, others raves about their steaks and seafood!  Drinks were delicious including one called The Riverwalk, my new favorite dessert drink. Very good service.
The food was amazing!!! Best brunch I’ve had in a while! Donuts were out of this world and both our meals were sooo good!!!
Food is consistently delicious. Cocktails are a tasty blend of seasonal concoctions. Service is friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. Music is interesting, varied and enjoyable.
Had nice meal with friends. Good food and we loved the music!

The food was great —as always. The service was not the best. We were told we couldn’t have tea this morning because the “hot water machine” was broken. This was mystifying; why could water not be heated from the stove … in the kitchen … ? We waited for an hour for food, which was not a problem at all. The menu says food is made from scratch and it would take time; we were okay enjoying our drinks. However, our server was practically MIA. The food runner dropped out donuts and ran. After breakfast arrived, I asked for jam, but she never came back. And none of that was the end of the world (I was just happy to see the restaurant was busy!) What was off putting is that after we paid the check, someone from my party got up to go to the restroom. While we were waiting for her to come back so we could all leave together, we were told we needed to “wrap it up and move on” so someone else could have the table. There were a number of other tables open and no one was waiting to be seated —and we had just signed a few minutes before. We were practically rushed out the door. This was not the typical experience at F&T but nonetheless, it was disappointing.
The food was good for the most part. The band was extremely loud for the size of the room.

We haven't visited in a while and I feel like the food & service has declined quite a bit. They were hosting a rehearsal dinner up stairs and were probably understaffed as our drinks and food took a very long time. Our mussel appetizer was tasty but many of the mussels weren't open so we couldn't eat them. In general the food was just average . I'm hoping it was just an off night for them but I wouldn't rush back based on the above & cost.
The staff was very friendly, but slow. The food was overpriced for what it was, and I was surprised there was a loud live band early on a Thursday night.
Frog and Turtle has a delicious Brunch Menu!  We love it!
Wonderful brunch with family.

Our server was so great friendly , sweet, efficient (Rosa)!

I.liked my breakfast . But I loved the cardio doughnut!!  

Will go again.. will ask for Rosa
One of our local favorites.  Great service and food.   The lamb soup was delicious.

Excellent food and service, music was too loud couldn’t talk to others at table or to waitress, difficult ordering with loud music. Would be great if they turned down just a little. I like the music but just too over too loud.
First time here, had Sunday brunch. Excellent food, service and value.

server Rosa & young man who was runner we’re both very upbeat and efficient.
Popular spot! 
The Kitchen rocks!
Make a reservation! Or at least call before you head over!

For 15 years F&T has been my favorite restaurant for so many reasons. The food is always incredible, and the atmosphere is the most perfect balance of cozy and classy. The best spot for a romantic date night or an evening enjoying live music with friends. Absolute best brunch- the donuts are a must! You can not go wrong with anything on the menu- and you’ll definitely leave wanting to come back to try something else! The staff is so friendly and professional. Chef James has created the most special place for people to gather and enjoy outstanding food and service in a truly unique environment!
Drinks were awesome! Soups were great. Didn’t care for the Flatbread pizza…. It was very bland. Waitress was wonderful!
They consistently deliver an outstanding product with  a friendly and helpful staff amidst the noise :-)

We have enjoyed F&T many times. The food compares with many of the best places in Portland.  Made reservations a few days ahead for Fri evening.  

The past few times we have been however the music was abusively loud. In the summer they could accommodate us on the deck and we enjoyed our meal. Last night the hostess just said “This is the best I can do.”  We were 6’ from the band’s amplifier and my wife was blinded by the stage lights. We left without ordering a thing and were really disappointed to have driven a half hour to find a restaurant that just isn’t about the food anymore.

Their menu used to brag about everything being made to order and encouraged you to settle in. Their bar program and menu are creative. The kitchen is legit talented. We used to love F&T and now we just can’t eat there. Guess we’re cranky old 40-something’s but we’re also a $200 two-top on a typical date night. 

What does F&T want to be? The atmosphere is standing room only, live band rocking the place, and screaming at the people you came with. Sometimes I like that kind of place but I don’t order mussels there. This is the atmosphere of snacks and cocktails not $30 entrees.

Delicious as always.  Their menu says “expect the food to take 30 minutes because it’s prepared to order”.  We probably waited 45 minutes.  We were a table of 6.  We all loved our abundant brunch entrees.   We will be back.

The entertainment (Sean Mencher) was outstanding.  The service was very good, and  the food was good for what it was (I had a fried haddock sandwich.  I found myself wishing the music was a little louder/ easier to hear).

Wow. A few months back we had a bad  experience here. The server forgot our appetizer. Our entree came out eventually and we let her know yet the appetizer still ended up on the check and we had to end up speaking to a floor manager to have it removed. No apology whatsoever. Decided to give F & T another try. Took over ten minutes for our sever to greet us and take our drink and appetizer order. 20 minutes later no drinks yet but appetizer comes out with a table runner. We politely ask about our beverages and are told that they will be right out. Meanwhile seeing that folks seated after us have already received beverages. 25 minutes later (that’s 45 minutes after being seated) and we still haven’t seen drinks or the server again. Eventually we spot the server and flag her down. Again we are told they will be right out. At this point it’s just not even worth wasting the time and money. We politely ask to have our orders cancelled, pay for the app and leave. Within 15 minutes we are seated at Legends Rest and have food and drinks in hand.
Had 630 reservation and by 840 still no dinner. Very poor kitchen management and no communication as to when or why dinner was late. Order placed at 650.
Staff was friendly and accommodating.

Ribs app was excellent. Paired the salmon with a nice Chenin Blanc. The dessert was perfect- chocolate chocolate chocolate otherwise called the Tear Drop of Happiness. Overall great dining experience.

Great Place, Great Food, Incredible Music.
James is a Rockstar

We love the Frog & Turtle and have been going there since it opened many years ago.  The food is always the best and the serving size is huge.  The staff is always friendly and try to accommodate your requests.
A perfect date night or causal dinner with friends. I simply love dining here!
The food was good, the server was slow. We wanted to order a donut but we got tired or waiting so we just asked for the check.
Our server Logan was amazing!
$42 for a Rib eye steak that was a lot hard to chew was disappointing

Had a reservation and had to wait 20 min after it to be seated. Tried to get a drink while waiting and the bartender took 10 min just to acknowledge us. Server forgot to put part of out order in and blamed it on the kitchen. Had to ask for utensils, napkins, and basic condiments. It was over all an awful experience despite me hoping it would be a good one.
Our brunchexperience was fantastic.  The food was amazing and we definitely will be back for dinner and brunch again.
Quite simply the best brunch around. The doughnuts….holy moly! And they always cook my husband’s poached eggs correctly. Love The Frog & Turtle!
Restaurant was not busy but service was pretty slow, chowder was good and so was burger and fries but the coconut shrimp and fish taco were not good.
We had a wonderful dinner, celebrating my daughters birthday!
We went to see the band and will definitely be back for the food (and more music of course)!

Great dinner and live band!  Best dessert ever, chocolate mousse was amazingly delicious!  Perfect date night.
Best venue for live music!
The service was great, the food was awesome, everything was great, but the noise level was way too loud, in the future I will ask to be seated in the smaller room

We met 4 friends to enjoy an evening on the deck while listening to the Queen tribute band. The ambiance is always fabulous, the drinks and food were delicious (as always) and the Vallee. Square concerts never disappoint! Rosa was great, the place was packed, and the staff was hustling. It was all hands on deck the owner and hostess were running food and cleaning tables. This is a great example of everyone pitching in during staff shortages and such. It’s our turn, as patrons, to show these dedicated workers more kindness and patience.
Perfect atmosphere

I usually love Frog & Turtle but this was my worst experience at F&T and one of my worst dining experiences ever. The wait staff was incredibly understaffed, leading to long wait times and incorrect food and drink orders. In addition, the quality of the food was not what it always has been-chowder was runny, salads were drenched in tasteless dressings, wine was warm and mixed beverages were sour/bitter to the point of undrinkable.

The Frog and Turtle had everything we were looking for in a Sunday Brunch and for a special occasion...from the wonderful mimosas to the egg selections to those amazing homemade donuts!!!  A must do for brunch!

We were seated downstairs and definitely had the "B" team for service. They "ran out" of the special old fashion on the menu, yet I could see all the ingredients behind the bar, I suspect the young man acting as the bar tender was not, in fact, a bartender and was pouring pre-mixed cocktails only.  Everyone was friendly and trying hard, but clearly inexperienced and very slow.  The special tacos were good and so were the fried mushrooms.  If we go back I would try upstairs and hope for mare experienced wait staff.

We last ate here pre-pandemic and excited to go back.  We ate upstairs in a spacious and bright dining area which was fairly empty.  Service was slow, but that is to be expected with lack of help these days.  The salmon was very good (according to my wife).  My burger was OK, it came medium when I asked for med-rare and was smaller than most pub burgers (6 oz vs. 8 oz).  Beer and wine selections were fine.  So, overall: A burger, a piece of salmon, a beer and a glass of wine cost $75 before tip.  You decide if that is overpriced or not.

We have been to Frog & Turtle many times and always enjoy our experience.  We had dinner on the roof top and were able to enjoy the Thursday concert series afterwards, while still enjoying our seats on the roof.  They (like so many others) are experiencing a shortage of staff but our server worked hard at keeping up with everyone.  She was pleasant, our food was great and the ambiance was very cool!

I have been to frog and turtle several times and normally I would rate it as outstanding. The food didn’t seem to be as impressive as every other time I’ve been. It was a pricey meal so I expect better.
We waited 30 minutes for our drinks, 45 minutes for the appetizer and then our meal.  It was not busy when we arrived at 5:30.  Disappointed since I hadn’t been there in a long time

Made a last minute reservation, we had not dined at Frog & Turtle in a while. Kind of surprised I could get a Saturday reservation for 6:30pm at 5:30 but went with it as it had never disappointed, it did this time. Despite many open tables overall it was a meh type of experience. First the waitress brought me the wrong beer, no big deal but….. we ordered and noticed many of the folks around us did not have food. A few minutes later she returned to inform us the burger I ordered was not available as they ran out of burgers!!! She brought the menu back and I picked out an entree, an eggplant one. She never mentioned  that they still had chicken sandwiches which was my bad, that is what it should have subbed for the burger. She said the kitchen was ‘slammed’ just earlier. But this was 6:30pm on a Saturday. Took well over an hour for the food to arrive,
It was good but overall disappointing.
Good food. First time upstairs. It is nice and bright. We have avoided returning as the downstairs is too loud and too dark. As long as we can be seated upstairs, we will not wait so long to return.

We had a 6 person reservation for 7:15pm. The server came over within the first 5-10 minutes after being seated. We were given glasses of water, then our drink orders were taken. Waited 20 minutes for 2 drinks, an additional 10 minutes for 3 drinks and a total wait of 50 minutes until the 6th drink came out, which was sitting at the bar already made and ready for about 20 minutes. 
We asked the server how long for food and she said 25 minutes. At 7:56pm we order our appetizers(cup of chowder, pork belly, and fried calamari) and meals at once(2 ribeyes, 2 chicken, 1 salad, 1 bowl of chowder). 
At 8:35pm our appetizers came out and we were told our meals would be out in a few minutes. At 9:00pm we asked for the kitchen to box our meals and also asked for our check. (We had reservations elsewhere at 9:30pm.)
The server was paid and our boxed meals came out at 9:08pm. 
With all of that being said, we were there for 2 hours. And didn’t even receive our meals in that time. 
Now I’m not one to write reviews but, I have never waited 2 hours for a meal. I have never had a server who doesn’t check in on their table. I understand completely if it’s a lack of staff issue, but a little heads up and honestly goes a lot further. Safe to say I will not return.
Always a great experience! Brunch is my favorite, donuts are sooo good!
The chowder recipe has changed.  My wife went to the emergency room with severe abdominal cramps after eating your pizza.  Enough said
They are short staffed; service was slower than expected, but the food was good and our wait staff was pleasant.

They sat us directly in front of the stage with a loud band playing at 8p. Good band - great ambiance for a bar - but not a restaurant with a 3-year-old for dinner. Noise and slow service were miserable.
We have been dining at the F & T for years! Always delicious, free food and creative menu options. Service is always great!
The Frog and Turtle is the very best! Awesome evening, great food and service and wonderful atmosphere. My favorite spot to gather with friends, I highly recommend this restaurant.
Friendly, delicious

My first experience with making a reservation with F&T and it was terrible! Arrived and seated quickly, but service after that was terrible. Waiter brought a drink menu and didn’t return to take our order for 40 minutes. Never received any water or service the entire visit! Wont be going back there soon😢

We tried to grab dinner here before going to the movies with a 5:30 reservation trying to catch a 7 pm movie just down he road. The first person in the group arrived just before 5:30 and was seated. She ordered a drink while waiting for us to arrive. We arrived at 5:40 and didn’t see the server for 15 minutes. He finally came over and took our drink orders and 5 minutes later he came back because he forgot the orders. We waited for at least 20 minutes before the drinks came. The drinks arrived and we ordered a second round of drinks plus our food.  The drinks came out right away this time and at 6:55 we asked for our food to be changed to take out. We then watched our food be brought outside to another table and then they realized it was our food. We then had to wait for the to go containers and our bill so that we could leave to get to the movie. The restaurant was clearly short staffed but this was still incredibly slow. The food was pretty good but not hot. In hindsight, we should have allotted a little more time but we thought Wednesday at 5:30 wouldn’t be too busy and it wasn’t that busy. There seemed to be a private event of some sort going on upstairs which may have slowed things down too but overall very disappointing. I have had great experiences here so I will give it another chance and hope it was a one time issue.

I’ve been a patron of The Frog since their opening day. This morning I enjoyed the absolute best brunch dish, the beet greens w/ goat cheese benedict! OMG Chef James has done it again! Thanks for making my tummy extra happy this morning!

Bartender was great; very personable, quick. Great staff, friendly, work well as a team with everyone helping each other.Eggs Bennie really good, Bloody Mary mix
incredibly salty.
Haddock sandwich over cook burger rare ordered medium 27.00 pepperoni pizza over rated no taste barely pepperoni   Never had a bad meal until sat night left very disappointed sorry

Our server Logan was great. The blonde manager was so rude. We sat outside and we’re getting eaten alive by bugs there was no candles nor the torches that worked. We were getting constantly bombarded by drunk people saying rude things and trying to pick a fight with us as we’re just sitting down trying to eat peacefully. When we told the manager, the blonde one, she told us that those are the regulars… That was her answer. She had no hospitality. Everything was just the answer was no, basically sounds like a you problem. She made us seem like that we were a bother. “Can I have a sugar rim please” someone asked “we don’t have sugar” in the worst tone ever.

Very disappointed. 1.5 hours in and no food...others people were seated, fed and left while we were there.  I asked to speak with the manager.  She came over and obviously couldn't be bothered. I ordered a salad and she said it should be out shortly. Give me a break.  We were already told that 4 times in an hour and a half.  She blamed it on me not enjoying the atmosphere and energy of the room.  Long story short...she refused to offer any compensation and said that they don't do that.  I told her to cancel my salad.  I believe She could use some managerial skills in dealing with customers.
Great chef! Great ambience and food choices. Love this place!

The food was very good and we enjoyed an additional benefit as we ate outside and a concert was occurring at the same time which we thought was great.  We liked our waitress who had her hands full with many table assignments.

Had dinner there last night, wait for food was extremely long for burgers over 45mins, ordered drinks off the drink menu and was advised after ordering the Peach margarita that they are not putting any peach jalapeno or Chayanne sugar rim as they don't want to waist their product, asked for a MBC lunch beer while drinking it there was "food, bug of some sort" in the bottom of the beer, received another one and was not the same as there was floating things in that as well and when talking w/ the server we were advised that that's how the beer is to look and when comparing the 2 together they were not the same as one was extremely cloudy and had god knows what in it floating in it (possibly needing to clean the beer lines), other drink of Tito's and soda that we asked for several times along w/ the server asking if we ever received it and the answer was NO, when finally receiving it there was a bug in that (granted I get those things happen but come on),  They were not very busy (as there was a concert outside) it took us at least 3 hrs to receive an order of mussels that were gritty and no bread to dip into the juice, 2 burger in which one was over cook and one under cooked, w/ onion rings that were dry, and 2 taco in which just did not taste good.  I get there a "gastro pub" but w/ not being that busy 3 hrs for food is not impressive.  This has been the 4/5 time we've tried Frog and Turtle and not impressed as there is always an issue and that service sometimes is not great as they make you feel like your beneath them.  I have been in the restaurant industry for over 25yrs and have worked at some very well known places with in Maine, and I know what to expect and have a lot of understanding esp with what is happening in the past few yrs, but I will NOT ever go back to F&G as what we had last night was unacceptable.
Great food, great service, and great music! I love this place!

We’re long time customers of the Frog & Turtle so our recent experience was deeply disappointing. From start to finish - it was a disaster! Two of us got there at 6 to have a cocktail before the other 2 in our party arrived.  We were sat & ordered cocktails right away. The other 2 in our party got there at 6:30 & we hadn’t even got our drinks yet (30 minutes to get 2 cocktails??). The restaurant wasn’t busy - when we arrived, there were 3 tables downstairs, 2 upstairs & 4 people at the bar. When our 2 drinks finally came, 1 of them was wrong (mojitos don’t have ginger beer!). The rest of our party ordered their cocktails….and 10-15 min’s later, the trainee helping our waitress came over to get their order AGAIN b/c our waitress hadn’t had time to put the order in yet (and clearly forgot what the order was!).  We’re used to waiting for food at F&T….it’s made from scratch & usually well worth the wait!  We waited longer than normal for our app (20 wings) and longer than normal for our meals. 2 of our 4 meals came incorrect (with mushrooms after requesting no mushrooms - we HATE mushrooms) & with stone cold onion rings.  When telling the server abt the 2 incorrect burgers, she said “if you’re not allergic to mushrooms I would eat them as it’ll be another 30-45 minutes to replace them”. So we unhappily picked our meals apart (mushrooms were encapsulated into the melted cheese) & ate what we could. When we finished, our waitress brought us the check & didn’t even ask us if we wanted dessert, another cocktail, etc.  My wife went downstairs to speak to a manager abt our experience. Our concerns were brought to James (owner/chef) who refused to do anything abt it. She was told “our policy is if someone takes a bite of their meal, we won’t do anything abt it.”  We ate the wrong meals at the server’s suggestion after having an entire evening of ridiculous wait times & wrong drinks/food showing up….and they refused to offer us anything. $200+ for a horrible experience!!!!
Good meal - good vibe - good price
The service was slow, the food was great, the waitress did drop our food  and we had to wait longer, I feel we should have had it on the house , they did offer a “free” donut.
wonderful meal the waitress was Alex she was very good in all aspects we would return
Food was ok service not so much. Our server was more into chatting with people than checking her tables. Very slow service
Music was too loud
Fantastic Local Gastro Pub with incredivble local music and Food

The food was pretty good, but the noise level in the restaurant was very high even before the music began. Once the band started playing, we could not talk at all, and one member of our party couldn't even eat. It was really disappointing.

Acoustics of the rooms made for a very loud dining experience. A bit hard to have a conversation or to hear the server—and that was before the band started to play. The apps were the highlight of the meal. Wings and poutine were good portions and perfect for sharing with a party of four. Long waits for drinks, apps, mains, and frustratingly for the check. It was a 2.5 hour experience.

We waited roughly two hours to get our food. In that wait time, our waiter checked in with us once to say our food should be here soon. Once we got our food, it was cold and not well cooked. it was not a good experience, and the staff did little to compensate for that. While I understand there are staffing shortages at the moment, we felt as though the crew could have communicated with us more so we could have understood why we had to wait so long. Overall negative experience.

So disappointing. I’ve been going since first opened, not just that some of my favorite items are gone from the menu but the food was not good. The service was awful took 20 minutes to get an ice tea. Had a reservation to bring family here this coming weekend but I have cancelled it. Too bad.

I am a big fan of F&T, however a tough night.  Our wait person saved the day otherwise may not return.  6:00 reservations and was not busy.  We were seated promptly and drinks came timely, and we ordered a short time after.  We watched a 5 party at the bar (that arrived at the same time) order, received food and left, the table next to us turned once.  The kitchen must have staff issues as the food came out in about an hour, one of our party of 4 received the wrong meal, which got retrieved after a few onion rings were consumed as it looked similar to the correct order.  I received half of my order 10 minutes apart.  I haven’t been here for a while, and it did not seem anything like my past, and many experiences here.
Still a great place, our server was great, just a bit disappointed in what I feel is a 5 star worthy establishment. We all have bad days……
Fantastic!  Love the atmosphere.  Staff was pleasant and food was excellent!

We were very disappointed this time. When we went 3 months ago, it was the best food and services that we have ever had. We love trying new restaurants. But I didn’t want to try a new one on this date night (which we never get, due to kids) I wanted to go to the place that was the best ever!!! Our waiter was clearly new (which was totally fine, he was great) It was the fact that he wasn’t getting any help. Thankfully the man (whom I think was the dishwasher, finally asked us if we wanted bread) Sadly everything I wanted you were out off. Which was fine because my dish turned out great. The one thing I came for was the poutine and it was inedible…. Thankfully it was taken off our bill but I was so sad. It was the best poutine we had ever had. I will be coming back because I think it was just an off night… no way it went from the best food we ever ate to…. I wish we tried a new place tonight instead. So hopefully third time will be better.

Honestly the best thing about this experience was the lovely hostess who was sweet and sympathetic to how loud it was in the restaurant. So I know that they have live music and I have been around this kind of thing all of my life and I'm not an older person so I can hang with the best of them, but there is a difference between concert levels and restaurants with live music levels, the PA system needed to be at least 30% lower to allow for most of the patrons whom were not there for the music to actually be able to have a conversation without screaming. On top of that we were told that the "kitchen works best if you put all of your food in at once" which didn't work for us since we were waiting for our third to get there and we just wanted to order a cheese board while we waited. It took 40 mins to get the cheese board and then another 40 mins to get our food, chicken wings and salads. So it was a bit of a mess. I have heard great things about the restaurant but I don't know if I'll try it again and like I said I have been around live music in every kind of venue since I was a child since my parents are in the music business and it's too loud if you leave a fairly small restaurant with your ears ringing.

Small band playing was too loud and made dinner conversation impossible.
50 min wait for our meals and food was mediocre.  Will not go back
Outstanding live music venue/ dining experience. The atmosphere is lovely and lively.
Great dining experience. We had salad, flatbread and tacos..all were delicious! Perfect timing of courses too..relaxing and not rushed.
We had the absolute best server and sad to hear that she’s leaving every time we go to the frog and turtle we have exceptional service and the food is always amazing.

Exceptional food and service 
Friendly and helpful staff
Quality ingredients 
Wonderfully prepared food and plated so nicely.
Upscale gastro pub food.
Loved every bit if all of our experiences 
Highly recommend
The donuts were unbelievable great ! I have been talking about them to friends since yesterday !
We ate on the terrace and it was lovely for a birthday brunch!
Love this place normally
The food is very good and the staff is very friendly.
Never disappoints…. Outstanding food quality and friendly service.
The service was slow. The food was great as usual, but it was a super awkward long wait, not just for the food, but even for the drinks.
Food was great and staff was really friendly.
The Frog and Turtle NEVER disappoints! 5 stars every time. Impeccable service, and fresh, delicious food.
Sat upstairs and watched the sunset. Wait staff and bartender were outstanding as was the food!

the Frog and Turtle is always great. However last nights meal was outstanding.

the bartender went out of his way to make my wife a cocktail that they had on the menu several years ago.

The waitstaff was more than outstanding, very pleasant, very knowledgeable about the menu

I had an amazing birthday celebration! Thank you!
Maureen McGrath
Food was amazing, service was on point from Peter at the bar. We talked about our meal all weekend long.

The band was very good entertainment but loud for a dinner venue. I would move the band to the back room or upstairs really..it is lovely up there and more room to dance party atmosphere. 
The food is excellent..but some items are over priced..the Brussels sprouts should be $10 and they were $16 for just an appetizer. I had the seafood crepe which was excellent except for the fact it was suppose to have scallops and there were none in it. The seafood chowder is loaded..really good. 
There were few options for gluten free.
The food was fantastic and the waitress was amazing. Loved the music!
We had a delicious meal at the Frog and Turtle.  The food was very fresh and we enjoyed every bite.  Only negative was we had to wait an hour for our order.  Atmosphere fun and lively!
Food and service were excellent!  We will be back and look forward to the outdoor dining experience!

Great food & great service! They warn you in advance that the entrees will take a little while to get out, but we ordered appetizers & drinks and they came out real quick. Seasonal menu was awesome and everyone at my table was satisfied.

FYI the creme brulee is HUGE. Would recommend.

Loved the renovated open second floor. Will return for the patio in warmer weather. Overall the food was great. My steak benedict was just delicious and cooked perfectly. It was not hot which was a bit disappointing. I was not happy with our server.  He was not welcoming- not particularly attentive- never told us about specials (we overheard him at another table). Not sure why that was the case. We will see what happens next time.
Love the food
Live music by The Groove Kings! Great night, great food and drinks, wonderful crowd!
We were there to see a band and everything was awesome! Especially our server Brie!!

Everything about the evening at the Frog and Turtle was fantastic. The mussels and the seafood crows were yummy. The service was attentive.  The Groove Kings were amazing, especially the saxophonist!    It was a bit loud for me but I loved it anyway.  Great atmosphere.  We will be back!
The food was just plain delicious.  The presentation was great. In short it is one of the best resto's around.    I have never had a bad experience at The Frog and Turtle
For my first time visit it was overall quite good. The food was delicious. Have you tried their donuts? TO DIE FOR!!!
This brunch never disappoints! Great service and drinks, too!

The Frog and Turtle is one of my favorite places to gather with friends and enjoy a fabulous evening. The food, the service and the ambiance are all exceptionally amazing. The music is always awesome and at this visit we happened to be well acquainted with the band, which made the evening even better. It was a reunion of Westbrook friends and the place was absolutely rocking! Special thanks to the owner of this fine restaurant, James, who always goes out of his way to accommodate us and ensures us of an excellent experience. Five stars all the way!
Another wonderful meal.  Our server was so nice and accommodating. Best service I have received in a long time.  Give her a raise!
Great food, Great Service, Great Music! We'll be back for sure!
Great burgers and beer and loved the music!!
Very good service , the food was average and a bit spicy. The drinks were expensive.
As always, amazing food, and great staff
The food was great, and the made to order donuts were phenomenal! Wait staff was very friendly as well!!
It was nice the food was good. Love the mimosas
Cool atmosphere, amazing food and drinks! Service was awesome, already booked our next reservation!
Overall pleasant first experience. Will try again

I typically love it here. It has been a favored place to go with a guarantee of good food and good service. This particular visit included good food but the service was terrible. We waited 25 minutes before our waiter came to the table. He did apologize. We have both worked in restaurants and understand that everyone has a night. However, we ended up waiting almost 30 minutes for our food, 15 minutes when we asked for a refill on drinks, and 30 minutes for our check. I had to get up and go to the bar to ask for the check. He walked by us at least 5 times during all of this and did not say anything. Again, I have done this work before and know people have days like this. I also know that explaining that to people and acknowledging their experience can be very helpful.

This was our first time there, and I’ve heard such great things, so I’m not sure if it was just an off day, but we watched the tables around us arrive, get their food, and leave while we waited for our food. It doesn’t take an hour to poach eggs and toast English muffins. Pretty disappointing.
The service and the food were excellent.  The atmosphere is casual and we weren't rushed. It was a totally enjoyable experience.
Great food. Good service.
Always love your fish and chips! The bar tender was great! Made our martini just the way we like it.
St Pattys Day band of course there was noise. Food as always was amazing. New server, but she did great by the end!
Excellent food and service, quaint quiet but festive atmosphere. Great place for a first date!
Birthday Brunch was amazing! My friends had never been there for brunch, if at all. They loved it!

Breakfast two weekends in a row ! Excellent!
Donuts are amazing and large portions!!
The food here is always delicious, the staff is stellar, and the overall feel of the restaurant is very cozy/welcoming!

It was a busy (energetic) brunch and every staff member kept a smile on their face, helped each other and interacted with our table in a great way!  The food was great as always.. and those donuts are out of this world!!
Food was delicious and the donuts are amazing!!!
Our server Bri was fantastic, we really enjoyed her and there was a great band as well.
Food very good.....although it was very noisy.....looking forward to upstairs outside this summer.....great location easy parking and lovely interior.

We sat upstairs so we could have conversation and less noise. The bartender was our server who did an excellent job considering he was managing the bar and
 several tables   Food was excellent great time overall!!
Great neighborhood pub. Delicious burgers! Amazing downstairs bartender and yummy drinks.
What an amazing dinner. We loved how fresh and delicious our food was. The staff were all extremely attentive and courteous. Definitely will return in the future.
Best chowder I’ve ever tasted 👍highly recommended

My Shepard’s Pie crepe was very good. My fella got the filet and he said it was just “ok”. As someone that orders filets routinely, he felt the cut wasn’t great- tasted more like a sirloin. We would come back again to try other meals but would not order the filet again.
Excellent dinner upstairs at the bar. Bartender was great the food was fantastic. Love the atmosphere upstairs.

We are long time fans and customers of the Frog and Turtle. We find the food always interesting. However, it may be time for them to think about the layout of the restaurant and what is serving what purpose. For example, we were there for a nice dinner, we were on the first floor where a very loud band was playing feet away and we could not hear ourselves talk. Additionally, the service was VERY slow, we were there for nearly 3 hours. We get that orders are hand-made and a wait is expected, but it seemed excessive. Our waitress was fun and lively and she did her best. I worry about how many tips these folks can get if the tables are not even turning over.
Maybe the music and pub food could go upstairs? and quiet dining downstairs? or vice versa? just a thought!
love the place, always, but seems a little identity confused.
When we first arrived music was very loud. Other diners asked to lower and staff quickly addressed. Brie, our waitress was very attentive accommodating, and friendly.
Best food and people
Great service, amazing food, and a wonderful experience.  Plan a dinner there to relax and enjoy the evening!
The only brunch that comes close is the Four Seasons!!  Love this place!!!
Always great fiord, great service and great entertainment!

Amazing! Excellent service, our food was exceptional! We felt cared for and cannot wait to go back! We had salads with grilled salmon added and some nice wine, brussel sprouts, simply perfect. Our server was attentive and professional.

Great atmosphere, great food!!  
My favorite place ever!!
Everything was wonderful!!

First time there..won't  be the last
Drinks,appetizers entrees and dessert  all were excellent. Wait staff cordial and very efficient. Would highly recommend to all.
Been here more than a dozen times, the food and service is always fantastic.

Bree, our server and only server, was 5 star. Once band started it was impossible to have conversation. I was told that I had to wash my hands before I could be seated. Interesting, as this was not happening with other patrons,  and no one who worked there was wearing a mask. Food delicious. Bree really was a superstar, attentive and pleasant

We were out celebrating my girlfriends birthday, and everything was great! One thing was different than advertised though, there a great band there at 7:00, but it was supposed to be a blues band. It ended up being Jerks of Grass, a bluegrass band. They were really great, but was hoping for the blues band. The food was good, especially the seafood chowder! We will return!

Overall very good. Server was excellent and very attentive. Donuts were fabulous with excellent selection of very tasty fillings and toppings! Chicken filling for omelet was subpar with several bones which was a huge turnoff and resulted in meal being returned. Also too much salt was used in egg dishes as well as house made chorizo which diminished the overall meal
Food was excellent, great drink options. Easy parking in the back
Fantastic food, brews and people! It gets busy so recommend reservations.

Since it was the evening of Jan. 1, and the previous New Year's Eve was on a Friday, we had no expectations.  We had a sitter for our kids, and just wanted to get out!  We were both very impressed with the service we received at the Frog & Turtle.  The staff must have been exhausted, but that didn't stop them from providing good drinks, excellent service, and awesome music (Juke Joint Devils)!

Our Server was extraordinary!  Crepes delicious….as always.  And your Parmesan and bacon salad is my absolute favorite.  Thank you, We’ll be back!!

Beth and Bill

Definitely not what I expected. We haven’t visited the Frog and Turtle since their renovation and we had a reservation for our anniversary . We were seated upstairs which is very different from the ground floor. Sports bar atmosphere. Watched the waitress have a 20 minute conversation with table next door while we waited for service. The food was excellent but expensive for the setting and service. Probably won’t be going back😞

So great! Roasted cauliflower dip with baguette, fish and chips, gnocchi!
Sage infused vodka, Eric is the bEST bartender!
Love F and T!
Atmosphere, service & food was great, wecwill be back for sure.

Overall, a good experience. I was a little disappointed because I booked a reservation specifically so we could listen to the band that was playing but we were actually seated upstairs so we weren’t able to listen. Food was good, entrees were a little heavy-handed on the black pepper. Drinks were good as always, we love the special cocktails.
Outstanding food from start to finish. The best meal i have had out in a long time, will be back soon

We did not have a great experience that we were looking forward to.
It started off great. Ambience warm and cozy.
We ordered appetizers which we very delicious. Then it went downhill from there.
Our reservation was at 6. At 7:30  we still did not have our food. Apologies, and then finally 3 out of 4 meals arrived.  The other meal never got cooked. Other apologies. A salad and free meal. But everyone else was finished eating when the 4th meal arrived.   Drinks were removed from the tab. Waitress was a bit cocky. The person who came to tell us about the meal not being cooked was sincere.
The music started as we were starting to eat. SO LOUD YOU COULD NOT HEAR YOURSELVES TALK. SO WE DID NOT TALK AFTER THAT. Very disappointing.
One of our dishes was undercooked and although they brought out a new meal this took a while and was not informed this was being done. Just would of liked to know

Christmas gathering with my golf partners and spouses. Awesome evening. The food was delicious and our server was tremendous. The charcuterie board was one of the best I have ever had, in fact the sous chef even delivered and described the entire board!
Sat upstairs 1st time … very nice.  Food  excellent as  always
Wonderful as always.
Outstanding experience. Our first time dining upstairs. Everything was over the top. The fireplace was perfect on a co a cold winter's evening.

The restaurant was decorated beautifully for the holidays. We sat upstairs where there was 1 hard working gentleman mixing drinks at the bar and waiting on tables.  We left him a great tip because he was working so hard . My dish of meatloaf and Mac and cheese was delicious. My husband ordered the pasta which was overcooked.

First time at Local 188 and would highly recommend.  Started with a bottle of Montana Rioja, surprisingly good for the price, the deviled eggs, and the jamon y manchego.  Both apps were strong, the latter was really excellent.  Ordered teh gnocchi and the risotto, which had a somewhat similar flavor but very good.  Finished with the cheesecake and some espresso and cappuccino.  Service was excellent, price was reasonable enough.
Great people.  Excellent choices of beverages.  Great food .   Wei will go back again
Wonderful food, service and drink list. We would highly recommend!
Local 188 is a gem! We visit this restaurant every year when on vacation in Maine. Great food and it’s reasonably priced.

This is our favorite restaurant in Portland. The food is outstanding, the service is very friendly and prompt, the portions ample and the place is fun. There is free parking in the back so no typical Portland hassles with your car.
Always delicious with an array of options for everyone.

Local 188 is celebrating 25 years. There are a lot of reasons why this restaurant has that type of staying power in a Portland market where restaurants come and go. The ambiance with the owner's own eclectic art collection on the wall celebrating 25 years. The manager checking on us, the wait staff, and the unbelievably dishes. Delicious bread, appetizers, and entrees. This place just moved to our favorites list.

Cocktails were sub par. Never had a totally flat Aperol spritz. And I think they didn’t know what a Negroni was. Ham and cheese app was the best thing. Shrimp were way overcooked and there was no bread with the mussels. Our server was nice a efficient

We enjoy our periodic visits to Local 188. The food and drinks are very tasty. Nothing is inexpensive anymore but the prices seem reasonable for the quality. We enjoyed everything we had: the seared tuna, cauliflower, the chocolate torte. Our server was great and we appreciated that the chef came by at the end of the evening.

We are summer residents who eat here often. The food is outstanding, the service friendly and the prices for Portland are reasonable. There is also ample parking so why go to the Old Port when this wonderful restaurant is so accessible.

Had a super nice Friday evening dinner. We shared the deviled eggs and the octopus, which was the chef special. I had gnocchi and my wife had mussels and a very nice salad. The service was great and everyone was very nice.
Ordered the cauliflower, pork bellies, tuna and a special that evening of grilled octopus. Everything was perfectly cooked, bursting with flavor and beautifully presented.
This is one of out favorite restaurants in Portland, ME, but things got a bit weird with our last visit.
Had a wonderful visit chose outdoor seating. The inside looked amazing as well service food, and drinks on point.
Wonderful food, service, and atmosphere!  Highly suggest giving it a try!!

We had a great meal, albeit a bit over priced and lackluster. My steak was unevenly cooked but ok. Scallops… 3? We would try again, probably. Miss the chicken livers! Loud as hell in there. The wait staff was 5 star all the way. Awesome people!

Imaginative, delicious food. We chose from the small plates and focused on seafood, because we wanted a more tapas-like meal. I especially appreciated the local scallops, which had that unique fresh sweetness and which was paired with warm spices and contrasting herbs. The grilled octopus was also tender with a crispy exterior, and the grilled shrimp with pickled onion and chimichurri were fantastic. One note: if you plan to share, do ask about how many pieces there are per plate, because it varies. The wine selection is terrific and less per glass than most places in the same category. 
Service was efficient and friendly, and I love the space (the comfy corner pillows are a big plus). It has a lively feel without being loud. We hadn't been to Local 188 in ages, and now I'm wondering what kept us away. We'll be back again soon.

We initially booked this restaurant due to its proximity to a Jazz venue.  We are so happy we chose this gem.  The decor is very chic  fun and relaxing, and the staff are very attentive.  The cocktails were made with care and reasonably priced.

Let’s talk about the food…outstanding!  We opted for tapas style dining and it did not disappoint.  Every dish was excellent, even the mussels were prepared with love (and yummy capers), be sure to order some of their delicious bread to sop up all the yummy broth. The tuna crudo special was indeed a special treat, and indeed a highlight.

This restaurant turned out to be a gem and we will definitely be back!
Awesome entres and super service. Definitely would recommend.

The menu was varied and interesting. The tapas selection was fun and unexpected. The paella was overcooked by about 4 minutes..the rice being a bit brittle and the shellfish dried out. The steak was delicious!The service was good but the waiters on two occasions brought us different wine selections than we had indicated, one we corrected and pointed out the mistake, the other we were told was one thing but on the bill it was listed as something else. So the bartender or the server or both made some mistakes.
We all had a great time. Great food and service   What’s not to like
Just a lovely, quiet meal with wonderful food. And parking right out back. Not a small thing to consider in Portland these days.

Horrible waitress. We were there for 2.5 hours for dinner, and not by our choice. After ordering apps she never came back for us to order main course, had to flag her down. We didn’t order the paella we went there for as it had 45 minute cook time and we were over an hour into our experience without being able to order or main course. We sat there for long periods of time with no drinks, water, or food in front of us throughout the meal. Eventually when we had finished and the waitress brought the check… she never returned to run the card through. I had to find someone else to do it. Additionally, at one point someone came over to clear away dirty plates and started to clear our full drinks and gave us attitude when we asked to finish them. Garbage service, food was average, not worth the overpriced bill.

What a gem this place is! We've visited twice now and each time have had a different item on their menu so we can try out unique offerings. The portion sizes are pleasing but not overly stuffing, the cuisine is exceptionally well done and not anything like we've had at other places, and the service is just as awesome as the artsy space they've created here. The wait staff is fun and vibrant with a modern vibe, quick and responsive service with a genuine smile.

Be prepared to spend about $60-75/pp plus tip depending on your appetite and drink choices. HOWEVER, make yourself aware that there is free parking located in the back parking lot for the restaurant. We hunted high and low for a street spot the first time we went, not realizing this!
Great food; great space; great service - a really good New Year's Eve event for us

I’m a little bummed we were not made aware of the menu changes. While I am willing to try just about anything, I do have friends that wanted specific menu items. Holidays are hard eating at restaurants because you never know what changes will be made to the menu due to the traffic, I just wish it was advertised.

Drinks were inconsistent, one drink served in a small glass jar, ordered a second of the same drink that came out in a glass twice the size, same price for both?

Service wasnt great - again understanding of it being a holiday and staffing issues, but for what we spent the food and service could have been better. Bummed because the vibe is everything you could ask for.

I was delighted to return to Local 188 and again have a near-divine course of their Seafood Paella.  It was just as incredibly savory and delicious as the first time.  Love their cocktail menu and mix of tapas style appetizers.  The other diners in my party loved the risotto.  Although the restaurant is dimly lit, as most restaurants are these days for dinner, the space between different dining table was generous. Kudus also for providing great value for a tasty varied menu.
Loved everything about our experience. Food was exceptional. will definitely return the next chance we get!

We are fans of Local 188. This dining experience was only good, not great. We had a later reservation because we had to drive from a distance to arrive in Portland. We love the small and changing menu, but we were disappointed that many of the menu items were sold out for the evening. When we expressed this, the staff suggested we come earlier. We would have it we could have-it would have felt a little better if there was some empathy. The quality of the food we did have was very good, and we will dine there again. But note if you are dining at 8:00pm, you take your chance to not have items available on the menu.
Not sure why this isn't ranked higher! Great experience and food!!

The server was lovely but she could use a bit of training. Having worked in several restaurants over the years, these are somethings I would share with her: never scrape food in front of a customer. Never ask if we want dessert when we are not finished our meal. Always bring extra plates if we are sharing a meal. Always bring 2 steak knives even if we are sharing one steak.  Other than that, great food, comfortable room.
One of our local favorites in Portland! Never disappoints.
Excellent restaurant with parking in the back.  Will frequent whenever I'm in Portland.

Went to Local 188 for dinner as we usually go there for breakfast/brunch on a weekend and truly enjoyed it! Cocktails, service and food were all perfect. Easy parking, nice atmosphere made for a perfect evening.

Love this restaurant!  The portions are varied and appropriate for sharing.  They worked well with my dairy allergy and I still had wonderful choices and tasty food.  I will continue to be a repeat customer!

Everything was fine, though prices were rather higher than the last time I was there.  I suppose that's par for the restaurant biz these days.  Portions were modest but tasty.  The only real kink was our waiter, who seemed to forget about us on several occasions.  We waited a while to place our drink orders before the meal.  Then it took some time to have them delivered.  When we were finished our dinner, we asked for the check and told him we were on our way to a play so didn't have time for a dessert.  We had to go find him eventually to get the bill, as we were running out of time.  Oh well.  A newbie, perhaps.
Very slow bar service was somewhat disruptive of the meal.
Apps hit the table before the bottle of wine we ordered. We waited 40 minutes for a bottle of wine and the table next to us got theirs before us, despite sitting after. Nothing was comped.

It took 10 minutes for a server to come to our table even though we were in the middle of the restaurant and staff walked past us constantly.

Once a server came, she notified us that they were out of two items on the menu already, at 7:30 on a Thursday night. My partner ordered a beer, and the server apologized and said they were out of it.

We finally managed to get drinks and a couple of appetizers. One of the appetizers was tasteless, literally. Just bland nothing. And when the server came back to get our entree order, my partner's first choice was also now out.

We paid the bill and left.

Been to Local 188 a couple of times. Dinner last night was just okay.. 

Pros: 
-The atmosphere is great. Dim lighting, eclectic decor, cozy vibe, and it's always busy making it a great place for any occasion, ambiance-wise. 
-Great cocktails, beer and wine selection.
-Servers are pleasant

Cons:
-I wasn't impressed with the menu. We ended up ordering four things to share of which two were good and two were not - The sour dough bread was undercooked and the beef skewers were overdone and not great. The shishito peppers were delicious and the market salad was great.
-Our waiter was very nice and pretty attentive, however it was very obvious that the food runners had no clue what they were doing. Our salad came out before our drinks, which I think I can confidently say is the first time I've ever been served food before a drink. The woman who brought out our shishito peppers asked us if we ordered green beans to which we replied no and watched her walk around asking all the tables around us if it was theirs with a dumbfounded look on her face... Finally I flagged her over and asked if it was shishito peppers. Our beef skewers came out after we asked for the check. The entire night I watched as multiple tables around us were brought the wrong dishes...

Overall I'd say I probably won't be back and will instead when I come to Portland try to book dinner reservations earlier at a more reputable place so that I can get in!
Just an impeccable vibe. Which is the reason I met my now-wife here for our first date 5 years ago. We love to come back to celebrate because we know the booze and food won't disappoint.

I found Local 188 on Open Table after looking for a restaurant in Portland, as I was in town for a wedding. I was delighted and impressed with the service and quality of food, creative flavors and the ambiance. The restaurant is eclectic and charming all around. The staff were attentive and friendly. The cocktails were spectacular, especially the Ruby Honey Jam. I got the gnocchi, which left me wanting more.
Late dinner on a Wednesday.  Server was helpful in guiding our choices. We enjoyed red sangria and a variety of dishes. The shrimp and garlic was a favorite.

We haven’t been to local 188 in years and after this experience we won’t ever be back. Waaaaaaay overpriced for portions that are insanely small. If the goal is to represent Spanish tapas / options, they’ve missed the mark completely. Not a single person in our group enjoyed their experience. We ended up at a different restaurant to eat actual food & even people there were like, “yea it’s gone downhill”. We used to love the food here & we’re all so disappointed.
Great spot.  Loved the choices of the little plates of food.  It was great to to have so many options.
We make a point to go here on our one nite in town every year.  Great food and bevis.
Tasty food (tapas style for the most part) and excellent service. Would definitely return.
Excellent and friendly service, absolutely delicious food in an artsy, comfortable and unique atmosphere.

I'm a "repeat" diner. The extensive wine selection excites me! I didn't count the whites and reds but I'd estimate at least 40 choices from all over the globe. We had the option for al fresco - and the summer evening was warm and perfect! The traffic (both foot and road) was not intrusive. Our server was knowledgable about the wines and the dishes. He helped us choose smaller tapas dishes and a larger dish to share. The amount and diversity of foods was perfect. We even had dessert. I was in the mood for chocolate and they had the perfect torte. We will return!

Our family of 6 made a last minute reservation here last Saturday at 5pm since there were no others with availability. We were nicely greeted and seated upon arrival. I recommend you order the beef pinchos, spicy or regular margaritas and the seafood paella. The beef pinchos were so good that we ordered 2 more. The paella takes 30mins so you might want to order it with the drinks. We also ordered the shrimp pinchos, patatas bravas, scallop ceviche and the seared octopus. The tapas are on the smaller side but we were full with what we ordered. For dessert we ordered the flan and the flourless chocolate orange torte, wow these were amazing.

Great service and delicious food, won’t disappoint!

Disappointed in food. Shrimp was undercooked and octopus was over cooked. Flavors and freshness just ok. Service was sub par. Expensive for what you get and not comparable to other great Portland restaurants. I would not return.

The food was good, but for what it was, it’s very over priced. Also, they don’t do a standard wine pour, it was much less than you would get at any other restaurant. It was good, but the value isn’t there, I won’t be back.

Service was terrific, wine list is very limited, food was delicious, diners all seem to want to make sure that every other table hears their conversation so it's very loud, but let me emphasize that the hostess and the waitress were awesome, the owner/manager went around politely asking if everything was good...the service was very attentive, excellent, made you feel welcome.  Many restaurants in Portland have gone from average menus to tiny ones, but at this one, the menu is long, varied, and the food perfectly prepared.  They really excel at the sauces.
Second time in. Food was average as it was first time. Won’t be back.

I went to this restaurant twice once I had dinner , it was unimpressive, staff did not care much.
Second time several months later, last week I booked through OpenTable table 8:45 pm, when we arrived at the restaurant we were told kitchen was closing at 9 pm and only the very limited Tapas menu was available.  I would have thought if they cared to offer reservations via open table they would let customers know that full dinner menu would not be available or not take reservation when they are about to close. And as always, the staff couldn’t care less. Never again!
Phenomenal food and great service! Would love to come back the next time I’m in town!

Thoughtfully created tapas with excellent service. The ambiance was elegant but cozy and each dish felt special. The scallop ceviche was vibrant and perfect for summer. This will be our new neighborhood date night spot.

Food as always unique, very good, well proportioned and fresh. Staff very accommodating and communicative. Vey good choices for wine and beer. Same for cocktails but! Cocktails were slow in coming and far too much ice. Thanks J
Local 188 is reliable, fun and delicious. Get the paella.
The paella was over the top! And we loved all of the 10 dishes we ordered. Eclectic, creative and fun.
Overpriced, bland, awful waste of time and money.
The atmosphere was fine. The service pretty good. The food decidedly mediocre and too salty. Not the first time with over salted food.
Atmosphere was great! Cozy, interesting and great art.
Nice ambiance, delicious cocktails. Disappointing in terms of portion size relative to price & quality.
Great food and service. It is a plane that seemed like it should be busy bit wasn't. It was a Sunday, but a holiday weekend so it may have been abnormal

Local 188 is my go to because it has a little something for everyone. The food is always precisely prepared with quality ingredients, and offered at varied price levels. There are refrescos from the bar for every taste. The atmosphere is immediately welcoming and cozy. The staff are attentive and warm. Just a sure bet to put folks at ease and enjoy their evening together.

Absolutely amazing! If you're looking for something other than the standard fare of lobster rolls, this is the place to go. It's quaint with exceptionL service.  Lite fare and delicious wine, just perfect for my Mother's Day brunch.  It's worth the short trip off the freeway.
We had a great meal with excellent service! The energy and noise level were just right. Not too loud but still lively.
The service was very slow, non attentive.  Not sure if she was having an off night or what.  Food was above average.  I always like the atmosphere and vibe there.
Great experience with friends! Everyone was impressed by the food, ambiance, and service.
As always, Local 188 has delicious food, warm and efficient service and great cocktails.
Fantastic all around. Love this place. Tapas and other larger plates. Cozy vibe, great drinks. Lovely server.

Service was exceedingly slow, and for what you get I would say the value is poor.  It is also very loud inside.   It was $7 or $8 for bread.  I  understand the concept of tapas and I don't mind paying a lot for small portions if the food is amazing.   The food was average though.  Been to a lot of restaurants in Portland and I think you have a lot better choices.  It's obviously one of the "go to" trendy restaurants, as it was packed, but I'm calling an "emperor has no clothes on" moment here.
Outstanding, as always.  Creative and interesting menu, deliciously delivered!
The best meal I’ve had in a long time. It was hard not to lick the plates.
Very good food. Only had one bartender working which backed up service. Everyone was having fun.
Four of us all enjoyed dinner.  We got to share many plates... it was fun.  We've had many brunches here but first dinner in a LONG time.  Forgot how much I like it!
We moved our reservation up and they were more than accommodating. We really enjoyed being at the chefs table and watching all the action. Wonderful night!
Glad the livers are back. Please bring the meatballs back. Always love coming here!

The food, drinks , and service was amazing and what was really nice was the chef coming around and checking on how the food was really nice touch can’t wait to go back also they have parking in the back which for portland is a real great thing
Favorite restaurant in Portland!! Always Fantastic.
Lovely experience, excellent service. Perfect food and a great vibe. Thank you.
Food was good but a little bland, Especially the risotto. Food was way overpriced. 3 clams for $33 is ridiculous..

Good ambience, but the tapas weren’t worth the price. I’ve had less expensive tapas that were much more innovative, complex, and flavorful. Our bread was deeply burnt on one of the dishes. Okay service, they were just really busy.
Wait staff was very nice and friendly. Food was average-
The prices for the food are outrageous beyond comprehension, esp for food that is not particularly inventive or exciting. No one should be charging 31 dollars for risotto. Will not eat here again.
Very slow bar and dinner service. All but one items (mussels) were a very small portion for the price. Would not go back.
Bills itself as a Spanish restaurant but the decor is more bohemian.  Tapas was good, but main course, $50.00 Paella was over cooked.  Servers were nice an attentive.
The server didn’t listen.

This was not only the best Spanish food I've ever eaten in the USA, but one of the best restaurants I've ever eaten in my life. The service was incredible, the atmosphere was wonderful, the food was life changing. Great wine and dessert menu as well.
Great service, drinks and food were incredible!

Last time we were there was preCovid.  They no longer have  a happy hour. An entrée that we used to get has increased to $50 from $30.
We won’t be back. Too pricey.

Mussels were served lukewarm, broth was not a good, small mussels.
Chicken livers were AMAZING!!
Wine selection was excellent.
We had not been there in several years and found it just as charming as we always had! Food is interesting and very tasty and small plates (our favorites) quite generous. We will be back again soon!

Local 188 was a delectable dinner spot! My sister and I were visiting for the first time and heard great things about this spot. It did NOT disappoint. Best mussels and gnocchi I’ve ever had! The service was fantastic. Ambiance was fantastic. Would gladly eat there again.
Server was awful, spent more time talking in the open kitchen than tending tables.

Our waitress was very attentive but very inexperienced. The appetizers were delicious, on the small side for the price and the entrees are ridiculously expensive for what you get. The best value is the dessert.

Absolutely love this place.  We'd only been here for dinner once before but it might be our new favorite.  We love the changing menu, especially the Risotto and the Broccoli soup, absolutely delicious.  I wish we could of remembered our servers name.  She was a delight!!  We will definitely be back.
予想以上に良いお店でした。メニューも高価ではなくておすすめ出来ます。またスタッフも心地良い対応に感謝です
steak and gnocci mediocre, overpriced. very disappointed .
Local 188 has great ambience and great service. The food was excellent! I do feel like the portions could have been larger, and that the prices were a bit high.
A bit off tonight. Service was slow and spotty. Food not at the level we expect from them. A bit disappointed

This restaurant surprised us in so many positive ways.  Our waitress was very helpful with recommendations and had a great personality.  The food was terrific and a very good value.  Nice atmosphere.  Will definitely return.  Soon, I believe!
Everything we had was delicious and well prepared.
My husband and I love the food and atmosphere! The staff is always attentive and friendly. The food is delicious and desserts even more so.
The seafood paella is delicious savory goodness served perfectly for sharing. Comida fantastica!
Very good food with fast, friendly service.
Outstanding service, fun and interesting menu options. Great downtown location but tricky finding parking. We will return!

The food was good but quite expensive for the portion sizes. The scallop ceviche was at most one scallop sliced thinly and overly seasoned. I do not need large portions but for $17 I expected more than one small scallop.

Great ambience and ‘open’ design. 
Good food as we had anticipated . Felt back in Spain for some of the tapas!

Delicious, well-considered and presented dishes, not overly fanciful.  Fresh ingredients, superb flavor.  Excellent and knowledgeable service.  We were offered a tasting of a few wines before making a final selection. Noise level was acceptable for the 4 of us to easily converse.  We ordered a mix of raciones and tapas, a bottle of wine, plus tax and tip brought us to just over $200.  Bonus:  there is ample parking behind the restaurant.
Wonderful food, service and ambiance but $17 for 3 bites of scallop ceviche was ASTRONOMICAL!!
Great food and great service. Was a little bit hot in the restaurant but it was one of the hottest days of summer. Will definitely be back!

Fantastic, as always.
Amazing food & service.
Nice ambience, good service.  Food was fine but very small portions (even for a main course) and expensive.

Just arrived in Portland for our annual summer visit & returned to Local 188. Thankfully it’s still as great as ever. I had the scallops & spouse had the chicken. Both were delicious. We couldn’t decide between 2 desserts so got both: the chocolate torte & fresh berry cobbler. Wonderful!

This was our first visit post pandemic and Local 188 is not the same place.  The food was mediocre and borderline unsafe - far from the interesting Spanish-influenced dishes that we loved.  They served raw (cold) kafka as an app,  and when we pointed it out, we were met with disbelief and an offer to 'warm it up' if we wanted - this was not tartar, but a closer to a raw meatball on a stick.  They did replace and recook the dish, but did not offer apologies and charged full price.   For our main course we split the wasabi coated scallops - that were overcooked, did not have any wasabi on them and portion-wise was smaller than the appetizers - four defrosted very small rubbery salty scallops.  

Very disappointing and we should have gone across the street for a senora dog and a marg.
Cool vibe.  Limited but dynamic menu with great locally sourced options.
We are discovering all the great food places in Portland. This is our latest venture.

I ordered the tuna I was not impressed, I couldn’t even cut it with a knife, there was so much gristle . Unfortunately, I will not be returning in the near future. My husbands steak was tasteful but also had a lot of fat.
The cocktails were great, the food was disappointing for the price.
First time there. Food and service was good. Menu is very limited. Dishes are definitely per person.

Local 188 was recommended by a friend and we loved it. A little off the beaten path from where we were staying in the old port area but well worth the 15 minute walk. Food and service were great, a great variety of options that will have us coming back the next time we are in there area!
Overall the food was delicious, atmosphere was superb.  We ordered the the tuna which was over cooked, everything else was delish!!! Great service and great cocktails.
Awesome experience. Always a pleasure to dine here…
Had olives and bread for an app.. the bread and butter were delicious!! Shared the paella dish, excellent!! Highly recommend!!
First time visit.  Food and service were excellent.  Will be repeat customers without a doubt!

we ordered drinks and appetizers. The meatballs came out before we even got our drinks. My husband was extremely upset by this and got up and left. We had to cancel the remaining appetizers and then my drink which I never received. The chef came out and comped what we had gotten. Meatballs and a drink is all.
Ate at the counter overlooking the kitchen - service was spot and the food was some of the best we had in Portland.  Highly recommend.

Menu is normally small and was even smaller as they were out of a few items.
Several of the plates have a broth base where you would like to have some bread to slop up the broth and they were out of bread.  Out of bread at 7:30 on a Wednesday night?
Awesome muscles, great service (really), a little pricy
Wow. Just go and experience yourself. You won’t be disappointed I promise.
Lots of flavors and unusual combinations!  Very helpful and sensitive to food allergies.

Disappointing experience 
Service though efficient was very unfriendly
We had the barest cheese & charcuterie board I have ever seen.  What was there was good, but geez
Our party had some food restrictions. The staff and kitchen could not have been nicer or more accommodating.
We were last @ Local 188 when we visited in 2018. It did not disappoint.
1st time back in 2 years! Good table spacing and food excellent as always.

Food and drinks were great. Arrived in a timely manner.
Our waitress, Sage, was awesome! We were a party of 7 and stayed for a number of hours. Never felt rushed, very accommodating.
Good happy hour drinks and tapas.
mother’s day dinner.. very underwhelming, i mean $6 for bread and butter.. $7 for three deviled eggs.. got the paella, they didn’t bother to season the fish in the paella.
Small plates and entrees were delicious and great service!

Ate dinner before a concert, outdoors on the sidewalk patio. 
Delightful server, Sean 
Good vegetarian options. 
The seafood paella was devoured by 2 of our party
Everything was delicious.

We were in before the TTB concert. The service was excellent- Sage was our server. The gnocchi was suberb as were the brussels sprouts. The meatballs were good but had a spice flavor we couldn't quite tell what it was. My husband liked the hummus so much we brought the leftovers home and he had some tonight. Thank you everyone. We will be back.

This was our fourth visit to Local 188 in two months and, instead of getting better, each visit has gotten worse. Initially the food and service were excellent two months ago. Our meals were flavorful, and the service was attentive and friendly. 
Our most recent visit was, well, it was awful. The risotto was tasteless. Essentially it was a bowl of rice with very little else. Very disappointing! 
It took quite some time to get a server over to our table and rarely did they reappear. I realize it’s a tough job these days given staffing levels, but the restaurant was not at capacity and there seemed to be ample wait staff to cover the tables. Except ours. 
I had initial high hopes four visits ago, but this past visit was definitely our last.

Noise level was at a good level when we got there- 6:00. When we left- 7:30 it was much louder. It is a very open space, so if you want good energy and a loud place then this is your place. If you want a place for conversation, I would look somewhere else. Food was good!

Really enjoyed our meal - had not been there for a while and was better than remembered.  Nice eclectic setting, good service, fun menu.  Prices have crept up a bit but not too bad - still fair.  Will be back,

The food, as always, was outstanding. We had the homemade bread with honey butter, the Bang Island mussels and a chicken confit risotto. The staff is attentive and friendly, and the ambience has a chill yet upbeat vibe.
We really enjoyed ourselves at Local 188 and would return! Our drinks were excellent and the food was good. Fully recommend at 4 stars.
charcuterie board had no meat except for a cold pastry which had some meat in it. mostly just pickled stuff.  one one medium sized slice of manchego.
One of my favorites! Beat ambiance, friendly staff, delicious food
Food was prepared and presented well. Would have appreciated a few more entrees from which to pick.

Food was excellent, the service is a very good, drinks are very professional.  Only downside is the cost is a little high.  However, I would rather pay a little more for a great meal and go out a little less often.
Excellent seafood paella, rose cocktail with petals on the glass for Valentine's Day, and perfectly dense, moist chocolate torte!
First time to visit local 188 and we can't believe we drove by it so many times. Can't wait to go back!

A perfect “night before” Valentine’s Day dinner for the entire family, which included our 11 year old who especially loved her strip steak, both because of its presentation (on a plank to emphasize her special request) and its seasoning (cooked to a perfect medium rare).  The deviled eggs and Brussel sprouts are superb appetizers; the hake was outstanding as well.  (Great specialty cocktails and an excellent flan for dessert to round out the night, too).  Wonderful service all around.  So glad to be able to enjoy Local 188 again and we’ll return soon!
This place is amazing! The butter and bread is outstanding. We sat at the bar facing the kitchen and the chef even checked in and asked how our food was. Will definitely be back!

Portland’s reputation as a foodie destination is made incisively at Local 188. Sitting at the bar, we had the opportunity to watch a finely honed team of chefs work their magic - turning locally sourced ingredients into delicious tapas treats. The bread and whipped butter was transporting. Did not sample dessert but saw enough behind the scenes to offer a strong recommendation. Add this one to your list of places to go for a delicious dinner with family or friends.
It was our first time there. We had heard good things about it and it was all true.  We look forward to going again.
We had a terrific experience at Local 188, wonderful in every way!
Great spot, warm decor, knowledgeable bartender and waiter. Everyone raved about their dinners. Definitely should check it out. Convenient parking in back once bike shop is closed.
very limited covid menu.
Great service. Limited winter menu but still plenty of tempting items to choose from.
Love local 188! Prices have unfortunately gone up due to inflation, but excellent cocktails and food

Loved the corner booth….thank you! 
Sean and teammates were extremely attentive and very present and timely, always courteous, even when I called him Sam. Thank you for a wonderful night!
Kevin E. Conroy
Portland, ME
Great food, payaya incredible, drinks vibe  and service

We ate at Local 188 last night and it was great.  On a cold night, the inside felt warm and inviting, the drinks were very good and the food was excellent.  We had the swordfish and stuffed quail  entrees and shared a piece of chocolate torte and all were delicious.
