We’ve been to Local 188 a handful of times in the past ten years and this was by far our best experience.  I’m already looking forward to going back!
The food was phenomenal and the service was quick and excellent. Great spot for a relaxed but upbeat night.

Food was fantastic !  My husband enjoyed the hake with kale and butternut squash that he raved about. I enjoyed the veggie chili with shrimp. All fresh and flavorful. Spicy margarita was exceptional. Server was perfect!
Great service and great food. We love the drinks and the food.
Local 188 is our holiday favorite. Looking out onto the lights in Longfellow Square, watching passers-by, sipping a cocktail, and enjoying a delicious dinner. Never feeling rushed. Excellent service.
Great meal wonderful server in nice cozy environment.

We really enjoyed our evening here.  Food was very good, beverages too.  Very nice ambience and attentive service. The place was not crowded, they had plenty of space between tables, and it was quiet enough for conversation.  Good place to visit and catch up with friends.

Our server was outstanding!  She was perfectly attentive, pleasant and accommodating!  Food was spectacular and look forward to coming back. Dedicated parking in rear of building is a plus in the city!

Great addition to the culinary scene - a Spanish restaurant with lots of space and accommodating staff. Food was great, and a plenty of options menu. There is an understated ambience and energy that adds to the overall good time for friends to share dishes and stories.

Wow. Definitely don’t sleep on local 188. It was incredible-food, ambience, kind staff, timing, etc… I am so happy that my friend suggested this place and I look forward to going back here with my family.
Charged 6.00 for bread. Mussel broth was very bland. Paella rice was good but not very much seafood. Steak was alright but to much salt. Very overpriced for what is was, will not return
Great Risotto, great mixed drink made to specification, great Spanish wine selection, and our bar server Jacqueline was warm and professional.  Nice evening.

I've been here several times and always had a great meal and a good atmosphere. This this time however the music  was ACDC, the server was annoyed for no good reason and the food was only mediocre.  But every restaurant gets an off day every once in a while.
Not good food
Excellent service! The scallops were absolutely delicious. Cocktail was yummy too. We will definitely be back!
Wonderful service, meal and drinks.  The "smoke show" was a really nice cocktail.

We are paella fans, and really enjoyed the paella. Plus the apps, including Shishito peppers and deviled eggs.

Very fun atmosphere and decor, casual, great food, Really nice manager and waitstaff, wine pairing was spot-on.

This is fast becoming my favorite place to eat in Portland.
Excellent food eclectic vibe
Excellent food and very good service, except when it came to paying the bill.
As usual - great vibe - great service - amazing food and lovely outdoor experience.

The servers are great. Professional and helpful.  Our plates were all delicious, if a touch small.  

Will be going back soon!!

Superb all around!
Lovely wait staff!
Would definitely return.
Good meal! We had gotten a recommendation from friends and they were right. The paella was excellent. Good service as well.
Bartender Jac created the best drink for us, on the fly!  And the food was terrific.  Chilly & damp outside but the heaters fixed that right up.

My wife and I hadn’t been there in a while but it was always one of our favorite places for date night. This trip the food just didn’t wow us the way it usually does and when you spend $145 with gratuity for two people it should wow. The ambiance and staff were great as usual. I’m sure we’ll go back but we’ll think twice before making it our go to for date night.

Mussels and bread were amazing! Delicious dinner. Lovely waitstaff. Outdoor seating worked out beautifully as we had our dog with us. Staff responded quickly to our request to roll open the awning when a few raindrops passed through.

Location is super neat and staff is friendly! However the food was disappointing. Bread was great but the butter served with it was terrible and then the paella was very disappointing - the shrimp were over cooked, fish was flavorless, and the mussels were burnt and crispy. Also, paella should have a crispy rice bottom, ours did not at all. The flavor of the paella was ok but it was lacking in flavor.
Excellent local tapas
the food was great (especially the shrimp pinchos!) and the staff was super accommodating with our dog who was able to sit with us outside!
Great service;  food. Dealt w a few homeless street people as we ate outside sidewalk side. But that’s somewhat expected in urban area. Overall very good. We love this resturant.
Good food and good service. We sat outside which was very safe but without much ambiance - and a lot of traffic noise. But the restaurant did a nice job and we will definitely return!
This is our fourth visit to Portland. Each and every time we come back to Local 188. It never disappoints.
Our server Kendall was fantastic. Thank you for the only stress free dining out experience we have had in months! Thank you for showing up!

Everything was EXCELLENT! We are visiting from Chicago which is well known for its restaurants, so we were curious as to what a smaller city like Portland has to offer. Local 188 definitely exceeded our expectations. We had the house salad, clams, potato gnocchi, and shrimp pinchos. Between the flavorful meal and the romantic ambience of the restaurant, this will certainly be our first recommendation for friends who visit Portland. Thank you!
Delicious food, great service, cool vibe.
We spend the summers in Portland and love Local 188. The service is great, the staff is super friendly and helpful and the food is wonderful. Also the parking is easy compared to the Old Port.

With the pandemic and beyond personnel are over stretched. But the food was delectable. Very original. Worth it for sure. It is a delightful place. I bought a gift certificate for a friend after enjoying it so much
Very quick drink request for creative cocktails.  Varied menu items stressing local ingredients well prepared and presented.  Neighborhood ambience totally different from tourist venues.

Had some good cocktails & apps for our anniversary dinner. Server was attentive given how busy it was. We sat outside, so noise was Street noise. The mussels were nicely done. The bread was served with honey butter, which was weird with mussels. 

Anyway, I would definitely go back again. The rest of the menu looked really good.
Food at dinner wasn’t great at all. Brunch is much better- solid and very good. Dinner- not impressed. Service was awesome, though.
Nice night outside, enjoyed dinner very much!

We loved Local 188! We vacationed in Portland for a week and came to this cute spot twice and dined in their outdoor patio seating. Their seafood, particularly the mussels, was fresh and delicious, as were our cocktails. A lovely find!
Local 188 never disappoints!
Great food and drinks. Excellent service. Parking around the back makes a huge difference
Outdoor dining  was a positive experience. Two fish dishes were very good.- mussels/ swordfish.
All in all a quite good meal. Most interesting, almost every dish had flavors we did not expect - in a good way. I don't need to eat there every day, but I always enjoy it.
We had the best paella in USA. We have been in Spain several times and for us was like eating a paella there, excellent we love it.

Ordered the seafood paella and steak. The steak was perfectly cooked to medium rare and the paella was enough to feed three. The service was attentive. Although we couldn’t get an outside table and was initially seated at an awkward table very close to the entrance, they were more than agreeable for us moving to the corner banquet table.
Beautiful inside, very nice service. Good for apps and drinks

Local 188 continues to be a favorite of my partner and I.  We are Portland area residents and always marvel at how lucky we are to live in a place with such a vibrant food scene.  On our recent visit, (which admittedly was long overdue from the pandemic hiatus) the tapas and entree dishes we chose were all thoughtful, beautiful, and absolutely delicious. The owner Jay Villani even took time to stop by and ask if we were enjoying our meal.  We’re well aware of the ongoing challenges that Portland area restaurants continue to face due to staffing and supply chain issues.  Congrats to Jay and team for staying the course and continuing to keep our local food scene top notch.  We’ll be back again!
Very nice atmosphere, staff was friendly and helpful.
Lovely venue as usual. Vibrancy as expected for a rainy Thursday night in Portland. Food and service were good.
One of my favorite restaurants. Food was very good, as usual. Lots of noise, sometimes hard to converse. Temperature was pretty cool. Server was a bit pushy.
Great sangria and unique food offerings.  A nice place to spend time grazing on the small plate options.

We were looking for a small eclectic spot away from the craziness of the water front and found it at local 188, it was a little noisy but the food and service was great.  We shared the seafood pialla, it was more than enough for 2, was seasoned wonderfully and had a generous amount of seafood.  We paired it with the red sangria which was great, not too sweet.  This is a great date night location.
Seated on time - off main tourist area therefore noise level is significantly less. Paella was delicious.
Lovely waitress and delicious food!  Great experience with knowledgeable staff
Great food and service. A shout out to Sage, our fantastic server and Jenny the manager. We are here for the summer and will be back often.
Yummy as always!
This is our 4th time here. I love this place for brunch but was underwhelmed by dinner. I want to support local business so will come back assuming this is a post Covid issue.
Sophisticated food superbly prepared, good wine, pleasant place.
Excellent food and great ambiance.  The paella is killer and enough for / people
Food was delicious!  Highly recommend the paella.
Love Local 188, but clearly hurting on staffing and service.

My boyfriend and I were craving a cozy date night and Local 188 did not disappoint! We sat on the patio and Bri took care of us, as well as many other members of the staff. Everyone was so friendly  and accommodating. We are both gin drinkers and started with the Ruby Honey Jam and the Electric Daisy, made with their house-infused gins, they were perfect. We wanted a little bit of everything, so we ordered the mussels, hummus and flatbread, deviled eggs, and gnocchi. The food was delicious and the portions were perfect to share. We resisted the urge to drink the white wine garlic sauce from the mussels and instead soaked it up with the homemade bread and butter. (You’d want to drink it too, it’s that good!) We were too full to have dessert at the restaurant, but decided to take home a flourless chocolate torte and cheesecake with homemade raspberry compote, don’t judge, we came to eat! The desserts were also fabulous, so needless to say our experience was 10/10 and would highly recommend!

Socially distance tables inside and friendly waiters.  The menu is quite small, but the amount served was good.  We had a few tapas, which were very nice.  We don’t usually get dessert, but we did here, and the tres leches was delicious.

The food was good - I was expecting to have more traditional Spanish options having lived in Spain. I was disappointed to not see gazpacho, croquettas, etc. the menu was small but what we did have was pretty good.
The food and service are  alway excellent at local 188.

Food was very good.  We could nitpick, I happen to be a professional chef, but it bordered on great.  Service was a train wreck.  Our server was uninformed about the menu, unhappy about being at work, and unable or unwilling to understand the concept of multiple courses.
Everything we had was great, great food, great service, great ambiance. Love Local 188!
Awesome birthday dinner!
Food was nothing to write home about. Cocktails were tasty, wine list needs some help.
Great ambiance and food for a night out in Portland!
Delicious food, as always! We moved to an inside table because it was windy and the street is noisy. Inside is lovely and well spaced.

I had the steak which was cooked perfectly. It was a bit salty for my taste so I can’t give 5 stars but my husband’s paella was superb. The cocktails are always nice. I’m going to guess it’s about my 15th time here and it’s always a positive experience. It was good to be dining inside again.

Great server!!! Authentically friendly  Sat outside so they have no responsibility for noise level. Mussels and shrimp taco were yummy.  Charcuterie board was not good.  Only one cheese and poor selection of accoutrements. Not nearly worth the price.  
I miss the chicken livers!   
Overall a wonderful experience.

Q
Artic char and fiddlehead ferns were so delicious 🤤.

Indoor ambiance is dreary and wait staff isn’t really interested In Taking care of your needs. Had to ask a couple of times about an allergy then she came around and offered to speak to the kitchen instead of saying, no we can’t. Bloody Mary mix was nasty and my food was cold upon delivery to table so.....there ya go.

Return customers. Love the atmosphere. Opted to sit at bar rather than reserved table. Great fun w cards and cribbage as all were quite busy.. Window view of typical Portland St was extra nice. Wine a little pricey but very good. Jeremiah was tops.   aq

Local 188 is an amazing establishment. Chef Klaus and his crew designed courses that were extremely well prepared, creative, and absolutely delicious. The service was second to none; our waitress was very attentive and pleasant, and made sure we had everything we needed for the best experience possible.
Dined outdoor.  We were on the far end of the tables and got little attention from our server.  Wasn’t terrible but could have been better.  Food was excellent as usual.

We stuck with the shared plates which were all very good. The montaditos were our favorite. The bread, deviled eggs, and shrimp were also very good. The cheese and charcuterie was presented well and, while good, was a little sparse for $18. A little more cheese would have been better. We spaced out the ordering so we didn’t end up with everything at the same time. The staff seemed to work well together, and helped each other out when things started getting busy. We had a few different servers but they communicated and seemed to know what we had ordered and when it would be up. It was a pretty relaxing, good time. I’d go back!
Brunch was excellent.
Easter meal. Food not hot. Server disappeared after order delivered. Disappeared again after check delivered. Waitin and waiting to get out.

Food and service were great!!  Excellent Covid precautions in place. However, our table was right under a speaker and the music they played over the 90 minutes we were there was terrible. Country western, pop, NONE OF IT of a Spanish nature or at all “suttle”. Really made no sense. Light quiet music with little or no vocals would be much more appropriate even if it isn’t Spanish in origin. Awesome experience other than that.

honestly i liked this place! only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 was because we were seated 30 minutes late even though we arrived on time for our reservation
paella was really nice, wish it had crispy rice on the bottom though.. drinks were just ok

I have never had a worse experience than I did on Sunday, March 15th. Five of us arrived at the restaurant after having reservations. One of us was concerned about Covid so we got a table outside. It was raining and upper 30s but since there were outdoor patio heaters, we figured no problem. 

After waiting 10 minutes after being seated and asking to have the heater lit, i went inside to ask if they could light the heaters. I immediately received attitude from Jeremiah, the restaurant manager. I was definitely not rude but I did insist that they light it because it only takes a couple of seconds to do so. He came outside and lit the heater. After five minutes, the heater went out due to no propane. We inquired again to get the heater lit, and the hostess told us that they were out of propane. We weren’t happy but nothing we could do about it. A couple of minutes later Jeremiah came out and brought a new propane tank and we were pretty happy about that. 

As he was installing the tank, he made a comment to me about being super busy and that he didn’t need the attitude from us. I couldn’t believe what I just heard and I am mediately shot back stating that I have been waiting outside for 10 minutes with nobody helping us. He told me that we weren’t waiting for 10 minutes and continued to give me major attitude. I was getting pretty upset by this time and asked him if this is how he talked to his customers. He told me that not only does he have the right to do so but has permission from the restaurant owner. I was furious by this time and said something with an expletive and he said I’m not going serve you. He was being a total dick about the situation and it was something that definitely did not need to escalate the way it did. I will never ever go back to that restaurant and I’m hoping that I get some sort of response here on yelp with an apology and explanation. i’m also going to reach out to the restaurant owner, and let him know how Jeremiah treats customers!
We were a party of four and all did the Maine Restaurant Week tasting menu.  All four courses were great.  The wine pairings were also quite good.
Quick, great food, nice drinks. Service was a bit slow
The restaurant and its staff were excellent and served us with such care and warmth. Loved it and highly recommend the restaurant.
All was good except we could not hear the server.
Great place for any occasion. We enjoyed every moments there!
Potatoes cold, server was overwhelmed, managment should have more worke

The food was fine, really plain. We had brunch and even for breakfast foods I was like ehhhh, I got the home fries and there’s were like 10 pieces of potato. Even local potatoes are like $1 a pound. I have heard their servers are really good so I think we just struck out. She never asked if we wanted more water or coffee until she took our cards to pay. I’ve heard such great things, and was a wee bummed. We were sat in the sun, so for a nice winter Sunday that was great!
Great brunch! Everything was lovely, our server even bought my sister a birthday cocktail.

Wait staff were not engaged at all during dinner. We ordered a charcuterie plate that only had one cheese and one meat and they just dropped it down and left without any explanation as to what was being served.
Local 188 is always a wonderful experience! Food and atmosphere are delightful. A true gem in Portland❤️
The service was top notch; the food delicious; the covid distancing excellent.

The drinks, shrimp skewers, and seafood paella were great. The chocolate flourless torte (or variation thereof) was out of this world — moist and flavorful, so much better than many tortes that can be dry and less flavorful. The menu was limited because of Covid, and we missed the chicken that was in the on-line menu of the morning, and being able to have a full-blown paella with chicken and sausage would also have been good. The service was outstanding — attentive, pleasant, personable — added to the experience. She was a young woman from Oxford Hills who is attending USM. The best.
Amazing as always! Best hollandaise in the world!!
High quality, decent portion sizes, great service and atmosphere. I felt very safe with how the tables were spaced and the staff's attention to detail.
Great room for social distancing...and a fantastic wait staff!!
Our family celebrated Valentine’s Day with brunch. Everything was great!
Great atmosphere and delicious food. The hostess checked in with us multiple times as well as the chef. It was a great first experience.

Food was excellent as usual. Very noisy, seated next to a large party that tricked in. Our server was their server. Because that party trickled in our server was kind of distracted. I would recommend they implement a “your party will not be seated until all members have arrived” policy. Would I go again? Definitely. Would I go on a Saturday again? Probably not.
The sausage gravy rocked my biscuits.

Havent eaten here since September and it's definitely gone downhill. It took about 15min to get any service, the menu is very limited now, no tapas, no olives, the deviled eggs were three tiny halves. They always had the best mojito but told me they didn't have mint, even though there was some on top of my dessert later. Charcuterie had one type of cheese, brie, and rock hard crackers. I don't know, always loved this place but in no rush to return.
Outdoor tables were warmed by heaters. Mussels were tasty!

Loved the ambiance and the overall open kitchen concept. Unfortunately the food and drinks were subpar to me. The menu sounded so delicious but we had the mussels that usually would have a flavorful broth and it tasted very bland. Then for entrees we had the chicken confit and the whole wheat bolognese. Chicken was very over salted but only on the outside and the chicken itself had no taste. The bolognese just was like regular pasta and sauce. So disappointed since everything sounded so delicious on the menu.
The local 188 delivered a superb experience. Delectable food with a warm inviting (heat lamp -supported) atmosphere. Great location and really friendly people. Don’t miss this place. We will be back!
The outdoor heater really helped. And we wore our coats, etc. The food was delicious - lots of comfort food dishes to choose from.
Local 188 delivers in all aspects. Great food, relaxed ambience, and wonderful service.
Great outdoor seating and wonderful food as always.
The best spot for low key hangs, great food and service, and the best bloodies anywhere. Also, I never thought much about English muffins until I had one there. The breads are fantastic.

We’ve gone almost once a week while the weather is still patio compliant and get a bottle of red and split the seafood paella. It’s exceptional every time and the waitstaff is always friendly and helpful. The patio is very clean and spatially distant and they even bring out big heaters when it starts to get dark out which I guess means my patio paella adventures have been extended at least another couple of weeks.

They should have indoor/outdoor reservation option, not expect customers to know to place a note. We had to beg for heaters to be brought outside. Hostess was just annoyed with everyone that walked in. Food was good, but 2 dishes were on the bland side.

Outstanding food and table service. The outdoor heaters did not work since they were out of propane. We were very very cold. I am surprised that Resto’s trying to stay relevant during Covid at 48 degree f don’t have enough propane ....

Great good, great atmosphere! We had the mussels to start, then the seafood paella, and finished the night with delicious carrot cake! The atmosphere inside was a much better vibe than outside, quieter and much more intimate

I found it ironic that the server asked my fiancé and I to put on our mask when she approached the table.  She then attended to the adjacent table and didn’t ask them to put on their mask.  A party of four was then seated and she did not ask them to put on a mask when she approached them.   I don’t believe it is the State’s guidance to wear a mask once seated.   I feel that if the server feels threatened by Covid, she should seek another profession.   I found it disrespectful to ask my party to wear a mask and not some of the other tables.   We are healthy people showing no signs of Covid infection.  
The food was excellent, so kudos to the chef.  I’m not sure if I would go back anytime soon because of the service.
Unfortunately our seating was outdoors which took away from overall quality.  Cheese plater and seafood paella were both very good.
Amazing food, service, and atmosphere from start to finish--even outdoors in the time of COVID. Can't wait to return!

Outside on a busy street there were people getting off the bus and walking right around you without masks doesn’t help a dining experience. No lighting and it was dark so you can’t see your food. When I saw outdoor dining only I assumed a back patio. 

What I ate was tasty but I need to see it.

Kendall was our server and was very attentive and made us feel very comfortable.  The restaurant has seating out front on the street and for dinner in the blocked off driveway next to the building.  Staff and diners were all following COVID protocols.  The food and presentation was amazing.  My wife and I shared a salad, risotto, and the chicken confit.  We needed some guidance from Kendall on the portion sizes but were very happy with what we ordered.  We liked it so much we went back for breakfast the next morning!  Highly recommended.

I had the New York strip steak and it was cooked to perfection as well as the house salad and hummus plate which also didn’t disappoint.  I had a great  Tito’s and soda as simple as that drink sounds it was perfectly balanced between the ice and the soda to not end up to week or overpowering. Our waitress did a great job and was very friendly and gave great opinions of the menu. Definitely will be back again.
Super condensed menu, attitude from some of the staff, and overpriced for what it was
The food and drinks were amazing
Service was impeccable, drinks were delicious and the outdoor seating felt exclusive. Loved it!
The food was pretty disappointing, especially for the price. The “patio” is an alley, which is fine taking into account the pandemic but it could be described more accurately.
There was a little bit of an issue but the staff immediately took care of professionally and effectively.
Highly recommend the shrimp pinchos and chocolate mousse!!

great place, we were staying in the general area and decided to try it out. The service and food were awesome, and we sat outside which was a great evening. Cars going back and forth were a little loud, but that's what you get when you eat on the sidewalk! no complaints, awesome place!!

Sea food paella, very good. Outside seating only next to very busy street though. 

Service was excellent
We always love eating here. Tonight we were looking forward to their Maine Restaurant Week special and they were out at 7:30. We still enjoyed wonderful good, but I was very disappointed.

We ate there for Maine Restaurant Week but their prix fix menu was only for meat eaters with no alternatives which was disappointing.  We ate from the regular menu.  It was ok. Seafood Paella was ok.  Not fantastic. Music was much too loud.
We went to the themed paired dinner during restaurant week - it was awesome

Excellent meal at Local 188 on Saturday. Fantastic service, yummy food and great wine list. Loved the mushroom mousse dish - so creative, not to mention pretty! Steak was cook perfectly and was great to share after having tried several of the smaller dishes.  Will definitely return to this spot in the future!

Ordered the roasted beet risotto, beet were barely cooked, I could barely get my fork through them. The risotto was tough, and the dish was very soupy. Service was mediocre. It took a while to see our waitress and when she was there she lacked energy and friendliness. Restaurant was very quiet, so food did arrive timely.
I only gave three stars because I’ve enjoyed this restaurant so much in the past. I didn’t let the waitress know that my food was poorly done, because she wasn’t back until we had finished eating, and never asked how the food was. I would still recommend this restaurant because I’ve had great meals here in the past.
Love Local,  Andy and Bree? Were our servers and they were wonderful!@!!
Great food for the value, many small plate options and great cocktails.  It is the perfect choice for foodies looking for casual fine dining.

Nice room.   Tapas style.  We had: clam stew / just ok, livers/ good, grilled shrimp / excellent, mussels/ outstanding, pork belly / outstanding, arugula & duck egg salad / just ok, banana bread dessert / good.    Reasonably priced.  Good service.
Always great!  Good food and drinks, great service, and they are accommodating of my gluten intolerance.

The food here is very good, with very high-quality ingredients. I do, however, think it's extremely overpriced for what you get. For example, $13 for 2 lamb ravioli. Our waitress was very nice, however, the hostess seemed angry and hardly communicated with us.
Great service and the food was really good. The atmosphere was really calming and perfect for our Valentines Date.
Fantastic service. Very solid food. A tiny bit dark at dinner. The bread is amazing.

We as a group were not impressed with our meals. Paella was not traditional and the rice was sticky and the sauce was congealed. The portions were not even amongst similar meals. Overall, was underwhelmed even though they did provide us with a percentage off of our meals. I was really looking forward to trying 188, but was very disappointed.
Busy night out.  Kitchen and waitstaff handled very well.  Food is delicious, esp clams and mussels
Love it here, very warm and friendly with great food and service.

The waitstaff was friendly, engaging and professionally relaxed but our meals were under spiced.  We expected more mouth watering tastes, but what we got were under whelming but palatable dishes.  In particular,  the liver tapas dish needs a complete reworking...the livers were swimming in a tasteless sea of brown gravy.  The expensive 3 deviled egg halves were nothing special at all.  Our Spanish style tortilla had not a speck of the advertised spinach in the dish and was filling but bland.  The mushroom selection and pork chop were the stars of the evening. Skip dessert altogether.
Consistently good food and service.

Great place to hang and eat. Service is attentive and professional but not overly formal. Excellent range of tapas options as well as salads and main courses. The highlight is the cocktail list: extensive, well-curated and with some truly outstanding drinks. My new love is their spicy Caipirinha--to die for! You can easily make a meal out of the tapas and not break the bank. Funky, cozy vibe with lots of couches around coffee tables and banquettes with piles of pillows.

We love local 188 and brought some of our family there over the holidays. Everything was very good however the seafood paella was over cooked.  We were a little disappointed as we heard so many good things about it. A first world problem & we would definitely return.
The food and service was amazing.  The menu price was a little high but with the experience and taste of the food it did not feel that way in the end.

Our server was wonderful. She made great recommendations and knew just when to appear and when to disappear. The House paella was delicious and definitely a meal for two not one! Very fresh and definitely worth the wait. Not enough room for dessert, but maybe next time. We will go back!
Our server was great. I’ve forgotten his name, dark haired male
Excellent food and service!  As a bonus, we were there on a 50% off wine bottles (some, not all), so enjoyed some nice well priced wine as well.

Local 188 was a great choice for a group of 6 on a Sunday night... family with a desire to catch up over a good supper. I would imagine that the place might be a bit more energetic on Friday or Saturday but it was perfect for us on a Sunday. We'll go back when we're in Portland!
We enjoyed a delicious meal and Anyah was helpful and a delight.  She gave us great recommendations on portions sizes, wait time and more.  We thoroughly enjoyed our experience.

Disappointing meal. Seafood Paella was pricey , however, at $39.00 I thought it would be amazing. Unfortunately, not so. The rice and seafood were incredibly dry and did not have a lot of flavor. Even with multiple wedges of lemon, it did not improve. My partner had the same response to it. One of the diners at the table stated that the pork chop was tasty, but quite a small portion. Liked the atmosphere, however, the prices do not warrant the servings, and would definitely not recommend the Paella.
We love eating at Local 188. The chicken pinchos are excellent. In fact all dishes we had were terrific. We appreciate your food and service. Thanks

We always love coming in with the whole family and enjoying the menu "family style" with all the tapas and smaller plates. We also enjoy the happy hour before dinner, with great deals on drinks and tapas in a very cool, but also welcoming atmosphere. Can't wait to dine again!

Everything was amazing! Our favorite place in town. Took some friends and we all had a great time. Service was friendly but a little slow. That said it was a busy night. We’ll be back! Great experience!!

The 4 star food rating might be a bit tough but our benchmark was Barcelona fare.  The patatas bravas were cut too large for the small plate presentation, and the tomato dipping sauce needed a bit more paprika for a lingering flavor.  The shishito peppers (an off-menu offering that night) were perfect after a little salting at the table.  The cheese plate was excellent.  Their use of local cheeses was the appropriate replacement for the Catalan cheeses typically served in Barcelona (glad they avoided  manchego).   A bottle of one of their Spanish white wines (Valdeorras) was a great compliment to the meal.  If you are in Portland, Local 188 is a must!
Great all round experience. Attentive friendly service delicious food comfortable seating what more can you ask for.

Nice atmosphere, good service, interesting menu. Good drinks, fair prices; but we were 50/50 on food. Tapas were great, but our entrée (seafood paella) was a bit dry and overcooked, with too large a rice to seafood ratio (for an entrée costing $39).  I'm guessing it may have to do with what you order, but we were not overwhelmed. Worth a visit, but we won't return for a while.
birthday dinner
Delicious food and terrific atmosphere
very good food but too noisy
Nice array of tastings through tapas!

This was our first time dining at Local 188 with friends. I appreciated that they had parking in back and loved the subdued vibe. The menu was small but delicious. My favorite dish was the chicken pinchos. I found that the paella was over salted and over cooked, therefore I wouldn’t bother ordering that again, but we loved everything else we tried. I only wish that they had Bissel Brothers on tap.
Great original selections, including vegan options. Could use some more sherries for a tapas restaurant. Looking forward to a return visit.
The food was great and our waitress Bree was outstanding! We highly recommend this restaurant.
Delicious Food, great drinks and a wonderful staff.
Great find from three thousand miles west. Second time just as good as the first.

Food was excellent but service was very rushed.  We ordered three courses and the first two arrived at almost the same time. Entrees arrived a short while later before we had finished the first two courses. The restaurant was crowded but there was no demand for tables. Server should have pace the meal better. Server appeared to be new and did not know the menu very well.

We went at 5:30 on a Sunday so it wasn't too crowded. That's what I prefer so I can carry on a conversation without feeling like I have to yell to be heard as I've had to at other restaurants. The server was very nice. I had the chicken risotto which was fantastic. Definitely a place to check out.
Great food and place

We tried several dishes and split them among our group. Every single dish was delicious! We tried everything from chicken livers, to scallops, to paella. Our only disappointment was that we couldn’t eat more.
A wonderful dining experience.  Good food, good service, and reasonably priced, especially if you go during Happy Hour.
Excellent food and vibe
Wonderful food, service. The only downside was the room temperature.

First time here, the entree were very good one of our better meals in our visit to Maine. The inly complaint We had was desert, Strawberry Shortcake, which was in a dry biscuit, a  minuscule dollop of strawberry ice cream and no whip creme with little fruit. Our server who was great inly charged us for one.
We were able to sit outside with our dog. Food was great and service was (almost too) fast and friendly. Great experience!
Great experience.  Will definitely be back, and I live halfway across the country.
One of my local favorites... delicious food, reasonable prices, lovely atmosphere.

Walked in off the street, was hot outside...was hotter in the restaurant. Really unpleasant sitting there eating while everyone was sweating and uncomfortable. All the people walking out were mumbling about the heat. Get a better AC!
Another fun evening sipping refreshing mojitos and ice cold beer, savoring different tapas dishes. The mushrooms are AMAZING!  My salad was very fresh and the goat cheese mousse...WOWOWOWOW!
Unfortunately the chicken risoto with mushroom dish I had was quite bland. The bread, soup and paella were good. Very noisy! Made conversation difficult!
Excellent white sauce mussels, drinks, and churros. Chicken polenta dinner not great and prices are high. Waiter was great but table next to us was server in training.
Good food the seafood paella was worth the 30 minute wait. It was very fresh and delicious I highly recommend it.
Local 188, you need to have better cherries in your Manhattans!

We had a lovely dinner before the concert at St. Luke's. We went for all tapas and then asked for just a scoop of their Chambord ice-cream. They were very accommodating. All of the food was scrumptious and the service was perfect. My only complaint is that the music was too loud when we first arrived but someone else may have asked to turn it down before I had a chance to because it was at a good level for the entire meal.
This place is consistently EXCELLENT . Interesting menu, cool ambiance, one our favorites.

Sadly, Local 188 has become overrated. I keep trying to go there with expectations that will be matched but every time the food is just okay, the portions small, and the price inflated. My husband ordered the tortilla which was really a piece of cold quiche with little flavor. It is like they aren't even trying. Our server was very nice and the atmosphere is great but the food just doesn't live up to standards.
Delicious and fresh and varied. A bit tricky to navigate this menu if gluten and/or dairy free. We managed, though!

Tapas were delicious. Seafood paella was not as good as previous times. The rice and shrimp were overcooked but some of the mussels were undercooked and fishy. Drinks were good and everyone seemed to enjoy themselves

I have eaten at Local 188 many times when in Portland. After my dinner there on Sunday I will not be returning.
The food was mediocre at best but the service was horrid. We shared a few appetizers one being mussels.
The bowl for shells was like a cereal bowl, so small the shells were spilling out over the table. The server, who was clearly not happy to have a table at 8 pm
as-they were slowing down as she told us, passed by
many times and never replaced the bowl. We sat  with dishes and shells on table for  far too long before they were cleared  as entries arrived . Several times we had to ask for things that should have been
evident to anyone who actually knew how to
be a competent server.

There are so many great restaurants in Portland 
too bad Local 188 is no longer one of them.
We really enjoyed our date at Local 188.

I have been to Local 188 many times over the years, so I was very disappointed to have had the experience we had there this past weekend. The service was awful. We sat at our table for 15 minutes before anyone came to us. The waitress neglected to tell us the specials. Our cocktails were awful - I sent mine back and ordered white wine instead, which came in a stemless glass -- not the way to serve white wine. The meal itself was heavy and quite honestly gross. We ordered lots of tapas plates. The deviled eggs were completely boring and totally overpriced! Three egg halves with nothing special going on and you're charging me $6 for that? No thanks. We won't be going back.
Our server forgot two items we had ordered. Fortunately the food was good.
Food was lacking, unfortunately. Potatas Bravas, which should be a slam dunk, was inedible. Rest of meal was bland. Great ambiance, poor food.

Enjoyable dinner before attending a concert across the street at One Longfellow Square.  The room is a bit funky but low-key and fun.  Extensive menus (cocktail, beer, wine, and food) with good depth and variety.  Shared apps followed by entrees (I don’t know the correct Spanish terms, sorry) filled us up and put smiles on our faces.  Our Server, Phoebe, was just right - attentive but not intrusive.  I expect we will be back!
Local 188 is one of our favorite places - it is a great combination of local bar, quality food , great ambiance and good service. We have never been disappointed .
Waiter Smelled Like BO really bad.  Was pretty off-putting, however he did remove a dish from our bill that we didn't like, even though I told him he didn't need to.  That was nice.
Terrific place, as always.  It is a go to in Portland and I am never disappointed.

This was my third visit to Local 188, my wife's first.  Dinner was as good as always and as good as it gets!   The risotto is PERFECT,  the house paella amazing, the potato gnocchi was inventive and incredible!  Had the lamb rillette special and it blew my mind!  Great, large place with attentive, friendly staff!  Eat here.  NOW!
The confit chicken risotto was outrageous. Garlicky, cheesy and satisfying. Entrees are large and definitely shareable
Everything was wonderful!

I’ve had both brunch and dinner at Local 188 and it never disappoints. The service, food, and feel to the place are all great. For brunch, you have to get the sausage gravy. It is a religious experience. For dinner, the gnocchi and beet purée was fantastic. My only dislike was the octopus was grilled a little too long, but it was still a delight. This is one of my new favorite spots.
Honored a special request for vegetarian paella and provided separate checks for our party of 8 without visible distress. Thank you!

I generally love 188 but the last two times for dinner it has not been the best.  I'll stick to brunch.  We ordered the tasting menu and a paella and my daughter had the gnocchi.  The gnocchi was excellent and everything else was "ok".  The shellfish in my paella were over done, the rice dry and crunchy and not very flavorful.  The trip through Spain Tapas was creative in plating but did not shine as outstanding.  The best item was the goat cheese croquette.  The restaurant was busy with a memorial service and we do understand that being spread thin and having a focus on a memorial is important.  Like I said, this is more about the last couple of trips.  Brunch is wonderful...dinner...might be too busy to be great.

Several years ago we had a lovely paella here, but the last 2 times it was dry, flavorless and this past time  burned black and inedible. How did the chef let it leave the kitchen? It was a special occasion and we had planned on the Restaurant Week special.  Sadly they ran out before we could order, something they warned  might happen. Fortunately we were in good company, our waiter was excellent and comped the paella, and the appetizers were ok (one was burned as well, but edible). We have eaten there numerous times over the years but these last experiences have finished us off.  Happily there are many other places to find great food in Portland.
We had their special tasting menu; every dish was delicious and the wine/beer pairings were also terrific. Thanks! Local 188 is still a great option in Portland.
Really enjoyed Local 188.  Plenty of interesting choices whether you want small plates or large.
It was great. Fun spot we had not been to in along time with interesting and delicious food
Great restaurant. The pairing meal for restaurant week was absolutely incredible. All ten dishes were delicious and attractive and the pairings were excellent too.
Maine Restaurant Week “a Trip Through Spain” 10 course tasting menu was phenomenal!
Great food and incredible service.  Off street parking is a plus as well

Paella was terrific!  Seafood was fresh and perfectly cooked. Kudos to the kitchen team for getting it right, first time in a long time there was not even a single piece of sand in my shellfish. Sorry but I needed to share because it makes a difference and I am truly appreciative!
Food and service were great, it was a little loud so hard to talk sometimes
Service was great, drinks were very cool. Had the seafood paella, it was good but expected a little bit better. Shrimp app was fantastic

Excellent crew
So lovely and warm
This place rocks ❤️
Get the flatbread, it's not what you expect but always get the flat bread!
Great server but for the second( and last) time the paella was over cooked.  Big mistake with $39 entree.
Fabulous entree with delicious accompaniments. Waiter was perfect.

Meeting with a friend who needed a bit of advice — both of us had the Corn and Lobster Chowder - excellent and jam packed with Lobster!  Companion had the Grilled Scallops and I had Steak Frites. Both meals were very well received, timely delivered with quite attendant service and reasonably priced.
Great service.  Food was outstanding. Exactly how we ordered the meals.
Always great food, service and view. Need to put up some shades on highest window in winter though

Very nice time! 
Great food & great service.
We will definitely go back.

Excellent food, service and ambiance! 
I think the quiet ambiance was unusual for this gem of a local restaurant but we enjoyed our table by the window and fireplace as we welcomed in the new year! 
I would highly recommend this place, and we definitely plan to visit again soon.
Low key New Years Eve dinner.  Great food and wine.  Short rib and steak frites were excellent!

Food is always great, loved our server, love your location on the water plus just being in the dinning room was lovely even without the view.   Timing of courses served was perfect, and we had plenty of time to linger.

The Dockside is a wonderful restaurant tucked in near the shore off Route 88 in Falmouth, Maine.  Great food, service and ambiance. The ocean views are exquisite: calming and restful with an enjoyable easy listening music selection. The restaurant also accommodates those who require wheel chair accessibility. Fantastic place to dine any time of the year.

First time visit and we were pleasantly surprised by the venue which was elegant yet friendly.  The view from what we could see as it was night was a nice addition.  The menu was varied and inventive - to the delight of this foodie.  Definitely worth and try and for us, another visit soon in the future.
Very good all around.  Good server.  Very good food.  A bit noisy and food slow to come out of the kitchen.  Well worth the wait and we were in no rush!

Both meals were very well received, timely delivered with quite attendant service and reasonably priced.
Great service.  Food was outstanding. Exactly how we ordered the meals.
Always great food, service and view. Need to put up some shades on highest window in winter though

Very nice time! 
Great food & great service.
We will definitely go back.

Excellent food, service and ambiance! 
I think the quiet ambiance was unusual for this gem of a local restaurant but we enjoyed our table by the window and fireplace as we welcomed in the new year! 
I would highly recommend this place, and we definitely plan to visit again soon.
Low key New Years Eve dinner.  Great food and wine.  Short rib and steak frites were excellent!

Food is always great, loved our server, love your location on the water plus just being in the dinning room was lovely even without the view.   Timing of courses served was perfect, and we had plenty of time to linger.

The Dockside is a wonderful restaurant tucked in near the shore off Route 88 in Falmouth, Maine.  Great food, service and ambiance. The ocean views are exquisite: calming and restful with an enjoyable easy listening music selection. The restaurant also accommodates those who require wheel chair accessibility. Fantastic place to dine any time of the year.

First time visit and we were pleasantly surprised by the venue which was elegant yet friendly.  The view from what we could see as it was night was a nice addition.  The menu was varied and inventive - to the delight of this foodie.  Definitely worth and try and for us, another visit soon in the future.

Excellent food, service and ambiance! 
I think the quiet ambiance was unusual for this gem of a local restaurant but we enjoyed our table by the window and fireplace as we welcomed in the new year! 
I would highly recommend this place, and we definitely plan to visit again soon.
Low key New Years Eve dinner.  Great food and wine.  Short rib and steak frites were excellent!

Food is always great, loved our server, love your location on the water plus just being in the dinning room was lovely even without the view.   Timing of courses served was perfect, and we had plenty of time to linger.

The Dockside is a wonderful restaurant tucked in near the shore off Route 88 in Falmouth, Maine.  Great food, service and ambiance. The ocean views are exquisite: calming and restful with an enjoyable easy listening music selection. The restaurant also accommodates those who require wheel chair accessibility. Fantastic place to dine any time of the year.

First time visit and we were pleasantly surprised by the venue which was elegant yet friendly.  The view from what we could see as it was night was a nice addition.  The menu was varied and inventive - to the delight of this foodie.  Definitely worth and try and for us, another visit soon in the future.
Very good all around.  Good server.  Very good food.  A bit noisy and food slow to come out of the kitchen.  Well worth the wait and we were in no rush!

Meeting with a friend who needed a bit of advice — both of us had the Corn and Lobster Chowder - excellent and jam packed with Lobster!  Companion had the Grilled Scallops and I had Steak Frites. Both meals were very well received, timely delivered with quite attendant service and reasonably priced.
Great service.  Food was outstanding. Exactly how we ordered the meals.
Always great food, service and view. Need to put up some shades on highest window in winter though

Very nice time!

Very good all around.  Good server.  Very good food.  A bit noisy and food slow to come out of the kitchen.  Well worth the wait and we were in no rush!
Came for your Thanksgiving meal. It was delicious! Great selection of food on your menu. Will definitely be back.

We had a lovely meal with terrific company, but with all due respect, I expected a more memorable meal for $85/head. Service was fine and personable, but my MIL missed out on tea because all were so busy. The food was plentiful and pretty good, but honestly, our entrees arrived tepid. I thank you for accommodating us, and will come back hoping for a better experience when it's not Thanksgiving.
Went for an anniversary dinner during Maine Restaurant Week and had a great time.

Our waitress seemed really inexperienced and clueless.  The food was excellent, though the menu was a little limited.  Mac and cheese was really good and not overpoweringly rich but a HUGE portion.  Dessert was meh.  Our service was so lousy the manager took 25% off our bill so that was nice.

We had a great Valentines Day dinner with the three course,prix-fix menu. It was delicious! Only marked down to 4 stars because several of the wait staff seemed bored and were checking on us every 3-5 minutes for a good half hour and it was overkill! 
Food was delicious and nice ambiance! Drinks at Top of the East after was perfect. 
We will go back!

It was absolutely terrible!!!! Went on New Years Eve and ordered their 4 course meal special. The food was average. The service was terrible. I got charged for extra drinks I didn’t order and I never received the dessert that was included in the special. I will never go back and if your reading this I recommend that you never go.

NY Eve but with few individuals in the restaurant when we arrived, on time. The host immediately complained that the table he wanted to seat us at was still occupied and sat us nearby. Excessive time for first contact from an overworked waiter. Had to ask twice for our bar drinks before they arrived. Food was slow to arrive, overpriced for volume and quality, often tag team delivered by harried kitchen staffer. Got louder as the dinner wore on but to be expected on NY Eve.  Hardest to swallow was price for the overall experience. Would not recommend.
Service was extremely slow.  Opened at 5;  out of advertised entre by 6.  Substitute entre was below par!
We were here for breakfast and had a wonderful time. We did not feel rushed at all like we did at other breakfast places. I will definitely come back again next time I stay in Portland Maine.
Food was average

NY Eve but with few individuals in the restaurant when we arrived, on time. The host immediately complained that the table he wanted to seat us at was still occupied and sat us nearby. Excessive time for first contact from an overworked waiter. Had to ask twice for our bar drinks before they arrived. Food was slow to arrive, overpriced for volume and quality, often tag team delivered by harried kitchen staffer. Got louder as the dinner wore on but to be expected on NY Eve.  Hardest to swallow was price for the overall experience. Would not recommend.
Service was extremely slow.  Opened at 5;  out of advertised entre by 6.  Substitute entre was below par!
We were here for breakfast and had a wonderful time. We did not feel rushed at all like we did at other breakfast places. I will definitely come back again next time I stay in Portland Maine.
Food was average
Came for your Thanksgiving meal. It was delicious! Great selection of food on your menu. Will definitely be back.

We had a lovely meal with terrific company, but with all due respect, I expected a more memorable meal for $85/head. Service was fine and personable, but my MIL missed out on tea because all were so busy. The food was plentiful and pretty good, but honestly, our entrees arrived tepid. I thank you for accommodating us, and will come back hoping for a better experience when it's not Thanksgiving.
Went for an anniversary dinner during Maine Restaurant Week and had a great time.

Our waitress seemed really inexperienced and clueless.  The food was excellent, though the menu was a little limited.  Mac and cheese was really good and not overpoweringly rich but a HUGE portion.  Dessert was meh.  Our service was so lousy the manager took 25% off our bill so that was nice.

We had a great Valentines Day dinner with the three course,prix-fix menu. It was delicious! Only marked down to 4 stars because several of the wait staff seemed bored and were checking on us every 3-5 minutes for a good half hour and it was overkill! 
Food was delicious and nice ambiance! Drinks at Top of the East after was perfect. 
We will go back!
